column8: This is the third Dyson product I have purchased.  Each has been an outstanding item, more powerful than any competition product.  We bought a floor vacuum years ago, and a smaller hand-held model last year.  This one was to replace the earlier floor model that took a tumble down a flight of stairs.  The thing still works, but some of the plastic parts didn't survive the landing on the concrete floor.  I was able to buy a new canister through Dyson and now there is no need to haul one up or down the stairs.  We have one on each floor.
I can't believe how light this vacuum is. It is so easy to use and move. It's not heavy like all the other vacuums I have used in the past. Best purchase I have made so far!!

I absolutely love this vacuum.  It is easy to use and I love the idea of not having to fight with bags anymore.  This is the second one that I have purchased for our winter home and I look forward to using it.

I had been using another brand in my home for about 6 months when I came across this Dyson vacuum. I was skeptical at first, because I have really weird carpeting and most vacuums have issues picking stuff (especially dog hair) up. But I went ahead against my boyfriend's wishes and purchased the Dyson.It was really simple to assemble, and came with dirt absorbing powder and extra accessories. I turned it on to begin using it and within minutes my filter was full. I thought it was odd, but I emptied it and went over what I had just vacuumed and the same thing happened. I emptied the filter probably 10-12 times throughout my entire house - but it was worth it. My carpet is so clean. It feels completely different. Even my boyfriend noticed a difference! I will never go back to any other brand again.If my experience had been an infomercial I would have sold myself!!

column7: Bought a Shark then exchanged it for this.
column8: Bought the Shark because of the good reviews. I took it back since it was missing parts and the brush roller wasn't working.I am so glad that I got this instead. It has a much more sturdy design and has great suction. The wand seems to be better since you can reach it in more places and the hose doesn't bother me for stairs. It has good reach and you will have no issues if simply place the vacuum at the bottom.I have read up on shocking issues, tipping issues, crappy customer service, and cheap parts for the Shark. The clips and brush roller come to mind.Two things the DC33 needs. Slimmer profile for the base so it can fit under furniture and retractable cord.

While the vacuum part is great and I would give it a five for that but the attachments are just so horrible and hard to handle that it got moved down to a one star.  The attachment for cleaning in corners or high places is hard enough to give me a heart attack and it would make more sense to buy another one just for edges and high places.  This vacuum cleaner is awkward to use in any other way than pushing it over the floor.  Why did the manufacturer bother to add a cheap hard to use expandable wand that keeps going back to coiled position and is hard to maneuver.  Someone in R&D was more concerned with making this a compact fit-together unit than something that would actually be helpful?  Your punishment should be to use this!
The best vacuum we have ever owned. Love the extension and the fact that the tools are readily available on board.
had an old electrolux which finally died, bought on recommendation of daughter love it, getting dirt up didnt know was there

column7: Hose is not covered in Warranty! Broke just after 1 year.
column8: I purchased this vacuum because so many of my friends recommended it. One of them bragged about the 5 year warranty!  It really does suck well! After about a year the hose broke.  I thought no problem Dyson has the 5 year warranty.  When I called I discovered the hose and any moving parts are not covered because they have wear and tear.  I gave them 2 stars because they did give me a courtesy hose.  She recommended stretching out the hose by pulling it out, wrapping it around the vacuum and leaving it that way overnight. I was also told that the hose was $30 to replace.  That's better than trying to replace items on my refrigerator.

I was very reluctant to pay out a lot for a vacuum, but so far this has been well worth it.  I can't speak to longevity because we've only owned it for a month, but here's our experience:Very easy to assemble and operate, including the arm extension.Very effective - empty the canister 2-3 times per vacuuming (appx 1150 sq. feet of carpet in our home).Downside, it's a little heavy, but not any more cumbersome than a regular vacuum.  My wife and I have no problems on the stairs, but if someone were more feeble, you might want to at least go feel one at the store prior to purchasing.I researched the ball vacuums versus this standard Dyson model and it seems to be an even split.  Biggest complaints about the ball vacuum appears to be a larger front end that can make it difficult to vacuum under the edges of furniture without moving the furniture.  Downside of the standard model were its increased weight and the fact that it was more cumbersome.  As mentioned, I haven't found those to be deal breakers.  It just pushes like a more standard model, and we don't need the tight turn radius in our home.I love the bagless concept and the canister emptying from the bottom with an easy click of a button.  Noise-wise, not that bad.  Didn't scare my 7-month old.  But, it is a vacuum, after all.  However, it just seemed to be less piercing of a sound compared with our previous vacuum.Take what I have to say with a grain of salt because my previous vacuum was an eight year old Dirt Devil.  Maybe this isn't as good as other expensive vacuums, but for someone who was scared to lay down the $350 at first and was hard to convince not to just get another cheap vacuum, I have not regretted this purchase at all.  Barring the thing blowing up in the next 6 months, I would not hesitate to do it again.  We have felt a stark difference in our carpet since we started using it.  It feels soft and clean again (not sure our old vacuum was picking up a whole lot toward the end there).

column7: For over 10 years and still loving it
column8: I ordered my Dyson dc-33 form New York over 10 years ago when they hit our shores and Ive loved this vacuum for that long. It was my purple and red wonder!Now Ive retired it to my workshop and garage for the car as a shop vac and purchased another.  You can beat this vacuum! I have had Kirby's, Kenmore's and even a retro looking tri-star, none of them beat the Dyson for cleaning and toughness.I have 3 cats and its never ceases to amaze me how good it is.Seriously good product, my sister and my sister in law now have one , I made them buy it! :)

I have only seen one review about this issue, and I can't understand how it doesn't frustrate everyone unless I am doing something wrong.EVERY time I vacuum using the whole unit, not just using the wand attachment, the wand attachment falls off.  Since the wand attachment is also the handle, it needs to have a better way to click into place more securely.  I have even tried using the canister handle instead, but because it is so low, it is very uncomfortable. Additionally, when I use the canister handle, the wand attachment is in the way and still falls off.  When I wind the cord, the wand attachment falls off.  It seems like such an easy thing to have the wand attachment lock into place rather than the current design, where it merely clicks into a small space.The suction works fine, and the canister is easy to clean (albeit small), but I can't say that it is any better than competitors.  This is my first and last Dyson. With three kids and a dog, I don't have all day to vacuum.  I need something powerful and quick with secure attachments.  Not worth the money IMO.

column7: Must be a strength trainer to use..
column8: I bought this unit refurbed last year from another site.  Cleans well but the hose is soooo tight that I actually get a backache from trying to pull so I can reach anything.  So regardless that its a good vacuum..I'm sorry I bought it.  I have pets so I need the hose to get under things to suck up fur, dropped dog food, etc.  Trust me the hose is hard to stretch!!  If anyone has one with the same issue or knows how to adjust loosen it up PLEASE let me know.

Heard so much about these vacuums we decided to get one.  Wish I hadn't.  It is OK as long as all you need to do is sweep carpets in the middle of the room.  After that it is useless.  Had to but a 50 dollar attachment just to sweep the hard wood floors but the hose and wand this attches to is terrible. No thought what so ever went into designing this.  Who ever OKed it doesn't ever use it.  We have dealt with this for around 7 months now and even though I spent more than I usually do for a vacuum we are throwing this one out and getting one that we can use arond the house.  One that we can sweep under the beds with, under the couch, around the kitchen cabinets and under neath the dining room table.  As long as you don't need it for any of these places it's fine, I guess.

I am very satisfied with the Dyson DC33 Multifloor upright bagless vacuum cleaner. It was  recommended to me by my neighbor and my son. It is very light to move around, and the different parts to do a more thorough cleaning in corners is very helpful. I feel that my rugs and my walls are cleaner than before Istarted using the Dyson vacuum cleaner.I am  very satisfied B . Goodman

column7: Jamming gears - NOT the quality you'd expect
column8: The third time we used it, the vaccum suddenly made a loud, whirring sound like something was stuck in it, yet nothing was. We called Dyson the second time it happened and they said that sometimes the suction is so strong that it sucks the rug into it and the that jams the gears and makes the noise. We said it didn't pull on the rug or appear to be sucking it up, but the tech didn't think that was unusual. They taught us to remove this styrofoam liner on the the lip of the vacuum, and 'reset' the vacuum itself by flipping the Floor to Carpet switch on and off 10 times. It didn't help. To this day the vacuum will do this whirring noise. The noise is so loud, my neighbor's have complained. My family AND the dog don't want to be inside when I'm vacuuming because the whirring is so loud it frightens them. We've found no rhyme or reason to the whirring. It doesn't matter what surface it's on, which rug, what it's vacuuming up, whether the cannister is empty or not - some days it's just going to jam, whir, and have to be reset. I can't believe I spent almost $400 on this thing. Never looses suction, but it will destroy your eardrums.

column7: If you have Oriental Rugs stay away.
column8: I have a brand new DC33, when running on a oriental rug, the agitator grinds to a halt and makes a god awful grinding noise. I had a DC9 that NEVER had issues with my 3 rugs. It isn't grabbing the edge, I am talking about in the middle of the rug, the vacuum stops and grinds.I contacted Dyson customer service(it might as well be customer deflection) the recommended turning the agitator off and using suction alone. This is a band-aid for the problem. Piss-poor customer service, poor product. I would look into another model.

Okay, I feel I paid a fair price for this Dyson. It does have awesome sucking power(-which can be a problem on area rugs). It was well packaged and went together easily. It vacuums GREAT on bare floors and seems to do well on carpet. But for $300 I feel it should go under my kitchen cabinets. Most cabinet heights are standard and this would have been a fairly easy fix and made life more convenient for lots of us. Then it would also fit under the front edge of our sofas, again another plus for most of us. And by the way, my kitchen cupboards are a bit higher than standard since we installed them that way because of our height. I also love the disposal of the dust. So much easier than my previous vacuum.I (and my 2 teens who also vacuum)feel that the cleaning wand is a royal pain in the #@* to use. It is awkward to use, and very difficult to put back in place. Each time I think I have it and then go to vacuum, it comes undone in my hand.  and the process for selecting bare floors or carpet seems quite outdated. Maybe the engineers needed to actually use the vacuum for real vacuuming for a period of time before the final product was created. Just saying. You had the opportunity to make a genuinely great product and dropped the ball on some important details. I am also concern about the strength of the plastic used to manufacture this vacuum. Time will tell. Parts of the vacuum seem chintzy.Dyson was not really interested in my comments. The girl at tech support made a big show of taking my mailing info but never sent anything out. That is not impressive. Thanks for showing me that I do not matter. So the next time I am in the market for a vacuum will I purchase a Dyson---probably not---there will probably be better competition out there by then.

column7: Good vacuum with a couple quality concerns
column8: When I decided it was time to buy a vacuum, I thought back to previous vacuum experiences I've had in the past. I had experience with Dyson before with an animal upright model and was really pleased with that vacuum, though I was not quite ready to shell out those really big bucks. Experience with other vacuums told me that a bagless system was a must, as was a switch to turn the brushbar on and off (like for carpets and hard floors). Based on my previous experience with Dyson, I was drawn back to them, but wanted a slightly less expensive/large model. After reading many reviews and not being entirely sold on the Ball technology (including in-store testing), I settled on the DC33 model.When I received the vacuum, I assembled it and began testing it out. It seemed to work pretty well, though not quite as well as I'd remembered Dysons working. After some exploring, I found that the brushbar wasn't turning when in the carpet mode. I called Dyson support and they recommended turning the switch back and forth a few times and presto, it worked! Once the brushbar was turning, it did quite the job cleaning carpets. Unfortunately, this brushbar issue happens frequently and its not immediately obvious if the bar is turning, so I'm frequently having to turn the switch back and forth and it's getting a little annoying. Hopefully soon I'll try to take it to get serviced to see if this problem can be fixed.The only other disappointing thing about this vacuum is that it doesn't feel as solidly made as the Dyson I used in the past, with a fair bit of play in the bagless canister rather than it mounting firmly in place. Also, the overall construction using a large amount of plastic creates a slightly cheap feel to the whole vacuum.Otherwise, however, I am pleased with this vacuum. I lent it to a friend who used it on hardwood floors and said it was the best vacuum for hardwoods she's ever used. When the brushbar is on, the vacuum performs well on carpets and isn't too loud. The accessories take some fiddling with to understand what buttons and clips do what, but once you get the hang of it, they work quite well.

I wanted a DYSON for 5 years and now I am so disappointed that I waited that long for this piece of junk.Why do I hate this expensive machine...1. I have owned it for 3 months and the canister button does not work. I need to use a screwdriver to open it to dispose of waste.2. The wand is useless and can't be used for stairs or corners or dusting. Way too cumbersome compared to my old hoover. (Not to mention, if you have a quick pick-up job for the wand, you have to unravel the entire cord to get to the wand, since the cord locks the wand in place. Then you have to wind the cord up again.)3. Every couple of weeks my machine has screeched to a halt because has been clogged with hair.  The roller does not have a self cleaning feature like some of the other models. (It gets jammed under the roller.) With my old hoover I owned it for 13 years and I only had to clean the roller about once every 2 years.We don't have any pets in the house so this would never work for a pet owner.4. My roller stopped working yesterday altogether, but there was no hair in it. (Very touchy machine.) I let it cool off for a while since I could smell something burning and then it started to work OK again. I think something is jammed is inside the machine.My old monster hoover never went to the shop and still runs. This one has two repairs that need to be made and it is only 3 months old.My only pro: This machine can suck like crazy. It can even get up small glitter dust off the carpet, but since it is so dysfunctional in other ways I can't stand it. Any machine that requires I have two vacuums doesn't work for me.My goal: sell this on craigslist for $200 and take a $200 loss and go buy a new hoover. :(TRY THE WAND FEATURE BEFORE YOU BUY THIS MACHINE.SOOOOO POORLY DESIGNED!

column7: Can't use on RUGS?!?! LOUD GRINDING NOISE!
column8: This vacuum is advertised and described as a multi-floor vacuum, but the truth is it only works on bare floor and wall-to-wall carpeting. Dyson knows this, but chooses not to make it clear in any way prior to calling support.Immediately after taking this out of the box and using it on our rug it made a horrible VERY loud noise that sounded like it was broken.Apparently that is the vacuum's 'alert sound' that something is caught in the roller.The Dyson brand bases their advertising on the creator's belief 'that things should work properly'. Well this is not a vacuum 'working properly'.I called support and encountered a rude representative that kept chuckling about the situation. I don't know why she thought this was funny. Spending this much money on a vacuum and having it be completely unsuitable for my needs is a really poor experience. She had the temerity to say 'that's why we offer a range of models'. If their product descriptions or website said anything about a 'Multi-Floor' vacuum not actually being good for more than two types of floor, and particularly not being good for rugs, I wouldn't have bought it. Frankly, it sounds like they know about the issue but are happy to just keep taking people's money and providing an inappropriate product.She told me to remove the gasket from the base. It helped somewhat, but still made the noise one or two times. My wife doesn't want to use it and feels like she's been betrayed by Dyson. I can't stress enough how inappropriate the support representative was.DON'T BUY THIS IF YOU WANT TO USE IT ON RUGSAdditionally, the hose is definitely designed in a way that makes it less useful for the kind of tasks I use hoses for. It will work for vacuuming your ceiling, a little less so for things anywhere below 6' up from the floor.

Big fan of the bullet point review...so here's mine!The Pros:-The vacuum is well made, and 'high tech' looking.  It seems to look the part of a 400$ vacuum.-My home is entirely hardwood flooring and tile and this vacuum did an excellent job picking up the dirt-As a bachelor, let's be real...I'm not buying bags for vacuums and all that other stuff so a bagless system seems to be the way to go.  The clear plastic bin that lets you see whats getting picked up is also very nice-The vacuum wand in the handle, a feature that ultimately made me drop the money on this.  It works well and picked up anything left in the corners of the floors and ceilings.-  The cord is huge.  I did the whole first floor and most of the hallway on the second floor using just one outlet.-People complaining that it is heavy really need to take a step back and figure out if they are that weak or that lazy.  Seriously some people equated this to basically pushing and pulling a bag of bricks.  If you're 70 years old, then yeah maybe, but if you're in the prime of your life and this is heavy then that's pretty patheticThe cons:-(Minor)  The floor vacuum seems to ride quite low to the floor so it will just push around large particles.  Again the wand is in the handle of the machine and with a click of the button it will just suck that stuff up through the handle.-(Minor)  Yes the floor machine will not go too deep under furniture.  But you could either move the furniture or use the wand to go underneath.  Another gripe based on pure laziness.  Either you want to clean or you don't.  If you do then move the furniture, if you don't then just swipe underneath the furniture with the wand-(Minor)  The extension hose for the wand will take some time breaking in, it is very frigid out of the box.  Until then the main part will bounce around a bit as you extend the hose to the ceiling.-(MAJOR)  The machine will make the most horrid noise you have ever heard from a vacuum when placed over a carpet door mat or bathroom rug.  Apparently it sucks up these unfixed carpets into the system like it would a sock or extension cord.  This is going to be a major problem when I finally get around to getting area rugs for the home.  Mats and bathroom rugs are one thing, I just shake them outside or onto the floor and vacuum that, but a 400$ machine BETTER be able to handle a bona fide area rug. To their credit I emailed them the first night I got it with this problem.  They replied very quickly and stated that there are two pieces on the bottom of the machine that can be pulled out that will help alleviate this problem without costing the machine any performance.  I am a bit weary of this solution because I cannot be the only one who has ever reported this, and if these removable pieces are the problem and will not cause any drop in performance...then why are they in the machine in the first place?I will be pulling out those pieces soon and then testing it out on an old area rug I borrowed from my parents to test this fix.  If it works, then this is an excellent all around vacuum cleaner that will stay at four stars because I can't give it 4.5.  If it doesn't it's a 1 because even though it is great on the existing home...I didn't spend 400$ to have to buy another vacuum for an area rug.

For a person with allergies and asthma this vacumm is fantastic!  THe suction mechasnism on this product exceeded my expectation.  Once used you will see how much dirt, hair and dust is really in your house aggravated ones allergies.  NOw I can breathe better and my sinuses and asthma has improved.  At first I thought this vacumm was pricey and held of purchasing it, but at the end of the day I thought I should try it and I don't regret a moment of that decision.Easy to empty and no extra cost required for filters or bag since this vacuum is bagless and the filter is easy to clean.I recommended this vacuum to anybody, you won't regret spending the money.

Give me back my $70 Dirt Devil!!!  I bought this thinking I was getting a vacuum I could use for the next 20 years and it didn't last 6 months before breaking.  Within the first month the brush bar decided to burn itself out.  Granted I have a lot of pet hair but I did clean the bar after each use.  I bought a new bar as that's not a part covered under warranty.  After 6 months of use the vacuum now sits in my garage broken.  I was happily vacuuming my bedroom, with the new brush, and the machine suddenly decided it was finished.  (Was it something I said?)  It's still under warranty but the process of getting it fixed is in itself not free.  My old Dirt Devil went for 6 years without a hitch and worked as well on dirt and pet hair.  For the amount I spent on the Dyson I could have bought 5 Dirt Devils and never have had to buy a vacuum again!  I'm sorely disappointed in the Dyson.

This is an amendment to my first review:The vacuum seams powerful, the issues stated before were due to the wham was blocked by a plastic bottle cap. This produced hissing noises, poor suction, and struggle with the hose... nevertheless, the issue with the length of the hose remains: it is long enough for some crucial jobs, but it fails miserably at accessing extreme places, it is just way too long. It had been a great idea to make the design with the possibility to detach the wham and leave room for a shorter version (4 inches or so) more handy for extreme spaces.
This vacuum really picks up dirt and debris! Its always nice to buy a product that exceeds your expectations and this one actually did!

column7: Amazed how much it picks up
column8: I had never owned an expensive vacuum until this one, and let me say, I think this one is worth the money.  The first time I vacuumed my house, I was amazed by how much it picked up...and I consider myself a neat freak.  To this day, I am still in awe about what it picks up when I vacuum once a week.  It's also helpful that the vacuum can pick up crumbs on my hardwood floors.  The only thing I don't like is the horrible sound it makes when I try to vacuum my braided rugs with the brushes going.

This Dyson is replacing my 12 year old Dyson DC07. I have several indoor pets and need a good dependable vacuum. I have tried many others that were usually broken and in the shop within 60 days of the purchase, the Dyson only broke once after 3 years of owning it. Great vacuum, you cannot go wrong.

We had this Dyson for a little over a month and it's been in the repair shop twice to have a clutch put in it. It works fine to vac dust, or get lint out of the dryer screen. But, to vacuum carpets it doesn't work well unless the carpet is less than a quarter inch thickness. When we put it on our thicker runner carpet, it makes the loudest grinding noise! We brought our old $70 Eureka vacuum out of the basement, that sucks up the lint in dryer, to vacuum our carpets, and it does it with ease!What a waste of $319 we ever spent, not sure what Dyson has been up to, but it's certainly ripping off consumers. We definitely would not recommend this vacuum.

I have had a trusty Kenmore for 10 years that sucked up everything.  Emptying the canister was disgusting because of the amount of dirt in there.  It died, so I decided to pay the big money for this Dyson.  It is a terrible disappointment.  Here are my biggest complaints:1.  It is HEAVY.  I work out regularly and I'm not a wimp, however my right arm is always sore and fatigued by the time I am done with the whole house.2. The canister is filled with the snowy-white fur of my dog, but that is it.  The canister contents are still white.  Where is the dirt?  My old vacuum dumped disgusting dark grey dirt.  The fur had always been turned black by the dirt.  I am so disturbed that there is no dirt in the canister.  That means it it still in my carpet.3.  It has a very tall base, meaning it does not have a good lip to get under the bottoms of dressers, beds, couches, etc.  I don't expect it to fold flat and go all the way under the bed, but previous vacuums have allowed me to go at least 2-3 inches under things.4.  It is expensive.  I will gladly pay that for a phenomenal vacuum, but paying $350 for something that leaves my carpets dingy and filled with dirt is offensive.I gave it two stars because I have to admit it does an excellent job on hard floors.  It doesn't kick stuff backwards like other vacuums. The attachments are fine as well.  It also has a long cord length, which is appreciated.  If it wasn't for those positives, this would be a one-star vacuum.  I am headed back to Sears to see what Kenmore models are currently available.

I bought the Dyson 33 and if you have carpet that has a pile at all, its harder than heck to push the vacuum. I have area rugs that are thick and some are shag and the vacuum just doesn't work on them. It says multi floor but it isn't. I'm taking it back today. My first time to buy a $400.00 vacuum and it surprises me that it doesn't work on a medium pile rug. The features on this machine for the money are pitiful!DISAPPOINTED IN TEXAS

column7: The DC33 - A chore for a chore
column8: With so many positive reviews on the Dyson, we invested in a DC33 for our weekly chores following frustrating belt breakage problems with a Hoover WindTunnel.  While many may get romantic about suction and features, I want a tool that helps us speed through the necessary Saturday morning efforts so we can move on to more enjoyable weekend exercises.  After three months with the DC33, we either have a lemon or I will simply question the ($400) hype as it is a finicky machine that requires kid-glove use and frequently clogs; seriously, we catch our breath if the machine is accidentally bumped on a stationary object concerned if it will continue to work.  We use the device for a 3,500 sq foot house that is 25% carpet and the remainder hardwood floors, and we don't have pets that might confound the machine's performance.  Disappointing, to say the least.
I love this vacuum overall. It is light weight and quiet. My only frustration is that it is hard to use when edging and vacuuming out furniture.

I  love Dyson.  The last one I had lasted over 10 years.  We would still be using it if my daughter hadn't dropped it down the stairs.  Even then, only the plastic parts broke.  The motor was still perfectly fine.  This new model is only better than the last.  Love this product.

column7: Dyson is junk.  Poor suction always. Clogging.
column8: We had the yellow Dyson. Very poor suction always. However, it was constantly poor so their claim that the suction doesn't change over time was pretty accurate. Starts off crappy and stays that way for ya!Plus our yellow junkie just continued to clog. One of the worst vacs we have ever had. I gave it to a friend who throw it out in under two weeks.My wife typically destroys one vac every year. This was no different only I really tried to keep it going but it really was bad vac from the beginning.We finally bought a cheaper Eureka bag vac and it has been working great for 5 yrs now. First vac to pass the one yr mark. And it works excellent at a fraction of the price.My advice... avoid Dyson.

Both of my brothers have a Dyson vacuum and have told me how awesome they are.  We've had a Bissel bag-less vac for the last 8 years and over the past few months, I've noticed how poorly it has started performing.  So instead of searching for a replacement in the $200 range, we decided to invest in the best and purchase a Dyson.I could not be more impressed with how powerful this vac is.  The old Bissel picked up a noticeable amount of dirt.  The Dyson, however picks up almost double the amount, based on how full the dirt bin is.  We own two dogs (Boston Terrier and Pug) and the amount of hair that was picked up in two bedrooms and a hallway was tremendous.  Although our carpet needs a good shampooing, it looks noticeably cleaner with just one run with the Dyson.Our home is two stories with laminate floors at the bottom.  The Dyson does a great job with this too.  Typically, I would vacuum the floor before mopping it.  With my old vac, there were still traces of dog hair, no matter how thorough I think I was.  They Dyson seems to have picked up a lot more, resulting in far less dog hair when I get down to the mopping.  Also, our Bissel had a shorter power cord; I couldn't do the entire living and dining room without having to unplug.  The Dyson cord is longer and I don't have to unplug more than once per floor.I only have two minor complaints.  The first is that you have to push down on the front of the vac in order to tilt the machine when you use it.  I'm so used to stepping on a 'trigger' in the back so this is a minor inconvenience.  Secondly, the hose and attachment is a bit clunky for my taste.  I've read that the hose needs time to 'break-in' so that might be the issue but it does seem a bit unwieldy when doing stairs.  Still, the powerful suction on the attachments more than make up for it.With a five year warranty and no filters to replace, I think that the Dyson will be an overall great value.  If you have more than a one bedroom place, I'd highly recommend purchasing it.  It makes cleaning so much easier and more efficient.  It is quite expensive (more than three times the cost of a Hoover, Eureka, etc.) but in my opinion it will be well worth it.  Considering I vacuum at least once a week, over the course of five years that's over 250 times I'll be cleaning better.

column7: Only buy if you do not have area rugs
column8: I really wanted to love my new Dyson. In fact, I was in love with my new Dyson when I vacuumed all of our carpets. The DC 33 is wonderful at picking up disgusting amounts of dirt on carpets that were previously 'cleaned' by my old vacuum. I am returning my Dyson because it simply cannot do one important thing- vacuum area rugs. I have many area rugs in my house due to the downstairs being all hardwood and tile (the Dyson does great on bare floors). When I went to vacuum the area rugs, the Dyson made the loudest grinding-screeching noise as if something was caught in the vacuum. I immediately stopped and checked the vacuum - no obstructions. I then tried again and encountered the same problem. I then looked on Dyson's website to see if there was an answer for my problem and unfortunately they acknowledge this design flaw and their solution is to simply vacuum those rugs in only the bare floor setting. That is not an acceptable solution for me - I paid $400 for this vacuum and I expect it to properly vacuum my area rugs (in bare floor setting the vacuum only suctions and the bar does not turn so the fibers in my area rugs don't properly get cleaned and fluffed). Also, my area rugs are very large, multiple 8x10's and an 10x 14, they are heavy and of various pile lengths so it's not like I'm trying to vacuum some flimsy 1x3 rug. This Dyson is not a multi-floor vacuum, only a dual floor: carpet and bare floors. Another recommendation by Dyson was to purchase one of their even more expensive models around $650 that does not have this problem. Sorry Dyson, for $400 I should be able to vacuum my rugs so you are getting returned. My search for a great vacuum that doesn't break the bank continues....

This vacuum Sucks!  Not only in suction power (it is strong) but also as a product!  After the second use, the vacuum started making the worst noise when the roller (carpet setting) was engaged.  I'm not talking about a faint whirr or whiz or ping...  but more like an extremely LOUD ENNNGGHHHHKKKKKKKKKKK!!!!  Holy!  What is happening to my Vacuum?  Turns out, this is a normal operating noise due to a pretty terrible design for this particular model.  Dyson has no interest in stating that this is a defect, which means they have lost me as a future customer for life!Do yourself a favor and buy a cheaper vacuum!!  I regret spending so much money on such an infereior product.  In addition the loud vacuum roller noise, the handle design is just as annoying.  If you want to clean pet hair of of furniture the hose and attachment are too long to use comfortably.  I would rate this vacuum 0 stars if I could.

My old Dyson of seven years bit the dust so I had to buy a new one. I really like the suction ability of the DC 33, however using attachments are quite frustrating.The hose doesn't really stretch out that far because it seems to snap back into place or the vacuum will fall over. I have to place the vacuum on one dude of an end table and pull the hose from the other side.I will try to keep it stretched for a long time to see if this helps with the flexibility.

I wasn't thrilled with many features of this vacuum. The wand is impossible to use, as the hose is so taut, the vacuum snaps at your heels the entire time you are using the wand. The profile of the vacuum is high, so it doesn't fit under anything, and the odd handle-integrated wand doesn't fit under things either. The on-board tools are cheap.But the final straw was when the roller started making a sound like washers in a blender a mere 6 weeks after purchase. And I was out of town for three of those weeks, so it really only had 3 weeks of once-weekly use. So essentially, it ran for about 3 hours. Unfortunately, by this time it was too late to return it to the store where I purchased it. I am still battling Dyson about the return. Their customer service is horrible. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!

column7: Too many cons for the price.
column8: I'd wanted a Dyson for a very long time but could never justify buying one since my Bissell Healthy Home was still in decent working order. Some pieces of the Bissell finally started to fall apart so, after reading many reviews, decided to purchase the Dyson DC33.  I was not initially impressed, but continued to use for a few weeks to see if I could get used to the things that bothered me.  I really wantedt o love this vacuum but, alas, it's going back.PROS:- Fairly light weight for its size.  Easy to carry up stairs.- Long cord, was able to do a few rooms without having to replug.- Easy to empty canister, although I can see that smaller lint/dust would start to accumulate on the filter in the middle and would have to be manually removed.CONS:- I know I'm going to get flak for this, but I was not impressed with the suction.  My Bissell's suction was just as good, if not better.  For that price, I wanted to be able to pick up a small child if necessary.  Not really, but you get the point.- Unable to vacuum under the bottom of kitchen cabinets or furniture.  Some other reviews had mentioned this, but I don't think you know how much this will annoy you until you get it home and are unable to thoroughly vacuum without having to use the wand.  Which brings me to my next con...- Who designed this wand??  I'm sure once you get used to how it works it wouldn't be as big of a deal.  But after using for a few weeks, I was amazed at how often I would just want to use the hose/wand for a small job, but would heave a sigh when I remembered what I needed to do to get it ready to go.  Plus, its design does not allow you to easily use on things in close range. Doesn't seem like that big of a deal, but again, get it home and it may drive you crazy.  It did me.- Last, but certainly not least, when vacuuming straight on, due to the front lip of the vacuum, you are unable to vacuum no closer than an inch and a half to an item or wall in front of you.  In many cases, you can turn the vacuum and run it on its side by the wall or item.  But in quite a few areas, it's not possible to manuever the vacuum into that area, and therefore, you'll be left with an unvacuumed edge.  You could use the hose and wand, but I've covered what a pain in the arse that is.I so wanted to be thrilled with this purchase, but I just don't see where Dyson gets off charging that price for a vacuum with this many flaws.

This is my 2nd Dyson , the 1st one is a similar but 5 years older model and still running strong - we use it at our rental. LOVE Dyson.Why? Because I'm petite (short), decently fit but weak upper body strength and core, have lots of stairs, and this is the only really powerful vacuum that I can manage up and down stairs. I love the clear container to point out to my husband how much it's picking up and why the price he paid for it was WELL worth it. But that's my husband, I think the only time he ever thought the carpet was actually dirty was when we had a red wine spill on white carpet - he needs a neon sign to point out where dust is - so this is the best vacuum for that.Amazon is great. I was a little hesitant to order such a big and expensive piece because of the hassle if it needed to be returned - but that's just a hold over from inferior products in the past. For well reviewed, good reputation products like Dyson, if all the worry is about an Amazon delivery - it's not a worry at all for me.

I read many reviews and decided to get this vacuum and am very happy with that decision.  It sucks up so much that my other vacuum missed.  The cord is very long so there is less replugging, I can do three of our four upstairs bedrooms completely without unplugging.  The hose is a little tricky at first but is very long so I can vacuum my stairs and leave the base at the bottom and reach all the way to the top with the hose.

This is an awesome vacuum cleaner.  It has incredibly strong suction and is very easy to use.  I'm not the one that generally vacuums, but once I started to use it, I couldn't stop and ended up vacuuming the entire office.
Everything has been fine so far, shipping was prompt, my only negative review is that the attachments that come with it could work better.

column7: Good for floors, cumbersome for most other surfaces
column8: To make it short and sweet, this vacuum is great for cleaning floors. If that's your main use, then I can recommend it wholeheartedly. However, if you're like me and spend a lot of time cleaning furniture cushions, vacuuming stairs/blinds/lamp shades etc. then you'll find this extremely cumbersome.I'm a man with a larger-than-average build and very long arms, but the wand is extremely frustrating to use. Because the accompanying tools are all designed to attach to the wand, using them means standing 3-4 feet away from whatever you're trying to clean. My next move is to purchase the accessory kit (http://www.amazon.com/Dyson-Home-Cleaning-Kit/dp/B002OHKLJW/ref=pd_sim_hg_1 - it seems like these tools really should be included with the base model of the vacuum) so that I can get the adapter to attach the tools directly to the hose. This is a huge oversight and nearly led me to return it, but unfortunately, I waited until the return period had lapsed.

I have used this vacuum for about 2 months now hoping it would get better, but it is just as akward to use now as then. You really can't use the wand very well becouse it can only be used when you pull the extension all the way out of the hose. It just won't work when it is inside the hose becouse you can't bend it to get into spaces where you need a short hose with maneuverability. I just had hoped it would have been better.

Fast shipping by Amazon as always.This is a great vacuum cleaner.  Much better than all of the cheap ones I've purchased at Walmart over the years.  I finally decided to invest in a good vacuum.  This was priced at $400 everywhere else and I got it for $299 at Amazon with free shipping.  Can't beat that.I gave this 4 stars and not 5 because although it picks up dirt really well, it doesn't leave the lines on the carpet that some people love.  I'm indifferent with respect to that.  This vacuum is alot quieter than I thought it would be.  I think it's a little heavy but I've been suffering with a bad back lately so it's probably just me.  Overall, great buy.

column7: Now I know why people want to have Dyson
column8: I've been in the states since 1999, and have had a lot of vacuums.I 've been disappointed with every single one I used cause they've been much inferior to the one I used in my country for like 10 years.I just couldn;t understand why the US can't make any decent Vacuum cleaner.I've come across to this cleaner, was kinda reluctant to buy due to much higher price, but wanted to end the never ending search.Boy! this one is made in Heaven.My search is finally over and I've found my VACUUM !

Without a doubt this is the best vacuum i've ever used or owned. It does a great job cleaning more hardwood floor our just vacuuming my shag carpet. I would not ever buy any other kind if for some reason my Dyson quit working after 5 years.

Okay...so, this is the second vacuum I've ever owned, but for the price and quality it's far superior to the Hoover that I had and the more expensive models (like the Electrolux) my parents had while I was growing up. It's quiet, has that awesome suction, easy to maneuver, easy disposal and comes with some great attachments.My only compliant is that the extension wand while very handy for cleaning of floors and ceilings is very hard to use for detail vacuuming.  What I mean is, if you want to get up and close to something to vacuum, like a couch, the long, none flexible wand makes such detailing difficult and frustrating.  I'm now thinking that I may have to buy some kind of hand vac for this kind of cleaning.  I wish I had done a little more research before buying this unit.  While I love it for everything else, 20% of my vacuum cleaning is now rather awkward and annoying.

I purchased this vacuum after extensive research when my 12 year old Oreck just wasn't doing the job as well anymore. I read all the reviews about other vacuums and this model always had such high praise. After purchasing it, the very first time I used it, what a difference! I never realized what other vacuum didn't pick up till then. It was like night and day. I keep my home pretty clean but was almost disgusted how much the Dyson picked up. I have a lab who sheds all the time and this vacuum picked up the hair so well. It was amazing. With the clear bin, you can see just how well it works. I would recommend emptying the canister into a bag outside to keep the dust you just vacuumed up as it is messy, but the trigger release is very easy and you don't get your hands dirty cleaning it out. The DC 33 does seem heavier than the Oreck but the suction is so much better and the brushes seem to really get my carpets clean so much better that I don't mind. It doesn't like fringe on carpets because it is so powerful so I have to be careful there. As for the noise level, it is on par with the Oreck. Overall, I would buy it again.

This vacuum has awesome suction power, but pretty bad in lots of other areas.Good Suction:This vacuum has great suction power. My carpets look like they are brand new after I roll this baby over them. The first couple times I used this after my old one broke down it pick up so much dirt my other one didn't. Cleans very well.Bad:Awful Grinding Noise -First off is the terrible loud grinding noise you get every time you use this. It has so much power sometimes it thinks it caught on something and the beater bar is stopped as a security feature. You can remove two strips of rubber in the head to allow more air flow, but the terrible awful grinding noise still happens. It will honestly make you jump every time it happens it is so startling.Bulky and Awkward -This thing is hard to use. It's heavy to push around and hard to get close to edges. And no way are you ever getting even slightly under furniture with this thing. The cleaning head is huge. Then there is the hose. It's is super duper stiff. I have left it stretched out for days, and even heated it up, and it still is super, super stiff. When you use it, the vacuum follows you a couple feet behind, banging into everything and falling over. It is almost unusable.Stairs -It says it's easy for stairs with the hose, but good luck. You basically have to carry the entire unit up or down with you or the thing falls over.Attachments -Basically the attachments are bad since you will have a very hard time using this hose.So, in the long run the suction is awesome, and the rest just bad. I would not pay $300 for this if i had to make the decision again.

Very good product:- Easy to use (but for a better understanding of all the functions, a reading of the quick instructions is necessary... after that, it's easy to remember :-)- Seems to be a good quality/solid item, even if 100% plastic, and I hope it will last a few years- Very powerful succion, perfect for our apartment (800 sq feet with 90% carpeting)- Easy emptying of the dirt, which lets you away from it (with my last one, I very often put a bit of dirt everywhere around my bin... it's not the case anymore)The negative points are the following:- The power cord is a bit of a pain to roll by hand on the back of the vacuum cleaner every time you want to store it. A retractable cord would have been really easier...- Quite noisy, but I guess it's as noisy as it's efficient- The main vacuum head is quite large and not that easy to slide and put everywhere, especially in the small corners. It is sometimes annoying to deploy the long vacuum head just for a small tricky corner- Quite heavy, and it's also a bit of a workout to vacuum thoroughly your whole apartmentAll in all, I'll buy this product again, and especially at such a low price as the one I had here

column7: Didn't last longer than a week.
column8: I am a nerd I know it and I'm not afraid to admit that before I use any appliance I sit down and read the manual. I read all the do's and don't with this vacuum. I did this mainly because my mother purchased a Dyson Animal years ago and within a year it was VERY noisy and required endless parts replacements. I started out very careful because my mother is very hard on her appliances and doesn't always make the best decisions on use and maintenance of them. So I decided I was going to 'show her' that these things are great.We purchased the Dyson DC33 and immediately loved it. it pulled hair and dust from our new rental house even after it had already been professionally steam cleaned. needless to stay we were impressed! We purchased the Dyson Zorb and I was even more impressed by how much it helped pick up even more carpet debris. I decided to Zorb our entire house and that way we could start from a clean slate when we moved in. Well after completing about half of the house I noticed that the noise level started to get worse. So i stopped it and examined the brush heads to make sure I didn't get anything jammed in it and it looked clear I also checked to make sure the hard floor/carpet dial was not in between gears and it was firmly on the carpet setting. Upon turing the vacuum back on I happened to see the gear knob turn PAST the carpet setting and stop way out of the range of either setting. I turned off the unit and then the dial switched back into the carpet setting when i put the unit upright. I then turned it on again in the upright position then pushed the head down to engage the brushes and again the gear shifted past the carpet setting and began to make a horrible sound. I know what most people are thinking... I didn't read the directions and turned the dial when engine was engaged and I stripped the gears but after carefully reading the instructions I made sure NOT to do this. So now I have a 6 day old dyson that makes the same sounds my moms did after 6 months of use!!! After reading some of the other reviews it seems others have been experiencing this same issue when the pile on the carpet is too high and it slows the rotating brush bar until it strips the gears in the variable floor selector. My carpet is MAYBE medium pile carpet and thats being generous...but that being the case there IS NO WARNING about any kind of pile restrictions with this Dyson. I am very careful and I HATE consumers that get mad when their appliance breaks after they use it improperly but there was no warning and I'm not even sure a vacuum should be advertised as variable floor if it can't handle anything over short pile carpet!

This product is everything I had hoped for. I have wanted this product forever it seems, but the expense was somewhat intimidating. I do not regret making this purchase. Since it works on hardwood and carpet it saves me time in switching appliances.It cleans all of my floors wonderfully.
I love this vacuum.  I've never owned a vacuum that cleaned my carpets so well.  It seems like the canister has to be emptied every other time I vacuum my house.  Highly recommend!

The only problem that I see with this unit is that it really doesn't work well on carpets. It is not a good vacuum for this reason. I bought it mainly for use on wood floors. For someone with a lot of carpet I would not recommend this product.

This is the best vacuum that I've ever owned. When they say the product has great suction they aren't kidding. We had our carpets professionally cleaned and when I ran the vacuum a couple of days later I was surprised by how much stuff it vacuumed up. Yes, I have a couple of small pets but they stay inside, so I wasn't expecting the vacuum to pick up much of anything.The unit is very easy to put together. You don't need any tools at all other than something to cut the tape on the shipping box. I love the way all the parts snap together; you know it is properly fitted when you hear the click.It is also handy that all the tools store on the vacuum. The telescoping wand easily reaches 10 feet; only issue is that on some floor surfaces the vacuum will roll towards you when you are using the wand so watch out that it doesn't fall over on small children or pets.The filter is easy to clean. If the suction seems to have dropped off you will need to clean the filter.All in all a well made product.

column7: If loving my new Dyson is wrong, then I don't want to be right!
column8: My allergies have always been bad, but with a rougher than usual Spring I finally broke down and bought a Dyson. The first time I used the DC33, it sucked a horrifying amount of dust out of my carpet. It also takes much less time to clean my apartment. I used to do the little dance where I'd run my old vacuum over a piece of lint or string, it would still be there, so I'd pick it up, look at it, and drop it back down and try the vacuum a couple more times and it would still be there. Grr! Not with this vacuum: one pass and it's gone. My apartment even smells better, and my eyes are less puffy than before.The hose feels kind of stiff and awkward to pull out, but I'm assuming with time it will ease a little. It also helps to remember to tilt the vacuum back before turning it on unless you're using the hose. Still, all in all this is a great vacuum and I'm very happy with my purchase.

I ordered this last week for a steal at $249.00($299-$50 applying for the Amazon Visa) and I now see the price has gone up $20.00, so I am so glad I ordered when I did!  Even at $319, it is still the best price out there for this vacuum new.Anyway, I had a VAX previously and it was terrible, but I paid close to $300 for it years ago, so I used it for many years while dreaming of someday owning a Dyson.  The VAX finally died (never so happy to have something break on me) so I could justify getting a Dyson.  I did a lot of research and decided on this one mainly for the price, but also the great reviews.  Yes, it does not have a retractable cord which I was used to with the VAX and it does not reach under furniture, but I am certainly not going to give it a bad review for those things!  I think I can handle wrapping a cord around a vacuum and I can use the wand to get under the furniture (that is what I have always done anyway).After having the VAX that I literally had to vacuum the same space 3 times to get it pick up the dirt and then sometimes having it spit it back out, I just wanted a vacuum that did it's job...VACUUM MY FLOORS!  I got it yesterday and of course, had to vacuum my house at 8:00 last night to try it and it is so WONDERFUL!  It is light and moves so smoothly and most importantly, it got the dirt and the dog hair the first time!  OH...I almost forgot the cord!  The cord is awesome!  It is SO long!  I LOVE not having to stop and unplug it to go into another room!  Granted, I cannot vacuum my entire house from one outlet, but I can get all the main parts that have the high traffic (mainly where the dogs go), so that's all that matters when I am just doing a quick vacuum job.  We do not have any carpet in our house...it is all wood, laminate and tile, so I was a bit concerned that it might not work as well, but it works wonderfully.  I highly recommend the Dyson DC33.

It took forever for Amazon to ship this vacuum (and the packaging, or lack thereof (no shipping box, just the clear wrap like you would get at a department store), was terrible, which for me is a first for Amazon), but we finally got it and have really enjoyed it. My wife really loves it and it definitely keeps the suction power as advertized. I find most of the complaints on other reviews to be really nitpicky, especially concerning the wand, however I understand their point of view considering the cost of this item. Anyway, build quality has been great, its easy to use and seems worth the money so far. I will update the review if anything changes.P.S.: We just ordered the Dyson Mini Turbine Tool (MSRP $83 - Amazon $41) to vacuum the stairs with and I will provide a review of that after using it a few times.

column7: Dyson DC33 upright bagless vacuum cleaner
column8: This was an excellent buy for me.  My last vacuum cleaner was 18 years old, and I must admit, it was getting ' tired'.  Hooray for Dyson, I no longer have to buy vacuum cleaner bags.Thank you.
It's worth the money! We are very happy with our purchase. It came very fast and as described. I would purchase this again.
Shipped fast and works well. Have had good experience with dyson in the past and hope this will be the same

column7: LOVE the older model! with the LONNNNG cord! 35 feet!
column8: I have had 2 Dysons so far in the last 15 years! I LOVE the first one I got which was NOT the 'ball' version. When my first 'original' Dyson Konked out, my husband (who thinks anything more expensive is better) purchased me the purple ball style. I have hated it from day one! I HATE that the cord is so much shorter! It barely makes it through one room. I HATE the ball. This machine actually sort of broke a couple years ago but I sort of fixed it and put up with it as it was off warranty. Today, it finally died and I gladly went to Target to find my old best friend, the origanal yellow Dyson with NO ball! It was out of stock which I am seeing online that it is most places but I just found it here. So it looks like there are not enough people complaining about the cord and the stupid ball and the ridiculous increase in cost when you go up to the purple (just because it claims to pick up more animal hair). They all have awesome suction so I know they ALL get that pet hair! Anyway, today I am getting one of the last yellow original Dysons at Amazon! If you are smart, you will too!Oh, I did see some at Walmart but they were $399! I was shocked that they are more there than at Target!

I absolutely love this vacuum! I researched quite a bit before buying this dyson, and I was still a little nervous because of some of the reviews on amazon. Everyone was saying how heavy it was, and how its bulky and doesn't fit anywhere.... I will tell you that's all crazy! Its an amazing machine, it isn't hard to push, with the amount of suction it has I like going slow so it picks up everything. And you are vacuuming, so that means a little moving around furniture, so no it doesn't fit under everything, but just move it...or use the hose bc the power behind that is unbelievable too! I have a dog that sheds a lot, so I was thinking about the animal dyson, but you can just get the attachments for this one (bc it has the same motor and suction) for like $60 and I saved almost $250. Overall I can find nothing wrong, it is fantastic!

column7: If you want suction then this is the one.Amazon's the cheapest.
column8: My wife has wanted one for a long time but kept it to herself. I found out that she wanted one and bought it for her. She has been very happy about it and I've gained a lot of brownie points for this,can you believe this over a vacuum cleaner. Guys if you want to be king of the hill then buy her a Dyson DC33 Vacuum cleaner.You can't beat the price at Amazon.

column7: I like it but i am not in love like i was with my DC07 animal
column8: I miss the attachments from DC 07. I bought the ball first and HATED IT, i ran a side by side with my DC 07 and it did not even compare to my 07. So i returned it and got the DC 33 and while i really like it i dont love it the way i did my DC 07 when i got it. This one just does not impress me.Dont get me wrong its a good vacuum. I just wanted the ohhhhhh and ahhhhhh i had with my DC 07. I will keep this one but in hindsight i wish i had spent the extra hundred and gotten another animal.

I bought this about 3 weeks ago and so far love it.  I also got the accessories which I have used and really liked them.  I cleaned my ceiling fans and it was pretty easy using the accessories.  I have also used the attachments to vacuum out the couches and loved it.  It is a breeze on stairs.  Love the long cord and the reach of the attachement hose.

column7: TERRIBLE! Sucks, not in the right way
column8: I will NEVER buy another Dyson. This all-plastic POS doesn't suck up even carpet freshner. TERRIBLE. You can get a Shark bagless for less than half this price. (NO stars)

I can't believe how much pet hair it's picked up - evidently my carpets weren't as clean as I thought! I've only had it a week but I think it's picked up enough hair to make another cat. I like how light and maneuverable it is! The super long cord is great, I don't have to stop and plug in somewhere else, just to vacuum the front rooms. If only the cord were retractable, it would be perfection. It is true that learning to use the on-board tools is a bit awkward, things don't necessarily work the way you think they should. But once you get the hang of it, it all works very fluidly. I never gave much thought to the lines left behind by a vacuum. Until I had them. Now I take great pleasure in the neat rows. Let's face it, if you're spending Dy$on money, you have some neatness issues and they have caught on to that. I've always had 2 vacs, a cordless for the kitchen and mud room and another for carpets. I can finally get rid of that Hoover LinX that got my scathing review. The Dyson is effective and easy enough to use all over the house. It's totally worth the investment and I would recommend it to a friend.

I came across the Dyson DC33 here on Amazon for only $299 with no tax or shipping so I decided that since it was 100+ cheaper than any other site I would go ahead and buy one...and I've always wanted a Dyson. I read the positive reviews along with the negative ones and figured I would make my own assumptions once I got my own Dyson and turns out it works amazingly! Now, if anyone has ever operated an upright vacuum they have experienced the vacuum tipping a little bit when using the attachments and I expected that with the Dyson since it happens with uprights but because the attachment reaches so far I haven't had that problem yet. And oh well if it does tip, I'll just pick it up again. The other complaint that I came across was that the front profile of the vacuum was so big that it didn't fit under any furniture or under cabinets, and as before, with my previous experience with uprights that has always seemed to be a problem. So I've adapted to that problem and just use the attachments to reach under those tight spaces. It works all the same.  I have no problems with these features. Now, the suction power on the Dyson is fantastic! I couldn't believe what came out of my freshly vacuumed carpet. My dad wasn't sold on the Dyson so I made him vacuum a section of carpet with his Oreck and then I went over it with my Dyson. The Dyson picked up so much fine hair, dust, and presumably skin that he had me vacuum the rest of his living room.  I can say for a fact that it gets the deep down stuff that other vacuums can't reach. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase especially since I got such a wonderful deal on it AND because it works ups to it's full potential. So anyone checking reviews ignore that negative ones since they seem to be petty complaints anyways. I love my Dyson.

Out of the box was making a loud grinding noise.  Fine in bare carpet mode, when brushes are not rotating so we inspected brushes and roller.  We could not find anything obvious, but an on-line search identified a number of others who have run into the same problem (...).  Apparently there is an issue with their quality control.

column7: Not as great as I thought
column8: My husband got me a DC33 as a present when we found out I was pregnant.  He put it together, turned it on and it made this horrible, loud grinding noise.  To keep it from doing that I have to start vacuuming in the kitchen first and then go out into the living room to clean the rug.  Even then when I push it forward it makes an annoying noise.  When I clean bare floors I've noticed it blows hair around.  Today I tried to use the hose and it was too big and clumsy.  When I empty the canister I have to dig inside it to remove the pet hair, getting my hands dirty.  The instructions to the machine are lame.  The only thing that impressed me was how nice my rugs look when I'm done.  I'll exchange it though because I don't think that noise is normal.

When you use this thing you can feel the quality and you know this thing is a well made machine. It is a little bulky and can't get under furniture. So if that's something you want you wouldn't like this. Also it can be cumbersome to get used to. the wand and other accessories aren't real user friendly at least at first. I bought it cause 'Quality is remembered long after the price is forgotten'

column7: Great power, but heavy and cumbersome
column8: I have always been an Electrolux buyer and have bought three models in the last 8 years costing upwards of $1000. The Dyson is much better! The power is above anything I have ever tried. I love the easy cleaning of the canister with a flip of a button.My gripes are the weight of the machine and the inability to vacuum under cabinets.

column7: Should have had multiple carpet height settings.
column8: We love the Dyson DC33 and should have bought a Dyson three vacuum cleaners ago as I would have spent less money in the long run. The last Bissel lasted less than a year. The hose will take a while to loosen up, but I think that is a good thing as it will last and retain its shape longer. The only complaint I have is that we had no idea it would not handle certain tight weave area rugs. Bare floor setting doesn't pick up well, and the carpet setting produces a loud grinding sound that goes right through you. We have come to learn that this is an 'alarm' of sorts to let you know there is no suction. It is nothing short of annoying, and by rights should be if it is an 'alarm'.  However, what makes it more annoying is that a vacuum cleaner of this price and quality did not come with any warnings, special attachment for these types of rugs or the most logical solution - an intermediate setting for carpets and rugs. The mini-turbine is not an acceptable solution as it is too small to do a large area rug (a hand-tool meant for furniture). The Flat-Out tool *might* work, but I'm hesitant to spend $50 to find out.Dyson missed the mark on this one point. Hardwood and tile floors are, and have been for some time now, more popular than wall-to-wall carpet. With these types of flooring, area rugs are also common. Our house and lifestyle could not justify the cost of the more expensive models, however if we had seen one review of the many we read which warned of this short-coming we may have considered moving up. Short of selling the DC33 at a loss and purchasing a more expensive model, we are stuck with this since Dyson doesn't acknowledge it or provide an acceptable attachment solution. The DC33 is perfect in every other way and delivers on all of its advertised features *except* when it comes to tight weave area rugs. For this reason alone we could not give it a 5-star rating.

I searched all the websites concerning a new vac.Honestly I am tired of buying one every few years.I finally decided on a Dyson,despite the bad reviews concerning warranty repairs.I expect dyson will soon remedy this situation as the price they charge for the product is extreme.Time will tell on that issue.I looked at all of Dysons products..the top model was WAY too much for me to pay to suck dirt from carpet,so I settled on the DC33.I am not disappointed..it brought out loose carpet fibers that the old vac did not over the last two years..The nap of the carpet is begining to stand up again in high traffic areas as it use to.Dyson is overly priced,but does as it was designed to do..A definate buy..
My wife says;  I never thought I could fall in love with a vacuum cleaner.  This thing rocks!
excellent product!  works great and a great price.  best vacuum I've ever used.  hose is a little still but the suction is so worth it!

column7: DC33 vs DC25. Its a really tough choice.
column8: I wanted to replace my Bissell Vacuum cleaner for more suction and power. I decided to go for Dyson for their no loss of suction technology. I zeroed in on DC25 and DC33. I had a tough time researching them online to decide which one to buy. So I had to try them both before deciding. Here are the more subtle differences of DC33 over DC25 that really matters.1.) DC33 has a bigger canister compared to DC 25. You can continue vacuuming DC33 for longer before emptying the bin.2.) DC33 has a longer power cord. Actually I found it to be too long and a slight inconvenience strangely.3.) DC33 has more suction power than DC25 although only slight.4.) DC33 dust bar is fixed unlike DC25 which can be removed for cleaning. But the real advantage for DC25 is that the dust bar protrudes a good 6 - 8 inches away from the body of the Vacuum cleaner. This makes cleaning under the furniture with low ground clearance easier.5.) Maneuverability in DC33 is a slight inconvenience over DC25 because of the lack of BALL. Not many will consider this as a real disadvantage though.6.) The brush beater ON/OFF switch is located at the bottom in DC33 compared to DC25 where it is located near the power switch.7.) DC33 is inexpensive compared to DC25 at least on Dyson website. With Amazon deals I was able to grab a DC33 for $299 where as the DC25 was listed at $319. The prices keep changing but this was the best I could get.I eventually decided to go with DC33 because of the following factors. More suction, Bigger bin and cheaper than DC25.
I was amazed at the power this Dyson has and shocked at how much dirt I vacuumed up the first time!I've always wanted a Dyson and am very happy I spent the extra money for it.Well worth it!!!
I love this vacumn cleaner.  I have never had a dyson before, and am very pleased with it.  I would recommend it to anyone.

First let me say, that I am lazy and hate to clean my house.  I have a 2500 square foot one level house, along with a parrot and two short haired dogs, so I am required to vacuum at least once a week.  I also have a Hoover Wind-Tunnel self propelled bagless vacuum which I've had for years and have really liked.  I was sort of nervous to spend this kind of money on a vacuum when the Hoover still works, but I know my Hoover can't last forever.  I will compare the two of the vacuums for you:  First I like the Dyson better because it is much much lighter and smaller.  I hate to drag out the Hoover from the closet and it's too big to stash in a corner, like I do the Dyson.  Both do a good job at picking up an unbelievable amount of dirt..where does all that dirt come from every week?!!?  I use the Dyson much more because it is handy to grab and use, rather than dragging out the Hoover.  Although the Hoover is self propelled, the Dyson is much lighter so I don't miss the self propelled feature.  The Dyson is also much quieter.  Both probably pick up about the same amount of dirt.  Like another reviewer says, the Dyson will suck a area rug right off the floor.  My Hoover never did that, but I learned that if you keep the handle at a lower angle to the floor, then for whatever reason it won't pull the rug (or not so tight carpet) up, causing an unworldly racket.  I like how the Dyson is easy to switch to hard floors, I have Laminate Flooring in a few rooms at my house.  Both the Dyson and the Hoover don't really get under counters because the front is too big, but both do an equal job of cleaning up dust on those.  The Hoover makes a lot of noise on hard floors and the Dyson doesn't. I don't know about the 'ball' Dyson or how that would have worked, but I'm happy with this one, it goes around corners just fine, because it's smaller.  As for the onboard tools, the 'telescoping' hose and tools is kind of cumbersome because the hose is kind of acordian like, and it tends to pull back into its original shape before you're ready.  I like the dust bin on the Dyson a lot better than the Hoover.  All you have to do is push a button and the bottom drops out, so you can put the whole thing into an empty garbage can, push the button and dust doesn't get all over, it just drops into the trash can.  With the Hoover, it's kind of a pain to take the top off, the filter out, etc.  The cord is plenty long, I wish it was self re-winding but my Hoover isn't either.  It doesn't stir up dust, and easily picks up dog hair, bird feathers and seeds, dust and dirt very well.  With the Hoover, it does lose suction after a few minutes but the Dyson really doesn't, which is a benefit if you hate to stop and empty the bin a million times,  I highly recommend it.  It was simple to put together and seems pretty sturdy, I would deffinately buy it over a Hoover, the only con being that the price is a little steep, but I think it's worth it. Hopefully it will last as long as my old faithful Hoover.

column7: Defective at first, but serviced well
column8: The vacuum does a great job but the unit we received was defective.  The brush bar clutch slipped a little ay first, but became worse over time.  There is on line customer service that works to rectify the problem over the phone, but that troubleshooting did not rectify the problem.  Because the unit is under warrantee for five years, the service was free. I needed to take it to a Sears service center ten miles away, and they replaced the defective part with no charge for parts or service.  We had the unit back with five days.  Other than for this problem, we are happy with the product.
This vacuum lives up to all the hype and is worth the extra cost of the Dyson name. Everything said on the Dyson website is true which has made us very happy.
If I had to make a purchase again for a new vac, what would I do?  Would I buy the same vac.. This is the criteria I use for judging a product. I would buy the same vac.  I Bought a Dyson DC33..

We bought this to replace another bagless upright (different brand) that we had had for 7 years.  That one would shoot sand/kitty litter/small rocks back at your feet and legs when you tried to vacuum a low pile carpet, and instead of sucking the fine dirt out of the medium pile, it would simply vibrate it down into and through the rug where it would collect on the floor underneath.We finally bought a Dyson, and it actually sucks things up.  This is exciting.  It pulled all kinds of things out of the medium pile rug that the old vacuum couldn't be bothered with, and picked up the sand off the carpet by the kids' shoe basket instead of flinging it across the room and under the couch.  There is a great attachment that I used to vacuum animal hair and small crumbs off of furniture, the dust off of the fabric on the front of the speakers, the keys of the piano, I went crazy.I did notice that while cleaning the low pile area rug, I have to set it to bare floor, lest the carpet and vacuum start vibrating together and make a terrible noise.  But even with the brushes up, it is still cleaning the rug.  I can even see it being lifted up by the Dyson as I pull the vacuum backwards.Also, I am not in love with the wand thing.  It is a little hard to deal with.  It is awkwardly placed, very long, and kind of hard to use.  Maybe I'll feel differently when I do the ceiling fans, we'll see.Mine is a refurbished one.  Even for a vacuum as great as this, these things are spendy!  Ours has been fine so far, as good as new.  Factory refurbed, 6 month warranty, $150 cheaper.

I really like my Dyson DC33!  I was really worried about spending so much money for a vacuum, but I have purchased 3 different vacuum cleaners in the last 10 years and was not impressed with any of them.  Seasoned Dyson friends recommended Dyson so I did some research and waited for the price to go down on Amazon. Love, love, love this vacuum!  If it does as good a job in 5 years as it does now, I will have saved money and had a vacuum I really love. I have listed a few pros and cons, but overall, I am very happy with my decision to go with Dyson.Pros - Extremely easy to assemble, AWESOME suction, easy to empty, fairly light to push, long cord and my favorite, NO DUST PARTICLES flying around as the vacuum seems to suck it all up!cons - attachment and hose is a little difficult to maneuver, but I think once I break it in, it will be fine. Vacuum is somewhat heavy to carry up stairs. I need to use attachment to get under kitchen cabinets and furniture, as the depth of the vacuum head is too high to fit under them.

I am so pleased with my Dyson, I put it together easily and the first time I used it I was so impressed with how easily it handled. Its quiet but works so well, works much better than the last vacuum cleaner I had bought which didn't last long. Works both on hardwood floors and carpets which I love, don't have to sweep the wood floors anymore, YEAH!!!

column7: Not as inventive as their commercials.
column8: I hope this helps someone.Pros:QuietZero smell of burned dirt or animal hair. It replaced cheep Chinese made Kenmoore which produced faul odor when vacuuming animal hairExcellent suctionLarge canisterLong cord Cons:Hose is too stiff and hard to maneuver. The design is interesting but using it is like fighting an anaconda. The self retracting hose makes it extrealy difficult on stairs and in tight spaces.HeavyDoesn't come with hard floor attachment. It will cost you $40 extra if needed. And if you need to vacuum under your furniture or bed you will need it!The base is to bulky making it useless without extra attachment which brings back the hose issue I mentioned earlier.Conclusion:Decent vacuum with a lot of suction power, but there is a lot to desire. Their commercial mentions all of the outside the box thinking and ideas but by fixing few issues other vacuums have they created a buch of new once. If all you do is race through your house and don't have to deal with furniture and stairs this is a perfect peace of machinery, otherwise look elsewhere.

I love my new vacuum cleaner.  I had debated for months on which one to get and decided on the Dyson after reading lots of reviews and asking all friends/family.  I like the attachments and find it very easy to use.  The suction is amazing.  I use it on carpet and hard floors and it picks up everything- I have two sons, a dog, and two cats- it picks up all the tiny dirt as well as the pet hair.  Definately recommend this vacuum.

I received this vacuum the same week as ordering (thank you amazon).  When I first used it, I didn't realize my carpets and stairs had that much dirt in them, because my old hoover just wasn't getting the job done.  This vacuum exceeded my expectations and does a great job!! I also like not having to change bags and the pure strength of the suction on this vacuum is amazing.I am happy all around.

Purchased in November 2011. Previously using an Electrolux Oxygen upright. This vacuum sucks really hard. It's fun to watch the dust and other particles move towards the vacuum like a magnet (on hard floors). It picks up things very well across all floor types. I like how it comes apart to remove clogs too and it's easy to clean. It's lightweight and has a good cord length.Cons:The hose attachment is a little awkward to use but has good length. You cannot get up under anything with the head of the vacuum as it's very tall.
