It won't go under the furniture, beds or foot plate of the cabinets but the hose can be used to cover these areas.I would recommend purchasing this vacuum.
I love it!  Easy to push around and maneuver, perfect for all floor types.  Switches from bare floor to carpet setting on the fly with your foot and it picks up everything.  The perfect sweeper!

column7: Older attachments won't fit...Dyson doesn't care
column8: We've had a Dyson DC07 for about 8 years until it died. Replaced it with this one, mainly because we had the attachments already: bare floor attachment, pet attachment, car cleaning kit, etc.Well guess what? they won't fit this model, and Dyson doesn't make an adaptor. Of course they said if I buy all new attachments they will work on future models, but guess what...that's what they said 8 years ago.We will NEVER buy another Dyson product. If they cared about their customers, they would make a simple adaptor to use the old attachments. If they don't care about me as a consumer, I don't care about them as a company.

What I think I love most of this vacuum is when doing my hardwood floors, the stuff close by actually gets sucked up, not just what I'm going over but, anything within a 2 inch radius gets pulled in.  The extension is supposed to be 15' but, I kind of doubt it.  My hose is tight and I don't think it's going to reach that far, but, haven't tested it so I'm not certain.  The attachments are okay but, I wish I had bought a better attachment to get the pet hair off my couch.  Loved what I paid for it on Amazon compared to what the stores charge and even compared to what Dyson's site charges.  All in all, I understand now how people fall in love with inanimate objects.  Won't go back to a regular vacuum ever again.

column7: Who would've thought I'd enjoy vacuuming
column8: I had heard wonderful things about Dysons but just couldn't stomach the thought of spending so much money on a vacuum.  As it turns out, all of the great things I heard were true.  It was amazing (and horrifying really) to see what came out of my carpet and how clean it could be.  I was skeptical on the bare floor cleaning but again, was so pleased at how well the Dyson did on our wood and linoleum floors.  While the bulky head of the vacuum doesn't fit in all the small spaces, I found our dog hair tumbleweeds left their crevice perches and actually were sucked toward the Dyson just by vacuuming nearby.  All and all, complete vacuum happiness.  I highly recommend it.

We have owned this for about 3 months. Every bad thing you have read about this model is true. It works fine on hardwoods, but on area rugs and certain kinds of carpets, it doesn't work. It actually makes a terrible screeching noise. Dyson has a 'fix' which is removing a belt, but it continued to make the noise even after. It doesn't work well on rugs when not on the carpet setting. I would not have bought this product had I known. It's not the worlds greatest vacuum by any means. There are better products for far less money.

I bought this vacuum after owning a series of cheap machines that I was never satisfied with. The suction power of the Dyson DC33 is amazing. I have a fairly new home and I'm careful about what goes on my carpet, but the Dyson picked up an unbelievable amount of dirt on the first few uses. I can't believe how much my old vacuum was leaving behind. I also found it convenient to use, and the tools are really handy. I would recommend it to anyone.

column7: Decent basic vac but lacks features
column8: I bought this vac to replace a similar LG model that I could not get serviced.  This vac has great suction, emptying the cannister is easy, the cord is nice and long, it' light weight, and the onboard storage of the attachment tools is convenient,  but that is where it ends.  The profile is very high, so unless you have furniture on stilts or say a high profile coffee table or kitchen table with a minimum of 1 foot clearance good luck cleaning under it. You will have to move furniture or use the attachment and wrestle the wand.  My LG and an older Hoover both got pretty far under a bed and no problem going under a coffee table that was 6 inches off the floor. This vac can be used on hard floors but it can't even get near the 3 inches of over hang under my kitchen cabinets. So it's basically worthless in my kitchen. My biggest complaint is the attachment feature and it's because of this that I regret buying this vac. The high profile of the vac pretty much ensures you will need to use the attachments.  The wand when extended is extremely unweildy. Nothing swivels so you have to do everything at right angles or parallell which is often a chore or and sometimes not possible unless you move funiture. When the wand isn't extended you have to stoop way over to use it and again you can't adjust how the attachment sits into the wand or twist it to a different direction once it's in. This is a big pain when trying to vacum up against baseboards or around the edge of furniture, especially in a semi tight space of say less than 3 ft x 3 ft. like behind a bathroom door with a countertop nearby.  When vacuuming a lamp shade or stairs I felt as though I was wrestling an animal. The suction is so powerful that you are struggling against the force of the suction to control what you are doing.  It was a work out on my back to vacum my carpeted stairs. I wouldn' dream of trying to use it on curtains, I accidentally got near some and it sucked them in the wand at least 6 inches.  LG had controls for power and movement from carpet to floor right at your finger tips on the handle. The attachment wand was much shorter (but extendable) and the flexible hose off the attachment wand was much longer allowing for much more flexibility in movement. The on/off switch on the Dyson vac is further down. You have to bend over and move a knob to switch from floor to carpet.  Lastly, the quick start directions that came with this vac was missing key information such as how to move the vac into position to vacum.  I finally figured it out, you step on the base of the vacum as you push the handle back, again, it's an awkward design. I happened to mention I purchased this vac to a friend who has the same exact vac.  She underscored the same complaints. I wish I had tried this vac out before purchasing it. Now I am stuck with it unless I want to pay shipping to return it.  For a vacum that touts it's superior suction engineering it utterly fails in the area of engineering and design of the attachment feature and access under furniture.

All I can say is WOW!  Unboxed and put together in a few minutes with no tools.  Swept the whole house and had to empty the canister three times.  So glad the wife and I didn't settle for a bargain vacuum, this thing is a beast.  The hose is a bit firm but will give with use.  My kids are now interested in sweeping, life is good!

We have a brand new house with a mixture of surfaces: carpet, tile, and laminate wood flooring. This vacuum takes care of it all. The hard surface setting ROCKS, and unlike my old vacuum, it actually sucks dust towards the vacuum instead of into corners. Every room looks great after I vacuum. It's not too heavy, it reaches really far, the cord is really long, it's got great suction, and it smells great after you vacuum. It's also really easy to empty!I have NO negatives to this vacuum. Buy one, it's worth the money.

I bought this Dyson expecting a good product,  The price suggested a good product,  Instead the performance is dismal to say the least.  The suction system is too complicated.  All the dust and the smallest particales like a small piece of paper or kleennex are trapped in the brush bar because the suction tube is to small and becomes clogged.  It is a constant battle to keep the suction tube clear.  I would not buy another Dyson. It is a piece of junk.I think you can get a better value from a Hoover at a lot less cost

I bought several vacuums that were 'rated' higher than a dyson, but under $100.  I thought they were great until I bough this bad boy.  There is no contest.  Ease of use, noise and performance were all substantially better.  I have two dogs who shed a ton and this has made a huge difference on the carpet and hardwood.  The chord is long enough to do almost anything I need and the extension hose is so much better than my other vacuums.  That being said, it can still be a pain.  If you are like I was and you just don't know if it is worth the money, do it.  It was worth it.

The Dyson hose for vacuuming with the wand attachments is unfathomably and very frustratingly difficult to use.  Additionally, the vacuum base height does not allow it fit under the standard kitchen / bathroom floor cabinet overhangs.These two drawbacks make it horrific for convenience and usability for a large and vital portion of typical household vacuuming chores. Human engineering is frightful at best. A waste of money!!!

column7: VERY highly and strongly recommended to me!!
column8: LUCKY me!I got to help my sister clean for a holiday party a couple months ago and used her Dyson to do so. I'm used to a canister for heavier weekly cleaning (who are we kidding? biweekly or monthly!)and after pushing this thing around I realized that my canister is a total 'DRAG'!If she wrote the review she would say 'best vac I ever owned!I was VERY impressed at what it got off her floors and carpets. Her dog sheds like crazy and there was no more cat litter sand left behind and under foot in the laundry room...Trust me- I was looking closely knowing what my pet series robot is capable of.... And though I wasn't at first sure of the bagless feature, the canister was easy to take off and on and it was satisfying to see the dirt after each room accumulate! My canister bags aren't cheap and are rather small so this will save me a significant amount of money over the 5 year WARRANTED period. I like that the same hoses that canisters are famous for are now attached to uprights. This upright anyway...I will be getting a vacuum for the upstairs soon as I (and my kids who do upstairs vacuuming) hate lifting it up and down each time. She assures me this is the one she has and it will be the one I buy!I'm sold! Sign me up!

My husband and I have had a Dyson for eight years. We LOVED it! Recently I noticed that it was leaving some dirt behind. We took it apart and cleaned everything, but it didn't help. We decided it was time to upgrade. After doing some research I decided to buy the DC33 over the super expensive DC41. I was so excited when I got home and did the vacuum test. I vacuumed with our old Dyson and then with the new and was disgusted and surprised with how much dirt the DC33 still picked up! I thought I was sold on the vacuum, but when I went to use the wand I was disappointed. The hose will not pick up anything unless you have an attachment on it (which I hate) and even then it barely picked up anything at all. I am reading some of these reviews that say it sucks in your shirt, but seriously I think I could have fed it my shirt and it would have spat it out! I decided to buy the Shark and I am thrilled with it! I did the same vaccum test with the DC33 and the Shark. The Shark still had more to pick up. It also has a shorter head so that it fits below some furniture. We returned the Dyson within our thirty days and I am not at all sorry. Overall, I don't know if it's just the DC33 or all new Dysons, but comparing it to my old Dyson (think it was the DC13), it seems that Dyson has gone for a cheaper, less reliable (though more expensive) product. Think I'll be a Shark girl from now on...

I bought this vacuum for my wife on the very first use it made horrible noises on the carpet areas of out house. (This was our second one with the same problem) we returned it and got the Animal it's a little more expensive but well worth the money!!!

I have been using dyson for a long time. After my husband clean kiddos throw up with my dc18 it was time to get a new one. So I purchased dc33.  Beside having good suction power this model is not convenient at all.Hard to maneuverVacuum has a really big head that you can not reach corners under cabinets ( especially in the kitchen)Since head part is not clear plastic, hard to tell roll in on or off for carpet vacuuming, you have to listen to noise, annoying. From hard wood to carpet you have to lift it, it doesn't jump by itself(more back pain).After dc18 it was too bulky for me so I returned it and got dc41 animal complete instead. Best decision ever, it is little pricy compare to this model but this is not something that you purchase it every other year.
Had my last Dyson for over 10 years before I bought this one. Three dogs, kids, heavy traffic and the Dyson does the job day in and day out. Well worth the price

column7: It's the Bentley of the vacuum world
column8: I just started using it today, so this may be just a 'love at first vacuum' impression, but boy is it ever better than anything I have ever used. I am known around these parts as the vacuum killer, I don't know why but they just destroy themselves around me. Not long ago I had three standing at attention in the garage and I was not happy with any. I love the review by the person who says they have seven, now that's a collection!So it slices, it dices and even cleans in places that I thought would be hopeless, like a very oddly built banister that seems to collect dust in its 1 1/2 inch slot from the top of the staircase to the bottom. I'm not sure that the builder considered how it would ever get clean. The features are very easy to use and it really cleans like nobody's business. The arm is handy and well balanced and the heads change out very easily. I took a break to write this and now will resume my joyful vacuuming.

As a gadget geek, I have long admired products who's engineering and operation are what is advertised, and this vacuum is AWESOME! I've never owned a vacuum that worked as well as this! the handle is a bit clunky and takes some 'grokking' to fully understand how to use, but that is its only drawback. Excellent product!
Wonderful!  Useful!  Great suction!  Love the long cord!!!  Hose is strong and long!  Canister is large and easy to clean!
I do like the vacuum very much so .. just wish they would figure out another design for the hand held use of it...

I have owned the DC33 model for close to a year now after purchasing a refurbished unit at a big savings over a new one.  I did not expect to be overly impressed with a vacuum cleaner.  this one  cleans well and seems to have plenty of suction power over time where other vacuums that I have owned in the past seem to have their suction diminish over time (probably due to filters starting to clog).  One thing in particular that I noticed is that there is no smell of dust in the air after vacuuming the floors.  Also, the unit is well-engineered having several ports with latches to make clearing any clog easy, although we just recently got our first clog after vacuuming up loose long needles from our Christmas tree.  I examined the two filters (one or both are HEPA?) and there was no evidence of anything at all accumulating on them even after almost a full year of regular use.  Our previous upright always ended up with dust caked up on the filters that required cleaning, washing, and drying.  I like the fact that the spinning brush can be turned off by just pressing a button to clean hard-surfaced floors.  I can only find a couple of minor things to criticize about the design.  The hose wand stores in the top of the handle and when removed for use the straight non-flexible section at the end seems a little long and awkward.  Also, there is no buit-in light to illuminate the floor ahead of the vacuum while cleaning.

column7: Once you have a Dyson you can't go back...
column8: I had the Dyson Animal vacuum for years.  After we didn't have dogs anymore I gave it to my sister to use because she has pets.  I bought a 2 different brand vacuums and hated them.  Got this one for a great price and have been so happy!  I don't even notice a difference between this one and my Dyson Animal vacuum.  I would definitely purchase again.
Works exactly like I expected it too couldn't be happier !!! And the price on amazon was the best I could find anywhere !!

I am really happy with my new vacuum.  It is easier to vacuum, makes the carpet fibers fluff up.  Only thing I don't like is the stiffness of the wand.  It is easy to remove the wand to use but then you must stretch it out in order to control it.  Otherwise, best money I spent.

Product arrived in a timely fashion and this thing really picks up dirt and you can see it in the canister.  As I was warned in a Sears store when looking at this earlier, the hose is very stiff and needs stretching for a while to be easier to use.  It would also be better if I didn't have to go out and spend a fortune on new attachments.  But this thing really sucks ;-)

I don't know what all the hype is about. This is a vacuum like most others. I'm hoping it will prove to be a longer lasting piece of equipment than previous ones I have owned. If it is then that will be the difference but function-wise it's pretty much the same as the Shark I had before.One negative is the hose. It takes three men and a boy to keep the hose extended. The retraction on it is so strong, the vacuum keeps bumping in to me. Doing stairs is definitely a workout for the arm muscles.The price was reasonable, considering the cost of an Electrolux or a Kirby.

This was my 3rd Dyson. I bought two when they first came out about 6 years ago. They do pick up, but hard to push and pull on thick carpet. The suction with hose and tools can be a little much. I just got my 3rd one, 1 month ago and it started that same horrible noise as the last two, decided I wasn't going to deal with again. I purchased it at Sears and they have a 90 day return, hassle free, so back it went. I found there are others just as good as the Dyson, but without that noise and much less money and same old plastic stuff and easier to use/access attachements.

column7: Works pretty much like my old DC14 Low-Reach, almost
column8: I bought this for my mom...I assembled it quickly and tried it out at my house first.  Having vacuumed with my 6 year old DC14 first earlier in the day, I wasn't expecting much else to be picked up by the new DC33, and I was right.  There was nothing but one fuzz ball in the bin.  One thing it tells me is that my old DC14 is still working great after all these years.  I think my old DC14 has more suction.  The new DC33 moves across the carpet with more ease, however...is smoother.  It could be due to the newer, stiffer bristles on the roller.  I actually bought a new brush roller for my DC14, but I haven't received it yet...will be curious as to how it moves after installation.It's pretty much the same vacuum as my old one, except for the placement and design/size of the tools and the new plastic handle extension (which I don't like...the metal one on my DC14 is much sturdier and I prefer it..this one bends & feels flimsy), and placement of filter.  And I like my old brush tool much better, with the articulating head that moved as the angle of my vacuuming changed.  The new one is smaller, static and feels cheap. The tools definitely are less prone to falling off the new one, however, since they're not located on top of the canister as on the old one.  All in all, I got what I expected...a new Dyson that acts exactly as I'd expect it too. My only cons are new plastic wand and smaller tools, however.This new DC33 one is about 7 pounds lighter, so my mom will appreciate that aspect.  If she doesn't like it, I'll use it for my downstairs and buy her a cheaper Hoover!!

column7: have to give it one star as no stars is not an option
column8: I have been a dyson-ite for years.  This vacuum unfortunately is such a disappointment I am surprised they sell it.  First off, no floor attachment and the one from the older model doesn't fit it.  The cord is very short, I have to add an extension cord to it.  The canister is so small that it needs to be emptied very often.  The stair attachment is a complete joke.  I find this vacuum rather difficult to operate on thicker rugs and it doesn't do a good job of lifting.  All in all, I wish I didn't purchase this and I will NEVER own another Dyson.  It has been like a painful break-up for me.

The Dyson DC33 Multi-Floor Upright Bagless Vacuum cleaner is an amazing tool around the house. I have many different floor surfaces in my home; super plush carpet, slate tile, vinyl tile and laminate. This vacuum goes easily from one level of flooring to the next. It's great with pet hair and the power cord is long enough to get a large area done without having to find a new power outlet. Love this vacuum.

This Dyson makes a very loud grinding sound when used on a carpet. I have contacted Dyson and I was told this is normal, if you happen to purchase this brand buy some hearing protection. I would NOT buy this type of machine.

I just noticed almost all of my reviews are 5 stars but that's because I do a lot of research before I buy something.  I researched all types of vacuums before I purchased this one.  I picked this vacuum because its suction is better than the other similarly priced Dysons, its container is larger, and it is more durable.  This vacuum works great on my tile floors, it picks up everything.  It's awesome on the carpet and light enough to carry up and down the stairs.  I have a cat and it easily gets all his hair and the litter that gets out of his box.  I use the tools on it to clean the steps on the stairs, clean the couch, and to get to the hard to reach spots.  I do not have a single complaint about the vacuum.  I also bought the Dyson Pet Clean Up Accessory Kit but haven't had to use it once because this vacuum is already great without the kit.

column7: Good Vacuum for wood floors but...
column8: If we could give halves, I would have given this vacuum 3.5 stars.The good. I've been looking for a good vacuum for wood floors that has great suction since I live in a 200 yr old home with its original floors, which means the planks have slight separations and I need to get the dirt and dust between them. This vacuum does that. So well in fact, that I thought I might suck up 200 yr old nails holding the boards in. After the first run, I just felt cleaner. I have a few rugs that don't get dirt on them but get small leaves or lint/dust on them. The vacuum doesn't get that clean if I leave it on the bare floor setting, but it does a fantastic job if I move it to the carpet setting. Some reviews say it's difficult to switch settings while on the go but I have no problem switching it back and forth with my foot. The wheels glide easy and I haven't seen any marks on the floor. But granted my floors are super old and so I might just be missing the marks if there were any. The power cord is so long! It's great. I can clean entire levels without having to switch the cord around. This is fantastic when I have 3 levels to vacuum. It's easy to put together and easy to empty the dirt pan.The cons. Again, I live in an old house that is in farm land, which means I get spiders inside with their webs. So I have to dust floor boards and corners a lot. I wanted something that I could easily attach a dust attachment and get it all done while I'm doing the floors. This vacuum does that but it is the most awkward thing I have ever used. The hose is so stiff that it will not stretch if the vacuum base isn't held in place, it will just roll along with you nipping at your heels. Then there is this long plastic extension tube that runs inside the hose which doesn't let it bend if you don't extend it. So you extend it and then suddenly you need to be 5 ft away from whatever you are cleaning. And just forget tight corners, you can't get to them without disassembling the hose. So you can get it clean, but it won't be a speedy task. There is also a picture of a person stretching that hose a full flight of stairs, mine will not stretch that far leaving me 3 steps short. I don't mind this, but it's a bit misleading. Then there is the heft of it. The vacuum itself is sturdy but not too heavy for me to carry up stairs easily. But stretching that hose is like an olympic weight lifting match. Maybe it's because I need to do more push ups but it is difficult to keep extended when I'm on the stairs. It's a workout and I don't mind it but it's defiantly not a plus. And lastly, you will never fit this vacuum under any furniture other than a table. Don't even try. It won't happen. Get the flat attachment and go that way.In all, it's a great vacuum and works well, I would just like the attachment hose to be more user friendly and not so difficult to maneuver.

I got a great price on this vacuum and I love it! It's lightweight and I could not believe what it sucked out of my carpet! I use it twice a week and am satisfied everytime. Also love because it's easy to empty dust. We have two dogs in the house and this vacuum sucks up all the hair. I have told all my friends about it. Well worth the price.

I have had my Dyson for 6-8 years and recently have had it in the shop twice with another repair on the way.  When I first got the machine, I was very impressed with its suction, even for pet hair.  I felt like my carpets were really getting clean.  However, the reason I traded in my Hoover was the suction was no longer there and I was willing to pay more for a vacuum that would have the ability to outlast my Hoover.  Unfortunately, although the Dyson's have no 'vacuum' that lose efficiency over time they have other issues.  The first time it needed service, the lever that holds the canister to the vacuum malfunctioned and had to be repaired ($90), but this problem could have been an idiosyncrasy of my vacuum.  Recently, I noticed it was just not cleaning up my carpets and that the suction both from the wand and the unit was just not there. I took it back to the repair shop where they did a basic 'tune up and cleaning' for $100.  I soon got a call from the shop and was told it would need a clutch soon; I declined to have that repair done as it would have been another $65-$75.  While I was there, I noticed all the vacuums in line for repair were--Dysons.  The clerk confirmed that this was normal, basically Dyson is keeping her boss in business.  Although, I understand that since the price of the Dyson is so much higher, people are much more likely to get them repaired.  Still, the machine was sold on the idea it would not lose suction because it does not have a vacuum, this idea is patently untrue, they clearly lose suction over time!  All being said, after my repair my vacuum is working better than it did before but not nearly as good as it did when I first got it.  I would not buy another one; for the price of my Dyson, I could have purchased several new vacuums over the years to get consistently better results.Pros:-Initial suction and cleaning are good-No messy bags-Easy to empty canister-Filter is easy to clean (must be done 1x/month)Cons:-Expensive-Exposure to dirt and dust when dumped in trash (canister dumps directly into trash can - not good for those with allergies!)-Long-term cleaning is less than desirable, losing suction gradually over time-Although the filter is easy to clean, you must do it when you know you will not be using Dyson for 24 hours as filter must dry completely.
This is a great vacuum that is a must own.  it is unquestionably expensive but it is the kind of vacuum that you buy once and never again.  A great purchase.

I, like many other reviewers, was very unhappy when I tested out my vacuum. Whenever the vacuum was on a rug or the carpet, it got stuck and made a very loud noise (even when raised to the carpet setting). I called the company's 800 number printed on the vacuum. I was immediately connected with a very friendly and competent representative who explained that the machine's suction power was too strong for the height of my carpet. She gave me some very simple instructions for removing a piece from the bottom of the vacuum and within 5 minutes, the vacuum was up and running as advertised.While this defect was initially annoying, it was very easy to fix.  I finally see what all the hype of the Dyson was all about!

Vacuum works great.  Picks up much better than previous model(Eureka)we owned. Not sure what the roller ball would add, this is one easy to push. For a dyson this is a great price and a very good vacuum.

This is an outstanding vac.  After still using my college vac, with two kids, it was time to upgrade.  Oh and being 37 made me think that it was time to graduate to a real vac. :-)  One word - disgusting.  I knew my kids were dirty, but could not imagine how bad our master bedroomm was.  Three containers and did it again two days later and got two more.  Cannot help but think it's gotta be more healthy.  Dyson = Sold.

column7: Sick and tired of 100 buck vacumms that catch fire!!!
column8: We bought a 85 buck little guy from Walmart 3 years back and it did the job (i thought) until this morning when the engine lit fire. I decide after years of buying cheap vacuums i would go woth a good one. Picked this one up and my attached picture shows what the Dyson picked up in one pass of my upstairs after my older vacuum had gone through twice.I was sold on this product then but the great warranty that Dyson has really makes it that much better.Cant wait to use this vacuum for years to come.

Possibly the best investment on cleaning I ever made.Forget the negative reviews about how the product handle looks and feels cheap..etc. None of that will matter if you actually see it perform.  It does an exceptional job in living up to the high price. I was lucky to get a refurbished product for half the price. You have to use it to believe how good it is.I Would recommend it to everyone.

This vacuum is like some thing from the future, it's so bad a*s! Although it is heavy to pick up, It moves SO smoothly it's like your pushing air. I ran this vacuum once quickly around my 2 bedroom apt (all carpeted) the canister was FULL, I have two cats and I couldn't believe how much fur and dirt was in there. What I really like too is you don't have to worry about replacing any filters or bags. Also it comes with a 5 year warranty, they send a paper you use to register your vacuum on dysons website, and you get the warranty FREE! This vacuum is AWESOME!!

Got this vacuum for Christmas and was excited to give it a try.  First vacuum that came out of the box made horrible noises when you bumped something.  Called Dyson and they didn't have a solution, so they told us to take it back.  Got another one that worked without making the horrible noise.  But, even though to generally vacuum the house it is fine, I do not like the hose or attachments.  I use my attachments more than I use the standard vacuum in my house and I found it a pain to use.  The flimsy plastic handle is no match for the heavy duty coils.  I found that it puts a lot of pressure on my wrist.  I also didn't find it very easy to use.  You have to put the extension up and it makes it just to clumsy to clean under the table or in tighter spaces.  I would also love to see an auto-rewind on this considering the cord is so long.  I plan on taking this back and just getting something less expensive that will be more useful for me.

I don't know how anyone could give this vacuum 1 or 2 stars.  I read almost every review and was a little apprehensive to order it ($$$ + disappointment = pissed) but I did so anyway.  The bad reviews made me think; if anything it's going to be heavy, not pick up strings and not reach under furniture. NONE of that was the case.  Putting it together was a snap.  Then I started to test it out.Test 1)  I had no problems putting my foot on the base to tilt the handle back.  Not having a release isn't a big deal.Test 2)  Pushing is across my plush carpet wasn't hard at all.  It felt the same as any other vacuum I've used.  It makes me wonder if other reviewers had shag carpet.Test 3)  IT PICKED UP THE STRING!  I threw a black string on the floor (regular thread for sewing) and ran the vacuum over it once and saw it was gone. A huge Grinch still smile was on my face.  The excitement started to brew now.Test 4)  It didn't reach under my sofa but I popped off one of the attachments and the hose and reached under there with no problem.  The unit does chase you like a stage 5 clinger but it also wasn't a problem.  It didn't fall over or tackle me to the floor.Test 5)  MY FLOORS LOOK GREAT! [insert chicken dance]  I love this vacuum.

I received my DC33 right before Christmas.  I have used it only a couple of times, but I am very impressed.  After using the vacuum, the pile of the carpet felt like it was fluffed up and softer to walk on.  I had to empty the cup after vacuuming one room (my old sweeper had seen it's better days!).  It even made the carpet look better too.  I had a hard time figuring out how to get the hose out and then putting it back together, but I finally got it done.  It is a little bulky on the front of the unit to get by the wall under the cabinets, but that's not too big of a problem with me.  I would recommend this vacuum to anyone.

I received my DC33 yesterday and I was totally giddy with excitement to try it out.  Assembled it with no issues, it literally snaps together in a couple minutes.  Stated vacuuming, but was shocked when it kept making a HORRIBLE noise, like a sock was sucked up.  Finally called Dyson and the very nice lady in customer service informed me that the DC33 is NOT meant for area rugs, even if they are secured to the floor.  What?!  Apparently, the 'clutch contolled brush' models are only meant for hard floors or wall to wall carpet that is tacked down.  The brush is powered by suction and, although it doesn't seem like the rug is being sucked up in the vacuum, it is.  She said that my options were to vacuum my rugs with the brush turned off (really???) or to choose a model that has a belt driven brush (which most are).Now, having said all this and feeling incredible disappointment, I did go ahead and vacuum one rug without the brush on and it did pick up tons of dirt and dog hair that my other vacuum left behind and that did surprise me.  I think this would be a great vacuum for those with wall to wall carpet.  However I am returning it and already purchased a DC41, which I am totally smitten with!

thought my carpets were clean, just vacuumed two days ago when my new Dyson arrived - well, my husband went through the same carpets and kept saying 'this is deadly'. We recommend the Dyson without reservation!!We choose the DC33.

OMG I LOVE THE VERSATILITY of this cleaner!!! It seemlessly switches from bare floor to carpet it's light, love the long chord. I LOVE that you dont have to touch the dirty canister to empty it. it's amazing.

column7: DC33 great for hardwoods, tile and area rugs
column8: I hardly ever write reviews but will not purchase anything greater than $100 without looking at reviews, mostly on Amazon.  I'm writing this as the DC33 didn't have a lot of reviews for my type of usage.  I also wanted to state that I had a grinding noise that wasn't referenced a lot in the Amazon reviews but was prevalent when I searched for this issue.First, I am thoroughly enjoying my DC33.  It's exactly what I needed for my house that has mostly solid surface flooring.  Living in California, we attract dust balls and no matter how often you clean, you will find dust balls throughout your house.  Also, I don't have pets but a wife with very long hair that somehow seems to find its way on the floors of our house.  Lastly, the DC33 replaced an Electrolux battery powered vacuum stick that worked well for over three years but did lose suction power that we hardly ever used it.The DC33 has picked up a lot of dust even though we cannot see the dust.  It's easy to use and I personally don't mind having to plug it in so that I get the most suction power possible.  I agree that the one issue is the attachments but could not understand what people were writing about in their reviews.  Let me try and see if I can explain it.  The attachment tool is a bit clumsy as when you use it, it pulls the vacuum with it.  Picture trying to vacuum your couch and when you stretch the tool, you feel the vacuum come with it.  Not sure how I'd fix it but just wanted people to understand the issue.  The good news is that I used the DC33 to vacuum my couch and it worked like a charm.  I didn't even think about this as an option when purchasing the DC33 so I'm pleasantly surprised.So far, I've used the DC33 about six times and can't complain except for one issue:  the grinding noise.  When I first turned it on and was vacuuming an area rug, the DC33 let out a loud grinding noise; I thought I broke it.  I kept vacuuming and the noise would occasionally occur but only when I was vacuuming the area rugs.  I found out that for low-ply carpeting, the suction power is too strong and is actually sucking up the rug causing the noise.  I called customer service and by taking out a rubber strip from the beater bar (bottom of the vacuum for those like me that didn't know what this was) and the noise has mostly gone away.  I have had the noise once or twice but I also know it's not destroying the DC33 so I'm OK.Overall, I gave it a four star rating due to the clumsy attachment situation.  Don't get me wrong, the attachments are so much better than my older vacuums as the suction power is very strong, it's just clumsy.

So far I have very little negative to say about this vacuum. It is far better than the others I have purchased. It has great suction and works well on my carpet and solid floors. I love how all the tools store on board and they click in so there is no falling off. My only complaints are it is a bit awkward doing stairs with the way the hose comes out and it does not do well on my area rugs! I do not regret purchasing it and would buy it again. I did get it at a great price after Thanksgiving!

column7: One Year Later and I Still Love It
column8: I purposely waited to write this review.  I've bought several vacuums and noticed that I always LOVE them the first few uses but ultimately they always end up a disappointment.  I'm very pleased to report that the Dyson DC33 bucked the system and is still as good one year later as it was the day I took it out of the box!I agonized over this purchase, reading every review, searching the holiday sales and even wondering which Dyson model to get (if you're reading this then I'm sure you're doing the same thing!).  I can honestly say that I don't have any regrets about this decision.  So, here are my favorite things about this Dyson and some other observations after a lot of use.First the setting:  Split level home with 75% carpet a very light off-white color, as well as some hardwood floors, tile and area rugs.  I actually bought this vacuum the day after new carpet was put in.  We also have a large dog.  She's short-haired but she definitely sheds daily (she's a Greater Swiss Mountain Dog). No kids.Why I like it:Excellent at removing dog hair, even from the very short-pile area rugs that can be tough to remove fine dog hair from.  I find that I need to make sure I make a slow pass over the rug, but as long as I don't do a quick back and forth, then all the debris and hair is picked up.Easy to move and easy to carry.  If I recall, it's weight is on par with other vacuums, however the shape and style of this one seems to make it easier to carry around the house.  It also moves smoothly and easily across all surfaces.Easy to empty.  This is my third bagless style vacuum and this one is by far the easiest and cleanest to empty. In the rooms that are off limits to our dog I can easily vacuum a few times and not empty the canister.  In the rooms with dog hair, I definitely need to empty after each room.  (so at least I know it's really working!)Hose and On-board attachments:  From what I remember of the reviews, this gets mixed reviews.  It's true that the stiffness of the hose and the angle of the handle can be a little cumbersome.  It's something you adjust to.  But despite what it looks like or how it feels, I can definitively say that the hose and attachments work well and have no problems picking up debris.  It seems like the bent angle of the hose would prevent suction or pick-up, but it doesn't.  I prefer using the hose and attachments on the stairs rather than holding up the vacuum because the coverage is better (and don't forget that the main vacuum doesn't have suction if the arm is upright, that engages the hose instead so that's part of the issue with getting the right angle on the stairs)One trick that's helped me with the hose is to stretch it out and then hold part of it to keep it extended.  To me making the adjustment is well worth it to have the vacuum be more compact and everything in one place.Still working one year later.  I know I'm harping on that point, but since they sell this based on 'won't lose suction' I have to vouch for the fact that it's true!  This vacuum is used multiple times a week in a dry climate with dust, dog hair, etc.  The maintenance on the filters is easy and only has to be done every few months.  And the design seems to really make a difference.One other observation:I remember reading comments about the design, the 'flimsy' or 'cheap' plastic materials, etc. And when I took this out of the box, I had some of the same concerns.  But I reminded myself that this whole thing was engineered by a guy known to be a bit of a perfectionist.  I've known a few engineers myself -- they rarely do something without a plan or reason and they really don't like to be wrong.  So, I took a leap of faith and decided to defer judgment until I had used the vacuum awhile.  After using, maintaining, cleaning and carrying this vacuum, I can see the 'why' in a lot of the pieces and design.  So when you wonder how that little plastic lever can really hold the full weight of the vacuum when you carry it - trust me, it just does.  Or when you wonder why there's a button that opens the vacuum tube into the canister rather than a solid piece, they had a reason (it's so you can open it up and get an object like say a pen that you accidentally sucked up with the wand!)After years of having vacuums that didn't work well and left you wondering why you even bothered, it's nice to own one that leaves you with a sense of accomplishment every time you use it.

Nothing beats Dyson, just the fact that you can completely disassemble it and clean it put it back together and it still works makes it better than any other vacuum out there. I have a DC14, use a DC17 Animal at work, my mother in law as a DC17, and I purchased this one for my mother. Yes there maybe vacuums out there with more suction but they don't take a beating dyson can.Pro - easy to cleanPro - lightweightCon - looks like they cheaped out on the reach wand on this model it's plastic not metal

This vacuum is light weight, fairly quiet and easy to maneuver. The canister that contains the dirt is very easy to empty and isn't messy. It works great on most surfaces.  The only exception is a thick shag area rug. It is unable to clean this without getting stuck instantly. The other drawback is edge cleaning.  It doesn't do well where the floor meets the wall, ie. baseboards. Overall, it is quick and easy to use.  I'd recommend it.

I have always wanted a dyson every since I compared its power to a competitor vacuum. We vacuumed the same room first with the competitor, emptied the bag on a white piece of paper, then we went into the same room with the dyson, emptied the contaner on another white piece of paper to compare and it pulled up twice the amount of the other vacuum. That sold me to the product. I've used it numerous times already and it works great.
I don't normally rave about vacuumes but this one is great.  Very good for dog hair and good for dust.No problems or issues to report at all.  It is expensive but is worth the money!

My husband bought this for me for Christmas 2010.  I had just vacuumed with our old vacuum and went over it again with the Dyson.  It picked up so much missed dirt.  The suction pulled up the wall to wall carpet.  We have four pets (and a puppy that visits often) so we have to vacuum regularly.  This picks up dirt off hardwood floors and deep down dirt in carpet.  It does really well on pet fur as well.  It's really easy to remove the wand and get into crevasses.  One in awhile the base of the vacuum will fall over when using the wand, but not an inconvenience for me.  The tank fills up fast and I have to empty it often.  Wish the capacity was a little bigger.  I would recommend the Dyson DC33 to anyone.  It's well worth the money.

Bought this vacuum on black friday and am very happy with its performance.  Seems to pick up everything and is much quieter that my hoover vacuum.  Purchased this Dyson model because of the long extension hose and attachment wand.  Happy with performance thus far.

I bought the Dyson DC33 on black Friday.  I couldn't be happier.  My house has never been cleaner!  My husband and I fight to see who gets to vacuum.  My carpets and floors have never looked better.  I am shocked that people actually rated it 1 and 2 stars.  I honestly do not believe the people that say it didn't clean their carpet.  Maybe they had a defective vacuum but I promise, ours is amazing.  We have a dog so I vacuum about 3x per week.  Even with my vacuuming routinely the Dyson still finds a ridiculous amount of dirt to pick up every time.  I read some person was upset that they had to wrap up the cord....what they didn't mention is that the cord is extra long.  Once you plug it in, you don't have to keep changing the outlet.  It is a little big in the front and will not fit under your cabinets in the kitchen/bathroom/etc.  However, the attachments are very easy to use and it really isn't that bad to have to use the attachment -it is better than having to use two vacuums (carpet/hardwood).  I can literally see the dirt/hair being sucked into the vacuum as I turn it on, I am not sure why people say that it doesn't pick up dirt.  If the cup gets full it will stop picking up, but once you dump it goes back sucking up everything!  I actually carry a plastic bag with me as a vacuum and keep dumping the cup.  It makes for a quicker vacuuming session when you don't have to keep walking back to the trash can.  The best part is I can vacuum my stairs so easily!  The vacuum stays on the bottom floor and the attachment can reach all the way up an entire flight of stairs.  I had to make a complaint, it would be that the cup is kind of small and if you are going to vacuum, you will need to dump at least 2-3 times.This vacuum has made my house so much cleaner and less dusty!  Thank you Dyson!

I love my Dyson vacuum.  I never believed the hype surrounding Dyson and always thought this product was too expensive. Amazon offered this vacuum at a very low price. The vacuum came by free shipping in 2 days. It was amazing how well it worked. The vacuum removed so much dirt from my newly cleaned carpet that I was shocked.  The suction is very strong. It is easy to operate and not heavy. I have not used the tools yet.  I am so happy with this product.  Amazon is great to offer this at this price. I would recommend this product for everyone.  Thank you Amazon.  I am very happy.

I've never had a Dyson before.  My last two vacuums were a Eureka and a Hoover.  There is no comparison.  This vacuum by far is soooo much better than the rest.  It has great suction power! And I was able to get it at good price compared to Walmart, Home Depot, etc... I don't regret my purchase at all. One note: read the instructions on emptying the canister.  I didn't and accidently pressed the eject button without a bag under it and the whole canister of dirt fell on my newly vacuumed carpet.

I purchased the dysonon for my daughter in Maui, Hawaii.  It is the fourth dyson I have bought.  The first one for myself over 10 years ago, then my son (3 Christmas's ago) and then my oldest daughter, 2 years ago.  It is a great and durable vacuum.  Doesn't lose suction, just like the ad says.  The only problem I had with the order was the delivery.  The box that the vacuum came in was very damaged.  They could not even tell that it was giftwrapped, which I paid for. They opened the box and fortunately the vacuum was not damaged.  But it was a close call.  For such an expensive product I would have thought the packaging would have been better.

column7: You'll never look at your carpets the same way again
column8: I didn't realize my carpets were so dirty!  Every time I use it I pull up dust and hair galore, and I vacuum regularly.  I have 2 dogs and a cat, and this vacuum works great for my purposes.  It doesn't leave stuff behind, works great on carpet and hardwoods, the hose is super long and works well on my stairs.  Overall I really love this vacuum.  I didn't give it a 5 out of 5 because I find the hose a little annoying to work with.  It's very tight, which makes it coil up effortlessly when I'm done vacuuming, but during use I usually have to wrestle with it a little.Things I've used my dyson for that worked well:Plush carpet, burber carpet, outdoor/cheapy carpet, hardwood, tile, concrete, baseboards, blinds, window sills, car, spider webs, stink bugs, and cat litter.Oh and it doesn't have a smell when I run it.  For example, with my old vacuum after christmas it would smell like pine needles forever, or less nostalgic: like dog because I have dogs.  Not true with the dyson, though this may be common for all bagless vacuums.

I have been 'borrowing' my cousins Dyson for years.  He finally got sick of me 'hoggin up' the Dyson so he gave me his old hunk of junk, Bissel or something.  Being an OCD clean freak this just didn't work for me...so I finally got a Dyson of my own.I love this thing!  Yes, the wand is a bit odd, but I am used to it since I used the cuz's machine for so long.  And this thing sucks like anything!  I have 2 maine coon cats and I was vacuuming 3-4 times a week to keep up with their shedding, now with a Dyson I only need to vacuum once a week, but I still vacuum at least twice a week, it's the OCD in me!If you're looking for a vacuum that actually vacuums, then invest in a Dyson, it's well worth it, especially if you have pets, it's great!

I knew I wanted a Dyson (good marketing?) and read every review posted here on the DC33 so I felt pretty good about this purchase.  It just came today and I couldn't wait to try it out.  WELL....I can't tell you how I felt after seeing and dumping out all the dirt and dust (and cat hair) that emptied right into the garbage. YUCK!  I couldn't be happier with my purchase!  I totally recommend!

column7: Do NOT buy if you have rugs or plan to use any attachments.
column8: The vacuum does not work on rugs. I repeat...The vacuum does not work on rugs. It makes an extremely loud grinding sound as stated by other readers that will wake your neighbors. I called Dyson to ask for solutions and their fix is to remove a seal from the underside of the vacuum that lessens the suction. I can now vacuum rugs with the ear deafening clacking sound present only 50% of the time. My sacrifice for this non-solution? Just some of the famous Dyson suction that draws consumers to this vacuum in the first place.No one should complain about the suction power of this vacuum. It is extremely impressive. Where Dyson went wrong was that they took their ground breaking suction technology and didn't bother to make it practical for use in a vacuum. Picture scientists patting each other on the back with stogies in their hands congratulating each other and deciding to make a vacuum out of their discovery on a drunken dare. That's what you have here. The vacuum creates so much suction that it isn't able to pick up anything larger than a grain of rice because it is suctioned to the ground so completely. The impressive suction power also keeps the attachment hose from fully extending so you are constantly attacked by the rolling canister as you attempt to vacuum up said grains of rice. This vacuum is not useful for house cleaning by any means.My biggest regret is giving away our 10 year old vacuum to my friend before trying out the Dyson. I have toyed with the idea of trading the Dyson back for my old vacuum. I ultimately decided that I liked my friend too much and it would be too cruel an act.PS. Do plan on spending well over $100 extra dollars on attachments if you do have rugs. Cue laughing and drunken scientists.

Picked it up at Walmart $399.00 11/20/2011.  If you go to Sam's club it's $30.00 cheaper.  Brought it home unpacked it and found that putting it together is slightly tricky as the wand stuff is really a part of the upright handle.  Snapping it into place took me a few minutes to figure out how to do it.Now the cool part, the carpet had just been vacuumed the night before.  Was a bit surprized to see the amount of Dog Hair it picked up.  In fact real surprised.  Had to empty container three times.  So I would say it passed the muster for Picking up dog hair (that wasn't visible until it was in container).Additionally, it picked up a lot of really fine dust particles.  I'm not sure but I don't know if beater bar is really fast or powerful as the main selling point is the suction.  It does a very good job of that.  As others have stated the extra long wand handle stored in the upright handle of the cleaner is a bit clumsy but nice for ceilings.Also, It is the quietest vacuum I've heard.  Nice...Read the manual, turns out that the motor turns 98,000RPM.  Yes that's the claim.  It's electronically controlled via a chip.  So the motor itself is new technology and 'is 5 times faster than any other conventional vacuum motor'.  The cyclonic action was 'borrowed' from industrial funnel type dust collectors from a wood shop.  Still can't figure out how the dust isn't sprayed across the room, as it just sits in the bottom of the clear container with NO FILTER.  That part is a stumper to me.I believe the new motor design is why it's much quiter... This summer I saw a Dyson fan at Best Buy.  No viewable turning fan blades but tons of air.  It has to be using the same motor design.  Totally cool.

column7: James Dyson is your stained concrete hero
column8: This vacuum is the only one I've ever owned that works for our house. It's 100% stained concrete with throw rugs. With other vacuums, I could only cover the rugs. Then to do the solid surface, it was anything from a dust buster to Swiffer to a broom. Nothing was fast or simple.This one goes seamlessly from surface to surface. The attachments and functions all work with perfect engineering.You'll never have to touch a grimy bag again.Just watch your dirty house spin around in the bin - then press a button and let it fall in the trash.I am almost ready to say that I enjoy vacuuming. Seriously.

I took it out of the box, set it up according to the instructions, and the unit kept making a terrible grinding noise when used on the carpet setting.  I had a long call with Dyson support, and nothing they tried worked.  So, defective out of the box, and I'm returning the unit.  My first encounter with the Dyson brand was a big disappointment.

well let me start of by saying, I was one of those people that went and bought a new vacuum every year at the store and it would go bad, even when cleaning the filters and put new belts on it and took care of my vacuums, they were mostly Bissel Vacuums, but they just always broke down after the warranty expired, so they got my money, so me and my GF saved money and bought this Dyson, I have to say this is the best vacuum we have ever bought, it's not loud but it vacuums so much dirt from deep in the carpet that the other vacuums miss, but get this Dyson, it's better then the ball dysons.

column7: Roller brush gets stuck on low pile carpet
column8: We needed a new vacuuming cleaner and figured we would not mess around and would just go with the best (Dyson). We were very disappointed when vacuuming area rugs. The roller brush gets stuck. The vacuum works fine on regular carpet, but for almost $400 this vacuum should not have done this. After reading several other reviews on other sites I noticed this was a common problem. Some people it seems to not bother, but to me it did just because of the cost. We returned this vacuum the very next day. I will never buy another Dyson, you do not always get what you pay for.

I received the Dyson DC33 in a very timely manner.  I was surprised at how easy it was to put together.  I didn't even need the directions.  The suction is amazing and I love the length of the cord.  I have a combination of carpet, tile and wood floors in my house and I have never had a vacuum cleaner that goes from 1 type of flooring to another with the ease that this one does. I feel that this product is well worth the money.

column7: Good power but doesn't work on carpet
column8: I thought we found the perfect vacuum cleaner but about 1 minute into the first use the vacuum started making a horrible grinding sound. It sounded like we vacuumed up one of the kids toy's. After looking at the brushes and checking all of the filters nothing was found. Testing it on the hardwood floor it seemed fine, but every time we tried it on our medium length carpet it would make a grinding noise.It seems to have good power and seemed to be picking up a lot of dirt and pet hair but it just does not work on carpet. Comments on the Dyson website recommended turning the brush off when vacuuming carpet. We tried that and the vacuum did not pick up any dirt.I would be very leery about buying this vacuum if you have any carpet. If you do try it be ready for a big disappointment and make sure the store that you purchase it has a good return policy.

Of vacuum cleaners we have had,in marriage quite a few.Steam cleaners, uprights, canisters,we've had both old and newOur first was not electric,Just a roller in a box.I'm not sure what happened to it,Perhaps it just got lost?The Rainbow had good suction, butWas hard to put together.Eureka lasted quite awhile,But broke from too much pressure.Steam cleaners bustedbit by bit.I learned don't put dishsoap in it.Now here to join our family,3 kids, two dogs, one cat, you see.to clean up hair and mud and fleas,a brand new Dyson thirty three.It cleans up every type of floor,a high-reach wand for every chore.No bags, no dust, or so they say,But how long till this too decays?

I recently purchased a DC25 which went back.  Lots of reasons why (read my review) but suffice to say it just didn't met our needs; so I bought the DC33.First the downside.  If you have a deep pile carpet-this is NOT the machine for you.  As an average guy (yes ladies I do the vacuuming) I was surprised how difficult this is to push on deep pile.  This isn't some 2' 70's shag, but it actually makes cleaning this room a chore.As you may read on a lot of sites-with the angle of the head you won't be cleaning under many pieces of furniture.Third, as the owner of 4 dogs, 5 cats and an African Gray Parrot-I not only need to keep a clean house but I know what picks up hair.  Don't be misled-if you have animals you will be sticking your fingers in the canister to clean it out.  Fur gets caught not only in the grate inside the canister but along this 'ring' around the bottom of where the grate ends.  Hard to clean-no....but you will be cleaning it.Some people complain this has too much power and sucks up area rugs.  I experienced the same thing (and the really loud noise) but when initially lowering the head to vacuum.  I found the key was tilt the cleaner back first, then lower the head.  The machine has enough power and the brushes engage fast enough my foot was sometimes on the head too long (like half a second) and the brushes catch.Don't be fooled.  The Dyson works well-but its not magic.  Areas where our cats leave the litter box obviously have a lot of litter in the carpet.  The Dyson does pick all of it up-but its not one pass...or two...or even four.  Granted, our old machine never seemed to get all of it.Now the good news.  Its cheaper than the 25, has a longer cord, more power and bigger canister.  The very first thing I noticed when I turned it on was how quiet it ran; you can hear the T.V or actually hold a conversation.The stair cleaning tool (the hose minus the wand) works REALLY well.  Honestly, our stairs have never looked better.Its light and doesn't seem to leave vacuum 'marks' on our carpet.Some people mention its pricey-we got our during a Kohls 30% off sale with Kohls's cash as a bonus so our net price was around $270.  Expensive for a vacuum but a 5 year warranty means Dyson stands behind the machine.Would I buy it again...yep

For the price and the TV ads, you would think this was a great vacume, wrong.  Very cheap made.  You use the handle for the wand, which pulls off the vacume, only problem is it pulls off every time you try to use as a vacume.  Also, to put the head of the vacume down you have to push it down with your foot, no release lever,  I will stay with the $80 Bissell.

We purchased the Dyson DC33 and it is wonderful!  Like everyone says, it makes vacuuming fun again!  It is amazing that you can vacuum with your old machine, and then vacuum with the Dyson and the amount of stuff it pulls out of your carpets is amazing!  Highly recommend this product.

column7: The BEST Vacuum Period!  -  Mom's, Pet Owners, & Allergy Sufferer's This Is For YOU!
column8: Let me first start of by saying that I have loved many products I have purchased from Amazon but have never written a review on them but cannot pass this one up.  Yesterday I was vacuuming with an old Kenmore lug around that has been with me for about 15 years and it finally gave up and stopped working.  So I went to a local retailer (because I had a coupon) and purchased the Dyson DC33 Multi-Floor Vacuum.This vacuum is amazing, and I will never purchase any other vacuum ever!  Oh, and just another pointer before I begin, this vacuum is one of the most powerful invented by Dyson as far as air wattage (suction) is concerned, it has a 240 air watt rating, most of the Dyson balls and Animal machines are in the 165 to 220 range.  So about the machine, it is built very well and extremely durable.  The suction power is CRAZY!!!  Some background about my apartment, we have two medium hair cats (a sokoke forest cat and a russian blue) and a dog (pit-bull terrier mix).  All three shed religiously, but the majority of the pet hair in the apartment comes from the dog.  There is carpet in the bedroom and wood floors in the living room, dinging room, kitchen, laundry room, and bathrooms.  I was able to vacuum my bedroom with the old vacuum before it died.  I wanted to do the 'Dyson Test' and vacuum my bedroom again and see what the old vacuum left behind.  I about gagged when I looked at the bin.  There was dust, cat hair, and carpet freshening powder (almost a full inch all the way around the bin).  My carpet in my bedroom has NO smell at all anymore, the air in the bedroom is noticeably cleaner, and the carpet is fluffy and spongey again.  The machine is incredibly easy to maneuver and here is one of the best features, you do NOT have to move cords laying around or by baseboards, the vacuum simply pushes them upward out of it's way to clean what is under them and then puts them back so to speak.  Awesome design!After the bedroom I cleaned the entire apartment with the vacuum and WOW!  This machine does incredibly well on hardwood floors as well!  It has my floors completely spotless which has never happened since moving in due to the pet hair.  There is no dog or cat hair anywhere, and again the air is noticeably cleaner and easier to breath.  OH, an important point for those with allergies or asthma, this vacuum is allergy and asthma certified, it does not indicate this on the Dyson website when using the search for your perfect vacuum feature, but it is says so on the machine and the box.Also for those of you who wear contact lenses...  I told my mother about his vacuum and she said they are nice but does not want to use one because she doesn't want dust in her contact lenses when she empties the bin.  Good news.. This vacuum does NOT make a cloud of dust so emptying is suitable for even the most sensitive of contact lense wearer's.  I wear glasses myself and have switched from contact lenses to glasses for eye health reasons.The attachments that come with the vacuum are a 'dusting' attachment and a 'hard to reach' attachment with bristles.  They are both very well built and work well, however I do think I will be purchasing the other tool sets as they offer more versatility.  About the hose/wand that so many people complain about...  It is a little difficult to use at first but does get better with some practice.  Many people complain saying it is impossible to use, that is most certainly NOT true it is usable but keep in mind that Dyson built the hose to retain DURABILITY so yes it is stiff but does loosen up after a coupe of uses and it most definitely reaches he ceilings.  I did notice a little neck and lower back discomfort from using the wand because I was using it to clean a vent on the ceiling but I think that is pretty much standard when cleaning something 9 feet above you with a hose...The wheels glide so easily on any surface and it is easy to change directions if you wish to do so, the cord is CRAZY long, could probably do the whole apartment without moving the cord.  The air that is expelled from the vacuum is clean, clean, clean!  NO ODOR AT ALL!  There are two HEPA filters that have a lifetime guarantee and have to be washed every three months minimum (ONLY cold water and NO cleaners, soaps, or scrubbing and wait 24 hours before using the vacuum after cleaning so the HEPA filter's may properly dry).As for mom's,  please stop lugging around that old vacuum that picks up 1/10 of the dirt on your floor, and puts out dirty air with who knows what in it.  You deserve much more than that, after all you are mom's!  You do so much work around the house, from cooking to cleaning to homework, etc, you don't have time to use an old vacuum that you have to vacuum the same spot over and over again.  Plus if you have children, especially babies and toddlers, you'll feel a lot better about letting them crawl on the carpet or floors once you know that they are actually clean.The vacuum is lightweight and easy to store, so those with mild arthritis or other discomfort should not have any problems using this wonderful machine.Oh, one last thing...  before using my Dyson vacuum my apartment took on the familiar but not so pleasant 'Oh you have pets, a dog and two cats.  Hmmm...'  even though I cleaned the house weekly, with one thorough vacuum the smells are gone, and I mean GONE!

I have been using the Dyson DC33 for several months now.  Sorry, I did not get from Amazon, but I want all to know that I do like the machine.  Suction is good on what littlecarpet I have.  I do have a problem with trying to dust with it.  Attachments fit into the hose and the hose just does not feel comfortable to use.  It will extend, but you have to hold it after extending or else it goes back to the tight hose again.  I don't like the fact that there are not wands to attach to the hose so you can attach the floor nozzelto it.  I have bare floors and this would really be a big help.  I use to use a Hoover Windtunnel with a long extra hose and wands.  The suction was not as good as the Dyson, but at least I could get under furniture and dust furniture.  I believe I will have to buy another cannister vac to do what I use to do with my Windtunnel.  Once we get carpet, theDyson will work for us much better, because of the great suction.  Right now, I am not really a happy camper.
I've wanted a Dyson for years but waited until my old vacuum finally died. I love this vacuum!!!! I can't believe the power it has...I'm super impressed!

Overall, I am pleased with my purchase of the Dyson DC33. It seems to really suck up the dirt from my carpets. My only real complaint is that you have to turn off the vacuum, switch it to another setting, then turn it back on to proceed vacuuming. Basically, you can't go from vacuuming your carpet to vacuuming your woods floors. It makes a horrible noise if you try to switch it before turning it off. Also, the hose extension for hard to reach places doesn't stretch that great. But it's not heavy and it gets the job done. I'm sure I'll get used to the 'switching on an off part' and maybe over time the hose will be easier to use.

The old saying 'seeing is believing'.  The Dyson vacuum we purchased is just that and more. I have never seen a vacuum that is so durable and so powerful. It does what the advertisement says it will do.  Try it and you will more than like it.

Updating this review... I still love this vacuum EXCEPT for one of our rugs. For whatever reason, the vacuum made a horrible grating noise whenever we vacuumed that particular rug - and it got worse as time went by, to the point of being intolerable. We have three different types of rugs in our house, and only one caused this problem. We finally replaced it with the much-smaller Dyson Animal DC35 - which works for our 1430 square foot house which now has hardwood floors and area rugs (we pulled up all of our carpet since buying the DC33), and doesn't make that horrible noise.This is the first Dyson I've owned, and definitely the most expensive vacuum thus far. Taking that into account, I really like it so far! It's much larger than the Eureka I owned before, but surprisingly doesn't weigh any more. It might even weigh a little less! Most importantly, it works really well! Our rugs look nicer and feel softer after using this vacuum. I like the long cord, and I LOVE how easy it is to empty the canister - just hold it over the trash can and press a button! I HAVE experienced the horrible noise it makes if you run over the edge of a rug and it starts to suck it up, so that is one thing to be careful of! It's also very large, but worth the superior vacuuming.The wand has a LONG piece of plastic at the end that doesn't bend. This is good for vacuuming clear under couches and beds, but can make it a bit unwieldy.

I purchased this vacuum cleaner expecting it to do a great job on my carpets.  It was great for the first couple of months, and then I found that I had to go over and over the same area to get it clean.  Repeatedly, I cleaned out the filter and searched for anything that may have clogged the unit.  After about 6 months, I realized that this unit was worthless.Finally, I gave up and bought a little Shark unit for about $125.  About 8 months later, the Shark is still doing a terrific job, even with the dog hair.

We bought this vacuum to replace a Bissell that we've had for three months. We spent $99 on the Bissell, hated it, and decided to spend more in hopes of greater quality. Admittedly being a little smitten by Dyson's marketing, we thought the Dyson 33 would be the end-all/be-all of vacuums. It was easy to put together, is easy to maneuver, has exceptional cord reach, and the wand/hose extension make it very easy to access hard-to-reach places. However, I found the suction power to be meager at best. For the price of this vacuum, I expected far more.We have saltillo tile floors with a few low-pile area rugs, and it took multiple attempts to get this vacuum to pick up the smallest of particles (dust bunnies, flecks of lint, small dried leaves from the houseplant). The hose attachment (despite its length) is virtually worthless because the suction power is so poor. We had to swipe one area of dust bunnies in the corner about 5 times before it grabbed anything. We even stopped to check all the fittings, re-read directions and be sure we put this together properly. It just has really poor suction. Also, the front of the vacuum (around the beater brush) rides so close to the floor that it acts like a bulldozer pushing dust/dirt forward rather than actually sucking it in. I find that to be a huge design flaw.Perhaps this is a 'low-end' model for Dyson, but it is certainly a mismatch on price for the actual performance you receive.
I can't believe I ever spent money on anything else. This is the way to go. Just when u think ur floors are clean, try this vac and u will be amazed. I LOVE my DYSON!!!!!!!
Like the tools better than my earlier Dyson. I must say it sucks.  Itz supposed to!!!  I would buy another JUST like it, just soze I had a spare!

My husband purchased this for me after the handle on my old Dyson broke.  I asked him to get me a Hoover Wind Tunnel because it is so much cheaper, even though I loved my old Dyson.  I have to say I do love this one, too.  It is similar to my old Dyson.  The features I love are how wonderfully it cleans and suctions, how the long wand extends, and how easy it is to empty the cannister.I have read other reviews about how carpet can get 'sucked up' into the machine and can make that awful grinding noise.  I have several oriental rugs and some wall to wall carpet.  I have experienced this, but only if I accidentally run the vacuum over the carpet fringe or over those small kick rugs (like my bathroom rug).  I have learned from my old Dyson to clean these with the attachments as the suction is just too powerful for them (which is great!)I have also read this vacuum is heavy.  It is lighter than my old Dyson so I don't feel like it is heavy at all!I don't have issues with the wand being so rigid - I find it useful for cleaning ceiling cob webs.  It is annoying if you are trying to use it clean out your car, so I use a shop vac for that.  (I know - not everyone has that option).Minor annoyances are:- High Profile - It can't reach under my kitchen counters due to it's high profile.  I'd prefer not to have to get out the wand just to do the baseboards.- Cord Wrap - I find it annoying to have to unravel entire cord every time I use the vacuum.- Beater Bar - Like my old Dyson, you have to cut the hair off the beater bar while it is turned upside down.  Seems like there should be an easier way.Major annoyance: - I do have issue with the rigid plastic pieces that hold this vacuum together.  My old Dyson's handle broke and could not be replaced.  I fear that the same thing or something similar will occur with this one.  The cost savings of not having to replace your bags does not occur if you have to buy a new vacuum every 5 years.

I decided that a Dyson was the way to go after taking a facebook poll of all of my friends choice of vacuums. I tried to decipher between all the different models of Dyson. I finally decided that the DC33 would probably suit our family of 5 plus a shih-tzu just fine. I have NOT been disappointed with my choice at all! I am still absolutely amazed every time I vacuum the house! I love the fact that it has a long cord. I do have to unplug it once and move it...but with a 1900 sq foot house that would be expected! I love how easy it is to empty...with just a push of a button it is emptied directly into the garbage (I do choose to empty it in the outside garbage can because of the dust). It switches from hard floor surfaces to carpet easy and works great on both surfaces! The pull out wand is easy to use and stretches from the bottom of the stairwell to the top step with no problems. I know some people have complained about the vacuum falling backwards when the hose is outstretched but I have not had that experience. I tend to vacuum the house 1-2 times a week, we do not eat outside the kitchen, do not wear our shoes in the house, and our dog is not the shedding breed of dog, so overall I think that we are a pretty clean family until I vacuum...absolutely amazing how much dirt is there! I have been very happy with this purchase!

Now in my mind & like every other regular joe shmoe who works a regular 9-5 with an average pay would look at this price & say 'THATS REDICULOUS', but lemme tell you, this right here has gots to be the most best thing I've ever spent money on. The first day I got it I immediately put it all together (mind you I read a few reviews of how people say that it was very difficult to put together but to me it didn't take a genius) & just started vacuuming...I mean when I tell you this puppy sucked up stuff I never even thought existed in my carpet just made me cringe & not that I'm a dirty person or anything like that. I just had a tiny little apartment sized vacuum before hand that was fairly good but damn sure not good enough compared to this power horse. I also used the hose attachment for my ceiling fans, woodworks & corners & wow!!! Definitely worth every single penny & so much so I even convinced my brother to get one as well!!!
We are thrilled with this vacuum. It has great suction. Actually lifts up the carpet. Easy to use and clean.  Highly recommend and it is a good value too.

We needed to replace a four-year-old Dyson (which we had been quite rough on) and tried the ball model at a local store. It felt really flimsy and I was worried that the company had begun skimping on their products. But I couldn't find another worthy alternative for the price, and purchased this one since it most resembled the previous one we owned. This vacuum is amazing! It is built like a tank, and handles much like our other one (maybe a bit more bulky, and the telescoping wand takes a bit of getting used to). It functions great (I use baking soda/borax on our carpets and the vacuum picks it all up, all of the time). Can't do small floor carpets anymore (suction way too strong) but that is part of the appeal. When I need to vacuum something I will be close to (chair cushions, for example) I simply remove the whole wand and put an attachment directly on the hose. Works great and it is easy to dump the canister and clean the filter. I also like vacuum up a cotton ball doused with a couple drops of an essential oil (lavender is my favorite) while I vacuum the house--the vacuum will then leave the whole house smelling wonderful, too.

I had concerns buying this vacuum over the Internet, but it has been great, it arrived in it's original packaging from dyson.  The vacuum sucks up everything in sight! I have never had a vacuum that does so well.  I am able to vacuum my entire hiuse with this vacuum; It works  well on my carpets, kitchen rugs, bathroom tile, and kitchen hard wood floor.
Outstanding product.  Does exactly what it says.  Picks up all the dog hair that all other machines failed to do.  Easy to work with and super easy to clean out.

column7: I'm keeping my old Dyson DC17!
column8: I purchased my old Dyson the first year it came out and have loved using it for years - the BEST vacuum I have ever owned.  Because it's starting to show its age after years of heavy use, I've been thinking about purchasing a new one for several months.  When Dyson announced a sale on selected uprights, I decided to go for it and purchased the DC33 at Target.  (I did not purchase at Amazon because 1) I wanted the vacuum immediately and 2) I figured it would be easier to return a vacuum to my nearby Target than send back to Amazon if I changed my mind.)
