The pick up suction is wonderful!!!  Using wand is a little tricky though.  Not as tricky as doing this review!!!!

I bought this for myself.  It does a wonderful job at picking up dog hair and dust.  It's quite amazing how much dirt was left in the carpet from my previous vacuum.  I can't think of any downfall to this model.
I waited quite a while for a Dyson vacuum cleaner to go on sale.  It is great!  Honestly, my carpet looked like new!  Very minor assembly was needed.

I purchased this vacuum for my wife about a year ago and I find myself enjoying doing the vacuuming! It was a bit pricey but worth every penny. For years, we always bought the vacuums that were on clearance and we would go through one or two a year. Each one would vacuum half the house then we would clean it out and let it cool down before continuing. With this Dyson, we can do the whole house in about 10 minutes. We live in an 1850 sq ft house and with the cord plugged into a central location, it reaches the entire house! I love this vacuum. Highly recommended!!

I though my old Kirby, though heavy, was doing the job of getting the pet hair up. When I got the Dyson, I did the whole house and was amazed at how many times I had to empty the canister. Its obviously a huge improvement. In addition, its really light and easy to use by comparision to the old vacuum. If you are waiting, don't.Great machine.

Caveat to potential buyers:First DC33 purchased from department store (not Amazon) was broken upon unpackaging and initial plug-in operation check.  The plastic brush roller had a finger-tip sized wedge/piece that had broken off on one side right next to where it mounts (the first indication was an immediate loud rattling/grinding sound when I first switched in on).  Returned that DC33 to the store and got a new one no problem.  Fast forward about half a year later, a sudden loud rattling/grinding sound again.  Quick check revealed substantial cracking in the plastic brush roller in the same area as the returned DC33.  The cracked plastic piece has not fully separated yet but complete failure is imminent.Dyson phone rep directed me to take the unit to a Dyson repair facility.  Keep you updated.IMO, poor choice of materials on Dyson's part.  Absolutely unacceptable for the $$$.
Great vacuum and it arrived quickly.  I have already used it and it is easy to use.  I would recommend it.
If you are a pet owner with carpets you need to get yourself a dyson... Don't waste your money on a ball/animal model since this one is far easier to maneuver (I've used both).

column7: not so gtrat for the cost
column8: Awkward to use the removeable handle attachment, it is too long, it gets in the way. It is quiet and has good suction.

I LOVE DYSON.  This is my first vacuum from Dyson and it is phenomenal.My previous vacuum is a Hoover and I thought it was great too.  But I was proven wrong when I had this home "Kirby" vacuum salesperson in my home showing me the Kirby vacuum versus my Hoover.  That was the straw that broke my back and made me start looking for a new vacuum.  I didn't want to look at Kirby's since their prices were so insane. Plus, they were heavy.I did some heavy research and I found this one.  I even did a comparison against the Kirby which technically I think it lost. However, I was looking at quality, price point and suction.  Dyson always advertised that they never lose suction.  That part is very true!  I have this shed happy Japanese Akita dog.  Feels like every 3-4 months she sheds and does it for 8 more months LOL.  I took a leap and bought the Dyson. Then I took my old Hoover and tested it out against this Dyson and I really did find that this Dyson worked extremely well.  I saw more suction and more dirt come out of my carpet then ever before.I think there are three small drawbacks that I have gotten used to: (1) The extension hose tool that they give you is extremely long.  I wish it was more adjustable in the length but it does help when it comes to my stairs. I have gotten used to this but I don't love it. (2) The waste can is kind of small.  I find myself going to toss the waste away 2x more often.  Again, this is just a little annoyance but I've gotten used to it. (3) It's a little harder to push on the carpet but I think that's because of all the suction it has to the floor.Other than that, this is a really good vacuum and I'm glad I upgraded to a Dyson. I would recommend this to anyone anyday.
It was a gift, but I love all my dysons, so I'm sure they'll love it as it was on their wedding list.

Love the Dyson, amazing what it picks up.  I gave it a 4 star rating because its a bit heavy; otherwise I would give it a 5 star.  The cord is long enough so I don't have to connect to each room and the extender is great for fans, ceilings and hard to reach areas.

I have several different complaints including:1.  This vacuum does not pickup dog hair.  If you have a dog or cat with long hair, the brush will clog up quicker than any vacuum on the market.  I used this vacuum for five minutes and 95% of the hair ended up wrapped around the brush, the remaining 5% went into the container and this process of clogging the brush up with hair caused all the dirt on my floor to stay on the floor.2. This vacuum is too powerful for area rugs.  It sucks the rug off the floor and causes the brush to stop and start clanking itself against the plastic insides. And you think I am kidding, the customer service at Dyson told me this was the case and I should return it for a less powerful model made for area rugs, perhaps the Dyson balls or DC24.3. The 'detachable' hose for vacuum is extremely clunky.  It is a long bar with a big hose attached and this happens to also be the handle you vacuum with on a rug.  Its not that it doesn't work, it is just not the ideal scenario.
This item is a christmass gift. hasn't been opened as of yet.either accept what I have written or not......I can't help any further.

column7: My wife enjoys to vacuum now
column8: My wife just said "i like vacuuming now." That warrants a 5-star review and this item has now become priceless.

This is the first Dyson I have ever owned. We have been living in our house for almost two years and in that time we have burned through three other vacuums. (A Dirt Devil, Hoover, and some other brand from Home Depot.) I bought this on sale on black friday, and it is seriously the best vacuum I have ever used. It has amazing suction power, the dirt canister is very easy to empty, and the cord is very long. I can plug my vacuum in one outlet and just about vacuum my entire downstairs. I read other reviews about this vacuum having a really stiff coil on the attachment, and while I do agree it was VERY stiff when we first used it, pulling it out a few times helped a lot and now that isn't an issue. I will update this review as i continue to use it.UPDATE: While this is still the best vacuum I have owned the coil is ridiculously stiff. No amount of stretching it fixed the issue. Whenever I use it the vacuum ends up falling over. It is very annoying. Still for the price I paid you can't beat it.
I am so pleased with my Dyson! It arrived on time. Works terrific and I feel I received a great deal.

column7: Get it for less at Costco
column8: As of the date of this review, Costco shows the listed price as $369.99 and gives a $90 discount for a total of $279.99.  The DC33 cleans very well.  I found the wand to be easy to use.  However, the red cap for the wand won't snap shut as it is suppose to do.  In my small bathroom the base of the vacuum cleaner was too wide to sweep between the toilet and shower and the toilet and the vanity.  However, the floor sweeping attachment is easy to use.  First, using the attachment, I sweep around the perimeter and areas where the sweeper won't go, then finish with the vacuum cleaner.  Things I don't like:  1) the base of the unit is too wide for my taste and makes it difficult to move around, 2) the vacuum is too heavy for me and makes it difficult to use, 3) it doesn't hold that much lint so you have to repeatedly empty the clear bin. I didn't like this sweeper at first.  It takes a bit to get use to and now I appreciate it as being a fine appliance.

I have owned this vacuum for over a year now and am still pleased with my purchase.  I have read several reviews about the vacuum losing power and suction and so far have not experienced this.  The vacuum is light and the body is mostly plastic however it is very durable and handles not only being run into a wall but passes the test of an eight year old boy operating the vacuum.  The attachments remove easily and work fantastic.  Emptying the canister is also a task that my eight year old son can easily accomplish.  I have not had to replace a single filter or component after a year of daily use.

I was really excited to find a Dyson Vacuum at such a good price with such a great reputation and 5 year warranty, I figured I couldn't go wrong. I really like it and it gets the job done, but I don't think it's AMAZING compared to the average vacuum.

the vacuum power is great but the attachments are close to impossible to use. the hose won't stretch because of the suction power, so it does me no good for reaching high places. I use my mini orek for that. Also, it is not real easy to figure out how to use the attachments.

column7: I'm a Tight Wad But Would Buy This Again
column8: We had a Eureka Boss for about 10 years which had several attachments broke but the main vacuum was fine. I bought it based on CR rating as the best at the time (Eureka Boss is still close to top today too) and I thought 10 years ago that $179 was not cheap when I could have gotten a $100 dirt devil but went with the ratings.My wife has been 'hinting' that we need a new vacuum for a couple of years which I kind of ignored as  A: the Boss worked fine still for carpet and B: We have 2 (big and small) shop vac's for the needed 'attachment' type cleaning.I would never in a million freakin years spend over $200 let alone $300 on a vacuum. I have known all about Dyson's for years and have heard all the raves. I attribute this to the likes of those those 'Apple Zombie' types. My wife's grandmother raves about by her Dyson yet I think she was just 'foolish' to waste that much money on a vacuum....or so I thought....So on Black Friday I am relaxing and playing with the kids (have never and will never go shopping on this day as it is rest and Christmas light day). I was checking my e-mail and got a 'Black Friday' e-mail from Sams Club. One of several 'featured items' was a DC33 for $249 plus free shipping. Now I have not been able to figure out what my wife wants for Christmas because she does not tell me (or as a man I just forget those hints over the year) so I thought bam! that was easy. I placed the order and told her (yea early surprise). She was shocked I did it knowing my 'cheapness' but very thankful....gosh we have been married too long where a vacuum brings joy.So it gets delivered and I try it out. We are in a brand new home as of April with hard wood floors in all living areas and brand new Armstrong Smart Strand carpet only in the bedrooms. We have a strict no shoe policy in the house, no animals, and my wife vaccums at least twice a week so the bedroom carpet is very clean...so I thought! We did one bedroom and I was 'SHOCKED' at how much crap the Dyson pulled out of the carpet that was just vacuumed the day before. I mean like half a canister of dirty, dusty, linty, crap!By the second room we had to empty the canister WOW! Not only did it pull nasty stuff out of my kids carpets but the carpet felt different...like brand new when it was installed 7 months ago...We have high quality Smart Strand but I had not realized how it lost its smooth and sheeny feel which the Dyson replaced.Next a high pile area rug bought from IKEA in July that was already getting matted down. These are made of Olefin so I assumed the matted was from the everyday vacuuming and the fibers slowly melting from heat friction. WOW the Dyson got a whole canister of crap from that rug and it is no longer matted.Bottom Line! BUY A DYSON!! I would pay full retail knowing what I know now if I had to do it all over again! That says a lot for me plus I don't often write reviews! Their COMMERCIAL is dead on..'If it says it works like a Dyson...it is not a Dyson! I actually thought that any vacuum is just as good and Dyson that was is all HYPE! The Eureka Boss is still a top rated contender for cleaning....uh um yea...look at the Dyson canister after the Boss does several runs and that is all I need to know!This company builds quality and it is clear! Plus it has great features and 'design' ideas that are very god and practical...like a 35 foot cord, like no hard snap to unlock the top and bottom half to cleaning(just gently push down with your foot and you are ready...now my kids can vacuum as they could not unlock the Boss) and so much more....love the hand tool LONG! hose with recoil and the fact it is in the handle...we can now reach 10 foot high spots like air vents that we had to 'lift' all three of our old vacuums up to....and someone actually complained about this feature..come on!As for the bad reviews.....people are morons! Yes it is hard to push but the light weight makes up for that (at least vs the Boss / beast the Dyson is much easier for us) I can see that a Dirt Devil / Orek type user would hate this as it does dig in and is hard to push BUT!!! the reason it is hard to push however is good? because it is actually doing its job....digging in and sucking the crap that the easy to push vacs leave!If you want a clean house and clean carpet BUY THIS! 5 Year Warranty Included vs 1 Year With Others..DONE! BUY IT!

this works just fine. I have no problem with the suction or cleaning power of the vacuum. However, if you need to push the vacuum over something the beater bar makes this God-awful sound.  I have many levels in my house, and even on the carpet setting I need to push the vacuum at times and the sound is just horrible. If I had it to do all over again, I'd get a different model, perhaps the ball version
We needed  a vacuum that would maintain its suction on carpet ant floors. This is easy to push across the carpet and gets so much more dirt and stuff up off the floors. Glad I bought this Dyson.

column7: Nice try Dyson, but back it goes...
column8: Always wanted a Dyson and finally made the plunge with Holiday pricing.  The first one I got broke immediately with a piece of the beater bar breaking off and gettign jammed in the intake.  After an exchange I fired up the new unit and ran it around the house.  First the positive: great suction on hardwood floors and the switch turning off the beater bar action is a great idea. That's about it. For the negative: what, for this price no auto-retract feature for the cord. Really? More importantly, as others have written, if you have any plush or shag rugs this is not a good vacuum - it gloms onto them, jams, and the beater bar starts whining and/or making rattling noises sounding like it's breaking into pieces. You cannot vacuum thick rugs easily at all. Lastly, the wand is hard to manage (I think due to the suction).  I'll be taking this back and getting a vacuum (for less $) with a height adjusting feature so I can raise it up for thicker rugs.

column7: Do not buy if you have area rugs!!!!
column8: I bought this vacuum looking for something with strong suction and was light weight. It is both if those and it worked great on my bare floors and regular carpet but when I went to vacuum my area rugs it made a very large grinding noise like something was stuck in it. There was nothing there. It has also made my new area rugs look kinda like shag carpet :(. This vacuum needs adjustable brush height. I paid almost $400.00 for this vacuum and I am sorry to say that it is going back. Sorry dyson but this vacuum does not standup to the dyson name.

column7: Great if all you want is a Coffee Grinder! DO NOT BUY!
column8: The Dyson DC33 is one Dyson to RUN FROM!We bought one, & right out of the box, the DC33 made LOUD grinding noises EVERY time we attempted to use it on a carpet.I called Dyson & was told that this was 'normal' & that the grinding was because something must have been blocking the brushes.They further explained that the grinding was actually a protection device to protect the gears & belt of the unit when something is blocking the brushes from turning.With the Dyson person on the phone, I checked everything that the Dyson person said to look at....Well...Surprise, surprise there was NOTHING blocking the brushes on the Brand New DC33 that was simply taken out of the box & then plugged in.Next, the Dyson person told me to take the bottom off the brush area & remove a rubber gasket to 'reduce suction'. Why? Because, as it was explained, the motor on the DC33 is just 'so powerful' that it is actually getting stuck on the carpet because of the 'powerful suction'....Yup....you read that correctly....The Dyson person told me to remove a gasket to REDUCE suction! I may be wrong here, but isn't the powerful suction of the Dyson the whole reason you want to buy one??I mean, their entire ad campaign is based on '..the vacuum that never loses suction'...& here is a Dyson Customer Service person telling me procedures to reduce the suction of a Dyson; just so that it can do the very basic task of cleaning a carpet!After doing everything as instructed (still with the Dyson person on the phone), the vacuum STILL made grinding noises on any room carpet I tried. The only time it did not grind was when I vacuumed a small tile area near our front door.After hearing over the phone that the Dyson was still grinding, the Dyson person said it must be a defective DC33; & to exchange it where I purchased it.Instead, I returned it & got a refund. (Wait...there is more...)Six months later, my Wife purchased another Dyson DC33 (from a different retailer). She felt that the problems we had with the first one was all due to a defective unit.....I hoped so as well......we were both about to have our hopes shattered...The new Dyson DC33 did EXACTLY the same grinding (right out of the box) as the first one we had purchased 6 months prior did!Again, I called Dyson & was brought along the same gasket removal procedure I was brought through with the first DC33 we had.Again, it did nothing to stop the problem.Again, I was told it was 'odd' but we must have a defective unit; & to exchange it where we purchased it.We brought the DC33 back to were it was purchased.When we walked in with it, we told a salesperson we were having a problem with it. The salesperson kind of twisted his face & said with a crooked half smile 'Let me guess.....its grinding...right?' We both started laughing & said almost at the exact same time 'YES!!'He said he has had ALLOT of people bring them back for the grinding problem.He was very nice & wanted to hear for himself what the grinding sounded like. He plugged in the DC33 & turned it on. It worked fine on tile & vinyl flooring samples he had; but as soon as it went onto ANY type of rug, the grinding noise was insane. He had many flooring samples for testing vacuums; & the DC33 made grinding noises on ALL of them except a wood, vinyl, & tile sample.We wanted to return our second defective DC33 & get another refund; but since the box was accidentally thrown away (UGH!) we were unable to return it. (Side note: It is nobody's fault but OUR OWN on the thrown away box / no refund issue!)The Dyson DC33 is by far the WORST vacuum we have ever purchased.Just do a simply web search for 'Dyson DC33 Grinding' & you will spend the rest of the day & night reading nightmare after nightmare about the DC33 grinding.There is obviously a design flaw with this unit that cannot be denied....except by Dyson.To have Dyson Customer Service instruct its customers to take parts out of their units to reduce suction in order to stop a grinding problem that should not be happening in the first place, is absolutely unbelievable & ridiculous.At least the yellow color of the DC33 is perfect for it, since it's a lemon!If you are unfortunate enough to purchase a DC33, DO NOT THROW THE BOX AWAY! Trust me, you will more than likely need it again in the VERY near future!

For all the money this Vacuum cost me it is just ok.  It makes the grinding screeching noise when I vacuum my area rugs.  The vacuum also has the worst cord in the world.  The cord is in a constant knot and always binding up and annoying all who use it.  I was so excited when I got a Dyson but it has left me disappointed. I have had this vacuum for 8 months now.  It really is no better than the Hoover I had and paid about $120 for.  I am glad to see it has come down in price.

Don't waste your money on this product.  After 2 years it no longer works.  It has a high pitched whistle and does not remove debris from the floor.  I cleaned the filters and it got worse. I wanted a Dyson in the worse way.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.

I purchased the DC33 about 6 months ago. When trying to remove the carpet fibers from the roller brush I broke the roller brush drive belt.I thought OK so I'll order a replacement from Dyson. After calling Dyson customer service they told me the belt was not available and directed me to an aftermarket source. The belt was purchased for minimal cost - that was the easy part. Most people will not be able to change the drive belt.You need an 6 inch No. 15 Torx wrench to take the unit apart. I found a Youtube video for another dyson model which helped me understand the disassembly. All this information should be posted on the Dyson web site if they really wanted to provided customer support. The video helped me understand which parts could be unsnapped without breaking. The disassembly was horrible. I was sure I was going to break the plastic prying on it. The entire clutch had to be removed from the unit and disassembled to get the belt off and new belt installed. When you take the clutch off you need a special tool to remove a very small C-clamp on the clutch shaft. Do the disassembly of the clutch over a towel or the 3 small ball bearing will go bouncing away. This is a three-handed job and takes a couple of hours for someone doing it for the first time. The clutch was not easy to reassemble due to small parts that don't stay in place. After reassembly the brushes are engaged all the time and can't disengage for the hard floor switch option. Probably some small part in the clutch moved out of place during reassembly.  People it should not be this difficult to change a belt. I've also owned the hoover brand in the past which performed well and was very simple to service. This will be my last Dyson purchase. Performance is great on the unit and it is easy to use. But if the drive belt on the roller brush breaks I would throw it out. This purchase has been disappointing and a waste of money. I expected to get a least 5 years out of this unit before having any trouble.After seeing so many positive reviews on this product I suspect Dyson company are posting many of the reviews.

I was reluctant to pay so much money for this vacuum which seemed like a bunch of cheap plastic but it has turned out to be worth it.  I have had mine for about 4 years, which is about 2 years longer than I have ever been able to tolerate a vacuum.  I have only just now encountered a problem, and that is the extension hose which just ripped making the extension hose useless.  I was very happy to see that parts are available, easy to get, and reasonably priced although I wish I had checked Amazon first because they are about $10 cheaper. However, the Dyson website has other parts that are not available here.  Other than the hose ripping, I am pleased with how well all that 'cheap plastic' has held up, and I am not all that easy on this thing.

I wanted a Dyson for so long and finally got one.  I am so sorry...this thing is a monster!  It does have great suction, love the easy empty and long cord.  My problem is I can't hardly push it across the carpet.  It's soooo heavy and cumbersome.  I ask my husband to vacuum the living room the other day and his comment was 'what's wrong with that vacuum?'  So disappointed!

column7: Scratched my brand new hardwood floors
column8: I purchased this vacuum for the sole purpose of cleaning my newly installed hand scraped beautiful hardwood floors. The stinking vacuum scratched the floors upon first use!!! 4 day old floors!  Dyson promptly stated that I must have picked up debris with 'regular use of vacuum' and the company takes no responsibility! The underside of the vacuum was clearly scraped from poor clearance on the wood. awesome Dyson! I will never endorse this company when they don't even stand by their products! Disappointing to say the least!

I've taken some time before I wrote a review to give us enough time to accurately evaluate the Dyson DC 33. Eight months into our purchase, we can now give our personal view.First and foremost it's a vacuum without peer.  Amazing suction!  before we purchased the Dyson DC 33 we investigated  many name brand vacuums and thru a lending policy with a store here in town, were able to take a few vacuums back to the house for actual 'real world' tests.  Brands you see everyday and some brands that are European brands not normally found in your local stores.If you have back problems, this is NOT for you.  The power and suction will give your back and upper torso a good workout.  I am over 6 foot tall and weigh 205 pounds and by the time I'm finished with 3 rooms of carpet and a kitchen/ dining area with vinyl flooring I will break sweat every time.  (the house is under 1500sq ft)It really picks up the dirt and dust like no other machine we've ever owned.  There is a floor attachment that you can purchase for you vinyl flooring that I would highly recommend ( easier to get under and around the low spaces).There is a small 'door' on the bottom right hand side of the machine  ( that no one tells you about) that can be opened for a  lower suction setting which is ideal for curtains and or a light scatter rug, otherwise the normal high setting will be fine for the the floors and upholstery.I purchased this machine as a re-furbished model and have never been happier with the results.  (The extra long cord was also a plus)The product looks fragile (all plastic parts) but it can take a pounding. Emptying the machine is a breeze ( I suggest you purchase a 1' paint brush to get the dirt residue that attaches itself to the upper portions of the canister and will not come out without a little coaxing)Over all I am more than pleased with this purchase.

I started using the Dyson DC-33 shortly after reciving it by UPS. It did a good job on the small amount of carpet we have in the houseb but it was woefully inadequate on our wood floors whlich comprise about 90% of our home. The dust and lint from the floor blew completely through the filter and became a bigger mess than just leaving the dust on the floor. I had to sweep up the dust and try to pick it up with the vaccuum, but much of it still ended up scattered behing the vaccuum. I don' have time to go over each area several times in order to pick up the dust and dirt the sweeper cannot pick up into the bagless container. I have taken it in on the warranty to have it checked, but I have not yet had the opportunity to try it out since.

I bought the dyson d33 and have had it for about a month.  This vacuum is amazing.  I was skeptical about the abilities of the dyson and all the hype.  my mother in law has a dyson dc 27 or something that she has had for 4 years.  she recently had a problem with the dyson making a noise, but continued to work properly.  she called dyson, they listened to the noise over the phone, sent her a box to ship it in, she shipped it off and it was back in a week working wonderfully with no noise.  this ease in service prompted me to finally make the purchase.  I have owned many, many, many cleaners in the past from kirby, shark, hoover, bissel, almost every one on the market.  I would replace my vacuum at least yearly and until dyson, found the hoover windtunnel to perform the best.  When I received my dyson, i wanted to test it out.  I immediately put the dyson together (very easy), vacuumed my small livingroom with the hoover (not even 6 months old) and then immediately vacuumed with the dyson.  I had over 1 1/2 inches of stuff in the dyson even after vacuuming with the hoover. I immediately called my daughter to come pick up her new vacuum, the hoover of course, as this was still an upgrade for her.  The dyson is the only vacuum I have ever owned that does an amazing job on my bare floors as well, it picks up everything and you can feel the difference when walking barefoot.  The price seems a little steep for the dyson, but I paid about $200.00 for my windtunnel anyway and with the dyson waranty and ease of service it is a great deal.  To me there is no comparrison.  I will never own another brand of vacuum cleaner.  I hope dyson creates a steam mop next!!!!  All I can say is if you've been on the fence about buying one, JUST DO IT!!
I love this vacuum.  I can't believe every time I vacuum how much stuff it picks up!  It's convenient having the attachments right on the cleaner and not having to attach a bunch of stuff.  Love it!!

I have had my Dyson vaccum for a month.  It is easy to use.  Cleans the hard wood floors and carpets quickly and efficiently.  It's long reach arm works great on the stairs and in those hard to reach places.  There is plenty of cord so I do not have to keep plugging it in as I travel around my house.  So far I love my Dyson.

This is without a doubt the best vacuum I have ever owned.  For years I resisted buying a Dyson because of the expense. I thought it could not be that much better than any other highly rated bagless. I was wrong. The suction is great and it's so easy to use and empty. It is one of the lesser priced Dysons, but I bet it can hold its own on cleaning with their higher priced models. I highly recommend it!
Dyson DC33 Multi-Floor Upright Bagless Vacuum Cleaner is a great vacuum! I've tried many others and Dyson by far works the best! I have two of them!

I purchased a Kenmore canister upright vaccuum about a year ago.  It was heavy, clumsy to use and the bags were outrageously expensive and can only be bought at Sears. I hated when it was time to vaccuum so I did it as little as possible.  Since I bought the Dyson DC33 I have been absolutely thrilled with its performance.  It isn't quite as light weight as I hoped but it is half the weight of the other one I bought and a joy to use.  It picks up everything the first pass (I have 2 large dogs and 2 cats that are all in the house) and I am done in a skinny minute.  My only regret is that I waited so long to buy it.

I vacuum every two days. I have a collie and if anyone knows about this breed they are major shedders. I also have another dog and 2 cats. So my vacuums get a work out. I end up buying a new machine every two years. Honestly I could have bought several Dyson's by now. I just couldnt bring myself to pay the big bucks for one. My friend has a Dyson and so does my sister n law. They both swear its the best machine ever. The last vacuum I bought was a year and half ago. Its a Hoover but I cant remember the specific model, it has done a really great job. That being said though, the switch on it is going. I press it on, it starts and shuts off and starts again. Not good. I spend about 180 dollars on it and had hopes it would last me a while. I am very good on maintenance and take care of my stuff but like I said I really use a vacuum. So after getting some coupons and other incentives I decided to take the plunge and buy a Dyson. I have had it a couple of days now and my thoughts are...Meh.I have read all the stories of how people vacuum with their old machine and then use the Dyson and are gleefully mortified to see all the dirt the Dyson picked up. I did my own test. Apparently my Hoover still has great sucking power because the Dyson didn't pick up a whole lot of dirt after using my Hoover. Sure it did pick up some more hair that the Hoover missed but I wasn't blown away by the amount of dirt in the canister. The obvious benefits to me are that it didnt take me a while to put it together. Didn't even need to break out a screwdriver. That was awesome. Just click and click and it was put together. The cord is much longer than my Hoover and the quality of the rubber is better where its not going to take me a month to get the kinks and stiffness out. It is also considerably quieter and lighter than my Hoover. Pushing it is easy and I like that. I do like how the canister empties. Its simple and easy but I did notice and hair will wrap around the filter inside the canister so not touching the dirt at all is not going to happen. I can live with this, one of the joys of owning a dog. I have asked around and was told there isn't much difference between the animal version and this one except for an extra attachment. I hope that is true so I opted for this one and saved myself a hundred dollars.The wand is not really my favorite feature. It is awkward to use and i agree with others that close up jobs require some finesse. I miss my Hoover in this regard. The Dyson does seem to have a much more powerful suction though and I do see a big difference between using the Hoover attachment vs the Dyson. The Dyson definitely wins in this regard especially on stairs, its just awkward and something I will have to get used to. I do hope I get more than a year or two out of this. If I don't then the machine is definitely hype. Time will tell I guess.

I have 3 cats and this vacuum does seem effective on picking up the cat hair, however, vacuuming has never been so much work.  This vacuum is very difficult to push on my carpeting.  I called Dyson customer service.  I was instructed to remove the plate from over the brush and then put it back on.  That seems to work great for a few days.  Also, using the wand extension is a pain.  I had high hopes for this vacuum since it's twice as expensive as vacuums I've bought before.  I am very disappointed and am sorry I made this purchase.  If I still had the packaging I would certainly return it.  My suggestion to you - buy something else.
my wife and I have owned many vaccums in our day. none compare to this. and with three small children that says a lot. however it is REALY low to the surface (no matter the setting.

This is my first Dyson. I bought it about 6 months ago on Amazon and I've been using it a lot since then. We don't have pets, but, we have our 5 year old grand-daughter living with us, so we want everything super clean.When we moved into this house there was some sort of unknown, crumbly caked-in stuff in the hallway, between two bedrooms. I think it was from a contractor using drywall as it looked white, like cement. I took everything I could think of when we first moved in to get it off of the carpet. Well, I took this Dyson up there when I first bought it and it came up very easily! This is after using a Hoover on it for 4 years and never getting any of it up. It sounded like rocks going into the vacuum, so I think it was some sort of building material. Anyway, it's gone!We have stairs and I love using the wand for all the stairs and not having to lug the vacuum up and down. That's SO AWESOME!I do not like that I cannot reach under the cabinets with the vacuum unless I use the wand, but, I still get everything clean. I don't like having to wind the cord up each time. I got spoiled with my Hoover having an auto rewind and having a light on the front. Those are the two things I miss, but, that's it. Dyson beats Hoover hands down for cleaning!I'm very happy with how it cleans the baseboards as well. I also really like having a switch for bare floors and carpet. That's really awesome.All in all, I can say that when I need to replace my Dyson, I will replace it with another Dyson. I'll also recommend a Dyson to anyone looking for a new vacuum cleaner. It's worth the money! I wish I had bought this earlier, I regret waiting so long!

column7: not as good as dyson animal version
column8: This vacuum seems to have great suction.  So much so that it won't push forward.  The brush locks in on my carpet when being pushed forward and won't budge unless I tilt the handle down to about 5 inches off the floor.  When I pull it towards me it works like a charm.  This type of use is not realistic (bending over to touch my toes with my vacuum everytime I go forward).  To clarify, I have medium pile carpet, not shag.We have a dyson animal for the first floor and it works fabulously.  If you are torn between the regular and the animal (purple version), I recommend the animal version.

This is our second Dyson, the first was a DC07 wich we had for 11 years. The DC33 is a superior vacuum wich provides quality results when used correctly. I found that the slower you push the vacuum the harder it is to push, but the results are worth it when vacuuming your pets favorite area to lounge. We have 3 dogs and 3 cats, so getting the hair, dander, dust up off of the rugs, carpet, tile and furniture are a must for me, since I have allergys.Once again Dyson makes a quality product that comes with a 5 year warranty.

This product was purchased 'like new' it was essentially brand new with just an opened box.  Works perfectly, great suction on tile floors.  Its not quite as good on carpet compared to the animal line from Dyson, but still works awesome.  I don't have animals anymore, which is why I opted for this model.  I was little nervous about by a used product, but saved $100 and it was pretty much brand new. Still in the plastic and everything.  The only complaint that I have about these Dysons is the extend handle in which you attach the attachments.  Its long which is great for reaching the ceiling, but its not easy to maneuver for the floor or in tight spaces.  This issue plus the fact that it doesn't work as well on carpet as the animal (which i believe was a 28) is why I gave it 4 stars.

Got this to replace a Dyson I bought when they first came out,  Same functions, didn't like that they changed the connectors for the accessory tools, unable to use some of the attachments from my older machine.  Price (even with shipping) was much less than any of the stores in my area.

Honestly I could never say enough good things about our Dyson. My partner and I have two small dogs, which we love. These dogs shed like no other. Well with the normal daily chore proccess of sweeping up a days worth of 'playtime' hair from our wood floors. Doorbells rings and in came the Dyson. I started to pant as I was so excited. Remember I just swept, mind you I am a professional from long years of chores as a kid. Well I started up the that graceful machine and in a mere ten minutes, I had a half canister of dog hair from three rooms. SHOCKED. That is all. I am totally in love and I am never cheating, ever! Scouts honor!

column7: Awesome vacuum, even for homes with pets!
column8: Where to begin on how much I like this vac!? We had a similar style vac made by another company and we've used it for several years and after the point that it would no longer pick up anything (not that it picked up much to begin with), so we decided we needed to get a new one. I had been wanting to try a Dyson for years - but was always hesitant to spend the money. Let's face it - these babies are expensive! But I finally bit the bullet and bought my vac at my local Sam's Club, vice Amazon only because they happened to have a sale on them.After taking it out of the box and getting it assembled, which I found to be a challenge even with the pictures only manual, I plugged it in and started it up. Boy was I surprised at how much this vac picked up!We vacuum weekly in our house - simply because we work full-time and also started a side business. We have an English Bulldog that has short 2 inch hairs that tend to stick to everything... The shape of the hair allows it to get embedded into the weave in my carpets and is an absolute disaster to get out. For that matter, we have a low profile area run that was just FULL of hair - hair that the other vac was unable to get out. With TWO passes of this Dyson, ALL of the hair in the carpet was removed and the carpet looked new again!!!As we hit all the area rugs in our home we found that this vac sucked up more dirt and hair that we could have ever imagined was in our rugs. ALL of our rugs look BRAND NEW again and I feel confident having people over now, knowing that the floors are really clean.And because of the filter in the DC33, there is no vacuum smell in the air after you vacuum. I truly believe that I've slept well the past week after cleaning - simply because all that dust, dander, dog hair, and who knows what else - went out with the trash. The first time we used this vac, we emptied the container six times!!!To echo what another reviewer said about hair getting wrapped around the beater-bar... It's true... It happened, but what I found was that it was the long human hairs from the female type that tended to get wrapped up. It was a bit of a pain having to clear them off... But I think with any vac, you'll have the same issues.I cannot say enough good things about the DC33. No need to buy a Dyson made for homes with pets - because this will do the job just fine! However, I think if you went with something like the DC28 instead - that you'd have the same experience.Buy it. You will not regret it!

column7: That's why everyone pays the money
column8: I must say I didn't realize what a crappy vacuum we had until I used this new one. The carpets look new, not even joking! This really picks up everything - we have a dog with lots of little hairs and a baby crawling around the floor. We NEEDED a good vacuum & this is great. The price was right too, we didn't pay full retail just because the box was open and did not have original packaging. I was skeptical never buying a Warehouse Deal before, but it was great. Never even been used. I would definitely recommend looking into the Warehouse Deals on Dyson vacuums & spending a little more to get a vacuum that will LAST.

This is the first Dyson I have owned and it certainly lives it to its name.We were intending on buying a Shark navigator lift away and saw the DC33 on sale locally which was cheaper than the Shark so we bought it and have no regrets whatsoever.The suction is fantastic and pulled junk outta our carpet that our dirt devil left behind.The wand and hose is long enough whereas you dont need to bend over to vacuum anything with it.Its also very quiet compared to our dirt devil.Also like how the canister emptys and no need to touch any of the junk that gets sucked up in the canister.The Lifetime HEPA filters is also a huge plus. Just wash and reuse them.Negatives?Would be nice if Dyson threw in a few more onboard tools for the price you pay.Speaking of tools, they have a slew of different tools and attachments you can buy for it however they are very pricey like the vacuum.

column7: A Smallish Cleaner for Smallish Spaces
column8: This is a reduced-size vacuum cleaner, so the canister is smaller and has to be emptied more often. However, the cleaning performance is the equal of most larger cleaners. Their cyclonic technology really does work.This is an excellent choice for a studio apartment or one-bedroom apartment. Don't try to clean your 3-bedroom house with it. Wrong tool for the job.It's made of plastic. It's well-made, but you have to treat it with respect.Buy extra belts, and then remember where you put them. Sooner or later, something will get tangled in the brush roller and you will burn up a belt before you can reach the power switch. It's not a flaw, it's a vacuum cleaner fact of life.I spent a lot of hours studying vacuum cleaners and reading reviews. You can save a lot of work by trusting me. Or, do it the hard way. Whatever.

We live in a large alcove studio apartment, and formerly had a larger model of this Dirt Devil. After a few uses, we have given the other vaccuum to a friend and kept this one. While a light would be awesome, the extra weight is unnecessary. Easy to use, very easy to clean, and makes a little less noise so the dog isn't as scared.  Love the rinsable filter!

I actually got this vacuum for my upstairs rooms. I have a Dyson for the main floor. I got to say I really like this one. It's much lighter than a dyson, but it's got plenty of suction power. The hose is easy to remove and use. Great for stairs. I've had no problems with it and would recommend it to anyone that wants a lightweight vacuum.

This is my third Dirt Devil, but this is a very cheap vacuum.  If this would have been my first Dirt Devil, it would have been my last.  Dirt Devil usually makes a great product, but this isn't it.  Do yourself a favor and get the Dirt Devil UD70095 it is a great vacuum, but this one is a piece of junk.

We've bought several Dirt Devil vacuum cleaners. I say several because they break easy and crazy us, we continue to buy. Now that we are older and wiser we say, no more. Our latest purchase definitely picks up dirt well. However, the belt comes off almost every time I vacuum. That means I have to flip it, un-screw it, put it back on with out pinching my fingers, re-screw it and start it again. I vacuum a couple times a week and this is time consuming and a huge hassle. The Dirt Devil I had previously, was horrible to dump. It would fall apart into the trash can so I would have to go digging for it getting myself dirty in the process--so more to clean.  The one we had previous to that had issues with the brush height. It kept falling to the lowest level, making the belt burn and also the 'upright' handle wouldn't stay upright. Maybe we had three 'lemons'. What are the odds. We still do have a Dirt Devil dust vacuum. They all suck very well--when they're working.
this is a really great buy for the price....works very well on my carpet and hardwood floors.  light and powerful for a good price.

Overall, its definitely worth the money.  I have a Dyson at home, so my standards are pretty high.  The motor is strong for 10 amps and the suction power is far better than I expected for $60.Note----I literally have to clean the dusty, nasty foam filter after EVERY use.  If I dont, the motor will get too hot and the thermal protector will power down the vaccuum for 30 minutes.  This is very, very annoying when its only been in use less than 15 minutes.PROS: strong motor, inexpensive, rather light weightCONS: shortest cord ive ever seen on a vaccuum, cheaply made, questionable longevity

I bought this dirt devil as the closest facsimile to the dirt devil vacuum I had had previously.  I wasnt looking for amazing, just functional would have been nice.  They have cheapened and cut corners in every conceivable way on this model.  The worst part is that when you go to empty this new 'bottom opening' cylinder, the debris invariably ends up all over your hands.  Even if you try to just shake it out, then the red center post located inside falls out too and you have to mess with latching it back into the chamber!!!There is no way they didnt realize the inferiority of the product they were putting out in this instance, and it's really unfortunate.  By the time you have to empty a full chamber where the debris is wrapped all around that central post thingy, most consumers including me would feel like it's too dirty and used to return to the store for the rip off it is.So, I wont buy any dirt devils again... not when I have to gamble on this kind of deliberate design shoddiness so they can try to shave a few more bucks off the cost to make a vacuum.I'm taking my brand loyalty somewhere else and purchasing a vacuum that is not a complete joke.

I read the reviews on the site before purchasing and decided to take the plunge (not that big of a deal for $54 or whatever it was when I bought it).  This vacuum picks up everything, is light, and is obviously inexpensive.  If you are a person who vacuums everyday and noise is a factor, you should probably be looking in a different price range because you love vacuuming that much.  For me, I vacuum maybe once a week or so and for the 1500 square feet of my condo, this is perfect.As one other reviewer pointed out, the suction is so powerful on this and the way the action works on the bottom, it is sort of pushes itself along the carpet.  Very easy to use.If anything goes wrong, I will update this review, so if you are reading this and there is isn't an update, know it is working just as I expect it to.

Can't compare this to my old "bag" Electrolux vacuum because it is not heavy duty. But the old vacuum had died and it was getting hard to find bags for it so, I decided to go bagless. For the price this vacuum is good and has good suction action. It is so light, I was afraid to assemble it, because I thought pushing the parts together would crack them.  It is VERY light plastic. But, easy to assemble and nothing broke -- so far, anyway. Picks up dirt very well. The only issue is, it is EXTREMELY hard to empty. I think if a person did not have pets, it would be perfect, however since I have quite a few cats and dogs, the hair it picks up gets stuck in the top of the clean-out chamber and requires that I pull out the whole "guts" of the device to get the packed-in hair out. Quite a mess and gets dirt all over the place. So found that it's best to do this outside. Can't simply, "open the bin and dump the picked up dirt in the trash" as the pretty instruction photos show. Guess it's better than having to buy bags all the time though.

This Dirt Devil unit screams 'basic.' It is not loaded with features (that you may or may not use). It comes with just a couple of tools: a brush and a crevice tool, but how many do you actually need or use? The fact is that we clean the house with this unit effectively and efficiently.The main point is that it is powerful enough to pick up dirt. That's what you buy a vacuum for, and that's what it does. It won't sing to you or cook the rice, but it will clean your floors and upholstery. It has the basic height settings, and it's not hard to push or maneuver.The bagless feature, pretty much a standard these days, is fine. But reseating the canister after emptying it is a little tricky until you get the hang of it; it's fussier than it should be and that's the only real drawback we found with this machine (one star off; this particular aspect could easily have been better designed).It's too early to tell how truly durable the unit is going to be but it does look and feel like it's going to last for a while, as has generally been our experience with Dirt Devil products.The bottom line: a good basic machine to do good basic cleaning. What more can you ask?
I bought this for our basement.  This is the cheapest vacuum i have purchased, it feels cheap, but so far it does the job.
Light weight, easy to use.  My housekeeper brought her's over because she was hurting her lower back.  I ordered one the day she did that.  Cleans great.

column7: OK - but not as strong as the original
column8: I got this the other day and was a bit put off by the funky instructions (you MUST insert the hose into the hose port on the bottom of the vacuum..otherwise it doesn't work.)  I had the original DD breeze with the removable long filter and it had way more suction than this one, along with the fact the original was not as cheaply made.  This vacuum seems more along the line of an electric broom...and doesn't vacuum as deeply as my first DD. Sadder but wiser - I may have to buy the next model up to get what I used to have!

column7: A decent vacuum for the money.
column8: First impressions from unpacking and assembly were amazing.  This unit is profoundly PLASTIC.  It looks, feels and smells like plastic.  Extreme Plastic!!  Assembly was really simple, with 1 screw needed to fasten the handle.  They included 3 screws, and I still don't know if the other 2 are for something else, as the directions are sparse to say the least.  But its pretty solid in its plasticness (is that even a word?!).And now onto the real review!  This is a pretty cool design, emulating the upright 'cyclonic' bagless designs of much more expensive brands, many of which we've tried.  Simply stated, suction is terrific.  It works well for sure.  And its loud!  For the price its pretty awesome.  The rotating brush in the vacuum head is highly aggressive, and it definitely gets the job done on carpet.  Its also light, really light.  It can be moved easily and quickly.In conclusion, its pretty amazing for the price.  We have some other Dirt Devil units, mostly electric brooms, and they seem to last for a while at least.  So longevity on this unit is likely to be decent as well.

When I finished putting this vacuum together, I was surprised how light weight it was. On the other hand, the plastic is pretty thin all over the vacuum and the wheels are noisy when they move. Nonetheless, all the features for a vacuum in this price range are there -- bagless canister, basic hose, washable filter, etc. Assembly consisted of three screws to put a few parts together and then installing the dirt cup.There is no height adjustment for the brush wheel and it doesn't seem to work very well on hard floors. There are only 10 amps of power, unlike some (slightly) heavier models that provide a typical 12 amp motor. The cord is sufficiently long (manufacturer states 25 feet) and the power switch is easily foot actuated. There is no headlight. The belt and brush roll replacement, however, requires five (5) screws to be removed and a bit more delicate handiwork. A one year warranty rounds the package out.My apartment has a relatively high pile carpet and this vacuum has no trouble dealing with it. The hose comes with a simple upholstery brush and well as an edge tool. The canister opens from the bottom (nice!) so just put your garbage bag/can under it and whoosh, it's empty. I haven't needed to clean the filter yet but it looks easy to do. In terms of cleaning performance, it seems to pick up everything I vacuum under it (mostly food crumbs and dust I think). No pet hair in my household so can't speak to that type of suction efficacy. In short, the performance seems similar to the 12Amp Eureka I have with more features (headlight, longer cord length, easier to replace belt, etc.)If weight, price, and performance (in that order) are the most important factors to you of a vacuum, look no further. But if any other order of preference applies to you, look elsewhere.

column10: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo2THKU4OI25DB4preplayImageId" />

column8: BottomLeft
column13: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo2THKU4OI25DB4preplayImageId" />

column7: A good, all around, light vacuum...
column8: This is a good, all around, light vacuum cleaner.While not recommended if you have a large house IMO, this vacuum is very well suited for small areas, stairs (because it's light), and under tables etc...The tools are a little hard to use, harder than other vacuums, but for the price, you'll get a lot of use out of this one.

This vacuum is lightweight and lacks features you find on competing models in the same price range such as a self-retracting cord.  The Dirt Devil certainly works, but for the money I think you can do better.  It just feels cheap in your hand.

column7: Works like 5 Stars, Built like 3 Stars!
column8: I'll start with the postive--this vacuum really works!  I'm amazed at the power and suction it has.  I've been keeping around an old Eureka Optima for years because it had a lot of hose suction and I use it to clean the carpet in my car--but I think I can finally replace it with this one.  I've never owned a vacuum with this much hose suction!  I do have a much more expensive vacuum that I use in my house--but I'll probably use this one until it breaks or something.I've used this on both my carpets and tile floor and it works extremely well.  I'm not sure how the automatic height adjuster works, but it seems to.  My carpet is a very low carpet and the power brushes on this vacuum are actually strong enough to almost self-propel the vacuum forward!  This didn't happen on the tile floor in my living room. Since I don't have thick carpet I can't comment on how it will work on that.The negative--this is the cheapest feeling vacuum I have ever owned!  I'm not sure how the plastic pieces will put up with normal usage--but I'll find out.If you want a powerful vacuum dirt cheap this seems to be it.  My advice to those who still aren't sure . . . what a few months and see if the early reviewers start complaining about it breaking apart.

column7: Good buy for the price point
column8: The suction on this vacuum is not much weaker than our Hoover WindTunnel Pet Cyclonic, and the fact that the Dust Devil is so light makes it quite a bit easier to use (and makes it easier to tip over.)  Like our Hoover (and pretty much every vacuum I've owned), using the attachments for the hose results is greatly diminished suction.The Dust Devil is not perfect, but it does well for typical household tasks.  Given the price point it deserves 5 stars.

If you're on a budget look no further. This vacuum performs amazingly for the price. It works best on low-medium pile carpet. Its smaller, so great for apartments. Or people without large areas to clean. The biggest complaint is just that they didnt make the bin a little bigger. It fills up fairly quick. This vacuum has a lot of issues compared to something like my dyson... part of it feel very cheaply made, the bin sometimes jams, it has a tough time on very high pile carpets and hardwood floors, dog and pet hair seems to get stuck in there, and suction is not what ive come to expect... And yet, this is hands down the best vacuum for this price I have ever used. I assume formerly expensive technology is starting to trickle down but the economics or technical voodoo of it isnt really important. Its great. Its compact, its easier to tote around then a large vacuum, and will do 75% of what my dyson dc 28 does. And at this price when the cheaper parts inevitably fail it can be replaced in a couple years for something better. I cant say the same about my expensive vacuum ive invested in--that sucker will be being repaired for years to come. Highly recommended.

column7: Good vacuum, especially for the price
column8: Lightweight, and pretty effective at picking up three dogs-worth of pet hair! The assembly instructions were a little hard to follow for those of us who are mechanically challenged, but once put together it worked just as well as other cyclonic vacuums that I've used, including a Hoover and the extremely expensive ($500+) Dyson pet hair vacuum.  This, of course, made me wonder why the heck I've been paying $250+ for vacuums over the past 10 years, when this one works just as well at a fraction of the cost.  I do think the collection container is on the small side, thereby requiring more emptying during a cleaning session, but I think the Dyson has the same problem.  What this means, for example, is that if you have a lot of dirt or pet hair in the house, you may have to empty the container twice vacuuming a 200 square foot room.  For the price, however, that is something I can live with.  Good vacuum.

column7: Cheaply Made, But WOW Does It Perform!
column8: No, I don't expect a Mercedes Benz for the price of a Hyundai, but I have an old Hoover that I bought for about the same price within the past 10 years, and it is much more substantial and well made than this vacuum.  From the moment this Dirt Devil came out of the box and my wife began assembling it (by the way, assembly was simple--just a few minutes and 3 screws), everything about it said CHEAP.  Good luck finding a part anywhere on it that is not molded plastic.  Further, it weighs next to nothing.  For those who are looking for a light vacuum, you will like this one.  For us, it just felt cheap.  Frankly, I had all but written it off until we finally gave it a try.  THAT'S WHEN MY PERCEPTION OF THIS VACUUM MADE A CHANGE FOR THE BETTER.Wow, it is a real performer!  When I say it's a performer, I am obviously referring to its ability to extract dirt and debris from surfaces of all types.  We have tried it on tile, laminate, and carpet flooring, and it has done fabulously on all surfaces, with no height adjustment required, I might add.  One of the nifty features of the vacuum is the fact that it auto-adjusts to the height of the surface being vacuumed.  I have NO IDEA how it does this (engineering is not my forte), but it works.  That much I will attest.  I can tell it is working well because you can see, hear, and feel its power.  When I say you can see its power, there is something reassuring about seeing the dirt collection receptacle on the vacuum swirling around with dirt that has been collected.  We were truly amazed at how well it works.  The detachable hose and attachments work well, too, and they attach/detach easily.  No complaints there.  The dirt collection receptacle attaches and detaches smoothly and easily.  We tried opening up the receptacle to see how we will empty it when it gets full.  Again, it was simple.  Should be a snap.We look forward to putting this vacuum to the test.  My only concern gets back to where I started.  It just seems too cheaply made.  I can see it getting tipped over and breaking on a hard floor.  From there, we will have a worthless piece of junk, as nobody wants to use a broken vacuum.  I feel like they should have built this kind of quality performance into a better made vacuum.  I guess this is the way of the world now in our 'throw away' society.  I remember the days of vacuums getting passed down from one generation to the next.  That ain't happening with this vacuum.  It give it 3 years max before it meets the trash barrel.Still, I give this vacuum 4 stars because it works great.  If you baby it and handle it like fine China, it may last you many years.  For the price, it's hard to complain.

column7: Awesome, lightweight, easy to use, picks up a lot, and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
column8: Amazing. This is my first cyclonic vacuum and I am very pleased with it. I've been using a Hoover Tempo for 4 years, it's worked well. I vacuumed the carpeting before this new Dirt Devil arrived, so I felt it was already fairly clean. New vacuum arrived yesterday and I went over carpeting again with this new one. I was very surprised to see how much it picked up. Clumps of matter which you can see in the plastic container, then empty in the garage. Based on what I see this is the best vacuum I've ever had. So I give it 5 stars and HIGHLY RECOMMEND it. It's very lightweight (13.8 lbs. shipping weight) and easy to use. Who knew vacuums do not need to be big & heavy?!. I do feel the assembly directions were weak, however. There was no quick assembly sheet included, the booklet had very small print in 3 languages printed one after another. Dirt Devil (made by Royal, in Ohio) would do new users a big favor if they would include a larger print easy assembly guide in all new boxes. It's lightweight, easy to use, picks up quite a bit, very fair price, and highly recommended.

column7: Smaller than expected, but a good cleaner.
column8: Despite shipping hiccups and a few cracks in the plastic which were easily repaired with a bit of duct tape, the vacuum is a great little sucker. I have a 2 bed, 2 bath apt. with 2 cats and a large dog, so I have to empty the container a couple times each room. This would be a lot better for an apartment without pets, but in the end it works really well and cleans great, so it doesn't really bother me to empty it often. The suction is pretty amazing, my roommates GF has the original DD Breeze (12 amp, non cyclonic) and this really does a better job, pushes easier, and cleans up more dirt even while only having a 10 amp motor. The tools are simple but work fine as well and the hose connects simply and sturdily.All in all its a great cheap vacuum, I would spend a bit more if I could do it over again and get a heavier duty and larger dirt container vacuum instead. That all said, if you are debating between the ~$50 vacuums, this is probably the one to get as its the latest tech, and genuinely works great.

After reading a lot of reviews I bought this vacuum.  It does indeed have incredible suction.  It is also bulky and heavy and difficult to push around.  The vacuum is in a fixed position so more maneuvering is required and turning the vacuum requires an effort.  I am physically strong, middle aged and my shoulders hurt after using this vacuum.

The Hoover Platinum Cyclonic replaced a Hoover Mach 5 Cyclonic. Had I realized the cord on the Platinum wasn't self-storing as it is on the Mach 5, I would have gone with another Mach 5 and at almost half the price. The cord on the Platinum is very stiff, so it is difficult to work with and to stow on the hooks. The handle, like every Hoover I have put a handle on, was extremely difficult to install. In fact, after using my best tools and handle grippers the handle is still not completely seated. Hoover took a step forward on the vacuum, but a step backward by not having a self-storing cord on the Platinum. I will take the handle off and lube the screws and try again to secure it.
phone call to help line solved immediate problem with vacuum but not the ongoing problems with the hose, gasket, and accessories wearing out so quickly.  not sure where to go next.  maybe to Dyson?

i have had this unit for a year now.. it is outstanding. i do agree with others the hose is a little short but i have managed to work around that issue. Not sure what everyone elses complaints are but my guess would be simple maintenance issues. If you empty the dirt and clean the vortex filter (extremely easy) this vaccuum works like a champ.. I would highly reccomend this unit. it's low profile is a plus as well. you can pay for the name of dyson, but physics are the same....the process of creating the amount of suction is produced by the power and speed of the suction... go ahead and pay the money if you have it for the dyson name... but you will not find that machine any better than this. the key to a vaccuum is to actually use it regularly. if you wait six months and expect it to clean your house and when the filter gets clogged and doesn't work well, well then you are mistaken... there are many good vaccuums on the market , this is definitely one of them... I am thrilled to have it. being an engineer i get the mechanics of these items. pretty simple but effective... good luck in your decision making process.

column7: Hard to beat for the price
column8: We needed a vacuum that had height adjustment due to new carpet. We used to have a dyson animal so my comparisons are to it.Pros:PricePowerCord lengthLed lightHeight adjustmentCons:DesignIf all you need is a vacuum to clean carpets and some bare floors this is hard to beat for the price. The design flaws are evident if you have ever owned a Dyson. I think the cord is too long and gets in the way but am probably one of a few.  I find the height adjustment doesn't always change. A power cycle fixes this but it is annoying.  I think the canister dump buttons are cheaply made and on the wrong side. They have held up so far so we will see. I hate having to remove the cylinder in the middle I'd the canister to remove dog hair each dump. It's is a serious design flaw. The largest flaw is the wand/ attachments. The tube is too short. In order to reach anything it needs to be right beside you. That doesn't work well for stairs.  I wish it would come with a rotary brush. I purchased a hoover one separately, but it is worthless.  The carpet stops the brushes.Overall I would recommend this due to the price and how well it does its main task of vacuuming floors. The ancillary functions are just not as well designed as a Dyson.
This is not a bad vacuum cleaner; however, the wand for stairs and curtains is Very short and I feel sorry for my wife.

Awesome vac for people who have a lot of surface area to clean. It does great on carpets and has incredible suction. But be warned- it is very heavy and not maneuverable. One of the problem spots in our house is the carpeted stairs, and the weight makes this beast almost unusable on them.  Not the best vac for our condo, but when we upgrade to a McMansion this will be perfect.

column7: 3 years of wall to wall, still strong!
column8: I bought my Hoover back when I was living in an apartment with wall to wall carpet.  I vacuum easily twice a week thanks to my dog's shedding, and this vacuum has been amazing.  I haven't had a single problem with it in three years, and my OCD cleaning habits send this product through its paces!  Just remember to empty out the canister after every room, and make sure the filters aren't getting clogged with dust, and this cleaner will outlive its warranty; I have no doubt of that.  The plastic is strong and durable, the carpet light is very bright, the cord is plenty long enough for any home this side of a palace, and the attachments are quick to install, and easy to use.  The Hoover Platinum rightfully earns five stars across the board!

I love this vaccume, it does everything it says it will do. I gave it a 4 star because it doesnt have a cord rewind. With that it would be the ultimate vaccum! The suction is unbelievable and the off button for the brush is sweet for the tile sweeping'

column7: The Name Hoover... Pay More For Less
column8: These days you pay more for less, I had a Dirt devil platinum force which lasted for 12 years, it still kept it's suction but fell apart from wear and tear, never once did i have a problem with it, the attchments were great the hose was longer, the canister was easy to empty. I bought this Hoover because of the name "hoover". the suction is great, but it only has 2 attachments... the hose is not even long enough...also it's hard to empty the cansiter which dosent even hold as much dirt as my last sweeper. I just wish i would have shopped around more... My advice to you guys out there is shop around more and check out the reviews...

I got this vacuum as a Christmas present and so far, I just love it. (My kids call me 'lame' for wanting a vacuum for Christmas) What better time of year to test it than cleaning the after-Christmas mess? I was shocked by the amount of dirt it picked up (after I just finished vacuuming with my old Sharp vacuum 12 amp). It was embarrassing! Love the long cord, clean/dirty light, and on board attachments. Also, the button to switch from hard wood to carpet settings is easy. It is heavier than my old vacuum, but I'm just going to consider it a work-out session. This is my first bagless and it is easy enough to empty. I take the dirt cup out to the garage garbage so I don't shake the dirt back into the house. My house actually smelled cleaner when I vacuum, which was weird but nice. It seems quality built and the suction is awesome!

This sweeper is awesome. It even tells you when the carpet is still dirty. I have had good sweepers in the past but neither of them got out the deep sand type dirt that cuts the carpet fibers. The best part is that you can empty it each time you use it, so no allergens stay causing irritation. The warranty is for SIX years. They are really standing behind this product! Just be sure to clean the top filter regularly.

Wow. I'm happy to report Hoover didn't disappoint me. (I had a cruddy steam cleaner of theirs several years back) I have their  little Linx lithium stick which I love, so I thought I'd try a heavy duty mode.  First of all, I dropped it as soon as I pulled it out from the box. Nothing broke and it still worked. I went with the bagless because the Linx bagless system has worked great and I am spoiled now. This monster is just as easy to empty. It has such a wide brush line too and I love the super long cord as well. I give it 5 stars. My only complaint is that I wish the hand tool wand was telescoping so you had a little more reach, otherwise this thing is fab.

I'm quite happy with my new Hoover vacuum.  The long electrical cord is great.  The dirt cup is very easy to empty.  Love the fact that the height control is on the handle for easy access.  The suction and cleaning ability is great too.  Would definitely recommend this product to a friend.

I did research and thought I made a good choice. But the vac is heavy and I am truly regretting this purchase. It was not cheap and I don't clean as often as I should, especially living in such a small place, and now after only 8 months the brush broke and it won't power on. The short life span is really annoying. I will update this post once I try to get the 'warranty' work done. Watch, it won't be covered. (Hoover UH70015 Platinum Collection Cyclonic Bagless Upright Vacuum Cleaner)

I purchased this vacuum after reading (mostly) good reviews here.  The build quality is decent as well as performance.  The one touch height/surface control is a back saver.  Warranty is excellent.However, there is a flaw with the the way you're supposed to empty the dirt.  The latch is pretty flimsy and it is very messy to empty the container.  It seems that all lint, dust and hair sticks to the middle plastic part which needs to be taken out every time.  If you think you can empty it simply by pushing a button (as shown in videos), forget about it.

if u want a beautifull vaccum that does the best cleaning job this is the one, take it from amazon its half what is retailed elsewhere and you wont regret it, it is bagless so you will have to put up with emptying it out by hand, however if a capable vaccum like this would have been bagged it would need one bag each time because it removes literaly everthing
This vacuum is awesome! Well worth the money. Would definitely recommend it to a friend, and I already have.

If you are considering a Dyson this is a better vacuum. I wanted something with a lot of suction and this one does the trick.I vacuumed my house the first day I got it and filled it up 3 times before I was finished. Did I mention I used my old vacuum first and still had soooo much dirt left to pick up.

I love to vacuum now.  The clean/dirty sensor sounded stupid to me, but now I just love to watch it.  I can't believe how much more doghair it picks up than my old vacuum.  It amazes me every time I use it.  I do agree that the latch it a pain, but I don't mind because I love to see how much doghair I'm dumping in the trash.

column7: Not as Great as it seems! Save your money!!!
column8: I purchased this vacuum in March 2010 because it had so many good reviews and was cheaper than the Dyson I was looking at.  Please don't waste your money!  It is now July and it keeps breaking on me.  I am unable to return the item so I have to spend time and gas money taking it to & from the repair shop.  Thankfully it is still under warranty.I should have returned it when I first felt 'disappointed'.  It doesn't accept attachments which was a minor dissappointment in the beginning. The cleaning wand is pretty short which makes it hard to clean the base boards around the house without bending over and makes it difficult to reach those high places as well. The canister has to be emptied often and is very messy as others have stated in their reviews.  We have some carpet, tile and hardwood floors which require switching gears.  Although that is easily done with the push of a button, it doesn't always switch gears like it should.  The wheels do not turn/roll very well and they make a squeaky noise once in awhile.  It doesn't vacuum 'throw' rugs, small bathroom rugs or kitchen rugs very well either.  The machine has always felt 'cheaply' made, but looks good. Anyways, I really wish I would have returned it earlier.  I was really trying to make it work and was hopeful especially since it had so many great reviews. I had a Dyson for 8 years and had no problems with it. I was looking for a new vacuum because I dropped the Dyson canister and broke it...My Dyson still works, so I probably should have just bought a new canister instead of the Hoover.  I am so disappointed.Don't rely on all of the good reviews. If you do purchase this machine, and notice anything that doesn't seem right, take it back right away!  Check with your friends to see what vacuum cleaners they use.  Unfortunately, my sister has a Dyson, my neighbors machines have also been breaking, and others didn't have any good reports for me.  So, I relyed on the web reviews.  Now I'm out a great deal of money!Wish companies cared more about the quality of their products and made them worthy of the pricetag!!!

column7: Hoover UH70015 Platinum Collection Cyclonic Bagless Upright Vacuum Cleaner
column8: This is a great suction device.  Cleans very well and is easy to use.  Long cord is a real plus.  Brush is a bit small.  An upholstery attachment would  have been nice. The on/off switch has a delayed reaction, which can be frustrating.  Cleaning the dirt canister well is a real chore.  My husband uses his air compressor to blow the dust out of the nooks and crannies but I suppose it could be rinsed with water.  Over all, I recommend this appliance and would buy it again. It's a bit pricey if you're frugal like me, but it's been worth the cost.

I love this vacuum! It cleans so well. I loved that fact that when i first tried it out on my living room rug it picked everything up in one swipe and even some dirt that was under the rug. It keeps my house very clean since I have a four year old and a three month old baby. I even noticed that since using this vacuum that the air in my house is also cleaner. Before I used to sneeze all the time in my own home and every morning I'd have to blow my nose because it was always full. No more! There is a reason why I shop amazon and that's because I'm not a weathly person but I was so fed up with the dust all the time and my vacuum not picking up anything that I was thinking of just buying a Dyson. But buying a $400+ vacuum was not happening here. So I did some searching and found this baby. Even at this price I was unwilling but I'm glad I did. It's well worth the price for what you get and the maintenance is not that bad there's even a little dial on it that tells you when you need to clean out the filter. The indicator light on it is a neat little gadet but I still just use my own instincts when vacuuming. The clean/dirty light works ok on carpets and rugs but not so well on bare floors. And if you do have really nice bare floors people I don't care what vacuum you buy you run the risk of scratching it, use a broom! If you are looking to buy a dyson consider this one save some money!
I'm very happy with the Hoover Platinum vacuum cleaner. I'm a owner of a dog that sheds a lot of hair. I can feel confident the Hoover Platinum vacuum cleaner will clean my carpets.

column7: Works like a champion. Compare to Shark Navigator.
column8: This vacuum is replacement for Shark Navigator, I had before. So in this review I will compare Shark and this champion. I gave to Shark one star review, because motor stop working on my second use, it was overheated. In my bathroom I have very high pile carpet area rug. Then I used Shark, brush roll stocked inside and stop working. Now then I'm using Hoover, I'm just changing floor selector to high pile carpets and vacuum doing that it should do.
