Hoover picking up much, much, much more dust, then Shark. Under furniture I can reach now deeper, not like with Shark. Hoover has furniture guard, so I'm not worrying to scratch my furniture. Shark is lighter, but then I'm using Hoover, I can feel that I'm using very well build vacuum, real vacuum. Hoover's cord, I believe, is longer than on Shark and much lighter. Hoover has light in front, Shark is not. Shark blowing air from filter in front, which can blow dust, then vacuuming bare floor. Hoover blowing air on both sides. Big and very important difference. At Costco Hoover cost $198 and Shark - $160. $38 dollars difference, but worth every penny for performance and this is what everybody looking in vacuum. I'm very confident in Hoover, this is my champion.

This was a real good vac for 8 mo. Then its motor burned up. The service center said Hoover company owed him so much back pay for services he is forced to reject future work on all of hoovers. He told me I would need to find another service center or ship it to hoover for repairs.Told me Hoover is owned by a china company now and like other china manufacturers they dont care about servicing anything at all. Basicly told me my vac was a throw away item.  I called Hoover and was told the next nearest service center to me was 180 mi. away. I would have to pay to ship it. I'll never buy a hoover again. Old Hoover company quality and service is history. They are all junk throw aways now.  I wish I could give it -5 stars.

column7: Much better than my previous vacuum
column8: Compared to my Eureka- this is a huge step up!  Everything is better- the cord is longer, the suction is stronger, the unit is lighter, movement is smoother, the canister is easier to empty, the filters are easier to clean and overall I'm happier with this vacuum.  It's certainly not the 'OH MY GOSH I LOVE IT!!' vacuum I read about in other reviews, but with three dogs, it gets the job done and I'm happy with it.  I've had it for about a month and only time will tell how well it holds up in the long haul.

This is a great vacuum. Has great suction and no filter to constantly clean. I wish the hose was longer, but it's awesome the way it's set up with the handle up high. Everything is veryergonomic. I love the way you can turn off the brush bar and adjust for carpet height right from the handle. The dust filter seems like it needs to be cleaned more than every two months.Having said all this, if I had to do it over again I would have purchased a Dyson Ball vacuum. Mainly out of principle. Dyson developed the technology first and Hoover actually tried to buy the patent to it could take it off the market. Dyson has a longer reaching hose and the ball technology makes the vacuum extremely maneuverable, and this vacuum struggles to maneuver at times.Still a great vacuum especially for the price. I paid just over $190 on Amazon and I think it was originally in the $400 range.

This thing is just plain amazing. The canister is SUPER easy to clean, cord is extra long, blue LEDs let you know what carpet setting you are on, and lights up the power button. LED on the bottom tells you if the floor is clean or dirty, super easy to use (its a heavy unit, but as soon as it powers on its almost as if it has an push assist motor), awesome colors, and very powerful. Everything you could ask for in a vac. A+!

I'm sick of studying & reviewing vacuums, but it paid off. This cleaner in my opinion, is as good as, or better than the Dyson, at a fraction of the cost.I was trying to stay away from a bagless because I feared dust escaping every time the canister is emptied, but I was drawn by not needing to buy bags anymore, and the washable filter.  The canister opens from the bottom for emptying, so when emptied in a 13 gallon trash can, I don't have dust flying all over the place.I was torn between the Shark Navigator and Dyson DC25 Animal.  The Hoover Platinum is a bit heavier than I originally wanted, but by comparison, it makes the others look like toys.I agree with the other reviews that the hose seems shorter, but that is because it doesn't have an extension wand. On the plus side, it does stretch sufficiently without the vacuum tipping over.The DirtFinder system is AMAZING.  I keep testing it every time by going back to a room I've already cleaned, and the CLEAN green light stays on!I didn't want to spend so much on a vacuum, but after researching and trying various products, I couldn't afford not to.  I LOVE this cleaner.

column7: There are some lemons out there....
column8: I purchased this vacuum after reading the great reviews.  It does a wonderful job of picking up dirt and pet hair... if you can keep it running.  The first day I used it, it ran for about 15 minutes and then shut itself off.  I turned it on again and after a couple of minutes, it shut itself off again.  It continued to do this until I gave up turning it on and having it go off again.  It just wouldn't run.  I looked up info on the Internet and there are some other reviewers who have had this problem.  I guess I just got a lemon.  I took it back the next day... the darn thing just wouldn't run.

I purchased this vacuum after retiring our 20 year old Panasonic upright.  I had read many of the various reviews written about this vacuum and have always been skeptical of bagless vacuums but decided to give this vacuum a try after looking at it in a discount shopping center.  (Next to the broken Dyson vacs on display)Our family of 6 has two large dogs, a cat and several birds so needless to say vacuuming is a must daily.  We were going through vacuum bags in our Panasonic about 1 every 10 days to 2 weeks so the bagless feature was a big seller for us and this bagless vacuum works great.There is no odor at any time while running this vacuum (you could always tell when the bags were getting full on our old vacuum because the discharge air would have pet odors) and no dust.  The Hepa filter does a great job of cleaning the air.  This vacuum has a total of 3 filters on it.  We take the dirt collector outside to the trash bin to empty becuase it is indeed a messy task and hard to complete inside without creating a mess, so for those of you who don't have the convenience of being able to dump this outside you might want to reconsider.  You also need to read the owners manual closely about emptying the dirt collector as there is a filter screen (Hoover calls it an Umbrella Tube) which can clog up before the dirt cup is completely full if you tend to pick up a lot of hair or larger debris.  If this clogs up it will reduce the suction of the vacuum considerably.  Hoover recommends you clean this monthly but we usually clean this screen everytime we dump the dirt collector as it is very simple to do.This vacuum has great suction and does a great job of cleaning.  The dirty floor sensor works great and we have found that the heavy traffic areas of our carpeted floors took a little extra effort to get clean the first time over with the new vacuum but it did the job.  I would put this vacuum up against any Dyson vac out there and I believe it is built better because I looked over a lot of vacuums before we bought this one and it looks and feels sturdy.  It is a bit bulky compared to other uprights but that goes back to it's sturdy build.  It has an adjustable height control at your finger tips wich is nice and a feature that shuts the brush roller off when the vacuum is in the full upgright position.  I suppose it would have been nice to have a self-propelled feature on this vacuum for the ladies as it is a little hard to push around on plush carpets becuase of the excellent suction.  But as I see it that is just one more thing to break down, so if you can live with a vacuum that is a bit heavy and bulky you will still love this vacuum.I ready several complaints about the Hoover vacuum hoses being too short.  The hose on this vacuum is just as long or longer than our old vacuum but it is much more flexible so when you connect the hose attachments to it it wants to pull back on the hose naturally becuase of the high suction. You really have to pull on this hose if you want to take advantage of its full length capability which makes it pretty tuff to clean up high or all the way up and down the stairs without moving it a couple of times.  An obvious remedy is to work from the top half way down and from the bottom half way up.Overall I think this is a great vacuum and would have given it 5 stars but then there are a few things that could make it better.  Like I said I looked at a lot of vacuums out there (and believe me there is no perfect vacuum) before I purchased this one and I believe this vacuum delivers the best value for my money.  The true test will be to see how it holds up over time.  If it lasts 20 years like our old vacuum I would say it was a steal for the price.  (We purchsed this on an Amazon special price of under $280.)

column7: HOOVER UH70015 Platinum Collection Cyclonic Bagless Upright Vacuum Cleaner
column8: I purchased this vacuum after searching several sites, reading reviews and reading consumer reports.  There is not one thing I can say negative about this vacuum. I used my other vacuum then re-did the carpet with my new Hoover. Not only did the 'DIRTY' light come on but stayed that way over most of the carpet. Continuing to vacuum the light eventually turned 'Clean.'  I could not believe all the dust and animal hair that was collected especially after using my other vacuum. The canister is especially easy to remove and empty it out. I highly recommend this vacuum to anyone considering a purchase. As for my other vacuum, well let's just say it is finding use on the garage floor.

We have had our vacuum for about a month now and I just LOVE it!  We had an oreck before and it hardley got any of the hair on the floor.  With 3 kids, 1 dog, and 2 cats, hair can be everywhere!  This vacuum gets it without the problem.  The bagless feature is nice too!  I am very happy with my purchase

This is a great vacuum at a great price, especially with the free shipping. This vacuum cleans very well, especially pet hair. We have 2 labs and it makes quick work of their hair. The cord is kinda long and doesn't stay put very well when vacumming. The controls are easy to use. Wish it had a edge cleaner. The metal hose wand is nice but could use a power adaptor for the carpet on the stairs. Overall would highly recommend. And the house cleaners love it also.

This is a very good vacuum.  Some have reviewed that it is too heavy.... well it's a well made, high quality vacuum.  If you want a cheap lightweight piece of junk then get a dirt devil at WalMart.  If the vacuum is too hard to push then you have the carpet height setting wrong.I love how the canister opens from the bottom to empty!  No more turning over a canister to empty and having dirt come out the little input hole.Some have also complained about not having enough attachments, it has the two I need and it doesn't bother me that it doesn't have the standard 2 extension wands as the hose is rugged and stretches far!  I can stand on the ground and clean my ceiling fans and cobwebs out of the corners on the ceiling, so to me it's got plenty of reach.  (I'm 5'9' for anyone who cares).The suction on this vacuum is incredible, which is what makes it critical you don't set the carpet height too low... if you do the thing sucks to the ground and is harder to push.  I find I have the carpet height setting about one setting up from my other Hoover.Having the carpet height adjuster on the handle is bliss.... no more bending over to change the setting when you move from room to room with different flooring.I would (and already have) recommended this vacuum to others.

I have had this vac for about 4 months and it has done a great job for me!! We have three dogs in the house and a lot of carpet and the Hoover gets up the pet hair everytime!! One of my dogs is a Sheltie and she has very very long hair and is now shedding it everywhere but I just get out the Hoover and it comes up easily!! I have used the vac on tile and it seems to do as good of a job on tile as carpet!!

This vacuum is awesome! It took me several weeks and lots of research before deciding on this vac, and I know I made the right choice. I don't like to say that I'm cheap, but I can be a little conservative with my money. I was torn between this and one of those pricier vacuums with the ball. I am so happy with my purchase. I agree with the other 5 star reviews that this vacuum doesn't get everything at the edges, but that's why there's attachments. The suction is so strong that I could lift my carpet with the hose. The amount of dirt this thing gets up is unbelieveable! I had to go over my carpets several times to get the 'dirty' indicator to go off, but when all the dirt finally came out, it switched to 'clean'. It's embarassing to admit, but I got over a pound of dirt out of my living room carpet! I guess you really don't know what's in your carpets until you have a quality vacuum. I recommend emptying this outside because of all the dust and fine particles. Some people may find this vacuum a little heavy, but I wanted a good, sturdy vacuum after years of inheriting everyone else's junk! I love it!

After 25 years of using a Hoover hand me down (from my Mom) I decided I needed to find something a little more state of the art to clean with.  Not a hard task!  The old Hoover had run it's course and was basically worn out.  After reading lots of reviews for different brands and models, I bought another Hoover.I'm very satisfied. It has a lot of cleaning power and has features I really like:  Height settings (controlled by an electric switch on the upper handle) which lower and raise the cleaning unit to accommodate different cleaning needs.  The first of four settings (the highest) is great for hardwood and tile floors which I have a lot of.  The brushes do not rotate on this setting - just suction which appears to do the job well.  The 2nd through 4th height settings result in lowering the unit closer to the floor and start the brushes rotating to brush the carpet as it cleans.  For the carpeted area of my house, I've never had to go beyond the second of the four height settings.I love the 'Dirty/Clean' light which seems pretty accurate in determining what areas are clean and which aren't.  Kind of fun watching it turn 'Clean' after cleaning a section.Also, the 'bagless' unit makes it easier to toss the dirt from the easily removed dirt container which snaps out for an easy trip to the trash can.  I'm always amazed how much debris and dust gets captured during my twice a month cleanings.  Okay, maybe this is not the cleanest house on the block but it's still nice to see the dirt disappear when I do clean. The unit is a bit bulky but the rollers are useful for maneuvering it about.All in all, this vacuum sucks! (In a good way!)

I researched vacuum cleaners for a month and everything that I was looking for lead me to the Hoover.  My comparisons were Dyson and Meile, which are way out of my price range!  I have a two bedroom apartment (approx 1200 sq ft) two kids and a small dog.  I buy a vacuum about every six months.  I wanted something that was going to last and keep working!!!  I think I'm going to be very happy with this vacuum.  Price was right on Amazon ($250ish). Assembly was very easy.  Two screws to attach the handle to the unit and I was ready to go!  The suction is amazing!!!  I wanted to address some of the complaints that I've seen on many boards....  The dirt cup IS hard to close.  But just hold down the button you pressed to open it and it will catch the latch.  Stop trying to slam it shut!!  I was able to figure it out and my hands did not get dirty!! The only time my hands did get dirty was emptying the cyclonic cone.  No big deal.  I expect that when I have a bagless unit.  I'm not sure how sophisticated dumping dirt can be...realistic expectations people!!!  I suspect that regular vacuuming with this unit will cut down on the number of times I have to empty it...as its first use was excessive because it was picking up after a far inferior vacuum.  I also read about the hose being too short.  Again, realistic expectations...I gave it a good stretch before using it and I was able to reach the ceiling....what more do you want?  I see they sell an attachment....  And for this thing not being self propelled (and I will admit, I've never owned one) it sure did jump right into action when I turned it on! I saw some complaints that it was hard to push.  Adjust the floor setting to a higher level.  Problem solved. A six year warrantee is nice too...that says to me that they stand behind the workmanship and don't expect anything to break...and if it does they will fix it!  SIX YEARS!!  After buying a new vacuum every six months...that sounds pretty sweet!!  I'm very happy with my purchase!!  Thank you Hoover!!

column7: Picks up dirt I did not know was there.
column8: I was and possibly still am a little skeptical of a vacuum priced so low, however I may have been a past sucker in purchasing an Electrolux vacuum many years ago at a very expensive price. I don't have experience with longevity of this vacuum since I just purchased it here at Amazon.I can say the vacuum has picked up such fine particles of dirt my older vacuum missed that I was astonished at what my vacuum was not picking up.I like this vac as I can turn off the beater bar. I have some Shaw carpet that requires NO beater bar when cleaning it. Sounds strange I know, some carpet sellers don't even know that they are selling carpet which requires suction only and cleaning 2 times a week.The vacuum is a little heavy but not any heavier than my canister vac.The cord is SUPER long.You do have to hand wind the cord up, not the best feature.I found the dirt finder display to work properly and well.Putting my hand or a large paper over the bottom of the vacuum I found the suction to be not so good. However when I start to vacuum a low profile area rug the suction is so incredible I can't hardly even push the vacuum over the carpet.This can be good and bad. You have to really push it.I don't have this problem on our other carpet. I think it is because the area rug is on a hard wood floor and the suction is making a tight seal through the rug and on the hardwood floor.Overall I am happy with this purchase.I hope the vac lasts a very long time.One thing I do wish it came with was a attachment with a rolling brush to remove hair from furniture.

column7: Very good Vacuum, especially for the money!
column8: We have been using this vacuum for about 2 months now.  We Love the vacuum.  I only have 2 complaints at this time to report.  1.  The upholstery tool has a little clip so you can remove the brushes,  this clip broke last week but i think you can get a whole new tool from Hoover for under 4$.  I just used a strong glue to reattach the brushes.  2.  The area with the end of the cyclone tubes has dust in it and it makes the vacuum look dirty even when its been emptied?  Not sure if dirt was supposed to get into that area but it just cosmetic and doesn't affect the oeration, just looks bad.  But all in all i am impressed with the vacuum, its my first upright I had been usimg my mothers old Rainbow D2 that finally dies after 30+ years.  I was amazed at how much dirt this vacuum picked up and continues to remove from the carpets.  The carpets are definately much brighter than they were with the old vacuum.  I have a hoover dual V steam vac and love it as well.  Seems like Hoover may just have some of the best products for carpets.

I decided to purchase this vacuum after owning two lightweight vacuums that did not hold up well...one was a Shark and the other was a Eureka.  So I decided to go back to a full size vacuum.  I selected this vacuum mainly because of three features that it has: 1) A brush roll shut-off feature, 2) a nice, long cord, and 3) a lifetime washable filter that is very easy to clean.  I really like this vacuum and it's proven to be very efficient.  The only slight complaint I have is Hoover's customer service.  When the vacuum arrived, it was missing the screws that hold it together.  Even though I ordered this product from Amazon, I called Hoover's customer service to resolve the situation.  I had to call them twice, and it took two weeks to get these 2 screws in the mail that were required to even use the vacuum.  Once that problem was resolved, I've had no complaints!

I bought this vacuum in December 09 after owning an $89 dirt devil for a few years.  This vacuum is amazing!  It's a little heavy, but it's self-propelled and not difficult to maneuver.  The wand has a handle on it, so there is no detatching it from the bottom, you just pull the handle, and suck up stuff in the corners..that was a HUGE selling point for me.  It has tremendous suction.  Dirt canister is easy to empty, no mess.  Other reviews mentioned it's hard to close the flip-bottom dirt canister after you open it, but all you have to do is close the flap and mash down the button kinda hard...and it's closed.  The power cord is EXTRA LONG.  I can vacuum the whole living room, hallway, and kitchen without switching outlets.  It 'purrs' when you turn it on.  Hoover also has a six-year limited warrenty!!  I highly recommend this vacuum.  Worth the weight and worth the price!

column7: Glad I chose this over Dyson!
column8: It was time for a new vacuum, and I spent a month going back and forth between this Hoowever Platinum Upright and one of the more expensive Dyson models. So glad I settled on this one! Very powerful vacuum. I was shocked at how much stuff it pulled out of the carpet and off floors that my old Hoover had been leaving behind. Also love that this one doesn't kick back dirt on the floors like my other Hoover did. It works fantasticly on both carpet and on wood floors and ceramic tile.One of the things I LOVE which made me choose this over the Dyson is the raising and lowering of the vacuum is on the handle of the vacuum. I HATED bending over with my old Hoover to move the dial from bare floors to high carpet. Such a pain. With this Hoover Platinum, I do it with a touch of the button and don't have to bend over. This is a huge plus because I have carpet in the bedrooms, wood floors in the living area and ceramic tile in the kitchen, hallways and bathrooms. I was constantly having to bend over to raise/lower as I went room to room. No more with this one! Also love that it has a really long cord so I can do three rooms without unplugging. This vacuum is also narrower than my older Hoover so it fits into smaller spaces better.I have three minor complaints: Yes, the attachment hose is too short. But I knew this when I decided to buy it. Hoover really needs to look at increasing the length on future models. I was also surprised to find that the vacuum is made of a cheaper plastic than I had imagined for a vacuum at this price. But I bought it to clean, not for a beauty contest, so it does the job well. Like some other reviewers mentioned, the DIRTY/CLEAN sensor is really unnecessary. You know just by sight and sound that the floor is already clean when the CLEAN comes up.As other reviewers mentioned, this is a heavy vacuum. I also knew that when buying it. But I would choose the heavier vacuum with the raise/lower feature than a lighter Dyson without it.Very satisfied with my purchase overall and know I'll get years of use from it as I have with other Hoover products.

column7: Superb job doing what it's made for
column8: I'd read review of this vacuum before buying it, and the theme was that people were amazed at how much dirt it picks up.  I was skeptical until I got it.  Now, count me in.  I did a test when I first got it.  I vacuumed the upstairs with our 15+ year old cheapo vacuum, then after it was 'clean', I did it again with the Hoover.  I think I emptied the dirt cup 3-4 times!!!  I was simultaneously amazed and disgusted at all the dirt that had been there.  Granted, a lot of it was loose carpet fibers, but also quite a bit of very fine powder.This is a powerful vacuum.  It's main job is to remove dirt from carpet.  It does this job exceptionally well.  The 'Dirty' indicator is a bonus, and it is not a gimmick.  It consistently lights up right in the heavy-traffic spots I'd expect it to.  And the long cord is great.  For this main cleaning job, the vacuum was worth it.There are some things that this product does not do exceptionally well.* It does an OK job on bare floors.* Edge cleaning is pretty much non-existent.  You'll need to grab the attachment hose for a quick run around the edges.* Stair cleaning is awkward.  This is not a lightweight, agile vacuum you can carry around with you as you vacuum the stairs.  You need to park the machine on a flat floor or landing and use the hose attachment for stair cleaning.  This is sometimes difficult with tall stair runs.I don't agree with other reviews that the hose doesn't reach above shoulder height -- but it is a coiled hose.  To get more length, you need to twist the hose.  Also, I thought the manual was pretty clear about how to empty the center cup, and it is easy to do.So, if you want a powerful machine that does a great job at cleaning carpet, this product is a great choice.  Realize it takes a hefty motor to get that, and you won't find a vacuum that is both as powerful as this, yet lightweight and agile.

I had a dyson for pet hair prior to this.  Iniially I  thoughtit was great but over time it didn't last.  This vacuum picks up cat hair and cleans better then any other vacuun I ever had.  I ordered the attachment for vacuuming furniture from hoover and it picks up the hair that sticks to the furniture.

column7: Not quite what I hoped, but ok.
column8: Pros:Has a 6-year warrantee. This is lucky because the first one I had, after using about a month of use, started spontaneously turning itself off after running for a few seconds.  Hoover replaced it for free.Good suction.Cons:The hose is much too short and it has only one extension wand.Pet owners should know it clogs very easily, and you have to empty it after nearly every use.

I really like this vacuum!Easy to use,long cord,easy dump container,life time filters.Can't get under beds or low furniture.No big deal,this really gets up the dust and dirt.You will love how this works,i do,really glad i spent the money on a good working vacuum.I would put this up against any vacuum out there,and bet this one is more powerful,better all around.Six year warranty is great,but i am betting i won't need it.

The suction on this vacuum is great. I love the light that tells you that the spot you are cleaning is clean or still dirty. The only problem that I had with the vacuum is that the hose is not very long. It does need a longer hose. It does not reach very high and there is not enough hose to reach all the steps to the top.

Very high quality construction, strong suction, 'dirt finder light' very handy though it doesn't seeem to be as sensitive as the one on my 10 year old hoover.  I would recommend this product especially at the current pricing.

I have had a rocky relationship with Hoover vacuums.  I have to say, if Costco didn't have the greatest return policy, I don't think I could have given Hoover another chance.  I gave this vacuum a chance, and I am glad I did.  This vacuum sucked so much dirt and debris out of our carpets, I could not believe it.  I heard all of the rave reviews of Dyson and almost went with one, but then my next door neighbor's Dyson got clogged and they spent hours trying to fix it.  I didn't feel like bothering with all of the hassle, so I looked towards this vacuum.  It really does an amazing job sucking everything out of the carpets.  The height adjustments are on the handle, and that makes switching between carpets, hardwood floors, and rugs a breeze; no more bending over and fighting the switch to cooperate on the base of the vacuum.  The DirtFinder may seem like a gimmick, but it really is useful.  The one thing that I can see being a problem for some people, is that the wand is not telescoping, neither does the vacuum have extension wands.  It is just the one foot long aluminum wand, plus the fairly long hose.  Since the aluminum wand can be easily removed with the press of a button, Hoover could sell a separate telescoping wand separately, maybe that is their plan; but that is the only thing I can find that I am not pleased about.  Other than that, this is a terrific vacuum, that will help make our home a cleaner one.  You cannot go wrong with this vacuum.

column7: Wish I Had Bought This Sooner
column8: After several years with an older Hoover, we finally got tired of its performance and began seeking a replacement.  After doing a lot of research on this, Comsumer Digest's, and Best Buy's sites, we went with this one.  Assembly was quite simple, requiring only a Phillips head screwdriver for two screws, before it was set up.  Our first use, just after vacuuming an area done with the old vacuum, left me stunned.  The clear reservoir/ 'bag?' area filled with lint, dirt, dust, hair and fibers, and left me uneasy about leaving any other carpets un-done.  Part of this vacuum's appeal comes in the form of the sensor that lights up as 'dirty' or 'clean' as it detects the amount of material being sucked up.  It never seems to be wrong, taking me into the more heavily-trafficked areas and requiring a little extra time to get it all sucked up just right.While some have complained about the length of the attachment hose, it does stretch pretty well, which allows me to hit everywhere I need in my one-floor home.  The bright LED light in the front illuminates the carpet much better than our old vacuum, insuring that tiny Lego parts are saved and crying children are therefore avoided.  The hose 'attachment' has a much sturdier construction than our older vacuum, and will seemingly take a lot more abuse before it should have any problems.  Two additional hose attachemtns are provided, a crevice tool and a wider head, which should help most tackle their needs.Overall, the story on this vacuum is that it is well worth the price, and will leave you appalled at what you used to accept as a standard of cleanliness.  My wife has commented that the air in the house seems cleaner/ clearer, and I definitely notice an improvement in the feel of our carpets walking around in bare feet.  I wish we had gotten this years ago, and am thrilled with the results thus far.

I'll agree with everyone else.  This vacuum does pick up well on both carpet and hard floors.  But it could use a little extra thought in the design of the hose.  The hose is very short.  It doesn't extend enough to reach all the steps in my entrance hall or my basement.  There is no extention piece either nor does the wand telescope to be longer.  And the little attachment that comes with it is hard to manuver without the brush on it.  It gets hung up in the carpet and is pretty small.  A turbo brush attachment should have been included to allow a more thourough cleaning job on stairs and upholstery.  I would have thought a company like Hoover who has been around for years would have thought out and designed the perfect vacuum by now but this one falls short.  It's great for normal vacuuming of carpets and hard floors but forget using it for the rest.  I am leaning toward returning it for a refund and looking for something better.  Also see my review on the Electrolux Versatility.  My search continues.

well when we bought this vacuum we had High hopes, especially of the price.  Let me start with the great part, More suction then any other vacuum we have ever owned.  Brought out more dirt and dust then any vacuum we have ever owned.  The dirt sensor is awesome, works just like described, usually by our doorways is the dirtiest and the sensor proves that.  Now for the bad. Size!!!!!! Too big, will not fit under our beds like all our other models that we have owned, even when you put it at the lowest setting it still will not fit.  The extension is NOT long enough to do any vacuuming above shoulder height.  Would love to give it a  5 star ratings, but the two items that I mentioned are too important not to mark it down a star for each one.  Would I buy it again? No, for the two reasons I mentioned, but Man the areas it does reach... Wow, what suction!!!

I just purchased this vacuum so this is from the perspective of the first 48 hours.  I read quite a bit about different versions looking for a HEPA filter bagless model.  In the end, the choice was between this unit and a DYSON 14.  The DYSON had many more positive reviews and, to me, was considered the standard.  However, I do not plan to use the vacumm often so I let my wife may the final decision.  She handled both vacuums and selected this unit.  As I understand it, she selected this one because of the conventional look as well as the perception that the Hoover will go under some furniture and will clean baseboards.  The DYSON will not.A small glitch occurred when we got the unit home.  There are only two screws to finish the vacuum and Hoover forgot to include them.  So, I had to drive a 1hr round trip to obtain the screws. Thanks Hoover.Back home, the vacuum went together and we tested it in areas where we typically vacuum with our old sears craftsman model.  In all areas, lots of dirt and carpet lint were recovered.  Inspecting the debris both then and after another repeat indicates that most of what is picked up is carpet lint.  The beater brushes appear to work carpet hard.The dirty/clean indicator is sonic based.  From what I see, if anything is 'seen' in the airstream, the light is red.  This means that carpet lint triggers the dirty indication as well.  This seems to work but repeats over the same patch of 'clean' carpet will likely have reoccurrences of 'dirty'.  I think we are going to think in terms of average rather than looking too closely at the light.What I notice is that the extension wand is short as in very short.  The DYSON, though difficult to get on and off, was better in this regard.  One good thing about the vacuum is that the brushes turn off when the vacuum is on and upright.  This is something that the craftsman didn't do.I gave this unit 4 stars for the completely useless canister bottom lid clip. The canister comes off perfectly.  It dumps easily but not as easliy as the DYSON. Closing the bottom cover is a pain.  The manual says 'press firmly'.  Yeah, a gorilla could press firmly but everyone else is going to try banging or slamming the lid close.  This is not good long-term.  I eventually showed my wife that by pressing the release button again, you can actually close the bottom without risking damage to the unit or your hand.  Unfortunately, this will get both hands completely dusty.  This is a complete failure by Hoover.  If anyone can simply press down and get this to close I would like to know how.  I have to wonder if the engineer even tried this contraption.One last item is noise.  This unit is quiet.  It is quieter than the DYSON or our old craftsman.  Both my wife and I commented on this.In the end, this vacuum appears better than older models.  It appears to be sturdier than the DYSON.  This unit has three filters all of which are permanent (cyclone, primary, hepa). This is what I was looking for and expect it not to disappoint.Here's to hope.....

This vacuum cleaner was worth every penny I paid for it!  I was very hesitant to pay about $450 for a vacuum, but I was tired of buying a new vacuum about every 2 years because I did not want to pay more than $100 for a vacuum cleaner.I was not disappointed.  I have a dog that sheds, and I have longer hair, and I shed a lot too, and find that this vacuum picks up very well.  I could not believe how clean my rugs looked after using this vacuum on them; I did not realize just how dirty they were.Also, the controls are very intuitive, and the vacuum was very easy to assemble.I agree with the one user who mentioned the awkward way of emptying the vacuum when it's full, but it is by no means a deal breaker.Between the performance and the 6 year limited warranty, I highly recommend this product.  I wanted to give it 4.5 stars because the awkward way of emptying the vacuum, but since I could not, I rounded up because I really like this vacuum.

column7: Good, but a few things you need to know
column8: We went through our second Dyson, and decided to switch just for the sake of doing so.  Aside from the really high end European models, we opted for this new 'prestige' line from Hoover, figuring it would be interesting to see what's the best they can do at a higher price point.The machine itself looks really good, and when you turn it on, it's like starting a nice car, it almost purrs.  The electronic start/stop and the electronic height adjustments are fabulous, very refined.  And the machine seems to pick up everything in site.Now, here are a few things to keep in mind, none of which are deal-breakers, but believe me, this thing is not perfect.First and foremost, emptying the dirt chamber.  At first we thought it was like most other bagless machines, you flick a lever and let the stuff fall in your garbage.  But after about a week, we noticed the machine not picking up nearly as well, and we couldn't figure out a thing.Then we looked carefully and saw that a huge collection of hair and debris had collected inside an inner cup, wrapped around the so-called cyclonic device.  Once we got rid of that stuff, the vacuum was like new again.  Still, it is hardly referred to in the manual, and it is rather a messy task.Finally is the 'dirt' indicator.  It works on some sort of audio principle, sending out sounds which come back distored if they run in to dirt.  I find that this works most of the time, but sometimes, it just stays red, and even after going over the area five times, it stays red.I guess one could beef about the extension cord, why they didn't come up with some better way to unreel it and attach it to the machine.  This is just like every other vacuum in that respect, but the cord seems longer.I think I would buy it again, but the bag emptying procedure is sloppy and very unsophisticated.  I'd be looking for machines that might do that job better.

I recently had to pick up a new vacuum when my old vacuum (an upright that wasn't supposed to lose suction, but which broke down and stopped sucking altogether. At least stopped sucking dirt from the floor, that is) went kaput, and I did some research, trying to find one that was sturdy, had the extra tools, and really picked up dirt. I have two large-ish (50 - 70 pound) dogs that shed a bit, track in some dirt, and can cause carpet chaos, so I really wanted to bring home a powerhouse this time. I liked the early reviews I'd seen on this new Hoover Platinum, and liked how it combined cyclonic action (which I thought was one of those marketing terms, but which actually makes some cleaning sense) and Hoover's own Windtunnel mechanisms (my mom swears by her Hoover she's had forever with this, and hey, you have to be able to trust your mom, right), and so decided it was the vacuum for me. And, I'm darn happy so far that I did. It just picks up more dirt and dog hair from the carpet and upholstery than any vacuum I've had so far, and is great for cleaning all of a big house. Sometimes you just want to spot clean, but if you really want to get at cleaning, and really want cleaning power, this is the vacuum for those jobs. All the tools are a plus, too (especially the long hose and the crevice tool, which are perfect for stairs. Oh, the dusting brush is oddly handy, too. I've never really had one of those that worked that well, but this one's tops. Maybe it's just that the engine and all deliver enough power to make the dusting brush worthwhile, but I use it all the time), and it looks great, and the 6-year warranty is nice, but really, without the suction and dirt-pulling ability, would anything else matter? Nope, which is why I'm glad I made the right choice and went for this new Platinum vaccum, because it really picks up the dirt.

I've been a Hoover user for many years now, but the price of Hoover's new units keeps getting more expensive with cheaper parts and build, and are less convenient with fewer features.The Platinum bag-less upright picked up a decent amount of fine dirt and lint off of carpets, so far, in over ten uses, and in my short use of this cleaner I have few complaints about the carpet cleaning part of it's job. It does bother me that you have to bend over, because of the short hose, and clean around the base boards with the crevice tool because the vacuum does not have an edge cleaner.It is easy to push from room to room and to and from different types of rugs, carpets and bare floors. But the bare floor cleaning leaves a bit to be desired. It kicks small items, such as cereal, bag ties, etc. aside instead of picking them up.The bin is easy to empty, but difficult  to close. A self-propelled model is not available, but this one is not very difficult to push. However, cleaning anything that is six to seven feet above floor level is not possible. This vacuum is also too large to clean under or around anything, but is good for a straight run over a carpet. This unit does require that you use either a stick or a wire clothes hanger every 4-5 uses to clean the lint clogs out of the hoses and other parts so that the vacuum, or sucking power is maintained.Although the wand/hose is very accessible, it has no wand extension for the hose, and you can't get one. Since the hose is very short and a hose extension is not available, you can't clean anything higher than 6 to 7 feet above floor level. So forget drapes, ceilings, or any area under or around tables, beds, sofas, or any type of furniture, etc.The two brush and crevice tools are very small, thin and cheap, and they look like something that would have been included with a $70.00 to $80.00 vacuum cleaner. Hoover did not include a powered hand brush tool or extension wands, like on their previous machines, and the Hoover attachments I have from two other Hoover vacuums will not work with this machine. I don't know why Hoover would include less attachments and tools on their new top-of-the-line machine other than just cost-cutting to maintain a larger net profit.The short hose and the lack of a hose extension and floor and furniture attachments that would normally be part of a premium vacuum machine are missing on this unit. So far, it does a good job only in a straight line on carpets. For anything else you'll have to purchase another type of vacuum cleanerBottom Line - NO, I would recommend this to a friend.

I purchased this vacuum as a 'factory refurbished' model on EBay for $129.  It came boxed in the original Hoover box and was in brand-new condition (they replaced all the parts that get 'dirty' in normal use).  I purchased this vacuum as a replacement for my 12 year old Dyson DC-07.  The Dyson DC-07, although it's old technology was refurbished with a new roller brush and belts (which, BTW are nasty to replace), so it was in like-new condition.All I can say is that I'm delighted with this purchase.  I tested it by vacuuming my living room carpet with the old Dyson and then with the new Hoover Platinum.  The Hoover picked up incredible amounts of dirt that the Dyson left behind.  I had to empty the dirt cup twice for the living room alone.This model is definitely lighter than the Dyson DC-07 and has a much more solid 'feel'.  The motor is 100% quieter.  Again, Dyson has certainly improved their vacuums since 2001, but this Hoover was head-and-shoulders better than the DC-07.I'm absolutely thrilled with this vacuum and I highly recommend searching out a 'factory-refurbished' model in the $130 price range.  You sacrifice the 6 year warranty (Hoover guarantees its refurbished models for 1 year), but I'm willing to sacrifice that for the $125 savings.

Did alot of research as most do. Always disregard the few negatives. Can't please everyone. What a great vacuum though. So glad I decided on this one over the Dyson line. Saved a few hundred dollars and have an extremely powerful vacuum. Definitely recommend it. Very sturdy.

Don't waste your money on this vacuum.  I'm not sure why they call it a 'platinum' product, when the parts seem to be more cheaply made than the regular Hoovers I've had in the past.  The hose will not latch properly and needs to be constantly re-inserted during use.  It lost suction quickly and had to be taken almost completely apart to remove the clog.  And now, conveniently 13 months after my purchase, it won't even turn on.  I'm so disappointed and now in search of a replacement...but it won't be a Hoover!

I couldn't be happier with my new Hoover Upright!  It does everything it claims it will, and I agree with all of the positive reviews I read about it!  There is one thing I think is weird about the plug though...it comes out of the wall extremely easy.  Almost as if the prongs are smaller than usual.  So happy I bought it, none the less!!!!  Thank you Amazon, as every store in my town that even carries the Hoover product line did not have this particular model in stock!

This vacuum cleaner has the most powerful suction of any vacuum cleaner.  We had an indoor cat and now have two dogs and I was totally embarrassed the first time I used this vacuum.  I thought my carpet was clean but I was so wrong.  In just one room and a hall, I had to dump it twice!  I had read in other reviews not to let the debris get above the max. fill line, so that the vacuum will not loose suction.  Very good advise.  I would recommend this vacuum to anyone that really wants clean carpets.

By far the worst vacuum cleaner I have ever used in my entire life.  I will give it away just to get rid of it.  Can't stand it.  Whoever designed the separate attachment canister obviously doesn't vacuum.  It's not even worth it.  Just whoever is reading this review take my word for it.  DO NOT BUY THIS VACUUM CLEANER YOU WILL BE SORRY!!!

This thing is either an excellent design or a bad one. It is hard to say.Nice controls. A motor adjusts the brush height by touching an up or down arrow button on the handle.Very powerful. Easy to empty the dirt container.On the other hand:Have had to dismantle this thing about four times in the last year. Nasty piles of dirt plug up indifferent locations on the unit.Hoover's website is worthless for trouble-shooting. Their phone support is available with a 30 minute wait.The reader should be aware that my household includes three dogs. This may be a complication for any vacuum cleaner.

column7: 'Lifetime' in Hoover speak is a vague definition
column8: I'm upgrading my rating, since the machine works great after the problem of bad electrical connection was fixed.Would be good if they put into the manual under trouble shooting that screws in the handle could come loose after timeand might need tightening!I still don't like the wording about 'lifetime' in the manual. I give the manual *** .  The people you reach by phone get **.__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________This machine worked great for 2 years.Then suddenly, it keeps shutting off every 2 minutes. Starts right up again, but keeps turning off.Good airflow, checked that nothing was clogged, cleaned the filters according to instructions.Still a problem.Contacted Hoover by email. Hoover email : it could be thermal protector/motor, but advices to change the filters first,'especially if they have not been replaced yet this year'.The service guy I take it to also wants the filters changed first before he looks at the machine. He will charge $ 60 just to look at it,so I take it home, I can get the filter part done myself.The filters in question are a 'primary filter' that you are supposed to rinse off and a 'HEPA filter' is described in the  owner's manual (p 19): 'The HEPA filter is intended to be a lifetime filter.' Then an instruction describes how to empty it.I feel I should not have to pay for these filters to be replaced. I contact Hoover. Long discussions on the definition of 'lifetime':'Lifetime' is as long as the warranty lasts... lifetime is a vague concept....by definition all filters have to be replaced...He keeps talking about 'the filter on top' or 'the filter on the bottom', even though I'm using the definitions from the manual.I move on from 'customer service' to 'corporate'. This guy wants me to trouble shoot. 'Shall I turn it on?' 'No, plug it in first'...Then questions on whether there's good sucion...roll is moving...???I say all I want is for them to ship out the filters for free, which they will.After that I'll take it to a service place and then hopefully they can look at the motor.The only thing more frustrating than a non functioning vacuum is talking on the phone to a Hoover person.

The Hoover UH70015 does an excellent job on carpets AND bare floors -- the suction power is amazing, and the push-button height adjustment saves time and keeps my back from complaining. It should be noted that the Dirt Cup has an almost-invisible 'MAX FILL' line on the side of the Dirt Cup. The suction power of this Vacuum is so strong that the Dirt Cup fills up rapidly, and must be emptied often to prevent buildup and/or clogging of the Red Cyclonic Tubes.Most of the problems noted by others can be prevented by emptying the Dirt Cup when the dirt reaches the 'MAX FILL' line.My UH70015 arrived on time and in perfect condition. Easy to assemble and it cleans beautifully !! Thanks, Amazon !!

column7: Awesome Suction Power -- Just Keep It Clean !!
column8: We've had our HOOVER UH70015 for about a year -- It's suction power has proven to be WAY better than any of our previous Hoovers or Urekas, which were BOTH better than those insanely over-priced Dysons. New Owners and/or those who have experienced problems with clogging of the Red Cyclonic Tubes can prevent/avoid this problem quite easily:Look closely to see the 'Max Fill' line on either side of the Dirt Cup. This line is hard to see, but it's IMPORTANT that the dirt does not go above the 'Max Fill' line. Using Bright-Red or Orange nail polish, paint a stripe completely around the Dirt Cup at the 'Max Fill' line., and don't allow the dirt to accumulate above the line.The machine has so much suction power that it often fills up the Dirt Cup after just ONE ROOM of vacuuming !! Wife and I empty the Dirt Cup after vaccuming just the Living Room. It's a slight drawback, but the dirt/debris/doghair never stays in the machine long enough to get smelly, like it did with our previous 'bagged' vacuums and the near-worthless Dyson.When you empty the Dirt Cup, check for dirt accumulation, and if necessary, reach in and remove the 'Umbrella Tube' by twisting it to the left (counter-clockwise) and withdrawing the tube. Remove any dirt/debris and replace the Umbrella Tube.These simple steps will prevent your Hoover Cyclonic from clogging.Yes, it's hard to get used to emptying the dirt cup so often, but that's a small price to pay for the awesome cleaning power of the Hoover Wind Tunnel Cyclonic. In addition to it's awesome suction power, the UH70015 features a push-button height adjuster that eliminates bending over for every change in carpet heights or bare floor. The brush roll is driven by a sturdy belt that (so far) has not stretched or slipped, and it gets the deep-down dirt in the thicker carpets, too !! **UPDATE** December 28, 2012 -- STILL the best vacuum cleaner we've ever owned !!

I've only had this vacuum for a short time, but so far so good!  I was frustrated with my uncloggable Dyson that constantly was clogged & didn't really make my carpets look clean, so I researched a new vacuum & decided on this one.  So far I love its results!  My carpet not only looks clean, but it also looks the way I think it should--  not flattened down like it did with the Dyson.  My only complaint is after using a Dyson for a few years, this is bigger, heavier & a tad less manuverable-- the ball feature of the Dyson is the only thing I'd prefer over this vacuum cleaner.  I am amazed at how much more dirt this picks up.  I just hope it continues to work this way far into the future.

column7: Too heavy, not enough perks for the price!!
column8: I've had this vacuum for 3 years and I dislike it immensely. I gave it 2 stars because it did have good suction, before it broke. I hated using this vacuum so much that I reserved it for use on our carpeted ares only and used a small lightweight vac for the tiled areas (which is most of our large house). I had a cheaper vacuum before this one that had a retractable cord, why doesn't this much more expensive vacuum have it??? It is very cumbersome and did not maneuver well at all. The only good things about this vacuum are the suction (which can be found on MANY other vacuums), the light, and the clean/dirty indicator. I had to clean it out after almost every use and found this to be very annoying. I have had a few vacuums and though this was the most expensive I liked it the least. Not worth the money!

This vacuum is all they say it is and some ! Great suction, lighting, ease of operation with extra long cord. Very easy and simple to empty and manuver. I've had windtunnels( self propelled) before and even though this model is'nt self propelled it's easy to use. Love the power height button ! Fast and reliable shipping from Amazon.

This had to be designed by a woman!  To start lite weight, 40ft cord, vacumn suction is beyond believable.  The buttons on the handle to easy removable canister and the drop out bottom.  It edges everything.  I just bought a bissell pet vacumn returned it in one week later .  Was just looking on the web and found this one with a video it looked like everything I wanted, couldn't find it anywhere In town so I ordered  It online.  Came in 2 days no shipping.  Fell in love with the first time I used it now I fight my husband to vacumn go figure.  Good job Hoover.

i have owned this vacuum for a very short time, however, i love it! it picks up everything and leaves a look as if i just had the carpet cleaned.. my sister turned me on to this vacuum and she has had hers for over a yr still  working perfectly!loved it so much i looked in to hoover all terrain steamers as well.. bought one but haven't used it.. more on that later..

column7: Never thought I'd be excited by a vacuum, but...
column8: Just purchased this vacuum and am in love.  I have two cats and a dog, and so getting rid of hair is a big deal.  I had a Hoover Wind Tunnel that was getting a bit ancient, so thought I' go with the cyclonic.  What a great device!  It cleaned my old carpet, and made it look years younger.  It got hair out of the carpet that was probably there for a LONG time.  I also love the handle on the hose.  Makes it very easy to use the attachments and reach up and around things.  Also love the dirty/clean indicator and the simple dial that reminds you when to replace the filter.  Only negative is that the catch on the dirt trap can be tricky.  You need to make sure that it latches tightly.Love this vacuum!  Can't say it enough.

I bought this vacuum after a being recommended by someone else. Budget was limited so I had to shop for medium price range. I saw it for sale as high as $320 at Sears. I bought it for $177 from Quality Wholesale off Amazon. I watched the promo video and read the other reviews. I am completely satisfied that it does what it claims to do. I didn't realize how bad my former vacuum was. I had to clean out the container after each room because the vacuum was picking up everything my old one didn't which was was a whole lot. Carpet looks newer than it has in awhile. Great suction on attachments for doing the crevices and edges.My only critques- as others have stated, the debris does not just all fall out when canister is opened. I've had to reach in and pull a lot out to get it all out which can be a little messy. Also during assembly, the two screws that connected the handle to the main body, were difficult to screw in by hand. I didn't want to push too hard and crack the plastic on the handle, so I had to pull out the eletric drill but that did the trick.Overall I am very satisfied with the purchase.

We purchased this vacuum the other day and it works good enough. Picks up dog hair even after the dirt sensor is green. However there seems to be a major flaw in the design. Maybe it's me but is the middle portion of the canister supposed to accumulate dust and hair after only using it for a day? It's the portion just below the red cyclones. It does not look like I am able to access this area of the canister without removing many screws. If this is the case then it's going back and I am going to look into something else. Perhaps this is why some people are saying this unit does not work as good after a year. I will be calling Hoover tomorrow to see what can be done. I just don't see average consumers needing to take apart the canister by removing screws every few days. I will amend my review once Hoover gets in touch. As for now I would say to stay away.

column7: electronic controlled height adjuster doesn't work
column8: Overall it's a powerful vacuum and easy to use. However, there's one big problem: it comes with an electronically controlled height adjustor, which means more things can go wrong.I was unfortunate to receive a new vacuum which the height adjustor didn't work properly. Good design, poor execution? - you can take this risk if you're daring enough.The height adjustor doesn't work all the time (for me). If you're vacuuming high carpet, to low rugs, then to bare floors (varying carpet/floor heights), then you may find yourself frustrated to find that the adjustor doesn't work when you need it to. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.The vacuum can't pick up everything if it doesn't create a good seal and make contact with the floor. When it does create a seal, hold on tight because you will need to put your back into moving this beast.

Great vacuum - I purchased this vac in 2011 and have used it for several months before I was willing to write a review. The vac has not disappointed me and some of the features were a pleasant surprise.Pro's:1. great suction, the carpets actually look and feel better.2. the dirt sensor actually works, I thought it may be gimmicky but it helps to produce more thorough cleaning.3. easy to clean dust bin.4. long power cord.5. convenient hose and attachments.6. can be used on carpet and hard surface floors.7. brush stops rotating when the handle is in the upright position. nice feature.Con's1. dust bin hinge and catch look as though they could fail. They haven't but I handle them carefully.2. cord is long - but it feels thinner. That makes it easy to handle, but I am accustomed to heavier cords.3. this is not a light-weight vac. I like the feel, but some may find it heavy. If you're looking for a powered carpet sweeper this is not for you.all said it is a great value.

I have had this vaccuum two years. I bought it on the recommendation of friends.  When it works, it works great but I keep having problems with it.  Additionally, I think Customer Service has completely dropped the ball.The first time I vaccummed, I was shocked at the dirt that came up.  It was short-lived and the vaccuum wasn't picking stuff up; I also noticed balls of hair in the cyclonic part of the vaccuum. Turns out I was missing the umbrella tube and the vaccuum doesn't work without it.  Part was out of stock and took between 2-3 months to receive a new one.  Now the hose will not stay attached to the vaccuum; the only way to vaccuum furniture is to hold the hose at the base while trying to vaccuum with the really short hose.I took the vaccuum to the service center and he said I was missing a gasket and I needed to buy a new hose assembly. I instead called Hoover Customer Service; they said there is no gasket there but needed to bump this up to Technical Support from Customer Support to figure out what's wrong this time.  That was three (maybe four) weeks ago today, and although I've now left my phone number three times, I have yet to receive a callback.Dissapointing product but Customer Service is even worse.

I was a bit skeptical but decided to buy this vacuum anyway because of the good reviews. I own a Kirby but felt it was time to try something else. After vacuuming just one room I was amazed at how much my Kirby missed. To get measurable dirt is amazing. To get 6 pounds of dirt in my living room made me sick to my stomach. Yes, you read that right, 6 pounds in one room alone.I will have to agree with the other reviews complaining about the canister being difficult. However, it's worth the frustration for having such a great vacuum at such a good price.

column7: The best vacuum I've ever used
column8: This is coming from my expeirenc with windtunnel vacuums, when they first came out, and then we switched back to the bagged vacuums.Our hoover upright bagged vacuum cleaner was needing to be replaced (plus it was super loud), so I deided to try windtunnel again, after reading the reviews of this machine. I was also impressed with the specifications.This thing really does pick up so much more than any other vacuum I have ever used. Going over my room after just vacuuming with the bagged vacuum filled up the collection chamber: that's how much the old vacuum was missing!What I also really like is the three part 'collection'- the main chamber for the large particles and things, the fine dust filter at the top, and at the very bottom (take out the middle piece and there is a latch that opens up the base)- there is what appears to be a HEPA or other air-filter of some sort.Other vacuums would simply exhaust anything it didn't pick up, but this machine is purifying the air as it runs.Overeall very impressed. I don't mind cleaning it every time I use it, because at least I know it's doing it's job, right!Others have commented on the amazing suction, and I have to agree- it's amazing.The 'dirt finder' light is actually kind of useful. Going over dark carpets it's hard to tell when it is clean.Overall recommended. I would definitly pay the full price, though I have to admit I got it on a great deal.

column7: Decent but hose is a poor design
column8: In general I'm satisfied with the performance of the vacuum, but the hose and wand are too short and the hose pulls loose of the vacuum frequently. Very frustrating! An email to Hoover did not get a response to the hose pulling loose and their suggestion for the short reach is to buy and extension to the wand.

First of all, my parents own a carpet cleaning business, and I spent 9 years of my life cleaning carpet myself.  I know clean carpet.I've owned 3 different vacuums in my home all of varying quality.  A dirt devil I got off craiglist for $10, a hoover wide path tempo that was $90 or something and then I made the step up to this and it made a complete difference.  The carpet in my house is horrible and grabs string and pet hair like crazy.  The other vacuums would simply not pick it up.  It drove me crazy to bend over and pick up string.  This vacuum gets everything in its first path.  I go over all areas 3 times just to make sure it gets most of the dirt too.  This vacuum picks up a ton of dirt and it gives beautiful vacuum marks in the carpet.I love that the pile height selector is on the handle and you can adjust it easily without bending over.  The brush stops spinning when you put it on the lowest pile height so you can vacuum hard floors.  Also, the brush stops spinning when the vacuum is upright so you don't have to worry when using the attached hose.I read many reviews that said the dust bin is hard to close.  It isn't, you just have to do it right.  You push the button to release and then when you close the lid, push the button again.  Works great.The dirt finder is more for amusement than anything.  It does work.  Where the carpet is obviously dirty it says dirty and where it is obviously clean, it says clean.  However, there are a lot of places that it just won't turn off.  I use it more to amuse myself while vacuuming that for anything.  It's still cool.The only con that I can think of with this vacuum are that the attached hose and wand are pretty short.  Fortunately I have other plastic tubes to connect it with, so it's not a big deal.Remember, for ultimate cleanness you should still think about getting your carpets professionally cleaned at least once a year if they have heavy use.  If you take your shoes off and vacuum twice a week like I do, you can go a little bit longer.

column7: You will want to rip out your carpet!
column8: I read all of the reviews about how much dirt this picked up and I still was not prepared.  In the past 2 weeks I have vacuumed over and over and over again, and also had my carpet professionally cleaned.  When the vacuum arrived today, I installed the 2 screws and got started.  I could not believe the amount of dirt that I threw away today. (it has to do with where we live!) I seriously want to replace it all with hard wood - I am disgusted.  We will be vacuuming every day now.  As for the machine losing suction, it has a 6 year warranty, really nothing to worry about, right?  In addition to that, the manual is very specific about cleaning your filters at least every 2 months, and certain parts after each use.  For the amount of dirt it picks up, I will gladly clean it after each use!A few others concerns I've seen - not reaching under beds: mine won't go all the way under, but it does go under a few inches.  Opening the canister or re-attaching it to the machine is not difficult.  Closing it is takes a little finesse, but that is because it is sealed very tightly on the bottom.  Just hold down the release button and it snaps right back in place.  About being heavy - it is very easy to push.  I had no difficulty.  I even loaded it in my vehicle and took it down to my friend's house to test her carpet, and it wasn't difficult to lift at all.  In fact, my friend's small 8 year old loaded it when we left.  The sensor works!  In a few traffic areas I went over and over - at least 20 times and the dirty light did not go off.  A while later I came back and worked on it some more, and it finally turned green!

column7: Won't even suck up a cheerio
column8: I have had this vacuum for nearly 2 years.  At first I was very pleased.  Yes, the dirt bin was gross to dump, but overall it did the task well.  I hate it now.  I took it to get serviced recently because I noticed the suction was reduced.  Since I've gotten it back, the suction has continued to diminish.  I literally chased a cheerio across the carpet today.  So frustrating to spend the money on a product with a brand history of quality, only to be disappointed.  Don't kid yourself, this thing is a piece of junk.

This is a great vacuum! I have a 50lb dog that sheds plenty.  I'm amazed at the amount of hair this thing picks up!  I'm very happy with it.  I also LOVE the LED head light on it- amazing what you can miss in the dark corners otherwise. :)

There is a lot of suction power loss after use. The clean light indicater does not really work and you have to keep cleaning the machine weekly to keep it working if you vacume as much as I do. I have this about a year and it's barely working now. Definately won't recommend this to anyone I know.

I was back and forth between this and Dyson.  I am glad I went with this Hoover.  This vacuum has more suction than any vacuum I have ever owned.  I was amazed at the amount of dust and dirt it pulls from the carpet with each vacuuming.  I had just vacuumed the week before with my Bissel whcih I was replacing becuase it was junk - and I really saw what a poor vacuum the Bissell was after filling the canister completely just vacuuming my bedroom alone.  I continue to be amazed and highly reccomend this vacuum.  I do agree that the hoses for the attachments are too short and the vacuum is a bit on the heavy side but its suction makes up for those short comings to me.

I've owned this vacuum for a little over a month now, and here's what I've found:Cons:It's heavier than I'd like.  Then again, I don't lift it often.  It does give a bit of a workout pushing it, though, due to its weight.The clean/dirty sign is pretty useless, but I don't rely on it anyway.I really wish it had a hook to keep the cord from getting in the way while vacuuming.It does an 'OK' job on hard/bare floors, but not fantastic.Pros:It's got a really long cord.And most of all, it's got amazing suction.  The greatest suction of any vacuum I've ever owned.This vacuum isn't perfect.  I listed more cons than pros.  However, in my opinion, the number one requirment in a vacuum is to have suction strong enough to really pick up the dirt without having to make multiple passes.  That's what I want in a vacuum, and it's what I've got now.  It is the best vacuum cleaner I've ever owned, despite its few faults.  My floors have never been cleaner.

column7: Good vacuum, better then our last dyson
column8: I had bought 2 dysons and can say this product has lasted and worked better then both of them. I use this product daily and it picks up dirt just as well or even better the the dyson. The only thing I have a problem with is sometimes hair gets lodged up near where the cyclone tubes are and it kind of hard to get out. So if they fix that problem in the next version of this vacuum then I would probably buy it just for that fix.

column7: As good as our old Dyson
column8: We purchased this model after reviewing comments made by other customers. We are keeping the Dyson we currently own and are using it for the 2nd floor of our colonial. With 2 shedding dogs, we didn't want to constantly run a vacuum up and down the stairs. The Dyson is a great machine. This one is as good asour Dyson and at 1/2 the cost. The only complaint that we have is that, as per others, the attachments are on the small side. Yes, cleaning out is notquite as easy at times as the Dyson, but again with 2 dogs, it works just as well.

column7: Great vacuum, but quality is lacking
column8: This vacuum works great.  BUT a) the quality of some of the plastic parts is rather low and b) closing the door on the dirt cup after emptying it is rather difficult.On my second use, the hinge to the dirt cup broke.  This means that after emptying the dirt that the vacuum collected, it was not possible to close the compartment again.  Thankfully, Hoover replaced the broken part free of charge, but it is evident that part (and several other parts of the dirt cup) are rather flimsy and I have no doubt that I will be requesting several more replacements over the six year life of the warranty on this vacuum.[Update after over 1 year of ownership]I have NOT had any more broken parts.  Everything is working great.The vacuum still works great.  Picks up a lot of dirt and the HEPA filter keeps the exhaust clean.  I really appreciate being able to turn the floor brush off when vacuuming a hard floor.In future models, however, I would like to see the ability to hold more dirt, a better system for emptying dirt (its kind of awkward), and a type of plastic that doesn't sorb dirt.  After a month or so of use, the clear plastic in the upper parts of the canister gets coated with dirt.  This does not seem to affect proper functioning, but it doesn't look good..

This vacuum never worked well for me. Eventually, I took it to a Hoover service center and was told that a part (the umbrella tube) was missing. After five weeks, Hoover had sent two assemblies, both without the umbrella tube. I retrieved the vacuum, bought an umbrella tube, installed it, and the vacuum still doesn't generate sufficient suction. It has been a complete failure, as has Hoover's service. I either have to replace it or hazard going months without a vacuum. Oh, and my wife contacted Hoover directly by email and never received a response.

I really like the vacuum, it is well built and boy does it ever pick up dirt. The cord is super long and should do a whole floor of most houses with a single plug in. The only downside is the weight. This is one heavy vac, you will be sweating when you are done!

I did the research and this is the best vacuum for the price. I had a hoover wide path.  I vacuumed with the wide-path first, and then this.  It was amazing how much hair and dirt it got from a seemingly clean carpet.It was a cinch to put together (2 screws), it has easy motion wheels, it feels like it is gliding over the carpet.  Love it!

This vacuum rules!  It has great suction and cleans everything.  Keep it away from electric cords--I ruined my iPhone synch cord by running over it with this vacuum.  Read the directions so that you understand how to empty the container properly.  I read a bunch of reviews from people bitching about issues concerning emptying the container.  If you read the directions, you will have no problem.  I love the LED light on the vacuum to assist the user.  It is a great value compared to Dyson vacs.  I highly recommend this vacuum.  Be advised however, if you order it thru Amazon, it will show up at your doorstep in a Hoover box.  I live in a low crime area however I could see this box disappearing in some neighborhoods if you are not at home when it is delivered.

I have not been home to see the results, but here are 2 quotes from my wife for anyone looking to buy this unit.'Yeah I'm glad you bought it. Its not like I can see all the dirts with my eyes, but the house seems so mch cleaner now.''I could instantly see the difference when i vaccumed the rug'The only drawback was the screws that hold the handle to the unit seemed too big for the screw holes, and had to be forced into place. But they arent designed for repeat removal and replacement. Overall awesome product.

After researching several vacuums I decided on this one - what a great choice. I received it in 2 days thanks to amazon mom and the 3 month free prime membership. I unboxed and put the product together in less than 4 min. We have a fireplace and a 100 pound black lab so I was VERY excited to see how much my old hand-me-down vacuum has been missing for the past 4 years. Yikes, the entire canister was filled after just vacuuming the fireplace room. My carpet looks like new! You will not be disappointed with this product.

I wanted a good strong vacuum to clean up after the kids and dogs. This one really doesn't do the job. You practically have to be right on top of the dirt or material for it to get sucked up. Using it on bare floors is even worse, it basically pushes the object around that you are trying to vacuum up. The hose is also too short. Wish I would have bought something else.

I have had my new Hoover for about 3 weeks now and I am very pleased with my purchase! When it arrived I put it together and then set it aside while I vacummed the upstairs with my 1 year old Bissel. Then I vacuumed with my new Hoover and WOW I was really surprised at the amount of dirt and hair in the canister when I was done! We have a little Papillon and this vacuumed picked up all the hairs the Bissel left behind!I LOVE the feature that the beater bar shuts off when you engage the hose to use the crevice tools etc. That is such a safety issue when you have children and pets and it's great to know you don't have to worry about a child catching thier fingers or a pet catching it's tail in the beater bar should the vacuum tips over.As for the 'clean/dirty' light..I have only seen the dirty come on once in the entry way so not sure it really does much.There are only 2 things that I feel could be improved upon. The length of the hose is too short to be able to reach all the stairs from one place And I really wanted an auto wind for the electrical cord. 40 feet of cord is nice but you have to hand wind it and if it isn't done tightly it won't fit!

This vacuum cleaner clearly sucks up the dirt from my carpets; it has amazing suction.  I really like the adjustment it provides for different carpet heights and floors.  The hose for attachments is a bit short, but I can live with that.  I also like the length of the cord.  I can plug it in and go for a long distance without having to stop and find another plug in to finish cleaning the carpet.

Upon using my Hoover Cyclonic Bagless vacuum for the first time, noted that the Dirt Sensor stayed 'Green' (clean floor), almost all the time...had to pour some oatmeal on the carpet to make sure that the sensor worked.  Returned this unit, and received the replacement.  Again, the Dirt Sensor stays 'Green' almost all the time, even when the vacuum is clearly picking up dirt (mostly dust and dog-hair).  (I can fill the entire canister, and the light never turns 'Red').  Therefore, the dirt sensor is almost useless with both vacuums I tried.  (I have another brand vacuum with a dirt sensor, which works reliably).Besides this, the vacuum does a very good job on both carpet and hard floors.
I OWN BOTH DYSON BAGLESS AND HOOVER PLATINUM BAGLESS. FOR THE MONEY THE HOOVER OUT PERFORMS THE DYSON.IN ALL CATAGORIES SUCTION IS MUCH STRONGER AND MOST OF ALL IT'S AMERICAN MADE.

After retiring my old Hoover, I ordered this one. What great suction power!  My plush rugs look like new when I get done sweeping.  I love the 'Dirty'-'Clean' indicator lights that show when an area is clean. The cord is extra long making for convenient cleaning.  Probably the only cons I have would be that the extension hose is not that long for doing steps, and the vacuum itself is heavy. I kept my old extension hose and attach it to this one, so it is really not a problem but if you have stairs to vacuum you might want to keep that in mind.

column7: Nothing like a Hoover...again stands the test of time!
column8: This vacuuum is beyond amazing.  It is so practical in design and function.  Everything about the unit is perfect.  And teh other great thing is how it cleans.  This machine is amazing...it pulls out dirt and grime that I never know my carpet had within it.  Very easy to assemble.  Extra long cord.  And I like that it contains and self stores the basic attachment that you really use...a crevice tool and small upholstery brush...the extra attachments that you may get with other models/brands you never really use but pay for.  So again, great engineering and value this machine has in it.  Great location of power switch, cord and even the embedded dirtfinder indicator light/system works great and not just a novalty.  In fact it cleans so well, that it brings up prior stands that were covered up or pressed down into the pile with my prior vacuum.  So in short...I am glad I made the purchase. It should be rated six stars!

I've had this vacuum for a little over a year and I LOVE it! I'm not a high-end vacuum person, so this was a little more money than I've spent on vacuums in the past, but well worth it!!The plus sides: Amazing suction. More than any other I've owned. I have 2 dogs and 3 kids (8-13 yrs), so that's important. I also love, love, love the clean/dirty indicator light. Honestly, that's what made me take the chance. It works just like it says it does; even when using the wand. I don't even want to think about how dirty I discovered our carpet to be when we vacuumed the first time (again, 2 dogs & 3 kids... eew!).
