Very satisfied with this product, will only buy Dyson from now on, have several dogs and 2 cats and it really does an excellent job picking up all the hair.

column7: Dyson DC25 Animal Ball Vacuum Cleaner
column8: I read many of these reviews before purchasing this vacuum. Also, I have had plenty of vacuums in the past that just didn't last. I have a small family with a cat and a dog. Both animals are heavy shedders and their hair gets stuck everywhere (underneath low lying furniture, on furniture, under appliances, basically everywhere). So I wanted a vacuum that would be able to get under low lying places without me having to bend under much. DC25 was built to be able to fit under places that other vacuums cannot. With a head thats low to the ground I can get pretty far underneath the furniture without having to pick the furniture up and move it! Works really well on tile too!!! So with no belt, no bags, and long lasting lifetime filters the vacuum pays for itself eventually. I would go through a bag or more a week and replaced so many belts on my old vac to count (and this vac would have saved me a lot of money in the end).  IT TURNS SO EASILY THAT ALONE IS WORTH THE MONEY (NO MORE BACK ACHES FOR ME !!!!!).

I adore this vacuum.  I researched before buying a vacuum, and this machine lives up to every word of its claims: it has great suction, it grabs pet hair like crazy, it is extremely maneuverable, it is compact, it is very easy to put together and operate because it works logically (I did not even read the manual, which I usually do with new products), it is WONDERFUL! I highly recommend this machine.
We have a toddler and a dog, so we needed a high quality vacuum.  This did not disappoint.  Everything works great and we love not having to deal with bags anymore.  We are completely satisfied!

column7: Works great with 3 dogs in the house!
column8: I would vacuum constantly, and hair was always still on the rug. Once I got the dyson animal, I vacuumed TWICE on the living room rug with the old vacuum- a Hoover Windtunnel. I then vacuumed with the Dyson and i was shocked and disgusted by how much it picked up that the old vacuum was leaving behind! The beater bars make a huge difference in getting pet hair out of carpet. I love the ball design, as i find it much easier to vacuum. It's very lightweight and easy to maneuver. I've had it 6 months and I love it! I recommend this to anyone with shedding pets!

I won't rehash the same details that the other reviews have done.  This one's for the folks that are used to using lighter-weight canister vacuums, as I was.  When I first pulled this thing out of the box (mangling the packaging in the process), I thought, 'Did I just make a $400 mistake?'  It seemed SO heavy compared to my old vacuum.  And when I used it for the first time, the sinking feeling in my gut deepened -- it was tougher than I thought it would be to maneuver around on hard floors, I missed my floor brush, and the extension hose was so stiff that my arm was sore for three days after doing the stairs.I'm a few months out from my purchase now, and I have to say: I'm glad I took the plunge.  I have carpet runners on my stairs and in my hallways and wall-to-wall in the attic, and this machine cleans them beautifully.  You can see the vacuum suck in dirt and hair off the hardwood floor as far away as a couple of feet.  I feel more competent about wheeling it around the house.  Either I'm getting stronger or the hose is getting broken in, because it doesn't seem as tough as it used to be.  But the best part is probably the reduction in my husband's allergies, and that ain't no small thang.If I had to do it again, I might buy one of the smaller, lighter models (or even the stick version) and buy the mini turbine head separately to do stairs and upholstery.  But this is a great vacuum, and it's working like a champ.

column7: I liked my first Dyson, but....
column8: This one is basically a waste of money.  We bought our first Dyson Animal vacuum back in 2005 and it was fantastic.  We used and abused it for over four years (we have a large dog) before we had any real problems with it.  After getting it serviced for $50 at a local repair shop, it worked great once again.  Tired of lugging it up and down the stairs, I decided to buy a second one (this model) for the second level of our house.  At first it worked alright--their claim that these vacuums 'don't lose suction' is true--but we have had nothing but problems with this vacuum since we bought it last year.  The beater bar quit spinning (we got it working again after taking it apart with the help of their 800 number), the canister is much smaller than the last one (I have to empty it before I'm even half done vacuuming our 600 sq. foot living room), but today was the last straw.  Less than a year after I bought this vacuum, it literally fell apart while I was using it.  I pulled the attachment out (according to the directions--I'm no Incredible Hulk), and the vacuum hose literally fell off the attachment and it won't go back together.  So I'm done with Dyson.  I'd rather buy a $70 vacuum and replace it every year than buy a $550 vacuum that won't even last a year.  Save your money on this one!

column7: Very effective and LIGHT but material is cheap-seeming
column8: First, I definitely do like this vacuum. It's very powerful, easy to use, easy to care (I'm a woman with not much upper body strength and can easily carry it around). I love the ball function and how easily it turns on carpet. The brush bar is great for really getting dirt to come OUT of the carpet so the suction can get it. The attachments easily snap on (otherwise I know I'd lose them) and the hose/extension thing is very easy to use and put back.I don't really have any complaints per se, but I have to admit that I don't see how this thing cost almost $500. Don't get me wrong; it's by far the best vacuum I've encountered. But even at first glance, you can tell that the parts are typical cheap plastic. Nothing to write home about, and for that money, you'd expect sturdier-looking parts. It seems like this thing would get damaged very easily. I don't plan on tossing it down a flight of stairs, but it'd be nice to have something sturdier considering how much I invested in it.The only other thing I would suggest would be a retractable cord. I just hate wrapping that thing up every time.Overall, I do recommend this vacuum. It's a great product - just wish a little more attention to detail was evident! Again, for this amount of money, you'd expect something pretty sturdy. I get that they have to make it light, but couldn't they use titanium or something? The plastic just seems so cheap.

Overall, this vacuum does what it promises.  The suction is great.  It is excellent for a house like ours with 2 indoor labradors.  All filters are easy care.  It is fairly light weight and turns easily.  The only fault I find with it is that the hose is too short.  Due to the telescopic nature of the hose, it takes a lot of effort to extend it.  It is also hard to move the hose into tight spaces.

column7: Cleans well but more cons than older version
column8: I switched from the older 'pet hair' model to this new one because the other vaccum lost suction. (even though they say they never do). This is a great vaccum if you have pets, i have a yellow labrador who sheds like crazy. I found alot of cons though. When i empty the container, the hair stays stuck in it so i have to pull it out. I though i could tap it but the plastic is so cheap and thin. The cord is also way to short. I have to constantly move the dam cord around. I can vaccum one room at a time. HUGE pain.

I think almost any animal owner can justify spending 500 bucks on a vacuum. I know I can. I don't know what it is about the Dyson Animal Ball that makes it good for pet owners, but I do know that it gets up the hair - and that's where I find my money well spent.I won't go into great detail about why you should buy this vacuum. Instead I'll just explain why I gave it four stars and why I still think it's worth the money. Let's do this with the good 'ol pros and cons list.Pros:It sucks - literally. I did what I like to call 'the dark shirt test' - after I vacuumed my rug I rolled around on it wearing a dark shirt and checked to see how much dog hair was on me. None. My previous vacuum never passed the dark shirt test.The ball - what a genius idea. It makes the vacuum so much EASIER to maneuver - making it seem like less work to vacuum and *gasp!* fun.It is lighter (emphasis on the -er) than most vacuums.It has a small footprint making it easy to store in a closet and not take up all the floor space (in my closet anyway).Easy to get under low lying furniture.It has a reach wand and a neat little motorized brush attachment for stairs and curtains.Easy carpet to floor switch - no more having to turn off the vacuum and bend over to adjust the level, just press the button and it adjusts itself to go from carpet to hard floor in an instant.It has a warranty - this is my 3rd vacuum purchase in 6 years. It's nice to know that for at least the next 5 I won't have to buy another.Cons:The instruction manual leaves much to be desired. I had to find a youtube video to figure out how to get the wand out.The price - costing as much as a computer the cost is hard to swallow.Not as light as you expect - you will notice this if your house has 2 flights of carpeted stairs like mine.The wand is not as easy to use on the stairs as I thought it would be. The hose really requires some muscle to pull as you get further up the steps.The motorized brush is small and requires several swipes across each step. It also doesn't get into the corners and crevices of the steps where the dog hair likes to congregate. It can be hard to push across the carpet of the steps. If they had an another motorized brush attachment with a wider footprint I'd buy it and use that instead.The cord is short! Well, shorter than the cord on my previous vacuum. My rec room is quite large so I have to unplug and plug this cord back in a couple times to get the whole space vacuum.Overall, I recommend this vacuum if you are the loving owner of a notorious shedder like I am. I found it on sale so I don't regret spending the dough, nor do I think I would even if I had paid full price. However, for a $500+ vacuum it really should come with a better manual, longer cord, and better stair vacuuming tool. Either way, I'm having a ball with my Dyson.

Best vacuum ever. Picks up everything. Easy to use. Easy to manuever. Indestructible. Gets to the dirt other machines leave behind. More fun than 'Dancing With The Stars.' Buy it. You won't regret it.

Ordered this vacuum after trying miele and electrolux - this is a great vacuum. We have 2 dogs and seemed to always have pet hair around, no matter how often we cleaned. Tried the same test other reviews have mentioned - cleaned with my old vacuum, then went over the same places with the dyson. I was amazed at how much extra dirt and hair the dyson picked up. The ball technology really does make the dyson easy to move around the room, and the attachment make it easy to clean under furniture. The price I found at Amazon was actually cheaper than the stores in my area - this vacuum is worth every penny.

I bought this vacuum for our beach cottage, as we have sand, a lab that sheds constantly, and a long hair cat with us.  The other upright canister vacuum provided with out home lasted six months.This Dyson has been amazing, does the job both on hard floors and carpet, always picking up all of the hair and sand - plus everything else.  I am very impressed and would definitely recommend and buy again.

All I can say is.....I am a believer......Like you, I've seen all the commercials on TV, seen the ads in magazines. read friends' posts on Facebook and listened to my sister talk on about Dyson vacuums, but I kept putting off getting a new vacuum cleaner for years.  The one that I have been using works fine, but it was just missing so much....I'd vacuum and when I was finished, it looked like I hadn't even started.  All that it did, it seemed, was moved the dirt from one area to another.  With four cats and a dog, I needed something that cleaned.Well the Dyson Animal dc25 arrived today via UPS. I had just finished vacuuming the entire house with the old vacuum cleaner, so I thought, what better time to test the Dyson.  Putting it together was a snap (or according to the directions a click).  Within 15 minutes, I had the Dyson out of the box and ready to use.  I only vacuumed the living room, hallway and kitchen and I am embarrassed to say that I almost filled the canister.  This vacuum really works!  If you're like me, have pets and have putting off buying this vacuum, don't wait any longer; it's worth every penny.

column7: Nice looking vacuum, but is that it?
column8: To be fair, I only used this vacuum once so far. I received it for my birthday. I insisted this was the gift I really wanted. You might ask.....A vacuum? for your birthday? Ok, so I like to clean. I am not a neat freak, but keeping my floors clean is important to me. We have 1 dog and he doesn't shed too much, but I vacuum about twice a week. We have a combination of laminate and tile and 1 large wool area rug in the living room. There's still carpet in 1 room, but will soon be replaced with laminate too. We will be adding 2 more area rugs in the near future. Once we complete our flooring, we will have laminate throughout with area rugs only.Getting the Dyson out of the box and putting it together is a story for another day, but when I arrived home from work yesterday, my wonderful husband had it put together. I'm sure it was easy. I was just super tired the night I tried it....I finally tried it tonight. First impression is how easy it is to maneuver vs. my heavy Kenmore upright. Now mind you I've been using a 6 gal shop vac to vacuum non carpeted (kitchen, bathrooms, laminate) flooring. The shop vac follows me around closely enough, but not too close and I could easily use the hose and wand to get into the corners and near the walls. A little barbaric perhaps, but I was content with it. I grew up in a house with a ton of animals and we vacuumed every day. We always used a shop vac because it was powerful and could pick up bigger items. My old upright is just too heavy to drag around the whole place and the piece that keeps it upright is broken, so it falls easily. I weighed it and it's 20lbs. but feels much heavier. The detachable hose is virtually useless since it's so short.So back to the Dyson. I was memorized by the commercials and the hose 'looked' easy to pull out and extend to a long length. And again, it is easy to maneuver. I'll give it that. Nice nd light to push around. What is different is that when I run it over my fairly thick wool area rug, I don't see any track marks, so I can't really tell where I ran over the carpet. I don't know if this is normal or not? I am used to seeing them with EVERY vacuum I've owned. I don't know if seeing the marks is a false sense of clean and they really aren't supposed to or need to be there or what. I'll have to research more I guess.So now the wand. I pulled it out and started to extend the hose. The vacuum was up my butt as I'm getting a work out trying to maneuver the wand around the room. I couldn't move very far without the vacuum following close behind because the hose was so tense. I assume this will get better over time, but I pictured myself with the vacuum in the middle of the room and myself prancing about the room with the wand and hose getting in the corners while the vacuum stayed put. I guess not :/So maybe I am being hard on the Dyson. Or maybe my expectations were a little higher since the vacuum is so darn expensive. I'll try it out for a couple of weeks and see if it's just a matter of getting used to it. I hope it gets better and the hose loosens up. Otherwise I may look at something else. Electrolux perhaps? Or maybe a canister vacuum?BTW, The vacuum wasn't purchased on Amazon. Without naming names, it was bought at that BBB place. ;) But I posted the review here because I love Amazon and do a lot of business here.

After I spent the money on this vacuum, I realized that I have wasted money in my lifetime buying subpar vacuums.  I have bought Hoovers, Eurekas, Orecks, Kenmores in my search for the perfect vacuum and I think I have finally accomplished my goal.  It picks up animal hair, dust, and dirt like none other.  The ball is very easy to maneuver and the canister is very easy to empty (except for the dust that flies up when you do).  I also love the multi-purpose onboard tools that don't take up a lot of space.  The only difficulty I have is with the removable stretch hose.  It seems a little short and the vacuum always tips over when I try to use it.  We have a lot of long hair in our family so hair does collect on the vacuum brush.  Fortunately, it is a snap to remove to clean.  This vacuum sucks up so much dirt and hair that you have to empty the canister and clean the brush pretty often.  That is a small price to pay for a clean home!

We recently purchased this vacuum and LOVE it.  Some of the pros:  It transitions from carpet to bare/wood floors without having to manually move a dial on the machine.  I found that switching from the canister to the tools was a bit akward at first but now I absolutely love how simple it is. The stair tool brings in air from the side of the unit, not from the front where the bristles are which means you get a lot more suction than other brands. The roller ball makes manuvering super easy.  The only cons (which are minor) are:  There is no place on the unit to store the stair tool (meaning I have to remember where I left it) and the on/off switch is in a bit of an inconvenient spot - it is not easy to just flip it on or off quickly.  I have not owned it long enough to confirm that it doesn't lose suction over time but I could tell immediately that it has more suction than any vacuum I've used previously. I would highly recommend the DC25 Animal.

The first day we had the Dyson DC25, we vacuumed our boys' rooms.  Both room had been vacuumed that day, and still, sand and dirt were sucked up.  I clean a lot.  My youngest has allergies that flare up, so reducing dust is a necessity.  The design of the vacuum makes it easy to use.  The tools also maintain powerful suction - something I've never experienced with other vacuums.  Our carpets looked new and felt new to bare feet after being vacuumed!  This has been my favorite part about the vacuum.  I have to be honest, I didn't know if paying this much for a vacuum was a good idea.  Now, I'm convinced I'll never buy a cheap vacuum again!  The feeling of clean is worth it to us.  We found this at a local retailer, and had another retailer 'price match' because we had a 20% off coupon.

column7: It lives up to the hype!
column8: This vacuum is awesome!  I never thought I would actually get excited about a vacuum, but it's happened.  I did not think that there could be anything so spectacular about a Dyson to justify the price tag until I tried out a friend's.  I was already waiting for the vacuum I had to stop working because I hated it so much, but when I knew I wanted a Dyson, I could not wait!  Finally, my dreams came true and our crappy old Hoover started sparking and smoking!  I ordered the Dyson that night and could not be happier.  They work better than any other vacuum and are easier to use in general.  There's copy cats out there, but they are just cheap wanna-bes.  They do not have the technology of Dyson behind them and are light and flimsy.  This vacuum is not too heavy, but more-so better balanced so that it rolls perfectly and works with no effort. If you get the animal version (which I recommend because it comes with extras) you really do not need many more add ons.

I recently adopted a long haired calico cat, but this vacumn cleaner can handle it all, with the exception of an occasional accident. I am tempted to use it to pickup the cat, but whenever I fire it up, the cat vanishes. Also works when the cat gets on your nerves.

column7: A few flaws, but overall - love it!
column8: It took me three years to convince my husband that we needed a Dyson.  So perhaps I had my hopes set really high when I finally bought one.  It works really well on low to mid pile carpet.  The hand-held beater bar attachment is fantastic for carpeted stairs and furniture.  It isn't great on hardwood - doesn't pick up the big stuff, and I've noticed that when going from hardwood to carpet, a lot of fuzz gets stuck to the bottom of the vacuum and comes off into the carpet.  Easy to use and the ball really does make maneuvering around things easy.  Well worth the cost.

at first I wasn't impressed with the suction-didn't think it was better than my 10 year old wind tunnel-now I love it! Not very noisy at all compared to my old wind tunnel.  I used the wand for the first time today and fell in love with it.  Animal hair-I have lots-two Shelties live here and the hair forms balls in the corners, but this vac cleans it up nicely-so you have to empty it more often, not really that big a problem.  I am very impressed with this vac; happy there is no belt to fool with because I am hard on a vac cleaner; it is out everyday for something.The only complaint I have is the instructions on how to use everything is non existent-you need to go to a Dyson operating site and in seconds you know how to use the Dyson vac-5 stars for the  wheel design -just love the dyson.

Received my Dyson DC25 Animal vacuum 5 days ago what a beast and I mean that in a good way. My sons dog was here and I vacuumed with my old Eureka canister vac.when he left. I tried out the Dyson vac. shortly after and I was amazed at how much more hair it got out of the carpet. This thing is worth the extra money. The only thing that I would have liked is a longer cord as a lot of you reviewers stated.

If you are considering ordering this vacuum, the price on Amazon is great, this is a terrific vacuum that really does the job for what its worth.After years of hearing great reviews from other people who own a Dyson I figured it was time to invest in my own. The 5 year warranty made this decision a little easier. If a company is willing to warranty a product for 5 years, that must mean it is built to last. Other vacuums we owned in the past never made it past a year.What I like about this vacuum is how light it is. This is not heavy to carry up stairs, or from one room to another. It moves easily when in use, turns without any problems & gets into corners like nothing I've tried before. This vacuum sits low to the ground so it can fit under furniture that is raised up like a bed, chairs, and some places high enough for it. This does not take up a lot of space, so storage is easy.The canister is big enough for daily usage in my home, and we are amazed each time I run this through the house at how much stuff it pulls out of the carpets. The carpets look & smell clean after running the vacuum. I haven't used the attachments yet, but having them on board is such a convenience & they are not in places where they will fall off the machine, or get lost easily.Allergies are rampant in my home. We also have a large dog that frequently comes inside and was a problem before with all the shedding & dirt she brings inside. Now we do not worry, because this vacuum gets all the mess up easily & quickly.The day I bought this vacuum we ran out old one. Our old model is bag less, has a HEPA filter, & we thought was picking up all the dirt & hairs in our flooring. Right after running out old vacuum we ran the Dyson over the same floors & were amazed at how much the old one left behind. The Dyson picked up a powder substance from the flooring that we can only guess is dirt, or dust & hairs. We even commented on what we found as looking like the Dyson picked up pieces of the carpet itself, that's how strong the suction on this vacuum is.The price on these machines is high. I bought mine in a local store & paid much more than Amazon has this one for. If I had known about ordering it here I would have. I've seen the competitors vacuums & even owned a couple of them. They never lasted in my home longer than a year. None of them ever picked up all the dog hair, or allergens in my home either. I wanted to try a Dyson to see if all the people around me giving such great reviews was true & found out they are. Maybe this vacuum isn't for everyone's budget, or home. For me this was a lot less expensive than replacing a vacuum every 6 months to a year. If I can go at least 4 years without having to replace this Dyson, it will be worth every penny I paid for it.Hopefully everyone will have a good experience with this company & vacuum as I have.

Great product. The suction is great. The ball system is so much better to manuever than traditional vacuum cleaners. Very easy to empty. I love that the filters are washable. I have had it for 5 years and the suction is great. I always empty it when the canister is half full so the motor never has to work harder. I wash the filters every 3 months. I have three dogs so I vacuum every day. Best vacuum I have ever owned.

I LOVE this vacuum!  When my last vacuum died, I did alot of research on which type of vacuum to get.  This one came highly recommended, and I decided to bite the bullet on the price tag, and go for it.....SO GLAD I did!  The amount of dirt, dust, and pet hair that it picked up on the first use was disgusting!  I hope it continues to perform this way for awhile, but for now I am completely satisfied with my purchase!ALSO, The price on amazon was also the lowest I could find ANYWHERE!

column7: Great job picking up pet hair
column8: I ordered this vacuum one Sunday afternoon.It took the full 10 days to receive it.It was easy to assemble. The only confusionwas with the hand tools. It was difficult to readthe picture page. The tools are cumbersome to use.The cord is a little short (but I had read this in another review)However, it does a fantastic job picking up pet hair.

I have two shedding dogs. I wasn't happy with my vacuum cleaner. Decided to try the Dyson. I was embarrassed at how much fur and dander came out of my carpets! It really sucks it out. The hose is a little awkward to use but may relax with use. Taking the cannister off to empty is not the easiest thing either. But what it gets up is worth it.

I have four mega shedding dogs who use a dog door along with my extensive daily gardening.  In other words, we track dirt, fur, leaves, etc. all the time into the house and I am obsessive about CLEAN.  This Dyson is the best vac I have owned.  It was easy to put together, the length of cord is reasonable (although it could be longer), and the reach of the hose is great.  I used to have to hold the vac up with my left arm while I used the hose with my right.  As you can imagine, THAT was inconvenient.  It sucks the fur off everything!!  The only thing you have to be concerned with is any area rug with a loose thread as it pulls it out and around the roller, although easy to dislodge.  All in all, a great decision.
I absolutely love my Dyson DC25 Animal. I have never seen my carpets more clean.It's extremely useful with babies crawling around, definitely less hair intheir mouths. :D

We received the Dyson and the first time we used it we could not believe how great it worked on our laminate floors.  Our floors have never been so clean even after we moped them. After we vacuumed and mopped the floors they were squeaky clean.  The cleanest we have ever had them.  Would give it 10 stars if we could.

We bought this vacuum because we lost our old one in a cross country move. It was a great decision to get this one. This suction power on this one is awesome and very easily maneuvers. I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone.

Gets animal hair, dust ... everything every time! We used our other vacuum and then this one right after and were AMAZED by how much better this is. We have all hardwood floors and some rugs, and use this to clean the floors, rugs and furniture.

I was skeptical buying such an expensive splurge.  In the past I have always gone to WalMart and bought a wind tunnel type hoover vacuum for under $100.  They did the job, but as of late my old vacuum just was not cutting it.  To have it repaired to its former glory would have cost $100, so I decided to invest in a new one.  There-go the Dyson Animal.Well I assembled my new vacuum today and did a test.  I sectioned my carpet into 3 sections and vacuumed only 1 of the three with my old vacuum. I then vacuumed another section of the carpet with only my Dyson.  To visualize you would see one stripe of non vacuumed carpet, another stripe vacuumed with my old vacuum, and the last stripe with my new Dyson.It was insane the visual difference in the carpet! The first section looked black that had not been vacuumed at all, the second looked grey, the third that was vacuumed with my Dyson was a rich burgundy red, the color of my carpet originally.  BTW I have 2 cats: my black and white cat sheds a ton, so what I was seeing was not dirt, but pet hair.I compared the pickup of each vacuum canisters and my old vacuum hardly picked anything up at all.  The Dyson on the other hand picked up three handfuls of pet hair!  I then vacuumed the stripe that was previously done by my old vacuum and it picked up another handful of pet hair.  That's insane - I vacuum 2x a week.Bottom line is when you go Dyson, you never go back - my old vacuum is going on Craiglist in the FREE section as I feel too embarrassed to ask anyone for money for it.

We have a black lab and bought a house that is fully carpeted upstairs, including the staircase, and partially carpeted downstairs. This vacuum really does the job picking up all of the hair! Not only is it easy to use, even on the steps, but it works great at clearing the couch and furniture of hair as well. But don't be mistaken, it takes up EVERYTHING not just hair, its that powerful. The beauty part is that the clear container lets you see what it took up! :)

My husband and I have been dancing around it for the last year, undecided if we wanted to spend the money on this product or not.  Finally last week we broke down and purchased it.  It truly is worth every penny.  My carpets have never been so clean. The very first time I ran it, I needed to empty the canister, and my carpets had just been vacuumed a few days prior with the old one. I did my floors, vacuumed the cat hair off my furniture, and even ran one of the attachments on our bed spread because no matter how many times i washed it i couldn't get all of the fur off of it.  It works great.  I'm really glad we purchased this product and I hope others will too. :0)

I was not as wowed by this vacuum as I hoped to be. Its vaunted maneuverability is its best feature and maybe makes it worth the money. It weighs about what my old Dirt Devil ($75 from WalMart 10 years ago) but is so vastly more maneuverable that it takes much less energy to vacuum the whole house. I was afraid from other reviewers that the suction would be too strong and it would eat my rugs or pull threads from the carpets, but that is not the case. It does very nicely on the carpets and is kind to the Navajo rug. But the fluffy bathroom throw rugs it just doesn't do, period.My biggest problem with this vacuum is the attachments. The wand pulls out and the various attachments go on and off easily (with a satisfying 'click') but I think the designers were all 5'4' or less. The wand is too short, which makes using the (optional) floor tool very uncomfortable. I am 5'8' tall and I have to lean over to get the right angle for the floor. Also, the hose is too short and/or stiff to pull out far enough so the main unit follows right on my heels like a lonesome puppy. Perhaps that will improve over time as the hose stretches out.I have never had a 'good' vacuum before, but for the money I expected several magnitudes of improvement over the Dirt Devil and I just don't see it.

column7: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this vacuum!!
column8: I've had my Animal Ball since '09 and it's been one of the best investments I've ever made! My three story all-carpeted townhouse is home to myself, two cats, a 150-lb dog and my Italian husband who's thick curly hair sheds more than all three animals combined! I was appalled at how much leftover dirt, hair and dust the dyson picked up on it's first run and would never go back to any other vac. The ball makes it super easy to get every inch of the floors and the fun attachments get into all the nooks and crannies which cuts cleaning time in half. I used to dread vacuuming the stairs but with the mini-head attachment my stairs have never been cleaner and I don't hate to do it anymore, I absolutely LOVE this vacuum!One tip: If you have as much hair in your home as I do, the dyson tends to clog up... it's easily fixable and won't cost anything because the dyson warranty is foolproof, but going through their customer service is not so fun. They wanted up to 7 weeks to fix it and send it back, I don't know about you but I usually vacuum 2-3 times per week so that was NOT an option for me! BUT if you buy it through BedBath&Beyond they'll let you bring it to the store where they'll have one of their vacuum techs fix it on the spot or if they can't they'll exchange it right then and there! I brought mine in and walked out with a brand new vac in under 15 minutes!!Bottom line: The Animal Ball is well worth every penny! It's the best vac I've ever owned and the customer service from BB&B only made me love it more!

After have used a Dyson in the past I knew how amazing the product was. When It came to buying a vacuum for my family I had no other options. This vacuum was easy to assemble, easy to use and has incredible suction. It's a smaller upright vacuum so it's better for smaller spaces like apartments. I love it!

The Dyson DC25 Animal design and technology work just as advertised but with the following exceptions:What is it with the extension hose?  In the TV ad you see this guy take the hose and extend it across the room, that's ridiculous.  I'm lucky to get 3 ft. of length before I begin to drag the rest of the vacuum cleaner with me.  The hose is extremely stiff, almost as if the plastic is too thick.The attachments seem to be cheaply made, or is it that Dyson wants me to purchase their add-on attachments?It's a little overpriced.  Even though Amazon is selling the DC25 Animal at a substantial savings I still believe $439.00 is too high.OK, enough of the exceptions.  I do like its ease of use.  I can maneuver the unit with very little effort.  It's lightweight and the patented 'ball technology' actually works.  And the darn thing does have a very strong vacuum.All in all I really don't regret purchasing this vacuum cleaner.  Again I think it's just way overpriced and you don't get what you pay for.Dyson, work on that short hose and I'll give you 4 stars, 5 if you also lower the price $100. Yeh, like that will happen.

It was time to replace my well used Hoover Windtunnel and thought the Dyson would be a great choice.  Sadly I was wrong and I am returning it (bought it locally)The good:It does do a nice job of sucking up fine dirt/dust from carpet.It's lightweight and easy to maneuver.Pretty quiet for a vacuum.Sadly these pros don't make it worth the $$$What I don't like:The Cord is too short.  I don't have a large house but I have to unplug the vacuum to clean each room.Bin capacity is small and needs to be emptied frequentlyWand is awkward to remove and use - not user friendly.Hose has a small circumference and gets clogged easily (thanks to small toys/accessories the kids loose) my old vacuum had no problem sucking these up.The worst part for me is the brush bar area.  Today a piece of foam paper got sucked up and caught in the brush bar.  Tried to open the bottom to access that area and it was near impossible.  First, it takes a special screwdriver to open and even then it was extremely difficult.  My guess is you are not supposed to open it but then how am I supposed to clean/remove the hair that was wrapped around the beater bar????  This is probably the main reason I am taking it back.  Between my hair, my daughters hair and the dog, there was a lot of hair wrapped around the beater and I only used it 3 times!Off to search for something else.......

I love my new Dyson DC25 Animal Ball-Tech Upright Vacuum.  I have friends (with animals) who have raved about the first Animal Dyson but I wasn't in the market for a new one at that time.  Now that I am a Dyson-owner, I wish I had gotten one sooner.  This new model is very easy to maneuver and you can watch the animal hair pile up right in front of you in the canister.  I find myself vacuuming more often now that I see there is new hair left on the carpeting daily.  The wand/attachment is not user-friendly but I've never found one that is on an upright.  It's a trade-off and I choose this vacuum for its power.The reason I gave the vacuum a less than stellar rating is the power switch.  I used it twice before it went out.  Dyson was good about taking care of it with the warranty but it was still a hassle to tote a new vacuum to the repair shop.  The repairman said he always keeps a supply of Dyson switches on hand as that is a quirk/weak area with them.  So be forewarned about that possibility.I am glad I have this vacuum now but if I had known about the switch problems beforehand, I might not want to spend that much money on a less than perfect machine.

I have wanted a Dyson ball for a long time, and finally found one at a great price. It is worth noting that other than the color, the only difference from the All-Floors model is a pethair attachment. We have a golden retriever, but I have yet to use that attachment! If I had it to do over again I'd probably buy the all-floors model rather than the animal because it's less expensive and is the same vacuum minus the attachment I never use. But I would stick to the DC25 over the DC28.When I opened the package, which was beat up from shipping, part of the hose assembly had broken. Dyson has a 5-year warranty and they have their customer support line phone number right on the front of the vacuum! So I called, and the customer service guy was extremely helpful. I was having trouble explaining what was wrong, so he went and got one of theirs and compared it to what I was saying. They sent me a new part next-day mail! It was one of the best customer service experiences I have ever had. I love that they have all their products hanging out near the support line and that they're so efficient with replacement parts. It's been a year (of very heavy use) and so far I haven't had to call them again.I have always hated vacuuming. The loud noise, heavy clunky vacuum, and broken belts/brushheads that stop turning. This vacuum is still loud, but is so easy to use and feels light. The brushhead stops turning only if I want it to!(There is a button to turn it off/it turns off when you pull out the attachment from the top). Even with my long hair and the dog shedding, I don't have to empty the cannister more than once while I'm vacuuming our large 3-bedroom home, vacuuming once a week. I also love that I have yet to smell that vacuum cleaner smell after I use it/while I'm using it, which must be due to the HEPA filter. It's worth noting other HEPA filter vacuums I've had did still manage to produce that vacuum, particles in the air, smell. My husband is happier now because he doesn't have to do all the vacuuming anymore!My neighbors and in-laws live close by and come by to borrow this vacuum all the time. It probably gets used every other day and has yet to have a problem.I was debating between this model, the all-floors, and the larger DC-28. If I had it to do over again I'd always pick the DC-25, simply for it's ease of maneuverability. It gets the job done very well, I don't find myself having to frequently empty the cannister, and it's so easy to push around! I have yet to find the cord much of a challenge, although I do have to unplug it and plug it back in every 2 rooms or so. The DC-28 is heavier and larger and therefore more difficult to maneuver.

column7: Obviously designed by someone who doesn't use a vacuum cleaner regularly
column8: Admittedly, I have only used my new Dyson once.  It's much lighter than I expected.  I've owned canister vacs for years and I have to admit that it was nice not having to drag the canister around.  The Dyson definitely picked up a lot more dirt and cat hair than my canister vacs did.  I'm not loving the wand.  It's too long and very awkward to use.  The hose is too stiff to use the attachments comfortably.  This machine was obviously designed by someone who doesn't use a vacuum cleaner regularly.  It is designed as a vacuum 'should be' rather than as a vacuum that is easy and comfortable to use.

We are a family of 4 with 2 dogs and a long haired cat.  After going through several vacumms in several yrs. we decided to bite the bullet and purchase a more expensive one.  It was easy to assemble but I prefer written rather than pictoral instructions and the instructions for using the attachments, emptying the canister, etc. could have been more explicit.  I thought my carpets were clean before testing it out but I was wrong; the canister quickly filled although it compacted the debris unlike any of my other machines.  Using a 'ball' rather than wheels too a few minutes to get used to. There is no obvious way to attach the pet hair cleaning tool to the vacumm for storage unless I have yet to discover where it goes and if there is not one this is going to be a huge challenge to keep it from getting lost or broken. This tool quickly and easily pulled the dog and cat fur off my furniture. I would have given this 5 stars but for the lack of a on-board storage place for the pet tool and the cost. This unit is also quieter and lighter than any others we have owned.
Love the vacuum.  Wish the cord was longer.  The hose and attachments aren't as convenient as my old hoover, but they work fine.  Suction is great and easy to empty cannister.

I wanted a new vacuum to use on my oriental rugs.  I use central vac system for our hardwood floors, but it's just never done a very good job on the rugs.  We had been using an old upright on them.  I ordered this after reading all the positive reviews here. Let me echo what everyone else has said.  The vacuum did an amazing job picking up the dog hair and dirt out of our rugs.  In fact, like others have written, I was SHOCKED at the amount of hair and dirt picked up, since I had used the old vacuum only a few days ago.  And it is so much easier to manuever than our prior vacuum.  I can't speak to how it works on hardwood floors, as we use the central vac for them.My husband put it together very quickly, although he said the directions weren't very detailed.  But it's easily apparent how it all goes together.Very, very pleased with my purchase.  And Amazon's price was the best we found.

I don't like vacuuming, however, the Dyson makes the task easier.  I'm amazed at how deep it cleans.  With two dogs, I have a lot of dog hair in the house and the Dyson does a terrific job of picking it up.  The vacuum is also light enough that I am able to carry it upstairs. The Dyson is an exceptional vacuum for carpeting.

This vacuum does a fantastic job of hauling pet hairs and all sorts of dirt out of a carpet. However, the turbine head, which is the only difference we can see between this model and the ALL FLOORS model, just doesn't do it for getting pet hair off upholstery- at least not our pets hair(short hair Jack Russell).  It is easy to use and we would highly recommend the All Floors model.
I love this vacuum, I use it at least twice a week. It is very light and easy to maneuver and sucks up everything!!!! Totally worth the money!

This is the best vacuum cleaner I have ever owned. I have owned at least 5 vacuum cleaners. This vacuum cleans in one sweep of the carpet. The others I have used where not as good. I would have to go over the same area more than once. It is easy to maneuver. I'm an older person, so the weight of the vacuum was a major concern. I found the vacuum cleaner easy to handle.

Maneuvers nicely.  Attachments are both good and bad.  Good how it comes off the vac and you don't have to attach parts to the vac but stiff and unwieldy and a little short too. Good again because with my old vac I had to use the attachments every time to get dog hair that would go under cabinets etc, I only need to use this one occasionally because it pulls that out and is narrow enough to work those areas. Vacuums very well.

This machine is awesome.  It is easy to use with little effort to turn, it seems like it's gliding on butter.  It has super suction and cleans really well.  The animal attachment has removed all the pet hair from our furniture and car. It amazes me just how much dirt it picks up. I highly recommend this machine for anyone wanting a super vacuum.  It is well designed and an excellent value.

The Dyson is actually so much fun my husband, after 40 years, has finally vacuumed & zooms all around the house.  Best features; light, gets around anything & picks up more pet hair than any vacuum we've ever owned.  After the first cleaning I thought, wow, I was living in a hair pit! My friends came over after I told them just to get to try it out; I got a cleaning crew with the Dyson! Go Dyson!!
I own a Dyson DC17 Animal. The DC25 is a good vacuum, but the 17 is much better. After I ordered the 25 I found it cheaper by $15 at another site. Oh well.

Love how it gets up cat hair! Only reason I say I don't love it was the difficulty in figuring out the attachments and directions that came with it need to be improved. As a vacuum cleaner, I am happy I bought it...now that I have figured out how to use it!

We purchased the first Dyson Animal and loved it, we used it for many years.  It finally broke and we replaced it with a Eureka (my daughter loves it) and then a Dirt Devil (Husband's office loves it).  I purchased the new and improved DC25 and I love it.  We have 3 dogs and need a great vacuum with lots of capability.  It is easily maneuvered and does a great job.  I love vacuuming now, I bought the dusting brush dust surfaces, it was also a great choice.  I am so grateful to have a Dyson in the house again.

I did my research before purchasing.  I read all the negative reviews, shopped around and read more reviews.  I have a 2-story home, myself and my husband are very active and we have two cats.*This Dyson is easy to maneuver and light which is great for stairs.  The design of the vacuum also allows you to lean the unit down under areas other vacuums cannot reach, for example under a dining room table or a piano.  To reach these areas with the Hoover I would need to use the hose extension.*I have had no issues with scratching the hardwood floors as other reviewers have mentioned.  The brush is turned off when I'm on hardwood.*The accessories are well-placed on the unit and are easily accessible and returned once you're done using them.*I don't have an issue with the canister becoming full frequently.  Each floor of the house (~1800sq ft) filled the canister to the full line and I vacuum weekly.  Many reviewers have said this was an issue for them- but even so the emptying of canister is a simple, straightforward and quick process.*The hose on the unit is not as flexible as I would like, but it may be a function of the unit being new and not having had time to stretch properly.*The attachment for pet hair works great!  We have microfiber couches and the attachment picks up the cat hair better than the lint roller I used to use.  My Hoover also had a similar attachment and it was useless.*It picks up significantly more debris from our rugs than our old Hoover windtunnel.Yes, the unit is expensive and it also outperforms.

I just purchased this vacuum and would recommend it to anyone.  My old vacuum, a canister vac, just did not pick up anything on our hardwood floor.  I used my Dyson for the first time and could not believe it!  My wood floor literally changed color because the vac picked up all of the dirt!  We also have a low mat carpet that used to be hard to vacuum and it is now spotless too.  Attachments are excellent, one even acts like a duster.  5 star.

column7: Very good but not perfect machine
column8: After reading many reviews (including Consumer Reports) and trying this model in a store, decided to purchase.  We have 3 cats and were going through a fresh vacuum bag every other week (and at $5 a pop it was adding up).  The DC25 handles very well once you get used to it.  You can push/pull like a regular vacuum (sometimes I still do) but once you embrace the ball this thing really goes anywhere.Highs:-maneuverability-easy to push/pull-great job on pet hair (OMG watching the fur in the bin is funny)-very good job cleaning (great suction with tools)-neat little touches like the easy-to-remove hose/extension wand, removable roller and easy assemblyLows (you've read these before and they are true):-short cord (we have a small house so it's no big deal but it is noticeably shorter than our old vacuum's cord)-small dirt bin (has to be emptied every time after vacuuming the house)-could have come with more tools (I'm going to buy the dusting brush)-the dust bin is easy to empty (but sometimes fur gets stuck 'up' near the top so you have to use a wooden spoon to knock the clog loose)I would recommend this for anyone that likes an easy-to-use vacuum!
I had heard that it is a great vacuum. I thought the appearance would be a 'turn-off' to my wife. However, she loves it. It works great, and is an excellent innovative design.

I purchased the Dyson DC25 Animal over a year ago and thought I was happy with it.  It seemed to do a descent job.My mother gave me her old Kirby (about 10 years old), which I hadn't used since my new Dyson purchase.Last month a Kirby salesman does a demo in my living room with the new Kirby which is over $1000.  He then demonstrated using my old Kirby versus my Dyson DC25.  He threw a handful of baking soda powder around my living room carpet and proceeded to vacuum with the Dyson for about 5 minutes (no joke).  He then went over it with the Kirby for about 20 seconds.  The result is completely astonishing.  The Kirby picked up at least 10 times more baking soda powder.  I honestly don't think I'd ever use anything other than a Kirby for the rest of my life now.I must have made the Kirby salesman mad because all he really did for me is convince me to use my old Kirby instead of my new Dyson.If you ever have a chance to see a live demo from a Kirby salesman, it will blow your mind.  Be prepared to spend a good G though.

column7: The Animal can NOT be beat!
column8: The modern look of the Dyson Ball was enough to draw our attention.The name, The Animal, pulled us in closer.The reviews said it all.We brought this slick piece of technology into our home with a shaggy dog and cat, not too mention a messy engaged couple, and we are both beyond impressed! Each time I vacuum, the carpet looks like it has just been washed and we have one tricky entryway rug that our old vacuum could not clean up at all, yet The Animal has her looking spic 'n span!GREAT product. Highly recommended.

I replaced a 10 yr old Dirt Devil with the Dyson Animal Ball.  One of my biggest problems is this old shag carpet that came with the house and someday will be replaced.  The suction is pretty good even with my shag.  The vacuum does not turn easily, but again, I think it is the shag, because of the suction.  It is much lighter than my Dirt Devil was and my 8 year old son likes to run it too.  I have a fireplace with actual bricks, a nightmare to keep clean.  To get the cobbwebs off, I had to use a brush, but with the attachment brush, the vacuum sucked everything right off without scatering it everywhere.  The attachments itself are more of a con rather than a pro.  Using the attachments turns into a chore by itself.  It took me a while to figure out how to put the attachments together.  There is no easy swapping, so I usually vacuum first, then change the attachment.  The hose is hard to use and seems short.  It takes some strength to pull the hose to use it where you want and stretch it out.  The cord is also shorter than on my Dirt Devil, so I have to change outlets more often.  The container is pretty easy to open, just push the button and the bottom opens up and most of the dirt falls out (most, because if you have animal hair, it may stick to the center and needs some additional attention). I empty the container outside, make sure to not stand against the wind.  In all I like the Dyson.  It does a pretty good job.  Was it worth the price....maybe not.

We had a great vacuum- a hoover of some sort. It still works pretty well, it just is SO heavy and our home has three floors that need vacuuming as well as two sets of stairs. Lugging it around was getting tiresome. Plus, with 2 indoor cats (one with horribly LONG fur) and a shedding dog we thought a vacuum specifically designed for dealing with animal hair would be worth it. We vacuum 2-3 times a week due to a dust allergy in the family so I *thought* our floors were CLEAN. One pass through the house with this and WOW I had to empty the cannister because it was already at the max line!!! I swear, we are VERY clean people and yet it was disgusting how much fur and dust and just SAND came up! If this thing lasts, it is totally worth the money.

I thought my old vacuum was good, until it finally broke down and I spent the money on a Dyson.  I have two dogs and a cat at home, and this thing is amazing.  I did a quick run on my living room, that I thought was clean, and picked up so much hair that I was convinced my old vacuum wasn't even doing anything.  Great buy, especially for those with pets.

Other than packaging it was hard to tell this was not new.  This filled the canister the day after my maid service had vacuumed the house.  Lots of suction and the ball is a joy to pilot around furniture.  Easy to dump.  I've had excellent luck with factory reconditioned products and this is another out.

column7: This is the BEST vacuum ever
column8: I have a few cats and two dogs. This vacuum is simply wonderful at picking up pet hair, cat litter, pretty much anything my dogs bring in from outside too, like leaves and grass.  I really didn't want to spend quite so much on a vacuum cleaner, but I'm really glad I did, it's such a time saver, and it really does work!
This product works great. I would recommend it to anyone! It has lasted a long time for me and it is a good buy!

column7: Dyson DC25 Animal Ball-Technology Upright Vacuum Cleaner
column8: This product is way overrated and it is way overpriced. Hoover makes a better product at a much lower price!
I love it! I never realized how heavy vacuum cleaners are until I got the Dyson and it rolls so easy and goes around curves of furniture.

We tried a less expensive canister vacume by Hoover.  After realizing we did not like the canister style vacume at all.  Returned canister vacume and purchased this Dyson.  A little expensive but very happy with this product.

I had NO IDEA how much dirt and pet hair our carpets acquired in a week's time until we got a Dyson. I LOVE this vacuum and would definitely recommend it to anyone owning one or more Labrador Retrievers!
This vacuum is awesome. Does its job well and is highly recommended by me! A little tricky trying to remember how to disassemble but practice makes perfect! Collects every stand of cat hair!

column7: Wow It Really Picks Up the Pet Hair
column8: I really like how this vacuum picks up the pet hair.  I also like that I will never have to deal with a bag of pet hair.  I just hold the canister over the trash, push the button and out it falls into the trash bag.  It vaccuums up stuff on my hardwood floors too.  Don't expect much out of the attachment hose and wand- they are tough to use.My biggest complaint is that since it is not adjustable for carpet heighth vacuuming my heavier carpet makes my back hurt.

column7: Never Thought I'd Love a Vacuum
column8: After researching vacuums at all price points and types (robots, canister and upright) I bit the bullet and bought the Dyson.  For those who say 'not worth the extra money' I challenge them to run this machine over their carpets and furniture after their inexpensive models have cleaned. The morning I got my Dyson I had vacuumed my home with my old Kenmore canister and my thick pile rug still was not up to my standards. After revacuuming I confirmed my suspicions that my old machine was not up to the job of keeping my floors clean. I have tile, laminate, thick pile and mat area rugs, low pile wall to wall and industrial wall to wall carpet in my home.  Add two adorable dogs, one short haired and one nice and fluffy plus a family and you can see why the Dyson Animal was needed.  On the first run through the dirt collected was amazing, I had to empty the machine (easy) before it clogged.  My sofa looked like new after sucking off the dirt and dog hair.  All of the furniture was cleaned in a jiffy with the attachment hose that is right on the machine.You must be sure to completely close the dirt bin after emptying it because it will click into the vacuum and you can keep cleaning even if it is not pushed closed.  Then when you go to open it to empty the dirt bin the next time it releases all over the floor and the machine.  Just make sure it clicks closed after emptying it.The operating manual would be more useful if more detailed.  A DVD or web video would be very useful.Five year warranty.

This is the worst vacuum cleaner I have ever owned.  Despite its touted maneuverability, it is heavy and on carpets you will find yourself in a tug-of-war.  I actually hurt my back using it.  The much touted ball keeps you from getting under furniture, and the wand is awkward to use and a real time-waster.  Also, watch your rugs.  The suction was so great that it unraveled a hooked rug and ruined nap on an Oriental.  I fell for the ad.  Do not do likewise.  I am going back to my Oreck.  It's lightweight.  The DC25 does not edge well either.  The accompanying assembly and use directions are in diagram form and are laughably useless.  I have used my DC25 once and likely never will again.  It's plain awkward.  Hoover makes a turbo canister  that works extremely well and is lightweight and easy to use.  It does, however, deliver on its promise to remove dirt.  It puled a great deal of dirt and dust out of my carpets, but there are other options on the market that do as well with half the struggle and less cost.

I was so excited to get my new Dyson after seeing ads and reading reviews.  Brother, am I disappointed and I do wish I had saved my box because it would be returned for a refund. While the suction is fantastic, it makes it extremely difficult to use the tube! You can barely pull it out to use. Trying to do the stairs I pulled my whole vacuum down on me because I had to struggle to get the hose out!  Now the beater bar is wimpy!  When you have to run over sock lint 5-10 times to get is off of carpet then that is way too much work!  The ball technology is a great idea and does work but is it worth all those extra $$?  Not really.  Think carefully before buying and ALWAYS save your box!! LOL

column7: Didn't last long - Poor warranty coverage
column8: I purchased the Dyson DC25 Animal in December of 2010 and it worked very well for the first few months.  In March I noticed that the brush head was starting to rattle and the noise continually got worse despite thorough cleanings.  In April the motor started to run much louder and had a high pitch sound as it would power down.  I called Dyson support and they had me remove the brush head. We found that a groove was wearing toward the end of the brush unit. They also asked me to wash the filters and send the unit to the nearest service center.  I washed the filters with water as instructed and did not want to put them back in the unit while they were wet. I put them in a plastic bag and send them along with the unit to the service center. I got a call from the service center saying the filters and motor were wet and they wanted over $250 to replace the motor. I explained that I was told to wash the filters and left them out of the unit to dry. There would be no reason for the motor to be wet. They denied my warranty so I had them ship it back to me unrepaired.I will never buy from Dyson again and would not recommend this product!

I got this model refurbished from Amazon 3 months ago for my home use. I am of small build (only 5'4' 104lb)and for the past year and a half have been a professional house cleaner for a local university, so I have used a professional model vacuum for comparison. I also used an older yellow colored model Dyson for cleaning a private account, and was so impressed by how powerful the suction was, but was disappointed with its bulky profile which made it hard to take out of its closet and lug upstairs.My 6 and 8 year old children were very enchanted with the new rolling purple ball design of the Dyson, which made them want to help Mommy. What a joy it was that all three of us could operate it with ease! They can even dispose of the contents when they are through with the push of a button.The down side was that the refurbished model Amazon first sent to me had issues. In fact, it was a lemon. With normal use and filter maintenance, the vacuum was weak. Amazon cheerfully agreed to send me another vacuum right out, giving me 45 days to return the old one. The new one came to us in 7 days (standard delivery). I have been quite pleased so far with the new one. It seems to work the way it should. It's operating sound is even different. When I cut the power, there is a distinct whistling sound as the suction dies down. Maybe its 'pneuma' or breath is returning to Dyson much the way our breath goes back to God when we die.:)I agree with the other reviews that the suction is superior to other brands in general, but you will not find the newer models to be as powerful as the older model DYSON vacs, which-while they are turned on and attached to a surface-are as stubborn  as octopus tentacles to release when an attempt is made. But to me it is worth having a little less suction if it means making this gem of a vacuum easier to lug around, especially if it has to travel upstairs. And wow! Is the newer ball model ever nice! I feel like Bob Bonderant in femme form, zooming around the corners with it!:).

column7: More than a little embarrassing how much it picked up
column8: I have 2 long-haired dogs that shed in balls--or so I thought until I emptied the Dyson.  So much hair and very fine dust that my damaged Oreck had left behind.  Morbid curiosity led me to empty the canister after each room to see where the worst of the dirt and hair had hidden from the Oreck.  Long hair from my daughters' shared bathroom was enough to burn out the belt repeatedly on the Oreck, but so easily removed from the brushes on the Dyson.  Although markedly heavier than the Oreck, and difficult to maneuver the hose to vacuum stairs, I am really pleased with the difference in my carpet.

I have only had the Dyson Animal for 3 weeks, but so far I am very impressed with the suction and handling.  The extension wand isn't easy to navigate and I haven't found much use for the pet hair attachment. The plastic construction seems flimsy.  Yet it has a 5 year warranty, so I guess we'll see.  Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.

Love the vacuum as it is easy to use and cleans very well. But please be aware that this is not a full size vacuum, it is close in size but not quite. Also one drawback is the coord is somewhat short so if you have a large area to clean you may have to switch outlets frequently. I would definately buy again though.

I've owned several vacuums in my day including Hoover, Eureka, Sharp, etc., and I can tell you none of them hold a candle to this one.  We have 2 dogs, 2 cats, and 6 very active people in our house and they kick up a lot of dust, dirt, and hair and the Dyson 25 picks up everything.  The best part is the ease to unclog - all uprights will clog eventually, but you can unclog this sweeper and clean the roller completely without any tools in minutes - home run!

I'm the owner of 2 cats and my own hair is waist length.  Needless to say, a vacuum that can handle all three of us shedding is essential.  I've gone through several vacuum cleaners over the years searching for a good solution.  I am loving this Dyson.  It's light weight but very powerful and easy to use.  It sucked up a full canister worth of gunk off a carpeted room I have vacuumed a day before with my old, obsolete vacuum.  Switching modes from hard-floors to carpet is an easy to reach button.  My downstairs is a hodgepodge open layout of solid wood floors and carpet so it's great to have one seamless cleaning device.  Switching to the accessories is easy, too.I had to clean the bristles after only a few rooms, but it wasn't too difficult.  It was mostly because my waist length hair tangles up easily.It is a little odd (but in a good way) to use the ball-design.  It turns so easily that the movements you may be used to on a regular 4 wheeled vacuum are no longer ideal.  You'll end up in crooked lines if you don't pay attention to how you push and pull the Dyson.

We own a short-haired dog that sheds all the time, all over the house. We have all hardwood floors with large area rugs. The vaccuum certainly lives up to the hype and picks up all the hair on the rugs, which just helps to stop the tracking of hair everywhere else. However, I have noticed it doesn't work as nicely on the hardwood floors, and I would agree with another reviewer it does sometimes just blow the dog hair around. (I will continue to use my easier Swifter dust mop on the hardwood floors). The ball on the Dyson doesn't damage the hardwoods so that's a plus. I did take the vaccuum to my sister's place, she has different carpet, more like office building carpet and it didn't really pick up everything? I'm really not sure why. I still love the vaccuum because it does get all of our dog's hair and that's mainly what I wanted.

column7: DOES NOT PICK UP DOG HAIR!!!
column8: This vacuum is very overpriced for the little work it does. I have 2 labs and this is supposed to have no loss of suction. But it continually gets clogged. I have taken it apart cleaned it all out and guess what it works for a little and then stops sucking up the dog hair again. Also the pull out telescoping handle sucks. Every time you try to put it back you have to re-crinkle the tubing because otherwise it does not fit back where it is supposed to be. Also it is to big to try to fit under furniture so you have to move everything. Also the handle does not bend and it is difficult to use with the attachment. I will never use another Dyson.

column7: my daughter just loves the light weight & suction. great buy
column8: I bought this for my daughter because of the allergy feature. My granddaughter has very bad allergies & so far so good. Great for the stairs too because of the lightness.

I bought this vacuum because of all of the good reviews - and they were right!  I waited a long time to buy this because of the cost, but it is worth it.  It is lightweight and easy to maneuver, also easy to carry up and down stairs.  And the carpet is cleaner than ever.

I never thought I'd own a Dyson.  I thought they were kind of gimmicky.  After having a Kirby since 2000, and a Miele since 2002, we needed something to pick up the dog hair.  (One Akita, one lab, one rat terrier mix.)  Our vac's were NOT doing ANYTHING about the hair on the rugs and carpets.  Didn't matter how many times you went over it.Out of desperation, we ordered the Dyson DC25 Animal Ball from Amazon.  We clicked it together as soon as it arrived, and tested it in the worst room of the house.  In the first 5 ft. square area of carpet, we had to empty the overfilled canister.  (We didn't notice the 'max' line on it until later.)  We emptied the canister 7 times for this one room.  It picked up not only ALL of the dog hair, it picked up the nasty sediment that had worked its way into the bottom of the carpet without us being able to notice.  It was absolutely amazing, and the amount of grossness that it picked up was impressive.  The volume of dog hair vac'd up filled a tall kitchen trash bag up half way.  My husband and I just couldn't believe it.We also tested the mini brush tool on the first 3 steps of the stairs (also carpeted), and it FILLED the bin.  It is by far the best vac I've EVER used - mine or anyone else's!  Only one minor setback is the size of the canister/bin, but if you vac regularly, it shouldn't be much of a problem.  Especially when you compare it to the cost of filling up expensive Miele vac bags!

column7: Dyson sucks, no wait, it doesn't suck, it STINKS!
column8: This is the most overrated vacuum ever sold.....a marketing scam of the highest order.  Let's see.....it barely picks up even the lightest dust or specs, the hose attachment fights against you constantly and even the nozzle attachment--which supposedly focuses all of Dyson's suckiness into a focal point--fails to even pick up dust less than a micrometer away.  Kudos to Dyson's marketing folks and legal teams for keeping the scam going.  That's it, from a very, very unsatisfied customer.  I never write customer reviews unless I am really P.O.'ed!  Ps.  I originally bought a Dyson for my home in Seattle but ended up throwing it away in favor of a cheaper but much better functioning vacuum, an older brand name.  To my dismay, I recently saw a new Dyson in my ex-wife's closet in New York.  I gave it a go and guess what......JUST AS BAD!!!!!!!!!!!  Ugh!!!!!!!
I love it.  I had a Dyson previous to this one and it was amazing as well, but OMG!!! This pne picks up everything!!

I bought a DC07 Animal about 6 or 7 years ago and it was, and still is, a great machine. So I had no qualms about getting a DC25 Animal a few months ago. I soon found that I couldn't vacuum the entire house with only one outlet change, it now required five! The difference between the DC07's 38 foot cord and the DC25's 24 foot cord, is the difference between enjoying vacuuming and being annoyed by it. I see the newer DC28 Animal comes with a 35 foot cord. So only we DC25 owners got screwed. Otherwise, it's a good machine.

column7: Hose notwithstanding, the best vacuum ever
column8: I have pets, and I have only begun to enjoy using this vacuum. It is very expensive but (hopefully) worth the $$$. I actually look forward to vacuuming now. As a floor vacuum (on carpet), it beats out my shop vac, and has become the best vacuum I have ever used. The suction is top notch. The handle is weighty, but doesn't hurt my wrists. I don't feel like I've done anything strenuous when I'm finished vacuuming. The Dyson was heavier than I expected, but easy to manuever from room to room. The cord is extra long and the vacuum doesn't usually roll over it, unlike another upright that I own and my shop vac. The filters look easy to clean. The dirt cup is easy to empty, so long as you hold it over the trash bin and gently tap it against the sides. (I found a swiffer duster handy to clean any remaining debris inside the dirt cup.) The vacuum is almost too easy to twist on the hard floors, so I think it does a much better job if you have carpeting, and the carpet looks like it has been vacuumed afterwards. I tested mine the first time just two days after using my other upright and was amazed at the amount of dust and dirt and who-knows-what-else it picked up. Now the hose: It may take some getting used to. The hose does seem the normal length to me, but it is very stiff. However, the vacuum does not fall over (like my other upright) when you fully extend the hose. I liked the benefit of having a handle on the hose but it also isn't a benefit if you need to vacuum something close to you, for instance, couch cushions. Fortunately, the handle can be disconnected and the hose used just like any other vacuum. Overall, I would say this is mainly a floor vacuum and best for carpet. For the quality of performance, I cannot give it less than 5 stars.

column7: Hose too short - poor customer service
column8: I own a Dyson DC25 Animal.  The vacuum works well on flat carpeted floors.  However, the accessory hose isn't long enough to do stairs or anything else that requires a reach.  My stairs on not the tall, 11 steps, but I can't get the accessory hose to reach the top step enough to clean it.  I called Dyson support to be told that they do not have an extension hose or any other way to solve the problem.  For a company that claims to solve the problems others don't, they don't seem to solve the problems that others do.
Absolutely amazing vacuum cleaner. I've owned it for approximately two hours and I can't believe how much hair and dirt it has picked up.Thank you Dyson!

column7: Good vacuum, overpriced with a few flaws
column8: A qualified 3 star rating- Just got my Dyson a few days ago.  Purchased at BB and B for $319.00-included an in-store promo for 150.00 off plus a 20% off coupon.  Best deal I could find on a new one.  Not sure I would have paid full price for it.  The price I paid seems like a good deal for the vacuum.  Easy to assemble and did an amazing job cleaning area rugs, wood floors and berber style carpet.  WOW- would  give it a 5 star if that is all I had to vacuum.  Cleaned our thick/high pile carpet well, but does not fluff it at all.  I moved some furniture and usually use the vacuum to fluff up the carpet where the feet were- did not do anything.  Had to get the old hoover out to do this.  Carpet got very clean- much cleaner than from the old hoover, but did not look freshly vacuumed.  Felt like I needed to vacuum twice, once with the Dyson to clean and a second time with the old hoover to make it look refreshed.  Just finished doing the stairs- the telescope wand is really quite useless and awkward for this.  Ended up attaching the small roller brush directly to the hose and carrying the vacuum with me up the last half of the stairs.  Again cleaned great but no fluff- feel like I again need to redo with the old vac.  I do like the small hand held beater brush attachment- excellent for stair and furniture.  Cleans much deeper than the attachments on my old vac.  I do think the telescope wand will be useful for cleaning up high and down low (baseboards) just have not tried it yet.  Not sure the Dyson ball makes it much easier to use as the vacuum is a bit heavy and takes a lot of wrist action to turn it.  Emptying the canister is a snap- much easier than I thought it would be.  Highly recommend you empty it in trash bins outside.  Otherwise would be putting quite a bit of fine particle dust into the house.Cleaning power- 5 starPet hair- 5 starFluffing power- 0 stars(If you do not have high pile carpets- this could be a great vacuum for you- I would have given it a solid 4.5 stars if not for that)I think I would have bought the highly rated Hoover wind tunnel anniversary edition instead if it had not received such poor marks for reliability.  Though at $229.00 full retail- on sale for around 190.00- it is a cheaper way to go.  It did received the highest ratings from Consumer Report though they would not recommend it because of reliability issues- too bad.

column7: Does what it says, worth the money.
column8: This does exactly what it says it will. It was extremely easy to get out of the box, and I snapped it together in less than 5 minutes with out even reading the instructions. This is a huge deal for me since I am the worst at assembling products.It cleans a 2200 square foot house easily. I will say the wand is a little awkward but the accessories store on the vacuum and its easy to pull off and get the edges and ceilings. This gets up pet hair, and messes left behind from two small kids. Sand, dust, dirt, and fuzz are no match for it.The canister dumps and attaches with a simple snap. You cannot ask for an easier way. My older cheap vacuum required it to be taken apart and it usually spilled more dust than I got in the trash can so this is a MAJOR plus for me. You have no idea!!I recommended this for my parents. They bought one and really love it.All in all, this is an extremely expensive vacuum. However I think it lives up to its expectations and I would definately buy again. If purchased with a sale, plus a promo code, you can find a decent deal. Shop around!

Having never owned a vacuum that cost more than $100, I was hesitant to shell out the big bucks for a weird vacuum that looks like a Plastic Praying Mantis. But wow, I gotta tell you this thing is the best thing that I've purchased in the last 10 years. In short, IT WORKS. The Dyson replaced a dependable but dated Hoover. I thought the Hoover did a good job on animal hair.....but the first time I used the Dyson in my living room it picked up 8 full CANISTERS of hair the Hoover had missed. Whoa. What a HUGE improvement.Goods - Sucks like a tornado- Most quiet vacuum I've ever owned- Featherweight, easy to lift and maneuver- Most popular appliance in my house, bar none.- Looks like something out of The Jetsons.- The accessory stuff is built ON, and actually works, once you figure it out.- The discharge air feels and smells clean- Virtually dust freeBads - All plastic construction, feels kinda flimsy.- The canister is small, and like a Chinese puzzle to get apart, and even harder to reassemble after emptying.- The accessories are built in, but folded up like origami. Good luck. I have a Masters Degree, and still had to ask my kids to help.All in all, the Dyson was a great purchase, despite the sticker shock. If you need real help with animal hair, this is the vacuum for you. I give my strongest recommendation to this product. It WORKS. Worth every penny.

column7: Best vacuum I have ever owned - by FAR!
column8: I had no idea how little my old vacuum was doing until I ran the Dyson over my rugs for the first time - I was simultaneously amazed and disgusted!I was prompted to buy a new vacuum when, only hours after running the vacuum throughout my place, I sat down on one of my area rugs to play with my 20-pound (but extremely fuzzy) dog.  Hair everywhere!  It was as though my vacuum hadn't sucked up anything (despite it being less than 2 years old).  After doing considerable research on various models and reading customer reviews, I decided to spend more than I had initially prepared myself to spend and buy the DC25 Animal - and I haven't regretted it for one moment since! My place feels infinitely cleaner since buying this vacuum.To address a couple of the concerns raised in several reviews I read prior to purchasing: the size of the receptacle and the ease of assembly.  The size of the receptacle is more than adequate and the ease with which it can be emptied would offset its size even if I had found it to be on the small side.  With one hand and a light tap against the rim of the garbage can, it was empty.
