Additionally, assembly took me (literally) 5 minutes - it's extremely easy.I would recommend this vacuum to animal owners without hesitation.Pros:SuctionEase of assemblyProduct weightManeuverabilityCons:Definitely on the expensive side (but, as I said, well worth it)

column7: An overpriced, overhyped, underperforming piece of crap
column8: At the urging of a close friend's wife, who has one, I bought a DC25. She raved over how easy it was to use, how it never needed a bag changed, and how well it 'sucks up everything but the color out of the carpet!'.  I used it for a month, trying to be generous and give it the benefit of the doubt.  After a month of putting it through every pace I can think of, here's my conclusion...It's junk.  Crappy, expensive junk at that.1) It doesn't 'suck up everything but the color out of the carpet'.  In fact, the only thing about it that sucks is how poorly it performs in light of the marketing claims.  Yeah, you can see stuff swirling in the canister.  Big deal.  Problem is there's a whole bunch of that same stuff it left in your carpet.  The hose from the beater head to the dustbin is way too small, the suction motor is puny, and the beater head is, at best, vestigial.  Overall the thing just doesn't work well.  Period.  The 50 yr old Kirby I inherited from my grandmother could suck this thing back through its own hose. (More on that hose later...)2) 'You never need to change a bag!'  Sure, but you have to take a shower every time you empty the dustbin.  Want to know what it's like to empty the thing?  Get a half gallon pitcher, fill it 1/3 full with pastry floud and 10X (very fine) powdered sugar.  Now try to pour it into a trash can or dumpster without the poweder flying everywhere and sticking to everything.  That's what emptying this damnable canister is like.  And that's AFTER you figure out how to get the rickety, frustrating latching mechanism to work.3) All the attachments are onboard.  Correct, they are.  The procedure for getting the hose uncoupled and attached to the 'extension wand' (the handle, which you have to pull out of the machine) is just as complex as switching from the beater head to the hose on the afotermentioned Kirby.  It's no advantage other than having it right there and not having to walk the ten feet to the closet to get the hose.  Big friggin deal.  And the attachments don't work all that well anyway because the vacuum not only has no suction, it also moved no air. (see item #1 above)  Which brings us to...4) The attachment hose.  Yeah, it's onboard.  Yeah, it's convenient to pull out and hook up.  It's also un-reinforced along its length and is CONSTANTLY trying to collapse back into its unextended state.  In other words, the thing is always fighting you.  If you pull the hose out to its full length and let got it instantly snaps back into the collaped position, and with a fair amount of force, too.  It pulls the vacuum around after you like some way-to-friendly dog that's forever underfoot or right in your face. On a hard floor I can't even get the hose to extend unless I physically restrain the vacuum in some way.  Even then the hose is trying to pull itself back to the vacuum all the time, making using the hose-end attachements that much more frustrating, scooting the vacuum over to you, or tipping it over.5) The Dyson is light and easily maneuvarable.  Yes, it is, but so is my bedside trash can.  And the trash can holds more and is easier to empty.6) The heavy duty motor pulls 11 big amps!!  Yeah, and?  I can pull a full 15 amps by shorting the cord.  So?  How much power the motor uses has exactly zilch to do with how the vacuum performs.I tried.  I really did.  I went through all the motions for a month hoping I was doing something wrong and wanted to justify the price and the hype.  But in the end the Dyson simply didn't live up to the marketing.  It's a product made for being pretty on TV first and performing second (or maybe third, fourth, or fifth, for that matter).  It just doesn't work well at all.  I ended up selling it on Craigslist and getting a reconditioned Kirby G5 for the same money.  Yeah, it's heavier and I have to carry an attachment or two around with me, but it actually WORKS!!  If it lasts as long as the one I got from Gramma (which still works like a champ) then I'm money wayyyyyyyy ahead.

I have purchased numerous vacuums, from inexpensive to very expensive, and was wondering if I should invest in the Dyson Animal or not. I can honestly say that I will never be without one again.  It is powerful, without being heavy, and the ball technology makes it so easy to maneuver.  I have bad back problems, and usually have to take several breaks when I vacuum my carpet and linoleum, or tile.  Not with this machine.  It is so powerful, that I do not have to continually go over the same spot, and it gets the job done without being so heavy that it hurts to pick it up or maneuver it.  It is so easy to empty the canister, and I'm still amazed at what it manages to pick up.  I thoroughly vacuumed prior to using the Dyson (DC25) and was mortified when I saw how much more it vacuumed up.  I don't care how many times I empty it, because I realize how much cleaner my home is becoming. I can go from carpeting to tile without sending dirt 'flying' if I forget to turn off the 'beater brush' - it is all picked up and contained.  We live in the country, with many various types of poultry, fowl, equine, and our indoor cats and dogs.  There is no telling what is being tracked into my home, as my husband isn't very careful about removing his shoes or boots.  I no longer worry about any of this, because my Dyson Animal will take care of it.I always thought that buying a Dyson would be a big 'splurge', and could not possibly work so much better than other vacuums, or be worth the extra money. I regret wasting time not having one. I regret buying all the bags and belts for all my other machines.  I regret buying all the other machines - period. After much research, I convinced my husband that we needed to at least try it out and found the best price on Amazon.com.  We are both in complete agreement that it was actually a very wise purchase, and wish we'd done it much sooner. I do not have to spend as much time vacuuming over and over, and I appreciate the fact that I know it will take care of the toughest jobs.  LOVE IT!!!*One word of advice, get the Dyson soft dusting brush if you do a lot of dusting - it's great for blinds, tables, tv screens - any flat service.  It is a time saving tool that really works, and works well.

This is my very first Dyson and so far I'm VERY pleased with it! Takes a little getting used to as far as moving it around (because of the 'ball'), but handles great.  I was amazed at what this picked up.  Worth the $$.
Works great, quiet, easy to use and light weight.  Extremely easy to assemble.  Wish the bin would hold more.  Worth the price!!!

I have owned a Kirby for 38 years; it was throwing out more dust than it picked up.  The new Dyson is wonderful; we have 2 cats and the air is so much cleaner. So is the furniture.  Also, it is light enough for me to push (couldn't with the Kirby, husband did it) so he's happy he doesn't have to vaccuum anymore!  Would definitely recommend this product.

column7: Worth the money after one vacuum!
column8: So like most people I was a little put off by the price of this. I mean who wants to spend that much on a Vacuum?!? Our other ancient vacuum died and it was about time for a new one. I researched different brands for about a month when deciding on this one. It shipped in less than a day which was nice. We took it out of the box and assembled it and went to town on our living room floor. We only did about half the room before we had to empty the can- WOW is all I gotta say!! You should have seen what came out of our carpet! We have two dogs and a cat who do shed. It was pretty gross. This Vacuum in worth EVERY penny! Our carpet looks brand new now, and soft too! If you a debating this vacuum I say go for it!We've only had one issue with suction loss *it was due to my husband sucking up plastic* and he didn't secure the hose back into place on the side so it wouldn't suck until he figured out he had to snap the tube in place. But that was user error lol so no problems with our vacuum yet!

column7: If there are any balls that you want to grab, grab the Dyson!!
column8: I received my item today. I read tons of great and bad reviews and I must say, I am going along with the great ones. I do not wear my shoes in my house, have a 18 month old, no pets, and yet this vacuum really showed me how horrible my other vacuum was. For those who left messages about the cord being too short, I believe it is perfect length (now less cord I have to run over) for one room. Also about the canister being too small, I ran the vacuum through the whole house and did not have to empty it once (it never came close to full). Then again like I mentioned before I don't wear shoes in the house and have no pets so what ended up in the canister was no surprise. The attachments are wonderful as well. It took me a few minutes to figure out how to disconnect the top but once you get a hang of it,its a breeze. I would recommended this Dyson Vacuum to everyone and anyone.

column7: The best thing to happen to housekeeping since the electric washer
column8: The Dyson Animal lives up to its promise to thoroughly clean carpets, etc. Despite Consumer Reports rating which is less than stellar this is truly the vacuum to purchase. Maneuvers like a dream, empties easily, and cleaning filters is simple. Love this machine.

This is the best money I have ever spent. I can't believe how clean my carpet is or how many times I filled the canister up just vacuuming a small room in my house. I also love the wand. It has great suction and makes it really easy for me to reach both the ceiling, the floor and under things, for example, my entertainment center. I have seen others complain about the wand and I may like it more than most because I am very short (5') and have a hard time reaching things in general. My only regret is that I did not purchase it sooner.

column7: Amazing Vaccuum Even For Dust & Animal Hair!
column8: Wow! Thank you Dyson.This vacuum was easy to set up, it had a pictorial instruction manual that even a child could use.My carpet is very shaggy and I have a cat. I had not vacuumed in several weeks because my old hoover was a piece of junk, and this vacuum cleaned my entire place like a breeze. I could not believe how much dust and animal hair this vacuum was able to pick up. My carpet literally took on a brighter shade since I used this product than when we first moved in.The attachments are amazing as well, the small handle vac attachment makes this model worth the purchase for animal lovers, I was able to use this on my cat's furniture and it removed the built up hair and dander with ease.I feel like I can breathe again. I am an asthmatic with seasonal alergies and this vacuum has the ability to lift dust from all types of surfaces where other inferior vacuums fail. And this vac. even has a reusable washable H.E.P.A. filter! This vacuum beats any other 'allergy' safe vaccuum I have ever used in the past, especially since you don't have to replace expensive parts on a frequent basis.Sorry to make this so long, but there is just so much to say about all of the awesome features this vaccuuum has: The ball makes menuvering this vac. a sinch. The removeable handle attachment allows me to reach and clean my ceiling without breaking my back. You can even turn off the brush spin for smooth floors (Screw sweeping, you no longer need to!). This vac is so light that I am surprised there is an even lighter compact model available.The only cons I could barely conceive of are the small size of the canister and the way the long handle rests on the hose a little when you use the hose without it. But the funny part about these cons are that the canister is so easy to empty it takes you less than a minute and you can go back to vacuuming (secondly my carpet was REALLLY dirty). You are able to retrieve any items you may inadvertently suck up when you do this (like one of my favorite earrings and a mousy cat toy eheh..) Also, the handle doesn't really effect the way the hose is able to suck up pretty much everything.There's so much more, but best of all my boyfriend now thinks its awesome to clean with this vacuum (because it looks cool and works so well) so, now I have to wait to have a turn to use it.The Dyson DC25 Animal is definitely worth the money, especially since this vacuum even has a 5 yr warranty with Dyson. I will never buy another cheap department store piece of junk that I would have to spend the same amount of money to replace every year, buy replacement filters for, buy bags for, buy stinky rubber belts for, or...etc.Simply Dyson all the way! (Sarcastically: Wow, Engineering works!)
This vacuum picks up everything!!! I am amazed that every time I vacuum it picks up some much hair!!!  The only negative thing I have to say it the price... (its worth it so far)

I was super excited to purchase this as my first Dyson product.  I had a 5 year old Bissell that definitely needed to be maintained after every use.  However we have 4 cats and plush carpeting.  This performed miracles!  I couldn't believe how nice it made the carpets look and how much ended up in the canister.  I had read reviews about other possible heavier Dysons and I think this is perfect.  It is easy to put together out of the box and very easy to maneuver.  It also did great in the bathroom where we have the litter box and linoleum flooring.However, I got the biggest kick out of my bathroom mats that look so flat after a short time and a few washings. It puffed them right back up and got the typical lint out of them.  I highly recommend this product for cat owners!

This vacuum is amazing! I have had it for a little over 3 years now and I love it. It still runs like a champ. Anytime I have had problems I simply call the Dyson customer service and the helpful people talk me right through it (I must mention all my problems were user error, not mechanical). My husband once used it to suck up water off the carpet, I was worried that he had ruined my very expensive vacuum, but even doing that the vacuum still runs like new!I have a big fluffy long-haired German Shepherd and this vacuum does the trick keeping my house nice and fur ball tumbleweed free. The attachments are great, but I don't think they are worth the extra $60 for the Dyson animal. I use them but not enough to justify the extra $60.I have a lot of hardwood and this vacuum is great on the hardwood as well as the carpet.The ball was a little tricky to get used to, but now that I am I love the ball and could never go back to stationary vacuums. Long story short you get your money's worth with Dyson.

I have had this Dyson since November and I am amazed on how much dog hair this has picked up. It lives up to it's billing.  The two things I'm concerned about is that it feels like an overpriced Cuisinart that is about to break with all it's plastic parts. This is very noticeable when you remove and empty the canister. Also, the telescopic hose is difficult to use on a staircase, since it wants to recoil once stretched out so you have to brace the vaccuum against something. Not sure if I will buy another one, depending on Dyson's customer support if I need to contact them.

column7: great on paper, in reality not so great
column8: 20 months ago...we bought a house...with an infant in the house and another one on the way...we wanted the best vacuum we could afford...after many raving reviews we bought the dc25 animal plus....the plus version comes with extra accessories wich we thought was great, but we quickly realized that only to accessories can be mounted on the vacuum it self...the rest have to no where to be mounted, and left in the bottom of our closetfew months after purchase the downsides started to show, pulling out the wand and it would often have little or no suction, putting the wand back and out again sometimes fixed this, the vacuum went in for repair for the first time...shortly after it happened again this time a piece of plastic hinge failed again the vac sat in the shop for 14 days, which sucks when you have two infants in the house, dogs dragging in filth. then a seal failed and again we had to wait 14 days to get it fixed after that it functioned as it should for about 6-8 months, then it broke down again, once more a plastic doohickey cracked and the valve switching from floor sucking to wand sucking wouldn't work, there is so much pressure on this hinge that superglue or component glue cant fix it....so back to repair we ended up getting a completely new machine, after that it has worked for 12 months because we have learned to very carefully insert the want into its place after use...if you just drop it down fast the plastic hinge will failpro'sbag less it has saved us a ton of money with the amount of dirt this household generatesgood sucking in the beginninggreat brushes on the motor head, really gets carpets clean when suction worksand thats it, its the only good thing that comes to mind, unless you count its good looks but that is in the eye of the beholdercon'sbrittle/fragile plasticcomplicated design with lots of gaskets/seals and places where false air can get inwont pick up small pepells, raisins, small leafs, paper from shredderno hight adjustments for the brusheslooses suctionbrushes are worn to the point, where it just combs the pethair in the carpet but doesnt beat them loose or suck them up...even though sucking is working properlywand hose is too stiff and tight that instead of extending the vacuum will fall overcanister has very little use able space so you have to empty often....especially with pethair or new carpets where fibers still comes off..if you have dust, sand etc then it holds a good amount, but long fibers fills it up fastair coming out of the vacuum is pushed forward, the blows pet hair etc away from the vacuumball is a gimmick, this vacuum have trouble even getting under kitchen cabinets where the door hang out 2 inches from the floorboardsscratches very easily, the machine looked old after just a couple of months useplastic is very static, holds on to pethair and dust making the vacuum dirty on the outsideemptying the canister is easy, unless fibers have made a hairball that has made it up past the fill line...then you have to take it apart leaving...easy but leaving you with dirty hands, if your in a apartment and cant go outside to the garbage bin, this will be frustrating, as you will be dumping a good part of dust around your freshly vacuumed floorball makes it look easy to maneuverer but when leaned back to vacuum under chairs and tables its still so tall that its hard to dolooses sucking and hard to find out where and whats gone wrongits bagless yes...but you still have two filters that requires washing, the cyclone ducts will fill up with dust particles and sucktion will decreasebristles are made of carbon fiber, here 20 months old, they have worn alot, and the bristles have somewhat lost their effecti will not buy another dyson....the principle and all is fascinating, but the mechanical design is flawed, plastics are cheap ones, the hose is too stiff to use the wand, cant pick up small stuff like raisins or leafs, only hair and dust, sometimes even sand is left behindour kenmore canister 150$ vacume has been pulled out of hiding....it uses bags, but for the price difference between 500 and 150 dollars leaves us 350$ to buy bags...thats going to be a lot of bags ! and even though its old it still gets out more dirt than this dyson....dyson is more of a status symbol than anything else

Since we purchased our Dyson it has proven, every time we use it, that it is the best upright vacuum we have ever had.Only drawback is the hose for the attachments.Its tension to recoil back into shape is way too strong so you're always pulling the unit along with you.Especially on a bare floor.Maybe a design change would be to be able to lock the wheels when using the attachments.This vacuum is way too awkward to vacuum stairs.Other than the hose, this is the perfect vacuum.Well worth every penny spent on it.

column7: Could be better... a whole lot better
column8: After 15+ years of having a Kirby, which worked great but weighed a ton, I was happy to get the Dyson. We have dogs and kids, so our vacuum gets daily use. At first I was thrilled, mostly with the lighter weight. But over time some big flaws have come to light that make me miss the Kirby which still works, but the power drive is broken so it burns the motor to use it for too long - otherwise I'd go back to it for better cleaning. Here are the issues with the Dyson. The cord is way too short, the hose is way too short, the hose suction is terrible, the attachments that come with it are completely useless, and it's worthless on hard floors. I'm torn on the bagless concept. On one hand it's great not to have to deal with bags. On the other it's a dusty mess that requires more cleaning to keep it semi-decent. The lack of a belt also has it's downsides. If you don't clean the Dyson roller after every use then it grinds down the spinning post in the head with no warning until it's gone. The only fix is to replace the entire head at $100+. It doesn't stop working or warn in any way that the head is sticking. And it doesn't take long for it to grind up. I really like to use hose attachments for dusting and the puny attachments that come with it are absolutely worthless. I took my Kirby dusting attachment and crammed it onto the Dyson crevice/dusting device. The little spinning head attachment just gets almost immediately crammed up with hair. Just one more roller to clean. And the hose suction isn't enough to make it spin once it gets a few hairs on it. We moved from a place that was mostly carpet to all hard floors and now I'm really, really not liking the Dyson at all. Turning off the roller for hard floor use just makes it blow dirt around and gunk up the roller with whatever sticks to it in the attempts to get sucked in. The thing can't get under furniture at all. The hose is the only way to clean a hard floor and without a flat head to dissipate the suction it's useless. So now we're expected to spend another hundred bucks to get a decent floor attachment and dusting attachment. But dumping more money into it doesn't address the ridiculously short hose. The short cord I could deal with annoying as it is, but with a hose that short you pretty much have to carry the main vacuum around with you or it's pulling around and tipping over. In that little product pic for using the hose they should add a ghost image of it slamming the lady in the back of the legs. On steps you must carry it even on a smaller staircase. Now we have a long steep 'old house' staircase, so the short hose and short cord work together for supreme frustration and potential deadliness because we must do half the staircase (carrying the thing) then unplug, replug, and do the other half (still carrying the thing) which is less than stellar on a steep wooden staircase. Add to that the fact that the only 'handle' is the one on the canister which makes for barrels of laughs when you accidentally hit the button and spill dirt everywhere while you're cleaning.All in all, I was very excited to get a Dyson - but for such a hyped and pricey product they really could have done a better job with the design and included attachments that actually work instead of making people dish out even more money to make it into a remotely functional product. I would not buy another nor recommend it to anyone. And I'm really hoping it has mortal issues soon (perhaps involving a steep staircase) so I can replace it with something that works. The Kirby did cost more and was cumbersome, but it was a great workhorse that not only came with a super long cord, super long hose (that you have to remove the head to attach) and good attachments, but it also came with a shampooing unit. And it didn't blow dirt and dust around like the Dyson. And it went almost flat to get under furniture. I'd probably go with a canister next time to get the maneuverability and light weight along with working attachments. Dyson is not worth the price.Update: A couple of months after writing the original review, I bought an Electrolux Ultrasilencer Green canister vacuum from Amazon for less than $200. It gets run every single day (often multiple times/day) and is still wonderful over a year later. It's much quieter with better suction than the Dyson, lightweight, has great attachments (I can dust with it!), does an acceptable job on area rugs, and the hose and cord are of adequate length. On the stairs, it is light enough to easily carry. The hose reaches about 2/3 of the way without carrying it, but with the cord length I can do the whole staircase from one outlet with no problem. It has no spinning brush, so is perfect for hard floors. The Dyson has been relegated to the screened porch where I use it to clean the indoor/outdoor rugs. I use the hose on the bricks and have noticed that it's been getting progressively more difficult to pull the hose out. Needless to say, I'm glad I got a new vacuum!

Just got the DC25 Animal today,couldn't wait to use it.It is replacing a '98 Hoover Wind Tunnel which has been a very good vacuum. Putting it together was easy the toughest thing was getting it out of the box,packed very well. The Dyson does everything they said it would, yes I would recommend a Dyson. It is expensive,but if you want a vacuum that picks up the dirt and pet hair then spend the money.The wand is kind of quirky,the cord could be a little longer and the tools are on the cheapy side. These things I can get used to. The only thing is, I hope it last at least 13 years. I've read countless reviews, watched dozens of videos, I really don't know what some of you people are complaining about, this vacuum is awesome. It works! And it works great! Period!

Never thought Id be writing a vacuum cleaner review, but here we go.Im a single male in my 40's, and have owned a variety of vacuums in the past, the most recent being a Eureka upright that is about ten years old, weighs a ton, does not do that great a nob anymore and is difficult to use because of its weight and bulkiness.For the Dyson, I will give it four stars.Positives:In terms of weight and maneuverability it is great.  I've used it twice in the three days Ive had it and it is VERY easy to life up and dwon stairs, and does a great job and getting under and around furniture.I have hardwood floors and dog (Weimaraner).  She does not shed alot, but I do find small clumps of dog hair.  The Dyson does a great job of picking these up and smaller items up.  Much better than the Eureka.  The ball kicks out some air, and will blow dust and hair around a little bit, but you can always go back over that spot and get them, not a big deal.Negative.The only negative comment I have is the build quality.  It does seem fragile, and there is a plastic part that you step on to get the vacuum to work.  I need to remind myself to be gentle with this as I am not sure how well this will hold up over the long term.Canister size.  The canister is a little on the small size and needs to emptied fairly often (every two vacuums probably).Price. I do think Dyson products are grossly overpriced.  It does seem to work as advertised, but $400.00+++ for a vacuum is outrageous.  The only way that price is justifiable is if this thing still works ten years from now the way it works now.

I bought this vacuum and have been using it for a week now.  I LOVE it!! I can't believe all the 'stuff' it has sucked out of my carpet!  My carpets look like they have been shampooed.  I love how you can easily steer it and get under things.  It also goes right along the wall really well.  The one thing I would like to tell people is the $40 more you are paying is only for one attachment.  I had a hard time finding that out before I bought it and went ahead with the animal. Had I known you only get one attachment I would have gone without the animal. Other than that I love it and don't regret my purchase at all!!!

column7: 80 lbs of dog & 25 lbs of cat
column8: We have two cats and one big dog. Our house requires a quick once over every day to keep all of our hardwood and tile floors clean.We had a Oreck XL for years and it just would not do the job without much maintinance on the vacuum every time. The Dyson 25 is light, agile and just works correctly.The attachments are very handy to have on-board but do take some getting used to. If you have pets this is a solid way to go.Now let's see how it does over time.........

We've purchased 4 vacuums previous to this one, all having been destroyed by dog hair. This one has stood up to the dog hair! The ball technology makes it very easy to maneuver and it easily switches from carpet to wood floor. The drape/stair cleaner is a little awkward to operate at first, but once you get the hang of it, it's fine. Definitely recommended - a wonderful vacuum! We know, this is our fifth!
I'll never buy another brand of vacuum again. Dyson is truly worth the money. We have two large dogs that shed a lot. This vacuum has really kept our house clean.

I have a one year old yellow lab who sheds like crazy.  I purchased a less expensive pet hair vacuum that did not work very well, I never felt that it picked up all the fur off the carpet and the attachments did not work well at all.  I was hesitant to spend this kind of money on a vacuum cleaner, but I figured that I am going to have my dog for a while so I might as well try it out.  And I am glad I did.  The first time I used it, it picked up all kinds of fur and dust off the carpet, and I only had to go over it once!!!  The attachments work great, I have one that I use to get the fur off the couch and pillows and it does an amazing job.  It is so easy to maneuver under couches and tables, it is light weight and not a big bulky vacuum cleaner.  And the best part is that my dog is not scared of this vacuum, he was scared of the other one I had but not this one, every time I use it he comes right up to me and follows me around the house.  If you have a lab that sheds excessively, I would highly recommend this vacuum cleaner, it is the best!!!

I was not very happy with my husband when he purchased the Dyson.  I thought it was too much money for a vacuum cleaner.  We had looked at them several times and couldn't decided if it was really worth the price.  After using it a few times, there was NO DOUBT that it was worth the price.  And then there is the ball, well that thing is just fun.  I actually like to vacuum now, except for emptying the canister.  But, how can you make emptying a canister enjoyable??I vacuum ALOT of dog hair and ALOT of cracker crumbs every week.  I feel confident that my floors are clean enough that it's not going to hurt my daughter when she drops a cracker on the floor, then picks it up and eats it.  You know how kids that age are!

After reading many reviews, and borrowing a Dyson DC25 Animal, this was the best product for home use.  My previous vacuum was about 18 years old, and needed to be replaced.  When I borrowed a Dyson DC25 Animal from my daughter I was amazed at the amount of dirt and pet hair it picked up, and only two days after vacuuming with my old machine.  Within a week I made the purchase of my own Dyson Animal, and am very happy with it.The ease of movement, the wonderful long cord, and the on-board attachements make use very easy.  Cleaning the tank is simple and by emptying it after each use there is no more stale smell when vacuuming.My home has both carpet and hardwood flooring, by switching the beater bar to 'off' I can easily continue moving from one surface to another.  Having had my Dyson Animal for just over a month now, and vacuuming weekly at minimum, I can honestly say that this was a truly good purchase.  I have, and will, recommend this machine to anyone.  If you do not have pets you wouldn't need the Animal version, but you certainly would appreciate the ball technology version.

I've heard such wonderful things about the Dyson vacuum cleaner that I had to get one.  What a disappointment.  The bin is small so I have to empty it several times while vacuuming just one room.  After six rooms this is getting old running back and forth to the trash container.  And what a mess that process is.  Dust flies up while I empty the bin and it never seems to be dust free after dumping either, leaving a fine residue on your hands, the middle of the ball, and the bin.  At first I was impressed with how much dust and hair I collected, but this is probably no more than my old cleaner with a bag that didn't let me see how much I had vacuumed, but still produced a full bag.  It appears there is good suction, yet not enough to pull the nap of the carpet up, so although it may be clean and animal hair free, it is becoming increasingly more matted down, giving the impression of worn out carpet.  I attribute this to no setting, such as high or low plush.  I didn't have this issue with my old Hoover that left track marks where the nap was lifted, something I particularly like seeing.  My last complaint is the short cord that doesn't reach far enough and doesn't retract.
Works very well. I was amazed how much more it picks up over our old vacuum. One weakness I see is the smaller wheels seem flimsy. I would recommend this product.

column7: Dyson DC25 Animal Ball Vacuum Cleaner
column8: I couldn't believe it when I first tried it out.  We have a long haired dog, and my other vacuum only brushed up the fur into balls on the carpet, but refused to take them up.  I was walking behind, picking up a trail of fur balls--all this from a machine that had promised so much.  So I tried out my new Dyson, I actually needed to empty the canister after each room on this first go-round because it picked up so much fur.  And looking further, the dust and grime it pulled out of the carpet.  Unbelievable!

After years of being a solid Hoover owner, I tried this vac based on rave reviews by a family member.  I am so impressed.  It is amazing what this pulls out of your carpets.  I got out a lot of that carpet powder that I assumed had been vacuumed up every time I applied it - not so at all.  It is also the best edge cleaning vac that I have ever owned.  The first night that I owned it, it accidentally sucked up a penny (using the flatout floor attachment) in a flash.I'm impressed with the brighter appearance of the carpet and the soft feel of the carpet when I'm in bare feet.I love the 'engineering' aspects of the cleaner - the way the wand pulls out from the handle and you can choose the firm wand or detach the flexible hose part to use the attachments.  Also, the quick way that the beater brush can be removed to clean off 'wraparounds' is great.  It is very lightweight for all that power - I couldn't believe the difference when I moved my Hoover Mach 5.  The removal and re-insert of the dust bin is so easy.Attachments that I got that are great- the flatout floor tool allows you to go far under tables, chairs, beds without moving them - it retains the suction power of the unit itself.- the soft dusting brush (purchased separately here @ a 10$ discount from any other site) will be great for louvers, panelled furniture, etc.- stiff bristle brush for 'scrubbing' at tough, dried in spots- long flexi tube crevice brush AND a standard size crevice tool that lets you choose brushed or plain end.I found the instructions amazing - just illustrations and arrows that were very easy to comprehend and follow.What I will miss- the cord doesn't retract or doesn't have that little loop on the back of the handle to hold it out of the way while you vacuum- the flexible hose for the attachments is a bit unweildy, but considering that it is such a large diameter to assist with cleaning, I'll learn to live  with it.- not much on board storage for attachments, but again this will keep the entire unit more lightweight for use, so I'll learn to love it.I've only had this a few days and I am really loving this already.

I received my Dyson Dc25 two days ago and couldn't wait to get it out of the box. I have seen Dyson vacuums in stores so I knew what I was getting style wise, it's a sleek machine. I had no major difficulties attaching the necessary parts and had it up and running rather quickly. I was surprised to discover that only 2 attachments fit on the side, for some reason I thought there would be a place for each attachment. They sent me a few extras, some I may never use, and I have put them in a bag I will carry with me from room to room.I vacuumed my living room and could not believe the amount of dirt that filled the canister. I wonder if my old vacuum worked at all. It has very strong suction, which is one of the reasons I bought it. I had a little trouble opening the canister and actually opened the top part not realizing the bottom flipped open if the right button was pushed. I figured out how to open the bottom and the dirt fell into the trash. The only downside to this is that some dust flew up into the air, but that also happened when I removed the full bag from my old vacuum. I like that you can empty the canister after each vacuum and the get the dirt out of the house, no need to worry if the bag is full. I will have to get used to vacuuming with the hose, it's not as flexible as my old one, but I can deal with it.By the end of the day I had vacuumed most of my house and found myself vacuuming in places I normally skip ( behind the couch) just so I could see how much dirt I could pick up. I'm sure that is just a temporary thrill of having a new vacuum that out preforms my old one. I am very happy and though it may sound odd~ I can't wait to vacuum again.
This vacuum is amazing and picked up so much more than any other vacuum we have had in the past.  It was amazing what had been left behind by our central vac that this one picked up.

I've had my dyson 25 animal ball for about two weeks now and wow....this is the best sweeper I have ever owned.  I know I've read reviews before that have said this...but if you're sitting there wondering if you should spend all that money...do it!!  I was just like you...buying sweepers that were about half this much, bags, bagless, hoping to find a good one but always being disappointed.  This sweeper delivers.  It came in about four pieces and I (a girl) was able to put it together fairly easily ;)  I think the hardest part was trying to figure out where the attachments went and how to get them on and off...but once I figured that out I was in business.  It has great suction power for carpets but not so much that you can't do area rugs without it trying to suck them up.  I don't know how they do that but it's great!  The part that surprised me the most was when I turned off the beater brush for carpets and continued on to hard surfaces...it didn't lose any suction power!  Emptying the collection bin is very easy and hardly any mess.  Only thing you have to do to maintain the sweeper is clean the filter with water occasionally and maybe take it apart and use a hair hose to blow out the dust that might collect in it...that's it.  And as for the ball technology...well, I don't even know where to begin.  It's fantastic!  My nine year old son even thinks it's fun to sweep now to see how he can spin around things..lol.  The only draw back for this machine that I can see is it is a little on the small side.  So I could see if you live in a large home it might take longer to sweep your house than with a larger vacuum.  But my house is small, about 800 sq.ft., and it's perfect.  In fact, I think it takes me less time to sweep because I can easily go around all the things in my home.  It's also very easy to carry around.  My only request to improve this sweeper would be to somehow find a way to hold the extra attachments that you can get with the sweeper.  Mine came with three and that's all you can carry with you.

I had a Dyson Animal for several years and it has no equal in terms up picking up dirt, debris, animal hair etc.  I have a smaller condo and really wanted to try the Ball for its size and meneuverability.  The Ball Animal has a shorter cord than my old Animal, but everything else about it is an amazing improvement.  The maneuverability/flexibility took a few minutes to get used to, but it is a huge improvement over the older model.  also, the extension wand just telescopes straight out, I don't have to flip it around like I did on my older vacuum.  I am pretty happy with the newer improved Animal. Keep 'em coming, Dyson!

This is our first Dyson and we are very impressed.  We were amazed at the difference in the amount of dust and hair this vacuum picked up on the first use compared to multiple uses with our other upright.  It is easy to maneuver and just does an awesome job.  Very happy with this purchase.

Not since June Cleaver with her high heels and pearls has anyone been so excited about pushing a vacuum cleaner!I have several pets and the hair drove me crazy.  I replaced a sofa and love seat of a sofa/love seat/chair/ottoman set that I loved because my old vacuum cleaner could not get the hair off.  I kept only the chair and ottoman but I hid them in the back room so no one would see them because I couldn't get them clean.The Dyson pulled off every single hair...you can't tell an animal was ever on them.  It makes less noise than my other vacuum cleaner and is so lightweight that I don't mind using it. Did I mention the air?  No kidding...it actually feels cleaner when I breathe!  And it does a great job on the floors as well -- carpet, hardwood and tile. I love the ball-drive, too -- no more wrestling with the old stick shift.My favorite chair and ottoman are in the middle of the livingroom again.  Had I only known what this vacuum cleaner could do, I'd still have my sofa and love seat, too. How much cheaper it would have been to buy a Dyson than to replace furniture! It makes me sad I didn't do this sooner.

Because I could gush on about this vacuum forever, I'll start with a list of pros and cons to organize things a bit:Pros:The ball technology really is magnificent.Weight/size of the vacuum doesn't sacrifice quality.It sucks - really! The suction cannot be beat here.No replaceable belts, filters, or gadgets to mess with - low-maintenance in every sense of the word.Overall ease of use is superb.Cons:The cord is way too short.No fancy device that winds/sucks up the cord for you.Pricey, and rarely goes on sale (but well-worth it).Honestly, those are the only cons I've been able to come up with as of yet, and the last one isn't even really a con.  After lusting over the Dyson for years, my husband finally agreed to buy me one as an early Christmas present during our Black Friday shopping trip (we paid $100 off the list price at Target at $449). I had built this vacuum up for so long in my head that I was deathly afraid of being disappointed, but I haven't been yet.The size of the Dyson is a dream. You don't strain yourself lugging a 50 lb. vacuum out of the closet, or up the stairs.  It's light but powerful, quiet (at least compared to my last vacuum) and easy to push around.  The attachments are spectacular, easy to use and work well on cleaning furniture/reaching tight spots, etc.I chose to get the Animal because we have a dog who lives primarily outside, but when she does come in, sheds like you wouldn't believe.  This vacuum has the capacity and suction to get every last dog hair off the carpet and the kitchen floor.  The function that turns off the brush is a dream - whenever I tried to clean bare floors with my old vacuum, it would generally just blow the dog hair around the room.  The Dyson's suction combined with the ability to turn off the brush is tremendous.Dyson recommends a 'maintenance plan' of washing the vacuum's two filters once every three months.  They even send you an email as a reminder, and though I've only had to wash mine once since I've had the appliance, they were hardly even dirty (my old vacuum's filter had to be washed after every use, or the hose clogged - it seemed the majority of the dirt ended up in that half-inch of foam rather than in the dust bin itself).As for the cons, I've read some reviews complaining about the size of the bin.  I don't have a big house - about 1300 sq feet - but I can vacuum the whole place without emptying the bin once.  Unless you live in a large house, the size of the bin shouldn't be a huge problem.  Also, the hands-free emptying ability makes the chore incredibly easy, anyway. My only real complaints about this vacuum involve the cord.  I feel that it's much too short to be convenient - I usually have to unplug and replug two or three times just to get my living room done. Also, I was very surprised there was no function for winding/sucking up the cord hands free.  Neither issues are deal breakers, it just seemed to me that a company that relies so much on convenience and ease of use for their products would have remedied this.I'm of the firm opinion that, in something like a vacuum, you get what you pay for. Sure you can get a lot of sub-par vacuums for $100 or less. They get the job done, but for something you use every week at the very least, a product's quality speaks volumes.  The Dyson has a 5 year warranty, and will undoubtedly last much longer than that in great shape.  My old $200 vacuum more or less kicked it after 2 years, and gave me countless headaches long before that.If you have kids, pets, live in a dusty area, or just like a impressively clean house, the Dyson is completely worth its price tag.

Please beware there are 2 different sizes.Amazon doesn't disclose that when ordering.When I received mine I was disappointed because it was the smaller one for 424.00.Wish I had of known would have ordered differently.

column7: Blows to much dirt into the air while vacuuming
column8: The dyson ball seems to blow the dust on the floor and carpets into the air which seems counter productive to me, not allergy friendly at all.  I also have pets and you have to reach into the canister to pull the fur out, you cannot just empty it - wish I did not buy the Dyson.

column7: Can't smell my dog but cumbersome.
column8: After much consideration, I thought I would give this unit a whirl.  Here is what I found:Likes:-Smaller head so I can get int tighter spaces...ie behind the toilet.-No pet odor everytime you vacuum.-Bagless.Dislikes:-The cord is too short.  I am always unplugging the unit and replugging it somewhere else.-The hose is way too short and way too tight.  Everytime I go to use the hose with any attachments, I end up fighting with my Dyson.  It has good reach but you must keep your foot on the unit itself so it does not spring back and hit you in the ankles.  The coiled hose is extremely tight and hasn't stretched at all in the last 6 months.  This is very painful....IT HAPPENS EVERYTIME I USE IT!  I feel like I need to wear my boots everytime I vacuum.-The canister is very small.-Takes some getting used to pushing the unit around with the ball.-Does it suck better than my last $100 unit that lasted 10 years?  Absolutely not.  In fact, it has a lot less suction but I don't have the pet odors to deal with.Was it worth it for the money?  That depends on how long it lasts.  I used to feel good after vacuuming because I felt my old vacuum did a great job.  Now, I loathe vacuuming because I know my ankles are going to take a beating and I just don't feel like it cleans as well.

column7: Not Enamored with it at all
column8: I've owned this vacuum for a couple of years now and I am not very happy with it at all! I gave it two stars for two reasons. One, it is lightweight enough to carry up and down the stairs easily. Two, the ball feature does add great maneuverability. My two biggest complaints concern the accessory tube and the emptying of the collection bin. The accessory tube fits inside the handle and every single time I have used it I feel like I'm going to break it and it is pain in the butt to wrestle with it. (Husband feels the same way)  I feel like I'm fumbling and there is nothing intuitive about it. It makes me avoid using the accessory hose/ tube attachment, to the point that now I have apparently forgotten how to get it out. I'm doing everything I thought was the process: flip the red lid, pull out the tube, press the button and pull but nothing is happening. My second issue with it is that not once have I emptied it when I didn't have to stick my hand into it to get the stuck hair out of it, even when I make certain that the crud is far below the maximum level. Yuck! A secondary complaint of mine is that I don't like the lines it puts on the carpet. One stroke leaves multiple lines the carpet not one wide swath like we're used to and that can be vacuumed 'out' so that it isn't noticeable. It sounds like it shouldn't be a big deal but it bugs me every time I use it.

column7: Very Disappointed - on to my next vaccuum
column8: I am very disappointed with the Dyson DC25!!  I bought it because I have a yellow lab and keeping up with the dog hair and mess was very important to me.  At first, it had great suction and I felt it did a great job.  Then I noticed that even though it had great suction on my carpets, it wouldn't pick up the smallest pebble on my hardwoods.  I would have to use the handle to get the small items on the floors.  It is heavy so not a practical machine to use on the stairs and forget about the small tools.  In fact, I doubt I have used any of the accessories more than once because it soon became more work and they didn't really perform as well as they should.  I've already had it in for repairs and now there appears to be another issue with the suction and I may have to take it back again.I am frustrated with the performance, weight and how little the canister holds.  Like all new machines, it worked great the first year or so and now, it is just as disappointing as those other machines, except I paid a lot more money for this one.  The suction was great in the beginning but after a few years is only average, just like any other vaccuum I've had in the past.

column7: Amazon has the best customer service I have experienced
column8: When the delivery estimate came and went, I called ups.  It was not easy to get a human but the human was helpful.  He told me to have the shipper initiate a tracer.  I contacted amazon.  It was very easy.  I opted for email though I could have called.  That evening I had a reply from amazon.  They shipped me another dyson AND shipped it overnight.  As far as I know, the other one is still lost somewhere at ups.  Now for the dyson.  It is all it claims to be.  My favorite feature is how easy it is to empty the canister.  Since I have a two story house, I also bought the Hoover wind tunnel retractable.  The first time I emptied it, I had to pull the canister apart and use my hand to unwind the dog hair.  With the dyson, it is really as simple as pushing the button that opens the bottom and giving it a few shakes.  For me, that alone is worth 300 extra!  The ball really does make it easier to use...especially around objects.  I am not totally in love with the wand piece but I think I understand why they did that and you do learn to use it.

column7: Love it!!! Takes the chore out of vacuuming!!!
column8: Purchased the animal ball with a little hesitation about the price (it's almost $600!!!) and whether the DC28 or DC25 would be right for my house. Most of the reviews said that the DC25 was useless on thick carpet and better for hard floors, however our house has both carpet and hard wood floors! In the end I ordered the Animal Ball DC25 and I am COMPLETELY satisfied! It does an amazing job with pet hair (no more chasing around the fur bunnies that would scatter when my other vacuum came near!) AND, vacuuming the carpet was easy! I used to have to vacuum 2x a week, but with the dyson I have only vacuumed once in a week and a half. Amazing!The best thing that I have discovered about the vacuum is the attachments. It is so easy to switch from vacuuming to using an attachment with out skipping a beat. The traditional narrow tube that cleans corners also has a bristled head that slides down so you can do the baseboards while vacuuming the carpet! Amazing!I also found the vacuum suction strong enough to dust the tops of dressers and blinds! Score!!!

Like others that have commented, I was astounded at what this vacuum picked up!  Despite my complaints below, I do highly recommend it.  I love the ease of maneuverability.My complaints, also like some others have commented:(1) I had one hell of a time getting it out of the box.(2) The 'operating manual' leaves a lot to be desired.  My Dyson and I got off to a rough start last night.  I had vacuumed my whole place and couldn't figure out why the bin barely had anything in it.  I was fuming mad and put the Dyson into time-out for the evening.  Apparently I had unknowingly popped the cap on the wand and subsequently didn't realize all the suction was coming through the wand.  Second try was a charm today!(3) The wand is extremely awkward to use and is very limiting.  It definitely needs to be redesigned to build in some kind of flexibility.  I guess I'm going to have to stick with my mini Shop-Vac for things like vacuuming the kitty condo.

Our other upright vacuum died and we were in need of a new one and my wife has been trying to persuade me to get the Dyson DC25 since we have a dog and a cat. I had never thought there was much difference the various vacuums except price, that has now changed. We just moved into a new house and even with new carpet and vacuuming regularly you will be amazed at how much this vacuum will pick up! This is well worth the money and you will not be disappointed with this purchase!

column7: OK on carpets, no good on wood floors or with attachments
column8: Summary: OK if all you want to do is vacuum carpets, but not good on wood floors or with attachments.There have been many positive reviews so I will focus on the negative aspects of this product that, every time I use it, makes me wish I had not bought it. I was attracted to the Dyson Ball due to the clever advertising and the many positive reviews.  We have pets and I chose this particular model for the mini turbine head attachment to clean pet hair on the furniture and because it was lighter weight than other Dyson animal models. Our house is about half carpet and half hardwood floors. As a carpet vacuum it works well enough but not any better than others I have owned or used that are significantly less expensive.  The ball design, once you get used to it, does make the vacuum very maneuverable but I've never really had a problem with maneuvering a standard vacuum so this seems to be solving a non-problem. The vacuum is not so great on wood floors. The ball is a disadvantage on hard floors. There are exhaust vents on the ball and when vacuuming hardwood floors the exhaust air on the rotating ball tends to blow light weight debris, such as pet hair, away from the vacuum so it never vacuums it up. The attachments are the worst aspect of this vacuum. The flexible portion of the hose has a very strong internal spring so that it stores properly back into the handle. The combination of the spring and vacuum suction is so strong that if you try to stretch it out more than two or three feet it just drags the vacuum along with it or tips it over. It is extremely tiring to use attachments due to the strong force of the spring and the suction pulling back. I thought it would get better over time but after 2 years of use it is no better. The rigid portion of the hose is about 3 feet long and includes the handle making it ungainly to use. I've tried detaching it but then you have to stretch the flex hose out even further which increases the spring force even more. The mini turbine head is marginal at best. The rotating bristles on the head are widely spaced resulting in it cleaning narrow parallel lines and requiring many passes to properly clean furniture. That combined with the problem with the hose tension make using it a major chore. Much better is my 15.6 V cordless Shark hand held vacuum with motorized brush. For less than $50 it cleans better, faster and infinitely more conveniently. For things where I need attachments such as cleaning stairs etc, I've reverted to my old, less than $100, Bissell. Its suction is not as good but at least it doesn't fight me the entire time.  The net result is I never use the attachments anymore; it's just too much work. Following are a few more annoying traits. The dust canister is very small and usually requires emptying once or twice if I am vacuuming the whole house. Also carpet fibers and pet hair tend to mat inside the canister so you have to reach in and pull it out. Not pleasant. I empty the canister long before the full mark, but it still happens. When the rotating floor brush is on, the high pitched whine is so loud and piercing it hurts my ears. All in all, I wish I had been smart enough to return the vacuum shortly after purchase. The return shipping cost would have been a small price to pay to eliminate the aggravation I feel every time I use this vacuum.

column7: close to my Bissel Healthy Home... BUT BETTER!
column8: I bought this b/c we adopted a pet and I wanted something specific for pet hair... I checked one out in the store before ordering MUCH cheaper on amazon and it just seems so... flimsy- Its very light- which is awesome- but its all plastic and super small- For the price I almost want 'more for my money' ... but it not the size that matters IF it does the job- AND IT DOES! I did the 'dyson challenge' and vacuumed with my Bissel Healthy Home first and then went back over it with the dyson and I have to be honest... there was VERY very little that the dyson picked up after my Bissel- I was honestly really disappointed- I wanted to have to empty the bin 2-3 times like others did and really feel I got my moneys worth... BUT after owning it for several weeks now... I JUST LOVE the convenience of it!! the 'Ball' really is a great feature- It fits in places my other bulkier bissel just cant AND IT MOVES FROM CARPET TO TILE TO MY AREA RUGS with NO effort at all! It is SO powerful and does a FANTASTIC job on the rugs (which the Bissel couldn't do without us standing on the edges/corners so they didn't suck up and scoot around)I would def. recommend this product to a friend and have! Even if I vacuum every day (realistically its only more like 2-3 days a week) I DO get dust/particles in the canister and I really feel like it is helping me keep my home clean and allergen free! (as much as possible with kids and pets)

Ok I would have gave this a 4.5 star but you can't. Not a five because I have not had it long enough. Here are the facts. I paid way less than the current price on amazon ( I bought mine on amazon,the price went up) It was delivered as promised. My wife vaccumed the carpet with the old vaccum. I vaccumed with the Dyson and she almost cried when she saw how much nasty stuff it picked up. She called her mom and talked about it for an hour.My wife is a clean freak to the point where it gets on my nerve.

column7: Worth the price and then some
column8: I read many of the reviews here before ordering the vacuum for myself. I know one reviewer mentioned that the vacuum was difficult to use on high pile carpet, which I have. I have no problems using the vacuum on carpet of any kind. It is easy to maneuver and does an amazing job of picking up dirt and cat hairs etc. In a multi-pet household, having a good vacuum cleaner is a must. This one does the trick. My only regret is that I didn't buy one sooner.

We ordered a Dyson DC25 Animal after our Bissell Pet Eraser broke a belt and we had borrowed a Rainbow from a friend for a long time. When she wanted it back, we needed a new vacuum but weren't ready to shell out the money for a Rainbow. So we got a Dyson while it was on big sale for Black Friday and haven't been disappointed. It was super easy to set up, is picking all of the pet hair and dust that we need it to get, and is easy to move around our house. Some of the other reviews complained that it was a little heavy, but we have a one-story house and have no problem with it. The brushes and other tools work well for us, too. Overall, a great buy and we love the warranty!

I'm a bit of a vacuum freak.  I loved my DC17, but when we moved to our new house with lots of area rugs, the DC17 let me down!  It made a horrible 'rocks in a blender' noise every time I vacuumed short pile area rugs.  So I got a new one - same problem.So I tried the Dyson cannister and hated it.  I tried 7-8 other vacuums, the usual suspects (Bissell, Hoover, Shark, etc.) and never got anything that worked better than just mediocre.  Nothing could handle pet hair like my old DC17 - with 2 dogs, 3 cats and a 5 year old, Dyson set the bar too high and nothing else came close.Then I saw this DC25 Animal and decided to give Dyson another try.  It's wonderful!  Last night I went over my area rugs and there were no problems, not to mention how much dust and other nastiness the DC25 sucked up just 24 hours after I had vacuumed with my Shark.  Eeeeeewwwww!It also worked terrific on my wood floors - turn off the brush for simple light pickup or keep the brush on for larger debris (or use the wand).  Easy-peasy.I still haven't tried it on regular pile carpet or stairs, but I expect it to work fine.  Will update my review if I find any problems, but so far I'm quite thrilled!

I would highly recommend this vacuum. We had a 3 year old Bissel vacuum that just wouldn't suck the way that it use to. Once I received this vacuum, which by the way came very quickly, I put it to use. I was amazed, disgusted and yet so happy at how much pet hair and dirt this thing picked up. Our carpets and rugs are like new! I only hope that it keeps its powerful suction like it claims.

column7: Was my carpet really THAT dirty!
column8: Great vac!  I can't believe how much it pulled up even after using our old vac.  Piles of dirt and puppy hair!  This is nice and light and moves pretty easily.  I only wish the cord was a bit longer and that it had a place to store the upholstery attachment.

Prior to today, I have never written a product review; however, I am so incredibly impressed by my Dyson that I wanted to rate it.  I have a 1 year old Golden Retriever and purchased a house with a black tile floor in the kitchen (a bad decision on my part).  I have been fighting dog hair and mud for the last year: in the kitchen, in the carpet, on the furniture, near the air vents, etc.  I purchased a new Hoover Windtunnel about nine months ago, but it did not seem to make much of a difference.  After reading several reviews on the Dyson Animal, I decided to put it on my wedding registry.  Last weekend, I received it from my friends at a shower.  I was curious whether it would live up to its reputation, so I ran the Hoover Windtunnel over an area rug and then ran the Dyson over the same rug.  I was DISGUSTED by all the Dyson picked up.  I literally had to empty the Dyson as soon as I was finished vacuuming one area rug because the cansiter was full of dust, dirt, and doghair (this is the same area rug I had JUST vacuumed with my Hoover about 5 minutes prior).  I know this is a very expensive vacuum, but it is completely worth the price.  While I received it as a gift, now that I've seen it in action, I would purchase it for myself tomorrow.  There is literally no comparison between my Dyson and my $250 Hoover.  The Dyson's force is so strong it almost picked the area rug off the floor, but it never once got the rug caught.  My area rug is now a shade lighter than before.  I would consider myself a very clean person, but I was living in filth and had no idea because I had ineffective tools.  If you are considering a Dyson (especially if you have dogs that shed), I promise you will not regret purchasing this product!

Not only is the Dyson animal such a cute vacuum... It was one of the best functional Christmas gift ever! So lightweight and easy to maneuver around my new house you can quickly vacuum in the highest of stilettos, and I removed the fur and dust from the three kitties in my residence! hearts hearts and more hearts!!!!

column7: A solid choice for pet owners.
column8: We recently replaced our carpet with a color that shows dirt and dog hair (we have a Sheltie) much more than our previous carpet. We thought we had a perfectly fine vacuum (a self-propelled Hoover Windtunnel 2, about 8 years old), but it just wasn't doing the job. It would pick up a lot of the dog hair, but even if you ran over and over a spot, it never really got it clean. It's probably just as well to have the new color of carpet. If our old carpet held this much dog hair and we just didn't realize it, then it's better to know.Anyway, I did a lot of research online and narrowed my choices to this unit, the DC25 Animal, and the larger DC 28 Animal. I ultimately went with this one for the ball and the lighter weight, even though it sounds like the DC 28 is more powerful and would pull up more hair.This was a good choice. I vacuumed with the Hoover just before this arrived, then went over it again with the Dyson to see how it did on that remaining dog hair. It took it up with no problem. It cleans extremely well and it is really light and easy to use. I thought the ball thing might be something of a gimmick, but it really does make it much easier to handle. Two other things that make this stand out to me. The Hoover never would clean right against the walls. There was always a little half inch strip along the molding that I had to clean with the wand. This cleans right to the edge. Very nice. The other thing is that, even though the Hoover had a floor setting, it really didn't work on floors. It just blew dust around and didn't really pick it up. The Dyson does a really nice job on the hardwood floor.I'm not wild about the whole awkward extending handle thing, but it will do, and I otherwise really like the unit.
It works very well, but the capacity for all the dog hair we pick up is small. However, it does what it says it will do!

I had wanted to try this vaccumm for quite some time now.  The prices in store were much higher than on Amazon, and with free shipping and delivery to my door within 5 days of ordering, I am a pleased Amazon customer!My previous vaccumm was a Kirby G2000....great vaccumm for getting up all the dust etc., but not so great for vaccumming all of the corners, furniture or anywhere you need a wand, since you have to take off the front of the vaccumm and put on the hose. I was also tired of spending money on bags that I could only buy at the Kirby store.The DC25 Animal is easy to maneuver, (although a bit 'heavy' to push sometimes) has great suction, on board hose and attachments, a great furniture cleaning tool, and no bags.I am grateful for the filtration which prevents that 'doggy' smell.Also like the fact that it automatically adjusts for carpet height and has a button to turn off the rotator/beater bar.The only things I have found so far that I don't like: the cord could be about 3ft longer, there could be a place for on board storage of the furniture tool, and the canister could maybe hold more.  These are all things which are not a big deal, though.The on board hose is a little tricky to get used to and I tend to pinch my fingers sometimes when I am in a hurry.  The furniture brush has to be held at the right angle to work well, but that is no big deal.I no longer dread vaccumming with this vaccumm!  It makes a quick run over the house easy, cleaning up the dog hair and dirt(I have 3 dogs in the house). I can accomplish what I need to do in less than half the time.

I vacuumed the first time and filled the dirt canister with super fine silt.  I felt like I was walking on much cleaner carpet after that.  I like seeing all the dirt I vacuum up every time.  The only complaint is that the ball prevents vacuuming under things that my other vacuum could do.  It picks up pet hair better than any vacuum that I have used.

I purchased this vacuum for our son and his wife.  They have had a dog or dogs for many years.  They were amazed at how much hair remained in their carpeting over the years, using vacuums that can't compare in any way, shape or form to the Dyson Animal.  I made their day!

We've had Hovers, Dirt Devils, and many others.The 'animal' is the BEST we've ever owned by far.Bought here at Amazon, on Black Friday sale. Stillexpensive, but well worth it.We have two very hairy cats that shed a lot. After just ourfirst sweeping, we cut the hair down by 1/2. After the second,were hard pressed to find any.As mentioned by others, the dirt canister could be bigger, but thisis but a minor complaint.So, if your looking for a good sweeper, get this one, especiallyfor the animal hair..

column7: Powerful vacuum that will damage fine rugs!
column8: My first impression of the Dyson was that it manueuvers very easily and I was impressed. To my great surprise, however, after vaccuming one time I found that it had pulled yarns out of a hand made rug in my dining room, leaving exposed areas that are very visible!  I have since discovered that Dyson knows about this issue and yet they don't have a specific warning in their manual. If you look through all the fine print, you will find a general statement about consulting with a flooring manufacturer before using it; however, you can't do that with rugs than are hand made or antique. I now have a damaged rug that was much more costly than the vacuum.  When I called Dyson, I was essentially told that the finer the rug, the greater the chance of damage due to the hand knotting. Wouldn't it make sense to place a clear warning in the manual? They suggested that I try turning off the brush bar when using it, but I found that it lost its ability to clean.  It is basically useless without the brush bar and there is no way to adjust its height.  If you have fine rugs, stay away from this product!

column7: Love it, Love it, Looooooooove This Vacuum!!!
column8: My hubby got this for me this x mas and boy it blew our rainbow, cirby, and phantom out of the water. It truly is amazing and it does not lose any suction. You feel it grabbing on to carpet and sucking everything in. Love the idea that there is no water to deal with or no filthy bags.

column7: Wish Dyson had a consumer friendly manual for vacuum.
column8: Don't throw away your old vacuum, you will need it to clean up the dyson.  After a big vacuuming job the dyson wascompletely covered in pet hair and dust and had to be vacuumed before it could be put away.The instruction booklet is useless.  Poor descriptions. No answers to common questions.  It is trial and error forme every time I use my new Animal 25 and it's frustrating.  I have soooooooooooo many questions about this vacuumand no answers.

column7: A cheap version of the Dyson vacuum I used to love
column8: I had the old purple Dyson without the ball, which I used (and loved) for many years. It broke recently, so I was excited to find this one for $399 on Black Friday. I was completely disappointed. The ball technology is nice, but it doesn't 'turn on a dime'-- it's tough to explain, but it's still awkward to turn and I found myself picking it up too often to help it turn. The canister is way too small. And I don't like how the attachments are more difficult to attach and unattach than the old model. I also don't like that the crevice tool has bristles on it. And last, the neck of the extension pole is way too narrow..it became stopped up when I tried to vacuum up goldfish that my children had spilled in the car. I am hugely disappointed. I wish I had listened to my friend who recommended that I buy a Miele.

I've owned the DC15 for about 5yrs and LOVE it, since I run my own cleaning business I decided to finally break down & buy another vacuum cleaner for the house & keep the old one in my vehicle. Without paying close attention I ordered the DC25 thinking I was getting the same one I had. (i was so excited to get it for $384!!) Imagine my surpise, anyways... I tested it out -not really impressed.  CONS:-The canister is way to small, I had 2 empty it twice just for the (12x24) livingroom,(I have 3 cats & a dog)on top of that after I was done I went over the same area with my DC15 and came up with about another cup of dirt/hair.  soooo I guess i will use the new one for my cleaning business as none have more than one animal in the house & most have none.- Another is that the cord on the DC25 is alot shorter than on the DC15-no on board storage for mini turbine headI guess a PRO would be- & only because I'll be constantly hauling it around, is that it's smaller in size- not so bulky.Some of the houses I clean for own the DC7animal,DC14animal& reg.,& DC17animal- My DC15animal ROCKS over all of them.
i have been using used, refurbished vacuums for years....  i finally had the money to get what i've always wanted - a dyson.  and i haven't been disappointed!

I absolutely LOVE this vacuum!! I have been purchasing cheaper vacuums in the past which only last me for a year or so. Was a little concerned about paying this price since it is more than I have paid for past vacuums but you get what you pay for and this one is well worth the money! Very easy to assemble, took less than half hour. Works great and easy to get edges and hard to reach areas. Able to easily access the stairs. Very light which is great for transporting up and down the stairs. The attachments work great! Highly recommend this to anyone. I am actually excited to vacuum every day!!!

I love this vacuum cleaner! My husband and I bought this same Dyson about 2 years ago and it is the best vacuum I have ever owned. I have a cat and a dog and it picks up their hair like I can't believe. It even picks up loose carpet as well. My mother has more pets than I do so when she needed a new vacuum, I decided she needed this one as well. It's easy for her to maneuver since she has edema in her legs and having everything on the vacuum makes it convenient to get the job done as fast as possible. The long hose allows her to reach areas of her cathedral ceiling as well. I know one thing, as long as Dyson continues to make excellent vacuums, I will never buy another brand.

Just brought the Dyson!  I consider myself a neat freak.  I would vacuum at least one or two times a week with our old vacuum. After vaccuming a room with our old vacuum and then running through with the Dyson, I was shocked.  It picked up so much dust, etc.  I am impressed.  I was concerned about about hardwood floors (as some reviews mentioned scratching). But, this model has a switch so you can turn off the rotating brush to avoid scratching.Bought Dyson at Sears for $399.  I saw it at most other retailers for $550.  Great price for the results.Great purchase!

So like many people I bought a $100 vacuum annually and was never happy. One day our vacuum died and I had it. I decided to step up my game and get a big boy vacuum. Having cats I wish I had earlier. In my little 1100 sqft apartment I have to empty the bin like 7-8 times if I vacuum weekly. Its amazing, it really is worth the money if you have pets.

I have owned the Dyson DC07 for five or six years, and it is still running strong.  However, we were in the market for a new home vacuum, and were going to turn the DC07 over as our small business's showroom vacuum cleaner.  We had seen the commercials for the Shark, wherein they claim it to be as good as Dyson for 1/3 the price.  So, we headed to Bed Bath & Beyond to check them out; because I'm not one to usually have brand loyalty and am all about inexpensive!Upon taking the Shark display down and giving it the once over, I could tell immediately that the quality is not nearly the same.  I was disheartened because of the price difference, but I decided to stick with Dyson and am so glad I did.  You get what you pay for in this case.The DC25 Animal has awesome suction (as I am used to).  Improved features that I noticed are the ease of use for the hose and attachments.  The maneuverability is awesome! It gets completely and easily under my end tables with no problem, and around my table legs with such ease.  It transitions from hardwood to rugs like a champ and doesn't suck up the smaller rug edges.  It is smaller than the old model, and doesn't require as much storage room - which I love!Our family consists of three kids and four dogs (one of which is a 170 lb. shedding machine), and I am a bit of a neat freak when it comes to the cleanliness of my floors.  I am one of those every day to several times a day vacumming kind of people, and I love my Dysons!!  My DC07 has been going strong day in and out for lots of years with the only problem being the need to replace the hose.  I expect the same out of my wonderful new vacuum.

column7: Not as strong as it sounds, but does what it should
column8: I think the whole animal pet hair angle some times makes it sound like this vacuum is going to jet-engine suck up your hair in one go. It takes multiple passes for my pet hair but it does get it, and gets it well. The size, ease of cleaning, and the general mobility make this a 5 star vacuum by itself. The ability to actually vacuum up pet hair just makes it even better.The only problem I would say is that the vertical size could've been compacted more in my opinion. Storing this vacuum can be difficult if you have a full closet.
I love my Dyson....a great vacuum for anyone with pets. Easy to use and help keep my place clean and dust free.

column7: Long haired wife, toddler, 2 dogs, NO PROBLEM!
column8: My household contains a long haired wife, toddler and 2 longer haired dogs. We also have deep pile carpet. We present a significant challenge to a vacuum. This machine is able to pick up just about anything we can put down. In addition the extra attachment is very helpful for pulling hair out of the stairs and furniture. We also use our machine on bare floors and it sucks up all sorts of leaves and dirt from outside without difficulty. It is also tough. My son loves to touch it and climb on it and he has yet to find a way to damage it.Pros:Have purposefully tried to loose suction, but have yet to succeed.Ball makes for amazing maneuverability. I won't buy another vacuum without a ball.Cons:Be careful when you wash the filter. If you do not let it dry thoroughly it will mildew in the vacuum.It is hard to find a filter to replace on short notice.Occasionally I will suck up something HUGE with the tube and have to pull it out with a pliers, but even this is an easy fix.

I love that a Dyson never needs to be cleaned to maintain it's exemplary level of suction, unlike all other vacuums on the market. I didn't save a huge sum of money on this purchase bet every dollar counts, and the shipping was super fast. Overall I give the entire experience 5 stars!

column7: One of the worst vacuum cleaners ever.
column8: Having had an upright Dyson for some time that was quite good, we decided to get another and this one looked like it was easy to handle and good for pet hairs.
