Although this vacuum cleaner was reasonably effective to begin with and it was light and moved around easily, it very soon started to clog and lose it's suction power.  Dyson claim that this doesnt happen with their cleaners but I am afraid that it just isn't true, it has been a nigtmare, really appalling. I have found this to be the very worst feature. The filters clog up really quickly as well. It frequently got blocked and was very difficult to clean out.The dog hairs wound themselves around the brush head and clogged it up and stopped the brush from spinning. I had to literally take the end apart and cut the trapped hair balls with scissors to get them out. The brush on the end gradually wore loose and made a deafening noise. When it was replaced with a brand new part it it didnt work at all. didnt spin around and didnt pick up. The cleaner got noisier and noisier with a high pitched whine and it didnt pick up despite all airways seemingly clear.Have spent hours unblocking it and even then never satisfied with the quality of the cleaning. It got to the point where it wouldnt pick anything up at all. It has a ridiculously short lead as well and an awkward shape on the hose, useless for cleaning out cars. One of my friends also had the same experience with hers. One of the worst vacuum cleaner experiences ever,I got totally fed up and bought a George this week, which cleans brilliantly and washes the carpets as well. I am sorry but Dysons DO clog and DO lose suction.

I don't generally write reviews but I found that some of the reviews misled me in one way or another. Hopefully, this will help those considering buying this type of vacuum.Empty Canister as Suggested:As most have stated, this vacuum has a lot of suction (more than any other vacuum that I've ever used) and the suction doesn't drop off as the vacuum fills. It is important, however, that you not allow the canister to fill beyond the max line because it begins to draw much more material up into the filter. When the filter (pre-motor filter, filter A) gets clogged, it will lose suction and it will make the motor overheat.Although I vacuumed regularly, the previous vacuum was clearly not doing a very good job. It was only removing the material from the top surface of the carpet. There was a section of carpet near an entry door that looked clean but when I used this vacuum on it initially, the entire roller housing turned brown. It was like I was vacuuming pure sand/silt. I didn't realize it but this was not good for this vacuum. In less than 5 minutes, the canister was filled to the max line. After filling the canister to the max line several times, the vacuum began to lose suction. At the time, I thought that there may be a serious problem with the vacuum. It was only recommended that the filters be cleaned after about 3 months. I didn't think that they could possibly have needed cleaning in less than 1 hour but they were both dirty. After removing the pre-motor filter, I could see that it was very dirty. Any slight movement of the filter would result in a huge dust cloud. I checked the second filter and it was so hot that I couldn't remove it from the vacuum until it cooled a bit. It was also very dirty. After cleaning the filters, the vacuum again worked as it should.Fine Silt:The type of dirt that was being drawn out of the carpet was a very fine silt (about as fine as baking flour). If you see that the majority of the material that you're vacuuming up is that fine, you should clean your filters much more frequently than is suggested by Dyson. If the quantity is such that the canister fills within a very short period of time, you should check the filters after a couple of hours of use.Using the Hose:In one review, someone complained that they had to use the 3ft wand and they couldn't understand why Dyson designed it that way. The wand clips on like any other accessory. If you don't want to use the wand, remove it and install the accessory tool directly onto the hose.There was a complaint that the hose was hard to extend. The hose is actually very flexible and easy to stretch out. This hose is designed to collapse. This is the only practical way to store 10+ feet of hose on-board. When the vacuum is on and you restrict the airflow into the vacuum, the hose will tend to contract. This is to be expected. If the vacuum had less suction, it would tend to contract less but that would defeat the purpose. I find it easier to have the vacuum behind me with the hose over my shoulder when using the hose. This makes it much easier to use the hose-end attachments for extended periods of time.Proper Orientation of the Vacuum:When using the hose with attachments, have the front of the vacuum facing away from you. This will ensure that the vacuum will move easily with you as you pull on the hose. If you pull on it from the side, it can pull the vacuum over. If you pull on it as suggested, it will follow you perfectly.Misleading Reviews:There are reviews that indicate that the vacuum doesn't have much suction because it can't pull a paper towel roll away from another vacuum. If a vacuum is properly designed/adjusted for the carpet, there will be very little leakage around the perimeter of the vacuum head. You want the air to be flowing up through the carpet, not from around the perimeter of the roller head. This vacuum does a very good job of sealing to the carpet which means that it pulls hard from deep in the carpet, not just from the surface.There is a review that shows the head flopping around as the reviewer flicks the vacuum from side to side. First, no one uses a vacuum like that unless they're intentionally trying to make it malfunction. Second, when the vacuum is running, the suction will keep the roller head pulled down to the carpet.Bag vs Bagless:Many people like bagless vacuums because they don't need to buy bags. For me, this vacuum has been a lot more work than a bag vacuum, especially since I had more crud under the carpet than most people due to using a poor performing vacuum previously. When considering buying a bagless vacuum, I think you need to see what sort of material that you are picking up. For larger material (lint, hair, bits of grass...), a bagless vacuum may be a good choice. If you have a lot of fine dirt/silt like I did, a bagged vacuum may be a better option. When I have to empty the canister, I have to do so outdoors. The dust is so fine that there is no way to prevent having a dust cloud. Even if I could empty it into an inside trash can without causing a dust cloud, it would be impossible to close the trash bag without making a mess. I have to go empty the canister outdoors.For those who say that they have the same problem (making a dust cloud) when changing the bags in their bag type vacuums, try this... When you open the vacuum and pull the bag off of the internal nozzle that goes into the bag, immediately cover the hole in the bag with a couple of strips of packing or duct tape. With the hole covered, you can handle the bag and no dust will escape.Poor Suction:There have been complaints that the DC25 has little or no suction. If you encounter that problem (especially with a new vacuum), you should look for leaks where the canister meets the body of the vacuum or on the various sections of hose. These vacuums have a lot of suction. It would be a shame to get rid of such a good vacuum for such a simple problem. As was mentioned before, the filters must be cleaned. It's also possible to suck something large up into the vacuum to make it lose suction.Thorough Cleaning:When cleaning the canister, you generally just push the release and let the contents fall out. If you have used it to clean really dirty carpets, you may want to go a step further. You should realize that the clear canister can be removed from the rest of the cyclone assembly. With that removed, you can easily remove any material stuck to the side of the perforated area. Any material there will reduce the airflow into the vacuum and reduce suction. When the filters need to be cleaned, I take the cyclone assembly apart and wash the entire assembly thoroughly. If it's really dusty, it's best to slowly submerge it in a bucket of soapy water. Submerging it quickly will cause a dust cloud. After the clinging dust/dirt is saturated, you can wash it out with a garden hose. There is only one part that may be affected by water and it's a small beige plastic assembly under the top cover. I either remove the top cover from the cyclone assembly or avoid getting that part wet. If you clean the cyclone assembly like this, be sure to let it dry completely before using it again. You can shake most of the water out of it. Shake it. Wipe it dry and then shake it again. Dry any remaining water with a cloth and let it dry. This applies to the canister/cyclone assembly only. Do not allow any other part of the vacuum to get wet.Pre-Motor Filter:When cleaning the pre-motor filter, I've found that it's easiest to do in a sink filled with water. I apply a soap (liquid hand soap or similar) and squeeze it repeatedly under water. The water will become very dirty if the filter is really dirty. Drain the water and continue to do this until the water remains clear. Wring the filter out and let it dry. You need to get out as much water as possible at this point to reduce drying time. You need to make sure that the filter is completely dry before using it again. The air passes thorough this filter and directly into the motor. If there is water in the filter, it will be pulled into the motor and is likely to damage the vacuum. This will not likely be covered under warranty.Motor Exhaust Filter:When checking the motor filter (the one in the ball), tap it on a hard surface. If dust is seen, it's time to clean it, even if it hasn't been 6 months. As was stated previously, dirty filters make the motor run hot and will likely reduce the life of the vacuum.Good Filtration:One thing that I've noticed with this vacuum is that there is no smell of dust in the air when using it, no matter the type of material being vacuumed (I've never tried vacuuming cigarette ashes and would avoid doing so). My other vacuums all emitted a smell of dust. There is absolutely no odor of any type when using this vacuum. A carbon filter is available that can reduce odor emission if that becomes a problem.Mini Turbine Head:For the 'animal' vacuums that have the rotating brush attachment (mini turbine head), there have been complaints that there is no suction because too much suction is used to turn the brush (air flow powers the roller, not electricity). If you have this problem, there is an issue with either the attachment or the vacuum. When both are working properly, the brush has plenty of power and there is plenty of suction. I did find that the bushing on the end of the roller needed a bit of lubrication to operate smoothly. They could solve this by using a ball/roller bearing instead of a brass sleeve bearing/bushing. If you have fine furniture, you would not want to lubricate the bushing. It works as it should but not as smoothly as it could with a proper bearing.Roller Drive Belt:When I initially began looking at vacuums, the first thing I did was to look at the belts that they used to drive the roller/beater bar. The problem that I had with my previous vacuum was that as soon as I got the vacuum adjusted to pick up properly, the roller would put too much stress on the belt and the belt would overheat. This would cause it to stretch and the roller would not longer spin as it should (you could hear it slow significantly on various parts of the carpet). This vacuum uses a cogged belt that cannot slip. It also has a secondary motor to drive the roller. This means that it takes no power from the motor creating the vacuum. If you inadvertently vacuum something that you shouldn't (like a long shoestring under a bed) and the roller is stopped, the power to the roller will be shut down (to protect the motor). When this happens, you can pull the shoestring (or whatever) from the roller. The roller motor will not restart on its own and won't restart if you push the roller button/switch. You have to turn the vacuum off and then back on to reset the roller motor.Proper Tool for the Job:There have been complaints that the vacuum wouldn't pick up large items like cereal and that a cheaper type of vacuum worked better. There is no device that will work well for every application. For a vacuum to pull up as much as possible from carpets, it needs to seal tightly to the carpet. This won't generally work well on large, solid objects. For those who need to pick up items like cereal, you may want to invest in a motorized sweeper. These have no vacuum. They only spin a brush to sweep material into a dustcup. Use the right tool for the job.Turning Sharply:Some people claim that it doesn't turn as sharply as advertised. It turns very well but not at a sharp 90, especially if you're not pushing it forward. It's still more maneuverable than any other upright vacuum that I've used.Cord Length:There have been complaints about the short cord. I don't find it too short. Longer means more cord to manage and to keep out of the way when vacuuming.Animal Version:For those who do not know, the animal version only varies from the all-floors model by the color (purple vs yellow) and the mini turbine tool (included with the animal model only - but available separately).No Light:There have been complaints about having no light. That is somewhat of a problem but is easily solved. I purchased a headlamp (Fenix HP11) and it works beautifully. It's also very useful when cleaning in dark areas without the vacuum. Having the light come from a higher position works better than any light that could be mounted on the vacuum. It's also very good in that it allows you to see in dark corners. It's amazing how much dirt/dust you can see when there is plenty of light. If you use this option, you'll want to invest in rechargeable batteries. If you're like me and already have plenty of rechargeable AA batteries, you won't have to invest in batteries and a charger. You can buy cheaper headlamps than the one suggested but the Fenix is very good and can be used for other things.Initial Assembly:Some have complained that it was difficult to assemble. There are only a couple of pieces but if you're not familiar with the design, I can see how it might be confusing. When you get it, the wand will not be attached. The hose plugs into the handle end of the wand. The wand goes onto the vacuum with the handle end down and the hose to the back of the vacuum. It may not be immediately obvious but the handle slides over the rounded post on the top of the body of the vacuum. When the handle is in place on the vacuum, the wand will slide down smoothly and easily into the hose. When it's all of the way down, there will be a click and the cover will close over the top of the wand. To remove the wand/handle, lift up on the red part of the wand until it detaches from the body of the vacuum. It's very simple after you see it done once but not immediately obvious if you've never seen a vacuum like this.Tool Storage:Some complain that there is no place to store all of the attachments on the vacuum. I purchased a tool bag to store the attachments. I purchased a second canister assembly so I use a tool bag that's large enough to hold that as well.Canister Capacity:There have been complaints about the canister capacity and having to empty it too often. This is to be expected for any type of bagless. No vacuum is perfect. If a vacuum is very powerful, you will have to empty it or replace the bags more often. Bagless vacuums always have less capacity than bagged vacuums of the same style/size. For people with pets that shed a lot, the canister will fill to the max line quickly because the hair won't settle to the bottom. If you have no pets, it will take much longer to fill the canister, especially after the initial use remove most of the deep-down dirt. A bagless with a larger canister will take a bit longer to fill but will still require frequent emptying.

column7: Heavy, cumbersome to use, could clean better.
column8: I've had mine for 6 years.  No repair issues works as it did when it was new.Does not clean slightly warn tracks in carpet very well.  The vacuum air discharge blows dust around on bare floors.  The cord attaches half way down the handle making it difficult to grab and toss out of the way, that gets to be a real nuisance.  And the cord does not toss very far and could be longer.  It is noisy.  The hose is short and stiff making it a nuisance to use when cleaning window cills, etc.I have thought about replacing it many times for a lighter vacuum with more suction, one that I did see in a local vacuum shop and was less expensive.This is a heavily advertised vacuum, and expensive.  When I was shopping I wanted a good one, should have kept looking.
Awesome vacuum in every aspect.  I truly am happy I made this purchase.  The prices was better than any other place I looked.

Purchased this and didn't get to use it until just before Thanksgiving. Have loved it ever since. It is easy to move in tight areas. That's a plus because I don't have a lot of space in my dining area and always had to move the chairs into the great room. Now, I can just pull the chairs away from the table and get completely under the table. I purchased the 'animal' version because I have two dogs. I can hear this Dyson sucking up grit and crumbs that they drag in through the doggie door onto my oriental rug. Plus it goes easily from the rug to the hardwood and also does a great job on the ceramic tile in the kitchen and wall to wall carpet in the bedroom. It also isn't as noisey as my other vacs. This model comes as the 'animal' and regular...so if you have pets, be careful to get the 'animal' version. It is worth the extra. This was the best price, even with TV shopping special value (not the animal) and department store specials. Worth every penny. Easy to use, easy to assemble, easy to push and oh, wow, the pick up of dirt and dog hair.

column7: Dyson DC25 lives up to expectation
column8: This vacuum cleaner really does the job.  Time will tell if it holds up to regular use (we've used Hoovers in the past, they tend to wear out) but it appears very well thought out in design, and very well constructed so I expect good durability.  I believe it's a very good value for the money.
This vacuum does everything it claims.  I use it every day now that it is so easy to use.

When my Royal finally gave up the ghost, I started looking around for a new vacuum. I looked no further than my housekeeper who was on her second Dyson, this one an Animal.  Our daughter calls it the pet vacuum and with good reason.  She has 2 dogs, we have a cat and not just any dog, but a full-coated rough collie who comes from a line of show dogs renown for their coats.Boy, does this vacuum work!  It's light, easy to maneuver and I just love the way you can switch to the hand-held nozzle for furniture.  Between the cat and the dog, I have to vacuum my furniture as much as much as I do the carpets and floor.  And speaking of floors, this vacuum has a button you push to turn off/on the beater bar so it goes from carpet to floor in a heartbeat.The only flaw I can see with this vacuum is that chord.  It's a one-room chord, whereas my previous vacuum was a 2-room chord.  A little aggravating to get used to but considering all the features the animal has in comparison to my other vacuums, and I'm pretty happy.  When I was shopping for my previous vacuum, I was told that the average life of a vacuum was 2 years.  Of course I stretched that out to 8 years because apparently I don't vacuum as often as other people, in fact, I might be a borderline hoarder, but enough about me, the Animal is a great vacuum, light weight, lots of suction and you can see in the canister how much dirt and hair you're picking up.  In fact the first time I went to empty the canister, without reading the instructions of course, I opened it up all over the floor in front of me.  I couldn't believe all the dirt.  Well, easy enough, I put the now-empty canister back on and vacuumed up the dirt for a second time.So, all in all, I'm very happy with my new vacuum and I paid only $100 more for it than I did for my Royal 8 years ago.  Now, while I can't say vacuuming is a joy, at least it's a bit more pleasurable.  Thanks, Mr. Dyson for your great product.

I was very nervous to spend so much money on a vacuum. But, when black Friday came by and Home Depot had it for $385.00 I could not resist. Im glad I did not. I have a 4300 Sq.Ft. house and about 3500 of it is carpet. It used to take me hours to vacuum the floor because my Dirt Devil did not do a good job. I would avoid vacuuming like the plague. but now that I bought the Dyson Animal, I'm done in half the time. Believe it or not I don't mind the chore anymore. And I'm a guy! I think of this machine as a powertool for women. This machine Rocks!!I could not believe how much dirt was in my carpet. Actually, if you don't by a Dyson know that you're carpets are full of dirt and you're living in it. This machine is so easy to use and the ball feature makes it very easy to manuver. I also like how everything fits together and it is very lightweight. I can't wait until they come out with a carpet cleaner.

column7: Amazing for our house with 3 cats
column8: Our old vacuum just wasn't cutting it and after several friends with Dysons let us know how great theirs worked, we decided to try it.Vacuuming our house the first time with the Dyson Animal Ball had the canister half-full with mostly pet hair and we were disturbed at how much our previous vacuum had left behind!We also have a new wool rug that previously had to be vacuumed by hand with attachments due to the small clumps of wool that would gather and be left behind.  This has never happened with the Dyson  - it gets everything and we only have to use the hand attachments for things that actually need it, like our furniture.I would recommend the Dyson to any household, but especially those with pets that shed.

I am a Samoyed owner. My two beautiful, long-haired white dogs live in the house with me. I groom them indoors, and then vacuum after the three-times weekly combings. I had a clunky Kirby for years, and it finally gave out. Asking around in my circle of pet-owner friends, everyone said, 'Get a Dyson Animal!' I was a bit put off by the price, but this has been the best investment in a household appliance I have ever made. When I first bought it, I vacuumed with the Kirby first. Then I went over the same territory with the Dyson Animal DC25. I couldn't believe how much more it picked up, from dog hairs to dust!I am a huge fan of this machine for carpets. And the suction is great for other applications, too. But I am a bit disappointed in limited attachments provided for the price. I've had to purchase the extra attachment set, which added to the price of the vacuum.Also, cleaning the filters is a bit of a pain four times a year. I suspect most people don't clean the filters, since it involves dismantling the machine.Still, this machine is great, and I would recommend it to anyone who has a pet.

The is the best vacuum ever! I recieved it as a gift last x-mas 2009, it works so well. no messy filters to clean, just rinse the filters every 3-6 months. I have one cat (used to have 2)boy I used my old bagless hoover to vacuum all throughout the house, then used the DYSON, wow it was amazing how much the hoover left behind. You will not be dissapointed with this vacuum !

I just purchased this vacuum. It's my second dyson. The first a small DC24 (all floor; light weight) has done a WONDERFUL job over the 4 years I've owned it.  I have 2 persian cats and wanted the animal to help with cat hair on the posts and also being larger than the DC 24 I have, this house is much larger, something that can handle all my needs. I kept the DC24 for light jobs when we have a 2nd story house, etc. (we are military so we move a lot). At this time the DC25 sucked up a full load of what the Hoover I bought just under 60days ago did not ( I took back the hoover). I was trying to be cheap and although I knew that the Dyson was better, I thought that the price savings would make up for any inferior vacuum the hoover would be. Well it did not make up for anything! The hoover is AWFUL and I took it back! Amazon has the BEST price on this vacuum which retails for $550+.. I paid $438 no tax, no shipping.I could NOT be more pleased. There is NO comparison to the dyson. I know it's a lot to spend for a vacuum but it's worth every penny. Sucked up years of cat hair off the post.  The hoover belt already smoked, bottom plate popped off ( I had the hoover windtunnel pet for under 60 days). I missed the ball too with the hoover. My DC 24 has a ball and  so does the DC25 Animal. With the ball, you can literally vacuum with ONE hand and the flick of your wrist!!!! SOOO easy it's  Amazing.  If you've never used a dyson w/ the ball, you are in for a MUCH  better experience to vacuum! Flick your wrist it moves, push it and it's comparable to a self propelled lawn mower to a non self propelled mower (all non ball vacuums; non dysons)! It moves SO easily! It sucks VERY well, yet does not mess up the new carpet in our  house! The hoover tears up the carpet, and I have several clear plastic strings coming up from the hoover being too rough. Yet, the dyson gets more dust, dander, and lint/hair than the hoover did, it's much easier on the carpet. Glides along vs tugging.  The chord is long enough. Overall,  quality is just 'it' .. you do get what you pay for.. shop around, amazon.com will always have the best price. Even if you do not have a pet the 'animal' has features that might be useful to you vs the all floors: it includes a MUCH better accessory with it's own brush roll, attachments, and what I feel is a better overall vacuumI noticed another positive for dyson: both this DC25 and my DC24: nothing can touch the bare floor quality, it goes from my rugs on the kitchen floor to the vinyl to ceramic with EASE. The hoover I had to lift up and manipulate to get it over a rug, the dysons: NO problem! EASY to get from a rug, to bare to carpet...  A neighbor borrowed my DC24 and she was AMAZED at the bare floor suction... dyson's are also lower and I can get RIGHT up to my baseboards under kitchen cabinets, no rubbing, etc... My son gets asthma like symptoms and technically could be diagnosed with asthma; 'allergy induced bronchitis' that sometimes requires nebs and inhalers as well during the spring.  This vacuum is accepted by the allergy and asthma institute certified. He's not allergic to cats, however, this vacuum does  cuts down on hair and allergy airborne particles that bother him.  HIGHLY recommended!!Heidi Weaver
Best investment ever, works like a charm and well worth the cost.  Easy to use and clean.  I would highly recommend buying this product

After using this unit for over a month I am still impressed. We have 2 long hair indoor cats and our last canister vacuum couldn't keep up with them. This vacuum is light and easy to maneuver, has incredible suction that gets every last piece of cat fur out of all rugs, and the canister has so many advantages versus bags. It has been able to pick up spilled cat food and other small items from the floor as well. Highly recommend this unit!!!!

column7: Dyson a GREAT House Warming Gift
column8: This was a family gift for a couple who have 3 large dogs!!!  Their new home had miles of carpet and the 'Animal' gobbles up pet hair without breaking a sweat.  The ball glide works great even on wood and tile floors, and does a good job on stairs.  They love the gift knowing their dream house can be both clean and hold 3 indoor doggie guests.

I have been researching and debating on purchasing a Dyson.  My husband and I lead a very active life between our Boxer puppy and housecat the pet hair was getting over the top!  It seems like every year I am always standing in the vacuum aisle blowing another [...] on a new vacuum that claims it has new technology blah blah blah.  Sure, they are bagless but they also suck (no pun intended) at picking up even obvious pet hair to the naked eye while just recirculated all the dust and grime to stir up my allergies.  [...]  After bringing the box inside, the vacuum snapped together in an easy 5 minutes and the instructions in the box were clear and simple to follow.  I did an experiment before I tried out the Dyson: I vacuumed my living room with my 1 year old Bissel and then back over the same room with the Dyson.  The Dyson picked up THREE canisters of pet hair and dust. WOW WOW WOW!  I used the attachment to pick up the cat hair my cat has left on the couch and it was unbelievable.  The carpet feels so much cleaner in between my toes and it's a great feeling!  The previous reviews state that the canister is too small--it is a little bit on the small side but if that means I have to empty it a few more times--big deal!  The cord does not seems short at all--unless you have only one outlet in your house, its really not noticeable.  For how easy this is to get the vacuum up & going and for how great of a job it does, any of those 2 shortcomings seem like nothing.  Well worth every penny and no more buying crappy vacuums because this one comes with a 5 year warranty!  At the rate I purchase vacuums it will pay for itself in 3.5 years. Bravo!!

I was a non believer at first I must admit... paying all that money for a vacuum seemed rediculous. But after many lost battles agains the animal (and husband) hair in my house I became interested. I started researching and also saw a consumer report on my local news. I was so determined to get one that I asked my husband for one for my birthday (true determination). To my suprise he got me one... Man does it SUCK! Love it!!!I decided to 'test' it myself. I currently have an old (15 years?) top of the line vacuum. After running the old vacuum I ran the Dyson animal ball to see if it would collect more hair like it did on the news. It did!Score: Dyson 1  Old one: 0I put powder on the floor (actually my son spilled my good bath powder on the floor).Score: Dyson 2  Old one: .5The cat food Gavin spilledScore: Dyson 4  Old one: 1 (I know you are thinking 2 points?! there is enough suction that the brushed don't shoot the food out of the back of the vacuum, so it only took like 2 sweeps to get it all)the big test...I turned the brushes off to take it across the hard wood floor to another room as to not scratch the floor and to my suprise it started to pull hair from around the floor into the vacuum and I wasn't really trying to vacuum that floor just get across it.To anyone like me that has animals and lots of hardwood you know that no vacuum has ever been able to clean the pet hair up from the upright position (ie. not using the wand). This vacuum does.Game over!This vacuum keeps its promise... it sucks!

column7: This unit really sucks - in more ways than one!
column8: We have had an Electrolux Guardian canister vaccuum for years, but my husband was tired of lugging it around, and suggested we try out this Dyson.  Since we have two dogs (a Labradoodle and a Lab), and it bills itself as a vaccuum for people that have animals, we thought we would give it a try.From the moment we unpacked it, we realized that it is cheaply put together, and just feels cheap.  Lose one star for that.The instructions were pretty minimal, which created a little bit of grief as we tried to put it together.  Where does this plug in?  How does it plug in? etc.  Lose another star for that!After assembling it (without breaking anythying), we decided to clean our carpets.  I guess I would say that it did an okay job, but I had to run over several spots multiple times (though they only require one swipe with the Electrolux).  The pickup canister was admittedly interesting - kinda neat to see what gets picked up.  The canister certainly filled up the 'max' line quickly, and required emptying several times (gee, the bag in the Electrolux, seems to last a couple/few months)...On to the stairs and WHOA!  The brush for the stairs is NOT POWERED at all, relying instead on the suction power of the unit to run the brush.  Needless to say, that did not go well at all.  Lots of frustrated trading off with my husband as we struggled to clean the stairs with this unit.  We called the 800 number on the vaccuum, and the Dyson folks told us that it must be our carpet - odd, that the Electrolux doesn't have any issue with it!  Another star lost.If it can't do the stairs, we figure, then what is the use?  We just finished packing it up and returning.  Long story short, I do NOT recommend this for someone that has pets that shed and carpetted stairs.Sorry!

column7: The Most Amazing Vacuum Cleaner EVER!!
column8: I purchased this vacuum because it was on sale and because I had heard such great things about it from a friend. My friend was not exaggerating! It is absolutely amazing at how much pet hair it picks up, whether from regular floor or carpet. My husband remarked that on our laminate floors it looked like it had also been mopped!It also has an attachment for furniture that is also wonderful. We have a cat who likes to sit on our dining room table chairs, and the attachment sucked up all the cat hair like it was never there.It is very easy to use and the only upkeep is to wash the filter in cold water every 3 months. No need to purchase other filters, etc. It also moves like a dream, especially around corners and under furniture. I wish that I had purchased this item earlier!
Just simply awesome! Nothing more to say... I wish I would have bought one years ago, but glad I have now!

I never write reviews for products, but I just had to for this Dyson.  I know these things aren't cheap, but this is by far worth the money for a clean house.  My wife LOVES it!!We cleaned the house for a Thanksgiving Day get together with family.  Vacuumed the carpets once with old vac, then cleaned them twice with the steam cleaner.  Afterwards, we put down some freshening powder and vacuumed it up with the old vac.  The Dyson came in the mail a couple of days later.  We vacuumed the carpets to see how much it would pick up.  We weren't expecting much.  Wow, were we surprised.  From two bedrooms and a living room, we got about half of the container full of dirt and cat hair.  Amazing!!

This has to be the best vacuum I've ever owned.  You can literally go over a carpet with a normal vacuum and make it look clean.  Then run over the same rug with this vacuum and fill the canister.  I took mine over to my mothers house, lets just say she's a bit obsessive about the look, and cleanliness, of her house and ran that test (She had literally just vacuumed).  I was blown away at how much it picked up.  The rolling ball and the low profile intake make edging furniture a dream.  Absolutely amazing.

I bought this vacuum at Target after thorough research and reading tons of other reviews. I am a dog owner and frequently foster dogs for local rescue groups. I had bought a Bissell but it wasn't cleaning like I needed it to. My friend had the Dyson DC25 and I was constantly borrowing it from him... so I decided to bite the bullet and cough up the money for this machine and I'm SO GLAD I DID!!!When I first brought it home I wanted to test it out so I vacuumed the entire home with my Bissell... then turned around and used the DC25 Animal and WOW was I shocked! I had to empty the canister 3 times! Even after using the Bissell!!! It just goes to show that the other vacuums don't clean deep into the carpet like the Dyson does. There was so much pet hair and dirt that came up. My carpets surface appeared clean with the Bissell.... but it obviously was disgusting underneath the surface!With random dogs (big and small) constantly coming inside and outside you'd think my carpet would be a mess (most of my home is carpeted) but thanks to this AMAZING vacuum my carpet still looks brand new after 2 years!I love this machine so much that I don't even bother putting it in a closet. I keep it in the living room (it's compact and sits in the corner) so it's in easy reach whenever I need it. I'm hoping this will last me many, many years!

After lugging an inefficient and clumsy Kirby around for 15 years, my wife bought a DC-25, and it was love at first sight.  For reviewers who say that a some aspects of assembly and use are a challenge to figure out, we beg to differ.  In five minutes, my wife had it out of the box, assembled and running; the instructions were still in the bag.  The mini-turbine head is great at getting cat hair off of furniture, and the reach of the wand makes getting at hard-to-reach places a breeze.  The Animal is light, powerful, and very easy to handle.  It goes from the tile floor to the carpet with ease, and no settings to change.  The cannister does fill up a bit quickly, but it's so easy to dump (and none of the hassle of bags), that it doesn't matter.  We're really pleased with it; well, I probably will be if she lets me use it. :-)

I have two big dogs and live on a beach so between sand and dog hair, I never felt my carpet was clean.  The only time I did was when I had the carpet company in and then, it never lasted long.  The first time I went over our living room, I filled it with dog hair and sand.  It was so easy to push.  I used to alway get my husband to vacumn because it was so hard to push.  This just glides and the ball action makes it so easy to get around furniture.  I NEVER buy the more expensive vacumns but spurged and bought one for myself for Christmas.  I love the 5 year warrenty also, we will certainly give it a run for the money with all the sand and dog hair!

column7: Don't buy this vacuum cleaner!  It has serious engineering flaws
column8: I bought this vacuum because, coming from a science and engineering background, I appreciate a well engineered product and I had heard good things about the engineering design of this vacuum.  But the Dyson has disappointed me in several key respects in that area; so much so, that this vacuum cleaner *seriously* annoys me every time I use it, even though it ultimately gets the job done in the end.The pros:1) It does have pretty good suction, compared to our old bagless upright.  I have no complaints about how well it cleans our carpets and hardwood floors, although I have noticed that it does not pick stuff up as well on hardwood as it does on carpet.  It still does better on hardwood than our old vacuum, however.2) It is fairly easy to maneuver.3) It is fairly lightweight and easy to carry. It is also compact and easy to store.4) You don't have to read a big thick manual to get started with it.  You take it out of the box, and little easy-to-follow pictograms show you how to snap it together and get it started.5) I can wash the canister out, which I like to do on a regular basis to reduce allergens, and get rid of that 'dirty dog' smell that vacuums develop if you don't do this.The cons:1) As noted by other reviewers, dirt mixed with dog hair does not willingly come out of the canister unless you stick your hand in there to pull it out. Yuck.2) I *hate* the hose/wand attachment.  It is the absolute most annoying thing about this vacuum.  The wand telescopes into the hose, and about 25% of the time I have great difficulty sliding the wand out.  I am worried I am going to break the plastic one of these days because I have to pull so hard.  I have no idea why sometimes it comes out relatively easily, and other times I am pulling and straining and swearing a blue streak trying to get the d*mn thing out.3) More on why I *hate* the hose/wand: the thought that went into engineering the ergonomics of this attachment is non-existent!  I always vacuum the periphery of my rooms first with the hose/wand, and I find that I am trying to maneuver a long rigid wand on the end of a quite short flexible hose.  I always have to kink the hose over to get the wand to touch the floor, which I am sure is going to drastically shorten the lifetime of the hose.  It also decreases the suction, and stuff tends to clog up where the kink is.  This vacuum is simply not designed for use of the hose/wand on any surface less than 6 feet up.  And forget about anything more than about 7.5 feet up, because the wand isn't long enough unless you physically lift the vacuum cleaner higher.4) The power button for the motor head does not properly start the motor head until you push it 3, 4, 5+ times.  You hit it, and the motor head starts, but as soon as you release the button, the motor head stops.  So you push, push and push again until the d*mn thing finally engages.  I expect a lot higher quality than this from a high priced vacuum.Every time I use this vacuum I am ultimately satisfied with the job it does, but I get very, *very* annoyed in the process.*********************Update: Jan 31, 2012I now give this vacuum cleaner 1 star (and would give it 0 stars if I could).  The starter switch on the vacuum cleaner has completely broken and it cannot be turned on.  It is unacceptable that I now have to shell out what is likely to be at least $100 for repairs to a $500 supposedly-top-of-the-line vacuum cleaner that is less than 18 months old.  I'm never buying another Dyson product again.

Well I say all the time that I am going to divorce my husband and marry my iphone because I love it so much.  When I do marry my iphone, I'm going to cheat on it with my Dyson! I love it just as much as my iphone!I have been vacuuming for the last two hours with my new Animal. First, I had no idea my house was so dirty. Suction is fabulous! Picks up my 85 lb Lab's hair like a dream. Also, I live in Florida by the beach so sand is continuously being tracked into my house. I was shocked at how much sand was in the canister. I had no idea. Second, The ease of transferring between different floor types is a breeze. Third, transitioning to using the wand is also a snap. Fourth, emptying the canister is as easy as it gets...no touching the icky stuff. Fifth, the ball is a dream, I didn't realize how heavy my old vacuum was or how hard of a chore vacuuming was with my old vac until I used my Dyson. Sixth, This vacuum is easy to carry upstairs, When I tried lifting the other Dyson Animal (non-ball) it was too heavy. The ball is very manageable.The only gripe I have is the use of the wand. While vacuuming the stairs it is difficult to achieve the right angle on the hose attachment because the wand itself is a solid rigid piece and seems too long to me. It's almost like you have to back away from whatever you are vacuuming to vacuum it comfortably.  And when I pull on the wand/hose to move further up the stairs, I seem to pull the vacuum itself closer to me on the tile floor (needs a brake!). I wish the wand itself was more flexible and that would make it easier to achieve the right angle for suction.I read all the reviews before I purchased. Some people mention the size of the canister...I don't see this as a problem with regular vacuuming. The first time I vacuumed with it, I emptied the canister 9 times for a 2200 square foot home. I guess that is a testament to how much more this vacuum picks up with it's awesome suction! My old vac obviously couldn't keep up!The other complaint from other reviewers was the cord length. Personally I think that if the cord was any longer it would be a burden to keep off the floor and out of the way of the vacuum while I was vacuuming. With that said my house is an open floor plan with a combined living, dining, kitchen and den with no walls...so it's very easy to move between rooms.All in all, if I had to spend the money all over again...I would buy this vacuum again, and again or at least until Dyson comes out with the next new improved version and then I'll buy that. It's not perfect but it's as good as it gets.

This is my first Dyson after using products from Hoover (bagged) and Eureka (bagless). There are lots of glowing reviews here, so let me inject some criticisms for those interested in purchasing this vacuum.-The ball is an improvement but not as great as advertised. It probably enhances mobility by about 10%, while adding strain to your wrist. Overall, I'd say it is an improvement over regular wheels, but just barely.-The hose collapses compactly, making a streamlined looking vacuum, but the tension on it is too strong when stretched. This makes using it to clean stairs impractical. I found holding the entire vacuum with two hands to do stairs was simpler, faster, and with less strain. Also, the promotional image of the woman stretching out the hose is false advertisement. If you barely stretch it (about 20% elongation), the vacuum will come rolling towards you.-Aside from the purple color and turbine brush, there is no difference between the Animal and the All Floors model. This also means there is no place on the vacuum to attach the turbine brush. If it's not on the vacuum, you're much less inclined to utilize it.-Emptying the canister is more than just touching a button and releasing the dust. Dust also collects around the perforated grill area. On every empty, I find myself having to press a second release, remove the upper portion of the canister, and brush away the stuck on dust. Overall, still easier than with the Eureka.-Picked up less dust than I expected. This may be due to the brush bar, with sparse bristles, which doesn't dig down enough into my medium-pile carpet.And some good notes:-The exhaust for this vacuum is very clean--the HEPA filter is no gimmick. I often smelled hints of dust from the Hoover and Eureka, assuming that's just how vacuuming smells. This is totally different.-The brush bar gets less hair tangled in it than with my previous vacuums. Whether this is due to it not picking up the hair, or the hair entering the canister is hard to determine. I've been using a Roomba, so it may be keeping hair levels down.Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase, but only at the extreme discount I got. I would not but this vacuum at the retail price.

I love this vacuum!  I've had it a few months now and it works great.  I am replacing a cheap vacuum that occasionally broke, was heavy and had bags that were hard to change.  After getting this vacuum, I cleaned the house and had to empty the canister 3 times! (and we have a pretty small house) I can't believe how much dust and junk it picked up that my old vacuum missed.  It works great and seems to be very well made.  Although I was not excited to pay so much, I think it was worth it.

This review is for those who already own a Dyson and are looking to buy one as a gift or to replace an older model.  For those who have never bought a Dyson.... stop reading and buy the DC25!  Ok, for the rest of us....  I would like to compare the DC25 Animal to the DC07 (one of Dyson's earliest models).  Our DC07 broke down... RIP old friend.Good points on DC07:- Cord length is awesome.  I can vacuum the entire living room/dining area without changing outlets.- Bucket size is bigger than the DC25 and is easier to empty.  It is also easier to put back into the cleaner.- Bigger motor.  (Although the DC25 is supposed to be more efficient.)- Quieter.  This is because the DC25 has 2 motors (one for the main motor, and a separate one for the floor bristles).  Turn the bristles off on the DC25 and they are about the same.Good points on DC25:- Much more efficient.  I steam cleaned the carpet last week, then used the DC25.... OMG there was a ton of dog hair!  I didn't even see it on the floor!- Narrower.  This is a benefit because you can go between chair legs (I couldn't before).- The ball.  Need I say more?  The ball is awesome.  You can turn on a dime.  The form factor also allows you to go further under couches.- The Animal has a cool vacuum attachment for the arm extention.  Although they didn't include a spot to put it on the cleaner. :(- Two additional filters that can be hand cleaned.- You can turn off the bristles on the floor suction.  There is a separate button.- Lighter.Bad points to DC25:- The arm extention is clumsy.  The DC07 wasn't great either, but the extention on the DC25 appears heavier and is much shorter in comparison.- Cord length is too short.- The bucket seems cheaply made and doesn't easily snap in when you put it back into the vacuum.- The cool vacuum attachment doesn't have a place in the cleaner.
bought this for the wife so hopefully she would stop asking me to vacuum.  She has not asked me to vacuum once in the 2 months we have owned it now!!!

We purchased the Dyson Animal Ball expecting a good vacuum cleaner. After the first pass, through what we thought was a clean house, we were stunned to watch as this vacuum picked up a container full of hair and dirt on its maiden voyage. We thought we had a spotless house. But we had no idea. It is very easy to manuver around the furniture and quiet for the power it has. We are very satisfied and highly recommend it to all our friends and family.
Just not as good as I thought it would be. I think a vacuum about half the cost would work just as well.
My wife vacuums once a week with a 10 year old sharp, she used the Dyson as soon as it arrived and it filled up the canister  immediately. Great unit

column7: Buyer BEWARE if you have cats!!!
column8: I just got off the phone with the Dyson customer service, and I'm so mad that I need to write this review!!  I bought this pet version of the Dyson (Dyson DC25 Animal) because I figured it would also be great to use to clean up after my three cats.  Big Mistake!!  It turns out that fine powder or dust, such that you'd get from cats using a litter box with clay litter, can clog the Dyson.  You're out of luck if you spill flour on the floor as well.  The customer service rep. told me that they don't recommend using the Dyson around the litter box.  She also informed me that I'd have to send the Dyson in for service and that the repair of cleaning the inside of the vacuum would NOT be covered under the warranty!!  So now I have a completely useless $500 vacuum!!  This vacuum is marketed specifically as an animal vacuum, but you can't use it to clean up after cats.  That is absolutely rediculous!!  I guess all of those people giving it rave reviews are dog owners.

This was not my first Dyson.  I went back to Dyson because I liked my first one so well.  Some of the buttons on this were more convenient than my older model.  I found the vacuum to be very heavy and cumbersome.  I went to bed with a backache from using it on some carpets in my house.  It was fine for bare floors, but I have pets and rugs do attract hair.  The hose was not as long as I would like and the attachments were not enough.  Wish I would have liked it more.

column7: Great performance, but has design shortcomings. Overall happy with it after one month.
column8: Vacuum reviews are not very meaningful unless the reviewer has had some time to use it for awhile, rather than reviewing on the same day they use it for the first time. I have used my new DC25 Animal for a month now, hopefully I will be as happy with it in 5 years after the warranty expires as I am now. The good outweigh the bad for me (so far).  Ultimately, a great vacuum is all about great suction, and this vacuum has it and does not lose it.The Good:-Suction. It passes my suction test. With the hose it can easily lift and hold a size 11 men's tennis shoe off the floor. It can also nearly suck the curtains completely off from the curtain rods if you're not careful.-The ball. At first I thought this would be a gimmick.  But it really does make vacuuming easier. It practically steers itself in all the hard to reach areas.-5 year warranty.  Enough said.-Easy to remove canister.-Easy to wash filters.-Brush on/off switch (as long as vacuum is not locked upright - see the bad below).-Brush extremely effective.-Excellent carpet performance.-Excellent bare floor performance.-Feels relatively durable, despite being all plastic.-Online product registration easy.-Online support looks above average.  Although hopefully I won't actually have to use it.-Vacuuming is actually a bit more fun.The bad:-The price, even though Amazon had it for $100 less than everywhere else.-Short cord. All the other reviews are right. I didn't think it would bug me, but it does.-Canister a bit small.-Brush automatically shuts off when vacuum is locked upright. That is not ideal for vacuuming carpeted stairs.-The wand and hose can not be used unless you completely unwrap the cord from it.-The hose can not detach unless you have the wand lifted completely out.-Assembly and operating instructions are a bit confusing. No text, all vague pictures.-Mini turbine head is weak. The majority of suction is used to spin its brush, leaving less suction to pick up dirt. The DC25 Animal was actually cheaper than the regular DC25, so no loss here.-For the price, it really needs one of two more additional on-board attachments included besides the two little ones that are.-Animal hair clings inside canister, does not empty from canister so easily without shaking rigorously or using hand to pull it out.In short: I still love this vacuum despite all the improvements in could use.

column7: Money well spent - thank you Amazon
column8: This is an exceptional sweeper.  I have a large black lab and she sheds quite a bit.  This sweeper does a great job of picking up after her.  It was simple to put together and is very easy to use.  I was impressed with how quickly I received it (3 days after ordering).  My wife and I have been using it for a month now and we both are very satisfied.  At first I was hesistant about paying over $400 for a vacuum cleaner but the old saying 'you get what you pay for' really rings true.  The difference between this Dyson and my old $150 Hoover wind tunnel is like night and day.

I have really found myself quite disappointed with this vacuum. I have 2 cats - one of which is a very messy eater. With my old $50 Dirt Devil, this was never a problem. However, my $500 Dyson apparently thinks this is a major problem. On hard surfaces, no matter with the brush on or off, the Dyson just rolls over the pieces of cat food, which then get stuck under the head. I have to either use one of the attachments, or go back over the cats eating area with my little hand held dust buster just to pick it all up!I took the unit in for repair under warranty and was told there is nothing wrong with it. Their answer to me was basically that I should switch cat food. Seriously?Aside from this, the vacuum really is ok. Not great, but ok. It is quite easy to maneuver around, and does most of the things I need it to do. Fortunately, my husband and I received this as a wedding gift, so at least we aren't out the money. However, if I had the opportunity to re-register, I definitely would not ask for this vacuum.
I love this vacuum! I never thought I would be so excited about a cleaning instrument. If you have a pet, you must strongly consider purchasing this vacuum. It is absolutley amazing!

WELL DON'T BE!! I am african american age 27 and I bought the Dyson! Now you know black people don't pay this much for a DOG ON vacuum!!! but I did and I love it! Now when you first buy it you may feel like, 'this thing is overrated', 'there is NOTHING special about this thing'. BUT!!! I say use it more than once...you may not notice much the first vacuum but use it a second time (its all warmed up and ready then) and OMG this vacuum works wonders!! for your carpet!! Now keep in mind its a vacuum for people with animals so if you dont have animals then you won't see the HAIR this thing picks up but you will see alot of dirt!!! If your hair sheds alot then you will surely see yours for sure! I had to use the vacuum 4 times in one day to get all of the years of dog hair up off of my carpet and I had only had it one day! Someone said that they had to change the bin 3 times in one day and they felt that was a BAD THING! Well I say what does that have to say for your carpet. To have to empty the bin that much then you better be GLAD you have the DYSON. I AM SO GRATEFUL AND I RECOMMEND THE DYSON DC25 ANIMAL!

column7: Why did I wait so long?
column8: After suffering far too long with a lesser product, the Animal has been a dream come true. We wish that we had not waited so long before making the move. The Animal works wonderfully and everything about it seems well-thought. From assembly to emptying after use, everything is well-designed and easy to use.

I held off buying a Dyson for years, thinking the price was too high for 'just a vacuum.' I was wrong - these machines have superior engineering, and back it up with a 5 year warranty. If you have pets, you'll be amazed at how well this machine cleans your carpets. I love my dogs, but their shedding has worn out several other 'bagless' vacuum cleaners. Yes, there is a trick to taking the machine apart to clean and empty it, but have patience. I have been very impressed with the performance of this vacuum. I purchased it at Target - this model was on sale, so i saved $110 off the list price. it's so easy to use, my kids argue over who gets to use it - no joke!

I have tried several vacuum cleaners on my rugs and have been very disapointed with each one.I have 2 dogs and 2 cats, and a heavy sheading problem. This Dyson does the job that several others couldn't do.I guess the old saying is correct; 'YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!!'. I would and have reconmended this vac to friends and relatives.

I had a really nice Kirby sweeper but needed a bagless sweeper because of the addition of 2 inside dogs.  The Kirby was awesome but replacing the bags was getting way out of hand.  Much too expensive to keep the Kirby.  I read a lot of reviews on the Dyson on different websites and came across the Animal Dyson on Amazon.com which was a $140.00 cheaper than buying it locally.  Most of the reviews were excellent and a few really worried me.  I bought the Animal Dyson anyway and I am so glad I did!! Those few people that had problems must have bought lemons.  There are always a few lemons in everything you buy from cd players to cars.  Some people complained that it was too heavy.  Those people should try pushing a Kirby.  The Dyson is so light weight and actually fun to use.  It just glides over the carpet.  We have 3 different heights of carpet in our house and the Dyson works great on all of them.  Someone complained about the hose feeling cheap.  I just can not imagine what kind of sweeper that person had before.  My Kirby had the stiffest plastic hose I had ever seen.  The hose on the Dyson is very flexible and does not feel cheap to me.  Another person complained about the Dyson not picking up well and not sucking up debris along the baseboards.  I just don't understand these complaints because mine works fantastic! One person said the Dyson was hard to put together.  Trust me, you do not need to be a scientist to put this thing together.  Buy it and you will like it....I gave up a $1,600.00 bagged sweeper for a $420.00 Dyson and I love it!  p.s. I'm 45 years old and have used a lot of sweepers.

column7: Wheels on dyson for moving across carpet.
column8: I purchased a DC-25 ball animal vacumn cleaner, and the wheels on the vacumn to move it around the house, are not large enough. When I am moving it across the carpet from room to room, it is very hard to roll, and binds in the carpet.  Can this vacumn be modified to put larger wheels on it? Monte Cole

I had heard so much hype online and from friends on how awesome the Dyson products are and I am sorry to say I do not see it. I've had it for a short period of time, but immediately found several items worth mentioning (which I had not read about).1) the size of the head unit is narrow, so you do not get a lot of coverage per pass. It does allow for access to tighter areas, but I would rather use the attachments for that and get 2 to 4' more head width.2) there is no carpet hight adjustment, so you have to work harder on high cut pile where the suction makes movement harder3) there is no light, I miss the light4) the cord is short and for my bigger rooms I have to use multiple outlets5) one speed motor6) the mechanics in back to raise and lower this unit to the floor is plastic, flimsy and does not reflect superior engineering. Real concerned about the life span of this part and when it goes I will have to ship the whole unit somewhere.I am really second guessing this purchase over the Oreck commercial construction and local service.

column7: The LAST vacuum brand you will buy
column8: After purchasing several top brand vacuums over the years, I finally opted for the Dyson DC25 Animal Ball. This is by far, the BEST vacuum I have ever used. The suction is powerful, the brushbar is easily removed when cleaning, as is the collection bin and filter. The suction is also just as strong on the cleaning hose(attachments). It has #1 turning/maneuverability! DEFINITELY worth the money!!!

I had been reading the reviews of the Dyson DC25 Animal and compared to other brands and other Dyson's. As a note I have a Hoover Windtunnel bought about 5 years ago. I bought the Dyson DC33 on Sat., took it home, put it together, and used it. I was kind of happy until I brought out my Hoover. Turned them both on to compare the suction - Hoover won, the DC33 went back.I bought the DC25 Animal and brought it home. I had read that the only difference between the All Floor DC25 and Animal were the accessories. I conducted a couple of different tests to determine if it was going back to never buy a Dyson again. I tested the suction - very good, then put it to work on a the cream colored carpet in the hallway that has had caked on dust along the baseborads for ages - WOW!, after vacuming over a few times, what a major difference, although the carpet still needs cleaned, no more dark dust along the baseboards and the carpet cleaning dude told me they were they to stay! Next test - cream colored carpet in a bedroom that is not used, but was cleaned and vacumed 2 weeks ago and then the door was closed. Now, I expected to pick up some stuff, but definitely not as much as I did. Again, DC25 Animal was so far in my good graces. Next test, wood floors with dust bunnies from a shedding Lab. I have used my Hoover to suck up all the stuff on the floor, but still always something left, whereby I would sweep and dust again. The Animal got along all the little crevices and I was happy that there was nothing left to suck up. I also used it on a Belgian Wool navy blue rug -what a difference. I also used it on a couple of older braided rugs, YEAH!! It worked in getting everything that sticks to those older type of rugs. I di dnotice the house has a cleaner smell to it after vacuming.I'll keep it! But, have to try the tool on the stairs - again cream colored carpet.Now, for those there are considering if its worth the price:1. I used a 30% Kohl's coupon2. I am an Engineer and had no issue putting it together, however, my husband couldn't figure some things out. The written instructions are minimal, so review the pictures.3. I have various types of carpet, but the one thing I noticed was that the beater bar didn't put lines or marks in your carpet so if you are used to walking in the room and noticing the carpet has been 'raked' you won't necessarily get it with this, but do know your carpet is clean. I'll use my Hoover for that so I get pretty lines in my in-laws bedroom.4. There is no storage compartment or clip for the smaller stair accessory.5. You must fill out the paperwork for the warranty.6. The length of the cord is fine for me, but may be short for others, it is still as long or longer than my Hoover.7. The design is easy once you get used to it works. It is not as clunky as my Hoover WT.8. When emptying the container, I still have to reach up and pull the dog hair out, but it is not as dirty as my Hoover. I have to use an air compressor on the Hover filter each time I use it. The Dyson I knock on the trash can a couple times and pull stuff out if necessary. The Dyson is still cleaner to clean than my Hoover.9. The exhaust air is actually clean and does not smell. When vacuming dog hair up with the Hoover, the exhaust air smells like animal hair, not so with the Animal. It is actually clean.10. Test it yourself and if you don't like it, take it back. The Animal picked up fuzz and dust I didn't know I had.I will keep both my Hoover and Dyson - I'll use the Hoover to pick up the dirtier messes - I have a Lab and a houseful of teen/20 something boys - and the Dyson afterwards to get what the Hoover does not.

column7: Dyson DC25 Animal is an animal...
column8: Works as advertised, which is quite an accomplishment.  Two friends of mine have these and after hearing their superlatives I replaced our POS Hoover with it - and it's a joy to use.  Very lightweight, much much smaller than you'd expect from the photos, full of cool geek gadgets and easy to use.  And it sucks, oh boy does it suck.

This thing sucks hardcore! I mean, really, this is the sucking-est vacuum ever! That's exactly what I want in a vacuum. It picks up stuff I didn't even know was there. When we bought our house, we had some fairly major cosmetic changes to make, one being sanding a great deal of textured (ugly) plaster off the walls. We vacuumed with the old vacuum several times. The floor looked clean. That old vacuum died from the dust, so we ended up getting this. We vacuumed the 'clean' floor just to try it out and promptly picked up a great deal more plaster dust, hair, fuzz, etc.I have extremely severe allergies to almost everything a person can be allergic to. As a result, I cannot really vacuum. At least, not without having severe allergy attacks that require a great deal of benedryl. That is until we bought the Dyson Animal Ball vacuum. This is the first vac I have used that is clean enough and well-filtered enough to not send me into a severe attack. I don't even get the sniffles! Great for allergy sufferers!

I just purchased this item this past summer.  It truly is an animal when it comes to cleaning carpet and bare floors.  Was a little tricky to figure out how to release the hose / wand assembly because the instructions are all in pictures instead of english.  But of the 3 vacuums I own, I like this the best.  It's amazing how easy it is to take apart once you know how when you want to clean it and everything.  Great suction and like advertised even picks up cat litter on bare floors.  Very happy with this unit and I hope it works this well as it ages...

This is my second Dyson. True the cord is a bit short and the bag less tank not a large as previous models, but my god does it do a fantastic job of picking up dust, dirt and pet hair. The new Ball-Technology takes a short time to get use to, but once you do it is very easy to maneuver around. If your looking for a vacuum that leaves your floors, rugs and anything else you run it over completely clean then look no futher.

column7: the packaging, the cost and the filter
column8: First lets get the cost out of the way. I am willing to pay a good price for a good vacuum. The vacuum came in a box that was so torn up that it looked like someone had purchased it at a garage sale. I paid over 500.00. I expected more. I cut my finger tore 2 nails getting it out of the well taped and retaped box. I finally put the product together. The filter had to be cleaned. I am sure I paid for a new Dyson.I will not refer this this product to anyone due to the nature of how it arrived and if it was new, I will always question that. I see that the same vacuum is lower in cost. I usually always am happy with Amazon. I spend alot with them. This purchase I am not happy with.I looked today to buy a new filter for the Dyson. Not sure that can be done. Please let it be known I have a Eureka Animal Vacuum that works very well. Much cheaper.Maintenence is the key  in any vacuum. You take care of them and they will always work. I just have always wanted a Dyson and now I wonder why???

I bought two other bagless vacuums recently before this because I had a hard time spending that much on a vacuum.  The other two cost between $150 and $200 and I thought that should be enough to spend on a vacuum.  After being very frustrated with the others I broke down and ordered this.  I would have saved money by buying this originally.  It really does work much better than the others.

column7: The Best Vacuum ever - Even better than my previous one - a Bosch!
column8: It's hard to get excited over a Vacuum - but this one is really awesome.  Received it today at lunch - went home to sign for it - put it together - quick and easy to do!  Had just vacuumed with my Bosch Vac - this new Dyson picked up more stuff that I couldn't see.  It is light, easy to operate - and you can do quick turns!  Be careful, it almost drives itself.But on the serious side, it is a great vacuum and easy for anyone to operate.  I was surprised to see it came with like 6 extra accessories.  Glad I didn't order the extra accessories kit since this vacuum came with most of them!  Buy from Amazon with confidence!  I always buy with confidence at Amazon and this is an excellent purchase for the price!

column7: Excellent in every way.  Lightweight, Perfect for arthritis sufferers!
column8: I just received this vaccuum today and am amazed!! Extremely easy to use, works VERY well, no detectable emissions, and it really gets that fine clay dust and cat hair out of the carpet! It doesn't grab and suck up things that don't belong in the vaccuum, and emptying the container couldn't be easier.My most recent (previous) vaccuums were Kenmore Progressives because of the top ratings several years ago from a consumer organization we all know.  Those vaccuums seemed to do OK at first, but I always had to buy the expensive cloth bags to keep the emissions down.  The fine clay dust would go right through those bags and filters and clog them up very quickly. I could only use a bag for one or two times then had to replace it, long before it was full because of the emissions.  At the time I purchased them at Sears, I was shown a Dyson and nearly bought it.... oh, how I wish I had!!As for ease of use, this product is top of the line.  I'm pushing 60 and have Ankylosing Spondylitis and osteoarthritis.  Today, for the first time in over 20 years, I was able to vaccuum and not be in absolute misery with pain by the time I was finished.  No bending, kneeling, squatting or stooping required to operate this excellent machine.Although I normally shop here, I did purchase mine from c o s t c o because it was bundled with the allergy tools set at no additional charge.

Dyson Animal. Amazing machine. We were skeptical at first and held off for years, but we finally bought a Dyson Animal Ball 1 year ago and we'll never go back. Great design, powerful suction, and great attachments, especially the turbine head (make sure it comes with the turbine head tool, this model may not). The two filters clean easily and don't require replacement. The main brush and the turbine head brush both remove without a screwdriver for easy cleaning. Does NOT loose suction with normal use and care. Great for hard and carpeted floors alike. Very intuitive design all over. 5 year warranty for EVERYTHING. Can't beat it.Hoover was sued for trying to duplicate the patented design and lost. The fact that Hoover fought the lawsuit shows how desirable the design really is. It's fundamentally different and it works.  I know, I was so amazed with the performance that a buddy and I reverse engineered this thing one day and were very impressed with it's 'simple complexity'.Also, buy at Bed Bath and Beyond with a 20% coupon. It specifically says the Dyson is excluded in the fine print, but the young guy at the register didn't notice and scanned the coupon...it worked, saving me over $100. Best deal. Make sure the register is manned by a high school kid. Worked for me.
I have had this vacuum for 4 months now and am not happy with it at all. It doesn't have the great suction it is supposed to and is difficult to use. Way over priced.

Fantastic suction! I love this machine! The only downside is that it isn't as easy to use the tools as other less powerful vacuums. It makes up for it by being so much more powerful - and light as well. I can vacuum at anytime - it doesn't seem like such a chore! With the amazing shedding lab I just got in my home, it's fantastic!

column7: Useless for stairs and above-the-floor jobs
column8: I was so excited to bring this vacuum home.  I have a couple of friends who own Dysons and ranted and raved about how good they are.  I have about 1,000 sq feet of tile and 1,000 sq feet of carpet in my home, plus a carpeted staircase.  I was able to combine a Kohl's 30% off coupon with my Kohl's charge card along with a price match to purchase this vacuum for about $340.  I did the 'Dyson test' when I got home.  I first vacuumed with my old $50 Dirt Devil vacuum cleaner that I've owned for 3 years, then followed with the Dyson.  The Dyson barely picked anything else up - I think it's because I keep my floors relatively clean to begin with, and perhaps I didn't give my old Dirt Devil enough credit.  I do believe that the Dyson has great suction and gets things clean.  It also has a VERY easy cannister to empty, and I like that there are no bags to buy and washable filters.  It is also very light-weight.  With that said, the following cons were deal breakers for me, and I ultimately returned it after trying and trying for a month to get used to using it:1.  My old Dirt Devil has swivel caster wheels in the front and back, and the Dyson ball was actually far less maneuverable than the Dirt Devil.  The ball makes it hard to steer in a straight line if you are trying to clean along the edge of a wall.  The vacuum tends to want to wabble all over the place due to the ball design.2.  The edge cleaning did not work well at all compared to my Dirt Devil, and I usually had to follow with an attachment to clean near the baseboards.3.  The hose connects to the bottom of the vacuum and sticks out on the side.  Additionally, the gray wheels that are used to roll the vacuum from one room to another when not in use also stick out on the sides.  This means that when steering around corners, furniture, etc., the hose and the wheels often bump into objects.  Apart from making it difficult to get around, the wheels are also made of hard plastic which can scratch or scuff your walls.4.  The part of the vacuum which cleans the floors has a hard plastic bumper instead of a rubber bumper.  The bumper is relatively flush with the vacuum, which means areas of the vacuum above the bumper make contact with the walls, too.  I noticed it taking some of the paint off the walls (scuffs on the vacuum that are the same color as my walls/baseboards).  Though I didn't see visible damage on the walls (yet), obviously if it is removing paint, it is causing damage, and over time I worried this would be an issue.5.  The #1 deal breaker for me is that the hose and attachments are a HUGE pain.  If you are at all concerned about the hose being too stiff, DO NOT purchase this product.  The hose is so stiff that it will tip the vacuum over or roll the vacuum towards you before it will stretch out, especially when using on tile or hard floors that do not have any extra resistance.  Additionally, the wand is about 3 feet long when attached and makes it hard to use the attachments for up close jobs like cleaning window sills or upholstery.  I found I would have to disconnect the wand and connect the attachments directly to the hose, which meant having no wand at all, but was easier than using the long one.  The wand is difficult to detach and made it a huge hassle to quickly take the wand out and clean an area as I saw it.  My dirt devil hose attached in a snap, and the wand was only about 1.5 feet long and I could attach an extension if needed, which proved more practical for my purposes.  I have heard that the hose may stretch after extended use, but it was so hard to use, that I do not believe I would have had the ability to use it enough to stretch it out.  My husband tried stretching the hose and leaving it overnight, but it didn't make a significant difference.It's a shame that there are so many design flaws, because I believe the vacuum itself is very powerful.  However, I constantly utilize the hose and attachments on my old vacuum, and to own a vacuum where this is so inconvenient that it deters me from using it, it's just not worth it.  I am on the hunt for a better replacement and will use my $50 Dirt Devil in the meantime.

column7: this was an overpriced waste that can't even pick up a dried leaf
column8: The regular part of the vacuum works OK but the Tool is useless.  It will also not go back down its hose without a great deal of effort.  I believed the hype.  I am very dissatisfied with my purchase and I waited a week too long to return it because I was out of town.  I did not know it was 60 days.  It is not even that easy to handle.  Friends who have the non ball one have less complaints but after spending 400 on this..I can not afford anything else.

I don't buy anything without doing research first. We had heard the design vacuums were good products and had seen them in use at the houses of family and friends. We decided to get one for ourselves and we got it from amazon.com.When it arrived it was extremely easy to setup, took only about five minutes and required no tools. I vacuumed our house with our current vacuum (an orek upright) and only after the floor looked clean did I try out the dyson.One pass with the dyson and I was convinced. It picked up so much that the other vacuum missed, it dug down deep into the carpet and got all that pet hair, all the little lint that had fallen into the cracks, and the attachments cleaned our couches, behind the vents and throughout our kitchen.The thing turns on a dime, is very easy to use and navigate, and doesn't scratch up the furniture or the walls.Best vacuum ever!

column7: First time I have LIKED my vacuum cleaner!
column8: I have always hated vacuum cleaners, until now. The Dyson Animal Ball does a great job picking up dirt from carpets and hardwood floors, isn't too loud and is very easy to steer! I wouldn't have any other vacuum.

I was nervous about ordering online, but amazon had a great price.  It was delivered free and quick, though the shipper had really dinged up the box (big rip in the box, just left it outside without even ringing the doorbell.). Fortunately, no one stole it, and the vacuum wasn't damaged.  Super easy to assemble, works as promised.  Dyson provides a long warranty on parts and service, so will assumably save $$ there.  The bin is plenty big - handles most of the house without needing to be emptied.  I have 3 cats, 4 litter boxes, a toddler and an infant. This vacuum sucks up all the litter, fur, sandbox sand, more without kicking up any dust. It isn't too noisy.  I use it from the carpet right onto the tile- works on all floors with no adjustments. My carpet finally looks clean, and I don't curse anymore when it's time to vacuum.  My only complaints 1) the cord could be better - I like the ones that retract, also this one could be a little longer 2) the wand could have better instructions.
