It's cool, but it took me a bit to figure it out.  I have a hard time angling it for windows. Oh- the mini turbo doesn't have a storage spot on the vacuum.  All in all, I'm glad I bought it, and super glad I went thru amazon for the price.

We purchased the Dyson DC25 on amazon.com.  Amazon.com offered the DC25 at $100 cheaper than local stores, plus free shipping.  The item arrived quickly and was immediately put to use.  After using the Dyson for the first time, we immediately noticed a difference in our carpeting.  It looked brighter and cleaner.  The Dyson DC25, although pricey, was an excellent investment, especially for a dog owner like us. Highly recommend it.Edit 11/3/10 - Warning - DO NOT use this vaccuum with any kind of cleaning product such as a rug deodorant/cleaner.  I recently cleaned the carpets to remove dog smell.  The swirling deodorant scratched the heck out of the plastic container. Although still functional, the conainer is a mess.  The cyclones are clogged and I need a new one.  When I talked to customer service, they said this vaccuum should not be used with any cleaning product, even Resolve carpet cleaner. I guess I now need to invest in a regular, bag vaccuum for spot cleaning!  This may be an issue with people with kids and animals who occassionall cause stains.  This vaccuum should be used for straight dusting... that is all!

It really works like they say and easy to use, but the cord could be a bit longer. My son is so amazed at how powerful it is. He wanted to vacuum almost every other day for the first 2 weeks. And it took almost that time to get old ground in dust my old vacuum didn't get out of my carpets. We have carpet in basement that thread and dog hair weaves into it and my old vacuum had a hard time to pick up sometimes, you could go over several times and it is still there but not the Dyson DC25 animal,I go over it once or twice and it is gone.I would recommend it to anyone. Should of gotten one sooner.
A little smaller and lighter than the original Animal, this vac does all it says it will do and more. Picks up every hair AND moves like a dream. Worth every $$$$.

This vacuum pulled so much dirt out of the carpet the first time I used it it was amazing! Your house will be cleaner than it has ever been. Best 500 dollars I have ever spent! It made my 10 year old carpet like new again. Simply Amazing

I thought about buying a Dyson for a long time before making the committment because, let's face it, it's a lot of money. Boy am I glad that I finally decided to purchase this vacuum. Not only is it lighweight (which makes vacuuming two sets of carpeted stairs easy), it works really well on cat hair. I have 3 cats and they are still shedding well into summer. The ball feature is fabulous - really makes it simple to move the vacuum.I've read before about the fact that the canister fills up quickly, but it doesn't really seem like that big a deal to me. I've had other vacuums do the same thing.I HIGHLY recommend Dyson and this vacuum in particular.

Anyone who thinks Dysons are well made has never seen a nice vacuum. The plastic is cheap and they are EXPENSIVE to repair. Also, I suggest looking into the health of using a bag-less vacuum. The whirlwind action grinds the dirt particles into a super fine powder. This powder clogs the motor and goes into the air that you and your family breathe. The whirling action also serves to fluff up the dirt, making it look like it picks up more than it actually does.The Dyson does have a lot of suction, but that is not the only feature to look for in a vacuum. Quality is extremely important. If you have pets or long hair you want a vacuum with a metal brush roll (beater bar), and enclosed end-caps. You also want fairly stiff bristles on the brush roll. A vacuum with ABS plastic will hold up longer than other types of plastic. But, please, for the health of you and your family...buy a vacuum with a bag!Don't buy a vacuum because you saw an advertisement on TV or because your friend has one. If you can find a nice vacuum store, go in and talk to the employees about a vacuum that fits YOUR current lifestyle. Ask to try them, compare the different features. A nice vacuum will make your home a healthier environment. This is especially important if you have any little ones crawling around. Also, if it is important to you, there are some very nice vacuums made in the United States.

column7: Suction is great - pick up is awful
column8: This vacuum is not worth the price. It has great suction power alright. Dyson got the suction part right. What they did not get right is the brush. A vacuum is much more than just suction. You can have great suction, but the vacuum is not going to pick up well without a good brush getting the dirt, hair, dust, etc. up from the carpet so the suction can take it away. Have you ever broken a belt on a vacuum cleaner? If so, you noticed it would not pick up anything because the brush was not spinning. It still had suction, but no brush getting the stuff up.I was vacuuming with the Dyson in a room with burgandy carpet. My dog is a Golden Lab. The dog's yellow hair shows up very well on the burgandy carpet. I found myself vacuuming a spot, only to see hair still on the carpet in that spot. I went over it several times with the vacuum, but the hair was still there. I was able to pick the hair up with my fingers. I then checked out the brush closely and realized that was the problem. The brush just does not do what it is supposed to do. First of all the brush does not have many bristles. Secondly, the brush part is allowed to move all over the place. This just does not work.I returned this vacuum and purchased a $160.00 Hoover Windtunnel Animal. It was advertised as, 'Never looses suction.' It is a much better vacuum than the Dyson. I used it to vacuum the room with burgandy carpet and it picked up everything the Dyson had left behind!

So I checked out vacuum cleaners at the local retail store and had an opportunity to try them out in the store.  The salesperson dumped dirt on the carpet and asked me to use the vacuum.  Behold, both the D28 and the D25 broke down.  He said this has never happened to him before.  I believe him- and I don't think the Dyson is a bad product.  It's just not worth the expense.  I bought a Hoover Platinum which was rated at the top in Consumer Reports, for half the price...

It was worth the money.  My carpet looks brand new every time I vacuum.  Now I can practice yoga in peace and not fret about all the dog hair on the carpet.  However the key is to expel the dirt from the canister as often as possible, I believe that is the reason why the machine never loses suction.  If you are willing to spend hundreds on a Luis Vuitton bag then you can purchase a Dyson.  It will improve your life, and it looks better than a LV bag.

column7: Is it possible to be in love with a vacuum sweeper?
column8: For anyone hesitating on getting this due to the price tag, as I was before taking the plunge and placing the order, rest assured that it is worth EVERY penny and more! I have two cats who shed like crazy, and my old sweeper, a Hoover that was only a few years old, just wasn't performing the way I needed to and was still leaving a fine layer of hair behind on my carpets. The first time I used this in my 900 square foot condo I had to empty the bucket THREE times. That is how much hair this thing sucked up. It's actually a little horrifying how much hair was apparently on my carpets, but this sweeper works like a dream and my carpets look brand new again. Another great thing about this sweeper is how lightweight and maneuverable it is. If you have tight corners to navigate, or stairs to go up and down, again this will be worth every penny... no breaking your back or breaking a sweat lugging a heavy, clunky sweeper around.

We purchased the DC25 Animal Ball about two weeks ago.  What I would've liked to have seen before purchasing is a review that gave me all the answers- but I quickly realized such a review doesn't exist.  It's impossible to tell the difference between what's always true and what's anecdotal, what's proven and what's someone's opinion, brand loyalists, people who are determined to be underwhelmed or unhappy with the product, etc.  So, in an effort to help everyone out there who is in the same position I was- here is my attempt at all the answers for you:Some background- we are a family of 3, with 2 Shiba Inu's that are adorable but shed year round, -especially- in the summer.  I don't mean there is a little hair here and there, I mean there is literally hair wafting through the air, it is EVERYWHERE, and it never lessens or ends despite hours of 'furminating'.  Beyond that, we are not overly zealous when it comes to cleaning and tend to value our time together over time spent vacuuming/dusting.  We also are not the kind of family that can throw around $400-$500 willy nilly.  So if we're going to spend it, it better be worth it.  That said, we had spent over $300 on vacuums over the last 3 years.  Some were nice (Hoover Windtunnel), some were Walmart brands, etc.  But all of them broke, -multiple- times, all of them clogged, and none of them were easy, or even began to help solve the hair problem.  Recently, the latest model went to vacuum heaven, so my husband and I began a very long, tiring search into all the available brands and models and which would be best for us.  Obviously, my biggest hesitation here was the money.  The reviews for Dyson are generally good, but what I wanted to know was, is it such a good product that it's worth a downpayment on a car?  Here's what I found, so you don't have to:If someone had told me, 'This is the best vacuum cleaner you can buy for $400', I would've said, 'eh...'  But if someone had told me, 'Yes the vacuum is expensive, but it will clean your entire house, every nook and cranny while still being easy to use, easy to lift, and fun', I might've saved myself some sleepless nights.Pro's:-The vacuum is -incredibly- easy to use. I have to laugh when I read reviews where people say it took them forever and a manual to make the vacuum work, or to use the attachments.  I don't mean to be confrontational, but if you can write a review (or even if you can't), you can successfully use this vacuum and all the attachments/abilities.  Everything on the vacuum uses the same 'button release', and it is simple to figure out.-The ball is fantastic.  When you have a smaller house with furnishings, it's important to be able to get around and under things without breaking your back.  Not to mention that the vacuum is less bulky, less rigid, and easier to move in general than any other vacuum I've seen to date.  This includes my mother's $1200 Kirby.-There is an attachment for everything, and it takes less than 5 seconds (I counted) to choose one, hook it up and start using it.  If you have hair all over your sofas, or your bedspread, behind your toilet, on top of your fan blades, or even just a healthy buildup of dust- there's an attachment for that, and it will blow your mind.-The hose is incredibly long and flexible, it can reach anywhere- plus you have the choice of using the rigid 3 feet of hose with the handle attached which is handy for floor trim where you don't want to bend over constantly, or of detaching the rigid part from the flexy hose so that you can get to small spaces that are hard to navigate.-The canister is slightly smaller than some vacuums I've used, but it actually holds MORE because it compacts everything very neatly and easily without you doing anything.  When you're going to empty the canister 2-3 times per vacuum or more, you don't want to mess with bags and you don't want to mess with a canister that is coated in dust and grimy after every emptying.  This canister empties and stays clean- again because of the compacting.-The suction on this thing is ridiculously wonderful.  It pulled over 3x more hair out of my carpet than even the Hoover Windtunnel, and it pulled out dust which I have never seen in my other vacuum's canisters/bags.  After vacuuming, my house literally -smelled- cleaner and fresher.  This is new to us, and we love it!  Additionally, I watched it pull hair from under our bed and furniture on hardwood from over 10 feet away.  Fantastic!!-The vacuum has a 5 year warranty- everything is covered, and Dyson is incredibly easy to work with.  That means that if it loses suction in 2015, I can get it replaced for free.  That means my total cost for the next 5 years is a maximum of $430.  Considering the vacuum is already far superior to all the others, it's already cheaper and more satisfying to own a Dyson than it is any other vacuum.-The vacuum is just generally fun to use.  My husband who hates cleaning was so excited he vacuumed the whole house just because it was fun!  It took half the time it usually does, and it was easy to carry downstairs, even for me being 4 months pregnant.Con's:-The only con I can think of for this vacuum is that in a perfect world this vacuum would be the best and also be about $100-$200.  That said, I have an easy time forgiving the cost when I see how much improved my day-to-day life is.  I can honestly say, this is probably the best $400 I have ever spent.  It took something I hated, and made it fun.  And my house is ACTUALLY clean for the first time in the 2 years we've owned it.Synopsis- If you are tired of dealing with vacuum cleaners that lose suction, replacing broken belts, smelling fried engines, missing half the hair or dust in your house, not having the proper material to clean your entire house with one product, or of spending hundreds of dollars over the years on vacuums that simply don't work- stop debating and buy a Dyson!  It's the best decision you'll ever make, and I promise you won't regret it.  What you'll find is, after getting past the difficulty of parting with your money, your life will be much improved.  I will say, make sure you check multiple dealers for the best deal- when we were looking, Maxvacuum had the best deal, slightly cheaper than Amazon with free shipping, no tax, and even a free 'cleaning kit' thrown in which added another 4 attachments and a heavy duty spot remover.  Good luck, and I wish you good decisions!

column7: Best thing I have ever purchased
column8: I do not like to clean... however, since the arrival of my Dyson DC25 Animal vacuuming has become my new favorite pass time.  I have a dog and have had quite a few cheaper vacuums.  My Eureka boss pet hair vacuum died after less than a year so I decided to get this one.  I have not had it for very long but the suction is amazing, it picks up everything and the air is so much cleaner after you are finished.  The cup empties from the bottom - not the top like all of the other ones I have had which I like.  I read somewhere that this is really expensive and why would you pay this much for a vacuum cleaner... but I have been through the cheap ones and have wasted time and money.  It is worth EVERY penny.

I recently received the Dyson DC25 and was initially skeptical. A couple of questions occurred to me while researching this device: Why would a simple vacuum cost so much money and is Dyson just marketing towards rich dumb people and recently married couples with too many gift cards to blow through? Well after using the Dyson on most of the carpets in my home I can tell you that it is indeed a fantastic device and not just a hyped up gadget for financially irresponsible people. It picked up a ridiculous amount of cat hair (granted, we do have pretty gross house that we rarely clean) that I was able to see whipping around inside the collection canister like a furry tornado. I was planning on just testing the vacuum on just one room but it was so satisfying to see how much stuff was being collected that I did the rest of the carpets in the house and ended up with a canister of 100 kilomartys worth of hair. I also accidentally destroyed a bra that was on the bedroom floor but that is just a testament to the power of this machine. Another nice feature is the HEPA filter- while running the machine I didn't sneeze or smell any dust in the air. The Dyson ball is extremely well designed- the buttons are in convenient places, it contours around corners, and the built-in wand pops on and off the base of the main unit like a domesticated Transformer. The design of the wand could only be improved if it was shaped like the proton guns from Ghostbusters. In summation, I give the Dyson Ball 4 out of 5 stars. It is a powerful and well designed device but looses a star because of its high price and because my wife and I are trying to conceive and it made me ejaculate twice while she was at work.

column7: This thing sucks...in the best way.
column8: This vacuum is so powerful the attachment nearly pulled off my finger. I've only had it for a few weeks now but the one thing that I would advise is that if you're cleaning animal hair off your couches to use the smaller attachment head with the red lint strips. It works much better than the attachment with the spinning brush for furniture. I would save the spinning brush attachment for stairs.Happy vacuuming!

After much searching around the net and in stores for a decent vacuum cleaner, I read a few great reviews about this Dyson DC25 animal.  Turns out my sister has one and raved about it.  Turns out a couple of people at work also raved about their Dyson vacuum cleaners.  They all said I wouldn't regret spending this kind of money on a vacuum cleaner.  They were absolutely right!I honestly can't believe I spent this much for a vacuum cleaner.  I just bought all new kitchen appliances and this was more expensive than my new range or dishwasher, and very comparable to the cost of my new refrigerator!  But I 'sucked it up' and bought it.  Amazon had the best price by far, either online or in-store anywhere.As an experiment, I used my old Eureka vacuum cleaner on my area rug in the living room.  A day later I used the Dyson DC25 and it picked up SO MUCH DIRT!!  I actually had to empty the container twice just vacuuming that area rug.  I could not believe all that dirt and cat hair had been left behind by my old vacuum cleaner all these years.  It was disgusting.  I have my 2 bedrooms carpeted with wall-to-wall, and again I had to empty the Dyson container multiple times, which is a GOOD thing!  I was absolutely amazed at how much it picked up, and everyone was right, I do not regret buying this vacuum cleaner.  My house will be a lot cleaner from now on.It was fairly easy to put together and it's very easy to empty the container (this might sound geeky but it's actually FUN to empty it and see all the crap it picked up!).  I like the little hand-held attachment that comes with it, that made it very easy to vacuum furniture, pillows, and my bed comforter where the cat sleeps all the time.One word for this product...AMAZING.  I highly recommend it.

We bought this vacuum after looking at tons of reviews and going to the store to see the different types of vacuums.  We have a dog who sheds horribly.  This vacuum does an awesome job of picking up her hair.  The canister is small so we often have to empty it after each room, and the cord is short.  But, it's easy to use, lightweight, and does a great job.

After hearing glowing reviews from friends about their Dyson balls, I had to have one.  It is everything I expected.  Very good suction and manuverability.  My only wish is that the hose extended more without buying anything extra.

I received this yesterday. As another reviewer noted, it was a bit of a hassle getting it out of the box and putting it together. Dyson really needs to improve their manual. The pictures just aren't sufficient. Also, the hose could stand to be longer. Those are my only complaints so far. (Aside from the steep price)On the positive side: it has better suction than any vacuum I've ever owned (and I've had a few!). No tools necessary to put this machine together. That was a nice surprise. I also love that I don't have to flip any switches or dial anything to go from carpet to floor. Someone was really thinking! I was also pleasantly surprised at how light the machine is. No need for power vacuuming. The ball technology makes getting into difficult areas a breeze. I haven't had to empty the canister yet, but did test taking it out. Easy and clean.Now, let's see what sort of longevity we get. I really hate having to replace a vacuum every year or so. Dyson...surprise me again!

I have bought a lot of vacuum cleaners in my life as I have always had cats.  They all worked great at first but then  for whatever reason stopped being efficient.  After hearing so much about the Dyson Ball Animal I decided to jump in.  So far I am not sorry.  It was easy to put together and it works fabulous.  I can't get over how much stuff was in my carpets when I used it the first time.  I am delighted with my purchase. I was lucky to find a seller on Amazon who was selling it new for $439 with free shipping.  The shipper was great.  No problems.  Received it within less than 10 days as promised.

With two dogs and four cats, my carpet always seems to show a fur coat. Also we live on a dirt road in the desert.  I've tried all the inexpensive vacuums because I couldn't convince my husband that with vacuums, you get what you pay for. Finally, with the Dyson, he now sees my point, literally. I had to empty the container twice in each room to start with but now that's down to once for two rooms. The only downsides are the short cord, the small dust container and the I find the wand a bit awkward. I seems as though Dyson was trying to make this machine really small and light weight to be easier for owners with two story houses and small apartments. It does that beautifully, but it did cut down on the size dust container they could put on this small machine. I love it's weight and manuverability, but if it was slightly larger it would still be lighter and more agile than standard machines and it would hold more. As for the cord, that's just cheaping out. It wouldn't have cost them 50 cents to have added a few feet to make it of standard length. Over all I'm delighted with it's cleaning ability. It also switches from carpet to hard floors easily. The little spinning brush head tool that comes with the Animal works very well. Better than comparable ones I've used. Just vary the pattern until all the fur comes up. If you need to clean up after multiple critters, this is the machine.

column7: Dyson is a waste of good money.
column8: I unfortuntately own this vacuum and have numerous problems with it. Back peddle (release for vacuuming and standing up) malfunctioned. Hose stopped working (no there was no clog), ball jammed etc. Dyson and I are on a first name basis. Be aware their warranty only covers 'defective parts'..as defined by THEM.You have to fight for service. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I have a 50 yr old Hoover that works better than this junk. Spend a lot of money at your own risk.

column7: What took me so long?  I love you, Dyson-man!
column8: Dyson sucks (in the best way)!!!  Lives up to everything you've heard!I test-drove a Dyson Animal DC28 the day after my vacuum broke (and it broke after vacuuming) and I was disgusted & embarrassed by the volume of dirt and yuk (and hair from my Attack Sheltie).I then compared the Dyson Animal DC25 to the DC28, and chose the DC25 for these reasons:Weight--the DC25 is 16 pounds -- 4 pounds lighter than the 25 lbs on the DC28.  The motor is in the ball, so its low center-of-gravity makes it feel lighter.Ball Technology--again, lives up to the hype for maneuverability, and allows you to get into the corners.  Learning to 'steer' is intuitive.Some of the cons you might think of:Suction and amperage--the DC28 has 1 more amp, and suction power is 25 greater.  BUT, I bought my DC25 one day after vacuuming with the DC28, and picked up even more yuck and hair and dirt.Cleaning path width -- the DC28 is 1.5' bigger.  You might think this would decrease your cleaning time.  The reality is that the Ball decreases your cleaning time. Also, the smaller head seems to fit into and under more things.Cord length -- the DC25 cord length is 24.6', while the DC28 is 35.2'.  For me, a longer cord means more tangles.Dirt Catch bucket -- half the size. (.31 vs .61)That's why I chose the DC25 over the DC28.

I have the original Dyson and I just talked my Mom into buying this one. It is much lighter than the original Animal but works just as well. I am disappointed that not as many tools come with this one (Mine came with 4 tools and carpet kit). My mom really loves it. It is light enough for her to carry up and down stairs and even with her high pile carpet it *sucks* beautifully !

The comments I read before I bought it are right.  The cord is too short and the bin is too small, but these are minor issues to me.  The vacuum works great and I am very pleased.  I would definitely recommend it.
I was very happy with the performance of the Dyson Animal, rolled easy , easy to manover and clean, Got the dog hair up the others didn't

A vacuum shouldn't excite me - but let's face it, this is one of the best investments and splurges I've done in a long time!  Spend the extra dollars, you will be as impressed as I.  I had an expensive Kenmore Progressive Intell-iclean, besides being heavy as concrete, it lost most of it's cleaning power over a few years. Even after an overhaul it wasn't picking up properly.  I bought the DC25 Animal and first vacuumed my bedroom carpet with my old vacuum. then vacuumed with the Animal - SOLD hands down. Not only does my carpet look clean, the contents of the Animal dirt bin was astounding. Not just how much, but what!  I though because of the roller brush I would find a lot of carpet fibers but not at all, I found so much human hair, pet hair, dander, just plain dust and dirt.Contrary to reviews of struggles to assemble, if you can match a picture to an object, it snaps together in minutes with no trouble and is ready to go.  My stone and carpet floors have never felt so clean, been so clean.  Great design + great performance + great value = DYSON. Get one, today and it will make you feel clean, if not down right happy!

After we moved to our new house, our old vacuum started to lose suction and eventually lost it completely.  We have three cats and a dog, so it's very important that we have a great vacuum.  We bought the Dyson DC25 Animal Ball about a month ago to replace the old vacuum, and I have been very happy with it so far.PROS* Lightweight / compact design - I know some have said that they think it's heavy, but I guess it's all relative.  This vacuum is much lighter than any other vacuum I've had before.  I have no problem carrying it up and down our tight spiral staircase.  The compact design makes the machine easy to store.  The extension wand slides inside the back of the machine and doubles as the handle, which declutters the machine.* Great suction - I think this model has plenty of suction and does a great job cleaning our carpets.  ~ Some have complained about their suction and about the machine not 'fluffing' their carpet.  We have berber carpeting throughout our home, so maybe the machine works better on dense carpet or carpeting with a low pile.  In any case, this machine is far better than our old machine that sucked at sucking.* Canister - The canister fits well against the machine's gasket, so nothing leaks through.  The canister is also easy to empty; a trigger releases the bottom and the waste falls into your trash can.  ~ Some have complained about pet hair getting stuck in the canister, but I don't find this to be a problem.  It's just the nature of the beast.  I would rather have the hair in the canister than on my carpet.  ~ Some reviewers say that the canister is too small.  My last vacuum's canister was only slightly larger and that machine was much bigger/bulkier.  The compact design of the Dyson may limit the capacity of the canister, but I don't mind dumping it more often.* Maneuverability - The ball design really does make this machine easier to maneuver.  It turns on a dime and cuts down the length of time it takes to vacuum the house.  My mother has the Dyson Animal model without the ball, and when she visited and used my machine, she said that she wished she had gotten the one with the ball because it was much easier to use.CONS* Cord length - The cord on my last vacuum was very long, so in comparison, this one seems short.  I can still vacuum at least a whole room without moving to a new outlet, so it could be worse.* Attachment storage - not all of the attachments can be stored on board the machine.In the end, I love this machine and it does a great job cleaning my carpets.

The ball is everything it claims to be and the 'never loses suction' advertisement is true as well.I read a lot of reviews saying that the vacuum is really loud... NOT THE CASE!!!The only thing I will say is there is NO difference between the animal version and the all-floors models except with the animal one you get an extra accessory. Go yellow unless you want to pay extra for the color purple :)I looked all over the web for this vacuum and amazon's price is by fare the cheapest you will find (Having Prime was clutch).

I honestly cant figure out why there are 12 one star reviews for this vacuum.  It actually scared me a little bit but we ended up buying the vacuum anyway.  And wow am I glad that we did!  This vacuum is awesome!  I have never felt like we can walk around barefoot in our house without having to wipe our feet off constantly. We have a huge german shepherd who sheds like crazy and two cats.  We are also extremely busy and we dont sweep as much as we should.  However, the broom is now out in the garage because there is absolutely no need for a broom anymore!  We have beautiful new hardwoods and I was always terrified to use a vacuum on the floor because I was afraid it would get scratched, but since the Dyson can easily turn off the brushes I never have to sweep again.  The floor feels so clean its crazy.  Oh yeah it also works wonders on dog beds and rugs and carpet.I would complain that it is rather pricey... but we got it for $379 on sale.  So I definitely feel good about the value.  It also DOES pick up small items, like say cat food or cat litter.  It also DOES not release clouds of dirt like another reviewer mentioned.  I also love that you dont have to bend down, all of the controls are high enough on the vacuum that there is very little bending.  So what if you have to clean out the canister more often?  Its only because its picking up more dirt than your old vacuum and since its so easy to do.... who cares?The only thing I wish is that it would also mop my floor at the same time... now that would be awesome!

column10: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_moIS7EVV1PX6EWpreplayImageId" />

column8: BottomLeft
column13: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_moIS7EVV1PX6EWpreplayImageId" />

column8: Do not waste your money on the Dyson animal. The one I have is very noisy and also the 'hose' used to vacuum furniture is way to short! You end up fighting the hose to get it to stretch enough to do the seats let alone the backs. I was very disappointed in how it pick up animal hair, I actually have to get my old hoover out to pick up hair...would not recommend this product.

I read some reviews before purchasing this vacuum with only a few saying that they disliked the length of the power cord. I figured if that was the only main complaint I'd give it a try. I bought a refurbished DC25 Animal Ball model for the half the price of a new one and it still has the 5 yr warranty. I highly recommend doing this if you find one. The vacuum itself is great! I have three cats and a boyfriend which equate to times of shall we say untidiness. I can now get my whole house vacuumed in about 15 min where before it took about a half hour. If you have animals (and or a significant other ;)) I highly recommend this model. O and the cord... I have no idea what people were talking about the cord is ~24 FEET long!! How much longer does it need to be??!!

This is the first time I've ever reviewed a product, but I wanted to stress how awesome this vacuum is! We had our carpets professionally cleaned approximately 2 weeks before purchasing this vacuum. The first time I used the Dyson, it picked up an entire canister of cat hair in one bedroom alone! I was disgusted by the amount of hair that was in the carpet, and left behind by the professional cleaner, but so impressed with what the Dyson was able to do. My house literally SMELLS cleaner after I vacuum and it really brings the life back to worn carpet.It was slightly heavier than I was expecting, but so easy to move around. Even my 18 month old son can push it! Overall, I'm extremely pleased with the purchase and would recommend the Dyson to anyone!

I contacted Dyson customer service for an issue I was having with my DC25 Animal and I must say that I had a perfect experience. The customer service specialist who took care of me was very professionnal, courteous and efficient. She returned my emails and phone messages within a couple of hours and provided me with the help and solution I needed without any problem.I wish all customer service representatives I ever dealt with in the past, had provided me with the same level of service.It proves that the customer service department of a company is essencially what determines the quality of it and of the products they sell.As people say 'a happy customer will bring you 10 new customers, an unhappy customer will make you loose 100 new customers'.I will recommend Dyson in the future.C.R.
The vacuum worked great for 24 hours and then -- contrary to popular advertising -- it lost suction for no discernible reason and hasn't worked since. Don't waste the money.

I was so excited to get this vacuum after seeing all the ads and the story of the struggling engineer who invented it.  Unfortunately, it takes an engineer to use this convoluted contraption and I am a housewife.  Impossible to use the wand to get furniture and corners without pratically dismantling the vacuum and you better remember how the parts come together because there are no obvious release buttons, just little drawings only an architect could decipher.  And no owner's manual to refer to.  And I've lost track of how many broken nails received trying to unhook the dust container which makes a horrible mess when emptied.  This piece of junk is going to the Goodwill and I am headed to Sears to get a decent, consumer-friendly vacuum with a sanitary dust bag.  It will be nice to have something that actually works!
We have a cat that likes to shed all over the apartment. This vacuum works wonders on it and seemingly everything else we've thrown at it. It's very easy to use and turn corners.

column7: Killed several vacuums before my dyson
column8: Bought this badboy after killing many 200$ vacuums after a year or two, so the cost was worth it in comparison. This thing sucks. In a wonderful way. So much so, that you see how nasty your carpet really was before you got it. Hair, dust, dander, previous owners carpet powder, sand, you name it! I have had this dyson for almost 2years now with no issues with it cleaning. I had one problem about a year ago where the vacuum would not turn off - once I unplugged it and called customer service (calling them was no trouble and they helped me right away. I emailed first, and did not get a response for several days, by then the issue was resolved, so calling is the faster service) they were great! Instead of sitting on hold they have an option where they call you back, and in no time I was speaking with a very nice lady (she spoke English!). She talked me through fixing it on the phone, and even got a model of my vacuum in front of her so she knew what buttons I was referring to - everything was quick and painless. Plus it has not messed up since!Just so you know what this vacuum has to deal with- I have very long hair, have 4 100lb dogs in and out of the house, previous owners used carpet power like it was going out of style, live in the country with sandy soil, and have an affinity for going barefoot outside to visit my husband laying on the ground working on manlyprojects - all of which means a very hard time on a cleaner. I would recommend this to anyone that wants clean floors!

column7: The best vacuum I've ever owned
column8: I have three cats and two dogs and LOTS of pet hair in my house. Before parting with my previous vacuum cleaner, I used it once more in my home. Then, I took my brand new Dyson to the task and picked up mountains of pet hair.  The canister has to be emptied fairly often, but it's easy and you don't have to touch any of the mess.  This vacuum has made my home much cleaner.

column7: does not pick up dog hair
column8: Although Dyson claims this to be a vacuum for pet owners, I strongly disagree.  For so much money you would think it would suck up everything in its path, but sadly it does not.  When I vacuum my carpets, I have to go over and over each section to get the cleaner to pick up the hair.  The roller bar seems to not have enough bristles, and when I contacted Dyson about my displeasure, they offered me no solution.  Don't waste your money on this vacuum......
I am 80 yrs. old and have never had such a great sweeper !! W e have a cat and the sweeper really does it's job.I would reccomend this to anyone who really wants a good sweeper........

I was debating on whether to get one of the bigger versions of the Dyson vacuums or the new smaller one with the ball.  To be honest, I didn't think the ball would be that great and may be just more of a gimmick than something that was worth the extra money.  I am so glad I went with this version because it is lighter in weight and does maneuver quite well.  I watched a video on another website of a lady comparing the two vacuums and she said out of the two she would recommend the Dyson 25.  I am so glad I went with this choice!  It's amazing to see how much stuff comes off my carpets, even when you think they are fairly clean!  I haven't used the animal attachment that came with it yet, though.

I am a lifelong pet owner.  I have wasted money on several useless vacuums over the years.  I bought the first Dyson Animal over 7 years ago.  I never had a problem with it and used it everywhere in my 3-story house.  However, carrying it up and down stairs and banging it around I did break a connection that made it not work as well as usual.  Instead of putting money into fixing it I was happy to buy the newest model.  I love this vacuum.  I feel like the Windows commercial when I talk about it, 'My name is Ann, I'm  a vacuum and the new Dyson Animal was my idea.'  Every change that was made to this model makes it better and easier to use.  This is not just a great feat of engineering, it is great industrial design.  The changes to the upholstery hose are just what I needed.  The Ball makes it so easy to maneuver and it feels so smooth on any surface.  It is also much lighter and easier to carry.  I love the new brush and the washable filter.  I have not had to deal with the cost and annoyance of bags since owning a Dyson.  I do not work for the company but if they designed a car, I would buy it in a heartbeat. I think Toyota should learn from the Dyson design team.  I plan on buying the Dyson fan after watching the video.Ordering from Amazon was the best.  Best price($424)  and quick and free delivery.  Macy's has it for $650. plus shipping so it pays to use Amazon.Another bonus -- the Dyson packing material is minimal and almost all recyclable.Last word: If you don't own a Dyson you don't own a real vacuum.

Needed a vacuum to help keep my dog's hair under control and this fits the bill.  It took me a while to figure out the wand was accessible by fully extending the pole on top of the handle.  It is easily to move around with the ball, making harder to clean areas.  Love the 5 year warranty, but hope to never use it!

column7: Works like a charm so far
column8: We have an older Tyson that wasn't doing too well. Long cord kept snarling and it wouldn't pick-up birdseed or much dog hair. This new one does all that and is easier to move around. The Dyson service people have been good in the past and that was a factor in buying another Dyson.  I even volunteer to vacuum for my wife now so that's a great testimonial. It was cheaper on Amazon than at Wal-Mart also.

I am a veterinarian and I breed English Setters plus have two rescue dogs in my home.  I have mostly hardwood floors however there are some large area rugs. I always felt that I was accomplishing little when I used a competitive vacuum product.  I ordered the new Dyson and then vacuumed the porch floor with my old machine.  I repeated the job with the Dyson and picked up 3/4 of a canister of material my other vacuum had failed to retrieve.  That is all it took to sell me. I have since purchased the hard surface tool for use on the wood floors and again am delighted.  Now as long as the machine maintains problem free operation I will be a satisfied owner.

column7: Best Vacuum I Have Ever Owned
column8: .....and I've owned alot of vacuums. I waited a while to write this review because I really tried to find a flaw, but I can't! The suction is incredible. I have never seen a vacuum suck up dirt before getting right over top of it. As far as other complaints I've read about:1. Removed fibers from carpet; My carpets are old and any fibers I found were minimal.2. Bin too small; I can deal with that.3. Wire too short; Unless you live in a large mansion, in which case you probably have someone do your vacuuming, a shorter cord is better in my mind, especially if it isn't retractable, which this isn't. I hate winding,unwinding,unknotting long wire.4. Attachments difficult to handle; It is a little awkward but not impossible.I recommend this vacuum.

The Dyson is amazing. Picks up fur, dust, and debris like no other vacuum I've owned. The carpet actually feels softer after I get done. I will NEVER go back to a regular vacuum. Dyson for life! lol, but seriously the Dyson DC25 is well worth the money, give it a try.

column7: Never thought I'd feel this way about a vacuum.
column8: Seriously, this is an awesome, awesome product.  Right out of the box it snapped together so easily (and I'm terrible at putting stuff together).  It was a breeze.  The ball makes it glide around on the floor and into places that a regular vacuum wouldn't go.  I think it's also quieter than your average vacuum, and therefore, my dog doesn't go quite so beserk and bark like crazy every time I turn it on.  Within minutes of turning it on for the first time, it had sucked up a half a cannister of dog hair (and our carpet is nearly new so I really feel like it must have sucked up every last piece of hair!). One attachment works awesome at getting the dog hair(pug/beagle mix) off of my microfiber couch and another is great at sucking dog hair and dust off of flat surfaces.  The cannister is super easy to empty.  I could go on, but really, if you've had it with the dog hair this really is a wonderful product.  My only tiny, tiny complaint is that when you pull the attachment out it's a little bit too long which makes it just a little difficult to handle.  Not a big deal.  Well worth the money.  I feel like the people at Dyson really know what they're doing.

This is my third dyson, got this one not because the others weren't doing their job, but simply because the roller ball concept fascinated me.I have a 6 year old son who loves his geotrax set, and so we often have elaborate setups in the great room.  I thought this may make it interesting to vacuum around it while it's up, easily being able to follow the turns of the tracks and such.And while the rollerball does make it turn differently, I have to say I didn't see any real benefit to it over a 'normal' vacuum.  But that fact didn't detract from the rating, since overall this is still one of the best vacuums I've ever used, just as all the dyson line seem to be.Suction is outstanding, and consistent.  Even when the canister is half filled with goop, it still pulls and pulls.It's very easy to move around, since this one is actually smaller than the previous dyson models I had.  The attachments were an improvement too, including the pull out extension.  In my previous models, I had to push a large release catch to 'unlock' the upright part that separates into the wand and extension.  This one it just comes up without any release, but does not come off unintentionally.  Simply pulling out the extension wand simultaneously unlocks the handle so it comes up too.  Push it all back into place, and it's once again locked.  No manual release catch needed.As with all of them, the ease of emptying the unit is only marred by the receptacle you're dumping it into often letting dust waft up...  It's a good thing when the worst complaint about emptying your vacuum is the performance of the GARBAGE CAN rather than the vacuum!beater bar works very well, a little TOO well as evinced by an ipod cable of mine that got yanked in the VERY FIRST TIME I used this thing...  So my clear plastic shield over the beater bar now has a white mark where the usb jack end of the cable was squeezed through by the high power spinning bar...  Don't let animals or small children too near it ;)The locking and unlocking of the stand behind the ball is simple, just a toe release lever and those supporting back wheels fold away. Simply push the handle back to an upright position and they come down again and securely catch.  There's no doubt that they lock in place, you can hear and feel it.And when you're moving it from place to place, not vacuuming, those little back wheels are easy enough to push it along with, even over carpet dividers and edges where the metal strip holds the carpet secure where it joins up next to tile and such.Outstanding unit, and i'm every bit as pleased with it as I was with any prior Dyson purchase.

What a great vacuum!  After reading all of the reviews and trying to decide which Dyson vacuum to buy, the DC17, DC23 or DC25 we went with the DC25 Animal. ( We have 2 cats, so the animal promised a better job with the attachment for furniture and pet beds. It has a rotating brush in the attachment head.) We were very hesitant to purchase the DC25 because it had some negative reviews about suction and the size of the dirt holding tank. We received our new vacuum today, the day after we just had our carpets professionally cleaned. Had to test it out and was shocked how much hair and stuff was sucked up considering the carpet cleaners used a commercial vacuum and their cleaning equipment just the day before! Any of the reviews that said the suction was not good I think are not correct. Also the size of the tank was a little small but I imagine after doing the house with a good vacuum a couple of times you won't need to empty as much. We had to empty the bucket 3 times but did all of the furniture and cat beds also. The bucket is easy to empty, the attachments are easy to use, the animal attachment did do a way better job on furniture and pet beds than the regular brush attachment. The vacuum did everything we wanted it to and more. I am very satisfied and pleased with the product so far.
The dyson is a great cleaner, easy to run and picks up on both carpet and tile

I have wanted a Dyson for a really long time but the price kept me from making the purchase. I live in the desert, on land, outside of Tucson, AZ. The wind really blows the sand & dust here. I have gone through 2 vacuums in the 6 yrs that I have been here. That powder fine dust just clogs them up & kills them. The Dyson is so powerful.  *At first I found the process of releasing the extension wand/hose awkward but now I am a quick draw.I also ordered several attachments as the description did not say exactly what came with it (or I did not notice).  *The flexible crevice tool is perfect for the tracks on my sliding glass doors they are frequently full of sand. It works wonderful for this. I used to have to go after it with a tooth brush for the crevice tool to pick up with my old vacuum.  *The soft dusting attachment is perfect dusting everything around the house for a quick job or before actually cleaning, oiling & dusting with cloths. Really gets the dirt off first.  *The stiff bristle brush is great for baseboards, lamp shades & furniture.LOVE THIS VACUUM!

This thing is awesome! I definitely had reservations about spending this amount of money on a vacuum cleaner, but it has shown that it is worth it. We have two cats and the Dyson DC25 picks up enough cat hair each week to make two more cats. It is really satisfying to be able to see everything that is being pulled out of your carpet and being able to throw it in the garbage. I did lots of research and I just couldn't get away from how much everybody seemed to like their Dyson and now I know why. The only complaint I would have if I were forced is that everything is plastic, which seems to be the way all vacuums are now. So if you're like me and you are having trouble clicking the purchase button, just do it. You won't be disappointed.

Very simple to set up. The only draw back I had while assembling this was trying to figure out how to remove the extension wand but after I figured it out I was impressed on how simple it was and how dumb I was.Everything about this vacuum is centered around simplicity. Like emptying the canister and not worrying about replacing filters. Also the onboard tools are simple to attach and detach.Of course the main purpose of getting this vacuum was because of the picking up ability. I was not disappointed! Even though I had previously vacuumed the day before I had the canister to it's max line after only minutes of use. I have 2 cats and so there's always plenty of hair in the carpet and this DC 25 picked up every single bit of it. Overall I'm happy about it's performance especially since I was able to get the allergy kit for free as a promotional deal normally $69.00. All for $439.00 plus $3.99 shipping over nite with Amazon prime.You will not be disappointed.

I absolutely love my Dyson DC25 Animal. I find myself vacuuming a lot more than I used to. It is so easy to use. I had shoulder surgery and it was difficult for me to push my old vacuum around. The Dyson DC25 is lightweight and easy to manuver. I wondered how long it would take me to adapt to the ball, but it all came so easy. It is a lot quieter than my old machine too. The only disappointment is the size of dirt collection bin. If I want to do a good job I have to empty it at least four times because all the dog hair gets stuck and stops spinning. When it gets really dirty from the dust and dirt I can rinse it out. Which makes for a clean machine. It was well worth the price I paid for it.

Sad to say that we bought a new Dyson DC25 thinking it would be as good if not better then our old DC17 animal, we were wrong.  The suction on this cleaner is sub par.  It did not pickup all the dog hair and you can tell a huge difference between the DC 17 and DC25.  I heard the DC28 is not as powerful either.

THE GREAT:  The ball, the suction, the ball.  This vacuum works great.  It does everything it says it will do and does it well.  It is a very good vacuum cleaner, the best I have ever used.  We have a long-haired German Shepherd and this machine handles the job well.  It also works well on our wood floors.  It is also light weight and easy to maneuver.  Did I tell you we really like the ball?THE WEIRD:  The attachments remind you that it is a Euro design.  Not sure if Lord Dyson just wanted to be original but he would have been better served to keep things simple when it comes to the attachment design.  What I am referring to is how the handle for the entire unit is a tube that detaches from the unit with different latches and snaps to become the wand.  The problem is if you want to move the unit around while you are using the attachment, there is no handle as it now in your hand with the hose attached to it instead of being attached to the unit.  It takes some getting used to for sure.  In summary the attachments work well and just take a while to get the hang of.  If you use attachments a lot, I recommend you look at one of these machines and fiddle with the attachments in a local store before you purchase it 'sight unseen' online.We ended up saving a little bit off the Amazon price by purchasing our DC25 animal at Bed Bath & Beyond with a 20% off coupon we got for registering for their mailing list.  We are happy with our purchase and recommend it to anyone who can handle paying a little more money for a good vacuum.

We have a dog, a cat and a baby.  At the time the baby was just beginning to crawl, our old vacuum cleaner (a Dirt Devil, and a piece of garbage if there ever was one) was starting to die.  It would pick up everything (eventually) but the carpet never really looked clean.I decided to pitch the old vacuum and invest in a new one.  After much research, I chose the Dyson Animal.  I gulped a bit at the price, but decided that I'd at least try it out; after all, I'd bought the much cheaper Dirt Devil twice, and both times, it had completely stunk.I was sold after five minutes.  By ten minutes, I was convinced it was one of the best household purchases I'd ever made.  I'm still of that opinion today, five months later.I could not believe how easy the Animal was to use.  It went places our old upright would never go, and did so with ease.  It was actually fun to vacuum!  That first day, I'd just intended to vacuum our living room, and twenty minutes later, I was halfway across the house, still marveling at what I was getting up.I'd just vacuumed the day before...but the first time I ran the Animal, I had to stop twice in each room to empty the canister.  I was appalled at how much dirt and hair still lingered on an apparently clean carpet!  The extension is so easy to use, too - I felt as if I never really had to break stride to use it, so I was much more inclined to do detail cleaning than I had been.It's incredibly lightweight, especially compared to my old uprights, and extremely manuverable.  We've yet to have any of the perennial belt problems we used to have.  Also, while I do have to empty the canister frequently, I'm also able to sprinkle some lavender buds into the canister to lend a lovely fresh odor while I vacuum.  I also like seeing what I'm picking up.  I rescued an earring just the other day.  In our old bag upright, that would have been lost.Bottom line:  Buy this, especially if you live in a place with a lot of dust or with animals.  You absolutely will not be sorry.

column7: Doesn't quite live up to the hype
column8: I bought it based off of others' reviews, hearing that this vacuum will clean so much better. When I'm paying 2-3 times more than I usually pay for a vacuum cleaner, I expect it to perform, but this is really no better than any other that I have owned. The suction on the hand wand is pretty good, but the brushing power is average at best. I've read that they lowered the amps in the newer models. People I know that have the older models swear by theirs, so maybe this is the reason.The other reason I bought it was because it supposedly doesn't lose suction. So I guess time will tell on this.

column7: I Love My New Dyson, But It Could Be Better
column8: I've had my new Dyson Animal Ball for almost two weeks now.  I have two large dogs in my house and so I vacuum every day to keep up with the hair.  Here are my thoughts for anyone considering this purchase.I LOVE...* Its lightweight.* Super easy to manuever - was unsure about the ball when I ordered but SO glad I did.* This thing sucks - for real.  Its like it eats hair and dirt and loves it.* The long handle is nice for reaching above my head (I'm 5'3' so this is important for cleaning ceilings, etc.* The mini turbine works and works well.  My old vacuum had one that died shortly after purchase and was impossible to unclog.  This one works just as well as the floor head.* The canister is easy to empty.I WOULD CHANGE...* I think that the canister should be bigger.  I'm a clean/germ freak. Each room of my house gets vacuumed twice a day so there can't be that much to suck up, and I still feel like I'm emptying the canister too much.* I don't like that the mini turbine has no place to attach to the vacuum. It is so usable and something I use in every room I wish I could take it with me.  I solved this though by buying a bottle of Crown Royal whiskey and using its purple velvet bag to carry my mini turbine. Its the perfect size and the purple matches the vacuum. I just loop the bag over the small attached crevice tool.  Looks a little redneck, but it works!* Feel like the transition from normal vacuuming to handheld tools is a little clumsy and was sort of difficult to get the hang of at first.CONCLUSION:  I would certainly purchase this vacuum again, but will look for more upgrades and 'fixes' to the things I don't like in future models. Still the best vacuum I've ever had and I've had several.If you have any specific questions that you would like my opinion on, please comment and I will reply to you, usually same day.

column7: DC 17 Animal Vac - Worst thing We've Owned in 40 years of Marriage
column8: My daughter bought a Dyson (not animal) And swears by it so my wife insisted and off we went to Costco to pick one up. We have carpets and we have two hundred pound dogs and a couple cats. So cleaning is a challenge and we had an Amway cyclone type for eighteen years (its still working but ...) and I wished Amway still sold them (I'm not in Amway either) because I would run and buy one.As for the Dyson, we had it maybe a month, using it nearly everyday it had a bad noise. And while it worked in spite of the noise it didn't work half as good as our old Amway, whoever made it. We would do one sweep with the Dyson and you could see that there was hair everywhere on the carpet. We did tests as some reviewers wrote about because my wife was trying to justify spending 5 bills for this thing ... well in the fourth week the noise, which we couldn't find but knew it was in the beater bar - finally the belt came off and it was a chore to get it apart and try and fix it. I did, ONCE. Then we took it back to Costco who was generous in returning it without question.And by the way. I went online and registered my unit with Dyson. And when the problems started with noise and the belt I went on their site and complained, more than once ... drum roll please ... nada, nothing, ever, to this day!All hype as far as I'm concerned.

This vacuum has great power and I was horrified by what came out of my carpet when I first used it!  The ball technology is great.  I would have to say for the price I think more tools (all the tools) should be included.  It takes a couple times getting used to using the tool wand, but I like it now.  This vacuum's technology is really cool.

column7: review of dyson DC25 Animal vac
column8: After a couple recommendations, I bought the Dyson DC25 and am pleased so far.I have a german shepherd and she sheds alot. Also, dust build up from not cleaning regularly has made a mess of things. This vacuum has worked very well.The only thing I can find that I don't particularly like is when I emply the vac.Yes, it's great to have no bags, but when I empty it , it gets clogged with dog hair , dirt, etc and is not as easy to empty as advertised.Also, make sure the chamber is completely dry , after you wash out the chamber to stay clean between uses. If not, dirt and dog hair clings to the walls of the chamber.Overall, A nice vacuum but the price is alittle much. I hope it lasts a long time.

i've never... and i mean EVER had a vacuum suck this much! in a good way. i have two corgis and TONS of dog hair, this thing literally made it disappear. i would highly recommend to any pet owner. INVEST IN THIS!nothing on this is cheap, the parts are all high quality, and it's sooooo much lighter than i thought it would be. i am 5'2' and 135 lbs and i carry it around like the wind.

So, I don't know whether this vacuum picks up more dirt than my old vacuum, but since I can see the dirt in the reservoir my perception is that it does!  It does seem to pick up a lot of dirt every time I use it.  There are only a few attachments, though, and it's a little clumsy to use the telescoping arm.

Great vacuumeasy to uselightweightawesome turn on dimenice removal of dirteasy cleanuponly thing I thought was missing was a place to attach the cord to keep it up but easily done with a little rigging with a twistie tie or rubber bandoverall, would recommend to anyone

column7: Throw out the old and make this vacuum your new!
column8: I am a true skeptic about products and always read reviews to get opinions about things before I make the investment, especially with a vacuum that is $400 +!  I will go on to say that I owned a Hoover Windtunnel full size vacuum that is supposed to be excellent with its Hepa filtration and its power, this vacuum was clogging costly filters and seemed to be dying, so I read up on Dyson and this Pet model, since I own a dog that is in and out of the house all day. The Hoover piece of crap is on it's way to the dump!  I could not believe how the Dyson performed when I vacuumed with it the first time, like other comments I had just vacuumed a few days earlier with my old vacuum.  When I was finished with the Dyson, my carpet looked lighter and the contents of the dirt cup almost made me sick.  The amount of dust and animal hair it picked up was amazing, I was stunned that my old vacuum was not getting anything close to my old machine.  I am obsessed with my home being clean so I decided to comment on this vacuum, for other clean freaks with or without animals.  THIS VACUUM IS WORTH EVERY PENNY!  I also love the way this vacuum turns and operates with the ball design, it gets places I could not get before. I will close in saying that this is the BEST vacuum I have ever owned, and I have been through several brands of vacuums over the years.  Try it once and look at what you have been breathing in.  I am a firm believer, not to mention the 5 year Dyson warranty gives me piece of mind.  So read other reviews, then make up your mind.  If you decide on this vacuum, you will not be sorry, it does make my other vacuums seem like they were all dust-busters.

We've had this vacuum for just over two weeks and i can already tell you that from the very first time we used it we were hooked.  It is by far the very best vacuum i've ever owned.  I love the ability to go from carpet to hardwood with a touch of a button.  The only thing i would change is make the chord one length longer so i didn't have to unplug between my bedroom and our living area.  Other than that - EVERYTHING about it is wonderful!  And it really does pick up every tiny spec of animal hair we have... and every tiny particle of dust.  it is amazing!

My wife is Japanese and sort of petite. When she moved to the USA, she really wanted a smaller vacuum than the large Hoover Windtunnel upright vacuum I had acquired for our home. Even though the Hoover had a self-propelled mode and did a nice job, she thought it was still too heavy for her to operate. I also thought it was a bit heavy and I got tired to taking it to the vacuum repair shop. A few months ago, we bought a Dyson DC31 Handheld Vacuum, which is great little vacuum. I think I enjoy using more then she does! The experience with the DC31 made us consider the DC25 Animal. The DC25 is really light and maneuverable, which makes my wife want to use it more. The day it arrived from Amazon I was so excited to try it out I started vacuuming immediately, and it was a lot of fun to use. I was pretty shocked by the amount of stuff the DC25 sucked from our rugs and carpets, and we don't have any animals. As others have noted, this vacuum really sucks up the dust, dirt, and hair! I love how it is a bagless vacuum with a clear chamber. This allows you to see how well the DC25 is working and reminds you to clean it out. The DC25 a bit pricy, but if you can look past the price I believe you will be happy with the vacuum. We love ours so far.

After years of buying vacuums that lost their suction after a couple of years, I decided to try the Dyson DC25 animal. I love this vacuum. It picks up everything! It even fluffs the carpet up. The ease of use is also incredible. I would buy this vacuum again in a heartbeat.

column7: Good suction; hard to use attachments...
column8: I read a lot of the reviews here on this vacuum before ordering it here on Amazon.  I have three hairy pets, so I was excited about receiving it.  It does have great suction, and does a good job on the floors.  The problem I have is with the attachments and the hose.  The hose is so tightly coiled that I have to fight it to get it to extend to use the turbo upholstery tool, or the other attachments. I even ordered additional ones, like the curved one for ceiling fan and the soft brush dusting attachment.  I'm pretty discouraged about this.  The hose pulls so hard that using the attachments is not worth even getting them out and trying to use them.

column7: Like the ball concept, but overall prefer my old vac!
column8: We thought about buying a Dyson for about a year, so this was not a split decision. Other family members owned one(not the ball) and they seemed to rave about it. Since buying it, I happen to have been to 2 vacuum repair shops with my mother's vacuum and both repair men told me to stay away from the Dyson and that they get lots in the shop for repair. Both repair men recommended sticking with vacuums that use bags, not the bagless kind. (Unfortunately, this was after my Dyson purchase!)I love the concept of the ball and it is easy to maneuver around furniture and in tight spaces. I would not say it particularly sucks any better than my old vacuum however (which was a Hoover Windtunnel). It does seem lighter and quieter than my old vacuum though.What I don't like about it are the tools. They seem very awkward to use and difficult to 'angle' and maneuver in tight spots. Also, once the tools are in use, you are left with a strange plastic upright 'handle' to push the vacuum, which is not comfortable to hold. I've also noticed that it's easy to pinch your skin with the tubing while using the tools.Overall, I think it looks cool, but it's probably overrated. If you like the concept of the ball, buy it for that, but otherwise there are probably several other vacuums out there that do just as good a job, are more ergonomic and are a lot less expensive.

column7: It's impossible to over-hype this machine!
column8: Pro's:-Best suction EVER (You can actually fill up your entire cannister by vacuuming a clean looking area that you used your old vacuum to clean, it goes deep)-Removes animal hair with ease-Ridiculously easy to empty and re-attach-No filter or bag replacements-The only vacuum I've owned that can easily remove woven in animal hair from an area rug-The only vacuum I've owned that didn't eventually start spitting out debris when lifted in the air-The only vacuum I've owned that makes a seamless transition from carpet to hardwood floorsCon's:-I don't get as good of a workout as my previous vacuums gave me due to their weight, and constant need to re-vacuum areas.I held off for years on buying one because I thought it was a bunch of hype for too much money.  I was wrong, and now I don't think I could ever go back to another brand.  I can't speak to the durability of it because it's only been 3 months, but this exceeded my expectations.

My vacuum finally broke, after four years of wishing it would, so that I could get a dyson!  I LOVE THIS VACUUM!  It is a little difficult to get used to, but so worth it.  It is really light, and turns on a dime, which is wonderful, but coming from a regular vacuum to this one makes it obvious how poorly designed other vacuums are.  We have bamboo floors, and carpet, and this vacuum works perfectly on both.  Just remember to turn the Beater bar off!  I read some complaints that this vacuum was scratching wood floors, and when not used properly I am sure it would.  BUT when the bar is turned off, I cannot believe how well it cleans my wood floors, I may never sweep again.  I was amazed at all this vacuum sucked up when we had vacuumed with my other vacuum just days before.  Not just dust...but dirt, a lot of it.  If you are willing to give up your heavy, fixed wheel, cumbersome vacuum, and learn to live with the future of vacuum cleaners you must have this vacuum.  It won't take long and you will love how light weight, easy to control, extremely efficient, all surface vacuum.

I was (am) exceptionally happy with my Dyson DC14 (full kit) and couldn't resist buying the new DC25. A delight to use. (Replaces traditional vacuum wheel set so it maneuvers better.) I also like that the DC25 is a bit smaller than the DC14 so it is easier to use. The only features I do not like 1-shortness of the cord and 2- the locking feature on the attachments. Because of this new feature you cannot turn the handle sideways while reaching under a shallow space, such as a sleigh bed, therefore significantly limiting its reach. Frustrating!!!

I would not purchase this vacuum unless you have wall to wall carpeting.  We only have hardwood floors/ natural stone throughout the house and this vacuum DOES NOT pick up ANY food that the children have dropped on the floor!  Especially cereal!  Even if you pass it over the food five and six times it just pushes it around the floor, never sucking it up into the vacuum.  DO NOT waste your money on this one!  We brought out the old Miele that's still going strong after 8+ years!

My old bagless vacuum 'bit the dust' so to speak, just as I'd been shopping around for another one. I'd heard a lot of great things about the Dyson vacuum cleaners and after hours of reading reviews, both good and bad, decided to purchase one. I had been very reluctant because of the price of the Dyson, but managed to find a new one at a significant discount. The assembly was an easy 1-2-3 process (literally) and I had it running in less than 5 minutes after unboxing it. It is light-weight and much quieter than I'd expected considering the power it possesses. It easily picked up loads of dirt from my smaller rugs in the foyer~~I'd read a few reviews that claimed it would 'suck up' the rug, but I didn't have that problem with my rugs. Next, I tackled the hard-wood floors. With the beater-brush turned off, it cleaned everything in sight without the old problem I'd had with my former vac where it would throw the dirt and debris out the back and scatter it everywhere. It got into the corners and laid down flat enough to get under my kitchen table. I live on a farm and a lot of dirt gets dragged in daily, so it wasn't surprising that during the vacuuming of three large area rugs, I had to empty the canister three times. My old vacuum apparently wasn't doing much good! Did well on persian/oriental rugs without evident harm; just loads of dirt. I also own a parrot who makes a tremendous mess with his feathers, powder down and food. This vacuum sucked up even the smallest of downy feathers if I got to within a few inches of them on the hardwood. Next, I tried out the smaller hand attachment for use on furniture. It has its own rotating brush for picking up cat/dog hair (have two dogs and a cat as well). With other vacs, the moment you apply the  attachment to the furniture, the brush bogs down. Not this one! It picked up every cat hair off a chair I'd gone over several times with an attachment on my old vac. I must say, I am certainly satisfied with every aspect of this vacuum cleaner. Finally, I'll be able to reach up and get the cobwebs off the ceiling beams that I just couldn't get to with my smaller vacuum hose. The Dyson's wand extends to places I'd not been able to reach without a 12-foot ladder in the past. Definitely worth every penny. Shop around and get one for less~~they're out there. My sister has a refurbished one and is equally happy with hers.

I finally broke down and bought a Dyson.  I've been through countless 'cheaper' vacuums and am tired of having to purchase a new one every other year.  So I threw out my Eureka ( a replacement of a Hoover) and purchased the DC25 Animal.  I have a checkerboard style rug in my laundry room with alternating high and low pile.  Since the laundry room is off the garage, a lot of dirt and grass get deposited on that rug.  My old vacuum could never get the dirt out of the low squares.  The DC25 cleaned it like a pro.  It performed just as well on the low squares as it did on the high ones.  Afterward, I vacuumed my bedroom carpet and the Dyson picked up all of the gunk my old vacuum kept spitting out.  It did an excellent job around the base boards and cleaned dirt from the edges even without the crevice tool.  Love, love, love this vacuum!I then tried it out on my hardwood floors.  The beater bar button is conveniently located on the front so I didn't have to bend down to switch it off.  (Okay, I'm only 5'2', but still...) Our lower floor is all hardwood but we have several rugs on the floor.  I needed a vacuum that could switch between the two quickly and easily.  The Dyson had it covered.  Press once and the beater bar switched off, press again and it was back on.  Loved it!  It picked up dust and dirt as well as larger bits of dry cat food.  My floors passed the bare feet test and I didn't feel any grit or residue left behind. With two kids and two cats, that's a miracle.  The vacuum performed beyond my expectations.As others have mentioned, the ball makes cornering a breeze.  I could maneuver around chairs and other furniture with ease.  I did have to switch outlets a couple of times, but I've never had a vacuum cord long enough to cover the whole house so I'm used to that.  The dust bin emptied with a touch of a button and nothing got caught in the bin requiring manual removal.I just purchased this vacuum today so I can't speak to its durability, but so far it has been worth every penny.

I purchased this vacuum with a little apprehension. I have learned that high price does not equal high quality. Reading past reviews, I saw that people were disappointed, however I do believe that they were expecting more due to brand association and price. I have used a Kirby Legend II, the Hoover Platinum and a in home central vacuum system. Compared the the Kirby it is much lighter and easier to use, the Kirby also has to have regular belt and bag changes. The Kirby is a very powerful machine, but for it's size and weight you would expect that. Overall the Kirby was/is much more expensive but had quality you could feel. The Hover Platinum is the closest vacuum that could compare to the Dyson. The brush head and canister are larger, and the cord is longer, these points alone made me almost purchase that instead. It also has an indicator light that lets you know if the carpet in clean or dirty, a novelty item, but fun to watch. What sold me on the Dyson was the ball and the ease of maneuvering and pivoting. The house vacuum is just convenient and will spoil you. However it is very expensive and is usually installed while the house is being built. The best thing about the house vacuum is the option of having suction levers along the baseboards around the house where you please. The kitchen is a great place to have one, if there is a small spill, just flip the lever, grab a broom and sweep it in the wall. No vacuum can compare in my opinion. With that said, the Dyson is a less expensive option that is comparable in terms of convenience. I also own a Roomba, which is a lifesaver, especially when it comes to an easy daily vacuuming all around the house and leaving the deep vacuuming to once a week. If you own a pet or keep or windows open often, get a Roomba. Overall I would recommend this vacuum. It is light, effortless, convenient and good looking too. My only complaint is the plastic used, I would have thought it would have been thicker and denser, but that is what makes it so light, however I would have rather had denser plastic than a lighter vacuum.

I hate cleaning.  Particularly vacuuming, which is on par to cleaning the tub on the list of things I avoid until I absolutely cannot help it any more (which is usually when guests are coming over).  The biggest compliment I can give this vacuum is that it makes me want to vacuum my floors.  It is light.  It was easy to assemble.  It picks up hair from my two long hair black cats that embeds itself in my tan carpet.  Best vacuum I've ever owned.

column7: This vacuum is the new love of my life
column8: I love the Dyson Animal DC 25 vacuum. I read all the reviews for months before deciding to make my purchase and I couldn't be happier. My house has a combination of hardwood floors, Berber carpeting, plush area rugs, and tile and it does an excellent job in all places. It's great at picking up crumbs and sand my children bring in, household dust, and the animal fur left behind by my cat and two dogs. I have an area rug that no vacuum seemed capable of getting the matted-in fur off of, and the Dyson Animal sucked it up with no problem. The canister is a bit small, but I only have to empty it once, sometimes twice, when vacuuming my 1100 SF house. The cord is a bit on the short side as well, but even with a longer cord, I tend to unplug my vacuum and replug it in a couple of times while cleaning. The only real issue I have is that the hose can be a bit awkward to use with the long handle attachment on it.I saw some people complain that the brushes on the spinning part have damaged their hardwood floors. I have not had that problem. As long as the vacuum is in it's locked, upright position and I'm not pushing it, the brushes don't start spinning and I'm able to manually turn them off. The vacuum has even survived accidently running over shoelaces and Legos without any damage. My old Hoover Windtunnel broke any time I ran over anything that wasn't dust.The vacuum is super light weight and really easy to carry and maneuver when using. It was completely worth the $550 price tag (especially considering the 5 year warranty).

My husband and I have been trying to decide if a little plastic vacuum was worth all this money, but so far, we have to say it is.  We have a dog and 2 cats and a couple of rooms with carpet that no other vacuum we owned would clean lint and hair from.  We had to use lint brushes!  This vacuum cleaned every last piece of hair and lint off the rug and we just stood there amazed!  However, there are some pros and cons to weigh here.Pros:  1.  It cleans like a maniac!  2.  The dirt bin empties from the bottom, so no more turining it upside down and spilling half the dirt on your floor before you get to the garbage can.  3.  Best feature is when you put the vacuum in upright position, the beater bar stops moving, so no more wearing down your carpet while you move that coffee table. 4.  My husband really likes the ball technology.  I think it's ok.Cons:  1.  The cleaning wand is difficult to remove.  It sometimes takes 2 hands, plus a foot to hold down the rest of the vacuum before it will cooperate.  2.
