This vacuum picks up cat hair and specks off our tile and carpet equally well. I've only used the $50 animal attachment once.  It works, but haven't found it necessary.

column7: Great for dust and hair, but for dirty boys...not so much
column8: I purchased this vacuum after my second Shark canister died. I have all wood and tile floors, a constantly shedding dog and a few cats, two dirty boys, and would have to sweep a lot. The great thing about this vacuum is after I sweep, it picks up an embarrassing amount of hair, dust, and dirt. However, the really frustrating thing about this vacuum is that I have to sweep first. I figured for the price, it would eliminate that step. This vacuum is so low that it can't even pick up a skittle, not to mention the playground gravel my son brings home from school in his shoes. Also, I guess I was spoiled with a canister, because I like to not have to stop, put the vacuum in upright lock, tug and pull to get the strange wand out, attatch the flat head, just to vacuum under the sofa. Kind of a hassle.

column7: Expecting to return it but kept it and LOVE IT!
column8: This is the best vacuum I have ever owned. I bought so many vacuums before and returned every single one of them! They didn't live up to my expectations of what clean should be! I bought this vacuum because it had the mini turbine attachment which is absolutely wonderful for picking up pet hair on the sofas! I have a miniature pinscher and a doberman... both shed profusely... short dark hair on the sofa is hard to see, but the Dyson picked it all up!! I was disgusted to see the amount of hair lying on my sofa...Long story short. Things I love:Every attachment is thoughtfully designed to do it's job. I love the crevice tool which has a double duty purpose... vacuum near the side boards, and flip up attachment on crevice tool to dust! The mattress tool is wonderful for picking up embedded min pin hair on my bed!I love the design. The ball rolls around gracefully around chairs, sofas, tables. It cuts my cleaning time and back pain in half!The warranty! 5 years!!!!!!!!! How can you lose?I love the performance. I look at my carpets and smile! They are back to a white that I forgot that I had! You can feel how clean it is on your feet, and you can look and see that Dyson has done the job right!Here are the things I want improvement on:The hose... a little awkward to use, but once you get use to it, it works.Also the price. I don't regret spending the money on it, but I'd like to see the price drop!
This is the best vacuum I have ever owned.  It is light weight, it pivots and it picks up an amazing amount of dirt.  Love it!

column7: Dyson DC25 Animal Ball-Technology Upright Vacuum Cleaner
column8: There really isn't much to say. It cleans well and gets into hard to get places easier than conventional vacuums. Overall pleased with the cleaner and Amazon had the best price.Wouldn't buy another, Hover does a better job for half the money

Easy to put together right out of the box.  Nothing complicated about it.  Works great.  Light weight.  Only thing I can find that I would like to change is it would be nice to have a slightly longer cord.

I really didn't like this vacuum.It has a ball so I thought it would be great.But actually it started to hurt my wrist after I used only for a kitchen.I had to suffer the pain rest of the day after that.If you are not confident about your muscle or have any joint problems, you shouldn't get this one.This is kind of hard to control.Because of the ball, it keeps going to the right or left even though I want to go straight.I think nobody needs the ball unless you have a column in your house.Other cons are1. The cord is not long enough.2. The bin is not big enough.I wonder why they designed it like that.It seems not enough for everything.Some people say that Dyson's vacuum can ruin your carpet but it didn't happen in my apartment.So I exchanged to DC17 and I am very happy with it.

Wow, my Dyson vacuum cleaner was sent and it was certainly a factory defect.  The on button could not be push down at all.  It was not damaged in transport as there was absolutely no damage to the box it was shipped in.  I called Dyson immediately and asked what to do.  I was given the option to ship it back to Amazon or take it to a vacuum repair shop.  I asked the RUDE customer service rep, Latoya,if Dyson would pay for the shipping rate back to Amazon since this was a factory defective vacuum.  She explained that it was not a factory defect and Dyson would not pay for my retun shipping fees.  I asked on what basis she assumed that the defect was not factory related and she stated it wasn't and she knew it wasn't.  Amazing how these companies immediately take no liability for anything nowadays.  I asked to speak to her manager and believe it or not this RUDE man,Ray, also took no responsiblity for the factory defective vacuum.He also would not pay for return shipping charges.With little else to do I took it to an authorized vacuum dealer.  After looking at the packaging and the way the vacuum sat in the box he agreed that it was not broken in transport but a factory defective vacuum.  The customer service department at Dyson was to fax him a repair request but guess what!!!!  They didn't, go figure.  He did get the part faster than he usually gets parts and my vacuum was ready rather quickly.I love my vacuum!!!  I would recommend it to anyone.  I can not believe how well it works.  Too bad Dyson's customer service department doesn't work as well!!!!Sincerely,J. Tabar[[ASIN:B0014E3GM0 Dyson DC25 Ball All-Floors Upright Vacuum Cleaner]]

This is a great vacuum.  With the first run it cleaned a significant amount dirt from a carpet that looked clean.  The attachments and wand work well.  They are excellent for cleaning along the carpet edges where dust can build up.  We have a variety of surfaces from tile and wood floors to Carpet.  It works great on all. The ball makes the vacuum very easy to manage.

column7: Good vacuum, but you might want to consider other options
column8: This is the first Dyson I've owned, and I like it quite a bit, but I do wish I had done a bit more research.  But before I get to that, here are the things I like:* Great suction in both the vacuum and the wand* Lightweight and maneuverable* No bags or filters to replace, and no belt to break.  As an aside, I've noticed some people complain that the belt has broken.  Either they're not sure what they're talking about, they're reviewing the wrong model, or they're lying.* Decent set of tools* Bin is really easy to empty* 5 year warrantyA few negatives, which are minor:* Bin is somewhat small; we have a fairly small house but still sometimes have to change the container in the middle of cleaning* The wand is a bit awkward to detachAs I said before, I wish I had done a bit more research into Dyson's product line before buying this particular vacuum.The regular Animal, the DC17, has several advantages over the regular Dyson, the DC14: It has a motorized brushbar, it has a mini turbine head attachment, a low reach floor tool attachment, and more 'cyclones.'  I'm not sure how well the extra cyclones work, but Consumer Reports says the DC17 has much better suction than the DC14.  Presumably, the extra cyclones have something to do with that.The DC25 Animal (the vacuum I'm reviewing here) does not have any more 'cyclones' than the regular DC25.  In fact, I believe they both have fewer cyclones than the DC14.  Again, I'm not sure how well the extra cyclones work, but Consumer Reports seems to like them.  Furthermore, both the DC25 Animal and the regular DC25 have a motorized brushbar.  Neither of them have the low floor attachment.In fact, the *only* difference between the DC25 Animal and the regular DC25, as far as I can tell, is the mini turbine attachment.  In case you don't know, this attachment is used to get pet hair off of things like furniture and car seats.  I like it, but other reviewers on Amazon don't seem terribly impressed.If you want a Dyson ball but you don't want the mini turbine attachment, just buy the regular DC25.  If you *do* want a ball and a mini turbine attachment, consider this one -- it's only $50 more than the regular DC25, but the attachment by itself costs more than $50.If you want better suction (at the expense of more weight and less maneuverability), I think I'd recommend the regular Animal.

column7: Save Your Money,Hose Breaks,Poor Design, Too Heavy
column8: After 1.5 years, the design has not changed.The hose completely came apart.  It weighs a TON and has the DUMBEST, lousiest design ever.1.  cannot vacuum under furniture because it is so large,2.  the hardwood floor attachment pushes stuff around because the bristles block the suction3.  the hose and entire design are incredibly akward --to get suction the hose will bend and block air, thus you must often hold + unbend the hose while simultaneously vacuuming.4. you will injure your back with the weight of this beast.5.  save your money, it breaks just like the cheaper brands, and the hose replacement is well over $1006.  So after 1.5 years of a broken back, you can have my piece of dirt for free and I'm going to buy a new cannister every year as they break all the time anyhow.

column7: Not for anyone with back/neck issues
column8: I've had the Dyson for about 2 months now.Pros:  Very good suction, does well with dog hair.Cons:  Awkward to move around and heavy, the ball does not help much.  I bought this thinking that it would be easier to move around.  I have some disc issues with my neck, and this vac irritates my neck.The cord is short, goes across one room - I have some open spaces and it will not extend all the way across.The extension is awkward to use, does not always come off/on easily, does not maneuver well.  If stretched a long way, it does not go back onto the vac easily.The plastic dirt bag/container is not easy to empty.  Dog hair and other stuff tend to get stuck, and you might have to reach in to get all the dirt out.  Can be messy to empty.I have always used a canister vac, finding them easier to move around, and easier to reach corners & difficult spots quickly.  My Hoover canister has a reuseable plastic bag/container that is very easy to dump out and never makes a mess.  It is not as good on rugs, even with a beater brush.Dyson will not give a refund, even with my medical issues.

Just purchased the Animal and after a few uses, I am very happy. The only thing it has a hard time picking up so far is popcorn on the kitchen floor. Not a big deal. As for the small holding container size, what s the big deal. I look at that as a positive step in how much cleaner every thing is and really, how far do you have to go to empty it, across the street? If my previous vacuum picked up as much as the Dyson, I d be changing the bag every time I used it and then could complain about the cost of bags.

column7: Everything they say it is and more
column8: I have three cats, a poorly-insulated ground floor apartment with a heat pump, and a mostly-carpeted space. This vacuum is literally changing my life. Yes, the smaller reservoir is annoying. Yes, if you or your pets have oily hair or fur, cleaning is a little more involved. But the results are terrific. The carpets appear like new again (they also seem thicker, plusher). The air is sweeter. My air purifiers aren't working as hard. The pets are frolicking on the rugs (really -- it's fun to watch). And, at the start of allergy season, I don't seem to be getting my usual sinus/ear problems. The price is frightening, but so far it seems to be worth it. P.S.: for those of us with arthritis or other disabilities, the combination of the ball technology, lower profile, and lighter weight make this a much friendlier vacuum to use. I liked my Bissell Pet, but I love my Dyson 25 Animal.

My recent purchase of a Dyson DC25 was to replace a 3 year old Bissell Healthy Home.  I didn't think vacuums got any better than that one, but the Dyson definitely is as good if not better.  It is so light and easy to use.  While the wand is not as user friendly as it could be, I am getting used to it.  It surely sucks on the pet hair!!  I love the way it works on the hard floors and the dog hair doesn't stand a chance.  If I could vacuum my dog, I would...it's that good.  While pricey, we'll see if this vacuum stands the test of time.

column7: lightweight, very quiet, good suction for a bagless
column8: Got my Dyson DC25 after much pondering about forking over almost $[...] for it. My aging, 7 year old kenmore bagless would barely lift pet hair. After unboxing it a few hours ago, and giving it a try, amazing amount of dust, pet dander and hairballs came out of a carpet that was, supposedly, freshly vacuumed a couple days ago. yuck!I was expecting the dyson to be incredibly loud, louder than the kenmore I have. What a great surprise it was pretty darn quiet.Putting the vacuum together was easy: snap in the motorized brush base, snap the clear flexible hose to the extensible handle, click, clack put the attachments to the side and done!  I like the fact that you can turn off the motorized brushing action on and off with the push of a button.Cable seems adequate, although it's a bit on the short side. Not to be considered a con, unless you have a house with a single power outlet.One con, is that like most bagless, empyting the canister is kinda messy. Since suction action creates static electricity, it causes plastic to hold on to the cat/pet hairs. What I use to do, is after done vacuuming, wait for a few minutes before emptying the can.

I was pretty amazed at how much dirt it picked up when I have very recently vacuumed with my Kirby.  I love the NO bags, it is so much easier. It also has a pretty low head which goes under stuff easily. The conversion from carpet to solid surface is very easy as is the wand attachment. It is a little heavy but manageable.  Love the purple color.

I've had a first generation Dyson DC07 for many years and after several key components failed, I decided to replace it with a DC25 Animal. I chose this unit because I have a long haired dog and I expected unique animal related cleaning features (as the name implies). As it turns out, the differences between this unit and the DC25 Yellow are no more than the name, color and a suction driven attachment Dyson calls a mini-turbine head (for $45 more). Except for the color, they're identical machines.I've returned the DC25 and had the DC07 repaired.PROS:*Relatively light and easy to handle.*Brush headUnlike the older Dyson models, the brush head has its own motor and a smaller profile which allows for easier access to more areas and the clutch switch has been replaced with an easier to reach button adjacent to the on/off switch.*Easier maneuverability due to the ball design.CONS:*Undersized collection container We found ourselves emptying the container several times/day*Emptying collection container is a NUISANCE We found that our dog's long hairs got caught up inside the container and that only way to empty the container was to either reach in (no thanks) or use another vacuum. We ended up reaching for another vacuum most of the time.*Cord too short The cord is about long enough for you to vacuum one room. If you have several rooms to clean and you don't mind plugging/unplugging than this wouldn't be an issue for you. It was for us.*Power head switch If you want to turn the roller brush off, for cleaning hardwood floors, for e.g., you can simply press a button next to the on/off switch. This is a nice improvement over the DC07. What I didn't like here is that if the brush head has been turned OFF and you then turn the vacuum OFF, Dyson forces the brush head back ON before turning the vacuum OFF. Dyson probably determined they could save a few pennies with this design but I suspect it will, ultimately, shorten the life of the powered brush head.*Mini-Turbine Head As indicated earlier, the small brush head rotates via the suction coming from the  vacuum. It struck me that the brush rotation didn't provide any significant advantage over using the dust tool attachment. In addition, you're left managing it since Dyson didn't provide a way to attach it to the vacuum.All in all, the key issue I have with this vacuum is the woefully inadequate collection/disposal system. I consider this to be fundamental flaw: it's simply too small and, when dealing with pet hair, necessitates another vacuum to empty it properly. Back to the drawing board.
This is the best vacuum cleaner I have ever had! Fantastic performance, great look and versatility. A must have if you look for the perfect vacuum cleaner.

column7: Know before you buy, I'm sorry now.
column8: After reading the great reviews and the few negatives I took the plunge...now I'm sorry.First the positives:1. Yes it is powerful and does a reasonably good job.2. It is light and easy to handle and it does go around corners well.Now the negatives:1. The container fills up fast and has to emptied often.  Sounds easy but consider the puff of dust as you empty it.  Also you have dig the dog hair out of an inner crevice where it packs in...more puff of dust.  Add to that the thing in the middle with holes gets plugged up and that has to be cleaned often also.2. When the directions say not to run over, well just about everything, they're not kidding.  When ran over a very thin paper ribbon and that was enough to break the belt.3. The power and the overall job is really no better then our old Hover.  Accept the Hover was not so hard to clean, had stronger belts and I could throw away the bag resulting in the missing multiple puffs of dust.4. The attachments are very unhandy.  They really need to do some design changes here.  It's awkward and unwieldy. The attachments have not done a better job then my old vacumm; don't expect it to magically suck up all the animal hair from your couch any better.5. Cost, sheesh, for the money they charge for this thing. OMG.  I am so sorry I bought this.  I would go out right now and buy a $200 vacumm in a heartbeat except for the fact of the amount of money I spent.Overall I am completely dissatisfied with this product and sorry for the dollars wasted.  Please be aware and adjust your expectations.

But in a good way of course lol! I have two dogs, berber carpet in the bedrooms and pergo in the hallways and downstairs areas. This thing does a great job of getting the dirt and pet hair up. The only thing I would change is to not make the micro-bristles come on automatically when u start it.. but you can turn it off just by hitting the button for it so no big deal. Overall a good product. I can't say if it is better than the cheaper dyson brands, as I've never actually owned one before this.. but I figured why not get the best since I'll need one for quite awhile. :)

I had seen all the ads for this Dyson Vacuum, but didn't really a new vacuum yet, or so I thought! I had even tried it out at the local Best Buy Store, where a sales rep from Dyson was giving a demo. I couldn't believe how easily it moved and the suction was fantastic. Then my 2 year old vacuum burned out it's motor one day, and so I found myself needing a new vacuum in a hurry. I immediately checked on Amazon, and found the best prices anywhere! I chose the Animal Vacuum because I have 2 small dogs, and even though they don't shed much I figured this model would work out best for me. The Dyson arrived in a few short days, and I put it to the test. I couldn't believe the dirt and dog hair that it pulled out of my carpets. The first time I used it I found myself having to empty the container for every room. And I thought I had a very clean house! Even my husband is vacuuming because he likes the way it handles and moves around furniture. And its so easy to carry up and down the stairs. I am so happy I spent a little more money on this Dyson. It works great and I definitely give it all 5 stars and MORE!

column7: At last-a vac that does what it says it'll do
column8: Nothing picks up animal hair from floors/carpets as well as this vac. We have gone through several brands over the past 20 years,(including the great Rainbow vacuum scam- trust me, avoid that overpriced albatross at all costs!) and though this may seem pricey, you definitely get what you pay for (especially with the discounted price through Amazon.com). No messy expensive bags to change, either, and the HEPA filter makes it odorless, like none of the other machines we have owned in the past. I gave it 4 stars, 'cause nothing is perfect in my estimation, though this one is close enough!

I had been wanting a Dyson for years, my Mum had one in England when they first came out there 17-18 years ago (they were ALOT heavier and bulkier back then though!).  Well my Hoover broke last week and I saw the Sale on Amazon, so I thought why not?!  An average vacuum costs $100, if I'm replacing old crappy vacuums every year, this will pay for itself in 5 years (with the 5 year warranty!), so I clicked the 'Order' button and a few days later (last night!) it arrived.  After about 10 minutes maximum putting it together, I plugged 'her' in!Woooweee!  Now at this point, maybe I should explain I have been living with Fibromyalgia/CFS for the last 2-3 years.  Vacuuming has been hard to do because it is so physical and requires alot of energy!  Well, when I vacuumed last night ... it was a breeze!  The Dyson Animal 25 is not heavy, it manouvers easily with the 'ball'.  Infact, it felt so easy, it didn't feel like I was vacuuming 'right', I didn't feel like I was cleaning 'properly' because it was so easy!  Thanks to the Dyson Animal I will now be vacuuming more - that in itself, is worth so much to me (and my family!)  I used to dread vacuuming ... not anymore!  This has made my life alot easier and that makes it worth every single penny!Instead of registering via snail mail, I went straight to the website and registered my Dyson there, it was really simple and straightforward!Thank you Dyson for making my life, just a little bit easier!

DC25 ANIMAL REALLY PICKS UP - I VACUUMED THE ENTIRE HOUSE IN LESS THAN HALF THE TIME- BECAUSE IT REALLY SUCKS UP THE DIRT AND ANIMAL DANDER. THE BALL IS INCREDIBLE FOR MANUEVERING.  TWO YEARS AGO I PURCHASED THE TOP OF THE LINE ORECK.  LOVED THE LIGHTWEIGHT OF THIS VACUUM BUT THE VACUUM DOES NOT PICK UP AT ALL. FROM LITTLE GRAINS OF SAND TO BIG FUZZES- JUST NOT A POWERFUL SUCTION. I HAVE TO GO OVER THE SAME SPOT 6 TIMES-  WORST PART IS THAT ORECK DOES NOT STAND BEHIND IT'S PRODUCT. 4 TUNE UPS IN TWO YEARS.  800.00 DOWN THE DRAIN.  WHAT A TERRIBLE WASTE OF MONEY.NO MAINTENANCE, NO BAGS, DC25 SEEMS PERFECT TO ME.  I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!

My wife and I were looking for a vacuum to help with allergies and we are happy with the other Dyson we have, a DC 21 the canister.  While weight was not a concern for me, it was for my wife.  This is a light weight vacuum that is easy to use.  It picks up plenty and seems to do an excellent job. It does an especially good job on pet hair.  The canister is easy to empty.  And most of the complaints that existed from the previous ball seem to have been addressed.  The only drawback is that the tool extension is not very convenient to use.  It is a hard tube that is great for reaching an object at a distance, but not being able to shorten it for something close up is not a great design.  Overall though this does what we wanted and was well worth the price!
I love the Dyson DC25. It picks up every thing and glides like no other vacuum I have ever owned....

column7: Astonishing performance on long pet hair - definitely worth owning
column8: If you have long-haired animals as I do, buy this. It's as simple as that.One thing, though - even if you're a fairly fanatical vacuumer, prepare to be disgusted with what you pull up the first time that you use the Dyson. I am owned by one Golden Retriever- Sheltie mix who blows coat twice a year, plus two longhaired cats that leave fur trails daily (despite frequent grooming of all three). I purchased my Dyson Animal last month after burning through the fourth belt in as many months on my old vacuum (an Oreck, no slouch in itself).  I did a lot of research and decided that a Dyson that was purpose-built for pet hair had to be worth a try.Well. I had just vacuumed the day before the Dyson arrived, but thought I'd take my new appliance for a spin just the same. I ran the Dyson over the carpet in my previously-vacuumed (and recently professionally-shampooed) living room, and the amount of hair, dust and other assorted debris that the Dyson lifted was genuinely astonishing (AND totally disgusting, when I considered that it had all been lurking in the rug!). I had to empty the waste container four times during that first use, and it is not a small container. I could have knit a whole new dog from the amount of long red hair that the Dyson Animal found.Subsequent uses are now keeping the carpets clean, and the rooms even smell fresher. Added and unexpected bonus: my allergies have substantially declined.I have since used the Dyson on both carpet and oriental rugs, and while it surely and quickly gets the dirt and hair, I have seen no unwanted lifting of fibers from the rugs. One note - when you first fire it up, if it doesn't seem to be picking up as it ought, make sure you find and engage the switch that turns on the rotating brush (you can turn that brush off for doing hard floors or very delicate rugs).  Note that if you're used to really lightweight vacuums, this one will seem heavy. The weight actually is very useful in helping it to grip the carpet, and the ball makes it extremely maneuverable, so in general the weight isn't an issue. It would only be a drawback if you happen to have serious difficulty with lifting and if you also frequently need to go up and down stairs with your vacuum, in which case you may want to consider a lighter model.Setup was easy and took less than 10 minutes. The vacuum is well built and based on Dyson's reputation and bazillions of other reviews, I don't anticipate any problems with its durability. I also appreciate Dyson's use of recyclable cardboard for all interior packing - no styrofoam to clog the landfills.All in all, it's a fantastic vacuum and well worth the money, especially if you have four-legged fuzzies in your home.

I got my Dyson last night and it is so cool At first I was like oh I don't like the fact that when I vacuum my couch and chairs I'm like 3 feet away from them so that means I couldn't vacuum my cat.I just thought this was very awkward but thought we'll I guess I have to get used to it.I tried to disconnect just the flexible hose form the extended reach wand and I must have been an idiot the first time b/c then when I tried it again, it came right off.So then I was able to attach the soft brush to the vacuum and vacuum the cat, she was happy and so was I so after that hang up was fixed I love it!Also since it sounded different from my old vacuum at which the dog was scared of and could not be in the same room with it.He even got vacuumed, then he got a treat.So all is goodI love the fact that it weights like nothing-16lbs that's awesome the only thing is the cord is several feet shorter than my other one.I actually used the little beater bar attachment to vacuum the chaise and the sofa downstairs it worked well and since it's the ball you can totally get into places that you could not maneuver into before.The main beater bar head is smaller than my other one but I like that for the same reason I can get into place I could not go before.

I spent many hours researching the Dyson Vacuum and finally decided on the Dyson DC25.  We have 2 dogs (german shepherd/husky) and always have dog hair everywhere.  I have thick, off-white carpet in one part of the house and a tight, short berber in other areas.I am IN LOVE with my Dyson and wouldn't trade it for the world.  I ordered it from Amazon several weeks ago (Feb 2009) and have been vacuuming frequently.  My husband, myself and several others all feel that our carpet looks VERY clean.  I'm amazed at how much dog hair, dirt and junk it is picking up.I will say that the canister gets filled up quickly due to all the dog hair in our home, so to vacuum the entire house (2000 square feet) I have to empty it about 6 times.  But - that would never make me not buy this.  I love to see all the yuck that has been picked up off the carpet and it's very easy to empty the canister and go back to vacuuming.  The canister does have lots of dirt clinging on the inside, but I just use a dry microfiber cloth to wipe it down on the inside now and then.I debated over the animal vs. non-animal - think the major differences I found were color (non animal is yellow/animal is purple) and the animal one comes with an extra attachment that has come in handy for vacuuming furniture, steps and my car.I also LOVE the hose on this vacuum.  I can easily vacuum all the steps and even the corners of the ceiling (to get at cobwebs) with ease.  No more balancing the vacuum on one step while I try to vacuum the other steps.  Just leave it at the bottom of the steps and the hose can reach them all!

column7: Not worth it's weight in tin foil!
column8: I purchased this vacuum because of the great reviews from consumers (even though Consumer Reports gave it bad reviews I got it anyway).  The positives I can list:  nice style, fairly quiet, the ball was kind of neat to manuever it around, although a little sloppy.  The dirt cup comes off of the vacuum without making a mess, which is nice.  The cons: This has the worst suction I've ever seen.  It barely lifted the pile of the carpet, left quite a bit of dog hair behind. The carpet looked smashed down like I took a wide toothed rake to it. It 'never loses suction' because it didn't have any to begin with.  When emptying the dirt cup, I had to shake the dickens out of it to get the dog hair to fall out... which it didn't, so I had to try to stick my hand up there to get it out (my hand didn't fit, the cup is obstructed by the filter in the middle) so the hair stayed in there until I ran it again for it to swirl back down.  Closing the bottom of the cup is messy because there is dust all over it from shaking it out, which then puts dirt onto your vacuum. The pet hair attachment didn't work the greatest but it was ok. The cord is way too short for a vacuum in this price range.  I had a Hoover Wind Tunnel bagged vacuum before this, and the suction and cleaning was unbelievable.  I figured after replacing too many belts and the switch, I'd get something that might last longer.  I don't know about the longevity of Dyson vacs, but I do know that the one I had was terrible.  I wouldn't recommend.  I purchased a $40 dirt devil featherlite in the meantime... it picked up every single dog hair.  I'll gladly save $500 to have a clean floor!
Best vacuum we've ever owned---doesn't clog and does not lose suction.  Maneuvers very easily with the ball design.

I've been waiting to get this vacuum and finally broke down and ordered it.  We have 3 large dogs-a German Shepherd, a Lab and a Leonberger.  Dog hair gets everywhere.This vacuum picks up everything and makes the carpet look great. I did not think I needed the 'ball' but ordered it anyway and I am so glad I did.  The ball makes it so easy to manuever. I am very impressed and glad I made the purchase.I gave it four stars instead of five because of two things:  the body is made of plastic that does not seem to be of a heavy duty variety and I am wondering how it will hold up.  And also the canister has a very low capacity and I have to dump it multiple times, but the smaller canister may allow for the great suction.I would highly recommend this to pet owners.

column7: Apartment dwelling, dog owning, clean freak approved!!!
column8: A vacuum cleaner is one of those items that you 'get what you pay for.'I have owned 2 cheap-o (less than $100) cleaners over the past two years.  One was bagged and the other was bagless.  They were both CRAP!  I would have to take part the vacuum and unclog it just to get moderate suction power.  In the end all i was left with was carpeting that looked clean at first glance...simply because of the vacuum track marks.  But when i would closely inspect the carpet, it was nasty.  Still covered in dog hair and dust!  I wasn't able to vacuum our dog's hair to save my life and it was starting to stress me out.  I gave in and started to research online for a new QUALITY vacuum. After hours of online research it came down to two choices and they were both Dysons.  I had seen the commercials, knew people that owned them, and was always skeptical about paying so much money for a vacuum cleaner but I couldn't ignore the reviews from both average Joe's and online Consumer Reports.It was either the DC17 Animal or the DC25 Animal.In the end, I went with the DC25 Animal because of it's smaller profile and ease of use.  I am able to vacuum everywhere in the apartment without having to move lots of things around.  The ball simply was icing on the cake.  I was willing to give up the smaller collection bin for the low profile and 'ball.'  I was so totally right!!!  Had i purchased the DC17, I would have had some problems getting under and around things in my apartment.If you live in an apartment, if you own a dog/cat, if you HATE DUST, if you currently own a POS vacuum and are reading these reviews, trying to figure out if you are gonna cave in and buy a Dyson....DO IT NOW!!!  BUY THE DYSON DC25 ANIMAL!!!!  You will be glad you did and you won't ever mind cleaning your apartment EVER AGAIN!!! It does it all!!!PROS:-Cleans the carpet like a vacuum should!!!-I got four words for you dog lovers...'NO MORE PET HAIR!!!'-Low profile let you vacuum under and around without other attachments.-The attachments let you clean everything from ceiling fans to sofas!!!-Ball; the ball makes it fun to vacuum!!!-The Dyson name...you know it will SUCK the best!!!Cons:-Smaller dust bin than other models.  You will have to empty it 3-4 times when vacuuming a, really dirty, 3 bedroom apartment.*****FIVE STARS*****Even with the smaller dust bin, the Dyson DC25 Animal lives up to the hype.  Trust me, just go buy the damn thing and be done worrying about PET HAIR FOREVER!!!

I read ALL the reviews how it picks up stuff your normal vacuum doesn't, how peoples canisters were full even though they had just vacuumed with their other vacuum. Well not true for me. My dirt devil actually picked up stuff the dyson missed!!! My $60 dirt devil! They dyson has great accessories, and the wand to pull out to vacuum the stairs and couches is amazing, but would I pay $500 for that? No! I'm sending it back to dyson to see if something is wrong with it, because it just isn't living up to it's reputation for me!

I stepped up from a 10 year old Kenmore upright vacuum to buying the Dyson DC25 Animal when our Australian Shepherd puppy began to shed.  Our home is full of oriental rugs that cover hardwood floors and I feel as though I can finally see the true colors of the rugs again!  It is so satisfying to vacuum a room and see that so much dirt that you didn't even know was there is gone.  The rugs look fresh and new.  Definitely worth the money.

column7: Great vacuum - keep an eye out for good deals!
column8: Very impressed with this vacuum so far.  The first time we used it (having just vacuumed with our old vacuum a couple of days earlier) - we had to empty the canister three times.I do have some minor gripes.  It wasn't something I noticed prior to purchase - but unlike a lot of vacuums - the DC25 does NOT have a light on the front.  It would definitely be useful in corners / under hard to move furniture.  The hose attachments provided in the box are good - but none worked amazingly well on the stairs.  The brush attachment wasn't stiff enough, and the other just didn't pickup all the animal hair - so I'm about to purchase the $20 stiff brush to see how that works.  Lastly, the power cord could be a little longer.As per another review, the hose design did take a minute to get used to - but is very space saving and to my surprise was long enough to do our stair case without dragging the vacuum half way up the stairs.I'm still rating this vacuum as five stars because it does an excellent job of cleaning carpet, is easy to manoeuvre, and is a lot lighter and less noisy than my old vacuum.

Finally got tired of having to use my old vacuum's small hose attachment (10yr old Panasonic) over every single square inch of carpet to pick up the pet hair that gets matted into the rug (I have 2 cats). I did a bunch of online research and narrowed it down to this one, the DC17 and the Kenmore Progressive. I chose the DC25 because it's lighter than the DC17 and it has the re-cleanable filters whereas the Kenmore you have to replace. Also the ball maneuverability is nice to have, and come on, it just looks cool. This DC25 works great. I've only used it once, but it's done a better job than me on my knees with my old vacuum. Gonna be a huge time saver, assuming it lasts and performance doesn't degrade over time. We shall see.I only gave it 4 stars because I believe use of the hose extension is kind of a pain. My old vacuum I could just pull the hose out and start sucking. This one you have to flip a cap, extend a pole, press a button and do a jiggling pulling motion to pull the hose out. Not a huge deal breaker for me, and maybe I'll get better at it.

This vacuum has it all: light weight, maneuverable, great suction, very intuitive design, smallish size for easy storing. Plus the rotating brush attachment (animal version) does a great job on stairs and also has great suction. I also don't mind the clear canister. Seeing all the fine dust and hair that is getting picked up gives positive re-enforcement in a weird way.The only drawback is the price, but with the lower models you will sacrifice at least one of the important (to me) features mentioned above. I couldn't be happier with this model.

I love this one. it works ready great and powerful. I have a bernese mountain dog and she shade a lot. This one actually helps me to keep my carpet clean very easily, and I don't need to buy extra re-place bag for it. Althought it is pricy, but in the long run, it should be worthy. Will see in next two year. I recommand this product.

I have had my Dyson DC15 with ball for over a year and I still love it. Picks up what others leave behind, especially dog har. Very maneuverable with the ball. Empty with touch of a button, (do not empty inside)

I've owned just about every top rated vacuum that has been made. I was never satisfied, mostly because they where too heavy to handle, or the animal hair was blown about, rather than sucked up. I do have a canister vacuum that I have had for years, but I wanted a satisfactory upright that was light and easy to handle. I have a cat and a dog, and there is lots of shedding hair, all the time. Our house is mostly hard floors, stairs, and one large rug in the living room. When I saw the DC25 Animal, I decided to spend the money hoping that this vacuum would do the job. It has lived up to my wildest dreams, it is wonderfully easy to handle, so easy to maneuver, the 16 lbs make such a difference compared to those very heavy machines I had before, I had no problem carrying it upstairs. I love that with this vacuum I don't need to select different heights, it goes from floor to carpet to floor. I was even able to clean the dogs bed without the wand attachment. Speaking of the wand/handle attachment you simply flip open the top cap, pull up on the wand, and it disconnects from the vacuum and suction diverts to the wand. It took a little getting use to, the hose is a little stiff and took a while before I was comfortable cleaning the stairs. Most important, THIS VACUUM SUCKS, but in a good way!!Assembly was fairly easy, suppose to be 3 snaps with no tools. But I had a heck of a time getting it out of the box, and being not mechanically inclined I would have liked better instructions.I have never reviewed a product before, but this vacuum cleaner has me so excited that I had to share it with someone. I really love this machine!

Our old vacuum was overheating so much that it takes me two cooldown session to even vacuum half my apartment, even after opening it up and cleaning it.  So after eyeing this one for a month or two, I finally decided to buy this one instead of spending money on a cheaper vacuum that will probably break in a year or two.  This vacuum comes with a 5 year warranty, so even if it costs 3 times as much as many vacuums, I expect it to last at least as long as 3 of those vacuums, especially since the filter is washable and never needs replacing.Once I opened the box, which was even well-designed, assembly was easy.  Everything snaps into place without much force, and it was working a few minutes out of the box.I then tried it out.  The vacuum is fairly light, and extremely easy to maneuver.  Tt picked up so much dust, hair, and dander that my previous vacuum left behind that I had to empty the canister twice.  It even cleared up most of the dust which was floating in the air before.  The roller is extremely easy to remove when you need to clean it.  I took a quarter to the giant plastic screw and it popped right out, a feature I wish I had on my previous vacuums.Emptying the dust canister was easy as well, since it pops right out and has a button to release the bottom.  However, I find that it opens too fast so it disturbs the fine dust laying on the bottom of the canister and makes some of it airborn.  And a few times, I've had to reach in to get the dust out because it doesn't all fall into the trash bin when it clumps up, but both downsides are still minimal compared to my other canister vacuum, where I had to turn over the entire canister every time.The telescopic wand is very very handy and snaps in and out easily.  The reach on the wand is also very long, and can just about reach the top of my steps with the vacuum on the bottom of the stairs.While the vacuum itself is great, I'm not as fond of the turbine head attachment in the DC25 Animal version.  I tried it on the suitcase my cat was sleeping on, and it took several runs through the same spot to clean her hair off, which isn't much different from non-turbine brushes.  On the microfiber futon we have, it worked very well, however.  I also tried it on the stairs, but it doesn't seem to clean very well unless the angle was perfect, and when combined with the telescopic wand, is a pretty steep angle, causing me to have to lift it up higher than is comfortable.  It'd probably be fine if I was 6' tall, but I'm not.  If the turbine head attachment had an auto-adjusting angle, I would have no complaints at all about it.All in all, the DC25 part of the vacuum is just about flawless, and got me very excited about using it, but the turbine head attachment found in this Animal version is not quite as perfect.  The DC25 is definately worth every penny, just not as enthusiastic about the Animal part.

I bought this for the canister and the fact that I am tired of picking pet hair off my clothes. It works great on my area rugs, the hardwood floors and the vinyl in my kitchen and bathroom.  This was super easy to assemble and use.  I even accidentally sucked up a pet's toy and had to take apart the roller piece to get it out, it was easy. I don't really understand everyone's frustration with this appliance.  I read about how it takes a while to adjust to the ball technology, I didn't have any trouble and I am usually the one who has issues with hand eye coordination.  It works amazing, the only problem I had is that it sucks so hard my small hallway runner kept getting sucked up, I had to weigh it down to vacuum.  I can't wait to finish the house.

I never thought I would pay the $$$ for a dyson.  I finally did & it is so worth it!  I vacuumed what I thought was a pretty clean rug & sofa and could not beleive what the dyson picked up.  No bags or filters to buy it good too.  The dust bin is easy to empty and exhaust don't smell like a wet dog.  Wish I bought one of these long ago.
Great vacuum however the dirt canister seems a bit small and the cord does not stay secured on the back of the cleaner either when you wrap it up.

I used to love my Dyson animal until someone brought their Kirby vacuum over and put my vacuum to shame.  I vacuumed my kids playroom with my dyson and got a little bit of dirt in the canister.  Then right after that, we vacuumed the same room with the Kirby vacuum and you would not believe the incredible amount of dirt that came up!  Now I feel like I'm wasting my time whenever I vacuum.  Keep in mind that a Kirby is a $2000 vacuum.  When I bought my dyson $400 seemed like so much, it seemed like $2000 to me.  Now after seeing what I've seen I would either pay $100 for any old vacuum or just fork over the money for a real vacuum.I bought my Dyson animal 6 months ago.  I thought this was the best vacuum available.  When I started using it, I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be.  It seemed to pick up dirt about as well as my previous vacuum ($150 Eureka). I notice that it doesn't pick up everything when I have it on the setting for wood, I have to go back and sweep to get the dining room floor crumb free.  I also notice that things like little pieces of paper get caught around the brush.  The suction is only in the middle of the brush area, so unless the thing you are vacuuming is in that small section in the middle, it doesn't really get picked up very well.It does drive and steer like a dream, I love the ball.  It's nice, but it doesn't suck like I was hoping.

I have 3 lab mixes who shed horribly. I now vacuum daily and it only takes one pass to pick up all the hair from my carpet. I have spent tons of money trying to find a pet vacuum cleaner and this is the first one I have every liked. I used to never replace the vacuum with the same one because I have never been satisfied with my purchase but I will replace this vacuum with the same one because it works great.

First of all, this vacuum is definately worth the $100 more than I would have paid for another brand at Wally World.  I just want to point out a few things others might not have:1.  This vacuum is not a rug shredder.  It relies on suction, not bristle speed, to 'vacuum'.  I've did the rugs a few times and it hasn't grabbed the loose yarns.  My last vacuum would unravel the rug until I turned it off.2.  Has the awesomest baseboard cleaner ever.  The brush on the end of the skinny tube thingy is works great.3.  Many things that make you think 'why doesn't all the vacuums work this way'.  They are simple, but I haven't seen them before.

column7: Watch out for the high reach places
column8: I've had my Dyson for over a year now and for the most part it's great.  It does what everyone else says it does but there are things you have to think about:1) The price of all the extra attachments (a lot of these came out after I got my Dyson).  You will want them, trust me but they will cost you.  The hard floor tools, the hose attachment and the dusting tools and so on.2) If you don't have the hose extension and you are trying to dust high places, wear foot protection and be prepared for an arm workout.  That hose wants to go back to the vacuum like crazy and you will have to use muscle to make it do what you want.  The vacuum will then come after you and your feet.On the plus side the groom tool is really good as long as your dog is fine with the noise of the vacuum.  I have an Australian Shepherd with long bushy hair and it really helps cut down on how much he sheds.  The Dyson's suction is very good and when the attachments fit (that doesn't always happen) they are very useful.
I purchased this vacuum from a target store.  A week later, I returned it!  It jams and the 'high quality' plastic breaks easily. I would strongly reconsider purchasing any Dyson vacuum.

Simply put....great product. Purchase ordered, shipped timely, and was easy to to together.  Very impressed when we turned it on and the amount of collection it picked up.  Thought our previous vac did a good job but this one did much better.

I have a dog that sheds and a house that always seems to track a lot of dust and debris. I bought the Dyson DC25 and was somewhat skeptical about how I felt it would perform. Bottom line is it has pulled so much more hair, dirt and grime out of my carpets then I thought was possible. The amount of dust visible in the collection container amazes me every time. The brush on the Dyson really works the dirt out from deep in the fibers and the suction is more then adequate to pull it into the vacuum. My house really feels cleaner since using this vacuum. I can't say much about durability at this point and it's obvious that the DC25 is a piece of engineering with many parts but the product feels solid and I expect it to have a long life. The 5 year warranty suggests the folks at Dyson are confident as well.

I'm kinda in the middle with this vacuum. I bought the animal one basically because its not yellow. I do have four dogs now though and it seems to have good suction. I find that my canister fills up quickly but I think that just means its doing its job. I have only had the vacuum since 2010 and I will be sending it off to be repaired for the second time (in the last year) today. Last June the entire motor was replaced and now its doing the exact same thing not even a year later. I had to take it to sears the first time now I have to take it to the ups store. I find it very inconvient that I have to be without a vacuum for weeks for it to be sent off. I really like the vacuum how light it is and its so easy to manover but I'm not sure if I would buy it again because of the hassle. My mom has a Kirby that's lasted 15 years I highly doubt this machine will live to see 5 at this rate. And for almost $600 I do expect higher quality. I do agree with some other reviews I also wish the cord was way longer. I guess I'm a little disappointed in it. When it works, it works great but when it doesn't its a total pain..

Bought the unit 0n 7/09 ($450) and with light use and routine filter cleaning, went in for warranty work on 7/11 and going back on 2/12 because now it stopped working after overheating and a broken plastic piece that is part of the tilting mechanism. I saw a ton of good reviews so either our bad luck or the good reviews are writen too soon after purchase. And on top of everything the warranty dealer is a 45 minute drive from our home in Miami! All I can say is that after the warranty expires, we are buying another brand and planning on spending less. This is one unit that really SUCKS and I mean that literaly.
I have heard alot about Dyson.  I have a dog and a fairly large house.  I have bought many different cleaners.  We'll see if it lives up to the hype.  The jury is still out.

This was supposed to be the end all vacuum, the one that I have been dreaming of owning for a lifetime, and it has a lot going for it.  Its easy to use, very intuitive, and really fun and maneuverable with that ball...but it does not suck!  And I mean that in a bad way, the whole stick of this vacuum is that it is 'multi-surface' but it cannot clean my carpet because there is not enough downward pressure on the front floppy end to create a good suction.  (If you have shag carpet this would be an ideal sweeper)  I used my old sweeper after I used the Dyson, and it picked up twice as much dirt.  I wish I would have spent my money on another vacuum.  I started writing this review giving it a 4star, but found out that I am still a little bit bitter about the price.  Your money will be better spent on another vac.

This is the one.  They say that you can't beat a Dyson and they are right.  The Dyson DC25 Animal Ball does exactly what you want a vacuum to do......suck.  This cleaner has it all; the latest technology, an extended hose for cleaning with attachments, and is quiter than our old vacuum.  My wife researched several brands and styles, and read many reviews.  And this is the one.  It has everything that you'll want in an upright vacuum, and is great on pet hair.  There is nothing like it.

column7: Love my vacuum, but hate the price!
column8: I had a cheapo vacuum that got good reviews from consumer reports 2 years ago.  It lasted just under two years before it died.  Fed up with vacuum's that don't seem to last very long, i opted for the Dyson DC 25 Animal.  Holy Smokes!  Hello!!!!!  Where have you been hiding all these years?  I'm in love with my vacuum.  Did i just say that?  Anyway, it's been really nice and powerful.  What I'm pulling out of my carpet is down right gross, but very nice to see that it's coming up.  My initial reaction is really positive. Easy to use and easy to maneuver  with the 'Ball Technology'.  My wife really has also been really impressed.  This one has a five year warranty, so I'm crossing my fingers that it will last.Update!  So, after some more additional research on vacuum cleaners, i did an about face.  I opted to try the Hoover T-series Windtunnel  vacuum.  In my head to head with the more than 4 times as expensive Dyson, here is what i've learned.  Both do an excellent job of cleaning, both do an excellent job of in terms of functionality. Both seem to pick up a ton of dirt.  The Hoover also offers a couple of innovation that the Dyson doesn't. The Hoover has an auto cord rewind.  That's a major plus if it can hold up over time.  The hoover also has a toe taping feature that lets you turn off the rollers while sweeping a hardwood floor. It actually sucks it up instead of flipping it all over the floor. And last of all, it was the price.  I can buy 5 Hoover vacuums for the price of one Dyson.  If my hoover breaks down, i can simply toss it and get another one.

I have owned my dyson for approx. 10months.  In this time, my dyson has broke twice.  The first was around 4 months ago when the whole head of vacuum broke.  (dyson shipped me a new head)  Second was about 2 weeks ago when the power switch got a short in it and wouldnt work, so i had to take to local repair store where they shipped away to have switch replaced.  I'm glad there is a 5 year warranty on this but I feel when you pay this much for a vacuum i shouldn't have had this much trouble with it.  I do like how well the vacuum picks up but it just doesnt seem very good quality.  I just wander when it will break again...:(.

I recently purchased this from Costco and returned it in 4 days. I tried everything I could think of to make this thing work better, but never succeeded. The suction was there if you removed the canister, but it was not there when you vacuumed. I vacuumed my whole house before I took it back and then vacuumed it again with my 8 year old Bissell. The Bissell won. I also noticed the ball collected lots of dust, which it's also not supposed to do. When I spoke to Dyson, they also agreed it was not supposed to do that and suggested I exchange the unit. This is an expensive vacuum, so someone is going to have to prove to me that it's worth the money next time around, if there is a next time.

My husband bought this for me for christmas, I've been wanting a Dyson for like 6 years now. They're just so expensive. I love this vacuum! It works great! I have a boxer-pitbull who I'm actually a little allergic to and this does a great job picking up all the dirt and hair in the carpet! It's lightweight and the handle goes down for easy storage. I like that the handle is the hose, just wish it would stretch a little further but it's not that big of a deal. Emptying the dirt from the container is easy. I'm hoping this will last many years, my friend has had her Dyson for 7 years and it still works great!

This dyson is absolutely great. I was skeptical about spending so much on a vacuum cleaner, but it is so worth it. We have a white cat and he sheds like crazy.  I was getting so frustrated with seeing cat hair even after i clean.  The only problems we had was the instruction manual. There was hardly anything to it. It came with several attachments but we have no idea what they are for. The instruction manual mentioned nothing about them. But overall the vacuum is great. Our living room rug looks brand new again.

Seller is great to work with,  super fast shipper. I love my new dyson, now i can truely have a clean apartment again. Any one that has a dog that sheds, this vacum is a must!  Would buy from this seller again!
This is an amazing vacuum.  Was able to pick up my daughters hair.....they shed like dogs.  Would definitely recommend this item to be purchased through amazon.

column7: The most powerful and agile sweeper we ever owned!
column8: We purchased one of these about 8 months ago.  It is simply the best vacuum we have ever owned.  It is an upright vacuum with more cleaning power than our other sweepers put together.  We have a sweeper on each floor of the house and none compare to this one.  It is extremely light and the roller ball makes is easy to sweep in tough areas.  For lack of a better word, it is 'agile' and easy to move around.  We don't have a pet but we purchased it for the extra cleaning power and the HEPA features.Sweep your floors three times with your old sweeper and then use this one on the same carpet.  I guarantee you that you will pick up a full container of dust, dirt and old loose carpet fibers that the old vacuum would not even pick up.  It has a HEPA filter and is certified asthma friendly and has a hygienic dust bin.  It doesn't take cleaner bags and is fairly easy to clean.  It has a set of tools on the vacuum and a telescoping wand to reach the hard spots.  It comes with a 5 year warranty and it is the best sweeper you can get.One down side is a question that my wife and I discuss, 'Does anyone who designs household appliances ever use them?'  If they did they would make the hose on the telescoping wand 12 to 18 inches longer.  It is hard to reach the high spots and when the vacuum is running the suction is so strong it wants to collapse the extension hose.  I know there is a limit but the extra length would have made it perfect to get to stair cases, ceiling fans and the tops of high windows.

I really like my dyson and I wanted one for a long time before I finally broke down and bought one.  I do love it but the few things I don't like are the canister is small and I have to empty it after each room.  Also the hose for the extendable wand tends to want to stay coiled up like it is when is it collapsed but that could be because I haven't used it much and it is still stiff and new.  It does pick up well and the ball makes it easy to manuver.  I am glad I bought it.

This is the best Vacuum cleaner I have ever purchased.I had just 2 days ago vacuumed thoroughly with my old one, this Dyson made it look like it had never been vacuumed.It picked up stuff on a rug that I would have never dreamed was there. It was easy to put together and worked flawlessly out of the box. I dont even like vacuuming , but this one is kind of fun, so Im sure my wife will like it for that alone. I dont understand why people complain about emptying the container ot the frequency of having to do it...Im just glad to get that dirt out of here. If you dont like that ...stick to a bulky bag vacuum  that blows dirty dust all over your house and empty it once a year like you always have. Ignorance can be bliss I guess. Now we will see how long it lasts. My sister and her husband have had one for 5 years and they still love it and its still going strong.I look forward to saying the same thing!!

We had the vacuum less than 3 months when we had to take it in for repair.  It took nearly 3 weeks to get the part (and we live in So California).  I expected a vacuum that costs nearly $500 to be more durable. When we first brought it home we were very pleased with the cleaning power, but were very disappointed in the need for repair so soon and how long the repair took.  We have 2 dogs and 2 little boys, so we need a quality vacuum.If you purchase this vacuum, make sure you clean the filters often -- much more than Dyson recommends.

I purchased the Dyson DC25 Animal Vacuum because I have two cats.  I can't believe how much hair it removed from my wall to wall and scatter rugs.  I had just vacuumed using my old vacuum and then used the Dyson.  Amazing results!  My rugs look fantastic.  The nap of the carpet is standing up again as if the carpet were new. This is a fabulous machine and I would highly recommend it.
An outstanding product, reliable and worth every penny.  This took dirt out a carpet that we never imagined was there.

I am very impressed with this vacuum.  Just to see how good it was, I vacuumed the room with my old Kirby and then vacuumed it again with the Dyson.  I got a full canister of dirt and animal hair with the first use.  I thought the Kirby had done a good job.  Looks like I was wrong.

column7: Eye opening vacuum! A light swingweight" vac
column8: a MUST!"
column9: Bottom Line: Dyson vacs have a light swingweight. Other vacs seem heavy when operating.I've used Hoovers growing up, one was the old school Type A bag, the other was a bagless with a cleanable filter. I was like, eh, they are vacuums, they are all the same.I worked at Best Buy in college and I was told the Dyson was the best. Well, this last weekend I needed a new vacuum because my Hoover Type A vacuum kinda pushed around dust while going over carpet. I wanted something to last a long time and the best quality, so I walked into a Dyson store.I spent about an hour test driving all the vaccums. The canister vac is harder to move with a lot of parts everywhere making little sense (although I did enjoy the automatic power cord!), the models above the DC25 are larger made for a big house, much too heavy for the 2 bedroom condo I'm at. I thought the DC25 handled the best, mostly when you need to angle back and forth. I took apart the dust carrier with ease, the filters are easy to find. There's a little work to manually wind the cord. And there's a little work to operate the extension arm for ceiling corners. But those were acceptable if the price for the machine was right.We get down to price, I'm already worried at this price point because this is 2-3 times the amount of a regular vac. I ended up buying the DC24, which saved me $50 because the only difference I can see is an additional brush extension piece made for animals. And it's an orange vac instead of a purple one. I really wanted purple but let's see if it works at home.Vacuumed a 12 by 12 bedroom. After one vac, it was already worth the price paid. Massive power with a light swingweight. The results showed up in the dust canister, the vac simply did the job better than anything I've ever seen. Simply stunning. Also takes up less space to store. WOW!

column8: We bought this vacuum because our roommate has a very sucky one. After reading the review about DC 25 we decide to give it a try based on Dyson's reputation.The package was big when it was shipped to our house. the instruction is kind of confusing when i tried to assemble the parts. Finally I figured it out and the vacuum just started to do its job: suck everything in. We did not notice there were so much dust on the floor and the vacuum checked it for us. It sucked everything in.Thank you Dyson and the best of all it came with a 5-yr warranty.

I've had my new vacuum for almost a week. So far I really like it. Dirt that was still in my carpet after vacuuming the day before filled up the cup twice. Before when I would vacuum, I would see dog hair floating in the air .. Not now. Guess you can tell that I like my new Dyson a lot. The one area where they could do better is on their attachments. A bunch came in the box with the vacuum. Some you can pretty much tell what the use is but some, it's hard to tell. For example; there is a grooming tool that comes with the animal clean up kit. It doesn't look the pet grooming tool that I can see on line ... so how do you use it? Is it also a pet grooming tool? Don't know. I emailed Dyson a day after delivery when I registered my vacuum on line. Four days later I got a response telling me to call a number for customer service and they will help. It seems that at least on the grooming tool, I should have received an answer to the question. But again, overall, I love my new Dyson!

Best vacuum I've ever owned! We have 5 dogs. This vacuum picks up dog hair, small branches, leaves and everything else they bring in. The rugs look like new again! Vacuuming is now quick and easy and I'm left with a feeling of satisfaction knowing my floors and furniture are clean. It's heavier than I'd hoped but the ease of use and great suction make up for that. It took a little playing to get it together and figure out how to work everything but once you get it, it's all worth it. Instruction book leaves a little to be desired. I like words, not just pictures. Would highly recommend this product.

This vacuum is fantastic and here are the pros and cons.Pros:1. super easy to maneuver.2. sucks dirt like crazy (strong suction power)3. easy to setup stair vacuum. Simply just pull the center column and plug the head and you are ready to go. Can be done in less than 2-3 seconds.4. Not that heavy.5. can switch to floor vacuum or carpet with a push of a button.Cons:1. Kind of expensive2. Have to clean the container every 1500- 2000 square feet (estimate) of vacuum. (it can be a pro because it suction is too strong)3. Motor (inside the ball) gets really hot if you use it for an extended period of time (30+ mins).

column7: Can keep up with a Berner
column8: Anyone who has a Bernese Mountain Dog knows they shed like heck.  I can fill the vaccum cannister with a single thorough vacuuming of the house.We are retired. Our previous vacuum was a 15-year-old 12 amp Sharp.  It was fine but too heavy and cumbersome.  This vaccum is light, has well designed attachments and the ball designs makes navigating a snap.  I can not say enough about how much easier it is to use than older unit.

Good: When I operate it, it doesn't smell like it's on fire like my old vacuum did -- it doesn't really smell like anything.  It's easy to move around, and it's fairly easy to carry up the stairs.  I don't bother sweeping my wood floor anymore, since the Dyson does a better job anyway.  When my wife's hair got wound around the brush roll on my old vacuum, it was a long process to dismantle the bottom of the machine, remove the belt, pull the roller off, and clean out the hair.  With the Dyson, the entire motor head comes off, and the brush roll can be easily removed for cleaning.  Much better.Bad: The hose is too short/tight and you feel like you're dragging the entire machine around when using it.  The setup instructions are not very clear (and I've assembled many appliances over the years).  The collection bin is not big enough, and the machine's effectiveness means you'll be emptying out the bin many times.Overall, I'm really glad I bought this.  I no longer feel like I'm taking the dust and cat dander and blowing it back into the room.  It really does solve most of the things which really irritated me about past vacuums, and seems to be built in a way that it'll survive a few years of use.

Bought new. Product works fine but didnt come with any manuals or instructions on set up and maintence. I was able to find pdfs online andwas reimbursed $11 for missing manuals. Otherwise everything else works great and was in one piece.

column7: Very unsatisfied - would never order again - stuck with it!
column8: I bought the Dyson DC25 Animal Ball Technology Upright Vaccuum Cleaner on Amazon.  The item arrived with a brocken handle.  I wrote to Amazon to find out what to do next and they said to ship it back to get a refund on my card.  I shipped it back and the item was denied when it got to the address that I was told to ship it to.  Now I am out the cost of the vacuum cleaner plus shipping and I still do not have a vacuum.  I have since gone to the store and purchased the same vacuum in person.  So now I have 2 vacuum cleaners, one that works and one that does not.  I continue to get a run around from Amazon.  I give zero out of 5 stars for no satisfaction only frustration and expense.Liam Harney

column7: Instructions are horrible, but vac is great
column8: The vaccum cleaner - once you manage to get it put together - works wonderfully.  Exactly as expected and even better, in fact.  BUT.. the instructions for putting the vaccum cleaner together are HORRIBLE.  No words - all graphics - and the graphics are rather confusing. The 'quick' instructions attached to the handle piece neglect to tell you to push the wand down into the hose.  PUSH THE WAND INTO THE HOSE.... even the instructions online on the Dyson website are so generalized they fail to include this important detail.  I am not stupid - I've got two degrees, darnit - and I've put lots of other things together with fewer instructions.  Not one of the images shows the wand inside the hose, but they all show you pushing the handle onto the wand and then the wand onto the unit.  The YouTube instructions also fail to show this part, and again, do not cover this exact model of the vaccum.  Its rather easy once you know this detail... and then removing the wand from inside the hose is also quite easy.  The attachments include a small beater for cleaning carpeted stairs - yippee!Now to the most important part:  the vaccuming.  I have six cats and a house full of carpeting, plus we use a woodstove in our carpeted family room.  I just vaccumed - it pulled out hair, dust, ashes and dirt from my carpet which had just been vaccumed yesterday with my old vac (Hoover Upright).  Empyting the canister is easy - in fact, I was expecting to empty it the 'old' way and ended up dumping all the stuff on my feet.  Duh...  you empty it over the garbage can with one hand by flicking a switch, unlike the 'old' vac canister which had to be taken apart and then turned over to empty.  Right away I was pleased by this.  I was able to vac under and around furniture that I was unable to vac around and beneath before; so its rather nice to not have to stop what I'm doing to move the coffee table, for instance, then vac, then return it.  Now I just vac.  This is too easy!I bought mine through Kohl's because I had a discount and I earned Kohl's cash ($15 for every $50 spent), which I was able to combine with other discounts later for holiday shopping.  In all, I ended up paying about $480 for this model without waiting for delivery or fighting shoppers for the few vacs on sale at other retail chains on Black Friday.

With two dogs I needed a vacuum that could get the hair out of my carpet.  The day I got my Dyson, I decided to run a test.  I vacuumed my family room with my Kirby, then with the Dyson. WOW! I couldn't believe how much hair and dirt I got out after vacuuming with the Kirby.  To be fair, my Kirby is 15 years old, but I was still very impressed.I decided on this Dyson after reading several other reviews.  I agree that you have to dump it quite a bit, but that's because it gets so much dirt and hair out.  The cord is shorter than the Kirby, so I am having to move the cord more often, but I can deal with that.  I like that it is bagless, so I don't have the smell in my closet from the bag full of stinky dog hair.  The only way to avoid that smell was to change the bag after each use, but that was wasted money.All-in-all, I am very pleased with my Dyson.

I have pet rabbits in my dining room and they eat hay. Some of the hay gets tossed around and needs to be vaccumed up.  The Dirt Devil I used to have for about 10 years worked great at cleaning up rabbit fur & hay. Alas, I don't remember what model it was.  3 Years ago I purchased this power boost that claimed 'no loss of suction'.It stinks.The power cord is at the bottom so I am always vacuming it up or tripping over it.The extension hoses have very little suction and don't work well.The machine seems lazier than I am!! It works for about 5 minutes, then needs a 2 hour break to cool off before it will go back to work for 5 more minutes.  This constant shut down really cuts into my housecleaning!Am now looking for something I am not tripping over and won't shut off until *I* shut it off.
After read through manual book, we still not sure how to use it. It stops several times when we are in the middle of cleaning so we have to let it rest for a while to continue.

I never give reviews but this vac deserves one. Hard to find in retail stores any longer I was pleased to find this model on Amazon. Smooth operation and will take it's share of abuse, which it is given at my high traffic carpeted business.

My wife and I have owned and used this vacuum for about a year.  I personally fail to see any big advantage over the old cleaners with bags.  It is very loud. It has several filters and, if not kept clean, they will over-heat the engine and the vacuum will stop running. You have to be careful emptying it or you will have a mess...I have learned to hold it into the garbage can to contain any mess.  It does have a good suction, but who cares when the brush tears everything up.  It has shredded the edge of throw rugs and runners, even rubbing the insulation thin on its own power cord when it is run over.  Sometimes I see it spitting out pieces of lint or threads back onto the carpet and I am not convinced that it always leaves the carpet cleaner than before it was used.  Sorry, but I can't wait to replace it.

column7: you get what you pay for
column8: I have read glowing reviews of this vacuum, and I've read scathing reviews. Neither is really appropriate.To the people who say it's cheap and worthless, i have to ask- what did you expect for a $100 vacuum? If you want a super great indestructible machine, why didn't you buy a Dyson or an Oreck, duh? You bought this Dirt Devil for the same reason I did, because it says it does great things for a very low price. And for the most part, it does. Granted, I haven't had any of the problems that some have written about like the thing overheating and shutting down or just plain not working anymore. These things might happen and then I will be plenty mad; but I have mostly wood floors with just a couple of deep pile area rugs, and I recommend it for people who have a similar situation. I never have the thing turned on for much more than 5 minutes at a time. And it does a superb job of sucking up cat hair and grime from those rugs. Also love the electrostatic pet brush attachment. I used to rely on an old canister vacuum and a dust buster and I can't believe how much dirt this thing picks up so quickly. Kinda grosses me out seeing how much I hadn't been getting up before.Reviewers who complain that the vacuum shoots out debris from behind: they are absolutely right.This vacuum has what is supposed to be a dial that adjusts the height for deep pile to bare floor. However, after examination it didn't take long to realize that the dial does absolutely nothing. The wheeled foot that is supposed to change the distance to the floor doesn't even come in contact with the adjustment piece. It's always at the deep pile height. This is a really stupid design flaw and I can't figure out how to correct it because the shape of the foot is designed to block contact with the adjuster. Because it's so far from the bare floor, debris can shoot out from underneath.I would like to complain about it but it seems, from the other negative reviews, that it's almost impossible to get the company to pay attention. However, the attachments have enough sucking strength that debris can be easily picked up from bare floors with them.Another problem i had was getting a replacement belt.Not being used to an upright, I didn't realize that the base keeps sucking even when the attachment hose is in use. I don't know if this is typical of uprights. Because of this I accidentally ran over a sock while I was vacuuming furniture, and it got stuck, which caused the belt to break.I did a lot of research to try to figure out what the replacement needed to be. It's listed as Style 23 on the vacuum, which didn't correspond with the style (20)indicated on the broken belt, on Amazon they didn't even OFFER one, and the Dirt Devil website had a parts link that offered two other completely different choices, one of which was Hoover. Of course, of the many many different sizes of belts that Dirt Devil sells thru retailers, none of them were the right one in any of the stores I visited. I wrote to the company and they gave me the same stupid link to the two choices that were not either belts style 23 or 20. I had to go to a local vacuum retailer, who looked up the part online and figured out which Hoover belt it corresponded to (I didn't know Dirt Devil is a Hoover product line) bless him, I would never have figured it out without his expertise-- and his complete supply of vacuum parts. I'm sure he was wondering why I would buy a piece of junk instead of one of his very nice $600 machines with unbreakable metal components. I certainly would, if I could afford it; but I can't. So, at least for a couple of years (fingers crossed) I will get by with my adequate Dirt Devil.I don't expect it to be perfect. I expect better customer service and parts availability (and they could improve the included manual, as far as description of parts and repairs) but the machine itself is totally fine for a $100 vacuum.You absolutely get what you pay for.UPDATE:  I forgot to mention that I was confused by other reviews that said this thing was light and practically moves itself. This vacuum is pretty heavy and awkward-- and I'm not a weakling. It's a hassle to drag it upstairs, and moving it around to use the wand tools is a workout. Even so--- great suction, both on the rug and with the tools. If you have any mobility challenges I wouldn't recommend it, but I've used other more expensive uprights that were just as cumbersome.... and it's definitely better than lightweight low suction machines.
Saying that for anything other than a vacuum is probably bad but this thing sucks.  It works awesome for pet hair.  It is very light wieght.
It works alright but a little disappointed in the suction power.  Had to go over everything a couple of times.

When it works, it works very well, but you can't depend on it.  Suction is great but the vacumn stops suddenly when it overheats and takes a good 15 minutes to cool down (faster if you live in Chicago and put it on the back porch on a 38 degree day!).  If I had it to do over again, I would probably not buy this product.
This is an excellent vacuum for a great price.  I've had mine for over a month now and I love it!

This is the 2nd one I have purchased!  I have 3 cats so I vacuum almost every day!  It is amazing how much hair this product will pick up!  It handles well, is lightweight and easy to empty.  I love it!  Would recommend for anyone who has pets!

My wife and I have 2 dogs and we never could find a vacuum that worked well and sucked all the hair off the carpet so we went all out and paid around $400 for a Dyson. It's not my favorite way to spend that much money but the sucking power of the Dyson didn't disappoint and it cleaned all of the carpets and got the pet hair off without having to constantly make multiple passes with it.
