The only problems with the Dyson are it costs a lot and every once in a while there's this horrible gear crunching noise which the instructions say is part of a belt safety mechanism to protect the belt from getting broken. Only problem is it happens every time we use it.So when I had the opportunity to try this vacuum out I jumped. And let me tell you this thing is just as good as the Dyson.Cons: (-1 star)-The cord on this is not as long as the Dyson, I found I had to unplug and re-plug it twice to get my entire living room carpet cleaned. With the Dyson it's a long cord so I didn't have to ever do this.-Emptying the clear bin on the Dyson is as simple as a button on top and the spring loaded so it pops open, on the Dirt Devil it isn't difficult but it's not as easy. But for a savings of $300 I'm not really complaining that much.-Vacuum hose has to be connected to a plug on the base when used as an upright, in my initial tests the hose popped off multiple times. Finally after getting it pushed in with some force it stayed. It could just be it's new and the fit wasn't right yet but I didn't expect this type of problem to happen.Pros: (+4 stars)-head light, I know who would have thought? My Dyson doesn't have any lights on it, this one does and oddly I must admit that extra light does help.-High suction, easily picked up the pet hair and since my wife decorated the house for fall there were little decorative berry things that fell on the floor that were trash and it sucked those up too on the first pass.-Filters, I like that this has washable filters.-Assembly couldn't be easier. Literally unscrew 2 screws on the upright part (obvious which ones), take the top part of the handle and put it where the screws were at and put the screws back. That's it!Overall I really liked this vacuum. It easily matched the power of the Dyson I have and frankly at the low cost I was surprised at how effective this vacuum is. Great for pet owners, high power and easy to clean.Good job to Dirt Devil on this one.

column7: Picks Up Cat Litter, Pet Hair, & More
column8: In our home we have 2 indoor cats and a Chihuahua. Right  now all three are shedding a lot right  now, so there is a lot of pet hair on the floor, rugs, carpet, and  furniture. I vacuum my house 5-7 days a week (and the off days I let the iRobot clean up) depending what I have going on. I used the Dirt Devil Power Reach Multi Cyclonic Pet vacuum and it sucked up (in one pass) the random kitty litter that somehow ends up in practically every room of the house- where my previous vacuums would just blow it around and maybe pick up half after a couple passes. Also, picked up a lot of pet hair, I  could not believe how much dirt, hair,ect that was in the canister. I vacuumed the rooms yesterday afternoon and I would never have realized how much was actually left behind!This vacuum has powerful suction and sucks up everything in its way!I absolutely love the Turbo Tool, that worked great on my sofa, loveseat and chairs, cleaned up the pet hair and the furniture does not have a layer of pet hair!The cord is fairly long, but I would prefer a little longer cord and a longer hose possibly (not much longer) for using the attachments.This is going to be replacing my Bissel vacuum!

column10: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo3Q1R4SNG909HUpreplayImageId" />

column8: BottomLeft
column13: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo3Q1R4SNG909HUpreplayImageId" />

column8: although vacuum has very good suction when you want to empty the canister twisting off the lid to the canister from the canister itself is a chore. It is held in place by a cheap plastic 'tab' this fits into a slot in the canister. on my second emptying the tab broke off and now the lid doesnt fit properly and it needs to be replaced. Beware!! Try out removing and reapplying lid in a store before buying online. Otherwise a good vacuum.

column7: Try to get parts for this Vac
column8: Just bought the UD70095 Vac. Tried to locate filters for it, no luck. Called Royal Appliance, no luck. What gives???

Let me just say that this vacuum is absolutely amazing! My husband picked it out online sunday night for me and it got delivered today as I was on my way out the door and as soon as I got back home I ripped that baby open. Easy assembly, only two screws for the handle. Plugged her in and fired her up. Now I vacuumed yesterday with the only vacuum I had left (Hoover circa 1965 that had belonged to my grandmother), as I had blown up a $150 Bissell a few months back. The sad thing is, the antique Hoover picks up probably a tad bit more then the 5 year old Bissell. I knew that this new Dirt Devil would be picking up some of what the Hoover had left behind, but I was truly amazed. I filled up the canister with just my living room, which is 12x17. I have two short haired dogs, so I frequently use the Carpet Fresh that helps to release dog hair from carpet. The canister had about 1.5 inches of Carpet Fresh in it, and then there was about a 4 inch pile of dog hair all the way around. I just vacuumed yesterday, mind you. I was so excited, I felt like a 7 year old on Christmas morning. I was also truly disgusted at how much the old vacuums had left behind. My carpet was actually about 3 shades brighter then it was this morning, and it was night time! I can not believe the suction that this vacuum has, and it is fairly quiet for a 12 amp motor. With only a budget of around $100, I was not expecting much, but I feel like I bought one worth a $1000. It seems sturdier then most vacuums, even ones that cost 5 times as much. I sold large and small appliances at a major chain store before for two years, and this tops anything we had on the shelf. It comes with all of the attachments, has a cord long enough for two rooms, and switches carpet height easily. There is a light on the front, the filters are easily accessed (and washable!), and it even seems to be self propelled (don't know if that is listed as a feature). The only thing that I would have liked more was a longer hose, but the way it is will work. Small thing to live with, considering how wonderful the rest is. It cleaned my couches beautifully. At one point I even lost the non-powered attachment in between the cushions because there was so much suction! I could not recommmend a better vacuum. My mom is going to be jealous; she bought a $200 Hoover last year for pet hair, and it doesn't perform half as well as this $100 Dirt Devil!

I don't think I've ever written a review for a product before, but I feel this baby truly deserves some recognition!  I am so amazed at how well this vaccuum does its job!  I thought you had to pay a lot of money to get a good vaccuum, you know, one that really works, so I went and bought a Dyson DC-25 Animal to see what it could do.  I don't own any pets, but I thought that a vaccuum designed to pick up even all the pet hair in a house would be the best, and I'd heard all the hype about Dyson and how it's supposed to be so great.  Then I brought it home, tried it out and thought, 'really?  this is supposed to be worth slmost $600?'  I could not justify all that money for something that seemed to work no better than all the others I'd had before, so I took it back, disappointed.  I decided to buy this dirt devil instead for less than a fifth the price based off reviews here, and man am I glad I did!!  I tried it out as soon as it arrived and it sucked up stuff even the Dyson had missed - I mean a lot of stuff!  This vaccuum is awesome.  Even better than the Dyson and so much cheaper, it's a no-brainer.  Plus it's still bagless, has a hepa filter, and all the attachments you need.  The only thing I don't like is one of the attachments always seems to fall off when I'm really getting into it going under the table or around other furniture, but I can totally live with that.  Buy this thing and be happy!!  Or get the Dyson so you can tell all your friends what a dum-dum you are for spending so much money on a so-so vaccuum.

Boy, this vacuum really SUCKS...in a good way!!  Lots of power in a lightweight vacuum, but beware, if you suck up the corner of the rug it will not automatically shutoff. Instead it will continue to try to suck up the rug, begin to smoke, and the vacuum belt will eventually snap (speaking from personal experience).  Still love the convenience of the onboard attachments and lightweight mobility.

column7: Wost Vacuum ever! Blows dust around.
column8: I wanted a vacuum with a brush for pet hair.  I had had a Dirt Devil previously and wanted another. I cannot wait to return this.  I have never had to chase dust balls, hair, etc. with a vacuum. I would literally roll over the stuff and it would shoot more out from behind it!  I even took it apart to make sure nothing had come loose. Tried it again, and it still shot the dust, hair, etc. out from under it. I will never own another Dirt Devil product.
This vaccum works great, lightweight and easy to use. I would reccomend this product to every one. Love the washable filters.

I wish I could return this vacuum everyday.  I purchased the vacuum earlier this year after renovating my condo.  This is after having my last vac for probably 8 years.  I could not wait to get a new vacuum.  Well, it stinks!!!!! I have to strategically vacuum the house because it will overheat after one room.  It especially does this when I use the hand tools.  Unfortunately I would have tried sending the darn thing back but threw the box away.  I would not recommend buying this vacuum. You will be disappointed!

With the two wind turbines as well as the 3 filter systems, this is a perfectly great vacuum!When you turn it on and begin to vacuum, it has the feeling of a self-propelled vacuum, no difficult pushing and pulling.  Also, it is much quieter than our previous vacuum.  We have two cats and a dog, no more pet hair with the Dirt Devil!  The ONLY thing I wish it had was a second extension wand so that it can stretch on stairs without straining.  Other than that, I give this vacuum a 4 stars...
The motor burned out after just a few months of moderate use! It made a horrible death cry just before the suction stopped. Yet another crappy vacuum.

I had a Dirt Devil vacuum for over 20 years (it was a canister type) and it finally gave up so I got another (this time an upright) on Amazon. First the good - it sucks really good, the cord is the right lenght, the price was good and no shipping added. It is also easy to empty and to clean inside.  But, when I started using it I noticed that it was quite noisy comparing to others. When using the side hose the main part of the vacuum wibbles and is ready to fall constantly, because the hose is short and stiff and it is hard to reach with it anywhere without tipping the rest of it over.  But the kicker is that the darn thing shuts itself off whenever it pleases and then the troubleshooting guide tells you to wait a half an hour to be able to use it again. What's up with that? Now the thing dictates when it will start or not? I have never seen it or experienced it with other vacuums I was using before.  So if you have a light cleaning for a short period of time then you should be happy with it. If you have a heavy duty tasks for the vacuum try something different. This one is like a moody princess and does not want to work very hard. At least not in my house mind you.

This product came in a broken, taped up box, and was obviously refurbished.  The hose attachment does not sit well on the base and keeps falling off.  The wheel is also loose and falls off often.  Extremely disappointed.  I have ordered a ton of things off Amazon, and this was the first time I had a bad experience.

This vacuum is absolutely horrible.  I bought it a Walmart thinking it seemed like a great option.  It worked well for about 6 months.  Then we noticed that it wasn't picking up as well.  It progressively got worse.  We broke it down as much as possible to see if there was maybe something clogging the hose.  Absolutely nothing there. We figured the seal around the canister where it opens just wasnt sealing completely. From constantly emptying it to make sure it wasn't getting too full, the hinge to the canister weakened and eventually broke off on one side. The kicker? The hose still gets plenty of suction, it's the only part of the vacuum that is still useable.  I won't ever buy a Dirt Devil again.  We bought it to replace a $35 Eureka that was well over 10 years old.  I'm going back to that brand.  6 months is a joke.

column7: Dirt Devil UD70095 Power Reach Multi Cyclonic Pet Bagless Upright
column8: I am really enjoying the Dirt Devil UD70095 Power Reach Multi Cyclonic Pet Bagless Upright unit. I had a Dirt Devil prior to buying this one. It is light-weight, agile to move around, and the 'Pet' Version is great for my apartment. (I don't have pets) Quite remarkable suction, for a smaller vaccuum. I have no complaints what-so-ever about this product. If you are seeking an affordable, reliable, agile, great suction vaccuum, then I definitely would recommend this one.

column7: It's never quit sucking up dirt and hair...
column8: After reading the reviews on this vacuum cleaner, I decided to buy it. I've got a very full-of-fur Huskie and a short haired Jack Russell. Needless to say, there's a whole bunch of fur everywhere. This vacuum cleaner takes care of the job. I might have to empty the bagless compartment more, but it never stops losing suction even when it's full.I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 for two reasons: One is the small take-up compartment for the dirt and hair. The other is the cheap feeling plastic parts it's made of. So far, though, those plastic parts are doing just fine. I would recommend this vacuum cleaner to anyone.

column7: Decent suction, the rest needs work.
column8: I should have paid attention to the reviews that talked about emptying the canister; it is very easy to pick up the canister off the vacuum and carry that out.  HOWEVER, the button to open the canister is on the bottom, with a teeny little clip.  Therefore, you get a mess when you open it because your hand is right there.  Dust and hair and fur-- everywhere.  The suction is decent, though it takes many passes to get the floor very clean.The pet brush stopped working after the second time we used it.  Every time we use it, fur (for which it's made!) clogs up the gears so we have to take it apart and get it started again.  This is easy to do but a total hassle.This isn't the greatest, nor the worst vacuum we've ever had.  It will last me long enough to save up for a Dyson.  :(

This product only lasted me 10 months.  Hose clogged often, suction is good but hose is not.  Item just broke today.  Motor or something went.  Won't even turn on.  I've taken care of this product cleaned filter, unclogged hose, emptied when needed.  Removable chamber is difficult to clean and remove hair.  Spent more time cleaning vacuum than it takes to use it.

I am really happy with my Dirt Devil and  with the results I get from using it on the hard wood floors and carpet. It's easy to clean and not having to change bags all the time is really handy and  a lot cheaper. I would recommend it to people that want the best for their money. The price was a lot lower than the expensive ones that didn't do any better cleaning than the Dirt Devil.

column7: Dirt Devil UD70095 Power Reach Multi Cyclonic Pet Bagless Upright
column8: So far so good. After 12 years we had to throw away our old Dirt Devil Cyclonic Upright. It sucked like nobody's business. But it was heavy, noisy & clunky. We have a menagerie of animals in the house so we needed one that would get all the hair. It does, and is light weight & quieter than my older version. Only complaint is the attachments fall out their holders. Other than that it should last a few years & my dogs & cats aren't as afraid of it as the louder version. Within seconds it fills up with mostly hair. But as we keep using it I imagine it will be less. We still have an older Hoover back-up, but our house is big & we love our rescued pets so we keep them in much as possible to keep them safe. Good price, free shipping. I'm tempted to buy a cheaper Dirt Devil as a 2nd back up your prices are really good. This one was the more expensive. But you have them in the $45 to $60 range with free shipping. Excellent value, will keep a couple on my wish list.

column7: not up to Dirt Devil products
column8: poorly constructed the dog power brush wouldnt work low volume of air. called customer service and spoke to a nice young man who knew nothing about the product. he told me to take it to a local service man for a product i just received. The last Dirt Devil product i ever purchase. Very pleased I purchased the Dirt Devil form Amazon. The return was fast and easy.

Make sure you hook up the black hose to the bottom floor nozzle or it WILL spit debris everywhere when you try to vacuum uncarpeted floors.  Hook it up properly and it works just fine!!It's heavy and feels well made; it doesn't tip over when using attachments to reach around furniture.  It vacuums well and is relatively quiet -  two things that are really the most important.  The price is a good value.The hose is a little short and the wire could use another couple of feet, but it's adequate.  Switching the hose into and out of the base of the unit eventually loosens the join so you will need to find a way to keep it from constantly falling out which is an annoyance.The switch is in an awkward spot and for someone with a big foot, boots, or deep shoe, it will be a problem to squeeze your foot into the space to turn it on.I'm mostly happy with this purchase and will update this review when we determine how long it lasts.

column7: Works great if it didn't overheat and shut off
column8: Manufacturer: Royal Appliance.Product Name: Dirt Devil Power Reach Cyclonic Pet bagless upright.Model Number: UD70095.Reviewed by an engineer/husband that likes to help around the house.Purchased from Ace Hardware store five months ago for $90.Pros:- Floor suction is very strong and does a really good job with medium nap carpet.- Hose suction is also very strong.- Great at cleaning dog hair.- Switching from floor sweeping mode to hose and back again is fairly easy.- Hose extends out to 7 feet (8 feet if forced) and the extension tube attachment is another 18'.  So you can reach most locations.- Canister is easy to remove and re-install.- Canister is easy to open and debris is easy to dump out.- Primary filter is fairly easy to clean.- HEPA filter seems to function well.  There is no 'vacuum' smell when operating.- Unit is fairly light and easy to maneuver.- Electrical cord stowing is the basic wrap around two arms.  Contains the cord well and does not slip off until arm is rotated.  Has plenty of room for the cord to wrap.- Other than the overheating/shutoff problem (see Cons below), the product seems fairly well and ruggedly designed for its price.Cons:- Thermodynamically under-engineered.  Motor overheats and the thermal shutoff switches shut off the vacuum consistently at between 7 to 8 minutes.  Have to allow to cool for 15 to 20 minutes before unit will operate again.  Has been doing this since Day 1.  Cleaning the primary filter does not help.  Even does this with cleaned and thoroughly dried primary filter and with the HEPA filter removed.  Noticed that other reviews regarding this vacuum are complaining about the same problem.  Taking the head apart and getting into, found that the engineers designed in the motor without much thought of conducting the heat off of it - no heat sinks.  The motor is just surrounded by plastic mounts.  So the heat is isolated and builds up until the thermal shutoff switches shut the power off to the motor.  I think the engineers realized this problem too late into the design process.  Fixing the problem would have involved a whole backup and re-design and would have probably taken too much money.  So instead the manufacturer places a big sticker on the back of the vacuum stating 'Do not return to store.  Contact us for questions'.  Will give a summary of how this goes when we call them, to see if they are going to give us the run-around.- Electrical cord is only 22 feet long and requires switching to different electrical outlets a little more often than desired.- Forward light is really dim and fairly useless.  Not a big deal for most uses.Summary:If it wasn't for the unit overheating and shutting off so quickly, this vacuum would be a great value.  But because the overheating problem renders the unit utterly useless I'm giving it a rating of 1 out of 5.I'll let you know how the customer service goes, and if a replacement vacuum solves the problem (if that even happens).

Content revised by user. Overheating issue was a simple clear piece of plastic that covered the air intake by static electricity. Not the Products fault.This vacuum cleaner works like a dream. Simple to use and easy to empty.

column7: one of the best i have purchased
column8: I did quite a bit of shopping before i purchased a vaccumn. This thing had great suction as in leaving brush paths on the carpet after shampooiong. I have closed loop carpet and this is quite a feat.  Features are excellent to include the pet tool. Considering the price this product is unsurpasssed.  Features are nice, and all atachments and canister are easy to use.  I have nothad it long enough to see determine the durabilty, but in event it did go out in a couple of yeers, I would turn around and buy another. The only  small downfall was the short power cord.

This vacuum works great! I love the pet hair attachment! It takes the cat hair right off the furniture, which my old vacuum wouldn't even touch. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the way it picks up. The only thing I don't like is that the canister fills up very quickly and is messy to empty. It has a ledge inside that tends to trap the dirt and I have to use a stick to pull all the dirt out.

column7: The (Dirt) Devil is in the Details....
column8: Have had this vacuum for several weeks.  It replaced a Bissel that worked pretty well, but disintegrated after a couple of years.  The highs and lows include:Highs* Good price/value* Good suction (probably not as good as the Bissel it replaced however)* Relatively quiet for a vacuum in this price range* 12 AMP motor* Good at picking-up pet hair* Relatively light considering its size* All the right attachments (power brush, brush....)* Consumer Reports says that Dirt Devil vacs are among the most reliableLows* Emptying dirt the 'suggested' way by opening the bottom of the canister is a nuisance; it is much easier to empty from the top rather than using the bottom opening* The power cord says that it is 25 feet - it seems shorter* The hose assembly is a bit on the short side* To make the vacuum lighter it seems like they skimped a bit on the overall quality - hopefully it holds up over the long-run* The accessory brush falls out the holder when the vacuum is in useIt seems to work, it hasn't died yet and there is dust in the canister after I vacuum - all good things.

Easy to put together,it's not my first.As with the last one these are most suction for the money. I read the reviews about this model and could disagree more about cords,auto height adjustments and all that crap,if you are so lazy that you can't bend over to plug in the cord,roll it up or adjust the height to match your carpet then maybe spend $4-600 more and get those things that make your life worth living the rest of us who can bend over and will be glad they save the cash on another great product that exceeds the basic need of getting rid of pet hair with plenty of power to spare. I know my house is cleaner because the A.C. filters are cleaner.Less dust and hair about the house,my dog of choice Ace,a German Shepherd who needs brushing everyday.I can pull my carpets back and see that the dirt has been removed,that fine dirt under the carpets,if you have throw rugs or carpets know what I am talking about. I have a Hoover that I hated to empty gave it away.$500.00 it did all that didn't match the suction of the Devil. I had a Dirt Devil feather lite died of abuse of being thrown in the closet  and finally broke so I can tell you Dirt Devil makes some tuff stuff cause it took about 10 years to finally break a wheel off.The motor is fine and still works great just a broken wheel. Truth is I really wanted a new one. I waited 6 months of use before review.

We purchased this machine in March.  The suction tube has never worked well.  A month or so into having the machine the suction stopped working and the small brush attached to the suction tube ceased to work at all.  Our return window has expired with Amazon and Dirt Devil says they can not fix the 'way in which the machine operates.'  I would strongly advise spending a little more money and getting a better machine.

column7: Do not look any further, this is THE vacuum!!
column8: Let me start by saying: this is the best vacuum I have ever had!! I have bought so many different vacuums (Name it, I bought it!) such as: Dyson DC41, DC25 Animal, Eureka, Bissel, Hoover.... and NONE of THEM Matched this Dirt Devil. Yes believe it or not, even the Dysons were not close to it. And for the price of the Dirt Devil, I rather save $300 and get a better product!!So far, the Dirt Devil has been working great and no problem at all. The only complaint I have is the length of the nose when vacuuming the stairs. The weight of the vacuum is not bad at all either.I will update my review if any problem arises, but I trust Dirt Devil's product! I own another Dirt Devil vacuum which I only used for my bare floors and it is still 'sucking' as much for the past 4 years!The other vacuums I bought from different brands always end up beeing replaced because of poor quality, so after extensive research, trials, and MANY trips to the store exchanging vacuums left and right, I had to go with a trusted brand: this dirt devil! and I do not regret!!!

column7: The BEST vac for the money!
column8: I have had this vac for 5 months and it still amazes me what it picks up.  I bought this to use upstairs so I wouldn't be lugging our Kirby up and down.  I was shocked what this baby picked up after using the Kirby over the rugs and then going over them with this vac.  Hands down the dirt devil beat my Kirby 10 times over.The cord could be longer and the power button could be in a different place, but other than that, I find nothing wrong with  this vac.  The pet brush attachment is great and I no longer have to worry about having dog hair on my clothing from our minature american eskimo.All in all, this machine is lightweight, does what it's supposed to and for the money I can afford to buy another one for the downstairs as opposed to what I spent on my Kirby 10 years ago. (have been using the kirby to clean out vehicles now, what a waste of money!) Just very happy to find a product that is a great value for the money.

When we bought the house some 11 years ago and at that time we purchased a Hoover Wind Tunnel vacuum cleaner that has served us well, but is starting to get a little long in the tooth, and has been retired upstairs where the work load is not that taxing.  So we started looking for a relatively in-expensive replacement, a machine that shipped with a tool to remove cat hairs.  I like Hoover, but my research led me to that Dirt Devil, specifically the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum ($121.36 at Amazon.com).In The Boxo Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuumo Attachment Toolso Instruction Bookleto Quick-start guideThe 'Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum' comes fully assembled complete with various cleaning attachments and tools, except for the handle which is attached via two screws.  I had the vacuum out of the box and sucking carpet in under 10 minutes.  The only other assembly required is to make sure the hose is inserted securely into the base of the vacuum.  The vacuum cleaner ships with three attachments/tools: electrostatic (pet) dusting brush, electrostatic turbo tool, and a 12' crevice tool, all of which can be attached to the hose by a 16' extender wand.  All of the attachments are stored in various places on the vacuum.  The handle does not fold down, but storing the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum in tight spaces has not proved problematic.UseThe Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum features a standard 12 Amp motor that is quieter that vacuums we have used in the past, but still noisy enough that watching television while vacuuming is impossible.  The vacuum has a 12' cleaning reach and 14' wide cleaning path, so vacuuming under end tables is not an issue.The Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum is not self-propelled, but the unit is so lightweight it feels as though it is.  The vacuum glides over the carpet with a minimum of effort while cleaning the carper effortlessly, something my wife likes because she has limited mobility.  The dust and dirt is sucked into the multi-stage cyclonic filtration system that features multiple chambers of filtration; said canister includes a rinsable HEPA filter.Cleaning the canister should be done with the utmost care however; the lack of a bag has its drawbacks.  The dust in the canister is very fine and has a habit of getting everywhere if one is not careful, despite that fact that dirt is emptied from the bottom of the dirt canister.  My advice empty the easy to remove canister out in the garage or back porch; anywhere but in the house where the fine dust can leave a grey coating everywhere.The extra-long hose when used with the 16' extender wand and 12' crevice tool extend the reach of the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum some 11 feet making stair cleaning so much more easier than before.  And because the unit is so light, it is not hard for my wife to pick up the unit and move it up a stair or two if need be.I love the air-powered electrostatic (pet) dusting brush; it removes cat hairs with ease.  Just attach the tool and the built-in brushes do their job well. Like most vacuum cleaners in this price range the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum features a 5-position multi-height adjustment knob for multiple floor/carpet use.  The knobs on our past vacuums have proved problematic; not so on this unit, the plastic knob turns with ease.ConclusionChecking in at just under $125.00 I feel as though we purchased a quality product in the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum.  In fact we like the vacuum so much we purchased another unit for upstairs!  Not a big, heavy and cumbersome as the Wind Tunnel is replaced the Dirt Devil UD70095 Bagless Upright Vacuum has proved itself to be the perfect little vacuum for our modest floor space.

The vacuum worked great for the first 2 months and then we began having less and less suction power.  It is currently at the warrantee shop.  They expect to have it fixed or a new one sent to us within the month.  I can say that when it was working, it was wonderful!!!  The carpets had never been so clean!

If this were a perfect world, I'd tell everyone to drop $500+ on a Dyson or a Miele. These brands are the Cadillacs of vacuums. The Dirt Devil is a Ford........relatively inexpensive but performs well and has nice features. Coming from someone who is clean obsessed, that's a good recommendation just for starters.The Dirt Devil has a long cord which eliminates the need to continually replug the vac from room to room. It had a long hose, a cylinder which opens to release the accumulated dirt (no bags), an effective filter that blocks out pollen and pet dander, an attachment to vacuum upholstery, and a 12 amp motor that is robust.I bought this for my son who is allergic to everything and whose allergies really act up during the growing season. He gave it the greatest compliment he could 'it really sucks up dirt and I'm not sneezing and whizzing when I'm home'.My son doesn't have pets, but I bought this because it had good filtration. It seems to be doing a good job and I was thrilled that it was reasonably priced.

Excellent suction at first but filled up extremely quickly. After a couple of months needed to be cleaned each time used. By 8 months just stopped working - no smoke or squeaking - just stopped. Started again if left alone for a while, then stopped again after a few minutes. Continued like that until I lost patience. I've been lucky with vacuums before but do not recommend this one.

I bought this vacuum after my Dyson died after only 4 years.  It has more suction power than the Dyson for a third of the cost. It also has the best working handheld brush I have used.  I'm actually planning to buy another one for our second floor, since I can actually buy three of these things compared with my old Dyson.

column7: More false advertising, STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!!
column8: I've had this thing for less than two full months and it is already completely run down! My house is almost completely hardwood floors with the exception of only 3 area rugs! I only used this vacuum to clean these rugs and used the included Pet Brush to vacuum the sofa and bed spread of our dog's hair. I would empty the container after I would finish with EACH rug every time! I also would actually open up the pet brush after every use to clean it thoroughly which seemed to work perfectly the first week or two. But here I am less than two months in of owning this falsely advertised piece of junk and the Pet Brush is completely broken for no apparent reason (the wheels just do not turn any more no matter how clean it is) and the vacuum itself blows it's power within 5 minutes of use every time rendering it completely useless for a good 12 hours! So, unless you enjoy vacuuming in 5 minute increments at a time every 12 hours, PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT IF YOU PLAN TO USE IT!! I Cannot stress enough how well I cared for this product and it just did not deliver as advertised!

I read a lot of reviews, did a lot of comparison shopping, and ultimately decided this was the best vacuum for the money. I am SO happy with my purchase! I have a shedding dog and a shedding cat...and a 3 year old toddler who sheds everything as well. The first run with this vacuum I was AMAZED at everything it picked up. I consider myself a neat freak, and I cannot believe there was so much crap in my carpets! The pet hair attachment works amazingly on my couches too. I will update my review as more time goes on, but for now, I have zero complaints.

I purchased this vaccum after my old one died. This is a really good vaccum. Makes lesser noise than the old one for sure. I know that because my neighbor told me so. :-)It was really easy to assemble, just two screws and you are done. Container is easy to remove and put back in. It has HEPA filter which is good, you can clean and reuse it.I would surely recommend this item to my friends.

I could not believe how much this vacuum pulled out of my carpet the first time I used it.  It continued to pull tons of pet hair, soil and carpet fresh cleaner out each and every time I vacuumed.  About caught up now and the carpet looks (and actually feels) better than it has in a long time.  I highly recommend.  There are a few minor design items I'd like improved on - they've all been touched on in other reviews:Cord is kind of shortCord keeper requires lots of loops, they could have put the spots that you wrap it around further apartHeadlight doesn't do much at allOn/off switch is a bit hard to get used toBut it does what a vacuum should do best - cleans the carpet well.It is easy to empty, hair doesn't get stuck up in the canisterRoller brushes don't get 'strangled' by my Golden Retriever's hairI don't think it's too heavy - If you have to carry it, use the canister handle - It's balanced well and is much easier to handle than if carrying from the topI love it (if you can truly love a vacuum).

After reading other reviews on this vacuum,I bought one for myself.  Several years ago I paid ALOT of money for the Dyson Animal.  We had a dog and 2 cats.  The last couple of years I have not been happy with my Dyson but really didn't know what else to buy.  This is way better than my Dyson and much,much cheaper.  We have 4 cats plus a dog plus 2 young adults still at home.  I could not believe the dirt it picked up.  The only compliant I have is the hose is just way too short!!!  The long cord is nice,love the brush for pet hair,it has done wonders on my furniture and a kitchen rug.  But I cannot even get all the way up my steps to our upstairs due to the short hose.  This is the reason for 4 stars vs. 5.  I am just not sure why they skimped on the hose length.

column7: a step backwards for Dirt Devil
column8: Our previous Dirt Devil, which we loved, stopped working after 5 years. We replaced it with this vacuum and have been very disappointed. It lacks two features that made the previous unit much easier to use:(1) The cord doesn't automatically retract. You need to manually wind it up after each use.(2) The vacuum doesn't automatically adjust its height. If you have carpets of varying thickness and/or bare floors, you'll need to keep re-adjusting the vacuum height.Neither of these is a deal breaker. But this vacuum is also much less effective than our old one at picking up dirt and fur. When I empty this vacuum after going through a room, there's less collected dirt than there was with our old vacuum. This is unacceptable given how expensive this vacuum is. It's also a puzzle, since Dirt Devil had apparently solved all of these problems in their previous product (which wasn't more expensive).We'll be buying a different brand next time.

I cannot believe how fantastic this vacuum is.  Silly me bought a white rug years ago and three former expensive vacuums could pick up the small threads  and bitty piece of dirt.  This vacuum makes this rug look almost new.  I'm used to cannister vacuums, so it will take getting used to.  The on buttom is in a weird spot and I wish the hose could stretch when the attachments are on, but it's worth the trouble.  Amazing!

This vacuum has made my life awesome. Two dogs and a cat later...the attachments .are super helpful. Pet brush works really well, I can get up, under, and around furniture. Empties super easily....over a year later I am MORE than pleased with my $100 vacuum.

During assembly, I noticed how very cheaply made this thing is. Very thin plastics. This thing won't last you very long.  I spent $40 less on my 9 year old Dirt Devil and it was FAR better quality and much more substantial machine. First off, to be fair, I will say this unit was defective.  After two minutes use, it made a horrible whining noise.  I shut it off, restarted and it was fine for about one minute and started doing it again. While attempting to diagnose it, I noticed the brush head was tangled with cat hair after the first few minutes. This would explain why it wasn't picking up all of the debris in my home. It should be sucked into machine and not just twirled around the chintzy roller brush like spaghetti! This never happened on my old one. It also makes little balls out of cat hair and deposits them around the house, rather than sucking them up.  My house is small and extremely clean.  If this vacuum can't handle it, then what a shame! Also, the hose keeps coming unattached while in use.  The tools constantly fall off.  SO annoying.  The wheels are so cheap and don't roll nicely. No way will they last long.  When you empty the dirt container, it leaks out of the bottom, all over the floor and vacuum. I'm so disappointed that Dirt Devil has lowered their standards.  I assumed this would be a nice quality machine like my old one. On a side note, I may have received a previously returned vacuum.  The packing looked 'repackaged' and it seemed the machine was a little dusty. I will spend more $$ and get a better machine.  Back to researching....GRRR!

After reading the reviews, we thought this would be a great vacuum. We had a dirt devil upright for over 10 years that was great. It recently gave out on us so we looked to replace it with another dirt devil.  First, it has very little suction. When we tried it on our hardwood floors, we had to go over areas several time to get the dirt up. We used the hose with the attachment to vacuum around our windows and it would not even suck up the dust and dog hair off the window ledge.  The power cord significantly shorter than previous models. The quality of the materials used to construct it were poor and cheaply made. It was cheap plastic with no substance.  Our previous model was a lot more substantial. Yes it was lighter, but I would rather have the weight and have a product that is well made than something lighter not well made.  It was also a lot smaller in size so we had to empty the container more often. I requested the return label before my husband even finished vacuuming our first floor. We did not even bother trying it on the rest of the house. It went right back in the box and we returned it.  We are still waiting for the return credit to be issued from Amazon. So far we have been pleased with Amazon's service and ease of returning this product pending receipt of our money back.  Not sure which vacuum we will purchase.

I needed a new vacuum and did not want to spend the price on a dyson. I really rely on the reviews on amazon and bought one of these after reading such good reviews. Well,  I can attest that the reviews were not exaggerated, their little vacuum cleaner is the best I have ever used. I have not livid here for very long, have two small short haired dogs and do not wear my shoes on the carpet. so I figured that there would not be much to vacuum up, but it was so surprising to see the amount of dust and debris in the collection container after just one pass with the dirt devil. It was so quiet too, I was able to hear the television over the quiet noise made by the vacuum, and the bag less system is wonderfully convenient. I am allergic to dust and I thin this is the perfect cleaner for vacuuming up every little bit of dust and dog hair, plus it is very easy to empty the dust container.You will not be disappointed in this purchase. It is great!!!

column7: First impressions of the Dirt Devil UD70095
column8: Based on first impressions:Pros:--It's red.--It is not unreasonably loud.--The suction seems very strong.--Only two screws to attach the handle and you are up and running.--Filters are washable.Cons:--The headlight is uselessly dim.--Rubber-bristled dusting brush is awful on hard surfaces because it seems sticky, does not glide smoothly, and the rubber 'bristles' are spaced too far apart for effective dusting, though it may work well at getting up pet hair from your furniture.--No swivel wheels as on my old Vision model.--The canister on mine does not seem to lock in very strongly. The latch seems weak, but so far no problems.--The handle does not lower down close to horizontal for reaching under things.--The brush roller keeps spinning when handle is upright.--The power switch is foot-activated and is down by the switch that releases the handle. It is slightly awkward to use and it is too easy to feebly push the wrong switch if you are not paying attention.Order fulfillment and shipping was very fast. Good job Amazon.I hated the rubber-bristled dusting brush right away and have already ordered the regular dusting attachment (about 5 bucks including shipping). I am having a problem when using the hose. Although the machine does get raised when the handle is vertical, it is not enough. I am using it on a wall-to-wall, medium-pile carpet that has foam padding underneath. The machine is fairly hefty and sinks into the carpet enough so that the roller brush makes contact with the carpet even with the handle vertical and the knob set for a high pile. I am worried that if I left it this way too long it might eat a hole in the rug so I am thinking about ways of avoiding that possibility. Perhaps I can tip it back a bit while using the hose, or get a thin piece of plexi to stick under the power head.When moving the machine around while tilted back on its big wheels, with the handle locked up, the wheels sink deep enough so that the machine bottoms out and drags, making it harder to move it around that way.Wish list:Make it go higher when the handle is raised to vertical, or have it make the brush stop spinning.Put bigger rear wheels on it.Give it a brighter headlight.Reposition the foot-power switch, or put it up on the handle.
I like my Dirtdevil very much. I think the price was fair and the delivery time was excellent.On the Filter I ordered I believe it is the wrong size and intend to check this out further.

column7: Dirt Devil Delivers For Price Point
column8: We decided to replace a very expensive vacuum that had outlived its service life. We have a dog and our home is subject to dust as we keep windows and slider open a lot. We read the reviews and landed on this one. Almost bought the Bissel. We bought this because of the cyclonic technology that claims to maintain consistent suction for a long time. We have used it for over a month now. It definitely picks up more dirt and dog hair than our previous vacuum. It grabs dirt deeper in the medium-shag carpet than our previous vacuum. The carpets have a renewed plumped up look after vacuuming. We would recommend this vacuum FOR ITS PRICE POINT ($105.00 at Amazon-how could you go wrong?) and for its initial effectiveness.Here's a detail of features and findings:1.) Ease of putting together-very easy (just the handle and clicking in the dirt container).2.) Electrical cord length-excellent (although I've already run over it and knicked it). Two room lengths.3.) The light is a joke: It does not illuminate anything.4.) The on-off switch is near the ground, just above the wheels to the left. It is a foot switch. If you have big feet, you're not going to be happy fitting your foot in here to turn it on/off.5.) This vacuum is not edge to edge: it does not go all the way to the baseboard but may be strong enough in suction to cover the small distance.6.) This vacuuming head does not lay down 100%- some vacuums are made to lay flat to go under furniture- this does not do that.7.) This vacuum does not have swivel wheels so it only makes straight turns.8.) This is a pretty strong vacuum. It picks up well but you do get dirt/dust showing on parts of the vacuum. You see dirt in the hose and in/on the canister.9.) Cleaning the dirt canister is very easy but be warned that you cannot avoid getting dirt/dust on or around you when you dump the canister and the canister must be wiped clean after.10.) The canister probably holds 2-3 complete vacuumings of a 2200 square foot place but we dump after each vacuum.11.) When vacuuming on non-carpet floors this vacuum does make a 'plasticee' vibrating noise which may be a/some part vibrating. It does not affect performance and goes away on carpet.12.) To vacuum stairs or under things you unplug the hose from the vacuum head and plug the hose into an attachment. The hose itself is not very long but for use it gets the job done on our stairs. If you're used to an all in one vacuum you have to get used to this new routine to do your whole house but its not big deal.13.) This vacuum does not deliver with the HEPA filter if that is a factor for you. We ordered one separately and received the wrong one so check the specs to get the correct part.14.) The smaller vacuum head is not motor driven. Its brushes turn by force of the suction and your moving it on surfaces. So, in essence its just a hose with a brush.We are happy with this vac. And as stated above, for the price point it seems like a super buy. I put the details in because the product detail and other customer reviews didn't mention any of this and if we had known some of this, we may have gone with another product. So if these things are important to you- you have the facts.Hope this helps.

column7: Great on Carpets, poor on bare floors
column8: I bought one of these after reading the reviews on several. Gave it to a friend to use who had no good vacuum cleaner any longer. She reports that it works super well on her carpets but scatters the dirt and dog hair around when using it on bare hardwood floors, and therefore would rate it 3-1/2 stars. Also, found this model for a good deal less via ace hardware, but will buy some other model from Amazon when I find one that works well on both carpets and bare floors that I can trade for the one I gave my friend, because I have mostly carpet in my house.

The Dirt Devil UD70095 is not a good vacuum cleaner.  It looks cool, but that's all it has going for it.  The cons range from minor annoyances to functional failures, including:> The light is weak, bordering on useless.> The power cord is short.> The power cord attaches at the bottom of the vacuum, making it easy to trip over.  So I have to loop it around the top of the vacuum handle, further shortening an already short cord.> The foot-switch power button is easy to accidentally bump and turn off the vacuum when you don't mean to.> The thing is very heavy.  It's a workout to use this, and I suggest a heart monitor if you're going to use it on carpeted steps.> The canister is not easy to empty.  Dirt does not just fall out of the bottom like magic, and I usually have to put on a glove and grab the dirt out by hand.  You can imagine how much dust this kicks up, meaning it has to be emptied out doors, while wearing a dust mask.And most importantly:> It does not clean floors well.  With both bare and carpeted floors, I need to run this over dirt multiple times before it is picked up.  If you live anywhere near a pine tree, you'll save a lot of time by crawling over your floors and picking up pine needles with a pair of tweezers rather than trying to use this vacuum to pick them up.There is one thing it is good at: getting stuck on any sort of throw rug or door mat. It is best to put all floor mats in a safe location in a different house, perhaps in a different county, before using this vacuum.
Excellent product, great deal, very happy. Would recommend this product and Amazon to everyone. This is one vacuum you want if you have pets.
I am very happy with this purchase.  I borrowed a Dyson from a friend who paid $500.00 and this Dirt Devil works just as good.  Glad I saved a ton of money and bought this model.

column7: Must have been defective - never worked correctly
column8: I had high hopes for this vacuum after reading the reviews. My dog doesn't shed but I thought buying one specifically geared toward homes with pets would be a good idea and the other reviews were mostly positive. Unfortunately, we had to send this vacuum back and I am reconsidering my options and might switch to a canister one instead. I used it only one time and I knew right away it was not for me and might even have a defect. I did give it plenty of time to work and used it on an entire floor of my house - both on hard wood and on area rugs.The problems:- The vacuum spewed out way more dust and dirt than was originally on the floor! This really defeated the purpose and I had to keep going over the same areas again and again, only to have it spew more out more dust.- The hose kept falling off while I was vacuuming and getting in the way. It was very annoying and would not stay in place. If it happened only once or twice, that would be one thing, but this happened consistently.- The handle release feature that allows the handle to lower so you can easily vacuum sometimes would jam - it would work at times and then other times I couldn't get the handle to lower more than a couple of inches making it impossible to use.- I agree with the other reviews that said the vacuum was heavy. I knew that ahead of time and was willing to overlook that if it worked well, but I do want to mention that drawback.The suction did seem to work well but in all other areas, this vacuum failed me and I sent it back. Hopefully I just had a defective model but I was not willing to take the time to address these issues with Dirt Devil - it should work better out of the box than it did.
Excellent product. Very powerfull machine. We are very satisfied with this machine. We highly recommend it. We definitely would purchase again if needed.

column7: Update: Shopping for a new vacuum
column8: Update:  I have had this vacuum for a little over a year now.  The vacuum still does a fine job of picking up dirt and hair from the carpets.  However, it has become very unreliable.  It overheats frequently...I can do about one room of vacuuming before it shuts off and I have to wait for 20 minutes for it to be usable again.  Maybe it could be fixed, but I would probably spend as much fixing it as I did on the vacuum in the first place.Good vacuum for the money!  I had a 5 year old Dyson that has slowly been dying on me and finally just quit.  This vacuum cost less than the repair to that vacuum would have cost, so I decided to try it.  I have only used it a couple of times, but so far I am very pleased with it.  It got a ton of cat hair and dirt out of the carpets (I have medium and deep pile carpets).  My only minor gripe is that the cord is shorter than on my old vacuum.

This vacuum does an extraordinary job on pet hair, dander, ground in old dirt and debris, and everyday crumbs etc.Out of the box, you can have it together and running in 5 minutes. There is nothing to assemble aside from attaching the handle to the main body.It is not overly heavy. You will not endure a back ache or sore shoulder after using it. It is not a beast to carry up and down stairs.The first time the vacuum was put to use, it was amazing how much 'stuff' was sucked up and how many times the canister needed emptied as it seemed to pull out really ground in, old debris and hair. You would have never expected it by looking at the carpet before being vacuumed. The carpet itself actually looked better afterward though - it was more fluffed up and fresh looking. It really did an amazing job.After being in use for a few months now, it continues to suck up almost a ridiculous amount of pet hair and your regular everyday dust, lint, dirt, crumbs, and whatever else has found it's way onto the floors.This vacuum is used in a house with many cats - some longhaired and some short haired. Some are are just neighborhood strays that 'stop by' to lounge around, eat and visit with the other kitties and then are back outside as they wish. The fur that it picks up is amazing. The power is great - almost unbelievable.Such performance at such a great price is wonderful. It really gives me a whole new impression of the Dirt Devil brand.There have been no issues with clogs or malfunctions. Tools are useful, and easy to use. Crevice tool works great as well as the furniture attachment with beater brush. The hose is long enough to not have the vacuum falling over by trying to reach with the tools while in use and the cord is long enough as well so that you aren't switching outlets to get to different areas of the room.Highly recommended even if you do not have any pets, but especially recommended if you do have pets. It really is an amazing vacuum - no other words to describe the power - at a really great price.

I bought this vacuum based on the prior reviews.  The day before receiving it, I had vacuumed and steam cleaned my floors.  Once I received the new one, I had to test it out.  At first I was disappointed because it was so much quieter than my previous vacuum that I didn't think it was working very well.  Then I looked at the dirt canister and was absolutely amazed.  It was filled with pet hair and dirt that wasn't picked up from the full cleaning the day before.  So, not only does it clearly clean way better than any other vacuum that I have ever used, but it is also the quietest.  I also love how easy the canister clicks in and out, no fuss whatsoever.  The attachments are easy to get to but securely fastened with a long reach on the hose.  I haven't used the attachments yet, so I can't talk to how they work, but I expect they will do fine based on the suction power.  For the value, I don't think you can get a better unit.
Seriously, this vacuum is amazing... Sucks everything up! Even pesky cat hair... Canister is easy to clean, and easily removable. Love it!

column7: Amazing Vacuum for a GREAT Price!
column8: I have a double-coated, extremely fuzzy, HIGH shedding dog, and no vacuum has been able to combat her hair as well as this one.  The first day I had it, I vacuumed the entire house and got FIVE cylinders FULL of hair.  Talk about gross...especially since I had just vacuumed the house with my old Hoover Windtunnel!  I was worried this poor vacuum would break because of the heavy use on day one alone, but it is standing strong and I cannot imagine my weekly vacuuming of the house with any other vacuum.  I now get about two cylinders full of hair weekly, which is great.  I really feel like this thing gets ALL of the hair and dirt up!I love the pet hair attachment as well.  I have dark couches that my white dog's hair sticks to like glue...but with the pet hair attachment, I can clean my couches SO easily.  They look brand new after I am done with vacuuming them!  Of course, then my dog gets up on the couch and releases a new plume of hair all over the place, but hey...as long as I have this vacuum, I'm not worried about it!I love this vacuum so much, I have recommended it to several people, including my mom who also has a high shedding dog.  I have no experience with the Dyson Animal, which seems to be the highest rated pet vacuum, but I must say that this vacuum is excellent and I really have no complaints at all.  Maybe the ONLY thing I would like more would be a retractable power cord, rather than one I have to wrap after use.  That is a small annoyance that is easy to deal with though...otherwise, this vacuum is darn near perfect.In short, if you have pet hair everywhere, give this vacuum a shot!

column7: Excellent Vacuum! Dirt Devil UD70095 Power Reach Multi Cyclonic Pet Bagless Upright
column8: I was nervous to purchase an upright, as the only experience I've had with them has been negative. Expecting a clunky, heavy vacuum that would break a belt within a week, I was not only pleasantly surprised with my purchase, but I was completely wowed by the vacuum's performance.My new Dirt Devil is so powerful that it picked up dirt that I didn't even know I had! It sucked up so much junk that had settled under the carpet that the dust bin was completely full after vacuuming less than half a small room. It picked up dog hair with ease that had clogged (and broken) the last three vacuums I had had.It is effortless to push from room to room and it has a simple release to dump the dust bin. I could not be more pleased and impressed with my purchase. This Dirt Devil comes VERY highly recommended.
I had a Dyson D24 and replaced it with the DD and the DD vac just rocked and cleaned my apt better than the Dyson. You can't beat the price it's must buy.

I purchased this vacuum after reading many positive reviews on Amazon.  However, when first reviewing the unit I noticed that while the knob for carpet height turned, it made no contact with the wheels and didnt change the height.  My carpets were very dirty and had some surface pet hair, as I have several cats and my old vacuum had died a few weeks before. When I turned on the vacuum, it picked very little up even after multiple strokes; to add insult to injury it left dirt tracks in the carpet with each stroke! I thought for sure this must be a lemon and sent it back and requested a replacement, since so many of the comments for this model had been so positive.  The replacement arrived within a few days, but I was dismayed to find the exact same problem with the height adjustment knob. Worse yet, unbelievably...the exact same problem with not picking up the dirt in the rug and leaving tracks! The vacuum cleaner doesn't clean! I sent it back for a refund the same day.  What a piece of Chinese-built crap!  At least I got great service from Amazon, fortunately.

Pros:Quiet compared to older vacuumsSucks a lotEasy to useFairly lightThis vacuum is fairly mediocre in features, specs, and other data, however it is a great vacuum for the price. It cleans well, is fairly quiet, pretty easy to use, and its cheap. Just what we needed to upgrade from an ancient hoover bag vacuum.

My dog sheds year around. This Dirt Devil vacuum was purchased because it was bagless and my Consumer Report top rated bag vacuum was always clogging making it ineffective and very annoying trying to keep the suction working.  I was astounded at the amount of dog hair the Dirt Devil picked up from my carpets!  Now that problem is under control yet this vacuum is still picking up lots of fine dirt from the carpet. The suction never seems to vary - always strong.  I wish I had discovered this vacuum years ago!  Suggestions for improvements - make the cord a bit longer.

column7: Better off buying a good broom
column8: The only reason I don't give this 1 star is that the attachments are handy. The vacuum itself is pretty useless. The tiny pieces of carpet from a cat tree don't actually get picked up, they just get pushed backwards by the vacuum. That goes for everything, really, especially if you're using the vacuum on bare floors -- which it has a setting for. Save your money and buy something else or just buy a good broom.

We are delighted with this cleaner.  Our family was recently 'adopted' by a cat, and we have been dealing with the shedding of fur all around the house.  This vacuum works wonderfully on regular carpets being - very strong - and has a wonderful attachment for cleaning pet fur off of furniture.I took away 1 star or 2 reasons.  1) The power-cord when wrapped in the back, pushes the extension hose out of place.  2) When using the pet-hair attachment, the regular floor vacuum brushes continue to run - so that you will wear out that spot in the carpet while you work over your furniture.

column7: Awesome Vacuum for the pet lover!
column8: I have had a lot of vacuums.. Having five dogs and three cats cleaning is something I do on a regular basis and this vacuum makes it easy- Picks up hair with a incredible suction and empties with ease.. Also the attachment piece gets my couch and corners great, its extremely powerful. Put together in less then five minutes- Work great- Very happy with my Dirt Devil!** Edit * been almost a year of everyday use- With lots of dogs and cats I foster it CONTINUES to work great-No one issue- This is my go to vacuum!! ** 9/12/12

I purchased this vacuum for around $80 at a local store, after much back and forth debate over which vacuum to buy that would work on both the wood floors we have in the living areas of our home as well as the carpeted bedrooms.  I am happy to say that this vacuum performs better than expected.  I use it not only on the wood and carpeted floors, but also on the tile in the kitchen and the cement floors and area rugs in the basement.  The suction power is adequate, although has diminished a little over the couple of months I have had it, but I think I just need to clean the filters for better performance- our old vacuum was terrible and I was getting massive amounts of dirt out of the carpets every time I vacuumed (which was every other day, because we were trying to get rid of fleas).  This vacuum really got put through its paces the first month or so and did a good enough job that I actually looked forward to using it!  It does have a little bit of dirt kick-back that can be obnoxious, but I think that is a problem that most vacuums will have on a hard surface, so I can't complain too much.  Overall, I am quite pleased with this purchase, and if I had the choice again I would still choose this vacuum.

column7: Gets dust you didn't even know was there
column8: This vacuum cleaner is amazing.  I bought this to replace my old Hoover windtunnel, and am astonished at how much dust and hair the canister yielded after a single room. As others have mentioned, the cord is only moderately long, so if you have a big house, you will need to replug several times as you move through your house.  The canister is also not too large, and will have to be emptied out several times, which I didn't mind, because it was much easier to do than my old Hoover due to design, and it goes to show that the vacuum cleaner is thoroughly sucking dust up.  Emptying was not messy.  Washing the filters and canister is easy. Overall, very very satisfied with this vacuum. Great price too!

column7: WOW, picked up scary amount of dirt from carpet
column8: easy to assemble, two philips head screws to attach handle. Swept a 15x15 ft area of living room carpet that I had just swept with my kenmore upright, which has a light sensor that stays on until the carpet is 'clean'. I posted a picture of what came out of the carpet after I swept with the Dirt Devil. Almost gagged when I saw what came out, I posted a pic, it is of the canister on its side, but note the full line. Canister is easy to detach and replace, easy to empty into the trash, no big puff of dust, as I lowered it into trash bag as a precaution. Very light, and easy to use, sweeper head narrower so easier to get between items. Cord could use a little more length, Kenmore had about 4 ft more, but performance makes up for it.

column7: Takes Care of the Long Hair, Cat Problem That Is
column8: I have a long hair cat that seems to shed in clumps. Sure, like other pet owners, there are the stray hairs and the consolidated bed areas where they gather in piles, but mostly its these little black balls that get pushed into the carpet by walking. This vacuum, so far ( a handful of weeks now), has done a splendid job dealing with this hair problem. It has yet to put out that horrific dirty vacuum smell into the air, pulls up cat hair from rugs, carpets and vinyl easily. I find it too be a pretty good weight, easy to maneuver and the attachments rest well in their respective places although occasionally the red extension piece slips out of place if not put in place perfectly. I don't think they feel as cheap as a few other vacuums I have used in recent memory, so I have high hopes that they will last for a while.Although others assure me otherwise, I thought the handle area felt a bit cheap, especially when I put it together. It just feels like the kind of plastic that could crack with unexpected pressure. I've emptied the canister a few times. The first time was a little dicey and got a bit messy as things fell out prematurely, but overall, probably a piece of cake for people, unlike myself, who have used canisters before.I've not had a lot of lasting experience with Dirt Devil in the past, but I can already tell this is a sturdier product than the light weight vacuums I have had from them in the past. I am very pleased so far, and would recommend this to pet owners easily.

I had been looking for a vacuum cleaner that would do exactly what it should do, and this is what I have with the Dirt Devil UD70095.  The product arrived days earlier than I expected.  It was easy to attach the handle to the main body. Light and easy to use. Great suction. Purchasing from Amazon was great as I paid much less than the store prices, and it was delivered right to my door!

column7: A very powerful and easy to use vacuum
column8: This is a very good vacuum cleaner! It has lots of power and of course it is bag-less as well. This good because you can 'see' that it work and bad because you can 'see' how dirty your carpet is.It has many features I look for in a vacuum, number one is a loooong cord. I can use it to clean my living room and two bedrooms without changing plugs. It also has a long hose to get into those smaller areas, the Turbo Tool is great for cleaning furniture and the edge to edge cleaning means it gets right up the edge of where you are cleaning.When you are done, the Dirt cup releases easy and it empties from the bottom, so just press a button and all the dirt just drops out.The one con is that is it big and bulky, there are some places it just can't get into and it is heavy, so if you have a lot of carpet, it could get tiresome pushing this vacuum around.But overall, this is the best vacuum I have owned and definitely do recommend it.

This vacuum cleaner is a real powerful sucker.  It gets the job done.  We have cats in the house and it is a big help with the loose furs in the carpet and around the house.The bagless feature is convenient plus the fact that I no longer have to buy extra vacuum bags which can be quite expensive depending how much dirt you have in the house.Emptying the dirt from the canister is also easy.  You push the button on top to release the canister.  Bring it to the trash bin and flip the bottom by pressing the side button.  This you will need both hands, one to push the button and one to push down the bottom.Maneuverability though is a tougher issue. This vac is heavy, specially for my wife. It drags her down specially working her way through the stairs and to from one floor to the another.We have another vacuum where the cord rolls automatically inside the canister by simply stepping on a switch. Although there are not many vacs like that, it is real convenient to have that feature rather than manually looping it behind the vacs.Pros:+ Powerful+ Bagless (no need to buy vacuum bags)+ All accessories are easily accessible+ Designed for household with pets+ Carpet and hardfloors+ Not very loudCons:- Heavy- Hassle dealing with the cord for storage.- The only issue with bagless is that some of the dirt will fly off the air when you open the canister.Overall, a very decent vacuum cleaner.

Very simple to put together. Vacuumed my family room where everybody goes...still skeptical.  Wow! Excellent suction, great beater brush! Pulled up the beaten down nap of the rug and really cleaned it! Cat hair, dog hair, dirt, carpet freshener, etc...sucked up and the carpet looks better than it has in a long time! It's worth the money paid and then some. Only 2 things I didn't like...the cord is not long enough and the waste canister needs to be bigger so you don't have to empty it so often.

I have two long hair cats. I get cat hair everywhere especially in the Summer and Fall. I am very pleased with this vacuum . I can say that it picks up hair very easy, and the suction is strong. I have a high pile carpet throughout my house and it did an amazing job.The attachments go on easy and I have to say I can use it to get hair off the furniture.This makes my life so much easy. I cannot believe that after using this I can see all the hair and pet dander it picked up. For the price you cannot go wrong. Overall Excellent product to have in the home.

column7: Everyone is Right - It's Better Than a Dyson
column8: My husband thought an excellent gift for my birthday would be a Dyson vacuum cleaner last year ... yes, be jealous of the romance. I do like the vacuum cleaner but have not found myself using it religiously, and I will tell you why - the price. Looking at it alone is intimidating, I took to using a broom to get my rugs clean. We have plenty of rugs and we live in a brownstone, so I was more than happy to get my hands on this Dirt Devil. I didn't even care if it did half a good a job as the Dyson. I can say without a doubt that it works just as well. I would even say better because the intimidation is gone. I can bump this puppy into corners and against the legs of tables and not have a tizzy making sure all of the parts are there. It is an excellent worker bee, it isn't a silent one, but no way is it extremely noisy. It is also easy to clean, glides well over different types of carpeting, and does a great job on the dog hair that seems to attach itself to the floor length curtains in our living room for dear life.I don't have a single complaint with this vacuum. It is priced extremely well for the excellent job it does. And also, I love the fact that I can focus on the task at hand and not on the vacuum.

I don't think I've ever had a vacuum this powerful, especially for around $100! This thing can suck. One dog, one cat, house full of pet hair and wow - got it all and then some. I especially love the little pet turbo suck attachment thingy.... vacuumed the couch with it and hubby was blown away - 'It looks like a brand new couch! How did you do that.' My new favorite thing. :)

column7: Never knew what I was missing.
column8: 4.5 starsI had to play around the carpet depth thing quite a bit longer than I expected to get the right setting. But once I got to where I needed to be, I was very impressed with the suction of this vacuum. All I can say is I lived in a filthy house and never knew it.  I could not believe how much dog and cat hair this collected. I dumped three times and had vacuumed just four days prior to this cleaner arriving!The only thing that bothers me, though only slightly, is the cord length.  I find it is significantly shorter than any vacuum I've ever owned.  I'm used to being able to plug it in my dining room socket and being able to do the whole downstairs.  Now I have to use three different plug sites.The vacuum cleaner is every bit as heavy as all the others I've owned, so that was no adjustment.  I think it is a little more noisy than I'm used to, but that really isn't a big deal to me.

I have the red 'Ultra Vision Turbo' Dirt Devil Vacuum. It's similar to this one except for the filters. I paid $80 at Walmart for it. It has a filter that is not rinsible, and it costs $20 to replace it.My vacuum has the pet tool too. The only thing I have noticed with mine...you have to be watchful and not get anything like a t-shirt/sock caught in it for over 7 seconds because it will burn up the belt. Pick up your floors before you vacuum. I have replaced the belt 3 times in a year.I have a 52 lb short haired dog indoors in a 1100 square foot home. I have to vacuum at least once a week....I sweep every day. I use the vacuum on average 5 times a month. I have hard wood floors and one 4x6 thin area rug.My biggest complaint would be the smell that comes from the vacuum after a month. I'm pretty clean, but my dog must have smelly skin cells. I bathe her regulary too. So, when you turn the vacuum on there is a dog smell that stinks...even if the plastic canister is empty. When you replace the $20 filter the smell goes away for a short time. I use the filter with the baking soda additive in them.My second complaint would be that on my hardwood floors...I feel the vacuum throwing the dirt on the floor back at my feet behind the vacuum. It has always done that. It picks up 75% of what is on the floor. I use the hose and go back and forth over the floor to pick up the flung out dirt.The pet tool works great/impressive...just don't get big pieces or chunks or anything stringy caught in it.That's it. Overall Dirt Devil has great customer service. If you have an issue or complaint they are very nice and helpful. I don't have to wait too long either to speak to someone.Also, I forgot to add...the detachable hose for the tools reattaches for mine very insecurely. When it's attached it's on, but you have to keep your eye on it. There has been many numerous times when I thought I was vacuuming, but the connector hose was detached without my knowledge...so I was blowing everything I was vacuuming back out into the air. It just comes loose sometimes for me.

I have owned Dirt Devil Upright vacuums in the past.  They worked well, so why not another.  Shipping was prompt and product arrived with no damage.  Assembly was easy (one screw to attach handle).  Directions were good except for previous reviewers note of lack of specific instructions for emptying the dust collector. The cat hair picker upper works like a charm.  For a vacuum, it seems pretty quiet.  Easy to push.  Have not yet tried the filter cleaning or replacement.  It gets my vote as the best low cost vacuum that I have tried.

column7: Great suction, light and easy to use, nice attachments
column8: This vacuum works great, and the suction is awesome!  The rollers actually fluffed my old worn out carpet and made it stand up again.  I am happy with this lightweight, easy to use vacuum!My old Hoover vacuum, even though its not that old, has stopped sucking like it used to.  I haven't taken it in to get it looked at.  I had the opportunity to try this vacuum out, so I thought I would take it.  I can sure see how much my old vacuum was missing.  I filled the canister in just one vacuum swipe of my small apartment.  I have a cat, and most of it was cat hair!  I vacuumed around her cat box, and it picked that up well.  My carpet is worn out, so it is hard to get into the depth of it.  This vacuum didn't pick up all the cat litter, however, I was able to pick it up with the plastic brush attachment that came with it.  It picked it up, and didn't shoot it all over the place like some vacuums do.A couple things that I don't care for on this vacuum are the hose attachment and the on/off switch.The hose attachment goes into the base of the vacuum to stop the suction from the hose.  It came out once on me.  You have to make sure it is in there tight, and even then it loosened a little by the time I was done vacuuming.  It has to be in there, or the vacuum won't suck as well and stuff will shoot out of the hose.The on/off switch is on the back of the base of the vacuum, next to the switch that releases the vacuum from and locked in stand up position.  It is kind of hard to turn off, as you need to use your foot.  It isn't a big deal, but I prefer the switch to be on the handle.This vacuum comes with attachments that attach to the vacuum in convenient, out of the way places.  The vacuum has a roller on it, that brushes the carpet and fluffs it.  It has different height adjustments for different lengths of carpet, or bare floor and you can adjust it by rotating the lever.  The canister is easy to remove, and has a trap door style bottom that empties easily into the garbage.  I did have to use my hand to get all of the crud out of it.  This left the outside of the canister dusty, so I wiped it off with a damp cloth.So far I am impressed with this vacuum.  It was easy to attach the handle with a Philips screwdriver, and I didn't have to read the manual before I used it.  This is a really user friendly vacuum.

I am extremely impressed with this Dirt Devil UD70095 vacuum.  I have been VERY unhappy with a Dyson DCO7 that I've suffered with for the last 5 years and couldn't wait to try something else, even something this inexpensive.  You never know, maybe it might actually work better!IT DOES!  I am here to tell you that this very low priced Dirt Devil cyclonic upright is every bit the vacuum my Dyson is and MORE!  One of the biggest complaints I have had with the Dyson is the way their attachments connect to the machine. It is always a huge fight getting them on and then off and more than one attachment has broken in the process even though I was always very careful with them. I am happy to report the included attachments that come with this Dirt Devil are built as well or better than my Dyson attachments and they GO ON AND OFF EASILY! It makes this vacuum a real joy to use.
