The extender wand attachment, the extra hose, the furniture attachment, the crevice tool. they are all totally functional and  really easy to put on and take off the vacuum.The hose is plenty long enough too and the power cord is long enough to keep replugging down to a minimum. It really is amazing how much you get for your money with this thing.  The filters need to be cleaned /replaced occasionally and that can be a  real pain, but I have had to do that for the last 5 years with my Dyson and I am used to it now.  As for the effectiveness of the Electrostatic Turbo tool I can't really speak to that as we don't have any pets.  However I did use it on a large couch that had not been vacuumed or cleaned in the last 2 years after the Dyson attachments gave up on me and it got the couch VERY clean.  To see for myself how much dirt and hair the tool removed I first started with an empty dirt cup so I could actually SEE what was picked up. I am embarrassed to tell you just how much, but believe me when I say it was sizable! (yikes!)SO how does the Dirt Devil measure up to my much more expensive Dyson in the actual vacuuming department?  In a word: BETTER!  I am trying hard to avoid the old cliché in describing this Dirt Devil but I just can't resist.....It REALLY SUCKS! (but in a good way!) Honestly, after using the Dyson for more than 5 years and then trying the Dirt Devil in the same areas of carpet and tile flooring I was VERY pleased to find just how much more dirt and crud I was picking up with the Dirt Devil.  I did not expect this level of performance from something this inexpensive.  I guess I was just suffering from some vacuum cleaner prejudice.I want to reiterate that the overall build quality of this vacuum is very good. I was not expecting so much for so little.  I wish I could have purchased one of these Dirt Devils 5 years ago instead of wasting so much money on my now much maligned Dyson.Bottom Line, the Dyson is being stored in the garage just in case, and the Dirt Devil is now occupying the place of honor in our utility closet. Way to go Dirt Devil, you really do SUCK! (ooops, there I go again!)
My wife loves the vacuum, only thing she would like different would be swivel front wheels on canister. She also has a Dyson  however likes the Hoover much more.

Long story short.  I bought this vacuum after researching and reading reviews.  I was very pleased with my purchase for 6mos.  Then it just stopped working.  Took it to the only vacuum repair service in our area and after three weeks was told they had to order a part.  Four months later they told us they were moving to another location and still no part.  We brought it back home where it has been collecting dust for almost a year.  No one seems to know anything about this strange Hoover machine.  It's a lot of money lost.  Might be better off buying inexpensive cleaners.  When they break down your not out an arm and a leg.

column7: REVIEW OF HOOVER PLATINUM CYCLONIC BAGLESS VACUUM CLEANER
column8: I don't understand why this product has only a 3.5 rating at Amazon. I searched other review sites and found that not to be the case. It just happens that several Amazon buyers were unhappy mostly about the product being heavy or had delivery problems. Over the years I have had different brands and this Hoover Platinum is the best I have ever used. I have had Dirt Devil, Kenmore, Dyson, Eureka and Panasonic. None of them have come near the power for deep cleaning that this Hoover provides. I have 6 rooms in my home with plush carpeting. Everytime I use this product the rooms look as if new rugs had been installed. I think the only problem may be the product's weight. It's not a problem for me I am 5 feet, 10 inches - 210 pounds: semi - tough New Yorker. Its best advantage is its powerful 12 amp motor. It's a strong work horse. In conclusion this product provides the most cleaning power in its price range - $299.00 via Amazon.Com LLC.

This vacuum has been repaired by the local Hoover repairman (House of Vacuums, N. Main St., High Point, NC) two timessince it was ordered from Amazon about  a year ago.  Since the machine is still under warranty we have not incurred expenses but would not recommend it to anyone or buy another.  When it works the suction is very strong and it cleans well and we like the bagless feature.  It's necessary to clean out other parts in the canister.  Just dumping the collected dust is not enough to clean out the vacuum.  It is also very, very heavy.
Pros: Very good suction. Easy to maneuver. Long cord. Easy to disassemble and clean.Cons: Heavy. Cannot clean near edges.
Love it, practically pulls itself! Really strong suction and thorough cleaning. Saw this in consumer reports's top 5 vacuums. Very happy

column7: Much better then expected, I waited for months before deciding on this model, and glad I got it.
column8: I love this unit, I bought it hoping I could use the powered head on the stairs instead of the little attachment and it worked. The powered head is a bit big to do the stairs perfectly, but compared to using an upright it was a dream..lol. I vacuumed 6 days before with our older hoover bag-less and it was so much more powerful and quiet, I am very pleased. We have a dog and her hair gets everywhere, this unit picks all of it up.1. It picked up much more then the older upright units I have used.2. The ease of emptying the dust bin is quick, efficient, and the least messy of all three bag-less I have had, two of which I still own.3. If it could be improved upon it would be.a. heavier duty hose, but that would add weight and would not have as tight of a bend radius.b. attachment connections kept on the canister, but that would add bulk, thus another trade off.c. cord rewind seems a bit weak, time will tell.4. My last point is back to #2, I am totally sold on bag-less, not having to buy a vac bag EVER has value that reduces total cost of ownership and this unit is so clean and efficient, you have to try it to believe it.

I chose this vac a year ago because it was highly rated by consumer reports. I wish I hadn't. It is heavy, loud, and difficult to maneuver. I could live with that, but it's already broken. And it is NOT normal wear and tear. I'm not sure how to explain it. The swivel piece that comes out of the vac and connects it to the hose is broken. I've shoved it back together seveeral times, but it won't stay.  Cheap plastic. It is supposedly covered under a warranty, but at this point I'm not sure it's even worth my time to get it fixed.

column7: so far so good, much better than dyson
column8: my dyson dc23 was horrible, would not work on area rugs or pick up pet hair and was a royal pain to use.This hoover is heavier, but has a powered brush, height adjustments by foot and buttons on the handle, and it works really well.I saw all the repair comments and so I bought from wal-mart (online) for same price plus $30 for a 3-year protection plan that guarantees 3-day repairs and if 3 repairs in a year, get a new replacement.Consumer Reports rates this vac as one of the best for pet hair (and the dyson was one of the worst).

My new Hoover vacuum does a wonderful job!  We have 2 yellow labs and dark floors and a few carpets.  This vacuum does a wonderful job collecting all the hair on hard floors and carpets beautifully.  I can instantly see the results as I can empty the debris into the trash bin.  I have been a Hoover customer for over 15 years....my last vacuum was a Windtunnel Upright and the reason I had to toss it was that the 'nubs' that held the vacuum upright were worn out and it would just crash down to the floor and scare me!  The motor still worked well but it was time for a new one.  I chose a Hoover Platinum Bagless Canister and I have used it for a month and am very happy with it.

column7: Great vacuum, but received a refurbished or prev returned item
column8: Rated top vacuum by consumer reports.  Used it one day then it broke.  The periscope to the canister broke off.  Then realized it was either a refurbished or previously returned.  Otherwise it was a great vacuum.  Getting 3 stars due to return.  Amazon did provide for free shipping return and shipped the new one before I even got the broken one back to UPS.Received replacement. This one is brand new.  Power cord & hose are short for a canister.  Its a pain to empty out the canister.  The sucktion is fine for most people, but not as good as my old kenmore.  Then had a couple of other issues with this one, decided to return for refund instead of trying another replacement.When it worked, it was great on the dog hair. But too many short comings for my needs.

column7: Good at first, then all downhill from there.
column8: At first I liked this vacuum. But as time wore on,it wore out my patience. The floor tool doesn't store on-board and un-attaches easily.  The other tools store on the handle and like to fall off. The little stubby front wheel gets stuck even on low carpets. When you pull the vacuum on a carpet the front comes up a bit and the back of the unit drags on the carpet. Kind of like a dog dragging it's butt on the floor. Then there is the very annoying noise that comes from the hose where it attaches to the vac. The only good things I can say about this vac is the Bag-less feature works well, and the swivel power head is easy to use. But one big problem with the bag-less is it can't balance on a step if you are cleaning stairs. Recently the beater head started operating intermittently.I fixed the problem in the hose that was from a design flaw. However the repair didn't last long and I decided to cut my loses and replace the unit. I just bought a Panasonic from Amazon that is just like and old Kenmore I once had. No gimmicks just a plain old school Vac with the attachments on-board. And as it is a bag model it will fit on stairs. Hoover was once my favorite vacuum. Now it has become gimmicky junk like so many other brands.

column7: Works awesome on pet care but it's in been repaired 2 times in one yeare
column8: This machine works really well on pet hair, but I've had to take it in twice in a year. The first time for overheating. We cleaned it religiously but it was still stopping from overheating. Turns out there is a inner place that has to be cleaned out too. Then a few months after that the plastic piece that joins the shaft to the floor sweeper part broke. I would not buy this again.

We bought a Hoover platinum bagless vacuum S3865, which performs reasonably well. We were warned about quality issues and very long warranty repair times with Hoover,  but because of good write-ups, we decided to buy it. Sure enough, after about 6 months or so, the plastic nipple on the hose grip wand broke off and the handle would not stay in the telescopic wand anymore. So we took it to the local Hoover warranty shop and they told us it would be 6 weeks before getting it back. Finally when we got it back, we now have a metal nipple on the handle. Then sure enough, the plastic nipple on the bottom of the telescopic wand broke and the floor tool did not stay on anymore. Since we had a spare metal nipple, we fixed it with some effort and now it works again. WHY DO  THEY PUT PLASTIC NIPPLES ON PIECES THAT GET CONSTANTLY ATTACHED AND DETACHED ???This is why Hoover gets a bad reputation. They save on quality for a few cents and cause a lot of frustration.

I bought this machine because it can get under the beds and other furniture easily. It seems to be sturdy. It clogged a couple of times where the floor attachment meets the hose. Overall I am satisfied with this product.

I bought this Hoover against my better judgment and in trying to save a few bucks.  I owned a Siemens canister vac in the past and loved it and the only one's available of similar style today seemed to be the Miele, which are PRICEY.  I tried to save a few bucks and couldn't believe the negative aspects in some of the reviews on this product.  What I found that drives me mad from different perspectives are:1) The retractable cord doesn't retract (a minor 'feature', yes.  Annoyance factor: Unbelievably high! Here I should've listened to others!)2) The base canister is HEAVY and bulky - even thought the actual footprint isn't big3) The wand/handle often 'falls' from the upright position stance either because of lack of locking or weight4) The handle is... well...annoying...I often hit the on/off button and in reality there is no need to have designed this complicated looping handle5) The foot activated switch to change the elevation of the vac from the floor has not worked properly from day 1.  I can step on it over & over & over and sometimes nothing happens, sometimes it simply skips the heigh I select6) Doesn't vac non-carpeted floors well with the floor attachements  (I am often left going around with just he bare wand or resorting to my Black & Decker Pivot Vac (AWESOME product))7) Bag-less schmaggless - all the blah-blah about 'clean' emptying is talk.  If you put the canister over / into the garbage and hit 'bombs away' you are greeted with a cloud of dust (unless you have a really tall and empty garbage can)8) Only 2 accessory attachement items are stored on board (on the handle actually) - and not well as they often get 'knocked' off when using the vacWhat's positive?A) It does vacuum fairly well on wall to wall carpets.B) The cord is in fact a nice lengthI honestly wish to dump this product and buy a Miele - but I can't afford to do either.

column7: It's a good vacuum...when it isn't in the shop!!
column8: I bought this vacuum because of the Consumer Report rating. This was my first Hoover. The suction was good and it seemed to be a pretty solid machine...except it has had continual problems. The first problem was about 6 months after purchase. The machine's power would not stay on. I took it in to the shop and they had to replace the hose (the power button is on the end of the hose) because some plastic ring/seal had cracked. This took 2-3 weeks to get a replacement hose. Less than a year later the machine would not turn on at all so back to the shop it went. This time I was told that they had to replace the entire vacuum (I was told that the motor was dirty...hello, it's a vacuum cleaner...it's supposed to get dirty and I religiously clean the filters). This time it took about 2 weeks. I have a second vacuum cleaner (a Dyson) and decided that I would just stick with Dyson (I have had 3 and have NEVER had a problem...never even having to replace the belt on a 7 year old machine).Ultimately, for the money, I would recommend going with a Dyson as the difference in cost is minimal (I paid $300 for this Hoover, $320 for a Dyson DC23 animal canister vacuum and $250 for a Dyson DC33 multifloor upright vacuum). While the Hoover may feel slightly more solid than the Dyson, the Dyson's reliability is superior by far.The Hoover salesmen (at the repair place I take this vacuum) also completely turn me off from Hoover vacuums. They consistently bash Dysons and have told me that I shouldn't have purchased a canister (bagless) vacuum as they were not recommended for desert areas (making it sound like the problems with the vacuum cleaner is my fault, not the company that made the inferior piece of equipment). I have NEVER seen anything, anywhere, by any vacuum company that said that canister (bagless) vacuums should not be purchased in desert areas and my Dyson DC14 worked so well for 7 years that I was able to sell it when I decided to switch to a canister vacuum.After this experience I have become a diehard Dyson fan and will NEVER go back to Hoover.

Love this Hoover!  This is the second bagless Hoover I've owned and they just keep getting better. The swivel head and the turbine hand tool are great.  Got a new, very hairy, puppy and needed the new sweeper, works great and clean up is quick.  The only minor problem...the dusting brush will not stay attached to the handle.

Researched long and hard.  Chose the Hoover Cyclonic. Vacuum o.k. Had a problem with poor performance of cord rewind. Called and emailed the Hoover customer service dept.  Left name and phone number for a call back after being told that they were experiencing unusually high call volume. Never received a call back after 3 attempts by phone and 1 email. Hoover is now owned by a British company with the majority of company staff with some mid/east Indian names.  Hoover was at one time a respected name in the industry.  It has now been trashed. Save yourself time and aggravation. I will never buy a Hoover product again. Amazon went above and beyond and offered a full refund. Amazon is well worth your time.

After a lot of looking I realized that there really are not a lot of bagless canister vacumes avilable. I did look real hard at Dyson, since I all ready have a Dyson upright, but found out that they do not have a powered head. (only air power which I do not like or want)I was replacing a Kenmore which all though it cleaned well enough it spent more time and $ getting fixed than working.The Hoover was the only vacum that really fit my needs. It is small, cleans bare floors as well as carpeted rooms. I am pleased with the preformance. And of course I am allways pleased when I buy from Amazon. They are number one in my book and have allways delivered as promised.

I purchased this new in September of 2011 in October of 2011 it went into repair for over heating.  After two weeks the vacuum was returned and we struggled with it for another five weeks. Then in January if would work for five minutes and shut down.  I went into the 'authorized Hoover' repair again and has been in repair for nine weeks and counting.  I have tried to call Hoover customer service and listened to their music three different times for 10, 15 and 30 minutes before giving my telephone for a call back.  I have never had a call back on either of those three different days.  Bottom line I would never buy nor recommend ANY Hoover product.

worst vacuum i ever had. Bought  before Xmas .3 month later big brush doesn't rotate anymore.Belt is fine .Its very haivy,dogs hair gets stuck inside plastic tube all the time. Really upset that i got that instead of old stile canister with bag.

column7: Hoover is Supposed to Suck, But Blows it on this one!
column8: Bought this a little over a year ago and it worked great until the most critical part that holds the swivel mechanism between the hose and the floor attachment cracked because it was made of cheap, thin, plastic. Of course I'm sure the product engineers must have thought it was just perfect, but when I went to an authorized service center for their warranty service they wanted me to pay up front and let them determine whether the crack was caused by 'normal' wear and tear or something else. It didn't include fixing it. They wanted me to pay them just to evaluate it??? Your right Hoover 'nooobody does it like you!' That's unacceptable. The local vacuum repair man could take one look at it and conclude it was not the end user's fault. Horrible way to treat customers who pay $400.00 for a vacuum cleaner with a 6 year warranty.
Everything worked well the first 2 times I turned it on.  After that would not work at all.  Power lights came on but nothing else.  Did troubleshooting but nothing changed

column7: Be afraid, be very afraid.....  Don't buy this vacuum....
column8: I should have read the reviews closer...  This is the worst piece of plastic crap shipped over to America with an old American name slapped on it at the last moment so it 'comes from a name you can trust'......The thing never worked properly, and honestly, it was too much of a pain to send back to Amazon for a refund.  Since it has a 6 year warranty (Ba Hahahaha), I took it to an 'Authorized Repair Center' (Another Ba Hahahaha)....Long and painful story a little shorter:  The repair place has been waiting for parts for 7 weeks.... but they won't even say for sure those are the parts that will work....I am very disappointed with Hoover....

I have had this vacuum for a few months now and really like it. It's much better than my old upright, and does a good job at cleaning bare floors. The dust bin is easy to empty. Over all this is a well-designed vacuum and I have not had any serious problems with it. The cord could be a little longer.

My vacuum broke (plastic snapped) today for the 3rd time since owning it.  The first break happened during shipping.  The second about a month after owning it and the third today. The warranty ran out yesterday....grrrr....

column7: As good or better than Consumer Reports rating
column8: We have a long-haired Maine Coon cat, and this vacuum really rips the hair from our carpet. We have to empty the canister after each room becasue there was so much hair left behind by our other vacuum. Price is better than Dyson, and outperforms!

I've owned this vacuum for about 1 year.  It was working fine a then a few minutes later, it would not turn on.  The power light was on, but it would not turn on.  It is currently in the vacuum repair shop.  I don't know how much it will cost to repair yet.

column7: GREAT FOR TILE AND WOOD FLOORS
column8: Saw a review of this on our local news rating it as the top vacuum for hardwood or tile. My house is 80% saltillo tile and it does a WONDERFUL JOB.  It has been difficult getting use to a canister since I have used a upright for the past 30 years.  It is not real heavy but I also have COPD so any weight is a challenge.  Overall I would recommend it to anyone with a lot of hardwood or tile floors.

The price was very good.  Delivery was quick.  With much anticipation I opened the box to give to my wife and there was a critical piece missing.  The cover to the bottom of the vacuum chamber.  Without that it won't work.  I called the Hoover Platinum hotline the next day.  What a joke.  Their representative was almost useless but I was finally able to explain to her the issue.  She put me on hold for a few minutes and when she returned she was very perky.  Her great news was that she would be able to send me the part 'without cost'.  I was stunned.  I spend over $300 on this platinum vacuum and can't use it because of a missing part and she is ecstatic to provide it for free, plus free shipping.  Delivery time was 10 days because they don't do overnight.  This is a bunch of $#^&!!#.  Is Hoover so cheap they can't provide better customer service for their platinum vacuums?  I went to the Hoover website to find another avenue to contact upper management.  No link....nothing (for obvious reasons).  Continued to search the internet and found a page for their parent company and a valid email address.  I wrote my complaint and sent it.  It's been six weeks and nothing.  So I guess the position of 'screw the customer' starts up the chain from Hoover.  So my evaluation of the vacuum is that it performs well (once it works) but it is bulky and heavy to drag around.  For the company itself, I would never by another one of their products.

What I like about this vacuum cleaner is how well it cleans hard surface floors (when the cleaning tool will stay attached), how easy the sound is on my ears and how conveniently the dust cup detaches and reattaches. But...none of the attachment tools, including the one for cleaning hardwood floors, can be securely attached when in use---so what happens is the one in use constantly falls off. Not good.

column7: A lot of study went into this purchase
column8: I truly did a lot of study to buy this vacuum.  I don't spend this much money on household equipment without doing research.  I read a lot of user reviews, positive and negative (the negative are the most important), read Consumer Report on vacuums and other online reviews.  My experience is basically as I expected (or I was warned).  It is a very good vacuum.  I have used it on bare floors and on carpet. I have tile, lamenate, area rugs, painted concrete and several pets.  I find that I like the lowest setting on the power nozzle better than the bare floor setting and I use it for all types of floors.  The negatives are exactly as described by Consumer Report and that is, it is heavy and that makes it somewhat cumbersome.  But it is a substantial piece of equipment.  I love the bagless canister.  It is very easy to empty and replace.  All in all I expect that I will have this vacuum for ever and each time I use it I like it better.

column7: Good for both wooden floors and area rugs
column8: The vacuum cleaner has many good features which make it pleasant and effective to use:  I love the on off switch on the handle; the ease of emptying dust from the cannister; and that it is very quiet compared to others.  The suction is as good as I expected - particularly important for the area rugs; the extra attachments provided are excellent (I'm especially happy with the wooden floor head; I haven't tried the pet hair one yet). In an ideal world all the attachments would fit on the machine somewhere (not just the thin tube and small brush which are attached to the handle and occasionally come off when they are knocked) and the machine would be slightly lighter to pull around.  However, these are more in the way of suggestions to the manufacturer, rather than complaints. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.

After months and months of reviewing options, my husband and I agreed that this was the best one(Also consumer reports website) so we bought in may of last year.  Right away, I was surprised at how heavy it was. It can not be taken quickly from location to location. Do not buy this if you have multiple levels of your home!!!  SO, right away I noticed that it lacked suction. I thought, well it is quite, maybe because I have been used to 30years of bagged vacumes.  Well, the dirt/dust/hair just gets blown all over the room.  When the dust, etc, settles, you need to vacume again!!! I kept thinking it would get better, so I was patient. Each time blaming myself for not following directions.  I have kept it clean, eptied after each use.  My husband has looked at it, and nothing is blocking the tubes, it is clean. It still will not pick up a tiny piece of paper(Notebook paper)  I will try and call the number on monday, but after reading all the problems with customer service, I do not expect anything.  THis was REALLY expensive, the most I have spend EVER on any vacume. My last TWO did not equal to this one.  I am stuck with this one until it breaks, or it finally breaks me.  I will keep you posted....

Re: HOOVER PLATINUM CYCLONIC CANISTER VACUUM WITH POWER NOZZLE, BAGLESS, S3865.  After spending some time unpacking, assembling, and reading the instruction booklet, when I plugged it in, the vacuum would not work.  Obviously, I rechecked everything and changed outlets. The light on the vacuum came on, but no action.I must also add that I was shocked at its size!  I think it would have been very clumsy to use; an upright is less bulky.  What I'm looking for in a canister is less bulk and weight for bare floors and an occasional carpet clean up.

I really must say that I am quite pleased with this vacuum. I found out that I am allergic to our little terrier dog. Since it is the kids inside pet we won't be getting rid of it...:) I searched a lot of different ones and settled on this one because of the reviews. It has everything I wanted. The suction is wonderful. I really like the telescoping wand and the adjusting I can do for rugs and bare floor. It came with the attachments I needed also. We have mostly bare wood floor and I use the bare floor attachment and it works great! I haven't found anything that I don't like except maybe the weight of the vacuum, but I will just ignore that...:)

We have had this vacuum for about month and it has been great. The brush head does a good job on carpets, hard floors are great with the lighter attachment head. It is a bit messy to empty the bag less container because you have to unscrew an inner cup to empty it. The features I like best are the comfortable handle with the power button on it,  the cord rewind button, and the handle length adjustment. We had a Dyson monster before and it was so un-intuitive to use and just over complicated, but the Hoover is really easy to figure out and use. I would highly recommend it!

I've been struggling with a vacuum made just for wood floors for years. It took forever to vacuum and blew the dog hair around the house.  Was horrible on rugs.This vacuum is wonderful on dog hair, wood floors AND the rugs!  I can now vacuum all my furniture and floors in just under an hour.  The swivel head is great.  The attachments are on and off easy.  I like the On button on the handle, although I hit it accidently at times.  Emptying the bagless container is so easy I do it often to get rid of the dog hair and keep a good suction going.  As previously reviewed, if carrying it, it is heavy, but it wheels around so easily, I just avoid carrying it as much as possible.  It is a bit large, but it doesn't bother me at all.  I am thrilled with this purchase.

After months of research on Amazon, Consumer reports, and in stores, I finally purchased this with reservations. I can't comment on long-term reliability, but I'll summarize my first impressions from using it several times to clean my house, which is mostly hardwood floors, with several area rugs.Pros:- Effective cleaning. The carpet attachment is powerful and effective with dust, lint, and dog hair.- Maneuverability. Based on size, shape, and Consumer Reports, I expected the large carpet & floor attachment to be difficult to maneuver. It is large and heavy, but it swivels easily on large, smooth wheels.- Attachment selection: The choice of wide brush attachment for hard floors, or the carpet attachment with the brush turned off, is convenient.- Dust container detaches easily and neatly for emptying it elsewhere (e.g. outside).Cons:- HEAVY. Also, main vacuum body is also wide and bulky, and the carpet cleaning attachment is heavy, making carrying the whole thing quite a chore.- Hard floor brush attachment doesn't stow on-board. I use this brush a lot, and since the vacuum itself is unwieldy, I don't really have a hand free for this.- The wand release button is on the carpet attachment. So if you have it detached and you are using the hard floor brush instead, you can't quickly remove the wand to use the dusting brush or crevice attachment directly on the handle/nozzle. For me, this is a pretty major inconvenience. You have to either keep the wand on (it telescopes, so you can push it in to a little over half its length, but still awkward for up-close work) or put the carpet attachment on and then release it and the wand together (that requires hauling it to rooms where you don't actually use it).- As others have pointed out, the carpet attachment is the only one that engages with a latch - all the others rely on friction, and tend to fall off easily.- Dust 'cup' is a huge canister with many layers of plastic, and as another reviewer observed, once it's dirty, it's dirty. There are areas that can't be accessed for cleaning.I will probably keep this, because I upgraded specifically for the carpet-cleaning performance. Unfortunately, there are few highly-rated bagless canisters available. But I am only giving it 3 stars, because for the price, the engineers should have designed these features more thoughtfully, with real-world use and convenience in mind. The jury's still out on durability.

I haven't use this machine very much yet but it picks up dust and dirt well and is very quiet. It takes more floor space to store than an upright vacuum but I really like the versatility of the canister vacuum.

I was looking for a vaccum cleaner for a long time.My old vaccum was a rainbow which was handed down to me from my mother in law.It just got too old, but it sure did get the job done. So thats why it took me a while to find a new one, the name rainbow tells it all. I did alot of research and narrowed it down to the Platinum Cyclonic bagless  Canister. It has the the power I need and its bagless, one important factor I was looking for. The extension on the handle is perfect, you can adjust your height, which is another good factor for me, since I have a bad back. The attachments are good. Only one complaint the dusting brush,the brush seems to come off all time,kind of cheap. All in all I really like my new vaccum. Remember I was comparing to a rainbow.

Hoover has blown it for me.  I wanted a canister with lots of power and this one was in the right price range.  Buying a Bagless vac was a mistake, I hate it.  This is the second one that I purchased.  The first one I bought in January I sent back the same day - electrical problems - it kept shutting off.  I switched to another distributor and ordered another one.  It just got here today (1 month after my first one).  I thought that my first experience was just bad luck - that maybe I was just  one in a million that got a defective machine.  Ha! On this one, the power cord will not rewind and there is a gasket already loose in the dirt cup.  I think this machine is poorly made, poorly thought out, and I advise anyone not to buy it.

We have had issues with 'sucky' vacuum cleaners for years.  I took my time and found this Hoover Platinum as a 'Best Buy' in Consumer Reports. I was looking for a cyclonic vacuum and had was needing something with a retractable cord. This canister caught my attention. I was worried with the handful of poor reviews that were listed here in Amazon.com, but felt confident enought to take the plunge (but I've kept everything, just in case!).It's been over a month and we are VERY pleased.  The cord, which some reviewers complained was too short (and I was worried about) is just dandy in length! Ample distances can be reached. The little attachments do pop out of their holder on the handle; easy fix, just keep them with the other attachments in storage! The handle telescopes - a great feature for us, since we are taller than your average bear. The power of the machine coupled with it's AMAZING quietness is the real gem.The canister is not too messy to empty. It will be easier when the snow is gone and we can empty it outside by the garage trash bin, which is bigger than our kitchen one, but it is not that big a deal.We are very pleased with the quality and performance of this and hope that it remains as it is now for a long time!

I found this vacuum to be a useful appliance with only one annoying negative issue. The hard floor attachment keeps falling off. No matter how hard I press it on, it just falls off again after a few minutes of use. There really should be a locking mechanism to prevent this. Hey Hoover, If you read this how about sending me a re-designed extension and hard floor brush! Other than this annoying problem I am happy with my purchase.

Unfortunately, this vacuum turned out less than ideal for our circumstances.  The power head is too large and cumbersome for our small home, the 'wand' is too heavy, and the cup is too difficult to empty.  In addition, the on-off switch is located in such a position that is easy to accidentally turn off or on.  The brush attachment for bare floors falls off easily during vacuuming.  The suction power is excellent, however, and picks up pet hair very well.  I'd recommend this vacuum for use in larger rooms by people with stronger arms.

I like the way everything is at your fingertips or can be controlled by your foot.  You can easily disconnect the wand and use it as you go.  You can turn the brush off and use it on bare floors.  It is very nice to be able to vacuum all the floors at one time without having to stop and make any time consumming changes.  It is also quick and easy to empty--messy, but easy.  I like to go outside and empty mine so I don't get the dust cloud in my house.

Probably the best vacuum we have ever owned.  We have owned a ton of uprights, and stick vacuums, this vacuum is a workhorse. Works great on the hardwood floors and on the rugs.I agree with some other reviews, that the placement of the on/off switch gets in the way.  I find myself hitting the button often while maneuvering the vacuum.  It is on the powered hand attachment.  I would move the switch to the side, keeping it away from the users thumb.Only issue- all of the attachments don't have a place to go or be stored.  I looked online and no one sells a wall organizer for all the attachments.  One afternoon I used some scrap wood and built my own.  Now everything is stored in one place, including the hose,  and not just lying on the ground next to the vacuum.We don't have any pets, but with children, company, and a messy cook this vacuum can handle it all.  I conducted a bunch of research online before purchasing this vacuum I am glad we didn't buy another cheep upright that works more like a garbage re-locator than an vacuum.

I too loved this vacuum at first. gets the dog hair out of the carpet great...until things start going wrong!!! First the automatic rewind on the cord quit. Now I just wrap the cord up and stick it through the handle. No big deal really; but wait...then the beater kept falling off the extention when i was trying to vacuum; the connection wouldn't stay 'hooked'. Well, I had an extended warranty so they were nice enough to send another extention wand. It would have cost me $54!! WOW! But I feel that after only a few months of use this never should have happened to begin with. so nnedless to say I have 'babied' this one! Now today, less than a year since my purchase it literally blew up!!! Yes- sparks and all. Now it will do NOTHING!! The end of the new extention wand is burnt and the whole system is shot. we'll see how the service on this one goes. Will keep you posted!

column7: Defective Product by Hoover - Don't Buy!!!
column8: If I could give this vacuum 0 Stars, that's really what I would have given it!! All I can say is Buyer Beware!I bought this vacuum (which was expensive!!) thinking I was going to get a quality vacuum. It comes with a 6-year manufacturer warranty, so I thought that there wouldn't be any issues for at least 6-years, because that seems to be how warranties are, right? WRONG!!! I had this vacuum for 1 day, and the power on/off button & powerhead on/off button failed. For some reason, the buttons wouldn't turn off at the handset -- they just stayed lit up. And no, I did not abuse this machine in any way. I emptied the cannister several times during vacuuming thru my house.Here's how it went: I spent about 30 minutes on my downstairs and then let the unit rest (so I could rest); and then went to do the upstairs about 20 minutes later. After running the vacuum for about 5 minutes, I couldn't operate the handset control buttons (on/off and powerhead). So I unpluged the unit from the outlet and then plugged it back in and the control buttons wouldn't work at all (now they wouldn't even light up). After doing a little research on this (which I should have done more of to begin with), I found out that other people had the same issue. Some had it from when they just put the vacuum together and tried to use it for the first time. Others had it happen within the first month or two. So my recommendation to you is DON'T BUY THIS ITEM!I wouldn't be surprised if Hoover ends up doing a recall on this piece of junk (which I'm putting nicely). In an attempt to find out how long I would be without a vacuum, I called the closest Hoover warranty service center (which was about 24 miles away). The shop guy told me that they are no longer a service center for Hoover, and apologized. He asked me what kind of vacuum I had and I told him it was the Hoover Platinum Cyclonic Bagless Canister and he said that I unfortunately purchased a 'nightmare vacuum'. He went on to tell me that Hoover is horrible to deal with on warranty repairs. He said that many times the repair parts are on back order and sometimes customers are without their vacuums for weeks. That's when I knew what I had to do - RETURN IT!!! Thankfully, Wal-Mart has a great return policy -- they get 5 STARS for that!! So I just returned it today, and I'm happy to say that it's going back to Hoover as a Defective Product!Anyway, I just bought the Dyson DC23. I just used it and it's AWESOME!! It has incredible suction and I am soooo much happier now! My goal in giving this review is that other customers don't spend their hard earned money on a defective product. If you are still considering purchasing it, just be sure to do lots of research on it so that you will see that I'm not the only one that experienced this type of problem.

column7: This is the Vac for HARD FLOORING"
column8: wood and tile bar-none!!"
column9: Folks, to start with I am a 67 year young, just retired Master Chief, and now a Mr. Mom!! My wife of 45 years is still working (Teaching Profession) and will not retire just yet, darn. We have a older model Hoover Up-Right Vac., model Wind Tunnel Mac 6.9. Now that I am Mr. Mom and have taken over many (not all) of the home chores, found that this machine was the 'Beast From HELL!' Was like driving a 65 ton tank through a drive up window at a bank... Anyway it kicked my buttocks and did not do the job and left me with a back ache! I started doing much research trying to find the right solution for my back ache and getting the job done right to pass my self imposed inspection. The Hoover Platinum Cyclonic Bagless Canister Vac. Model S3865 was my selection and it just arrived today, 'YES!' Our home for 36 years is approx 1,800 sf and we have replaced the carpet with all tile (20%) and hardwood (80%)flooring about 7 months ago.  Now for the test, I first put in a fresh bag in the old Up-Right 6.9 and and vacuumed everything not nailed down, then I did it all over again with my new Hoover S3865. OMG, was I shocked at how much stuff this new machine picked up!! The low profile power head got under and around almost everything and I had to move very little to achieve total floor cleaning. With the Beast I had to move everything to try and get the job done with poor results. Folks, the canister was half full of fine dust, dirt and crap from I do not know where?? This new Hoover was like gliding over ice, one tenth the effort, the swivel power head is the best and very maneuverable with outstanding side/edge pick-up and this thing is very quite too. I used all the attachments with the handle and also with the extension tube, what a blessing it is to use this stuff, gets the job done and the back ache gone!! I did picture frames, base molding, cracks and crevices, window ledges ceiling fans, vent registers, you name it, it all met with my new Hoover and lost the war on dust, dirt, dog and people hair, all now in the waste can.  I went to my wife and asked her forgiveness for not getting this Vac sooner and she asked what took me so long to see the light?? I will do a up date after using the Hoover S3865 for a few months to let you know how she holds up under a crusty old Master Chief being driven to become Mr. CLEAN!!V/RKent M WhitneyMaster Chief, USN Retired

column8: Nice machine, and it seems to work well. I was surprised to see (and it wasn't easy to find), that, what I thought, was still American made, alas, was discretely marked 'Made in China'. Machine is clumsy to store, is somewhat bulky, and most tools do not store onboard. If this isn't a major drawback, I don't know what is. The important thing is that it's relatively quiet, and, so far cleans adequately. We'll keep it, but in retrospect, there are better choices.

I bought this vacuum for my wife when our old upright finally died. I knew she wanted a canister vacuum since we have multiple levels and floor surfaces in our house. Our friends have one of the Dyson canister vacuums and I was initially going to buy one of those, as it really does clean quite well. However after reading the reviews and doing some more comparisons, I settled on the Hoover Platinum since it had a couple of features I thought where nice:- Better control location. Hoover has the on/off, brush roll and suction level switch right on the handle. The pedals on the power nozzle are easily operated by foot.- When the hose is attached to the power nozzle, it will lock upright and remain standing on its own.- Hose attaches directly to the front of the canister, not angled to the side.Other positive points:- Very quiet motor and nozzle- Bright light on the power nozzle- Easy to see indicator lights- Balanced cord retraction system (strong but not too fast)- Easy to empty canister (Some reviews said this was messy but for us not any messier than changing out the bag on our old upright. Our solution: get a large garbage can, put the end of the canister into it, push button and your done)It is not without a few drawbacks however:- No clip for securing the hose when you have to store or move the unit- Extend-able wand is easy to extend but is somewhat cumbersome to use by itself- Indicator lights remain on while unit is plugged in but not operating. They are LED lights but still why waste energy?Overall my wife is happy with her new vacuum and I have been pretty impressed with its quality. For the amount of money it cost, $350, I think it was a very good choice and would definitely recommend.

Basically I'm dissapointed in this product.I bought this vacuum cleaner thinking that it has good reviews.  After using it for less than a month, the vacuum starts to have a burning smell.  The nozzle do not attach well to the hose, it keeps coming off. It's also difficult to clean the bagless part.

column7: Vacuum great, UPS is U People Suck!!!!
column8: I have sent a review before, please read previous for my comments.  Quit sending me surveys. Thanks in advance.

I bought this vacuum as a replacement for a very old model that took bags. I have two big dogs that shed and I was tired of buying bags. When it arrived, I thought it had great features and was a nice design. The more I used it, the more cumbersome I thought it was. The large wheels do not roll well. I was thinking they needed lubrication but I could not find any place to lubricate them. Using this vacuum is like lugging a concrete block around. I should have sent it back, but I threw the box out! After 5 months, I was vacuuming carpet and the machine turned itself off. The power lights were still on and I was able to turn the brush back on but there was no suction. It appears that the motor that provides suction is dead. I looked for service centers and there is one in my area and it is a small mom and pop outfit. I was hoping to take it somewhere that would repair it in a couple of days. I was told it normally takes 2 to 3 weeks for a repair. What am I supposed to use till then? I vacuum every couple of days. I understand that things happen but it is just plain disappointing.

Had the vacuum just over a month.  Just emptied the cannister today.  We like it so far. Easy to move and pick-up (if necessary). Works well and has an excellent, stylish, futuristic look. Enjoying it so far!We have bare-floors and carpeted rooms - works good on both (but I usually use the bare floor attatchment for the bare floor). On the carpet the motorized head makes cleaning easy.

column7: Great for 7 weeks, in for repair 4 weeks...MAKE THAT 5 (it's 8 now ) WEEKS
column8: This was purchased because of the positive reviews & Consumer Report's recommendation.I was amazed at the performance of this product. I wanted to get a higher priced vac & was glad I did...at first. It sucked up animal hair & stray cat litter with great efficiency on both carpet & wood floors.It was also the quietest vac I've ever heard...in fact, on the 8th attempt to use it, there was no noise AT ALL!After vacuuming a 2 bedroom house 7 times, it wouldn't start. The power got to the machine but pushing the start button did nothing.Since I live in a rural town between 2 major cities to the north & south, I'd have to drive at least 45 miles to get this repaired. So I contacted 'Hoover's Exclusive Platinum Collection (TM) Member Services Line' ....impressive,eh?...I hope the folks working there get paid by their title, because all they do (& can do) is punch in your ZIP & tell u the location of the service center.They told me that the nearest service was 32 miles away in Tehachapi, CA. I replied, 'That is almost 100 miles & a 2 hour drive away' Their response? 'Well, that's what it says on our computer' So much for 'Hoover's Exclusive Platinum Collection (TM) Member Services'... it's just a call-center sweat shop.There is no repair available in Bakersfield or Santa Clarita. It took a drive of 75 miles & 1hr 45min to Los Angeles to get service.The repair center told me that Hoover is just a name & no longer a manufacturer. They also stated Hoovers are poorly made. The hose needs replacing on my vac. I asked how a hose can go bad after a couple of hours of use...'Poor quality' was their answer. It takes 'weeks' for them to get authorization to do a warranty repair & to get parts.It is now 18 days after I dropped it off, & the part isn't expected until next week.!!??$?% If anyone is interested, I'll update this review as time goes on....and on....and on.UPDATE  It's now day 27 since I left the vac for repair. No part has been sent to the Authorized repair facility. Another employee of the center stated that Hoover doesn't return their phone calls & that they are almost impossible to deal with.FINAL UPDATE: Are u ready for more comedy/tears? I'll make this short, but these events played out over several weeks...After numerous non-returned phone calls (where Hoover promised each time to return the calls) to both myself & the repair center, KINGDOM Sew & Vac (the repair center, in Simi Valley & LA) felt sorry for me & took it upon themselves to contact their west coast rep to get me a new vacuum. Once he got involved, I picked up the replacement w/in a couple of days (300 total miles driven). Mind you, I didn't buy the Vac from KINGDOM, they did this because of all the lies & delays by Hoover in supplying a replacement hose. If u live close to their stores I certainly recommend this family owned business.It's obvious that Hoover will go to extremes in order not to pay for a warranty repair. They have u'r money....now go away. They will lie to u (at one point they said the part was shipped, it wasn't) If it wasn't for a small conscientious retailer I might still be waiting & waiting & waiting.What do I do when this thing breaks again?!?@?$?^

column7: Not the vacuum for hard floors
column8: I bought this vacuum because it had been rated well for hard floors and pet hair.  What no one tells you is that for hard floors you have to take the motorized head off and put the very-common-no-moving-parts-head on.  Well, geez, any vacuum can clean a hard floor once you do that but unfortunately, on this model, that head constantly falls off while in use.  With the motorized head on, it will not pick up sand off a tile floor.  With the no-moving parts head on, it still takes repeated passes over sand to pick it up.  The no-moving parts head does work fine on pet hair on the tile floor, if it would stay on.  This vacuum works fine on my rugs. The best thing about this vacuum was how easy it was to empty the canister and how easy it was to pull the canister around.  The automatic cord winder is nice too. Otherwise this vacuum was inferior to my old Hoover upright in every way.  I have returned the unit.  Amazon was great about making that easy for me so I will do more research and order a different one from Amazon.

It all started when I agreed to look at a Rainbow for a friend, and I saw how much dirt my old vacuum was missing.  So I started looking for a replacement. I have an 18 month old and just knew that his runny noses had something to do with all that dirt that came from my carpet. Wanted to invest some money but not over $2,000 for the rainbow.  Looked at several Dyson's, and did not feel that they were well built, felt cheap and way too much plastic.  So I looked at consumer reports and this was at the top of the list. I could not find one in a store so I bought this unit without seeing it or trying it out.  I could not be happier with this vacuum.  Picks up so much more dirt than my upright ever did, and is perfect if you have a lot of hard floors. My childs runny noses are now few and far between.  I can also tell there is a lot less dust in my home between vacuums. The warranty is 6 years, which is a full year longer than Dyson as well.  Great purchase!!!!!

This unit is everything I expected.  It is a bit awkward due to the weight and size, but the vacuum ability well makes up for the added effort. It takes a little more room for storage.  The bagless feature is excellent and very easy to use.Good job Hoover!The unit was delivered as promised and the vendor worked well with me.

I have always been a canister vacuum person. Had Sears Kenmore previously which lasted me 17 years with only one repair. Thought I would try another brand thinking the technology may have come a long way. Did a lot of internet research and chose this Hoover. However, I am not overly impressed. Let's start with the pros: it's bagless... 6 yr. warranty... love the under furniture swivel action... not too noisy... telescoping handle comes in handy. The cons are: bulky to handle... not powerful enough... attachments don't click into handle (including beater bar) so they keep disconnecting from handle while vacuuming... floor brush has no spot to be held on canister... retractable cord has to be fed back in, does not retract on it's own... beater bar does not pick up everything on carpets even at the lowest setting. Having said all that, I think the negatives outweigh the positives. It does an OK job but not great. I'm disappointed.

I just received this last week and it is a great vacuum. Great suction, does a really good job on carpets and excellent on hardwood floors. It feels real solid.Pieces go together with a solid feel and it just feels like quality. And it is VERY quiet, cannot believe how quiet it is for something so powerful. And it is so easy to clean out the canister. It comes off easy, you hold it over the garbage and push a button and bottom opens and junk falls out...so easy. I have owned several through the years mostly uprights, but wanted something that is good and will last. So far so good. And it has a very cool look to it!!!

column7: F A I L E D
column8: This vacuum is very portable, quiet, and efficient---IF it works. This expensive vacuum cleaner FAILED immediately. Bought in March and it failed within a few weeks. The hose loses its connection at the on/off wand-handle and constantly cuts off dead while in use. Have to wait a while before the vacuum will turn on again and when it is switched-on, after just a few vacuuming passes, it cuts off dead again. An extreme disappointment for the price.

I had an upright bagless before, compared to it, this is so much better.  Canister is easier to maneuver and gets into the corners and small spaces better.  This is very powerful with half the noise.  My dog is not even scared of me vacuuming anymore!  It cleans up all the dog hair; i really like the smaller power attachment to clean the couch.  The canister dumps out from the bottom which is a great feature and makes it much easier/cleaner to empty.

It took me weeks of research to order this vacuum and I did it based on reviews. Sadly, in my opinion, it really should have better suction and I've got it at max suction on the appropriate floor/carpet setting. Also, it's a bit heavy and cumbersome. Unfortunately there weren't any stores anywhere in my area that carried these in house for me to demo before I bought. I would not buy it if I had the chance to do it over.

column7: Solid performer for this price point
column8: To start, I should mention that I'm hard on vacuums. We have different flooring types, multiple levels in the house, animals, long hair and children, as well as living in a never ending construction zone in the center of allergy alley.  Thus, I need a fairly heavy performing vacuum that manages flooring transitions as well as being able to do stairs and furniture.If that weren't asking a lot already, I need it to be heavy enough to be multifiltered and high powered, but light enough that I can tote it up the stairs.I've had the Platinum Hoover Canister for a 3 months now, and I've been pleased with the performance.  This one replaced a previous Windtunnel, and while I miss a few things from the old version (like different power settings), all in all, the new version outperforms the older version.Pros:Suction is fantastic.  Transitioning from area rugs to hardwoods and then to carpet is easy.  Super long power cord lets you do multiple areas without having to unplug and replug. Filters, filters, filters.  Allergies in the house have become noticeably better with this unit. It's a lot more quiet that previous versions.  Powerhead is fantastic for getting critter hair off the furniture and drapes. Reset button on the main head is a wonderful thing, if like me, you have ninja shoelaces in unlikely places; such as those cleverly hidden by small children who have kicked their shoes under the couch.  Almost no dust escapes the vacuum while it is running, and while it is all in one unit...but that leads us to the cons...Cons:Emptying this vacuum is not for the wheezy.  You will get dirty, you will have a cloud of dust, you will curse yourself and the Hoover engineers if you make the mistake of emptying it in the house.  Trust me on this one.  The only good way to empty it is to take the canister out to your big trash can, standing upwind and praying.As well, the canister has collection areas that cannot be touched, washed or otherwise cleaned.  I realize that the engineering design behind this was to keep the user away from the dirt, but it also means that if something gets caked in there, like if you clean on a humid day...you're kinda hosed. (No pun intended....ok, a *little* intended.) It's as though the engineers had *seen* someone use a vacuum, but didn't actually vacuum anything themselves, and so hadn't quite worked through the final step of cleaning the vacuum itself.Still, the minor inconvenience of what I think is a poor engineering decision on that one part, is outweighed by the performance, the price point, and the significant reliability that I've gotten from other Hoover products.For a neat person with a small space, this vacuum is probably overkill...but for large houses filled with dirt tracking children and animals...this vac is a clear winner in it's price range.

I got this machine on 02/10/10 because consumer reports wrote great reviews on it said it was the best. I had it 1 wk and 3 days and used it one time, the wand where you turn on/off didn't turn the machine off you had to unplug from the wall.I called Hoover and they told me to take it to the one & only repair shop for Hoover in Rochester,NY. I took it in and they said about 2-3 wks. (the circuit board had failed.) Well I waited 4 wks then called them and they said the parts from Hoover are on b/o status. I called Hoover and ask if they would replace the machine and the girl said yes you have waited long enough. Well long story short she didn't, she made me wait for the b/o parts. Then I called Hoover back and got a manager on the phone and ask who from Hoover is going to clean my house since it is going on 5 wks w/o a vacuum to clean with. She made a call that day to the shop and they told her the same thing they were told parts on b/o status. Then she called me back and said a new machine was on it's way. I did get it but by no means is their service up to taking care of the cust. All is ok w/ the new machine so far. But to have a circuit board go on the 1st use of the machine. Bad quality parts from Hoover.

After much comparison shopping, I finally settled on this Hoover cannister. I received it mid-week and am so impressed with how well it cleans. My carpets are 15 yrs old, and I swear, I could see the color return more to original with the dirt lifting out with the vacuum.It was easy assembly, and fairly easy to pull around from place to place. The powerhead is quite wide & this seems to be giving me the most problems, as it is wider than my previous sweeper, but I'm sure I'll get used to the maneuverability of the powerhead. Also, the hose feeds into the very bottom of the cannister (I think this  is part of the 'cyclonic' design), and I often seem to be pulling the cannister up, instead of along.The suction is impressive, and I prefer being able to dump dirt (and dog hair) as needed as opposed to waiting for a bag to fill. The prior sweeper I had was also bagless, so I'm somewhat familiar with needing to be directly over the trashcan before dumping the dusty load. This model is fairly easy to empty, but again, you need to be right over your trash container.I like the auto shutoff feature on the powerhead (found this out when I sucked up a sock with first running!). That should save on belts in the future. The telescoping wand is a nice feature, and the cord seems to be of more-than-adequate length.One huge determining factor in my purchase was the 6 year warranty offered by Hoover. I realize I am still in the 'honeymoon' phase, and comparing my 10 yr old Fantom with this new Hoover, but I am quite impressed so far & would recommend it at this point.

My ancient Oreck upright finally sucked in its last bit of air at the age of 30. I analyzed my real cleaning needs and decided it was time for a canister vac, since our floors are wood and tile with just a few area rugs. South Florida has peculiar cleanling issues, too. Several reviews later, I found this model Hoover and read nothing discouraging about it except for the weight. No one stocked this machine within all of South Florida, so I ordered it from Amazon. I didn't have to pay shipping and it arrived right away.  The machine cleans thoroughly and it easy to operate, although it is weighty; I particularly love the fact that there are no bags, it has a HEPA filter and no dust escaping into the air. My one slight negative about it is that it could have better suction on the carpets (it is true that there is nothing like an upright for this)however, my house has not been this clean since we first moved in six years ago.  I highly recommend this machine to anyone who has a lot of tile to sweep and sliding glass door troughs to clean. It takes up one whole side of a closet when stored, so I wouldn't advise this for someone living in a limited amount of space.  Well worth the money so far--I have had this just a couple of months.

I received the vac promptly and in good packaging from amazon.  What I got was a heavy and, at first glance, a well built machine.  However, when I tried to put it away after use I found that the cord return spring was faulty and didn't work betond pulling the cord halfway back.I contacted amazon and got a replacement within days which is the kind of service I've come to expect from amazon.  The trouble was that the replacement had exactly the same problem!  In fact this cord doesn't return at all.I'm avoiding Hoover from now on.

Recently I purchased the Hoover S3865 Platinum Cyclonic Bagless Canister with all accessories and so far I am very well pleased with this unit.  I was surprised at the amount of dirt dust and dander this machine picks up, has great suction and does not lose it.  I have a dog and cat who constantly seem to shed even with good grooming really picks up the pet hair.  I am impressed with the way it handles,however the suction hose is a bit stiff, but I do like all the attachments and the way it cleans.  The power nozzle does a great job on the carpets and is very easy to maneuver about the bedrooms.  Love the swivel action it has as well as the bare floor brush.  If I need another vacuum in the future I will definitely revisit the Hoover family.

This is an amazing vacuum. I just received it today and vacuumed the whole house with it. Although I have been maintaining and vacuuming my home very well, you can't believe the amount of dust and particles it took out from my house! It has a great suction power and the power head is acting amazingly on carpets. My carpets now look fresh. Like new!!! I wish I did take a picture of before and after to show you the huge difference it has made. Also, for some reason the picture didn't make me realize about it is huge in size! This is a big vacuum and you will need some fare amount of room to store it. With that big size, moving it around for me was a piece of cake because of it's clever portability design. The power head had 3 levels to adjust the height of your carpet which became handy on my home while vacuuming both carpets and rugs. It also comes with a smaller head to let you vacuum the stairs. Everything is so high quality and great. It's looks 10 times better than the same priced Dyson brands. I loved it so far. Very recommended.

I spent so much time researching a good canister vacuum cleaner purchase that I decided to write.The other two reviews were very helpful so I wanted to give something back. Because I saw how much can cost a set of bags for some vacuums, I decided to look for a bagless canister vacuum. I have more wood floor that carpet. Please understand this review covers just the first week. Since the machine just arrived. I like that is bagless, and the fact that the cylinder is transparent, you can see how much dirty sucks up from the floor! Easy to take off the dust. Strong handgrip features electronic control buttons for power on and off, variable suction.Tools are easily attached to the telescoping wand made in metal. Not very noisy. I little heavy, but it gives you a feeling that it is more well made with strong material.

I received this Vacuum about a month ago.  This is the first canister vacuum I have ever owned.  The suction works great on carpet and my hard wood floor as well. It does not kick dust and debri back out like my old vacuum did.  It fits nicely under my couches, beds, and dining room table.  I love that you can adjust the level of suction so you can use it on different throw rugs in the house.  The dirt trap needs to be emptied often.  I carry a plastic bag with me and empty when needed.  It helps keep dust down.  The hose detaches easily at the top near handle or at the bottom at the touch of a button with your foot. It is not loud either.  Overall I am very happy with this vacuum.  I am glad I purchased after reading tons of other reviews on other vacuums.

I have owned or used many vacuums over the years including a Kenmore,Tristar and 2 Simplicity.This vacuum is by far the best one I have ever used.Well worth the money.The 6 year warranty was defininatly a plus.The only drawback is it is a little on the heavy side,but I knew that before I bought it.

column7: Why can't I give a zero rating
column8: I hate this vacuum cleaner so much I can't even put into words. There are ZERO pro's for this machine. It is heavy, it is dirty, it works terrible, and it was definitely not actually designed for animal hair. I decided to spare no expense to replace this piece of garbage and have now bought a Dyson and I am feeling relieved already. I have had it for over 3 years so at least it has lasted longer than others on here..... but I have EARNED THOSE THREE YEARS! After every time I used it I pull the whole thing apart - I unscrew the bottom pieces so I can remove it and get all the guncked up dog hair out from around the belt, I remove the suction filter to get the dust out from in and around it.... and every few minutes I have to empty the stuff from the bin. I cannot believe that a vacuum built for dog hair will so easily allow it to show up in every nook and cranny where it shouldn't be and impede it's performance. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS!! I am going to be lucky if I can give mine away.

column7: Decent performance. Design seems comfortable. Rolls easily
column8: Don't understand why all these crabby housewives have been squawking negatively!  Perhaps they need to stop hiring cleaning ladies and start pushing the vacuum themselves for a brighter spirit!Got this through middle class 'Gay, Bath and Beyond' last month...and no problems yet!
This vacuum came with no belt. Nothing is more infuriating than having to go out find BUY and then install a belt on a brand new vacuum !!!!

All of the one star reviews about this vacuum are correct. worst vacuum I've ever owned. whatever it picks up does not go into the tray, it gets stuck in hose, filter, or somewhere other than the tray.

This product broke within the first month of using it.  Pet hair and dust filled up the top portion of the dirt catcher.  When I went to remove the top portion to clean it out the filter is supposed to twist off.  It would not because it had too much dirt packed inside and would not twist.  I tried to manually remove the dirt and eventually had to use another vacuum cleaner to vacuum out the Bissell Pet Hair Eraser so I could use it.  What a waste of time and money!  Ten years ago I purchased a Bissel Green Machine.  It also failed within the first month of use.  I should have learned my lesson then.  'Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.' Albert Einstein.
After just short of a year, the vacuum is no longer picking up dirt.  I have tried several things to fix it, but it's time to purchase a new vac....and it will NOT be a Bissell.

column7: Disgusting Waste of Sweat, Time, & Money
column8: This is the most useless, filthiest vacuum I have ever owned, used, or seen.  I have yet to have seen even a shop vac in an industrial environment that is dirtier than this.  Plus, it's not hardly effective at all.  The canister is easy to use, but the seal/filter system is poorly designed. It is easy to have the canister unnoticeably misaligned blowing dirt everywhere.  If it is lined up correctly, dirt surrounds the outside of the canister while in the inside of the vacuum and, as you take it out, drops dust/dirt everywhere.  All of that also assumes the hosing attachment stays connected in the back.  Mine doesn't and it's easy to miss; thus, once again, dirt goes everywhere.  It's aggrivating vacuuming a room only to find out you just made it worse and now have to clean/check every surface in the room.  The attachments are pretty much for show and that includes the hose.  On top of that, this flop is cumbersome and difficult to push...and I'm a 200+ lb. man.  This is so poor a product that Bissell should be ashamed. This machine exists for the sole purpose of fleecing pet-owning customers. I would give it 0 stars if I could.  PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE believe the other negative reviews.  They're spot on.  And, no, I don't work for a competitor.

Everything the other reviewers have said is absolutely true. I have a Yellow Lab and a Golden Doodle. The Lab sheds quite a bit so seeing this vacuum I figured that it would do the trick. Initially it picked up everything I pushed it over. You will fill the dirt cannister only about a quarter of the way and as the dirt spins around, instead of distributing equally throughout the cannister, it piles up one side of the vacuum and quickly quits suctioning anything. Emptying it is as dirty a task as you could imagine. The filters plug up almost everytime you use it, and the whole thing needs to be torn down for cleaning. I am so fed up with this cyclonic piece of junk, I can't say what I really think on this site, but understand, it is not worth buying in any shape or form. I almost think I am ready to go back to bagger vacs. At least they worked dependably. Remove the bag and pitch it!

In the 14 months that I've owned this model, I've had to replace the brush-roll assembly 3 times (a $20 part).  Also, it has a poor design where the internal dirt-carrying suction tubing has a 90-degree bend that continually clogs with pet hair.  Given that this model is titled the 'Pet Hair Eraser,' that is unacceptable.  The last straw came last week when the motor began shrieking, rendering the unit unusable without extensive repair.  I encourage you to benefit from my suffering and not buy this model.

column7: Works fine if you don't have a dog or carpet.
column8: Like the other reviewers, this vacuum worked great for the first few weeks. Now after a few months of frustrated ownership, I'm ready to drop kick it to the ditch. Why in Heaven's name 'they' can put a man on the moon, but the cannot make a decent vacuum cleaner. I guess I will have to bite the bullet and by a Dyson. I could have had one by now had I'd realized a few short years ago that buying all these junk vacuums, I could have saved myself the money and aggravation by buying a quality Dyson product.The problem with this vacuum is the dirt and hair get hung up in the bottom part of the hose as it curves up into the the machine. It requires a small phillips head screw driver and 2 screws to remove the hose. From there you have to hold the machime upside down and shake the dirt and hair from the clogged area. While the clogging is taking place, the rotating brush becomes full of hair and can barely turn. As my vacuum lays 'dead' on my floor, I hesitate to put it back together and vacuum again. My husband just cleaned this stupid thing out about 2 weeks prior. I may just get my daughter's $20 vacuum broom and use it, works better than this stupid thing.

column7: Horrible Vacuum - not meant for pet hair
column8: I bought this vacuum less than 6 months ago.  It was never great to begin with, but now it has completely stopped picking up pet hair.  Instead, it just clumps the hair all over the carpet.  Do not waste your money on this vacuum!!

column7: Don't buy this poorly designed vacuum! Details:
column8: I bought this machine on the spur of the moment because my previous vacuum cleaner broke and this one seemed to be specifically designed to deal with pet hair. So, it's my own fault I'm so unhappy with this machine.  Some specific problems:- This vacuum is heavy, but it has no flat surfaces which would allow it to be picked up and moved easily. It's dangerously awkward.  You'll be able to give up your gym membership if you buy this machine.- The machine is mostly composed of hard plastic. It is the least 'flexible' machine I've ever owned.  This hard plastic is going to break sooner, rather than later.- Maintenance is horrific. Dirt and hair accumulate everywhere, but you need a degree in mechanical engineering to figure out how to disassemble and re-install the hard-plastic 'cyclonic' tube feature in the upper part of this made-in-Korea vacuum. It's obvious that that item needs to be removed from the machine in order to get to all the pet hair which accumulates in the upper part of the machine, but getting that item in and out of the machine is a nightmare. The plastic is totally unyielding, so one is afraid to put too much twist onto the item for fear of the hard plastic breaking.  A person who is not mechanically inclined would very possibly be unable to remove the item; getting it back in is just as bad and isa matter of operating in the blind.- The vacuum hose separates from the body of the vacuum very easily.  This means that if you are vacuuming you may discover that you were actually sucking up absolutely nothing.  The motor is so noisy that you would possibly not even notice that the machine was not actually vacuuming.  So get prepared to have to do it all over again once you re-connect the hose to the body of the machine.- It takes 2 people to use this machine on a set of stairs; it's just too dangerous and awkward do it alone.The one nice feature of this model - it got a really long power cord, and that's about it.

When using the hose attachment stuff will be kicked up by the rollers and out the open chamber created when your remove the hose to use it.the vacuum is quite heavy.easily falls backwards while using hose atachment.on hardwood or bare floors it simply kicks things around rather than pick it up.Requires routine cleaning of the entire machine to keep it semi-useful.In the beginning this worked great, over time its simply become a hassle and a mess.

I would like to start this review by saying this is the worst machine I have ever used.  Do not buy this vacuum because you will be very disappointed.The only good thing about this vacuum was the upholstery cleaning attachment.  I will keep this and use it with my other vacuum.  That being said it is not worth buying this just for one attachment because the vacuum does not work and you won't be able to use it anyway.  Unless you have a vacuum that already works.The worst part about this vacuum is that it has poor suction.  The first time I used it, it worked okay.  Every time after that now it just gets worse and worse.  The only thing you can do is completely take apart the machine to get it working again, but that only lasts for one vacuuming session then you have to do it again.  This is very messy and annoying.  The canister is way to small.  I vacuum about once a week and I have a dog with short hair.  This vacuum will do half a room and then needs to be emptied.  The canister is also poorly designed.  Only the bottom of the canister slides out of the machine. Every time you take it off dust and hair will fall on the machine especially if you vacuum to much and overfill the bottom.  Needless to say the vacuum gets dirty very quick and you loose about 25% of what you just vacuumed up onto the machine and floor.  The vacuum itself is large and bulky and not easy to vacuum around things.  It originally came with a hair magnet attached to the front.  I quickly removed this because it did nothing and is just in the way.  The switch to turn it on is on the front of the machine and it is small.  Why would you put the switch on the front where you can't see it.  Every time you want to turn it off or on you have to stop and look around the front for the switch.  This is just bad design.  The attachments hook to the handle, but fall off all the time.This vacuum is terrible.  It is called a pet hair eraser, but pet hair will easily kill this machine.  It can not handle carpet very well.  Expect to make a dozen passes before it is at all clean and there still will be dirt lines left behind.  This machine finally got to me about 9 months after using it.  It would not pick anything up and I was sick and tired of taking it apart so I smashed it into pieces on my back porch.  It seemed to be the best use for this vacuum.Do not buy this.  It will make you angry every time you use it until you decide enough is enough.  Just make sure you keep your old vacuum around because you'll need it.  I'm back to using my 20 year old hand me down and it still works better than this did.

I've owned this vacuum for 3 years and i'd say it worked well for maybe one...if that.  The tools that come with the vacuum are nice, but when the main part of the vacuum doesn't do it's job it's completely useless.  I recently purchased a LG LuV400T and was wowed.  After using the Bissel for over an hour on a Monday the LG picked up an entire canister full of dirt and pet hair 3 days later.  Bissel was completely useless.

Had I been able to give this 0 stars I would have. We bought the vacuum from Lowe's and brought it home. We turned it on to use the upholstery brush and the brush broke after one couch cushion. We immediately went to Lowe's and exchanged it for a 'new' one. Got home and hooked it to the vacuum and it also did not work.
