The vacuum had great suction for about the first 10 minutes than it had almost none. We primarily bought it because of its claim to pick up animal hair, we have 3 cats, it did not pick up the hair, it was still stuck to the couch. It also claims that the HEPA filter catches 99.9% of all dust and dander, yet we could wipe the dust off the outside of the vacuum and the inside of the HEPA door. It took 3 or 4 swipes at an area to clean it because it would spit stuff backwards at your feet. Horrible, awful vacuum. We bought it today and will be returning it when the store opens tomorrow. Don't be fooled by the claims the vacuum makes and it's reasonable price, it will fail you.

This is not a good vacuum cleaner. I bought it to supplement the 40 dollar Wal Mart Bissell vacuum because I have 3 indoor cats. I thought I would be impressed by the pet hair eraser tools to get the cat hair off the couch.  This vacuum was constantly getting clogged and unclogging it is a pain and very messy. The overall suction started off great and then declined quickly.  Yes, the filters have been changed.  The dirt container is SMALL and needs to be emptied about every room.  Emptying it also causes dust to fly everywhere.  The motor burned out after about 20 uses.  Even if the motor worked fine, the mess that this vacuum creates with its frequent emptying and clogging is enough to rate it 1 star.My cheap Bissell still works great after 4.5 years.  I'm hoping I will be able to use the attachments with it.

This vacuum cleaner worked pretty well while it worked, but that was only for 1 year. (That was vacuuming two medium sized rooms and a hallway once every 1-2 weeks.) Totally not worth the money and the landfill space.I have 3 big issues with this machine:1) It broke in about 1 year2) It has a bag-less chamber that the dirt and whatnot SHOULD fall into, but in reality, all the dirt and dust gets trapped up inside the non-removable filter area (you can remove the filter, but not that upper chamber). This is such a pain in the ass to clean and deal with--the machine gets filthy, your hands get filthy, the ground around you gets filthy--and that's just about every time you vacuum.3) When using the hose, the main body of the vacuum is unstable and almost always falls over (unless I hold onto it with one hand while hosing with the other, LAME). A couple times, it came very close to falling on top of my pug, thank goodness he's still a pup and has quick reflexes. Not a pet-friendly feature for a pet vacuum. An easy fix would be if the hose was designed to come out of the side or front versus the back.I think it's probably better to spend a bit more money on a machine that will last; it will save you money in the long run.

Like the previous reviewer I have had my share of issues with this vacuum.  The brush broke after the first month and over time I lost suction.  I have tried cleaning and changing filters but it only solves the problem for about a day and then you are back to square one. The resevoir for the dirt is small for a vacuum that is picking up dog hair. I constantly had to empty the container, clean the filter, etc...  I finally broke down and spent more money on a new vacuum.  I went back to the brand That I trust and couldn't be happier.  What happened to my bissel?  I had to take it to my office where there are no pets, kids and barely any dirt or dust.  It might do just fine there.

Oh boy...The handle on this vacuum doesn't lock in place.  It's very dangerous.  Last night, after checking to ensure that the handle was locked, I moved the vacuum.  In doing so, the handle promptly broke and the vacuum landed on my foot, cutting it and creating a swelling the size of a walnut.Additionally, the attachements fall off the allotted storage areas on the vacuum.The suction for the attachment hose is very low.  This cleaner worked well for about two weeks and now I will have to chuck it.  I'm only had it for 4 months and haven't been this disappointed in a product in a long time.This is the first negative Amazon review I have ever written.

We purchased our vacuum about three years ago, when our other one died.  We have two dogs, and the other vacuum just couldn't pick up all of the hair off the carpet.  The first time we used the Bissell, I was STUNNED at how much hair, dirt, dust and fuzz came up off of the carpet.  We had a half-full container just from the living room alone, and this is after vacuuming every few days normally.  Amazing!  I can't fault normal wear and tear on this unit as being a down-side.  We use the heck out of it, and with three kiddos and two dogs, it's on a nearly daily basis.  A few things have broken over time, like the plastic clips that hold the hose up and one of the power cord wraps as well, but that's about it.  It runs strong, works very well, and we will be buying another one here shortly.  Our middle child tipped over the vaccum from the upright position and it snapped a plastic piece on the bottom where the release lever is, so it doesn't stay upright like it should.Only downside is the beater brush doesn't stop running, ever.  It's always spinning, and if you lay the vacuum down while using the hose attachment, it exposes the spinning brush, which inevitably attracts little fingers.  My daughter got a brush burn on her finger from it, but it was my fault for not paying attention.Anyway, good vacuum for the money!

column7: Bissell doesn't stand behind their products
column8: When I first purchased this it worked great, practically sucked the carpet off the floor and great on cat fur. I cleaned the filters and emptied the collection cup every time I used it. Unfortunately after about a week of use it stopped sucking at all. Upon closer inspection I noticed the belt was broken so I purchased a new one and installed it. After just few minutes the new belt broke.I called the store where I purchased it but I couldn't return it because I no longer had the receipt. (note to self, keep receipts) So I called bissell and they said I must have installed the belt incorrectly or something got caught in it! Installing a belt is not brain surgery, it only goes in one way.I took it to my local vacuume repair shop and it cost over $100 to repair. The repairman pointed out where the belt had melted both the bottom and top of the plastic plates that hold the belt in place, chewing up the edges. That's why the second belt broke, the chewed up edges cut it as it spun around. He said he sees a lot of this model of Bissell with the same issue. The belts are not installed correctly at the factory!!!!I will never purchase another Bissell, if they aren't going to stand behind their product why should I?

column7: 2.5 a stars for a critical design flaw
column8: I have this machine and it stopped working after two months. First it began to accumulate dirt at the top of reservoir, then it completely stop sucking stuff. But I found both short and long term solutions to this problem if you have the same machine:First, short term solution: If your machine has performance problems, what you should do now is to dissemble all the hoses and check inside of them (There is one screw that you have to deal with, prepare your screw driver). Dirt has already accumulated there, as a result it can not suck anything. Especially the long wobbly hose accumulates things a lot. The mini hose connected to bottom also accumulates dirt. Also check two plastic hoses you just dissembled . One of these plastic hoses (the one connected to wobbly one) accumulates dirt as well. Clean all of these, clean the filters, and you'll see machine operating again.Good news is that, after this initial operation there is a way of making the vacuum function and not letting dirt accumulate in hoses or at the top of reservoir. Remember if you see dirt stucking at the top of reservoir, there is something wrong and you have to do the procedure I have defined in second paragraph.For long term maintenance here is the trick you should do: You have to wash small foam air filter (that is in the drawer at the bottom of dirt cup). I am not talking about the hepa filter on side, beware. You have to clean that foam filter (it is thankfully very easy to clean, just wash it) every two-three uses of machine. If you don't clean it, machine will operate, but there will be no air circulation or no cyclone in the reservoir, and as a result dirt will accumulate first at the top of reservoir as I've described it, then in hoses and machine will stop sucking things. You need air movement in the reservoir to avoid accumulation of dirt at the top and in hosesI know, this is a very bad and weak design, but that is how it operates.

column7: Perfectly fine for the price range
column8: As the keeper of many offspring, two dogs & two cats, I am hard on vacuum cleaners. And times being what they are, my latest replacement had to be in a lower price range than previously. So I researched, chose a machine on sale for about 100 dollars more than this one, then decided the funds weren't there, and went for the bargain.When buying a vacuum cleaner, it's important to consider how often you use it, how much you mind fussing with filters, collection containers and attachments, and also what floors you're most using it on. Some cleaners work better on certain types of floors. If price is no object, you can choose a model based on very specific needs and desires. But at this price range, what you should expect is mainly good suction, reasonable durability, and smooth operation. This model seems to cover all three points so far. I like that there are many floor level settings, the way it rolls, and the length of the cord. I don't mind emptying the canister; I like it much better than old bag style cleaners, partly because I can see my progress as I work.Because my very cheap interim cleaner was not good at picking up dog hair, my first few outings with this one meant stopping to empty the collection container after each room. It was upsetting to realize how much I'd been missing lately, but gratifying to see it emptied into the garbage can. At the end of the cleaning tour, I rinsed out the container, checked the sponge filter, and was satisfied with the day's progress. Each time I've used it since then, there's been less hair than before. The pet eraser tool works fine on one of my two large area rugs, but less so on the other one. I think it needs a real steam cleaning at this point, to be honest.I haven't had any problems keeping the attachments in place, I like the strap that came with it to use with the lift out canister, and the floor attachment is very useful. For the money, I'd say it's a fine value. It may not have the gravitas of a 400+ dollar machine, but I wouldn't expect it to. I got what I paid for; a decent, practical value that should last for awhile with proper care.

Bissell 3920 upright vacuum:  A DOG!!  Has very little suction; won't pull the dirt up through the hoses to the filter.  The carpet is getting clean, you can hear the sounds of dirt being sucked up & then you notice that the filter is still clean and shiny.  So you get out the screw drivers, take the hoses apart, fish down inside with sticks and wires to pull the dirt out by hand.And what comes out?  Golf balls?  Oranges?  No, just a little piddly pile of dirt and some rug-fluff even the cheapest vacuum could pull up - one would think.  The hoses are cheap plastic, come apart easily (I guess they knew we'd have to be able to take it apart each time and pull the dirt out ourselves).  And you don't have to do this after every few times - you have to do this after every ten minutes of vacuuming!  Also, the attachments also come loose while you're vacuuming, so they're useless.I bought this on impulse, thinking that a 'Bissell' was one of the best - WRONG!

column7: Save your money; don't buy Bissel if you own real" pets."
column8: Selecting a new vacuum cleaner was a matter of urgency when our old vacuum died, just three years old. We knew we were demanding of our vacuums and immediately I sat down to research the best, praying I wouldn't have to shell out $500 for a Dyson. This is a point over which my husband and I fought repeatedly, as he was pro-Dyson and I was convinced I could find something comparable for less. As much as it pains me to say this, he was right.Both our parents purchased Dysons some three to five years ago and while my parents have had a few problems with wear and tear (probably what you get when you buy a refurbished unit), his parents are still singing high praises.For approximately the first month, this vacuum was fabulous. Everything I'd hoped for. With two fairly large dogs (a Rottweiler and a Rottweiler-Lab mix) the Battle of the Fuzz was very real and ongoing. Certainly there were major design flaws--namely the fact that I had to slap the heck out of the canister to get the fur and dust, always lodged around the filter at the top, to fall into the canister so I could remove and empty it.As time went on I became more and more disillusioned and I stopped asking my husband to vacuum or I'd hear a constantly muttered 'Should have gotten a Dyson' the entire time he pushed the vacuum around the room (fruitlessly), cursing as he went.The sponge filter in the side compartment quickly clogged and now requires washing every week if we are vacuuming more than once a day (necessary with such large dogs). We learned quickly not to sprinkle the baking soda-based carpet refresher because we'd find soda in the canister for the next six vacuum sessions.The addition of a third dog (a Tosa) was the death knell for the Bissel. It doesn't even try anymore. While the Tosa doesn't appear to shed all that much, apparently he was the straw that broke the Bissel's back because most days I feel I'm simply rearranging the dirt.This vacuum does not have the suction to really pull any sort of accumulated fur off the carpet and I shudder to think of how much dander has worked its way down to the carpet pad. In addition, I find that the dander and dead skin from the dogs frequently clumps up the 'intake,' which is nearly impossible to clean (SCRAPE) out considering the angle.Unless you own a Mexican Hairless or a Handbag Dog, don't even bother. When we move we'll be leaving this piece of junk on the curb. And to my husband's 'I-told-you-so' delight, our next vacuum will be a Dyson.

This thing does a great job, however it could use some improvements. For one, the attachments do not stay in place whenever you bump the cleaner into anything. For the price of this cleaner, I would like it to be made more solidly than plastic. This has a much better air filter than another model we tried. It was less expensive and it showed. The Bissel was more expensive, but worth this price. We own a Kirby, and it is getting to heavy for my wife to lug up and down stairs. We have owned our vacuum cleaner for about 8 months now at it still works great, though it is a pain to take apart to clean it at times.  We have three dogs and this machine does a fantastic job of getting all the pet hair up. And the heppa filtration does a terrific job of filtering out oders as it cleans. Our Kirby locks in pet dander smell and everytime we used it, the air in our home stunk all day!

column7: The Worst Vacuum I have Ever Owned
column8: This vacuum worked great for the first week. Wonderful, actually, and had I written this review then I am sure I would have given it five stars. However, after the first two weeks the problems began. I must admit, when deciding which vacuum to purchase I read many reviews, including the negative reviews for this vacuum, and did not heed them. I wish I had listened now. But having two indoor dogs (one of which sheds quite a bit) I thought this vacuum would be a good fit (I was wrong of course).After the first week the trouble started with all the dust, dirt, and dog hair the vacuum picked up being piled up at the very top of the vacuum's inside (where I'd have to take the front part of the vacuum apart and take out the top part to get it all out. This is very messy, and I thought this alone was bad enough -now I have to do this every time I use this vacuum (on the rare occassion this vacuum actually picks up anything).After the second week or so the tiny drawer on the bottom (I forget what these are called) started accumulating all the dust and dog hair, and the vacuum picked up nothing else besides what it could cram in this little drawer.Now, after about a month or so of owning it, this vacuum picks up nothing. It has lost all suction. when I turn the vacuum over the tube that is supposed to suck all the dog hair and dust up is crammed full of my yellow lab's hair mixed with dust. When I try to get it all out (again, extremely messy) it still doesn't pick up much at all. I have checked again and again for clogs and gotten them out again and again, and it still doesn't help this vacuum. It is ridiculous.My vacuum is perpetually on RED, which I have to tell you is the most annoying thing EVER. I have owned many vacuums in my life. And the Dirt Devil this vacuum replaced lasted me for almost 5 years and even at the end of it's life worked better than this piece of crap vacuum is today after only one month of use.Soooo, buyer beware. If you've read this review you've been warned. This is the most high maitenance vacuum I have ever used in my life. It has lasted in my house (with two dogs) for a total of one month and a week and a half.I will be getting a new vacuum soon, because even though I think it's ridiculous that I should have to pay for another vacuum so soon, I like having a clean house and a clean carpet. You have been warned. And I will never buy a Bissell product again.

I bought this vacuum about 4 weeks ago and the front brush has only worked one time. This vacuum is a god awful headache and a waste of money. Unfortunately the store I bought it from will not take it back since I got it to work once. I believe the motor/belt is bad. That shouldn't happen to a straight-out-of-the-box cleaner! Never buying Bissell again.

My wife and I purchased a similar Bissell vacuum cleaner about 4 years ago. It worked great, the only drawback was that my wife complained about it being heavy. So reluctantly, I sold the Bissell and purchased a Hoover Rewind vacuum cleaner. It was much lighter than the Bissell, but it did NOT clean like the Bissell. About a month ago, my wife finally got the nerve to tell me she hated the Hoover and wanted anther Bissell. I reminded her about the weight, but she didn't care.Needless to say, my wife and I are very happy with the hnew PowerClean  Bissell! It's heavier than the Hoover, but lighter than the old Bissell. It is also much easier to empty the container when it's full. And yes, it does clean, just like the old Bissell! It's a heavier vacuum, but you can tell that it's much more sturdy. With a 5 year warranty, you can't go wrong.This vacuum cleaner is really one of the best you can find. Vacuum your carpet with your old vacuum cleaner and then go over it with the Bissell. You'll pick up more dirt and a lot of fine dust left behind when using the old vacuum cleaner. You'll be amazed!

I've had the pleasure of using this vacuum cleaner for a few weeks and it does an amazing job of cleaning with just the right combination of power, size, and features.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this vacuum cleaner to anyone looking for value and features.

column7: Perfect Replacement for my old Healthy Home 5770
column8: I broke my excellent Bissell Healthy Home 5770. It did not break- i broke it, just to be perfectly clear that it had nothing to do with how that product was made etc. It was an excellent vacuum and I would have easily repurchased that same vacuum again except for being a discontinued model it is now more expensive than the new model healthy home- and this PowerClean model only lacks the microbial aspect of the healthy home and is cheaper. Given that they both have the same hepa filters and the same design i opted for this vacuum instead of a newer model healthy homeA new vacuum was not in my budget- as i was not planning on breaking my 4 year old Bissell so cost was a consideration but i wanted something POWERFUL. Dyson was not an option as it is in my opinion prohibitively expensive- sorry but 600$ vacuum... um NO.So at first i looked at the new model healthy home and that is about 200$, this was pushing it so i decided to just look at other vacuums altogether. I ended up with the Shark - the purple one, the one with over 800 amazon reviews. I vacuumed once with it- put it back in the box and returned it. It lacks the suction and power that my old healthy home had- i expected for it to be amazing, not only for the reviews but also for the simple fact that 4 years had gone by since i last purchased a vacuum- i thought technology would improve- i mean like 5 more Iphones came out in that time frame.So then i went on the bissell website did a comparision and i see this awesome vacuum that with the current rebate is going to be 160$.  I ordered it- it has ALL the features my old Bissell had but appears to be a more compact upgraded version.I get it home put it together.This vacuum is narrower than my old healthy home- slightly more compact, weighs a bit less but IT IS A HEAVY VACUUM FOR MOST PEOPLE. This does not bother me at all- i love my vacuum to be POWERFUL and if that means it will be heavy and sturdy and built like a tank- fine by me.This thing sucks so good- it got SO MUCH cat hair out of my carpet. It was amazing. My carpet actually feels clean- the beater brush really fluffs up this old apartment carpet and makes it so good.Some improvements over the old model- the power brush attachment stays on better and does not fall off. The power brush on/off button and the power button are not located out of the way so you do not hit them by accident.The canister is no longer narrowed on top so stuff falls out easier.I love the wide 15inch path and the light, it is excellent for seeing the dirt and if you need to go over the area again.I have no complaints- maybe one- it is loud, but not any more loud than most vacuums i used. I dont think we will be entering the 'silent' and powerful vacuum era anytime soon so really this is not a complaint but more of a comment- it is a vacuum- it is loud.Anyhow- Overall- i highly recommend this powerful vacuum.

We purchased this vacuum to replace a 10+ year old Kenmore that finally died.  Did lots of research and found this at a good price at Kohl's just after Christmas.  Have now used it three times and it just doesn't work.  Period.  There is almost no suction.  I have to pass over the same piece of fuzz on the carpet three or four times for it to be picked up.  And I don't think it actually gets picked up, just stuck in the roller brush. It spews dust out all over the base of the vacuum and on anything in the general vicinity.  When using it on bare floor, it wouldn't pick up needles from the Christmas tree, even with multiple passes.  After reading over the 'troubleshooting' section of the manual and doing everything it suggests, I finally called Bissell's customer service number.  The woman I spoke with asked me if I had taken a broomstick and put it through the hoses to make sure it wasn't clogged.  I explained to her it was practically new, and how could it be clogged if it never picked anything up?  (Also, using a broomstick to unclog was not in the troubleshooting guide.  Why on earth would I even think to do that?) She told me I needed to take it to a service center to have it checked.  I'm doing her one better and just returning it to Kohl's.  Bad product and terrible customer service.

column7: too heavy and not good for berber carpet
column8: It's heavy vacuum and it will damage my berber carpet from the the brush part. I had to return it to amazon after first use.

The Bissell model that this PowerClean model 16N54 replaced in our home was the light blue Bissell 5770 Healthy Home Bagless Upright Vacuum. Why did I chose this model instead of the newer Healthy Home 16N53?  This PowerClean I found locally for $10 cheaper ($189) than on Amazon and honestly, there is not really a different between them unless someone really is paranoid about germs an allergies the other may, psychologically, make them feel better.We really liked our old vacuum and it lasted as long as its 5 warranty (2006-2011) before the on/off switch began to malfunction; it was a power horse. I loved it much better than the Hoover Windtunnel it had replaced. After looking at newer Hoovers and the Shark Navigator, this Bissell won out because I had become attached to features we need (for both carpet & hard floors) like the adjustable brush height and the ability to turn the brush on and off which the Shark Navigator does neither. Plus it has the rubber wheels which I have come to prefer. I also like having my tools on board and not in a bag (unlike the Shark). Our house is not small or cramped so the 15in wide aspect of this vacuum is great for open, roomy homes. This vacuum also comes with a lifetime belt, and the one on our 5 yr old Bissell never broke. I also wanted to stay bagless and away from Hoover's paper tube filters that do not clean well. Although we did notice that this newer model at first seemed, I hate to use the word, 'cheaper' because it doesn't seem as tough and durable as our older Bissell Healthy Home, it is also 7.5 lbs lighter. The old vac was 29.5 lbs and this one is 22. So I do like that this new one is lighter and it works just the same. It maneuvers fine and is easy to empty and clean, not to mention that it cleans all floors VERY well.Since manufacturers are dead set on making everything so cheap these days, I currently like to stay between $150-$200 on a vacuum and buy one every 5 years or so (as I don't ask more from a vacuum than for it to last at least as long as it's warranty which is 5 yrs in this case); I do however hope I can get this Bissell to last longer than it's 5 yr warranty. Bissell is running a rebate until mid October for $20 off all vacs over $100, so I sent that in which brought my total for this vac to $169. I am happy considering that the $475 Dyson that was sitting next to it on the shelf only had a 2 year warranty, per stated on the box. I will gladly take my chances with the Bissell again. :

Pros:Powerful motor and suction.  Does a good job on my carpet and hardwood.Easy to empty canisterLong cord.Revolving dust attachment works great.Easy to put together.Economical...got it on sale for $139.99Cons:Heavy in comparison to others.  This is not the vac for grandma.

column7: Great job on the cat hair and fine dirt!
column8: This vacuum does a great job of picking up massive amounts of cat hair and fine dirt on the carpet. I've had this vacuum for several months, and each time I vacuum I'm astonished at how much cat hair it picks up. (I'm surprised the cat has any hair left--it seeems to all be in the Bissell.) The only problem I had with it was due to operator error. I couldn't make the roller brush work. Turns out there's a clearly marked button on the handle. Duh! I don't know when I'd ever operate it without the roller brush working, but if I ever choose to turn it off, there's a button. The filtration system also works great. I'm allergic to cats (love them anyway) and am so glad the dander and hair is sucked up with no dust being stirred up or exhaled into the room.This vacuum isn't the most maneuverable thing and it is heavy, if that matters to you. But I don't mind working with it a little to get around the furniture and I use the hose attachment for those days when I'm really motivated and want to vacuum tight against the wall. All in all, it works better than I do.

column7: Decent buy, but not for everyone.
column8: I bought this vacuum last October and have been very happy with the purchase. I'm a cat owner, and it does wonders snapping up all of the hair. I chose this specifically because of the HEPA filtration system, and it does not disappoint.Build-wise, it's very sturdy, and actually quite heavy. This doesn't bother me at all, but should be something you consider if that is a concern. Everything fits together snugly and securely, with the exception of the brush attachment on the back, which falls off on me all the time, and the extending arm that never seems to stay locked in place. It handles beautifully, and will turn off the bottom roller when you lock it on the upright position. One of my favorite features is that it also has a separate button to turn the roller off. The little brush attachment is a nice bonus, and works relatively well, though it doesn't pick up everything without doing several passes.The only major detractor from this vacuum is how often the filters need to be cleaned to maintain suction. It's a bit of a hassle, but it is better than having to replace them outright. It has a high quality feel, but without the high quality price. Despite the minor gripes I have with it, overall this is a pretty big bang for your buck.

column7: Great Vacuum at a Reasonable Price
column8: We'd been looking for several months for a vacuum to replace an Electrolux we purchased several years ago for $700 when we came across this Bissell on sale at Kohl's for $139.  We have a long haired dog who sheds a lot so we wanted a vacuum to pick up dog hair for sure.  We liked the initial construction when we looked at the vacuum in the store and after reading several pretty positive reviews we decided to try it.  We've had it now for a month, have used it extensively, and what a deal it turned out to be so far.The first thing we noticed about the vacuum is that it has outstanding suction and picks up everything compared to the much more expensive Electrolux!  We have mostly carpets and some tile and going from one to the other was a breeze.  We also have two sets of carpeted stairs that we use a lot and attachments with it worked great on those.  You do need to be sure to always reseat the hose firmly in its carrying position after using it so the vacuum suction is redirected to the floor rollers.  The amount of dog hair the vacuum picked up (that we thought our Electrolux was getting) was astounding.  Also it is very efficient at getting the fine stuff as well.  It is really remarkable how well it works on our carpets (short pile).  Because of the 'dirt' our previous vac had missed we ended up emptying the canister several times the first time we used it, and discovered how easy it was to do so.  We also like the fact that all of the accessories remain with the vacuum and out of the way.Our impression is the Bissell 16N54 is sturdy, easy to use and move around, and gets the job done for a reasonable price - what more can you ask for when buying a vacuum? Time will tell how well it lasts, but for now we couldn't be more pleased with this vacuum.Update 26 Dec 2011  We'd buy this again in a heartbeat - what a great piece of equipment.  This removes so much dog hair and dirt that one has to be careful to empty it frequently, but I'm not complaining.  Our carpets and floors have never been so clean.  We continue to be extremely pleased with this vacuum - it appears Bissell did things right with this one!Update 19 Dec 2012  This vacuum continues to amaze us.  We use it a lot with no problems at all.  We highly recommend.

This Bissell Powerclean Multi Cyclonic has a lot going for it but one thing it really struggles with is accommodating carpets and rugs of varying types.  The wheels that control the ride height of the brush head are too small, the roller brush has short, very stiff bristles and is driven by a separate motor that bogs down easily.  All this combines to make the Powerclean very sensitive to the density and pile height of the carpet.  If your home has several carpet types or rugs you need to vacuum then don't buy this model unless you enjoy constantly reaching down to adjust the carpet height setting.Ergonomics and handling aren't great either.  It's a bit hefty, the rubber rear wheels are a hindrance on carpet and the handle has to be lowered almost all the way to the floor to lift up the front end.On the plus side the dual stage cyclone system seems to do a good job capturing fine particles and dust which should keep HEPA filter changes to a minimum.  Overall build quality seems pretty good, the dirt canister assembly appears to stay well sealed.  The accessory hose and power cord are fairly long but not so long as to be a nuisance.  The ability to turn off the roller brush is nice bit it appears to come at a price.A word about 'suction'.  This model can develop relatively high vacuum pressure at zero flow.  That's good for lifting bowling balls (Oreck commercial) and seems impressive when you stick the accessory hose against your hand, but it's not what cleans carpets.  To pull the dirt from the floor and into the vacuum cleaner you need air flow and the more air you move the harder it is to maintain vacuum pressure.  Without going into an overly detailed explanation of how vacuum cleaners work, it should suffice to say that under typical operating conditions, this Bissell has about as much 'suction' as my old $70 Hoover with a fresh bag.  It's adequate, but not astonishing.  To be fair I should note that my old Hoover doesn't provide anything near the level of filtration that the Bissell does.

column7: Not bad... I recommend it quite highly!
column8: Bought this one about 2 years ago for more like $150 and it's the best vacuum cleaner I've ever owned.  Sucks up dirt, hair, and other stuff and doesn't get clogged like all the other vacuums I've bought in the past.  I have a 4 year old daughter who makes great messes with food and of course other stuff.  Lots of long hair in the house too.  I vacuum almost every day (sometimes more!) and only now broke the belt for the first time (not bad for 2 years) but now I'm having trouble finding a replacement belt.  Thought they would sell one at the local store or here on amazon but it seems that I have to go to a speciality website to get one.  Too bad!I did find the belt at [...] so I bought 4 since I anticipate using this vacuum for many more years to come.

column7: Strongly advise AGAINST buying this vacuum
column8: It is very noisy and it overheats quickly. The hose is so short the entire device falls over CONSTANTLY. The clear plastic tube leading to the dust bin gets jammed full VERY frequently, and even worse, clearing the jam out is NOT easy, to say the least.  Plan on vacuuming for 2 minutes before having to stop, then 5 minutes to clear out the jam, and repeat those steps until you go insane or finally finish.  Extremely poor quality, design, and performance, which was a huge surprise to me for a Hoover vacuum.

This vacuum worked great for maybe two weeks.  It did a great job cleaning the carpet.  At first the only bad thing was how frequently I had to empty the dust bin, but I was fine with that since it was doing such a good job.  But I've had it about five months now, and the clear plastic tube leading to the dust bin gets jammed full of lint, pet fur, etc. after about two minutes of vacuuming.  To clear the jam I either have to remove the screws holding the plastic tube together to the vacuum (the back half of the tube is molded into the canister part of the vacuum, or fold up strapping tape and try to ease it down the tube over and over again, gradually pulling out little bits of the jam.  Also, it overheats very quickly, and the auto shut-off thing kicks in, so I have to stop and let the vacuum cool down for about an hour before it will work again.  Vacuuming the three carpeted rooms in my home is an all-day process with this vacuum.
This is one of the best vaccums we've ever bought. It sucks everything, from dust, to hair, to any dirt in the carpet or hardwood floor. Love this vaccum and I would highly recommend it.

This vacuum is horrible. It overheats during a routine vacuuming and shuts off. It sucks up dog hair, but the hair gets trapped in the hose. I've had it for a little over a year and it's stopped working.

We have had our hoover for about a year now. We were very pleased with the ability to pick up materials including pet hair. The has belt broken 3 times. Last week on the third belt, the beater bar's plastic bracket on the housing broke off. Needless to say it will never work again. Overall quality in materials is not good.

column7: You get what you pay for.
column8: I bought one for $80. To review things objectively, remember that you get what you pay for. This isn't a $400 Dyson, and it isn't a 20 year old Dirt Devil, which is what it replaced. Other reviewers are right--it spits dust back out if the filters are not seated properly. Unfortunately, they are difficult to seat properly and I don't think it was designed well for the HEPA filter to actually seal. My won't and it is brand new. It recommends cleaning the foam filter EVERY use. I don't, it works fine. It also recommends replacing the HEPA more often than I do. That said, it really isn't a great vacuum. It has plenty of suction power, it keeps your floors and rugs pretty clean. It pics up much more dust than it spits back out. You don't notice the dust coming back out, but it is there as the outside of the vacuum is always dust covered right hear the air discharge. Remember, you get what you pay for. I was tired of the old Dirt Devil and it used bags. Interestingly, it kept things cleaner, since the bags didn't leak. But bags are getting far too expensive as it was an old vacuum. So this one paid for itself by not having bags. I'm happy enough with it, as I have mostly hardwoods and use this for throw rugs, stairs, and even the wood floors. It makes them clean enough for us. It does require emptying the cup 4 or 5 times per full house clean due to the small cup and our dog with lots of hair. Also, the small holes of the inner workings of the cyclonic action appear to clog after a while, so you have to brush it out or bang it against the edge of a trash can to clear them every so often. If you have bad allergies, or have all carpet, this is likely not the vacuum for you. Spend the extra for something that works better. Worth $80? Not likely, honestly. Maybe $50. Certainly not $100, which was the sticker price (non-sale) at Target.

column7: 'o_o` It's not just me... this thing has got to go.
column8: I know the old saying is not to 'look the gift horse in the mouth' so to speak... I received this as a gift from a dear friend and coworker, but it is not picking anything up. I sometimes run this vacuum over and over a certain spot if there are little things visible but I end up picking them out of the carpet.It is also bulky and heavy and occasionally, it works backwards. Instead of sucking things up, I find dirt trails where this vacuum has been spitting things back out.I am someone with big time dust bunny allergies and sinusitis. Instead of cultivating dust bunnies, I need to get rid of them as much as possible. This is not helping. :(

Well I said I wouldn't buy another Hoover after the last one (self-propelled Wind Tunnel - no suction and belt broke after 1 month) but I took a chance and got the Turbo Cyclonic.  I won't complain about the suction, it's good enough and better than the last light weight Dirt Devil I bought, and I won't complain about the noise - I could care less how noisy it is, I want it to clean.  What I will complain about is two things - one, the 'carpet level adjuster' just spins without adjusting anything.  I turned it upside down and examined it and it just doesn't come anywhere close to the wheel assembly - poorly manufactured.  Second, I thought the handle would remove easily to use the tools but you have to remove the hose at the bottom and attach it to the handle tube anyway so what's the difference?  With my $40 DD I had to remove the hose to attach it to the tools, I'm no better off.  In fact I'm worse off because with the bagged vacuums, you only change the bag once every two months or so, with the bagels vacuums, you have to clean it out after every use.  What's the commotion over bagless vacuums??!  When I took my last Hoover in to be fixed after one month I was told (by a Hoover rep no less) 'Don't buy expensive vacuums, they're all garbage - buy a cheap one and use it till it breaks.'  That's when I bought the $40 DD which lasted these 2 years so I guess I got my money's worth.  No more Hoovers for me.

I bought this vacuum at Target in December 2009, so it is just over a year old.  I have replaced the belt twice and the roller brush ($35) once already.  We are two adults and two dogs and I vacuum once or twice each week.  Yesterday, I plugged in the vacuum, and it switched on and off immediately and now it's dead.  I guess either the switch or motor is out and of course it's out of warranty by a couple of months.  I owned a Hoover in the 80's/90's that lasted for about 15 years.  The guy at the vacuum repair shop told me Hoover sold to a company in China a few years ago.  This is the last Hoover I will buy.

I always do my homework before a purchase. I knew Hoover's are loud so no complaints. They really aren't way out of line there. That's the price of a strong suction. I too disagree with the negative reviews. This is a powerful vacuum cleaner that does a thorough job picking up pet hair and everything else it is designed for. I don't notice any dust blowing around or any obnoxious odor if I put all the filters back after cleaning and properly seating the removeable debris holder. If those components aren't installed correctly then dust blowing can occur. It isn't hard to push around and my wife and I are in our mid 70's (yes, I am a male vacuumer). Homework also reveals the weight so no problem there either. Other than normal wear the belts last as long as comparable vacuums. Of course if I mis-use it then they won't. By that I mean running over rug tassles, toys, etc. It is not designed to accomodate those items. I recommend this and I only paid $79. I knew what I was buying! Can't beat the value/price.

I've had this vacuum for about a year! The vacuum is a bit on the heavy side, but comparatively with other vacuums like this, it's not any heavier.We generally vacuum our bedrooms every two weeks give or take pending on the kids etc! We have hardwood floors on our main level and carpeting in our bedrooms and used this vacuum for both levels as well. It HAD great sucktion and I've only had to replace the belt once, and that's the only upside!! You would think these things should last more than a year, especially since you're more or less doing a repetitive task!! Now however, it lost its sucktion and makes a terrible noise!The weight has been an issue for my wife who doesn't like lugging this thing up and down the stairs, but as time goes, this vacuum lost performace.  Again, in one year to have to now replace a vacuum is not what I would call a terrific buy!
Used this vacuum less than 10 times and the belt is torn.  Terrible, wish I could return the whole thing.

do NOT buy this deadbeat machine! not only have the belts broken twice, but we've only used it 6 times in a small area. it's heavy, noisy and worse it spews dirt throughout and leaves a nasty odor. forget using the hose to vacuum corners since it's so short the entire device falls over and that thing hurts! hoover really disappointed us.

I have had this vacuum for about a year now. The vacuum sucks every little piece of dirt from the floor, even things that are somewhat stuck in the carpet. The accessories serve all other purposes (corners, stairs, below furniture,etc.). Now is the first time I have to replace the belt. I am not sure whether that is a normal cycle.I have allergies and the vacuum has been a great relief at home - the filter doesn't blow half the dust back out like other vacuums often do. The dirt cup (replacing the bags) can be emptied easily and cleaned with water. I have rinsed it in the shower, which worked great.The downside to this vacuum is the weight, it is quite heavy.

When I had to buy a new vacuum, I thought this vacuum was a safe option for buying something reliable and didn't cost a lot of money. Just remember, You get what you paid for (usually). It does a good job sucking up crud off the floor, especially dog hair. My problems with the machine is when pulling the hose off to do situation specific jobs.  You need to have the base near where ever your job is, cause it will tip over, which gets real frustrating.  I have not thrown the thing out the window (which I usually do when something doesn't work) yet.  If you are looking for something under $100 and not expecting it to work like a Miele, they are great.

column7: Stopped working after using for only 5 months
column8: The vacuum cleaner stopped working within 5 months of purchase because the belt was torn. When I called Hover customer service, they told me the belt was not covered in the 1-yr warranty (surprise!). I used the vacuum cleaner only 7-8 time since I bought it, and the usage was pretty light for which the belt should not tear. Would not recommend anyone this product because its poor in quality.

I have read the other reviews and i have to disagree. This vaccume is amazing and more than excellent for the price. Ive had it for over a year and its vaccumes my carpets faultlessly. The suction is almost too powerful. I have cats and dogs and a kid with asthma, and dust allergies.. and I can sleep at night knowing that my house is dust free. The tools are great for behind couches and in nooks and cranny's. Yes Its a little noisier, a little heavier than a $300-$500 vaccume, and there is no automatic, fancy retractable, cord button but for UNDER $100, its simplicity at its best. It does its job. How can you go wrong? And, you get a little arm work out as well (which I dont mind in the slightest.) ;)
I love bagless vacuums but the belt on this one broke after only 3 hours of use. It is going back to the store tomorrow!

This vacuum is the heavy and awkward to push around--I have owned other vacuums, and never had any trouble pushing one before.  It sucks up dust and dog hair okay, but leaves the room in a terrible dusty smell (i.e. you cannot vacuum without having the windows open for a day--not practical in winter or summer).  It smells like it shoots out as much dust as it sucks in.  We have only had this machine for 6-7 months--it was smelling bad almost after 1 month--even with trying to clean it out between uses.  I am not happy with this purchase.

I just purchased the Hoover Turbo Cyclonic Vacuum.  I was looking for a good buy and have never had a bagless vacuum before.  While I am still reserving judgement on it's cleaning abilities, (having only used it once, so far)what I did notice is it is very noisy.  I am used to using a Lindhaus in my upstairs, and a Sharp (library quiet) vacuum for my downstairs, ( this is the vacuum I am replacing).  I'm not sure if I'll keep this unit due to the low rumble noise and high pitched scream, that seems to accompany it's use.

column7: Very nice vacuum for the price
column8: I purchased this vacuum for a summer cottage.Works very well for the price. Love the fact no bags need to be used. I have been using it for over a month with no problems so far.

This vacuum is a waste of money.. Mostly it just blows things around.  Never worked well from day 1.  I am taking mine back to exchange for ANY product.  I always trusted Dirt Devil products but not any longer.

We got this vac as a wedding present, about 14 months ago. I have always been amazed at how much dirt the machine finds in our carpet. The problem is the dirt canister was loose when we got the vac and I didn't contact Dirt Devil, because I figured it was just a loose fitting design on a cheapie vacuum.Fast forward to a couple weeks ago, and now we have to make sure the vacuum stays 'reclined' while in use otherwise the canister will fall out and my wife will be sad.That problem was annoying in itself, but then the 'clip' that holds the bottom of the canister closed snapped off.Now, the vac still works but its like playing russian roulette because you might be sucking up all of that dirt, only to have the canister unexpectedly fall, and because its broken it will deposit all that newly collected dirt all over the floor again.Would not buy again, maybe this thing can be modified and used for basement duty in the future.

I bought this vacuum after my old dirt devil (which I loved and had for 10 years) broke.  This vacuum does not work nearly as well.  It tends to get clogged and requires frequent cleaning.  But the really terrible part is the hose.  I use the hose A LOT!  Well this one is poorly constructed.  The two parts fit together very loosely, so suction is poor.  I literally have had to run it over crumbs, etc. two or three times to get it to pick them up.  I'm not at all happy and will look for another vacuum.

I recently purchased the Dirt Devil UD40275.  I would like to tell you about how it worked, but I can't.  The vacuum cleaner took 10 days to arrive.  When it did arrive, there were no screws in the package.  I attempted to find the size of the screws but the manual referenced only 'shorter' and 'longer' screws so obtaining local screws was out of the question.  When I contacted Dirt Devil to obtain replacement screws, I was told that the model was manufactured over a year ago so they could not send me anything without sending them an invoice showing that I had purchased the item recently.  They further said that this is a discontinued item, and that I would be unable to obtain screws locally.  Really???  I went online to buy a Dirt Devil because I had such a positive experience with an earlier model. This has been a nightmare.  Beware!
For the price this is a great vacuum! works well very good suction and easy to empty container. I recommend picking it up!

With this price level ,you get an average vaccum ,don't expect high quality product.I'm using on weekly basis.Pro : power is good.Weight is okay.Carpet and floor clean okay,adjust level better put in medium for carpet.  Empty dirt out is good ,no mess.Con: Very loud ,the most I ever had.Spray pieces of dirt around ...so need to move over 2-3 times at the same area.  May feel,once in a while, some electric shock when touching the cord (No grounding wire}Overall ,no worry about repair,not worth the repair cost ....if it can last 1-2 years ,I'm okay with it.If you are a serious cleaning person,look for other vaccums (and pay more}.

column7: It does it's job for the price
column8: It does it's job for the price we pay. I would recommend this product for first time buyers. Pros: Easy to assemble.

This vacuum would be great. Everything works really well accept for one thing. The canister does not stay on. If you only have one floor to vacuum you might be okay. If, however, you have to carry it  to go upstairs, it'll just keep falling off. Heck, it'll fall off if you just vacuum too vigorously. Over and over and over. I'm not a moron. I have owned other bagless vacuums and I know how to make sure it's klicked into place properly. My last one was even the same brand and I never had this problem. Other people have left reviews saying it could do this but I assumed they were putting the thing together wrong. They weren't. Don't waste your money on this. I have had it for a long time now and have neer been able to make it work well. It's a pain. Aside from modding it with some velcro stripping or something, it'll never work well. Dirt Devil should not be selling this thing.

column7: born feb 2012, died in july 2012, RIP
column8: Return it within 30 days to amazon or get just part of your money back. And you will pay for shipping.  This vacuum most definitely sucks, but not in a good way. It completely died after vacuuming only about 60 yards of carpet, a large living room.  Get a vacuum with a real warranty.  This vacuum has other major issues as well.  The canister barely stays on as the latch is so cheap.  the canister seal does leak dust and you can taste the grit/dirt in your mouth lingering in the air after you vacuum.  Poorly designed, designed to fail, planned obsolescence.  The filters are very small and require cleaning at least after every other use.  Not a quality product.  do yourself a favor and find something/anything else.  I will never buy Dirt Devil products again.

i was not sure if i was going to like this vacum at first because the dirt container looks like it wont snap into place rite . turns out thats way it is. now i love this thing it has awsome sucking power & the attaching little vacuum brush is neat u can get under a couch under a recliner or in spaces the vacuum is to big for i tried on my kitchen floor & did just fine . and best of no filter needed.

Has someone ever played a horrible practical joke on you that you just had to pay them back for? If so, this vacuum cleaner is your solution!Purchase this for them as a gift. They'll be so excited to receive some wonderful bagless vacuum cleaner. Just think, you never have to deal with emptying bags again! They will never suspect your true intentions.See, this vacuum cleaner doesn't actually clean anything. It clandestinely moves dirt around your living room, depositing it carefully so you don't see any major buildup. After a few months of using this, your friend's house will be a complete mess! Just think of the surprise on their faces!But seriously, don't buy this vacuum.

We needed a replacement upright bagless to quickly pick up all the debris that seems to accumulate in our carpeted areas of our home.  This product is lightweight but heavy duty.  We received it really quickly and are very pleased with the quality of the cleaner.  It was easy to set up for use and the cord is long enough to reach several places without having to keep moving the cord.  We do have 4 romms that are carpeted plus a hallway, so this will be something we use frequently.  The suction power is good and it is easy to emply the container and keep going.  Hopefully we will be able to vacuum more frequently now and should not have to emply but once.  We do have pets so the attachments will be useful for deeper cleaning as well.  The price was reasonable and the product is well worth it!

column7: Great suction, but OUCH! It shocks!
column8: I was quite pleased to have finally purchased my very first, brand new vacuum.  My boyfriend set it up for me and I was all excited to vacuum my apartment.  I began vacuuming my living room, in which I noticed it picked up quite a bit of stuff from the carpet that I had no idea was in the carpet to begin with.  Amazing suction!  But as I rounded a corner, my leg bumped against the hose (as I have done with every vacuum I have ever owned) and I got a huge zap!  I thought perhaps it was because I wasn't wearing shoes (though I never wear shoes while I vacuum, as I don't like having shoes on my carpet), so I tried again with shoes on.  Didn't help.  Throughout the course of vacuuming my living room alone I got my leg shocked 3x and my hand once!  I'm returning it because I really don't like the feeling of being shocked every 15 seconds.  However, I really enjoyed everything else about the vacuum.  It's a real shame.

This is a good vacuum for the price. It doesn't take up too much space, is relatively easy to put together and cleans well. It doesn't have all the features of more expensive vacuums but for general vacuuming it works fine. Overall, there were no problems with it although nothing outstanding about it either.

column7: Works well, but cleanup can be a challenge
column8: This is a reasonable vacuum - it has good suction, is easy to maneuver, has a HEPA filter, and has a decent length flexible hose for those hard to reach places. In addition, this vacuum lists (in a very readable font) all the replaceable part numbers (filter and belt) as well as cleaning instructions (for filter replacement and container cleanup).While this vacuum did a good job with cleaning, my biggest problem was cleaning the vacuum itself - which can be agony for allergy sufferers. This is also the reason for my 3-star rating.The contents of the container, a super-fine chalk like powder, take to the air very easily. The vacuum does simplify this process with a single lever that not only pops open the bottom, but also sets off a little dust cloud. Next, the dismantling of the air director (a vertical shaft within the container) can be a challenge - as it needs to be dusted off and wiped down with a damp cloth. Finally, you have to deal with the HEPA and foam filters which can also get really clogged up with this very fine dust - much more so than with bagged vacuums. If this weren't an issue, the UD40275 would have rated much higher in my book.Happy Vacuuming!~Damodar

The power of the vaccum cleaner is 12 amp, which is very good.Assembling is very easy.The weight is not that big.Has 2 additional attachments, which are good for the places the vacuum cleaner cannot reach.Pretty easy in operation.Sucks dust very good, the exhaust is on the side and does not blow away the dust from the front.Filter cleaning is very easy.The only con is that the cleaning tank fixed not very firmly and can fall out of the vacuum cleaner, but it is OK since it is sealed.

This is a good vacuum at a reasonable price. this vacuum i had it for 5 months now works as well if not better than my dysen. it is very powerful and have some handy accessories. the bagless is well engineered and easy to operate. the only complain i have is this vacuum is bulky and kinda heavy. also the plastic its made of is of poor quality so i question its durability.

This vacuum is great, the first time I used it the dirt container got full in 20 seconds even though the carpet looked clean.  However the part that holds the dirt container to the vacuum body does not attach well and the container becomes loose causing the vacuum to loose pressure.

column7: Lightweight, powerful, and easy to use
column8: I was totally blown away at the value of this machine. It was exactly what I wanted, and pretty cheap to boot, but until I was able to use it at home I wasn't fully convinced. It's extremely light in comparison to other brands, has amazing suction and the variety of attachments have come in very useful (especially when I didn't know a few of them were even included!)

column7: Used to Like My Inexpensive Dirt Devil...
column8: I had the cheapest Dirt Devil, $50, and it worked great for years. I ran over the cord and it wasn't as pretty as some others, but it worked.A friend bought me this Dirt Devil to replace it and initially it was powerful and seemed like a great deal. But here are the problems that have developed in a few short weeks:--The canister FALLS off when you pick up the vacuum and move it around, like when you're trying to drag it up the stairs. This has happened so often that I started cussing out the vacuum.--The power brush also falls off when in use.--The suction isn't working anymore through the hose, so the vacuum is only good using the main, bottom part. The power brush doesn't work because there's no suction. It definitely doesn't suck. ;)--The plastic parts are so cheap that they break off easily. The pieces for the cord wrap-around are ready to break off and the place where the power brush click on also broke off. Which is fine, since the power brush is useless.That's all, but it's enough to put me off of this vacuum forever.

column7: Powerful suction on a lightweight vacuum!
column8: I bought this vacuum to replace my Dirt Devil Vision that lost suction power after 4 years. I received this vacuum in the Dirt Devil box without and outer box to protect it. The box got smashed from the travel to my house, but thankfully everything was in the box that should have been. I was surprised by the plastic parts and how cheap the vacuum looked. I thought for sure this vacuum was going back. **IMPORTANT**--You need to look on the handle for the bag with the screws to put it together. They are in a red bag tied around the red handle and it blends together so you cannot see it well. I drove myself crazy looking for them! I put it together quickly. It did not seem like the canister fit tightly over the filter area because there was a little gap, but it is correct. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised by the suction power of this vacuum! Very powerful! It picked up things that my old vacuum did not pick up. Now I've had the vacuum for about 3 weeks and the belt broke. I noticed I had a string from a runner rug wrapped around the roller. So you need to make sure that you do not pick up any long strings or anything that can wrap around the roller. Aside from that, it's a nice lightweight vacuum with very good suction power!

This vacuum was terrible from the start.It has more pieces to assemble than any of the previous vacuumsthat I have had (including Dirt Devil brand ones).This is apparently so that they can pack it into a square box,saving a few dollars on shipping.Cons . The front of the base is too light. It does not hold to the floor when operating  the vacuum backwards, making it impossible to do the standard 'Z' pattern  of back-and-forth sweeping motion, where you somewhat overlap each pass.  (When you pull it backwards, the front lifts up just enough to stop picking up dirt.)  This equates to more effort (and frustration) to accomplish the same task as other vacs. . It picked up roughly 1/3 to 1/2 of the amount of dirt that previous vacuums did  over the same floor areas (given the same period of time between clearings).  It just did not pick up as much as anything prior to it. . The power on switch began to fail after 1 month.  You would have to fiddle with it to get it to turn on. . The handle release switch did not release the handle with one hand (or foot) press.  Again -- this is likely because the front of the base is too light.  Think about how you would handle this. One hand is holding the handle already and  a foot or hand has to press the handle switch. If another foot or hand is needed to  hold down the front of the base to release the handle -- It's like playing a game of  twister just to release the handle.  sigh.Pros . (I'm trying to come up with one.)  I want to say cost, but for $20-more I've had dramatically better vacs.  Sorry -- I saw little redeeming value in this vacuum.May your experience be better than mine(but I would suggest a different vacuum choice).

column7: It's a good vacuum for hardwood floor and carpet
column8: I bought this vacuum to replace the old Dirt Devil that I had used for over 5 years! The initial set-up was easy. This new vacuum does its work better than the old one (which was a bagged and for carpet only). I was satisfied after the first use on hardwood floor and carpet. That's one of the primary reasons I bought it! It works for hardwood floor and carpet. I no longer need to have two vacuums.The vacuum's suction was strong enough that it 'grabbed' a t-shirt while I was vacuuming the hardwood floor. Probably, since it's still new. After initial use, the cup was half-full already! The bagless dirt cup was easy to remove. However, the lid cannot be opened all the way to the side so that the dirt can smoothly fall out of the cup. Also, the sound coming out of this vacuum, as in others generally, may be irritating after using it for a while.So far, I like this vacuum! I think it is worth the price.

We have had a house cleaner for the past year that has an unfortunate habit of demolishing vacuum cleaners. She's been through an expensive Dyson, a pricy Bissel and a stick vac. So when this Dirt Devil arrived I put it together (two screws and 10 minutes) and waited for cleaning day. I felt a little like a Roman centurion sending prisoner to the lions, but I told her where it was. She vacuumed the whole house with the Dirt Devil UD40275 Power Path Dual Stage Cyclonic Bagless Upright and it did a great job. I took the wheel several times and found it to be just the right weight (not to heavy to move, not to light to hold the corners). I wouldn't say it was quiet, but what vacuum is. It picked up the dirt and cat hair as well as our more expensive machines. It is easy to empty, easy to carry and doesn't take up much space in the hall closet. I really like the air powered hand held brush for cleaning upholstery. We'll see how long it lasts with 'Buffy the Vacuum Slayer'. I'll report back.
We needed a new vacuum and needed one that could keep up with 3 dogs.  This works great!  I love that the filter is washable, the canister is easy to empty and it's pretty light for its size.

This is great!  It was easy to assemble straight out of the box.  I absolutely love that it's bagless.  It works awesome.  I have a small apartment and it cleaned two rooms and a hall in no time flat.  I was seriously impressed at the suction power!  I think this is a great vacuum for the price.  You won't be disappointed.

This is my first bagless vacuum and I like it.  It is easy to empty and I don't have to worry about running out of bags.We have used the vacuum on hardwood, low, and thick carpets.  It has worked really well on all of them.It is light weight and comes with plenty of attachments to get at steps, curtains, corners, and upholstery.  We really like the upholstery attachment.  It is powerful enough to pull the dirt off, but it does not suck the fabric into it.The two negatives are that its light does not light up directly in front of the vacuum that well, and the thickness of the vacuum does not allow it to get under lower things.Over all I think this vacuum is definitely worth the price!!!

I think this product was created to compete with the likes of the much-more-expensive Dysons, which it actually does surprisingly well!The construction feels noticeably cheaper than a Dyson, and the assembly instructions were a bit weird (don't get freaked out if you can't find the 'shorter' screw they mentioned, there's only two screws and they're both the same size), but the suction was strong, the accessories and capabilities are similar to the Dyson and it features the same 'Cyclonic Bagless Upright' capabilities.If you're in the market for a vacuum a little like a Dyson, more cheaply made, but at a fraction of the price, this thing will do you well!

I had a hoover bag vacuum for 10 years and it worked great. The Dirt Devil stopped working within two weeks - the bag kept clogging up and trying to clean it has been impossible. In addition, customer service support is horrible. I could never get through to a real person and emailing generated generic responses. Maybe this might be okay if you don't need a real vacuum cleaner. I have a husky and a child so I need something that can handle heavy duty cleaning. If you're in a similar situation, I recommend another brand. Wish I could return it.

Purchased at AmazonDirt Devil UD40275 Power Path Dual Stage Cyclonic Bagless UprightURL: [...]Let me start off by saying that this is my second Dirt Devil. The first one I purchased at Walmart for around $45 or so some 5 years ago. Oh, it's still running, I simply wore it out. It's been relegated to garage duty - sort of a forced retirement. LOLLike most of us, I did a fair amount of research into vacuums.  My criterion was that I didn't want to spend a lot of cash, less that $100, but at the same time, I didn't want a piece of junk either. Not having a vacuum of another brand for a long time really doesn't give me the right to compare it with anything else out there - except to my previous Dirt Devil.The price was right, less than $100. It had the features I was looking for and a brand name that I did have some experience with. When I read these reviews, I always tell myself that we're human, with different tastes, needs and the like. You will always find someone who finds something offensive about a product which you find perfectly acceptable. With that in mind, here goes...The Dirt Devil came in a fairly small carton, which unfortunately, had a dent which pierced the cardboard.  I'm always anxious when I get something like this but thank goodness the vacuum was safe and sound. I wish Amazon would put the original carton into one of theirs (sometimes they do this) so as to give the packaging a little more strength and also hide what's inside. This vacuum was 'sold by Amazon'.  My overall experience with Amazon has been five-stars!I proceeded to unpack the vacuum, all the parts were there. You should note that the two (2) screws needed for assembly are taped to the handle in a red, plastic envelope.  The vacuum is red. I bring this up only because I missed them at first. You guessed it.  Panic! Where are the screws?The vacuum goes together quickly. Like I said, two (2) screws secure the two pieces of the handle to the part which houses the rotating brush, which has a light  The handle is sort of a loop rather than a traditional handle that you have to grip. This makes the vacuum easy to move around and it won't slip out of your hand.  It's a light vacuum but it has a good deal of power.  My carpet is 6 years old and is a low-pile.  It did pick up a lot of stuff that the old one was missing.  I found that it glided nice and smooth across the carpet. There are four (4) carpet-height settings and one for bare floors.The dirt container is really simple to detach from the machine and empty. Unlike other vacuums, the filter is not in the dirt container but underneath it. When the dirt container is removed, you can easily remove the filter to inspect/clean it as necessary. I've already cleaned the filter and the foam element that sits on top of it just by running it under water and it cleaned up nicely.  You just need to wait for it to dry so do this at the end of your vacuuming chores and it will be ready for the next use.The power cord for my use is long enough.  My house is small, 1400 sqft (ranch, so no stairs) so I don't need to plug/unplug too many times.  I think the shorter cord is a good idea.  My last Dirt Devil had a really long cord but it used to get really warm and the plug itself got hot as well.  This cord is barely warm.  There is no auto-cord windup but I didn't see that an issue for me.The usual attachments are there and have slots on the vacuum for storage. The small power-hand tool has a decent amount of power to clean upholstery, car mats, whatever.Switches:  The power-switch is foot-activated on the side of the vacuum.. Also located close-by is the pedal to tilt the handle backwards for vacuuming.  If you don't cut the power to the vacuum while it is in the upright position, the brush will continue to run.  This might damage your carpet if left there too long.Overall construction of the vacuum is satisfactory.  Of course it's plastic but it seems durable - only time will tell. Also, the vacuum's exhaust blows out the sides and not on to the carpet which could blow dirt around.I'm happy with the vacuum. I have a minor Asthma problem so I vacuum regularly.So far so good.  One more thing, I don't have any pets.  I'm sure that makes a big difference in the performance of a vacuum.

column7: sufficient  -- Update:  irritating permanent loss of suction
column8: This is a nice vacuum and for the price it does a good job.  I do not like the cheap plastic feel of it, but it does work pretty well on both carpet and hard floors.  I sprinkled some shredded paper on my carpet to see how the vacuum would handle picking it up along with the other trash and dust that was on the floor and to my surprise it had very little problem picking it up.  I didn't experience any jams, loss of suction or having to run over the same area twice to pick up trash.  It also seems to be able to pick up a lot of unseen dust and dirt as evident in the see through container.  It also has convenient attachments/detachments that will allow you to vacuum hard to reach areas such as stairs, car floors and seats.  It is lightweight and easy to maneuver.On the hard wood floors in my home, the vacuum also does very well.  From past experience, vacuums have never done well on hard surfaces as it would just blow stuff around instead of picking it up.  This vacuum however, surprised me.  After setting the vacuum height to the lowest level (2nd lowest for larger pieces of trash), I was able to pick up those annoying shreds of paper and other small pieces of trash that always seem to be showing up either from outside or tracked in the area from other areas of my home.  Unlike the carpet however, there were a few instances in which I had to go over an area more than once in order to pick it up.  Also I noticed that on occasion turning the vacuum off over an area where I recently picked up trash that trash would be spit back on the floor.  However, a quick re-vacuum of that area would easily pick up the spit out trash and simply going over a clean area before turning the vacuum off should help you to avoid this problem.  Though its quicker than sweeping, I still wouldn't recommend using this vacuum to completely replace sweeping on your hard surfaces.  It is however good if you just need to quickly get annoying pieces of small trash and loose dirt off the floor without having to break out the broom and dust pan every single time.My only other complaint is that the bag-less compartment doesn't ever seem to go back in right after emptying and there is an ugly gap between the bottom of it and the vacuum itself.  It seems like its going to fall out but I suppose the seal is good because nothing blows out of the gap while vacuuming.Overall I'm happy with this vacuum and it has already replaced my older vacuum that is only a vacuum by mere definition.  Other than the cheap feel and the iffy bag-less container it does a nice job.Update 12/14/2012:After using this vacuum for a few months, I have noticed that there seems to be a permanent loss of suction.  When I first noticed the indicator on the front of the vacuum being red, I thoroughly cleaned out the filter and tried again.  While the indicator wasn't completely red, it was about 60% red meaning that there is still is a significant loss of suction.  I've taken the vacuum apart made sure all the hoses were clear of obstruction in addition to cleaning the filter, but no luck whatsoever.  Oh well it was a good vacuum while it lasted, but like just about any other vacuum it becomes useless after a while.

After reading through a ton of reviews for various vacuums on Amazon and being extremely discouraged by the inconsistency of opinions, I finally decided on this one and hoped I would love it.I do.My husband is a mechanic, I have two indoor rabbits who get daily free time in the house, and an indoor cat. I needed a vacuum that can handle dirt, pet hair, cat litter, wood chips, and the occasionally stray piece of hay.I decided not to vacuum until this arrived to see if it could really perform and it did. My carpet is spotless. I can't ask for more.

We received this vacuum for Christmas last year.  In the beginning it was great.  Then a few months passed and it started eating belts.  I JUST replaced the belt about five minutes ago and it's already broken!  Not to mention the vacuum has lost much of its sucking power.  I would stick with something that will last a little longer and wouldn't purchase this one again.

column7: It sucks... but in a good way
column8: I gave this vacuum a good long workout for the last few weeks to see how it performs and to my surprise it's taken it all in stride.First off is the assembly. You'll need a screwdriver and that's it. Two screws and a few 'snaps' and it's put together and ready to go. While putting it together I noticed that the majority of the vacuum is plastic, compared to our older Royal which is like 99% metal, it feels extremely cheap and like it's about to break.Placement of the power cord down low became a hassle. If the power cord was routed through or close to the handle, it would keep the cord from getting in the way while vacuuming.The other issue I had was the foot power button. If or when it grabs ahold of some curtains, blind strings, or even a rug, it takes a lot longer to hit the on/off button with your foot than it is to flip a switch or push a button that is located closer to the handle. This was found out when it grabbed ahold of a blanket and it took me a good three or four seconds to turn off the machine, which caused the belt to get a bit burnt and smell up the living room a bit. Again compared to the older Royal vac, when it grabs ahold of something by accident you can almost immediately switch it off.Adjustment of the brush head (high pile to low pile) has to be done with your hand, so adjusting it on the fly is not an option. A foot operated pile adjustment would be better.Emptying it and cleaning it is fairly simple and doesn't take a whole lot of effort. Removing the brush head to clean/remove hair that gets wrapped around it can be done by unscrewing three screws and a bit of elbow grease. One thing I noticed is that the vacuum as a whole collects and retains a lot of fine dust in nooks and crannies. Also a LOT of static electricity builds up and everything sticks to it.Now I will say I started off hating this vacuum for all of the flaws I listed above, especially the flimsiness of it... but it has performed extremely well.Suction power is phonemail! Once the container starts to get filled up it's power starts to diminish a little bit, but a quick dump of the container and all of the power returns.The onboard hose attachment is quite nice. You can be vacuuming and pop that sucker right off, put on the nozzle and get the baseboard and other nooks and crannies vacuumed all without missing a beat.With all of the minor flaws and issues I had with this vacuum, the fact that it has so much sucking power and doesn't blow dust and dirt everywhere (because of the filter) TOTALLY outweighs the issues I have with it.So if you are looking for a new vacuum and don't want to break the bank, this Dirt Devil UD40275 Power Path Cyclonic Bagless Upright is definitely an awesome choice, especially for under $80!

I had the Eureka bagless for six weeks and really liked how it maneuvered, was very light, and the circular handle made it even easier to guide, but it began spitting trash out the back (I emptied it after every vac), and I traded it for this one.  Just used it once, and it seems to pick up trash on the bare floors better, but it's cumbersome and makes my arm tired.  If I decide to keep it, I may do one room a day. Also, much louder than the Eureka, which could mean the motor's more powerful? I don't know, but they're both 12 amp vacuum cleaners.Probably if I want the perfect vacuum cleaner, I'll have to go up considerably in price, and I wouldn't mind if I knew one that was truly better. Actually, I miss my old Eureka vac with disposable bag.  Yes, I guess it's being lazy, and not eco-minded, but it's soooo  much easier, and cleaner just to throw away the old bag and stick in a new one.  Technology sometime leaves me.....in the dust.

column10: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo2KBR5HIISMV0XpreplayImageId" />

column8: BottomLeft
column13: 0_.png" alt="Click to watch this video" id="cv_mo2KBR5HIISMV0XpreplayImageId" />

column7: For it's price and what this vacuum accomplishes...it's definitely worth it!
