column8: First and foremost, let me just say that I'm a Dyson vacuum user and have one that I feel is a good investment and still going strong after 8 years.But my review is not for a Dyson but a Dirt Devil UD40275 Power Path Dual Stage Cyclonic Bagless Upright vacuum.  I have to admit that I was curious to see how far cyclonic vacuums have come from companies like Dirt Devil (which is a reputable company that has been around for a long time).I.  SETUPThe vacuum was delivered and it came in segments. The instructions mentioned to insert two screws and at first we thought we were missing the screws until we realized that the tape around the handle held the two screws.  Once we figured that out, assembly for this vacuum was easy.This vacuum has a lot of attachments, extension arm and definitely much lighter than my Dyson DC 14.II.  THE TESTWe have a child and two dogs, and the three have given our vacuums an extreme workout.  We know what our Dyson can do and we know how other vacuums have done and have literally broke down.  So, let's give the Dirt Devil a try!And surprise...surprise!  This vacuum literally sucked the carpet of all the dirt and dog hair and whatever is in there into its compartment.  I was quite impressed, it did as well as my Dyson and it costs far less!And as mentioned, there are many attachments, it's light and for the most part, it did its job!III.  JUDGMENT CALLNow, I know there are many out there looking for a vacuum and for me, I bought the Dyson because I have had high failure rates with other vacuums.  They kept breaking down, overheating or had some sort of part breaking.  So, I invested in the Dyson for its reputation and as mentioned, it has worked well and not lost suction for eight years.BUT... that vacuum cost me around $500+ at the time.  Here we are with a Dirt Devil UD40275 that did a fantastic job of collecting dirt, dog hair and everything that was in the carpet.  I was impressed!  For $80, a lot of attachments, really solid extension and most importantly, magnificent performance...the Dirt Devil did just as good as my Dyson.BUT (#2)... As mentioned, my Dyson lasted me eight years and still going strong.  Will the Dirt Devil UD40275 last as long?  Will it lose suction each year? I guess time will tell and I can easily come back and update my review to let you know.  But I suppose at $80 and if you get several years out of it, you can easily upgrade to the next best thing years later.  Whereas in a Dyson, if it broke down early for the price I paid for it, I would be very upset!So, this is my feeling towards the Dirt Devil UD40275.For it's price, this is a fantastic vacuum.  It performed as strongly as my Dyson when I first bought it (and even now).  You're getting a lot of bang for your buck with this vacuum cleaner and because it is cyclonic, it picks up a lot of dirt, hair, etc. and it's easy to dispose of as well.  No bags, no rubber band belt that snap in the bottom...this is a solid cyclonic, bagless vacuum.Will it last you a decade?  Who knows.  But probably at this price...if it lasts you for 3-5 years...you can easily upgrade to the latest and new version of a Dirt Devil.  This is a vacuum that works within a budget and performs just as well as an expensive cyclonic vacuum cleaner.But for under $80 and for its performance, it's hard to beat.The Dirt Devil UD40275 is highly recommended!

The suction is stronger than the Sears Progressive (made by Panasonic) that I bought 12 years ago for twice the price. I am still using it and really like it. They both have a 12 amp motor. The Sears is 22.4 lbs and the Dirt Devil 19.3 but I did not notice a difference other than the Sears did not tip over as easily. I used the wand on stairs and found it a little harder to use than the Sears. My Sears has a disconnect to prevent the beaters from turning while using the wand which is shaped a little different.  My Sears had an optional add-on hose that allows me to park the vacuum at the top of the stairs and use the wand all the way down the staircase. I still give the Dirt Devil 5 stars for its superior carpet cleaning. It pulled up human hair and dust that had gotten to the bottom of the strands. I did not expect such a superior job from an inexpensive vacuum. I suspect that the bag-less design permits more airflow than my bag vacuum.Emptying the unit is easy. I suggest that you practice the removal and release and take out the filters before using it the first time. That will make it much cleaner and easier for when you have completed your first vacuuming. When I first read that you should empty the unit after each vacuuming, I thought-How is this an improvement over bags which last for several cleanings? But after emptying the Dirt Devil the first time, I thought- This is really easy.

My apartment is a typical bachelor pad, with a combination of hard wood floors and rugs. The Dirt Devil is one powerful vacuum - it did a halfway decent job picking up dust as opposed to the swiffer, but over the rugs is where the vacuum shined. I was flat out astonished as to how much dirt and junk that the vacuum picked up. In comparison to my original 10+ year old bagged vacuum, this was picking up a lot more dirt. The assembly is rather easy - there are two screws to hold the handle in place that are really needed to keep the vacuum from falling apart.A few caveats: I really didn't read through the instruction manual as to how to empty the compartment, I managed to dump a decent amount of it on the floor, so please read the instruction manual. It also The vacuum also feels a bit flimsy so if I had to bring this up or down stairs it might fall apart.Overall, I'm happy with this vacuum. It's really powerful to the point that I was impressed at what ended up in the vacuum. The nozzle attachment helped me get to tight spots and was long enough that I didn't feel like I had to play tug-of-war with the vacuum. If you're an urbanite like me looking for your first vacuum purchase, you can't go wrong with this amazing Dirt Devil vacuum.

Previous vacuums (Eureka, Hoover, and Dirt Devil) I have purchased in the past were packed with the vacuum in its full upright position.  I was surprised to receive this vacuum in a square box.  My initial thought was they shipped the base with some parts and the remaining contents would arrive in a separate box.  However, when I opened the box all pieces were inside.  Some assembly is required so a small flat head or phillips screwdriver is needed for a two-screw assembly.  The assembly would not have taken too long had the written instructions and diagrams were clearer.  This is my one knock on this purchase -- the instruction booklet.  So I ditched the instructions and figured out the assembly myself.  I've only used the vacuum twice in the past week of ownership, but was pleasantly surprised how much cleaner all my rugs are.  The attachments are on-board so cleaning floor, rugs, and area rugs were effortless. While using this Dirt Devil I took to the new handle (my 2nd generation Dirt Devil had a standard handle), noticed how light weight it was, liked how flat it lays to get under tables and chairs, and enjoyed the easy release function of the dirt canister.  Also, the HEPA filter is in a better location for filtration purposes, and it was a snap to clean after use.  For the cost, this vacuum cleaner seems to be a good value.  If this one lasts and performs as well and as long as my prior Dirt Devil, then I'll know I truly bought good value.

I just moved into my apartment and was in need of a new vacuum, I had the carpets professionally cleaned a week earlier (swept & shampooed). Out of excitement of receiving this dirt devil I wanted to give it a try. Within only half the room the canister was full! I was in shock! Ever since then I am using it all the time.Pros: Deep cleans, great long attachments, bag-less, easy assemble.Cons: Bag compartment fills fast, small leak of dust around bag less compartment, although it has a floor level change on front, I see no difference.Great for apartments, and first vacuum owners!

I have had this product for almost 6 months now, and continue to be amazed at it's performance.  My aunt owns two smaller Dirt Devil uprights, and being impressed with the quality of those units, I decided to purchase this larger unit to replace my old Hoover upright.  I had no idea that my old vacuum was leaving the dirt behind that it was, but each week when I vacuum now, the dirt it is extracting is unbelievable.  It must still be pulling old cat fur and debris left behind for years from my old vacuum cleaner.The only minus in my review would be for the 'Power Brush' attachment, which I was hoping would be a great tool in removing my cat's fur from the upholstery.  It is fairly useless, clogging almost immediately with just a small amount of fur in it, the tool must be disassembled to remove the fur from the brush, then it will clog again as soon as it get a little more fur in it.  I just continue to use my Pledge Fabric Sweeper to get the fur off my upholstery.I love this product and highly recommend it for floor cleaning.  However, if the 'Power Brush' attachment is that important to you for pet fur removal from upholstery, you will not be happy in purchasing it.

column7: Good vacuum.  Power tool attachment is a problem though.
column8: A friend purchased this vacuum for me from Amazon to replace an old, bagged, Dirt Devil.  It does an excellent job on the carpet, particularly with cleaning up fur from my cat.  However, the power brush attachment which is purported to be great for cleaning upholstery, curtains, etc leaves a LOT to be desired.  The brush is turned via the vacuum's suction, but it will stop rotating almost immediately after you hold it down on the surface to be cleaned.  When trying to clean up cat hair, the fur beomes readily entangled around the brush, subsequently causing it cease turning.You have to keep repeatedly opening the brush casing up to pull out the hair strands.  Unfortunately, after using this power brush just 3 times, it will no longer turn sufficiently fast to do ANYTHING now, despite having removed all the cat hair entangled in it.  As a result, I now have to go back to using the regular bristle brush attachment to try and clean up my cat's hair...which is a tedious process...having to pull the brush along a surface a few times, then pick the fur off and drop it in the hose to be drawn into the cannister.Overall, I give the vacuum a 4-star rating.
For the money it is a good buy.  I was hoping that the filter was less problematic, but it requores regular cleaning and then replacement.

The machine works like a charm and has plenty of power for any job. Would highly recommend this product for all uses. Very reasonable purchasing cost, I think so much of this item I believed I should of purchased two at that price !

column7: Very Powerful But With a Quirk
column8: I bought this to replace a cheap bagless vacuum cleaner I'd bought several years ago during a Black Friday sale. Said vacuum didn't pick up dirt very well, clogged easily (both the hose to the dirt compartment and the area around the 'filter' at the top of the compartment). It also didn't have a hose. However, until I used this Dirt Devil on my carpet, I had no idea just how bad it was.This vacuum picks up dirt better than the last bagged vacuum I owned. I learned this in an unfortunate way; skipping over the instructions on how to empty it, I ended up dumping the contents partly on my hand. Those contents were a very thin, almost rice-like powder, nothing like what my previous vacuums had picked up. Best of all, when I ran it over some loose cat litter, it didn't spit anything back out at me like many vacuums. The hose is generous with several nifty attachments (I haven't used them all but soon will) and the sucking power is strong enough to yank my hands towards the hose. But be careful when you first remove the vacuum from the styrofoam packing; I was repeatedly shocked when I vacuumed my floor, and badly. I recommend running a dryer sheet over the hose before using it the first time (unless you let it sit out for a while).Speaking of the bagless compartment, it has easy removal to empty and the bottom-opening method is rather clever once you know it's there. The HEPA and foam filter are also very easy to get to (pop open the catch once you've removed the collecting compartment, and voila!). It's also about double the size of my old one. I vacuumed a mid-size living room and it was only 75% full (I have a Maine Coon cat, so most of it was fur). The old vacuum had to be emptied halfway through most of the time.However, there are a few minor problems with this vacuum. The box suggests it can be used on bare floor, but it merely blew a small area of dirt all over the kitchen. But I'll not quibble over that since vacuums are meant for carpets anyway. The biggest complaint I have is that the collecting container falls out. It has yet to fall out during use, thankfully, but you should've heard me scream when it first fell out as I was putting it away. This was before I realized that the container is utterly sealed. No mess to clean up if it tips over (though at the time, I believe it was already empty - call it a habit from the old vacuum that had repeated spills). It seems to come loose if you set it down too hard. It's fairly secure when simply moving the vacuum back and forth, or even shaking the handle. It's a vertical jarring that does it.This vacuum is quite heavy, so I'm not sure it'd be good for taking up and down stairs. But the heaviness is all in the bottom of the vacuum, and helps push the vacuum onto the carpet. So it's a trade-off. I can't tell you if there's any extra oomph to be had by the cyclonic airflow. I did notice the cat hair was more evenly distributed rather than clumping in one spot and restricting the flow. There's also quite a bit of exhaust air, but I didn't notice it having as bad a dusty/dirty quality to it as most vacuums, so perhaps the HEPA filter matters. Lastly, I'm 5'9 and most vacuums tend to have me stooping slightly, but this one seemed to be tall enough for me. Personally, I'm pretty happy with the Dirt Devil UD40275, flaws and all. Good value for the price.

column7: Great Vacuum - Been Using for 4 Years!
column8: I bought this vacuum from Menards for $225 over four years ago. I love it! I am a little bit of a clean freak and vacuum a 2200 square foot house (all mostly carpet) 1 to 2 times per week. This vacuum works great. It has great suction and I like the attachments it offers. I espcially like the power hand tool which is great for vacumming carpeted stairs and furniture. I empty the canister every time I vacuum and, yes, it is messy. But it's bagless and I think all bagless vacuums are messy; it does save you from spending money to replace the bags though. That is one reason I switched from a bagged vacuum to this one. I've been reading other reviews stating that this vacuum no longer sucks and the powered hand tool no longer spins. Well, if you don't clean the filters every three months as recommended in the manual, of course it won't have good suction. And, poor suction is what causes the powered hand tool to not spin. As long as you take out the filter at the top of the canister and clean it well (I use my husband's shop vac and vacuum the filter and then wash it in the kitchen sink with water and let it air dry before reinstalling). Also, probably about once a year, my husband takes the canister apart and the base spinning brush section apart and blows it out with his air compressor. Yes, this can be a pain, but it makes the vacuum operate as if it was brand new. I have had to replace the belt and just recently the hose that connects the base to the hand held removable hose on this unit. I also opted to order a new HEPA filter for it while ordering the hose. Please note, this only cost me about $25 from a vacuum parts warehouse (search online), and I think it is to be expected when the vacuum has been used over 250 times in the last four years. The replacement for these parts was a little difficult (except for the HEPA filter, it just slides in and out), but it was worth the extra 30 minutes to an hour to replace these things and much cheaper than replacing a perfecting operational vacuum. Before purchasing this vacuum, I researched a lot of vacuums. I even considered buying a Dyson, but when it came down to it, I didn't think it was work the extra $200. I am happy with this vacuum and would definitely recommend it if you don't mind doing a little maintenance and taking care of your vacuum. I don't think any vacuum would be maintenace free. I hope my review has helped you.

I got this vacuum in 2009 and yes it's heavy, messy to empty and the bin is tiny but overall I only paid $99 so I think I got a great deal. I am a clean freak. I vacuum every other day with 3 cats and now twins. I have all hard wood in the house and a bit of carpet in the basement. I have become slightly disappointed in the pet attachment as of late. For the most part it doesn't spin anymore but again it was only $99. I came back today to buy another vacuum because mine had an unfortunate run-in with an incorrectly cleaned pet stain from our elderly cat and will need to be thrown away; wow was I surprised to see the priced DOUBLED!
This vaccuum is terrible.  I bought one for my wife and one for my father.  Both of them work for about 15 min. then they have to sit for an hour to work again.  Buy anything else

column7: The best out there in the $100 to $200 price range
column8: The best out there in the $100 to $200 price rangeLIKES* 4 years without a repair or reduction in cleaning (weekly used on 4 bedrooms, diningroom & livingroom)* Great suction* Great tool to get corners, window sills, and behind furniture* Great tool for furniture* LOVE the bagless super large cup* Simple to empty - just twist apart empty and twist on and go* Not cumbersome - it's not light weight but I am 50 years old and not in the best shape and I have no issues* Only replaced a belt once when I ran it too close to a bed spread and in it went LOL!* Easy turn on off with foot or hand* Cord retracts with a touch and pulls out easily* Hepa filter - easy to install - save yourself the hassle and replace instead of cleaningDISLIKES* Hose for tool could be  longer* replacing the belt is a total hassle - the old Hoover my mom had in the sixties was awesome - to replace the cover plate you just slide out 3 hooks and done - this one you have to take out like 8 screws  - that was ridiculous - however I looked at many cleaners and they are all like that - makes no sense* Doesn't go under most furniture

I received this vacuum as a gift after moving into my house, which is the only reason I still have it. First, the thing weighs a ton. It is very difficult to carry around, let alone push. The filter constantly gets clogged and needs to be cleaned, which then needs hours to dry before you can reassemble it. Emptying the canister is a complete mess...everything inside falls out all over the floor. I've had it overheat with only vacuuming half a room, and it takes hours before it will turn on again. The small rotating brush stopped working after a month, and now even the floor brush has stopped working. This vacuum will definitely be finding a new home in the dump. DO NOT BUY!!!!!

Works great when it works and it almost NEVER WORKS. I've kept every part clean and clear; from the dirt cup to the secret little foam filter above the dirt cup, the hose, nozzle, base and all I have to show for it is a super clean vacuum cleaner that doesn't clean anything.

column7: Not recommended for people with joint replacements
column8: I am a 63 year old female and I don't recommend this vacuum for people who have had hip or knee replacements (I've had both).It's heavy and unwieldy, making it difficult to maneuver. It put a lot of stress on my artificial hip, resulting in pain and stiffness. One commenter scoffed about the weight of the Hoover saying it weighed no more than a small child. Well, I would have trouble pushing a small child around the floor and I'm not looking to cuddle the Hoover on my lap, lol. It's one thing to lift this vacuum and another to actually to use it.Because I am unable to successfully use the Hoover, I can make no other recommendations, pro or con.

column7: Should be renamed HOOVER DUST-BOWL (Hoover Windtunnel + Cyclonic Bagless HEPA Vacuum)
column8: Hoover Windtunnel + Cyclonic Bagless HEPA Vacuumaka THE HOOVER DUST-BOWLIn my opinion and experiencePROS:- The longevity of this vacuum  has stretched to about 3 years (though rarely used), which is longer than I can say about my old Bissel (good riddance) without MAJOR repairs/replacements. FYI: this is NOT say the motor, suctions and functions haven't declined - which they definitely have. This is basically when plugged in and powered on = the motor still turns over, electrical connection, etc.- It does pick up a lot of dirt, dust, and other stuff deemed dirty.- Has carpet and bare floor settings.- Retractable cord.CONS:- The bagless aspect of this appliance is difficult to remove and replace, which is often since it does do a good job of picking up all the dirt.- The bagless feature is horrible and tend emits a dust 'wind-tunnel' all of its own accord, meaning that the dirt seems to escape through the cracks or something of the bagless container while in use, creating a layer of dirty residue on the outside of the vacuum. WHAT THE WHAT?!?- The bagless feature is A PAIN IN THE A** to empty and makes this vacuum live up to its name by creating more than just a wind tunnel but a full on DUST-BOWL each and everytime the canister needs emptying. SO AWFUL.- It has become increasingly louder over time, especially when it's on the carpet setting.- Has left darkened streaks on my white, high pile rug even though it was set on the appropriate setting.- The detachable brush/tools are irritating to use due the terribly too short hose length.- It's VERY plastic-y and to replace anything other than the HEPA filter, one must unscrew all sorts of pieces of flimsy plastic and, god forbid, if anything does cracks a bit, you're left worse for wear (I tightened a screw too tight when putting a piece back together, which split the plastic in half and created another hairline crack on a different piece. So now those 2 pieces are held together with duct tape and wishful thinking that nothing else goes awry until I can afford a new/better vacuum).- Very bulky and heavy without much agility whatsoever. Also, is too thick and 'fat' in the front to go under most low-lying furniture - such as our couch, bookcases, and bed.- The vac (functionality, motor, and suction) has declined on overtime - not really surprised, though.Basically, I'd recommend something with a bag (unless you're paying A LOT and it's a high-end brand) and be sure to test the weight and versatility of movement before investing in a vac.I would not recommend this to anyone. In fact, we tend to use or small hand-held Black & Decker vac in lieu of this one even if it does take eight times longer to do the floors. It's just not worth the mess, hassle, energy, and noise to bring out this Hoover. And it's sad because I always thought Hoover was an American brand to be proud of...well,that's changed, and I for one am quite ashamed of it, tbqh.

column7: Hoover Multi-Chamber Cyclonic Mach 6 =Fancy name for crap
column8: This vacuum is a piece of crap.  Lifetime filters????  Yeah right!  We cleaned and cleaned our HEPA filter as per instructions, and after only 2 years, we couldn't get it to clean anymore.  Without clean filters on a bagless vacuum, the motor starts to burn up.  Scary!  Of course, Hoover does not offer replacement filters, so out to the trash it goes!  What a waste!  This is also dangerous, because when the motor gets hot, so does the retractable cord, which could cause it burn you!  Of course, Hoover recalls their other vacs with this problem but not this one!Also, the 'no loss of suction' is a joke, it lost suction as soon as the warranty was up.  Blew the dirt around on our hard floors but never sucked any up from day one.  If you're looking for a vacuum that cleans carpet well for a year but then dies, this is your vacuum.  Otherwise, keep looking.

Our Eureka bit the dust this past year and we were looking for a replacement.  We have had ALL Hoover vacuums before this last Eureka and only bought it because it had good reviews.  Actually am an Amazon regular too but didn't have reviews when I recently bought this model Hoover at a local retail chain.  CAN'T TELL YOU HOW DISAPPOINTED I AM.  The tools just are terrible.  The brush attachment quit working the SECOND use.  The other attachment is OK but won't get up all the hairs or 'lift' the carpet.  I have resorted to holding the vacuum on stairs (I am a 210lb male and it is hard for me to do) to get them clean by using the regular part of the vacuum because the tools are useless.  We were regular Hoover customers before this.  Not sure after this vacuum.

column7: Worse Vacuum Cleaner We've Ever Owned
column8: We bought this model from Home Depot for over $200. It worked great the first six months. First, the agitator belt stretched out. We purchased a new one from the Hoover website, it took almost two weeks to get it. Then our vacuum cleaner started turning off by itself. I can vacuum for about 10 minutes with it, then it will turn off. I have to wait almost an hour before it will turn back on. The canister is very dirty-dust goes everywhere. Yes, it's easy to push the little button for the bottom of the canister to open, but I always have to twist the top of the canister to get the hair/dust off the top of the filter. Having to open the top of the canister defeats the purpose of the bottom opening. Our pet tool worked for the first month, it no longer spins. By far, this is the worse vacuum cleaner our family has ever owned.

We bought this vacuum from Sears and luckily purchased a warranty.  It has been fixed twice because it stopped spinning or the motor quit working. It has a life span of about 6 months.  Cleaning out the vacuum is tedious and messy as well.  Worst vacuum I have ever used.  Also very heavy.

Do not waste your money on this vacuum. It doesn't suck well and barely picks up anything. It is very heavy and hard to push. Most importantly, after about 20 uses, ours stopped working completely. If it will turn on, there is no suction and it shuts off after 3 minutes. I don't know which vacuum you should buy, but I know you should NOT buy this one.

column7: Gift I would not have spent the money on
column8: This vacuum was given to me as a Christmas gift about 3 years ago.  I wanted a bagless vacuum, but had I known this was going to be such a filthy mess to clean out all the time, I would have passed this model up.  Initially the suction was good, but it does not take long for hair, carpet fibers, and other gunk to get caught up in those hard to get to areas without having to take the dang thing apart to clean.  It really is gross to clean and like other reviewers, I often will take it outside in the warmer weather months to clean.  In the winter I put the canister in a large garbage bag and try to empty it there to keep the dust and stuff from flying around too much in the air or landing on the carpet.  The canister, etc. seem to need to be cleaned often. If not, and air flow gets clogged, the vacuum will not start until it is properly cleaned.  This happened to me a number of times when I was not on top of emptying and cleaning out the canister and filter enough.  The roller with bristols often times does not work, so it is not that useful on carpets (perhaps the belt came off).  It often sticks or just stops rolling. The wheels squeel often. When it does work, it is very noisy.  The small removeable plastic catcher that guides and holds the retractable cord, often pops out and has to be snapped back in to properly wind the cord back up. This vacuum is also very heavy--not good for someone who has difficulty lifting heavy items.  Hard to lug up and down stairs. Had I actually purchased this vacuum and had a receipt, I would have returned it; but since it was a gift and I did not have a receipt or know from whence it came, I could not return it.  I would not recommmend unless you don't mind thoroughly cleaning it out often and are handy with unscrewing the components and putting it back a part.

I would highly recommend NOT buying this vacuum.  My wife brought it home, and we loved it until Christmas when we were using it more often.  We'd be vacuuming our small place, and the motor would just randomly shut off.  I've cleaned the filter to make sure everything was working properly, but the motor still shuts off after only five minutes of use and won't turn on again for a half hour or so.  DO NOT BUY!!!

I've owned this vac for approximately 1 year, purchased at Big Lots for $80, by the way.  I loved the style and the price, plus I've owned many Hoovers that I have loved over the years.  This is the worst vacuum I have ever owned.  1. I feel like I need to take a shower after emptying the canister. Just is a messy job. The filter inside the canister clogs, so I end up having to stick my hand up there to pull out all the caked on gunk. 2.  If you have kids and a dog and vacuum almost daily, the canister needs to be emptied after just about after every room for proper suction.  3.  The beater bar is weak, won't turn on a plush carpet.  If you raise it up, it spins, but then it's not doing it's job on the carpet.  4.  There are 2 removable dust filters that clog almost instantly, to get vac to function well they need to be removed and washed weekly. 5. The light burned out after a week.Those are my biggest complaints.  I do like the attachments and use frequently for dusting.  Also, if you only use it for light duty/vacuum infrequently this may be a great choice for you, especially if you can pick it up at a discount store as I did.  So glad I didn't pay the $190 price tag amazon is suggesting.

To keep it brief, I would not wish this vacuum on my worse enemy.  The brush on the main unit stopped working after about 2 weeks of light use.  I attempted to contact Hoover with my problem and received only a generic automated response with no solution to the problem.  After searching the web, I discovered that I am not alone with this problem; it seems to be very common with this model.  Now, I have to try and figure out how I can return this product.  I have been happy with my previous WindTunnel vacuums, but this is likely my last.  The quality is definitely lacking.

column7: Sorry that I recommended it at first! This vacuum is terrible!
column8: When I first had this vacuum it was great at sucking up everything in the carpet. I recommended it to my parents and a neighbor and they went out and bought it. What a mistake! Within 6 months the motor would overheat and shut off after vacuuming just one room. You have to wait several hours for it to start working again. Hoover said that is just a safety mechanism, but who has hours to vacuum their house? It is very heavy and my parents have a hard time using it at all. It is very hard and tedious to clean the filters. I dread vacuuming. Now, over a year later the brush will not rotate anymore. It is going in the trash. I spent over $200 for this. My cleaning girls refused to use it a long time ago. They bring their own. My parents and neighbor all hate it too. Please, please don't buy this. There are other vacuums that are better. Keep looking!

purchased vacuum at walmart off the clearence rack for a great price of 60 bucks. pretty impressed with the suction power. onboard tools store handily. the only issue is that it will tip over at times if your using the hose with be the onboard attachements. but even at a smidge over a hundred bucks i feel it's well worth it.

I am not a Hoover Hater and when I saw that Hoover had started their own versions of cyclonic vacuums, I pretty much bought this vacuum without hesitation.  I LOVED this vacuum at first, it had great suction, which was what I was looking for, but after a month it started making a very loud noise when I used it on carpet.  I ordered new belts (it takes 2) and replaced them myself, took it apart and cleaned everything, and it was still very loud.  Several weeks after that, the brush roll for carpet stopped rotating all together!!!  Totally useless on carpet.  Again I looked up Hoover on-line only to find that there are no replacement parts to buy on line for this problem.  I took it in to see how much to repair it and they told me $100 + .... umm no, thank you - I would rather invest in a new vacuum that I can depend on not to break in a month!  I through this in the garbage... like throwing $200 in the toilet.  I rely heavily on customer reviews... and I can assure you that you would be disappointed with this product.

column7: Give up after one year of kicking butt
column8: I have owned this just a year and it's begun turning off on its own.The curved  U-turn hose is screwed in a plastic flimsy thing which jams up, and then it seems the vacuum overheats.I have no carpet in my home, which is all hard wood, and one 9x12 area rug.It did suck up well on the area rug, but I felt after vacuuming that I had not touched my hardwood floors. And I'd done them.I'm shocked at how bad this vacuum is, and its cost is exorbitant for something that dies in a year.I'm no ergonomic design major, but I do know this: no vacuum should have a hose that curves and gets jammed each time you vacuum.

column7: Perfect if you have no pets and are bald
column8: You get for what you pay for, I guess.  I kinda wish that the suction would pick up more cat fur, but the bagless part itself fills up so quickly, if you vacuum like I do, about once a week or so then be prepared to empty the canister in the middle of the vacuuming session.PROS ---1.  Self-winding, self-storage of the cord - There is a button on the side of this vacuum cleaner that, when depressed, will cause the cord to wind up so fast you have to jump to get out of it's way lest you be snapped in the calf by the thing.2.  Extension wands included - If you are trying to use this to clean a bed/furniture, then you will have no problems using the extension wands that will extend the hose to the appropriate height in order to clean off the cat/dog hair from the bed.CONS ---1. Stairs - I have stairs in my apartment, and if you are trying to vacuum them because they are carpeted then forget it!  The hose reaches barely halfway, and if you use the extension 'wands' that are included, you may as well just bend down and try to blow the dust away because the suction will decrease rapidly as you add more extension wands.2. Weight - This thing is REALLY heavy.  Coupled with the stairs, it is required that the person lug the thing up and down.  It is awkward to hold when trying to go up and down the stairs and I always feel in danger of tripping over the bulkiness of the vacuum itself and tumbling down the stairs with it.3. Pets - It is not very good when dealing with pets.  I have two cats and an apartment and I have to empty the bucket multiple times when vacuuming, and I vacuum about once a week (sometimes more, sometimes less).4. Messy Cleanup - Usually when I do cleaning I mop the floors, and when I do the vacuuming last I can't help but to get the dust everywhere.  Also, the filter is so large and bulky, it is impossible not to get dust everywhere because you can't keep all of the parts over the trash can at the same time.  If you use the easy 'release' button at the bottom of the bagless part you still have to reach up inside and get everything out before it is really clean.Overall, the cons outweigh the pros in this one.  If you want to go with something that is going to last and will pick up a lot of cat/dog hair, or if your place is bigger than your average apartment, look elsewhere I'm afraid.

column7: This vucuum sucks, and not the way a vacuum should suck
column8: This vacuum cleaner is garbage, and cost about ten times what it's worth. We had three of them for about a half a year. Why three? Because we were able to exchange it twice, after it they broke down within the first 90 days.It looks nice, and has a lot of nice attachments, and a self-retracting cord. But it goes through one belt every month; and the belts are not easy to replace. After a couple months the motor stops working, after about five minutes of use.I would not recommend this machine, for anybody who needs it for more than three months.

We purchased this vac last summer. It quit working after a week. We took it to a local repair shop and they ordered parts for it but it still would not work correctly. The repair shop did not charge me but they said the sweeper model was junk and that message was from Steel City Vacuum supply in PA. Next we took the Vacuum to a Factory Authorized Repair Center. They tried to repair it three times and finally contacted Hoover about a credit or a replacement. All they got was the old runaround at Hoover. This is a new Hoover Company, and they did not honor their own warranty. I just took the loss and junked it. This not the Hoover company that our parents trusted. These people are less than honorable. Don't throw your money away. Don't buy Hoover.

While I believe this vacuum does do a good job picking up dirt and cleaning my carpet I have a few complaints and would recommend this vacuum to others with reservation:1. not a big deal, but, the on/off button is too close to the handle and I often turn it off while vacuuming.2. it is very heavy!  I have difficult taking it upstairs.  Pushing it back and forth gives me a work out too.  I consider it my exercise for the day.3. when I empty the canister I often have to use a small bristle brush to get all the dirt out from the top.4. the handle often comes loose thus turns off the unit!!  This I would say is my biggest complaint.  May be a defect.

column7: Do Not purchase - stops working after about a year
column8: When we were in the market for a new vacuum, I did a lot of research and this seemed to be the best buy for what we needed. I was very pleased at first except that it's very heavy. However after about 10-12 months it would simply stop working or wouldn't turn on. After looking through the manual, it seems this is caused by the vacuum overheating. Granted I was vacuuming for about 10 minutes before it would not turn on again. Now vacuuming takes about 6 hours for our 1900 square foot house. I can use it for one room and then it overheats and I have to wait another 2 hours for it to turn on. Extremely frustrating. I would NOT recommend to anyone who's looking for a vacuum that will actually turn on.

I did like this vacuum when we first bought it.  The cord wind-up is a very nice feature.  I also liked that the tubing is clear so we can keep an eye out for clogs.  All of the attachements were very nice as well.However, after about 6 months of use it simply stopped working.  In the middle of using the vacuuming it shut off and will not turn back on.  It was good while it lasted but I wish I wouldn't haven't wasted my money in the first place.

I bought this last year and have about given up on it. The biggest problem is cleaning out the vacuum after it's been used. The dirt goes everywhere. Basically I have to clean it in the sink. The HEPA filter needs to be rinsed out after I've used it for one floor, and then it has to dry for a day. The housekeeper says she can only use it 15 minutes and then it overheats and shuts off. Frankly, I'd rather have a bag on the vacuum now.  It would probably pick up enough of the dirt around here.

bought this vacuum two years ago and it's still working as great as the day i bought it!  i like to take appliances apart and clean them, this may have something to do with it.  i let the dirt pile up too high once and wound up spilling it in the kitchen, but it was easy to clean up.  great product!

For $189 this product is not worth the money.  It's heavy to use and noisier than the one I previously owned.  I have to push the vacuum with one hand and hold the cord out with the other (otherwise the cord will retract).  I've only had it for six months and it seems like an old, beat up vacuum that you wouldn't pay $5 for at a garage sale.  Lately it makes loud noises  like it's on it's last leg.  Keep looking...

Owned a Dyson for 4 years. A friend borrowed it to clean his concrete floor after he'd pulled up his carpets and bits of concrete and carpet glue really messed up the wheels and hoses. Guy in repair shop said it was beyond repair so we decided to buy a cheap vacuum. BIG mistakeCons:It falls over very easily when using the hose. Has fallen on my a few times and can easily see how if you are less frail than I am, it could cause injury.Very heavy and bulky compared to our old Dyson and therefore awkward to maneuver.You'll need to empty it outside or re-vacuum after emptying it. Pet hair clogs the upper filter and you have to reach in with your hands to drag the dust down. Simply badAttachments are poorly positioned.Mediocre suction - doesn't even come close to our old Dyson.Pros:Less expensive than better products. But usually good things aren't cheap and cheap things aren't good.I've learned my lesson - going to give this one away to a bodybuilder and spend a little more on a better product.

My wife and I purchased this to replace an old Hoover bagged upright that finally died. It's the first bagless we've ever owned.The vacuum seems to be solidly built. We like the hose and the assorted attachments. It's easy to use (but heavier than our last one), and is also much quieter. This was a pleasant surprise. It also seems to be very efficient, and collects a lot of dirt in a very short amount of time.It's neat seeing the dirt and dust collect as you vacuum. It amazes me that dust collects that fast on our carpet, and we remove our shoes when entering the house.As this is a bagless cyclonic vacuum, emptying the cup (canister, whatever you choose to call it) can be a very messy business if you're not careful. We've found that the least messy way to do it is to hold the canister so the end is suspended *in* (not *over*) a trash can, open the bottom, and let it all fall out. Don't try tipping the mess neatly into a smaller trash can (as if you were pouring from a glass)--it's a good way to get dust everywhere. Remember to check and clean the filters regularly.Thus far we've had one mishap, when my wife accidentally vacuumed up some clothes. This caused the belt to be thrown. I was able to get it all back together, but it took some effort; much more than our previous vacuum. The belt pulley assembly is plastic, so I was afraid it'd break with all the force required to get everything back in place. No breaks so far, but I'd guess that as the plastic ages over time, and becomes brittle, the pulley assembly will break during a belt change.The only thing that we have noticed that irritates us is sometimes, if the canister is not seated properly, there is a high-pitched whistling sound when we run the vacuum, because the canister is not sealed completely to the rest of the vacuum. Readjusting the canister takes care of the problem.Overall, we're very satisfied with it and would recommend it.

I have been using this vacuum cleaner for the past 6 months. I bought this because of the range of attachments and the extra long hose it includes, for cleaning stairs. But 6 months of using this has convinced me that it is a shoddy product. The pros:-> Extra long hose is really long and flexible and makes most corners accessible. But there is no hook or crevice in the cleaner to store / keep the hose attachment. So you literally have to drag it with you or hang it around your neck :))-> The automatic cord rewind is really easy to work and very convenient.The cons:-> The attachments are attached to the cleaner via the hose on the side. The attachments don't fix tightly, there is no lock mechanism. You lug the vacuum cleaner up a flight of stairs and the attachment comes loose, falls down the stairs. You have to - Go down pick it up, attach & repeat this process endlessly! The design is very sub standard.-> HEAVY. To be fair the package was heavy when I bought it and I expected it to be heavy. It feels heavier because there is no convenient way to pick it up when you go up the stairs or something. You have to pick it up by the handle on top of the cleaner and that puts excessive strain on the lower back.-> The pet-hair removing attachment is absolutely useless. The brushes on the attachment get stuck and stop rotating as soon as it picks up a bunch of hair. For a pet-hair removing attachment it has very low threshold for hair!! You are better off using just the extension attachments and a lot of lint rollers instead!-> The 'sucking power' (no pun intended!) of the machine is not great either. I have to set the brush to lowest height to make sure it brushes the carpet clean. I expect 6 months down the line, I expect it'll just stop working!-> Last, but certainly not the least, the machine is very poorly made. The attachments are already coming loose. The parts look like bad grade plastic. It is as cheap and flimsy as it looks despite how expensive it is!Wouldn't buy it again if it were offered free to me! My old Bissell is much better than this one. I wish I had just bought the attachments for the old one instead of springing money on this Hoover!

Pros: Quieter motor, Powerful suction, brush turn off (this feature extends the life of belts), cord rewind, nice color, tool storage on unit, no bags to buyCons:  28 pounds heavy.  Dirt needs to be emptied on a regular basis and dirt canister and filters need to be cleaned periodically. Turbo Pet Hair brush loses power when it comes in contact with surface (mine does anyway).I researched vacuums for a few weeks before deciding on this one. The mixed reviews make it very hard to determine what vacuum to buy. The fact that I was able to get this unit for 50% off it's price, helped make my decision easier. I couldn't be happier with that decision. It works great on hardwood floors and carpeting.  My preference was to buy a Hoover Windtunnel bagged vacuum, but the extra cleaning power that this model has, is worth having to empty the dirt and clean the filter unit periodically. I couldn't believe the amount of dirt it vacuumed up from my rugs and hardwood floors. Obviously my old Hoover Windtunnel wasn't doing the job. I use my old vacuum to help clean the dirt cup and filter, it makes the job much easier.  My turbo pet hair brush is almost useless, when it comes in contact with the surface you are cleaning, it stops. Fortunately, I still have the turbo brush from my old vacuum, and I am able to use it with my new cleaner. I love the cord rewind feature, I always hated to have to wind up vacuum cords! Works great! Never had a problem with the cord retracting on its' own, as another reviewer stated. Because of this feature, the cord is somewhat slimmer though. The automatic or manual brush turn off feature means less wear and tear on the belt and hardwood floors. The Durabelt #170 belt available at Walmart fits this model, this number belt is actually made for Hoover Windtunnels.  It seems to be just a little bigger then the one that came with the vacuum (same width though), but it works perfect, and is much eaiser to put on. I believe that the original belt was probably too tight anyway since it broke after only two uses.  Please note that the Durabelt #160 does not work with this model, I already tried since it is the size my old vacuum uses.I highly recommend this vacuum if you don't mind having to periodically clean the dirt cup and filter. Great cleaning power. Be sure to clean the filters periodically since dirty filters will reduce the suction power of the vacuum dramatically, including the suction through the hose. Clean filters make a world of difference in the operation and efficiency of this vacuum.

One year later, we are headed out to buy a Dyson Animal. I really hate that we wasted a gift card (wedding gift) on this heavy POS. For about a month, this unit worked OK, but in my opinion, never as well as the cheap Dirt Devil I purchased as a bachelor. Main issue, the belts refuse to stay on. Yes belts(s) plural. If the main drive belt isn't coming off, the small beater bar belt is coming loose. You may make it through a vacuuming session without a belt popping off, but never 2 uses. Do Not get close to a rug or carpet or you will be taking this baby apart to reattach a belt. This has been happening from month one. My wife's pride kept me from taking it back since she convinced me to get it because of it's power head for cleaning pet hair off the couches and such.  Well the power head worked for about 2 weeks before it stopped rotating fast enough to be useful.  This attachment uses suction and another small belt to spin the brushes in the attachment around. But, here's where the second issues arises, the the vacuum isn't powerful enough to make it really useful.  In everyday use, you have to get right up on dust bunnies or cat hair before this unit will draw it up into it's 'windtunnel + cyclonic' chamber.  The suction on this is such a joke.If you choose to get this vacuum, keep a Philips head screwdriver, a broom and a dustpan mounted to the unit. At this point, a year later, only the broom and dustpan are working. The screwdriver is being retired for time served.  Again, this is a POS.

column7: If only we could have it all......
column8: Okay, I bought this Hoover to replace my 10+ year old self-propelled Hoover.  I am impressed with the suction, and love the self-winding cord but I can't stand emptying the canister.  I have to go OUTSIDE (not fun in the Winter) to the garbage can to empty this thing each time or else all those little particals will just escape and I'll have to vacuum/dust all over again not to mention wash my hands and the bottom and outside of the canister AND the slot where the canister sits on the vacuum--filthy and dusty ALL the time, yuck!  I purchased this at Target on sale for $169.  Much cheaper than the more expensive popular bagless brands.  I just can't justify spending that kind of $ for a vacuum, but may have to just so vacuuming can be an ok chore again instead of dreading all (2800sq ft) every time with this vacuum.Pros:  * Good suction  * Self-winding cord  * PriceCons:  * Way too messy to empty/clean  * It is heavy which is okay for vacuuming all on one level.  The old Hoover had a small lip/handle in the back so you could pick up the unit and hall it up/down stairs.  This model does not have a handle of any kind so it is very heavy and hard to grab and haul up/down stairs.  * Hard to clean the front entry area (top of beater bar where the suction is) Hair and dust clog this area easily.  If anyone has any tips/tricks to this vacuum please let me know!

Vacum arrived on schedule and was put into service immediately.  Suction is super and the cleaning of the carpets: Fantastic.  With little ones in the house, the cord rewind helps a lot.  At this time, no real negatives to report.  Compared to Mother-in-law's Dyson, better performance for the dollar.

i bought this to replace a canister shop vac i had been using for two small rooms i rent. i thought this would be smaller and easier. NOT----oh it works fine rugs look great picks up every bit as good as the shop vac but i still have the shop vac and why you ask??? because i need the big shop vac to suck the stuff out of the canister on the hoover others have described the process as 'messy' well it would qualify for descoverys dirty jobs. the powdered dust and hair and dirt collects up top and all around the tunnel housing, you open the little door and give it a shake thinking it will come out but no it wont you have to get a long thing, bar b q fork, chopstick to stick up there and try to puggle it out. no luck so you have to use another vacuum to pull the mess out. meanwhile you the floor the trash bin the air and if you are smart and go outside on the step for  this, are all covered. once you have finished you can change clothes and dont forget you will need to clean your shoes after you have showered all that fine dust is now in the laces. i have tried to give this away but no one in my family would take it ---i dont blame them

good for about a half dozen uses. after that, start shopping again. looses power after cleaning one 12x12 room. does nothing for pet hair. just clumps it up and leaves it on carpet. for $200 you're better off getting a case of lint removers and rolling over the carpet. it's pure junk. lasted about a month and a half (dozen uses) before issues occured. keep you receipt, upc, store clerk name, address, and color of hair and eyes if you want to warranty this item. pain in the arse. EXTREMELY DISSATISFIED!

I do not recommend this cleaner.  I should have checked with Consumer Reports first, as this cleaner did not rate very well there either.  I truly feel that the negetives outweigh the positives on this item.  Although it is less expensive than some of the other leading uprights and has that cool 'cord rewind' feature, there are just too many major flaws.  It tips over almost every time I use the hose and attachments, and it's awkward to try to hold the machine up while using them.  Speaking of  attachments, the one with the rotating brush stopped working after one use, the crevice tool doesn't really have a place for storage on the machine, and the brush keeps falling off the small upholstry tool.  Because the cannister is small, it loses suction before I finish cleaning my home...and it has to be emptied outdoors because it's such a mess to clean.  Now, after owning it for just a few months, it overheats and turns off after about 5 minutes of use.  I'm not sure if it's the hepa filter's clogged or what...  I'm really disappointed in this purchase.

column7: why should vacuuming be so stressful...
column8: So I've had this vacuum for a month now. I read review after review, polled my family, and finally decided on this Hoover Windtunnel. My previous vacuum was a Bissell which a vacuum repair shop told me wouldn't be worth my while to have it fixed. I loved my Bissell until the motor became unbearably loud. So here I am with a new vacuum. Oh yeah I have 2 cats so I vacuum every few days..Pros-it's got great suction and actually is pretty quiet for a vacuum. It smells clean now after I vacuum. I really like the automatic plug winder!Cons- the vacuum is heavy to push around.  Emptying the canister is a pain. On mine, the bottom does not release easily and I have to pry it open sometimes. I've come to empty the whole thing outside because of the mess. I'm not happy with this part.That's as honest as I can be. Hope this helps.

column7: It takes all the dirt away from my home!
column8: This is a super Vacuum cleaner, It does everything the 'best' vacuums do- and better!

Suction is tops and the accessories work excellent (air powered hand brush works excellent for furnature, pet hair, etc).  Contrary to what I've read here, emptying the cylinder is no big deal.  Very easy.  Sure there's some dust but it is what it is - a bagless design.  Dyson is no less messy and costs twice as much.I can't believe no one mentioned this glowing feature here so I'll say it in caps: THE AUTO-RETRACTABLE POWER CORD IS ONE OF THE BEST INVENTIONS EVER MADE FOR A VAC!!!! Trust me, you'll love it.It's quiet for a vac but slightly heavy, but a small sacrifice for such an awesome vac.  Very few complaints so far!

Hoover was recommended to me by my cleaning ladies who use one all the time, but unknown to me the one I purchased you would have to be a body builder to use very often. Even my cleaning ladies said there was no way they could use it for a whole day. My husband now has to use the vacuum as I have health problems and to use this vacuum completely wears me out. If I could have I would have returned the vacuum, but the box was nearly shredded off of the styrofoam packing so there was no way of putting it back in the box to return it. This vacuum does a good job of cleaning, but it really should have been a self propelled machine because of its weight.

This is a fabulous machine.  I compared it to the Dyson models in the store and it is not heavier ... the weight is comparable although the price is not.  This Hoover rocks.  My carpet looks brand new after running the Hoover on it.  I stood in amazement to see what came out of our carpets even through these are cleaned weekly (we had a Bissell that thankfully broke) ... If you want a Dyson by all means ... but I am a Hoover fan ... you will not be disappointed getting this model!!!
This model broke after one use.  One.  Not even on thick carpeting.  I am returning for a Eureka Boss.  Don't waste your time or money on this piece of junk.  You won't be happy.

I've had this vacuum for a little over two weeks and I have to say that this is the best vacuum I've owned yet. I have always been a Hoover fan and this model does not disappoint. What prompted the need for yet another vacuum cleaner was my growing intolerance of lugging the machine up and down the stairs. Our current Hoover Bagless Windtunnel model has been a great vacuum, of which we only had one complaint- the messy cylinder filter inside the dirt cup that seemed to hold on to odors, particularly dog hair from our two hairly house mates! Regardless of how well we cleaned the filter, it still seemed to spew that noxious odor through the house every time we vacuumed.We decided to retire that unit to the upper floor where the dogs are not allowed, and look for something that would handle the downstairs 'kennel'. Enter the Hoover U5780900.  This model does not use a filter within the dirt cup, but rather a series of chambers to remove and trap the dirt in the canister. I'm not a vacuum designer, but it appears to be a similar method used by another EXPENSIVE brand name vacuum. So far so good. The canister empties fairly easily from the bottom (still a two handed excersize) and if allowed to get too full, a little assistance is required to extricate the large lint and hair balls that will no doubt collect. Not a big deal to me and I appreciate not having the dirty filter to clean. The dust cup disassembles further and can be easily washed out in the sink on occasion, but not required after every use.This vacuum also features an on/off control for the beater bar for using on hard surfaces and auto brush-off when in the upright position for using attachments. I also love the cord rewind feature. Step on the button and the cord winds back into the unit. The cord has ample length to vacuum 2-3 rooms from one outlet.Suction seems to be very powerful and does not seem to diminish until the dirt canister gets VERY full. I am easily able to vacuum several rooms without emptying the cup (1300 sq feet). I will also note that this vacuum is remarkably quiet in comparison to other vacuums we've owned.The provided attachments are nothing out of the ordinary, although the turbo brush (air powered) seemed to work better than on our previous model. The hose could be longer, but I understand an add-on section is available through Hoover if needed.I'm neither impressed nor disappointed with the quality of the unit. I'm sure that with reasonable care, the unit will provide years of use.The only reservation I might have on is the overall weight of the unit. This this is HEAVY. I suppose this is somewhat beneficial in maintaining good contact with the carpet (We have a light weight Bissel that hops all over the floor)but could be a serious drawback for many people.All said, there isn't much I would change about this unit, although I could do with out the Motor City inspired chrome details.Good job Hoover!

I got this vacuum as an exchange for another bagged Hoover vacuum when that model failed (for the 5th time)  The store that allowed the return said they stopped selling the other Hoover model due to all the returns.  I wasn't thrilled about a bagless, but didn't have much choice unless I wanted to spend $500 so I took it home.The good:It's very quietIt appears to pick up a lot of stuff in the clear receptacle.The bad:It leaves a lot of debris in it's wakeIt's F I L T H Y to empty the container.  Dust everywhere...grossPet hair gets stuck way up inside the container so you have to either reach up inside and pull it out or take it apart and still reach in to get it loose.The light died in less than a weekThe beater bar is making noises like it has a bad bearing.  They don't use bearings so what is actualy making noise is plastic on plastic surfaces with dirt in them  That spells death the to the beater bar.The cord retraction mechanism is already weak after one month of use.  Soon, it will no longer fully retract the cord.When using the attchments and hose, any pull on the hose makes the unit tip over and crash to the floor.You'll need a shop vac to clean the cyclonic thingy.  It gets dust all in the tiny holes and they clog thus redering the unit with reduced suction.  Eventually, you'll need to disassemble the cyclone to clean it.  Poor design.Overall this vacuum sucks and not in a good way.  Flimsy plastic, poor design and cheap parts make it a unit to avoid at all costs.  Hoover's quality is abysmal.  This is my 6th Hoover in 2 years.  The last one kept breaking and I kept returning it until the store no longer sold that model.  Bad bad bad...

We had a Dyson for a couple of years and loved it, except the hose ripped twice.  We decided to go back to Hoover as it was always dependable before.  While this Hoover model is very powerful and has some great features, there were too many problems:1.  Emptying the dust bin is ridiculously messy.2.  The vacuum constantly tips over when using the hose with the tools--it narrowly missed my 2 and 4 yr-olds on several occasions.3.  The power tool rotating brush frequently stopped turning--nothing caught, no clogs.4.  The dusting brush is in 2 pieces and always slides off when using the vacuum.5.  Finally, the belt came off twice in 2 months.  To put it back on, you have to take the whole base apart.

Purchased this unit one month ago and now the brush refuses to turn.  I have taken it apart and cleaned it but, if it decides to work at all, it takes about 5 minutes before it will 'warm up' and start working.  As someone else mentioned, you better have a good grip on the handle if you decide to use the hose.  It will surely fall over with any tension on the unit at all!

This is a wonderful vacuum, which I highly recommend.  I had another model of this same vacuum that eventually broke because it kept tipping over when I was using the attachments.  This one is is much more heavy and sturdier, however, and doesn't tip over when I pull on the hose using the attachments.  The pet tool works much better on this one as well.

column7: Good but not the great Hoover quality
column8: This is my first Hoover, and probably my last Hoover. While it is a good unit, and seems to do better than my old Dyson did, now I realize I should have shelled out the extra money to have gotten another Dyson.Pros-Better at getting cat hair up than my Dyson (but my Dyson did the same thing when I first got it, but it is 4 yrs old and was beginning to lose its suction)-Somewhat sturdy unit, although it squeaks because of the plastic (could be considered a con due to shoddy materials due to overseas mfg)Cons-The cord is situated in the wrong location, in my opinion. It is constantly getting under the wheels when I go back and forth with the unit through the normal cleaning motions (even happens when I do my best to hold the cord up and out of the way) - I also have to make sure my feet are out of the way when I goto retract the cord, otherwise I'll end up with nice welt on my foot/ankle from the plug.-As already said on another review, the dirt receptable fills up quickly, especially if you use it on the lowest setting for the brush bar. Too much of a hassle to try and empty the unit also as I have already had to pull out stuff that has gotten stuck up in the jar (mainly carpet fuzz)-The center of gravity on this unit is way outta whack. I can't get but maybe 2ft at most away without the hose pulling enough to pull the whole unit down on to the floor (my Dyson 'rolled' with me). As I have already found out, if you don't situate yourself just right, you'll have this come down on to your leg, foot or back. To me this is the largest drawback of this unit.Hoover could learn alot if they would just get ahold of a few Dysons and study them, and see what they are doing wrong. Certainly won't consider another Hoover because of the already short time I've used this unit

Nice vacuum, but don't buy one. Why? Because even though I bought mine 2 months ago, Hoover doesn't have any parts for this unit. So, after my cleaning lady caught a rug fringe in mine and it developed a terrible knocking sound, I'm left without a vacuum I can't use. The repair center says it needs a new agitator brush roll, problem is no one, including Hoover has one. What kind of company sells a product and doesn't have any parts for it? My advice, put your money into another brand and don't risk getting stuck with a vacuum you can't use and worse, the manufacturer, is too unprepared to fix.

[EDIT 9/1/2009] There are newer models from Hoover that better mimic the design of Dyson's multi-cyclone technology, making them somewhat easier to empty/clean. The Turbo Cyclonic (Target) is a nearly exact clone of the DC14 and Hoover Whisper Cyclonic (Walmart) is similar to the DC14 but with a quieter motor. Both do not have a self-rewinding cord, but both are cheaper than the Mach 5, at about $100. Nevertheless, they are all bagless. What I have discovered that is an inherent part of the design of all bagless vacuums is that the process of emptying and cleaning the dirt cup is too messy to be worthwhile. I'm a clean freak and have dust allergies. I spend more time emptying and cleaning the dust bin and filters than I do actually vacuuming! I find that I put off vacuuming until the discomfort of the dirty floor exceeds the discomfort of emptying the dust bin and cleaning the filters. I am very strongly considering buying a bagged vacuum to replace this one even though there is nothing functionally wrong with it.After using this vacuum for two years, I can say that it continues to clean admirably. Suction continues to be strong and with no loss. However, I have noticed that if you don't empty the dirt cup with each use, the filters get clogged quickly and the vacuum begins to smell of dust. That happened to us and since I don't know how to replace or clean the HEPA filter (it's not washable), our vacuum continues to smell of dust. I'm attributing that to user error, however.---- Original Review ----Pros: Quiet motor, cord rewind, powerful suction, brush-bar shut-off.Cons: Small dirt cup, messy to empty, hassle to clean, heavy.The Bottom Line: This is the best value in cyclone vacuums, with all the typical benefits and drawbacks of that design type, plus a few special features--like the cord rewind and brush-bar shut-off.Full ReviewThe Hoover Windtunnel Cyclonic is the same machine as the Hoover Mach 5, which is sold exclusively at Walmart for about $20 less. The only differences are that Mach 5 is bright orange and chrome, whereas the Windtunnel Cyclonic is a much more 'normal' looking vacuum.The Hoover Mach 5 (and Mach 3) are replacements for the Fusion. The Fusion did poorly in Consumer Reports testing because of dust in its emissions. The new models attempt to rectify that problem with better filters. The Mach 3 has electrostatic filters for the pre-motor and final stage filter. The Mach 5 caught my attention because it has an electrostatic pre-motor filter and a HEPA final stage filter, both of which are cleanable and thus never need replacing. I had intended to wait until CR could test these new models, but went ahead and bought a Mach 5 when I saw one brand new and unopened on Craigslist for $100 ($75 below retail after taxes).As my friends and I used the machine several times in the course of moving out of our apartment, several strengths and weaknesses became apparent: First, the strengths are all those advertised--cord rewind, quiet motor, powerful suction, no loss of suction, easy to use tools, brush-bar shut-off. All those operate as advertised and the construction of the machine is by and large high quality, with only a few cheap-feeling things here and there. Fit and finish is good as well. And there is no problem with emissions. The motor is quiet (as far as vacuums go) and makes a lower-pitch noise than most. The brush-bar automatically shuts off when the machine is put in the upright position, and it may be shut-off manually using the foot-lever. It is a bit top-heavy, but not so much as to make it hard to maneuver, and the handle adjusts for height. It's really very easy to use and effective at cleaning.However, there are a few draw-backs. (1) The brush-bar is very aggressive. On our old and poor quality carpet, setting it to anything lower than the middle setting resulted in large quantities of carpet fuzz being generated and sucked into the vacuum. The carpet height adjustment for our medium-low height carpet ended up being set to a medium-high height setting to alleviate the problem. (2) The first issue aggravates the second, which is that the dust bin is small and fills up quickly. Despite the large clear bin, there is actually a 'full' line marked near the bottom quarter of the bin and it must be emptied once the bin reaches this mark or you will begin to lose suction as the high-speed cyclone is unable to work properly. (3) Emptying the dust bin is a relatively easy task, however, some dust clings to the cyclone assembly and must be brushed off with the brush tool. While it does detach nicely from the bin to allow for easy cleaning, it is still a messy process compared to removing and replacing a bag. And there is a tip at the end of the cyclone that requires cleaning to make sure it remains clear of debris, since this is the exit for the high-speed cyclone and if it clogs the cyclone will not work properly.Owners of cyclone vacuums often think that their machines do not need to have filters serviced. This is not true. Even Dysons have to have their pre-motor and HEPA filters cleaned from time to time (this is the leading cause of loss of suction for Dysons, and often is not made clear to Dyson owners). So too with the Mach 5. The pre-motor filter is located above the dust bin and is a washable electro-static filter (let it dry 24 hours before reinstalling). The HEPA filter is in a tray marked 'HEPA' below the dust bin. That may be cleaned but not washed. These filters should be cleaned about once every couple months or so, depending on how often you vacuum.So in summary, this is a good vacuum cleaner for the money. As with all vacuums, it is not perfect. It suffers some of the common drawbacks of bagless vacuums (namely the messier dust-emptying) while solving the problem of loss of suction. I would like to have a larger dust bin, but once the carpet height is set correctly, even the small one that it has is sufficient for a day's worth of cleaning. I recommend it, especially if you can find a good coupon for Walmart (the only place it is available retail) or other good deal (such as I did on Craigslist).

We just bought this Hoover today, It works great a lot of suction. We owned a Dirt Devil and a Kenmore previously, both were uprights. I love the retractible cord, the hose and attachments seem longer than my previous vaccuums. The dirt cup filled up quickly, easy to empty, some dirt, and hair stay stuck inside. I'm hoping this will last longer than my other machines. I wanted a Dyson but, the price was a little more than I was willing to pay. I went with the Sales persons opinion.

Do not buy - these are pieces of junk.  Got suckered in by the low price and bought one for home and office.  The one for home broke within weeks, Amazon replaced and that one broke.  The one at the office just broke too. I bought an LG and it has worked great going on a year. The LG was a bit more money but has a five year warranty.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

I actually bought this from a tool re-seller, probably a Hoover-endorsed shop because they carry the whole line.  I think it was refurbished.  I hate this vacuum, but it works well.  I have not had broken pieces or anything not working.  It is very heavy...very!  This is what makes me hate this thing with the power of 1000 suns:  The fact that the black rubber thing that goes around the beater bar so that you don't break stuff that you run into, well, it makes black marks ALL over my white floor moulding!!  And, no magic eraser is getting it off, I am going to have to repaint my trim.  I wasn't sure if that is what did it when I made a few marks the first time, and then my father was vacuuming and didn't see the black marks as he was running it along the edge of carpet/edge of trim. Do not buy this vaccum, it will set you crazy...

We've owned the Hoover Windtunnel for three years. It's the most powerful easy to clean vacuum ever. Just remind that the filters at the top of the bagless container MUST be cleaned or you will loose suction and burn up the machine. Keep in mind, too it's plastic - don't bang the wind tunnel on the side of the garbage can to clean it out and still expect not to break it. It's a great value - we've just ordered another.
Bought this for an apartment we use occasionally.  Second time we used the vacuum the beater broke.  But of course it's 14 days beyond the Amazon return date, so we are stuck.  Don't you be.

Got one from Hoover to replace a broken vac, and it CAME BROKEN - the brushes didn't spin even though the belt was intact. Apparently QC at Hoover isn't very good. I won't buy another remanufactured product from them again.

The brush stopped turning after about four total hours of use. The first time I used it, it did a great job, but had a squeal from the brush that made all the local dogs howl. I was just so happy with the quality of the clean, I didn't realize that the squeal was a death call and after I tried to use it again, it was done, which was after the return date.Now, I cannot locate any information on this site about the alleged six-month limited warranty so I have a dead vacuum on my hands.If this is what Hoover offers for a refurbished vacuum, I would never purchase a new one from them.My recommendation, spend the money and get it from a big box retailer and keep the paperwork so you can return it.

column7: Amazon made me give it one star and that is the only reason it has one!
column8: This is the worst vacuum I have ever owned.  Do not buy.  The vacuum works for me about 20 minutes at a time, it constantly clogs up...for whatever reason and the suction is horrible.  I am running to get a Dyson and never looking back.

We recieved vacuum in a very exceptional time frame, but when we opened it and tried to put it together, there were broken parts, the upright part of the vacuum didn't stay upright, and there were many cosmetic dings and scratches. On the up-side, I contacted Amazon and they were very friendly and replaced the vacuum and paid for shipping. I just stunk hauling around a damaged vacuum the send to UPS. We still love Amazon, and will still continue making purchases with them.

column7: It's a tool - but not a quality re-manufactured product
column8: Once a few bugs were worked out, the vacuum works fine but it is definitely not a quality product.  This was advertised as re-manufactured to factory specs.  The first problem was a loose screw on the bottom that tore up two rugs.  The vacuum was easily repaired, the rugs not so easily.  The next problem was the extension wands.  The ones that came with the vacuum were not the correct ones.  Hoover promised to send replacements - six weeks and counting - still no replacements.  The accessory power cleaning head was dirty and badly scratched, but functional.  Finally, the power cord is chafed; it is still usable but not what one would expect from a quality product.  For the price and the functionality we will keep it but I will think twice before buying another re-manufactured Hoover product.

We have been using it for over a month. It works quite well. The dirt cup is transparent so you know when to dump the trash inside. No more changing filter bag since it has the lifetime HEPA filter. My wife felt that the vacuum is too heavy for her to operate it. There are some scratches on the body reminding you it is indeed remanufactured.

I have used this for several months now.  Works fine except for two minor problems.  One wheel keeps falling off.  The belt which drives the rug brush keeps slipping of.  Both items are easy to fix, buy annoying.  Other than those items the machine seems to function well.

ive never had a vacuum that picks up an hole lot. it has twice the suction of my bissell. it vacuums pet hair like it was not there. its so quit when i use it when my cat max is sleeping. he will not wake up. i can clean the stairs with out moving the vacuum. i can turn off the brush roll on bare floors. butt my old dirt devil could not turn off the brush roll + the handel broke off the dirt devil. this vacuum i never have to picking up surface dirt. it picks up cereal in the mornings just like my eureka the boss. because the vacuum has an 12ft reach up all the way to the last 2 steps. it works cind of like a dyson upright. i think it cleans better than an bagless bissell uprigit. my hoover picks up the dirt i did not see. it picked up the dirt my grandmas kenmore left behind. im glad it has an hose vs an oreck.

column7: Vacuum" "cleaner" that neither vacuums nor leaves my floors cleaner"
column8: We've had this vacuum for three years. It worked well for less than one. First, it began overheating after 20 minutes of use. With 1800+ sq ft of carpet and 2 (now 3) kids, I didn't get very far in my chores before it quit. 20 minutes turned to 10 before we narrowed the problem down to a clogged filter. Bought a new one.Next, it developed a just-below-dog-hearing-range squeal. Then the internal cylinder cracked. Bought a new one.Now the brush control lever is broken, we can't seem to fix it, and the brushes no longer work. It was heavy and cumbersome as an upright; now I can't stand upright to use it, hunched over to use the hose and onboard tools, dragging the rest behind.We've spent >$300 on this vacuum, repairs, and our previous vacuum, also a Hoover, in 8 years. Never thought I'd say this, but I WISH WE'D INVESTED IN A DYSON FIRST. Would had saved us $ in the long run, it looks like.But I did like the retractable cord.

I love this vacuum. The best I ever had. I have 2 Chow Chows with lots of hair. I have bought alot of vacuums that just didn't work until I found this one. I also love the way it smells when I'm done, nice and fresh. The filter is great. Lots of power! All the tools are so handy. Don't let this one get away. This is a GREAT buy. Thank-You Amazon

column7: Worst experience ever,  only buy if you need a boat anchor
column8: I felt the same as the person that gave this a great rating.
