I use to love this vacuum even though it was heavy, but it performed well until I replaced the belt after about 1 to 1 1/2 years usage. Then it becomes a great heavy hand vac (that part works great) and that's it. After replacing the belt it will run like before a few times then the belt starts slipping. I have bought the replacement from Sears and even ordered belts from Hoover and the same thing keeps happening. I have complained to them but they basically give you the trouble shooters things to try which I have already done. I have had Hoover before and replaced belts many times without problems, that's why I bought Hoover again. But this model truly sucks. I am so disgusted. I hesitate to take it to a repair shop because people have done so and they still have the same problem and even the repairmen are at a lost. So my suggestion is save your money for your next vacuum instead of a belt. You'll need it. Unless they do something soon to rectify this, I will have to buy something else and you can bet it won't be Hoover again. I am looking at Oreck at Costco that has 5 yr warranty and inlcudes a handheld vac also.

We had a Bissell for years and it was great, but after moving into a new apartment, decided to splurge on a more expensive vacuum. Hubby brought it home as a suprise without reading any reviews - what a mistake! This vacuum had problems from the beginning. We tried clearing out the parts ourselves and cleaning thoroughly. After a few months, it was still making plenty of noise but wasn't properly picking up the dirt. Emptying it is also messy. Now it's been nearly a year and we give up - going to buy a decent vacuum with good reviews! Back to bags, too!

column7: This vacuum sucks- but not in a good way!
column8: I have had this vacuum for about a year now and it's just terrible.  I am going to get something lighter, easier to push around, and something that takes a bag so that I can throw away the junk off the floor mess free.  There has to be something better than this because I never want to have to reach into a vacuum and throw stuff away again.  :-/We got fleas this year too.  I have never had a flea problem before and I think it could be this unsanitary vacuum.  My last one lasted almost 10 years and it took bags, it was a dirt devil.

column7: Doesn't work very well - cheaper is not better.
column8: I didn't buy this through Amazon - but I buy a great deal through Amazon - this was a Walmart purchase of this same model.  One month - and now it pretty much doesn't generate pressure and moreover I've cleaned everthing.  Something smells burning.So I'm off again to hunt for the perfect vacuum.  Broke down and bought a $435 one for the vacation house - it is still going strong five years later.  That's because it is a Dyson.  The economy has me watching my pennies and I thought I'd try cheap.  Cheap is not spending $135 on vacuums every six weeks.I'm trying another brand.R

column7: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!! Total piece of CRAP!
column8: I really truly enjoyed using this vaccuum during the first 4 months or so that it worked properly. Although it's really heavy, awkward to turn, very annoying to empty the canister and the hose attachment is annoyingly short, despite all that I did enjoy using it and thought it did a great job cleaning. Until the trouble started....First the loud screeching noise begins to alert you that something may not be quite right. Then the agitator brush stops. Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't, sometimes you have to turn your vac upside down and manually stimulate it to begin rolling again (I'm sure this was a dangerous attempt, I'm not recommending trying that!) Then the brush stops working all together. When the brush isn't working, the vaccuum does not suck up a thing! Not a thing!!!I took it to the service center twice and it would work again for a couple of weeks and die. Total piece of crap!!! I am now shopping for another vacuum... uggh :(Don't buy this vacuum unless you enjoy wasting your money!

column7: I wish I had read the reviews before I purchased this!
column8: I purchased this vacuum because of the retractable cord, the fact that it was lighter weight than my last vacuum, and that it had a pet tool.The 'pet tool' is stupid.  The agitator brush works off of suction, not a motorized belt, so it barely turns and when you put it on a chair or stairs to suck up pet hair, it stops turning.2 weeks after purchasing this model, it overheated in mid vacuum.  Now it overheats after 10 minutes of vacuuming.  In reading other reviews, I see this is a common problem.I'm very disappointed in the function of this machine.  I can't wait to replace it with something better. Next time I will read reviews FIRST!

column7: It's a good machine for the money
column8: Good buy for the money, but you get what you pay for.  It does collect the pet hairs well.  It is light enough, but the wheels are cheap and big; making it hard to manuever.  Skimpy on the cord (really short), the hose (very short). Need to empty often as hair collects on one side and the wind tunnel stops working.  I will eventually buy another vacumn with more substance.  But if your vacumn is history and you need something right away, this is a good segway until you have time to test them all out.

column7: I absolutely love the Hoover Pet Rewind
column8: I have the Hoover Pet Rewind Bagless and love it. I have a 90lb mixed shephard dog who sheds like crazy.  Her hair was driving me so crazy that, besides my many swiffer products, I bought the vacuum broom, the electric swiffer product that vacuums on one side and cleans on the other, I have two carpet cleaners and two bag vacuum cleaners, yet still, I was just going to throw out my runner (rug).  When I bought this vacuum (I got it for a steal at Kohl's with a 30% off coupon and on sale) that rug was my first challenge. I had it on the back deck for a long time before brining it back in and deciding it was going to have to go. It is a fairly dark rug and my dog is light brown. This cleaner COMPLETELY cleared my rug of that dog hair. As a matter of fact, I was disgusted by the amount of hair in my upstairs carpet. My first floor is hardwood so I was always able to clean those, but it was just a never ending task. I went nuts when I first bought this cleaner and I still love using it. I have only had it for about a month, so I take heed to the comments on parts, etc.. Hopefully, I will not find such issues but if I do, I'll let you know.

I, too, found a vacuum that I thought was great, until it broke down after less than a dozen uses.  The Hoover Pet Cyclonic Upright Bagless Vacuum is a sad representation of the Hoover line of products.  Hoover should find a way to make this right and/or make amends to owners...and consider that it is a pain in the butt to have to replace belts frequently, and expensive, besides; we owners spend our hard-earned money on products we depend on to work for us.  Sad to say, if I don't get some satisfaction out of Hoover on this one, I will be switching to a new brand, from one that I have used all my <long> married life.

+1 star for excellent suction+2nd for the canister being easy to empty.- 1 because it's very heavy and the wheels don't roll easily to boot.- 2 the belt stretched out way too soon  considering I only have 300 sq ft of low pile industrial carpeting -everything else is tiles- 3 incredibly the hose is short, too stiff and the attachments are way too short.
This was the biggest waste of money i have ever spent !I can vacuum one room and then the motor quits ! So ittakes 7 days to vacuum the house . Its Junk !
Ditto on all the belt comments.  We're in our 2nd year with this vaccuum and the belts now wear our every few weeks.  We're tired of the repairs and will have to replace this model soon.

We bought this vacuum about one year ago and it is still doing a great job.  We are about to switch out the filter for the first time.  We have a 1400 sq. ft. house with one child, a big german shepherd and a huge black lab.  All three shed!  :)  This vacuum does a great job with all floor types.  We have both hard wood and carpet and to switch the floor type on the vacuum is a breeze.  I highly recommend this vacuum.  It's been durable and work horse for us.

This is our second Windtunnel.  When we bought this one we moved the first one down into the basement to my husbands Man Cave.  We have two Maine Coon cats and a Springer Spaniel.  They are very fuzzy and at this time they are shedding. I cant get over how well this works. Not only does it suck up the fur but you can actually see the dandruf from the animals.  Gross but it shows it works.  My favorite thing about it is the pet attachment that hooks to the hose and has a beater brush.  I use it on the furniture and even the cat tree.  My only problem I have with this was the hose which is one that automatically returns if you push a button. It now doesnt want to stay pulled out but we fixed it just with a clothes pin.  I have owned many vaccuums over the years .  Even expensive ones and as long as this works as well at it does I will always buy a windtunnel.

Seriously, I have never hated a product so much. It worked great for the first month or two, but after 5 months I am ready to throw it in the trash. It is not worth the frustration.Let me count the ways:1. It doesn't pick up hair.2. The beater bar won't work unless the vacuum is almost parallel to the floor and set on a high carpet setting, which then doesn't really touch the carpet and pick anything up.3. The automatic cord rewind is continuously rewinding the cord so you have to keep pulling it out. Not a big deal the first 10 times...just keep at it and it is so annoying and seriously slows you down as well as pulls the plug from the wall.4. The attachment hose won't stay in the vacuum when in use...so you are vacuuming and realize the reason it isn't picking up anything is because the suction hose has come undone.5. The automatic carpet tool doesn't work. That's all...just flat out doesn't work. Never did.6. The just plain old carpet tool has to be at just the right angle or it doesn't work. Oh, and it doesn't pick up hair either.7. It is really really heavy.8. It doesn't clean the carpet.9. The bagless canister has to be emptied constantly (it always seems full...not sure what it is picking up because I can still see the hair/paper/lint/etc. on the floor.)I can't believe Hoover put out this product. I am a 45 year old stay at home mom with 2 little children and I don't have time for the nonsense of this cleaner. Please, do yourself a favor and do not buy it. My 20 year old vacuum works better than this one.

I have 4 dogs and a cat and it is amazing how much stuff this picked up off my carpet after having used an Oreck for years that was barely picking up anything at all.  I feel like my carpet is so much cleaner now than it's ever been after using this vacuum.  The only negative is that it is super heavy.  If you don't have a strong upper body you will definitely feel it.  I guess that can be a good thing if you're looking to get fit.  Also, it is a messy task to empty out the collection cylinder.  I do it in the outside garbage can and stuff flies all over me but my carpet is clean!

I was very dissapointed in this vacume.. they call it the Pet Cyclone but it does not pick up pet hair and the transition from carpet to hard wood is awful.  I have had my husband take it appart and clean all the filters several times but it does not pick up pet hair or dirt.  I would not reccomend this and I will not buy another Hoover.

column7: Sorry I switched to a Hoover
column8: Do not purchase this vacuum at any cost.  Have had it for 15 months.  Started breaking before the one year warranty was up.  Hoover did pay for the repairs at a local shop but took over a month because the service center had to deal with Hoover for parts and permission to do the repairs.  Broke two more times since with the same problem but now that the 12 months are up, Hoover doesn't want to hear it anymore.  I even called their corporate office who sent me a 'courtesy' belt - the wrong one for the problem - and they weren't even nice about it!  I asked for a new machine or my money back, and they wouldn't hear of it.  I have a friend who bought the same model at the same time and is also having the same problems.  Not a good machine - but even more importantly - not an easy company to deal with!

I have had this vacuum for over a year. The first issue we had with this vacuum was the pet hair tool was useless. It works via suction and not by a belt. Therefore, the brush in the tool barely spins.The second issue is that after 6 months we had to replace the agitator belt. Since that time we have replaced the belt 4 more times. This last time the belt lasted 1 cleaning and needs to be replaced again. I have never owned a vacuum in which the belt needed to be changed this often.When the vacuum works, it works great, but it rarely works any longer since the belt lasts maybe 1 or 2 cleanings.

Just received my Hoover Pet Cyclonic Upright and am so thrilled! My other vac broke a few weeks ago so my carpets were very hairy.  It took me less than 5 minutes to assemble and i just vacuumed half my living room and the canister is half full with hair already and the carpet looks awesome! it's quieter than my last one vac which cost more and was about 5 years old before it got permanantly clogged...and it cost more than this one.  The cyclone is kinda cool to watch too! Very happy so far!!!

Its a bad design for pet hair. The hose connection runs through a little narrow pipe which gets clogges and shorts out the vaccume. Its sudden death. Everytime I use the vaccume hose the vaccume heats up. Ive actually been burned by the chord. Also, putting back the tank after emptying it is really difficult and the mechanism becomes loose after time. Its a poor design.

We have had this vacuum for four years now and it has always worked very well for us with two dogs to clean up after. I would recommend it to anyone with pets and the price is very reasonable for a good vacuum.  We are getting ready to purchase a new one now and are going to get the same model since it worked so well for us.Our current one I accidentally dropped down the steps and it has never been quite the same as before but that is my fault not the vacuums.

I had a Eureka that did not work very well, even though it was called the Boss.  I would go over my carpet time and again to get one cleaning.  With the Hoover, I only go over it once and it has the coolest attachments youve ever seen.  Definitely a value for the money.

column7: Great power, but belt breaks continuously.
column8: We've owned this vacuum for a year and a half, so my review is pretty well-informed.  For the first year, the vacuum worked fantastic.  We even had a Kirby salesman come to our house trying to sell us a Kirby vacuum and he was surprised by how well our Hoover Pet Cyclonic worked.  He said this was a better vacuum than some $300-$500 vacuums he sees when he visits homes.  The vacuum picked up very, very well, in a home that includes four children, one dog, and two cats.  The pick-up power in this vacuum is undeniably great.However, after the first year, the agitator brush quit working.  We narrowed it down to the belt that runs it, and easily found the belt number listed in the parts manual of the vacuum.  Finding a store that sold the belt was another matter, but eventually we found it at Sears.  We replaced the belt and the vacuum again worked great.  Within the past half a year, though, we have had to buy FIVE new belts.  At $6 a piece, we have now almost put 1/3 of the price back into the vacuum in six months.I wouldn't recommend this vacuum to friends or family.

column7: DO NOT BUY IF YOU HAVE PETS
column8: We bought this specifically to vacuum pet hair.  The special Pet Tool is one of the worst designed products I've seen.  Instead of having a power belt, it is powered by suction.  This gives it about 8 rpm.  Then what little pet hair it actually picks up is sucked right THROUGH the mechanism which clogs it instantly.  It is useless.  Don't buy it.

I have been spending $30 every couple of months to replace the belt that runs the agitator brush.  I could have bought two of these things by now.  I am finally just going to buy another vacuum - not a hoover!! Do not waste your money!

column7: Get ready to buy some BELTS!
column8: I bought this 'thing' when they first came out.  I'm on my 16th !sixteenth! (so good I had to spell it out) agitator belt.  At about $4 a belt I could have bought a cheap vacuum cleaner that actually works just on what I've spent on belts.  How can I say to you not to buy this terrible vacuum.  Oh, here's how......DO NOT BUY THIS VACUUM!  PLEASE LISTEN!  RUN NOW!

column7: Much Better Than My Dirt Devil
column8: I have had a Dirt Devil vacuum for quite some time.  I loved the fact that it had a dirt canister rather than using bags, but I hated having to try to clean the filter out, buying replacements for it, and I just did not feel that the vacuum was doing a good job.  I have 8 dogs in the house (yes, that's right--8) and I could vacuum my carpets and then shampoo, and the carpet cleaner would collect GOBS of dirt and dog hair.  The dirty water looked like mud.  The day I got my new Hoover Pet Cyclonic, I used the old vacuum first through the whole house.  I then used the new one and was AMAZED at the amount of dirt that it picked up that my old one missed.  And I don't have to buy new filters anymore!  I can just wash and reuse the one the vacuum came with.  This vacuum is a gem.

column7: I agree with Bill Scott, Don't Buy It!
column8: I bought it about a year ago.  It had many features that I liked, one being the retractible cord.  I loved the mini-pet brush as we have three dogs.  One that sheds a good bit.We have a cleaning lady, so I only vacuum in between cleanings, so very light use. Then the belt started squealing.  I took it apart, played with it, cleaned it, put it back together and it didn't help.  After a couple uses, the beater bar just quit working.  I took it to the shop, they replaced the belts.  That lasted for one more good vacuuming, then the squealing was back.  Second use, the beater bar quit again.  Its like the plastic contraption that tightens the beater bar when you step on the pedal just doesn't tighten enough, so there's not enough tension on the bar...so it won't spin.So, today I did a little research and bought a Eureka Airspeed from Walmart for $119.  Putting it together only took a few minutes.  The cleaning lady came today, and for the heck of it I revacuumed what she had done in the living room.  After just one room, I threw away about 2 cups of plain ole dirt.  Not dog hair, or debris.  Just dirt.  And we just had the carpets professionally cleaned about 3 weeks ago.I'll miss the retractable cord, but the Eureka Airspeed is much lighter and easier to push and definitely does a better job, and does a better job on the edges than any vacuum I've ever used.  I just hope it outlasts the Cyclonic-joke-of-a-vacuum.

I got this for Christmas last year and was so excited!  I run a daycare and have a cat so my house gets to be a mess and I find myself vaccuming at least 3 times a week.  Our last vaccum didn't have any suction and just pushed dirt around on our rugs so I was excited to get a brand new one!  The Hoover worked great until a few weeks ago.  It started squealing really loud and the brush would stop spinning.  I tried to lift the height a little but then it didn't get the little pieces left on the carpet.  I took it apart and cleaned the brush and all the tracks, put it back together, and found out it's worse.  It is almost not working at all now and I am very frustrated!  I haven't called Hoover or found out what I need to do to fix this situation but I hope there is a fix as this was not a cheap product for me.  After reading all the negative reviews (and few positive ones) I would never have bought this to begin with :(

column7: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS FAULTY VACUUM
column8: My daughter purchased this vacuum from Home Depot in August, 2009 and used it three times before the roller brush stopped working.  We took it back and Home Depot gave her a new one that did the same.  Rather than take it back, I ordered a new brush roller belt from Hoover and installed it.  The brush roller did not move with the new belt and we took the second one back for a refund.I could not determine why such a nice machine had such a design flaw.  It may have worked if I had sprayed 'belt dressing' to give the groove/belt contact more of a tacky contact.  If you are out of warranty and out of options, you may want to try a spray belt dressing to keep the belt from slipping.

.... all the negative reviews on this vacuum.  I've had it for 3 months and it's the best vacuum I've ever owned.  I almost didn't purchase this model based on the negative comments but we've had good luck with Hoover products in the past and wanted something that would help deal with Pet hair.  The suction on this unit is great.  The only negative I've found is the length of the hose, but we've learned to live with that.  I make sure that I set the dial for the correct carpet height and if I'm vacuuming throw rugs or anything with fringe, I turn the beater bar off.  I'd buy this vacuum again with no regrets.

column7: Good Vacuum - really helps with pet hair!
column8: My mother bought me this vacuum for Christmas because I have a cat and was getting ready to move in with my boyfriend who is allergic to cats.  This vacuum works great!  I vacuum three times a week and use the pet attachment and I never see a cat hair in this place.  My boyfriend's allergies have been great!  I did notice that if it is too full it will shut down.  This is a precautionary measure so as long as you keep it emptied it will run fine!  I empty it on the balcony and haven't found it to be particularly messy.  It is quite heavy but that would be the only downfall that I see.  I hope this review was helpful.  I read the reviews here after my mother gave me this vacuum and was quite nervous about it.  But as long as you take good care of it, I think you'll be happy with it!

My husband and I purchased this vacuum 2 weeks ago, and we LOVE it.  Our dog is a heavy shedder, and it does a wonderful job picking up her hair, plus everything else on the carpet.  The bare floor option does a wonderful job as well, mainly because when the brush is not turning the vacuum doesn't just blow dirt/hair around the room.  Also, this vacuum is amazingly quiet.  The only real complaint that I have about this vacuum is that I wish the hose was a little longer.  I have seen where others have complained about the weight of the vacuum, which I do not think is all that bad (and I'm 7 months pregnant!)  However, my suggestion for those people would be to adjust the brush height setting.  Also, I have found it is a little messy to empty the canister from the bottom, so I opt to dump the canister from the top.

I have had this unit in 4 times in 9 months to fix the agitator bar.  Last time it broke after only 3 uses.  I am so sick of this vacuum I am throwing it out.  I thought I'd pop for a higher end brand when I bought Hoover but it turns out that Hoover is just a brand owned by Hong Kong based TTI Floorcare.This vacuum is flawed, steer clear of it.  Amazon should just pull it.  Anyone who rates it highly is either a Hoover employee (they have marketing and finance offices in OH) or has just bought it and has not had their beater bar belt break.

We picked up this vacuum as a black Friday special and loved it off the bat.  It has super suction and picks up everything.  There is an occasional high pitched squeal that is associated with the cyclonic air intake, but that is not an issue.  After about 5 months of use (4 cats and a dog) we started noticing that the brush wans't working properly.  I took the bottom plate off the vacuum and removed the belt which was showing wear from the brush dragging and then I discovered the real problem...hair wrapped around the spindle of the brush.  I cleaned off all the hair from the ends of the brush spindle to free up the bearings and allow the brush to spin properly and then for a temporary fix for the belt, I flipped it inside out to get a little more life while I searched for a replacement.  Fired it up and it worked perfectly.  There is a design flaw that allows hair to gather on the brush bearings, so it's something that I'll have to clean out about every 3 months or so as maintenance.Finding a belt has been tougher than I thought.  The belt is listed as 40201-271 which is no where to be found.  I even went to the Hoover web site and this part number doesn't exist.  This is the flat drive belt, not a v-belt as indicated in one of the other reviews.  I think the v-belt is for another part.The vacuum is a bit on the heavy side, but so was our last Wind Tunnel.  The hose is long enough to reach up our stairs so my wife doesn't have to carry it up the stairs for that purpose.  We have a light weight Oreck vacuum for our second floor carpets, but it doesn't have nearly the suction of the Hoover.The cannister seems to fill up pretty fast and is not fun to empty.  It seems like no matter which way you go, top or bottom, you end up with a mess.  The seal at the bottom of the filter and cannister is a mess since you can't ever get it lined up perfectly.

I'm posting this review after 2 solid weeks of use every day on a 2300 sqft home.  I didn't intend to use it that much that quick, but I really enjoy tools that work and this one definitely does.  I have 2 large dogs and had a Eureka on it's last leg - the home would smell like wet dog every time we would vacuum even though it had a brand new bag and HEPA filter installed.  I read some reviews on a different model by Hoover, went to the big box store, but they didn't have the model I had done so much research on.  I took a shot in the dark and brought this one home with no research just because I liked the idea of the retractable cord. THIS VACUUM IS FANTASTIC.  I had previously been researching the Dysons as well and had even used a few before - this vacuum performs every bit as good if not better for way less money.  I can't believe how much dog hair, dirt, and dust it sucked up out of the carpet and off the tile, and now the house smells clean and fresh - no more dog smell!  The on-board pet brush is fantastic too.  I unintentionally gave it a durability test when I accidentally tipped it over just after unpacking it and cringed as the handle slammed into the tile floor - this is how my friend broke his Dyson - Hoover took it like a champ.  No damage.Regarding other reviews I saw one that indicated the brush won't work after 3 uses - mine still does after over a dozen HEAVY uses.I read another that complained about the belt - the belt on mine says Good-Year and it hasn't broken, frayed, or slowed down at all.One review called it a boat anchor and said it's impossible to carry - IT'S 23 POUNDS YOU WEENIE, and it's on WHEELS.  That's about what a typical 1 to 2 yr old child weighs.  In all fairness, if you have a 2 story and are elderly and/or handicapped in some way then perhaps this vacuum may weigh a bit too much for you.  I haven't had to lift it since I took it out of the box, so...Some are commenting that it's messy to empty - there are two ways to empty it: there is a door that swings open at the bottom and drops the dirt out, or you can unlock the top by twisting it, remove the cone, and gently dump the contents into the trash without creating a could of dust...  that also keeps the seal on the bottom of the trap door from getting dirty.  The retractable cord has been awesome.  What you probably wouldn't guess unless I told you or you read the name is that I'm a man and don't typically like to vacuum.  My girlfriend is ecstatic that I enjoy vacuuming the house, and has even gone so far as to take pictures of me doing it to prove it.  When I wanted a great drill that would last I bought a DeWalt - still have it and love to use it.  When I wanted a truck I bought an F-150 - over 200K miles and still rolling.  Now I lucked out and have a vacuum that has really improved the cleanliness of the house.If I ever have a problem then I will by all means update this review, but so far I'm impressed.

column7: Weigh's a TON..impossible to carry, hard to move...
column8: If you live in a 2-story and need a vacuum for both floors....DO NOT BUY...unless you're Arnold S...weighs a ton, very hard to push...suction and cleaning ability is ok....makes a great boat anchor.

I have been happy with the overall performance of this vacuum until, that is, the agitator brush stopped working. Like other people describe, the vacuum started making a high pitched screech and the brush stopped spinning. I could see that the belt that wrapped around the brush just wasn't grabbing the brush enough. So I searched online for a solution. I found two:1) If you feel up to it, call your local vacuum repair shop (I just googled it and found a number) and spend about $10 for them to replace the belt for you.2) If you are willing to wait a few days for delivery go to the hoover website and order 'item# 40201200  WINDTUNNL V-BELT'  for  $3.99 plus shipping and handling.I ordered the parts myself. they are very easy to install, all you need is a screwdriver. You can also download the manual that matches your model number and get replacement part #s for just about anything.Here's the link: [...]Hope this helps!

The agitator brush stopped working completely within one month of purchasing the vacuum.  I contacted Hoover and their only response was 'take it to a service center.'  I've read many reviews of the vacuum on various websites, and it seems to be a VERY common problem with this model.....high pitch squeaking followed by complete failure of the agitator brush within the first few weeks of use.  What a waste of money!

column7: Worst Vacuum EVER!!!! DO NOT BUY HOOVER!!!!
column8: We bought this vacuum and used about 3 times before the agitator brush quit working. Hoover website does not even list the correct belts for the unit. Can not find the belts anywhere locally. I had to buy the belts that it needed. Replaced the belt and the agitator brush worked for 1 cleaning and quit working again. I called Hoover and they said that they have never heard of this problem before and that I needed to take it to a local Service Center. I called the local service center and they asked me the model number and I was told 'You poor Soul.' The service center knew all about the problem. He told me the problems that I was having with the unit and that it was a design flaw with the unit, Hoover is aware of the problem and that they are not doing anything about it. So i am stuck with a vacuum that the agitator brush does not spin. Another waste of money on another product that is cheaply made and Hoover doesn't care. Hoover has poor customer support and do not care about the quality of their products. Do Not Waste Your Money!!!!!!!!!

I've had this vacuum for over a year and I absolutely hate it!  To empty the canister, you have twist off the cyclonic thing from it and bang it against the garbage can and it makes a huge cloud of dirt - and there is no way to clean the inside of the cyclonic thing - its dirty and gross.  Then you have to clean out the canister and the rubber gasket on the bottom of the canister isnt flush anymore, so there is a layer of dirt around the rim you have to clean.  Why would they make a vacuum where the bottom of the canister opens????? Its get filled with dirt and leaves dirt all over my house!  And I dont mind a heavy vacuum, but I have a ton of stairs in my house and there is no handle to carry it easily.  I'm already looking for a different vacuum because I HATE HATE HATE this one!  I miss my old Bissell.  Never buying a Hoover again, this is the stupid design of a vacuum ever!

column7: great suction, brush won't work after 3 uses
column8: Suction is great but it is heavy and hard to manuver,  Emptying filter canister is difficult and messy.  Brush won't rotate only in the lowest position after 3 uses. Makes loud squeaking noises. I am returning this item.

column7: Good Vacuum, but needs longer hose
column8: I have owner the vacuum since 12/10/2009. It does a great job on the rugs picking up dog hair & with the on off switch for the brush does a good job on bare floors as well. The handle on the short hose is very nice when using the pet hair hand tool. The vacuum is heavy so it needs a longer hose to do stairs. Mine did not come with a bare floor or brush attachment so I am ordering these online. Finding a longer hose has turned into a problem as the company I ordered from sent the wromg hose & now does not want to accept the return. Cleaning the filter is no fun. Now I have two dogs, but vacuum twice a week, but if the filter gets clogged I usually use another vacuum to clear & clean it. After a month of use there is a high pitched whine when I start it. While not a vacuum expert, I believe it could be the belt that drives the brush.

column7: wish we had gone to a store to try it out
column8: :)Good suction.Retractable cord!Ranked high on Consumer Reports:(heavy, clunkystarted making high-pitched whine sporadically after 2 weeks of use in our small 950 sq ft NYC apartmentnot looking forward to changing out the container...It's hard to see what a vacuum will be like unless you go to a brick-n-mortar store to try it out. that's what I wish we had done.UPDATE 18 months later:  My wife and I hate this thing. It's too heavy, it OVERHEATS and stops working after three or four minutes, it doesn't clean our carpets very well. It's also a pain in the butt to empty the dust canister. We really regret not sending it back after the first horrible week of using it.

This vacuum walks circles around my 10-year-old Hoover Windtunnel bagged vacuum. If you have kids and pets, you vacuum daily like I do. My home is small and so is my budget, so this affordable model covers all the bases for me. Emptying the collection bin is a bit messy, but it is worth it to me to never have to purchase bags again. I empty it into a closed grocery bag, and I'm sure I'll get better at this over time. With a lot of cat hair to pick up that has been left behind by my old vacuum, I have had to brush off the filter several times, again, not a big deal to me. The hose is sturdy and long, and the cord rewind feature is a plus. I like the fact that the beater does not run when the vacuum is in the upright position, and has an on-off switch for hard floors. It does make a squeaking noise when stopping and starting, which troubles me a bit. I only gave this product 4 stars for now, but will update after owning for a few more months.

column7: Great little vacuum for small spaces
column8: I got this vacuum I'd tell about 8 months ago in Walmart just for 60-something dollars and for this price it works great for me. I see that now it costs about $116 with delivery here, I don't know if it's temporary price raise or not, but for $100+ I defenitely would consider another vacuum - with more powerful motor and more features. But if you can find it for the price I paid last summer, it's a great deal.Pros:1) Price it was last summer - under $702) Seems to be sturdy and doesn't feel cheap3) Power brush works very good on carpets, we have a very fluffy cat and this vacuum cleans fur from carpet very good4) Small - easy to get in tight spaces and to keep in a small apartment. By the same reason I probably wouldn't recommend it to people living in house with a few bedrooms, vacuuming may take a lot of time for them.5) Easy to cleanCons:1) Doesn't have 'pet brush' attachment (like little power brush for furniture) so it's hard to clean carpets from fur where vacuum can't go2) Doesn't work good on hard floors (suction power is too low), but since I have just a few sq. feet of hard floor in my apartment, I don't count it as a big cons for myself.Overall, it's a great basic vacuum for small carpeted apartments. I wouldn't recommend it for big house or for a living space with a lot of hard floors though. And I wouldn't recommend to pay current price for it - for $100+ you can find better models on market.

Recently bought the Nano and it nearly drug me across the room.  Very powerful as evidenced by the amount of "powdery dust/dirt" in the cup.Cons:  short cord and small dirt cup...both of these are easy to work around.Well worth the purchase!

I was ecstatic when I received this as a Christmas present just a few weeks ago since ours was on its last leg. It worked incredibly well the first couple of times. Less than a week later, it began stopping on its own while I was vacuuming. I let it rest for a while thinking it might just have overheated, which is odd in a new product anyway. Gave it another go after a few days and it started up again. That's when I noticed it didn't seem to be picking up as well as it did the first time and seemed to be spitting out dust - then it stopped again. That's when we decided to return it to Walmart. Our family who gave it to us was from out of town and of course, didn't give us the receipt. But they got it from the local Walmart and we still had the original box. Husband exchanged it for a Eureka and just paid the difference. Hopefully, we'll be luckier with this one.

I first purchased this little sucker when I just needed a vacuum. The price was right (about $60) so it didn't matter to me at the time. I was immediately blown away! I've never in my life owned a vacuum that could suck up as much dirt and pet hair as this one does! I maintained and used this vac for almost 2 years! I've never loved another appliance more! But then I moved across country, leaving most of my stuff, the Hoover included, behind. So when I got settled into my new place, I tracked down another Nano and picked up that last one they had in-store at my local Walmart. Is it possible to fall in love with the same thing twice? Cause I did! I cannot recommend a better compact vacuum for the price!

after my dirt devil stoped runing i got this hoover nano it works like easy this vacuum is light no heveys vs my bissell lift off this vacuum works it great the cool standerd its easy to do on stairs i grab the hose put the extshon wond and i put on the dusting brush i can clean my cars like peace of cake this works as bagless upright it cleans my hamsters mess with the crvise tool

very happy with this product. I cleaned the filter and sponge (after 3 months use) and let it dry the recommended time in the sun (2 hours). That wasn't enough time. the performance dropped to 0 and after cleaning out the hose that got plugged up and drying the filter with the hair dryer, it works like new. I wish I'd had a heads up from the company about the filter issue so I could have avoided all that, but now that I know... I'm very happy with this lightweight cleaner.
Horrible product!  Only lasted a few months before it stopped working completely.  The customer service was a joke, the women actually laughed at us.  We will never buy another Hoover.

column7: Perfect for small apartments and homes!
column8: I bought this vacuum at Wal-Mart for $50 plus tax for my first apartment. What I liked about this vacuum was that it is light-weight and compact and it being bagless was a plus. I can honestly say that it is a great little vacuum cleaner and I was suprised to see how much dirt it picked up after using it. One thing that I don't like though is that the hose is pretty difficult to use. I always have a hard time cleaning with the hose because it doesn't reach out very far and it's kind of awkward.

We use this vac once every two weeks in a one bedroom apartment, suddenly it just decided to stop working. What a waste of money, why would a company built a garbage such as this? very very disappointed.

ever since i got this vacuum, i cant use it for even 5 minutes without having to take the whole thing apart and then remove a clog and put it back together... then it STILL doesnt work. COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME!

I bought this for around $60 based on reviews I read here.  Thought I'd contribute my own.  I love it.  We have a 1200 sq ft vacation home, and it vacuums very well.  Comparing it to my $500 Dyson at our primary home, I'd recommend the Hoover just as much as the Dyson.  Some people mentioned that the path is a bit narrow or the cord too short, but not enough to impede performance.  Suction is great.  It doesn't do a stellar job at bare floors, but still works well if you move slowly.  I'm not a fan of the wand, I wish it had a wide tube instead of the crevice tool that is permanently attached.  It's also a tad short in my opinion, but it works.  It also doesn't edge very well, but for the money I saved I can spend an extra minute going around baseboards slowly and using the wand.  I think it's a bit louder than others, but that could just be because I haven't vacuumed in a long time ;).  It's a vacuum, it's going to be loud.  It's exceptionally light weight, I'm 6 months pregnant and don't have trouble carrying it up and down stairs like I do my Dyson.  Assembly was easy.  I've only had it a day, so I can't say how it holds up over time. Will be purchasing another to use on the second floor of our larger home.

I'm a college student and I was not willing to spend hundreds of dollars on a vacuum. I saw this vacuum in Walmart and thought it was cute; I love the color. While I was looking at it a lady approached me and told me it was a great buy. She bought it and loved it. I got it in Walmart for $52.96 and I must say I am very pleased. The suction on this was AMAZING! I had no idea that my carpet was that dirty. It's very light weight. I took it on the bus home with me and I can carry it around with one hand. It's very compact and all the tools are attached. I must say it was definitely a bargain!

I bought this vacuum because it was light weight and i do a lot of vacuuming. It does not work for hard wood floors. The vacuum has no suction and blows the dirt all over while u r vacuuming. The hand attachment is very easy to use, but that too also has absolutley not suction. I seem to work well on carpet, but i only have small area rugs so that doesn't help me. I have always bought Hoovers but I might reconsider my next purchase.

Literally worst thing I have ever owned across all product fields. It is 6 months old. It shuts off after 15 minutes of use and will not turn on for two hours after. I'm assuming its some sort of motor overheat and works after it cools. It doesn't suck, never has. I use the sprinkle carpet deodorizer, it does not pick it up and if you lift the vacuum accidentally while using it will spray it all over the room.It seems the overall reviews are positive, and that's great for them. I also realize I could warranty it, but who has time to warranty a $60 vacuum? I'm just trashing it and buying a different brand.

I bought this vacuum today at Walmart, and I must say it is the best one I've ever used (non-commercially). The cleaning power shocked both my boyfriend and myself. After one rug (which was vacuumed just a day earlier) there was so much dirt and hair that we hadn't seen! The bonus feature of being able to just empty it in the trash is excellent.

I am impressed by this little vacuum!  I got it from my local w-mart for considerably less than the price listed here. The vacuum is very small and light, and thus very easy to handle and move around.  Plus, the handle can be detached for even more compact storage.  The sucking power is comparable to greater models and very satisfactory. There is no height adjustment but this doesn't seem to affect performance.  I vacuumed thin carpets, a thick rug, and bare floors (wood and tile) with ease.  In fact there is a pedal switch that allows for turning off the brushes, so you can use suction only on hardwood floor (thus without risk of scratching your valuable wood!).  The vacuum is relatively quiet when operating (comparably to others I've used, anyway), and especially quiet when in suction only mode.  Importantly, it does not suffer from the 'jet stream' exhaust effect like many other models (maybe just a tiny bit on the sides, but really not much), so it does not blow away dust from all around the vacuum when you use it :)  The on-board tools are pretty basic: the detachable handle is nice as it allows for reaching into tight spaces, but also for doing tall spots like window blinds, etc.  There is also a little brush, and that's about it!  Cleaning the dirt cup is very easy, although as with most vacuums of this type, you better do it outdoors!  The only negative thing I can find is that this vacuum will likely be inadequate for vacuuming large areas, due to its small size and coverage.  But it is just perfect for my 2-bdr apartment!  Anyway, if you are in the market for a vacuum which is easy to operate, easy to store, with more than satisfactory performance, for small spaces (I would say up to about 1000 sq. feet) and without braking the bank, this is definitely a great option.

column7: Stopped working after 10 months of use
column8: After 10 months of regular use, it simply stopped working one day. This is my light-use vacuum that I use every day or two to do a quick run on high-traffic areas. I have a heavy-duty vacuum that I use weekly, but the Nano has been wonderful because it's lightweight and I could even use it on my kitchen floor. But not anymore! I checked to see if something was jammed in it or if something came unhooked. It didn't come unplugged, no breaker was kicked, and it didn't overheat. My husband, after taking it apart, has found nothing fishy. The parts seem to be in good condition, but the thing simply will no longer work. Useless!

Got this vac at a box store like many other reviewers. After using it a couple of times and after having a dozen vacs over the past 20 years, I can say that it is the best bang for the buck. I have no idea how long it will last, and I have no idea how it works with pet hair, although some other reviewers were less than enthusiastic about it with dog hair. It is nicely designed, although cord is too short and hose is too short. It is not as noisy as many other vacs I have had. A friend just spent over $400 on a Dyson and wishes she had gotten this one instead since suction is better, it is much smaller and much lighter, and nearly 1/10th the price. For me, this is the perfect vac for the rugs in my 3 floor home.

I am the department manager of home living at my local walmart store.  I had purchased a Hoover Nano about few months before I started working there.  I absolutely love this vacuum and continually recommend this product to my customers, especially elderly ones because it weighs so little and is so easy to use.  I had paid 3-4 times more for a vacuum in the past and it lasted a month.  I have five children and became quite the vacuum repair person.  However, I have not had to do any repairs to my nano and only changed the belt once in two years.  I highly recommend this vacuum and feel like a Nano saleswoman because I have sold so many and Walmart has a great price, less than $60.  So get one!! You won't regret it!!

Totally agree with the other reviewer here about pet hair. We've got a German Shepherd, sheds a bit, not that much on the dog scale of things (he's not close to my last dog, a Siberian), but it overwhelms this Hoover. Worked for about six weeks. Then it clogged up. Just took the whole thing apart, cleared some dog hair, but can't quite get to another clog in the main line and can't figure out how to do it. Not worth the time to totally disassemble every few weeks, anyhow, so this is going to the curb. Bought this as a stop-gap while our main vacuum was fixed -- still waiting on part two months later, thanks Hoover! -- but it just isn't worth it. If you had a really small apartment with no pets, go for it. Not bad bang for buck. Otherwise, pass.

I have three inside cats.  One is an angora.  Her long hair works its way into things like typical cat hair doesn't.  It is very hard to vacuum up.  This little friend of mine picks it right up.  The button that stops the rollers on hard floors;  why hasn't everybody done this?  It's so obvious.  I can vacuum up kitty litter!  The handle on top of the dirt holder makes moving from room to room effortless.  I don't think the canister is too small.  I empty it everytime I finish the 2200 sf house, no problem.  The filter is great because I don't have to take it outside and bang it on a tree to get the fine dust out.  I don't care that the cord is too small.  I put an extension cord on and I leave it there, problem solved, no big deal.  The hinged drop plate to empty the canister ia also genius.  I seriously have no complaints!  I did decide to go to walmart to save the significant bucks.  They were out.  I live 45 minutes from walmart so I came home and ordered it immediately.  Even with the extra cost, it's a heck of a bargain.

column7: Great little vacuum; easy to use, easy to maintain
column8: This is a great vacuum; I got mine from Walmart 3 months ago.I have indoor 2 cats & my fiance sometimes comes home covered in coal dust. We have a 650-ish sq. ft. townhouse.Yes, the cord is on the shorter side, but that hasn't bothered me at all.What I most love about this vacuum is the efficiency in design -- there's only one attachment piece (the upholstery/curtains brush) that's completely independent from the unit, and even then it has an incredibly secure location. It hasn't fallen off yet!Otherwise, the handle doubles as the hand vacuuming attachment (I don't know what it's officially called), and the hose is readily switched between floor vacuuming and hand vacuuming. No wasted space, and no pieces that fall off.I've used other peoples' more expensive vacuums (eg Shark, Rainbow), and I would say this one is competitively comparable to them in cleaning power. This isn't a flimsy-cheapo machine.After a couple months of frequent weekly use, I noticed a drop in the suction. At that point, I removed and washed the filters (they were FILTHY -- I won't go that long without washing them again!), and my fiance cleared out a piece of plastic zip-tie that was stuck in the hose and had caused a hair clog (thus the drop in suction). Just that easy-peasy maintenance got it back to working like new.

This little guy has a serious Napoleon Complex! He is small but boy is he powerful. I was using the hose attachment and sucking the tumbleweeds of pet hair behind my couch. The hose is a bit short, so I set the vacuum on the couch (which I used to do with my dyson) so I could reach over the back of the couch. I didn't turn off the rotating bristles (dyson bristles automatically turned off when in upright position)... and they tore holes right through the cushion cover! I am glad this was on the cushion and not on my carpet though. I bought a replacement cover for the cushion but just know that when using the hose attachment TURN OFF THE BRISTLES! They will tear right through. I only have myself to blame for this. Also tie up your drapes! I can only imagine what they would do to my sheer drapes. I have been staring at these great reviews, both on Amazon and Walmart.com, and I couldn't get myself to believe them in a vacuum at only $58 (walmart price). I bought another vacuum, wasn't happy with it, returned it and gave into this little beast. It's pretty incredible. For it's price, it is definitely a 5 star! As a vacuum in general, I would give it 3-4 stars.Things I LOVE about this vacuum:-Light-The bagless cyclone canister. I have had disasters with the messes bagless vacuums make when emptying them and trying to clean out every last bit. This canister empties at the of a touch of a button. SO easy.-The green to red button when the canister is full. If you can train yourself to keep an eye on that, it's a nice feature to let you know, 'time to empty'-The hose wand. Some have complained that the hose wand is the handle. This was the same feature (with a different anatomy) as the dyson has which I grew to love and love it again in this machine.-The black pinched tip at the end of the hose isn't removable. I thought I didn't like this feature but it is nice so you are less likely to suck up a large piece that could clog up your hose. It is also one less piece to keep track of and have to put together.-It truly has great suction. I bought this the day we got new carpet installed so I cannot say it pulled up a whole bunch of dirt yet but I feel this was the good start to new carpet.-You can turn off the bristles. I am surprised to find that many vacuums even in the $100 range do not have this feature.Things I don't like about this vacuum (there is nothing I HATE about it):-Yes, cord is a little short but I have an older home with smaller rooms so it isn't an issue for me.-Hose is a little short but it is easy to hold this vacuum in your hand and carry it around with you.-Bristles don't automatically turn off when in upright position. Be sure to turn them off.-Not great for small pieces on hard floors. I was hoping I could use this on hard floors as well, as I have a lot of hard floors. With bristles off, it failed to pick up about half of the kitty litter in my laundry room.-Does not have a hight adjustment. This is my biggest issue. I have 1 shag rug that I am afraid may burn out the motor. It is a little difficult to push across the rug and seems to work a little too hard. I might use my old dyson just for this rug as it does an okay job for it. I also think if it had a height adjustment it may work better on bare floors on the lowest setting.-Many of the Hoover Vacuums have a retractable cords that rewind. For some reason, wrapping up a vacuum cord is some huge annoyance to me... just one of those things. I wish this had that feature. Good thing it's a short cord ;o).-It is a pretty ugly and dated looking vacuum lol. If that is important to you.

Man they are right this little sucker sucks great, our other cheap Bissell that I bought several years back for $60.  it kept up lint and hair but this little sucker was pulling up dirt like crazy.  I had no idea we had that much dirt under the carpet from vacuuming every couple of days.  We have a cat too and it was pulling in hair and it just never stopped, the cyclonic really works great, just hope it holds up.  Great all around, easy to carry and being able to turn of the brushes is awesome for hardwood floors and tile floors.Check out Wally World for the best deal around....

I just purchased this vac 3 days ago & have been using it each day since (I have 2 short haired dogs, who do shed). I love this thing.  I previously purchased a small Eureka that only worked once.  I have mostly bare floors & my carpet is 'office' carpet so it's just like a bare floor. The Eureka didn't suck up the carpet powder at all off the carpet and the Nano DID! And having the option to shut off the roller is the best for the bare floors. I'm very pleased.  I highly recommend this lil' guy to anyone with 'bare' flooring. I did purchase mine at Walmart - for $60.00 but only because I didn't want to wait for delivery. But I had planned to pay about $75.00 for something that would work.

Bought this item from Walmart almost a year ago for under $60. Definetely worth the price and picks up so much hair, dust, and dirt. Works much stronger then my cheap Eureka. Perfect for pet hair. What ever you do, DO NOT WASH THE HEPA FILTER, just replace it LoL. Made the mistake of washing it and now the vacuum doesn't work. But it was my fault. I would also buy a spare belt because after a month or two the vacuum started making a knocking noise due to a loose belt. Overall, great product for $58.

column7: If 10 stars were available, I'd give the Hoover Nano 10+!!
column8: YOU CANNOT GO WRONG WITH THIS VACUUM! I have had my Hoover vacuum for more than 3 months and if it broke today, I'd run out and buy another one.  It has earned what I paid for it already.  I have a Jack Russell Terrier who sheds quite a bit.  I have had no problems vacuuming up his hair.  My home is 2600 square feet on 3 floors, and I vacuum at least one room everyday.  I have a very expensive Kirby that I have now retired to the garage.My Hoover is so lightweight that my 8-yr-old daughter can easily maneuver it - and does!  I initially just purchased this for my carpeted rooms, but I also use it periodically on my hardwood floors, and although it does not do as good a job, I did not buy it for hardwood floors - that's a bonus.I wish that Amazon sold this directly.  I, like many others, purchased my vacuum at Wal-Mart for under $60.I will purchase another little Hoover soon to keep on another floor.  There are not many things that I recommend without hesitation, but I highly recommend this little Hoover.

After returning two other large, noisy, vacuum cleaners (Kenmore and Dirt Devil due low suction) to replace our old dirt devil vacuum, we settled for this Hoover Nano and brought it from walmart for a much cheaper price because of the positive reviews and price point. I used it as soon as I brought it home. Don't know as to how long it will last but it vacuumed so wonderfully that I want to keep it forever! It's very light weight and so easy to move around. In fact, it moves forward on it's own which was so funny which meant you don't have to put all that effort into pushing it forward. Because it is very light weight it was even easy to pull it back without breaking an arm! Highly effective cleaning and picked up EVERYTHING it went over. Emptying it was easy even for a child to do. Very easy to get it to go in to small spaces and under chairs. What impressed me also was the low noise level of this vacuum. Unlike every other vacuum I tried, this one does not have high pitched noises or shrills.It left my carpet fluffy and clean. The wire is shorter than the large vacuums and the tube is much shorter too. But it doesn't matter to me as this machine cleans way better than any other that has all the extras. Highly recommend.

Analysed & Searched a lot before buying this vacuum. Used twice so far for a 2 Bed apt (~800 sq ft carpet area). So far so good. Easy to operate, light weight to move around while on, sucks dirt well, cleaning was not so difficult. For cleaning, lid opens at the bottom which is convenient.. no need to tilt, but need to be careful to focus straight to your trash-can, otherwise will make the place little messy.. Its expensive at Amazon.. not sure why. Got a better deal in Walmart 'site to store' shipping..When using in Suction mode, noticed few dirts, few hair pieces were not sucked from Hard wood floor.. But in overall, like this product and pretty happy with my purchase..

When we got this vacuum, it was awesome. Strong suction, cleaned up everything. This lasted for exactly a week. Then the clogs started. Now the vacuum has to be completely disassembled every time we use it. Why is that? Pet hair completely clogs the hoses. I haven't emptied the tank in several months, because nothing ever makes it there, it all gets stuck in the hoses. Emptying them completely does no good; they just clog right back up. The clogs cause suction to decrease drastically, and the vacuum winds up moving more dust around than it cleans up. Complete waste of money.

column7: Good Vacuum But Doesn't Last Long
column8: For the price I can't really complain. I paid about $60 + tax @ Walmart locally for it around the end of April/early May and it worked great at first! The vacuum is easy to clean, you can wash out the sponge-type filter but make sure it's 100% dry before replacing as it'll grow mold AND any moisture will affect the suction. I'm not too fond of the handle wand as it has a permanently affixed crevice tool on it which then goes into the brush tool. The crevice tool seems to leak around where it's attached to the handle/wand although the suction is pretty good. Just recently I decided to vacuum up the same area a few times to have almost the same amount in the dirt cup each time which lets me know that it's not working to its' fullest potential anymore. You can't adjust the height of the brush head to different carpeting, rugs, etc. but we don't have rugs here so it's fine with our particular type of carpeting but I don't think it'd work as well on shag carpet. Cord is slightly short but I don't mind that so much. All in all, for the price, it isn't BAD but I wish they had the vacuum I'd wanted in stock at the time so I wouldn't have to replace the vacuum within 6 months or so.Pros:Very lightweightCompactSimple to operate (push down with foot to use & foot pedal to turn on)One-touch dirt cup emptyingPriceCons:Leaks around wand crevice toolFilters cost 1/2 as much as the cost of the vacuum itselfCrevice tool isn't removable & no extension wandsLasts about 6mos

I bought this vac at Walmart for about $48.00. I have thick carpeting and own 4 cats who decided they could shed their short hair anywhere. I needed a vacuum cleaner with a power rotor. I have a vacuum without a power rotor that doesn't pick up hair.This vacuum works as well or better than my old heavy Kirby tank for picking up hair from the carpet which somehow gets woven into the mesh. (I think my cats do that on purpose when I'm not looking). You still have to go over the area a couple of times. I don't mind that as long as it works. The biggest draw back is that the dirt compartment fills up with cat hair very fast and I am lucky if I can get a whole room done before I have to empty the container. Fortunately I live in the country and I can just dump it outside. Perhaps the container filling up so fast is a testimony to how well it was picking up.This was the second cheapest model I found with a power rotor. Dirt Devil has one that was less expensive, but my local W-Mart was out of them.

column7: Awesome Sucking Action & SO EASY to Put Together!!!  LOVE IT!
column8: This vacuum is Awesome!  A great deal for the money,  Sucks so good!!  Really the vacuum picks up so well!  I am a PROFESSIONAL housecleaner, have had my own company for years, I have tried  so many vacuums from Rainbows, and Dysons, to Dirt Devils and for the money this is the BEST!!  Also, the ease of putting it together, compared to so many others was SIMPLE!  I dreaded buying another vacuum because I hate when they come and you have so many parts to figure out how to put together,  NOT SO with this awesome WEIGHTLESS vacuum!  Two major parts, that's it,  no screws, and I didnt even need my son's help to do it!  I LOVE my new vacuum!!!

I am extremely pleased with my Nano.  The first time I used it, I realized how poorly my old vacuum was working. The pet odor in the room disappeared, and the carpet seemed a shade lighter.  This product is easy to use, and I like the fact that I can empty the canister with the touch of a finger...keeps my hands out of the dirt.  Also, the filter can be washed, so there are no additional parts or accessories to buy.  I was not, however, pleased with the vendor...Linda's, I think.  I paid extra for express shipping, but it arrived no faster than regular shipping would've gotten it to me.  Also, there was a Walmart shipping label on it, so the vendor had it shipped to me from them, which means I paid all that shipping and a little extra and could have gone straight to the source.  Not happy about paying extra.

For the price, it was great!  The best vacuum (as far as suction goes) that we have ever had.  It replaced our Dyson when it broke down a year ago.  Unfortunately, the parts around the vacuum don't last.  The on/off push button fell off.  Because it is small, you have to empty frequently.  Because we have a Great Pyr for a pet, his long hair clogs the vacuum constantly.  We have had 3 of these in 1 year.  We vacuum a lot (dog owner) and expect our vacuum to last.  I only wish the frame held up better.  But by far the best suction we have seen.  Now we look for something else.

I bought this vacuum at walmart for $60 and then I bought my daughter one as well because it works so well.  We have two cats and it picks up cat hair like no other vacuum I've ever had.  I used wood filler on my deck and sanded it and used this vacuum to pick up the dust.  Needless to say the whole thing got mucked up with dust.  But this thing is completely washable.  Your disassemble the canister and hoses wash out the filter and all the components, put it all together, run the vacuum to dry it out, voila good as new.  It takes 5-10 minutes.  Try that with most vacuums.  Good luck to you.

I got it at Wally World for $62.00 after tax. It sucks up pretty good; like everyone else said, the cord gets in the way and is too short, easy fix with an extension cord, oh and it's loud compared to the hated Kenmore I was using. That said it beat the hell out  dragging around the dead dog that is the kenmore cylinder that cost over $400.00 5 years ago and looks like it will live forever curse it! That thing is now sitting in the garage and this little sweetie is in the closet so what does that tell you? I have 2 dogs that shed like crazy and tile floors with two small rugs at the doors; I emptied the canister 3 times, didn't really have to do it that often but it was very easy to do and I got carried away. The rooms did not smell bad when I was done, like they do with the kenmore, and no more smelly bags full of old dog hair. If I had the money I would probably go up to a quieter one with a longer cord but maybe not, I only use it once a week, the other days I sweep with a broom, old school, quiet and kinda zenish. I will post if I have problems or if/when it dies. 10/15/2012 Having lived with this thing for over a year I can tell you my only problem is the hose that goes down into the guts that you have to get off to attach it to the extension/handle when you want to get into corners or get cobwebs is really had to release. And that reminds me the hose is too short to get the cobwebs off the ceilings. Everything else is still good.

column7: made me into a weekly vacuumer!
column8: I bought this little guy about 4 months ago to replace a very old and decrepit hand-me-down vacuum and I could not be more satisfied with it! It's very light weight but very powerful, and was really affordable!I'm a seamstress and have been cursing the countless threads on my carpet that no vacuum can seem to pick up, but the nano sucks them up without a problem every time! I kept expecting it to lose its steam in time, but even with weekly use it still doing as well as the day I bought it. I had to clean out the filter for the first time last month and it wasn't hard at all. As described in another review, there are two filters, one you empty like the canister, and a foam filter you pull out and wash with water. The best part is there is a little meter that turns red when its time to clean out the filter.My only complaints are that the cord is a little short and the canister is small-- but maybe thats why they call it the nano. The first few times I used it I had to empty the canister after each room-- which I think just speaks to how awesome this vacuum is! Now that I vacuum weekly (because I love this vacuum so much) I almost fill up the canister just cleaning my 400 square foot apartment.It might not be the best choice for a big house, but for my fellow apartment dwellers, or people without too much carpet I can't recommend it highly enough!

Our home was built in 1919, and still has the original hardwoods. As you can imagine, I am very picky when cleaning said floors. This little guy works great! Originally purchased to handle the area rugs in our home, I was intrigued by the suction only option and tried it in the kitchen. The fact that it cleaned without shooting dust and filth everywhere, and the roller was truly disengaged (not just raised like some vacs) made me try it on the hardwoods, and boy am I glad I did! It cleaned them in half the time it would take to sweep!I also like that it's so lightweight. My kids can handle it easily, and are now responsible for vacuuming their rooms!The only con could be the lenghth of the cord, but it doesn't bother us as we do have a smaller home, and the easy rinsable filter and bagless dirt canister more than makeup for the shortness of the cord.This vacuum is best for those with small aparrtments/houses, or people who cannot lug around a heavy vac.

For the price and size, I don't think it could be beat. Does a great for small jobs on carpet/rugs and really performs on hardwood (with the rotating brush off). My only complaint is that the power cord is a little short. The extender tool is the handle, so it keeps things nice and compact. I highly recommend this vacuum.

column7: You won't be sorry if you get this vacuum
column8: I just bought this vacuum, on sale, at Walmart. I have used it a few times so I cannot attest to its longevity, except that I have had good luck with Hoovers in the past.I am amazed at how effective this vacuum is. I previously had a Eureka bagless -- it was hit or miss and not too effective. However, it was purchased many years ago and they may better now. Unlike other vacuums I have owned, this vacuum actually picks up dirt very quickly and it is the best vacuum I have ever owned in that regard. It is also noticeably quieter than other models I have had.I also like the fact that it has a washable HEPA filter and a switch to turn on or off the floor beater motor for hard surfaces.You won't go wrong buying this beauty and will save lots of money and time on bag and filter replacements.Update:I have had this vacuum for now about a year and a half. Saved a lot of money on bags and it works as well as the day I bought it. Don't waste your money on more expensive vacuums with multiple attachments that you will never use and are so heavy that you will be discouraged from using them.This vacuum is very lightweight, powerful and you can clean very effectively with it.  It is all you need.

column7: Versatile, lightweight & durable; great value for your money
column8: We couldn't choose between the Hoover Nano or the Dirt Devil, but we settled on the Hoover Nano because of the low price, light weight, versatile attachments and it was more visually appealing than the fire engine red Dirt Devil. The Hoover Nano doesn't require you to purchase filters every 90 days like other vacuums as the filter may be rinsed and set out to dry. I'm extremely satisfied with our choice.The vacuum is perfect for our modest home. It picks up dirt efficiently and it's super easy to empty. It has an indicator on the side that lets us know when to empty the container or rinse the filter. It's multi-surface with a 'suction only' button for bare floors. The handle is detachable, attaches to the hose and acts as a long-reach vacuum for sucking up dust and other debris from hard-to-reach places. The on/off switch is located on the bottom of the vacuum so you simply use your foot to turn it on and off.The only complaint I have is that the dirt compartment is rather small. We have to empty it at least twice when vacuuming just the living room. This may not be an issue for others, but we have a long-haired 75-pound dog who constantly sheds.

This is the second Hoover product I've purchased since my Oreck died a year ago. Both under $100. Again, I am amazed at what I got for the money. I have had cheap vacuums before (dirt devils, bissels, etc.) that were junk. Got this one as a second vacuum for the kids to use in their rooms upstairs (tired of lugging my other one upstairs -- or not lugging it upstairs, so that the floors never get cleaned!).PROS: This little machine was $50 at Walmart and  is cyclonic, bagless. Very small and light. The roller motor can be turned off for bare floors, which I have a lot of. Not a typical feature in a low price vac. Does a pretty good job on the hard floors and a better job on the carpet. But a better job on the hard floors than any other vac. I've had since my Oreck (which didn't do so great on carpet, and had a roller motor I COULDN'T turn off). Dirt compartment opens easily: trap door at bottom of removable canister that opens with the touch of a finger. So you can just hold the cannister well into your trashcan, open trap door, and let the stuff fall in. No 'poof' of dirt from yanking open a tight compartment from the top (like I've experienced with other bagless machines).CONS: Short cord, and the hose requires 2 hands to assemble for use. Not a deal-breaker for me because of what I paid. You really wouldn't expect a machine of this size and weight to have a super-long cord anyway.

column7: The perfect vacuum for a small condo/townhouse
column8: I picked this up at Walmart and I'm quite happy with this purchase for the money I paid and the value. I hope Amazon ends up stocking this vacuum and competes against Walmart as I would have gladly bought this item from Amazon if it had been available. However, buying it at Walmart did have the slight advantage of being able to see the vacuum in person before purchasing.PROS:The suction on this vacuum is quite strong for the size. The cyclonic makes it pretty much suck as well as any other 12A vacuum I think I've ever used in the past.Very lightweight vacuum (less than 12 lbs as advertised) as I'm not a strong guy but I can pick this thing up with one hand which is great because my house is a 3-floor townhouse with a lot of stairs. If my mom's vacuum ever breaks, I know what vacuum I'm having her buy as a replacement. Heck Mother's day is coming up.The handle is used as part of the extension of the vacuum hose so you don't need to have an addition part/piece that you might lose. everything is on-board.Very easy to clean-out, dyson style one-button push bottom empty canister.The brush attachment even works with my Eureka 71B Hand-Held Vacuum to make a great combination.Even with a 1 year warranty, you can buy one of these each year for 5 years and still end up paying less than a Dyson. That's a better warranty than having one vacuum with a 5 year warranty.CONS:The vacuum cord is very short. Its fine if you vacuum one room but you do need to keep unplugging and replugging into another wall socket a bit too often. Or buy an extension cord but having to remember to grab that each would be a minor annoyance.Knowing to push down with your foot rather than having a button or lever was a little weird and took me a bit to figure out.8/13/2011 UPDATEI just used this vacuum again today and figured I would do an update on my review. It's been around 3 months now and this vacuum has still been worth every penny spent. I'm quit glad I purchased this at Walmart and I hope in the future amazon will be able to compete on the price. This vacuum is still great and covers everything I need for my house, is light-weight, has very good suction, and reminds me each time I use it how glad I didn't buy a Dyson for like 8 times the price.I've been able to figure out that for the small problem of the cord sometimes getting in the way while vacuuming that there is a small hook under the handle to keep the cord out of the way so that I don't have to keep grabbing the cord.The bagless cyclonic keeps the dust and dirt from getting out and I have not had any issues with feeling like I was breathing or smelling anything from vacuuming.I still wish there was a lever for pulling the handle back to vacuum but the little foot icon is a good reminder that I just remember to hold it down when needed and it is sturdy enough where it hasn't caused any concerns.If you are at all on the fence just go to Walmart's site to check out the 80 plus positive reviews.

I was actually looking for the Hoover Nano Lite Upright but Walmart was out so this little guy looked worth the try. So easy to use. My 3 year old can push without my help so shes pleased. The adjustments are easy to switch on and off. Definetly a good buy.

column7: Lightweight, great suction, smart on-board tools, thumbs up
column8: We just picked this up today at Wal*mart as an emergency replacement (again) on yet another vacuum cleaner.  It seems we're replacing vacuums about every 9-15 months!  And we only have two area rugs, I don't get it.  Anyway, I was looking for something inexpensive, lightweight without a bunch of stupid attachments that would fall off/get lost and were difficult to switch back and forth.  This vacuum is very lightweight but does an excellent job.  The hose wraps around the back/bottom like many vacuums do but the handle actually pops right off (a little latch holds it in place, very easy to un-latch with one hand) so you can slide it off and snap it right on to the hose for quick crumb/upholstery/baseboard cleaning.  I also like that the extender latches on with on-hand latch, all of the other vacuum cleaners I've had, you would just slide the extender on and they would fall off many times, every annoyingThis also has the power button that you operate with your foot, step on to turn it on, step on again to turn it off, simple.There is another button that you step on with your foot to make it so you can sweep your hardwood/laminate/tile/whatever floors without the brush spinning, just the suction.  I really like that, I've found with brush cleaners, the brush would grind against the floor (so much for auto-adjusting) and fling the bigger stuff back under the vacuum and at my feet.  This one doesn't do that at all.  We have dogs, cats and kids and just on my first run-through I swept two area rugs with popcorn kernels, dog hair and heaven only knows what, all of it came up without a problem.  Then I ran it under the kitchen table, sucked the cheerios up with no problems and grabbed the dust bunnies right out from under the sideboard.  It doesn't lie completely flat for getting under the sofa/tables, but it comes pretty close.It's very lightweight, I am  able to hold it with one hand and use the hose part with the other to get the steps.The only negative I have with it is that it has a shorter cord than I'm used to.  Easy enough fix with an extension cord, but something to mention.There are two sponge-type filters that say they can be cleaned with water and one that looks like it may also be able to be sprayed off with water, and of course - no bags, so the only things you'd have to replace on this would be if you broke the belt (or when the belt eventually stretches out like it does with all vacuum cleaners). I priced the replacement at the store, it was about $4.  The dirt container is very simple to take off to empty and snaps right back on, it's also light weight but sturdy.So, for right now, this is a great vacuum, it only cost me fifty bucks (plus tax) at Walmart.  I will update this review should there be any issues that pop up or if I discover anything else that I really love about it.
